title: Bowl Games to Watch on New Years Day
description: ROSE BOWL

title: New Years Eve, Stuck in a Church in Bangui
description: In the brutally violent week before Christmas, dozens of families poured into a church in Bangui in the Central African Republic, my colleague Carlotta Gall reported last week. Run by Archbishop Dieudonn Nzapalainga, the building had become a small island of refuge in the Central African Republics rapidly unraveling capital.

title: House Prices Rise Again, but the Pace Could Slow
description: WASHINGTON  It was a great year for the stock market. And it was also a pretty good year for many peoples biggest investment: their homes.

title: Jaywalking Rules and Habits: L.A. vs. New York
description: To the Editor:

title: Drawn Back Into Iraq
description: To the Editor:

title: Egypt Says 3 Journalists Will Be Held 15 More Days
description: CAIRO  Egyptian prosecutors on Tuesday ordered three detained journalists from the news channel Al Jazeera English to be held in custody for 15 more days, on charges that include belonging to a terrorist group and harming the countrys reputation abroad.

title: Killing With Kindness
description: WAIKANE, Hawaii  On days he can round up at least one volunteer to help him in his mission to restore native species to the forest, Paul Zweng commutes in an all-wheel-drive pickup from the home he shares with his wife and children in suburban Honolulu. Hugging the coast north toward the striking mountain terrain on the windward side of Oahu, he stops to pick up Sam or Charlotte or Jim. The regulars.

title: Spiders That Went to Design School
description: John Derian, who sells antique furnishings and curios in his East Village shops, got his start with decoupage. He decorated gridded glass panels with drawings of sea plants or parrots and hung them as murals. Now, thanks to a new line of wallpapers, those images will adhere directly to the wall.

title: Hello, Heres Your Closet
description: Good things came to a lawyer who waited  and waited  to renovate his apartment.

title: Love in the Wings
description: On the theory that if you build it, whomever youre waiting for will show up, Jay Dubiner decided to renovate his apartment.

title: Evaluating Teachers
description: To the Editor:

title: Hawaiian Roots
description: Armed with hatchets and herbicides, Paul Zweng and his volunteers thin a forest of invasive trees one section at a time. Their mission: to return the land to its natural state.

title: Does the Garage Interior Matter to Home Buyers?
description: Q. Does it matter how the interior of my garage looks when its time to sell?

title: Making Way for the Real Hawaii
description: One mans efforts would restore a part of Oahu to the days before invasive plants and animals altered the land.

title: Regulating Supplements
description: To the Editor:

title: The Obamacare We Deserve
description: TODAY marks the beginning of health care coverage under the Affordable Care Acts new insurance exchanges, for which two million Americans have signed up. Now that the individual mandate is officially here, let me begin with an admission: Obamacare is awful.

title: Anxious Youth, Then and Now
description: FOR years now, weve heard the gripes by and about millennials, the offspring of the Great Recession, caught between childhood and adulthood. Their plight seems so very 21st century: the unstable careers, the confusion of technologies, the delayed romance, parenthood and maturity.

title: A Guide to Years Ending in 4
description: War, famine, pestilence and death  the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse  have been well represented in years ending in 4, but probably not disproportionately so. A look at memorable moments in the last seven of these just might lead to optimism for the one thats upon us. Or not.

title: Make of It Whatever You Will
description: The son of a lawyer and a historian, Peter Korn was a likely enough candidate for an Ivy League education. But a career in the trades?

title: My Jewish State
description: LONDON  A year ends, another begins, time for reminiscences and resolutions, regret and hope, best-of and worst-of lists, confessions and crystal-ball gazing  most of it pretty excruciating. It will take a nanosecond longer to scroll back to ones year of birth. So it goes.

title: Sales at Waggo, Wolf Home and Others
description: Some of Michele Quans ceramic bells are 50 percent off while supplies last (extra-small thrown bells, originally $100, are $50; medium Teardrop thrown bells, originally $180, are $90); mquan.com.

title: The New Year Within
description: Sometimes the New Year comes in feeling merely newish, a matter of changing months and not much else. But sometimes the New Year brings with it a powerful sense of regeneration, as if, like certain insects, you were entering a new stage of complete metamorphosis.

title: Saying I Do Amid the Roses
description: By all accounts, the standout entry in Wednesdays Tournament of Roses Parade in Pasadena, Calif., will surely be the marriage of two men, Danny Leclair and Aubrey Loots, beaming amid the array of lavishly flowered floats to be viewed on national television and beyond.

title: Safe From Fire, Rats, Weather and Waste
description: In the 1940s, R. Buckminster Fuller converted grain bins into emergency housing. It seemed that these structures had disappeared, but at least a dozen have survived in New Jersey.

title: War Shelters, Short-Lived Yet Living On
description: Camp Evans, a decommissioned Army base in Wall Township, N.J., is frozen in midcentury, its brick administration buildings and boarded-up Quonset huts on hold from World War II. Fred Carl, 59, a former high school science teacher and the unofficial keeper of the site, leads a visitor to other throwbacks from that era: a collection of corrugated metal houses with porthole windows and conical roofs. They look like alien habitations dropped from the sky.

title: Only the Purest Water Will Do
description: Patrick Jouin was a pioneer in 3-D-printed furniture, but he also likes working with basic tools and materials. The French designers new collection for Puiforcat, the venerable silver house, was inspired by water. Each piece is meant to contain liquid, but go ahead, toss in a few flowers.

title: Homecoming of a Sort
description: The William, an extended-stay hotel, is to open next week at 24 East 39th Street in a 1924 building that for decades was home to the Williams College alumni club.

title: Cameroon: Kidnapped French Priest Is Released
description: A French priest kidnapped in November by Islamist militants in northern Cameroon was released on Tuesday, according to French authorities. The priest, Georges Vandenbeusch, 42, was reported to have been held in Nigeria by Boko Haram, a group with ties to Al Qaeda. He described his captivity as terribly boring, according to Reuters. He paced circles under a tent beneath a tree, he said.

title: Gaza: Hamas Lawmakers Approve Large Budget Deficit
description: Hamas lawmakers on Tuesday approved a 2014 budget totaling $589 million for the Gaza Strip that included a staggering 75 percent deficit. The Islamist Hamas movement has said that Egypts closing of hundreds of smuggling tunnels beneath its border this summer had cost the strip $460 million in taxes and broader productivity. Gaza gets significant funding from the Palestinian Authority and donor nations, but Hamas has rarely made budgetary specifics public.

title: For Stocks, an Amazingly Good Year
description: It was the market rally that defied gravity and left many with a case of vertigo.

title: Dont Knock These Faux-Bois Accessories
description: In the society of fake wood, there are many classes. Materials doctored to have the look of wood grain may be as humble as plastic laminate or as luxurious as silk  in which case the counterfeiting is more likely to be described as faux bois.

title: In Tiny Houses, Hope Lives
description: Kenneth Cobonpue, a Filipino furniture designer with offices in New York, Germany and his native Cebu island, has produced miniature vernacular metal houses that hold tea lights. Proceeds from their sale will help Habitat for Humanity Philippines build shelters for victims of the typhoon that devastated the Visayas region in November.

title: Arkansas Lieutenant Governor Faces Calls to Quit Over Ethics Violations
description: Lt. Gov. Mark Darr of Arkansas, who said this week that he would settle with his states Ethics Commission amid findings that he repeatedly broke campaign finance laws, on Tuesday defied mounting calls for his resignation, including one from Gov. Mike Beebe, and said he intended to remain in office.

title: Preserving Wireless Competition
description: The corporation that controls Sprint, the third-biggest cellphone company in the country after Verizon and AT&T, is reportedly planning to make an offer to buy the smaller rival T-Mobile in a move that would reduce competition in an important industry that already has too little of it.

title: Phish Fans Encounter Crackdown at Garden
description: The arrests began almost as soon as the concertgoers amassed outside Madison Square Garden on Monday evening. Uniformed and plainclothes police officers moved through the crowd, picking off targets and leading them to a police van parked around the corner where they were patted down and loaded in.

title: Supporters of $15 Wage Seek Appeal of Ruling
description: SEATAC, Wash.  Supporters of a $15 minimum wage, approved by voters here in November but partly struck down last week by a county judge, asked the states highest court to hear an appeal.

title: Kerrys Peace Ambitions
description: Secretary of State John Kerrys remarks on Middle East peace talks have changed over time.

title: More Guns Will Not Save Iraq
description: President Obama has done the predictable thing by sending more weapons to Iraq to counter an alarming rise in violence. But arms alone will not solve a problem that has its roots in the political alienation of Sunnis and other minorities and the undermining of democratic processes, especially by Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki.

title: College, Not Just for Himself, but for His Son
description: The load on a full-time college student is a heavy one. Finals and midterms, especially when paired with the duties of fatherhood, could crush any 21-year old, but Giovanni Classen, who recently became a single father to his 1-year-old son, Ezio, seems to have found a way to make it work.

title: Power Curbed, Detroit Mayor Faces Big Job
description: DETROIT  For some who have been around this city the longest, expectations for a new mayor have by now become understandably low: Turn some streetlights on. Do not get indicted. Wait for the lawyers to get Detroit out of bankruptcy.

title: U.S. Solar Panel Maker Seeks to Close Loophole in Duties on Chinese Products
description: A major maker of solar panels opened another chapter in a long-simmering trade dispute on Tuesday, asking the Commerce Department to impose new duties on imported modules made of certain components from China or Taiwan.

title: Snow May Deal a First Test to de Blasio One Day After He Takes Office
description: Three years ago, Bill de Blasio watched as a heavy layer of snow accumulated outside his Park Slope rowhouse during a post-Christmas blizzard, and waited  and waited  for the citys plows to arrive. Three days passed before his block was cleared.

title: Kerry to Press for Framework Accord to Keep Mideast Peace Effort Moving
description: WASHINGTON  In an intensifying diplomatic effort, Secretary of State John Kerry is making a major push to secure what Obama administration officials are calling a framework accord that would be a critical first step to a comprehensive Middle East peace agreement. But critics are already branding it as an effort to play for time.

title: Millions Gaining Health Coverage Under Law
description: WASHINGTON  Millions of Americans will begin receiving health insurance coverage under the Affordable Care Act on Wednesday after years of contention and a rollout hobbled by delays and technical problems. The decisively new moment in the effort to overhaul the countrys health care system will test the laws central premise: that extending coverage to far more Americans will improve the nations health and help many avoid crippling medical bills.

title: Jets, at Least for Moment, Put Entertainment Aside
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Off the top of his head, John Idzik could think of several reasons he still wanted Rex Ryan to be his head coach two days after a third consecutive Jets season of not making the playoffs. After all, they shared a legacy as sons of men who served as coordinators in the organization. They had similar views on how to build a team and, Idzik said, had developed a synergy on doing it together.

title: Old Rivalries Reignited a Fuse in South Sudan
description: JUBA, South Sudan  Few moments conjure as much fear in South Sudan as the massacre of Bor.

title: Cuomo Prods Assemblymen to Resign
description: ALBANY  In a strongly worded statement about the seemingly endless series of allegations of sexual misconduct in the State Assembly, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo called on Tuesday for two assemblymen facing such allegations to either immediately deny the reports veracity or resign.

title: Bowden Adjusts to His Life as a Dadgum Retiree
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla.  Bobby Bowden still lives in the cream-colored brick house he and his wife, Ann, fell in love with in 1976. There was a pool out back, a golf course beyond that and, in the front yard, a sprawling oak tree that canopied the driveway. Its limbs were so big and low that Bowden could walk up them.

title: 2 Slashed at Port Authority Bus Terminal
description: Two men were injured in slashings at the Port Authority Bus Terminal in New York on Tuesday night, sending frightened people running from the station, just a block from the New Years Eve celebration in Times Square, officials said.

title: Cuomo Issues Pardons for First Time in Office
description: ALBANY  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo announced the first pardons of his term on Tuesday afternoon, granting clemency to three New Yorkers whose lives, he said, continued to be hampered by their criminal records.

title: City Makes Deal to Keep Market at Hunts Point
description: On the last day of the Bloomberg administration, city officials bought some time in their long-running effort to keep the Hunts Points Terminal Produce Market from leaving the Bronx for New Jersey or elsewhere.

title: As for Athletes, but Charges of Fraud at North Carolina
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C.  In the summer of 2011, 19 undergraduates at the University of North Carolina signed up for a lecture course called AFAM 280: Blacks in North Carolina. The professor was Julius Nyangoro, an internationally respected scholar and longtime chairman of the African and Afro-American studies department.

title: Not Shy About Expressing Opinions
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  If you do the puzzle online, you will no doubt see this post before you ring in the New Year, but many people dont, so lets pretend its Wednesday morning and New Years Day. Ready?

title: De Blasio Draws All Liberal Eyes to New York City
description: Liberals across the country are looking to Bill de Blasio, who was sworn in as mayor early Wednesday, to morph New York Citys municipal machinery into a closely watched laboratory for populist theories of government that have never before been enacted on such a large scale.

title: As Alumni Meet at the Winter Classic, Even 74-Year-Old Likes to Have Coachs Confidence
description: DETROIT  So many former Detroit Red Wings and Toronto Maple Leafs wanted to play in the Winter Classic alumni game that they staged two games. So all the old Wings and Leafs converged Tuesday afternoon on Comerica Park, a baseball stadium transformed into a wintry ice arena, where some 35,000 fans in tuques and gloves and red sweaters or blue sweaters stamped their feet and thrilled to the sight of their heroes skating down the ice again.

title: Justice Blocks Contraception Mandate on Insurance in Suit by Nuns
description: WASHINGTON  Justice Sonia Sotomayor on Tuesday temporarily blocked the Obama administration from forcing some religious-affiliated groups to provide health insurance coverage of birth control or face penalties as part of the Affordable Care Act.

title: McDonagh Is Expanding His Game, and Adding Admirers
description: Since defenseman Ryan McDonagh made his debut with the Rangers midway through the 2010-11 season, he has been eager to deflect credit to teammates and has rarely sought the limelight.

title: Boy, 15, Charged With Murders in Newark
description: A 15-year-old New Jersey boy was charged on Tuesday with the murders of two teenagers who were among five people shot and killed around Newark on Christmas Day, the Essex County prosecutors office said.

title: Con Ed Agrees Not to Raise Its Residential Electricity Rate for 2 Years
description: Consolidated Edison has agreed to spend about $650 million to prepare for another storm like Hurricane Sandy without raising its rates for residential electricity for two years, the company and state officials announced on Tuesday.

title: Barbara Bush Hospitalized for Pneumonia in Texas
description: HOUSTON  Barbara Bush, the former first lady, has been admitted to a hospital here for treatment of pneumonia. She is recuperating at the same hospital where her husband, former President George Bush, spent weeks overcoming bronchitis-related illnesses in 2012.

title: North Korean Leader Says He Wants Better Ties With South
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un, on Wednesday called for improving relations with South Korea and boasted of his regimes tightened grip on power in his first public speech since the purge and execution of his uncle, Jang Song-thaek, last month.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Dec. 31, 2013
Nets End Year Gaining Nothing but Sympathy
description: SAN ANTONIO  The 31st game of a teams schedule may be an arbitrary checkpoint in the N.B.A. season, but as it fell for the Nets on the final day of the calendar year, it seemed to warrant at least a moment or two of reflection.

title: West Nile Virus Is Behind Bald Eagle Deaths in Utah
description: The mysterious deaths of at least 27 bald eagles in Utah were caused by the West Nile virus, state officials said on Tuesday.

title: Patricia Ryan, a Managing Editor at Time Inc., Dies at 75
description: Patricia Ryan, who started at Time Inc. as a typist in the secretarial pool and rose to become the managing editor of People and Life, a rare ascent for a woman in what was then a male-dominated company, died on Friday at her home in Boothbay, Me. She was 75.

title: Corrections: January 1, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Navigating Our World Like Birds and Bees
description: African tribesmen walk through their landscape in a pattern that eerily echoes the movements of scavenging birds, flocking insects, gliding sharks and visitors to Disneyland, a new study finds, suggesting that aspects of how we choose to move around in our world are deeply hard-wired.

title: Shorter Workweeks Are Likely in New Year
description: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago. He is the author of The Redistribution Recession: How Labor Market Distortions Contracted the Economy.

title: Whats on Wednesday
description: 11 A.M. (HGTV) ROSE PARADE 2014 The new year is once again coming up roses for HGTV, which heralds 2014 from its traditional perch at the 125th annual parade. Vin Scully, the hall of fame sports broadcaster and grand marshal, will lead nearly 50 floats, centered on the theme Dreams Come True and adorned with more botanical elements  including orchids (above), black lichen, Spanish moss, safflower blossoms, coconut flakes and even chive and onion seed  than the average florist might go through in five years, down Colorado Avenue in Pasadena, Calif. The Property Brothers  Drew and Jonathan Scott  and Nancy ODell will provide a play-by-play of the nuptials of Danny Leclair and Aubrey Loots on the AIDS Healthcare Foundations wedding cake float with the tagline Love Is the Best Protection. And eight former Women Airforce Service Pilots from World War II are expected to ride atop a float titled Our Eyes Are on the Stars. (Stanford will take on Michigan State in the Rose Bowl game at 5 p.m. on ESPN.) The HGTV programming moves into prime time at 8 with a tour of the latest Dream Home giveaway: a three-bedroom modern mountain house with soaring ceilings and wilderness views near Lake Tahoe. The winner also gets a GMC Yukon Denali and $250,000.

title: De Blasio Sworn In as New York Mayor
description: Bill de Blasio was sworn in as the 109th mayor of New York City early Wednesday, at two minutes past the stroke of midnight.

title: Mike OConnor, Journalists Advocate, Dies at 67
description: Mike OConnor, a longtime foreign correspondent who had worked in recent years to protect journalists in Mexico, died on Sunday in Mexico City. He was 67.

title: De Blasio Is Sworn In as Mayor
description: Bill de Blasio was sworn in as the 109th mayor of New York City on Wednesday morning, at two minutes past the stroke of midnight.

title: Need Some Greens? Then Eat This Pork Belly
description: Since opening nearly 20 years ago, St. John, Fergus Hendersons famous nose-to-tail restaurant in London, has developed a justifiable reputation for using underappreciated parts of many different types of animals (rolled pigs spleen, anyone?). Henderson also helped popularize serving unusual vegetables and vegetables in unusual forms. I remember ordering English peas and watching a kitchen worker reach into a crate, pile a couple of handfuls of unshelled peas onto a plate and send them to the table.

title: The Quest for a Natural Sugar Substitute
description: On a Sunday evening last September, stevia became famous. In the final episode of Breaking Bad, an image of the sweetener filled the TV screen. Lydia emptied the packet into her mug of camomile tea, not knowing that Walt, her former partner, had poisoned it. How are you feeling? he later asked. Kind of under the weather, like youve got the flu? That would be the ricin I gave you. I slipped it into that stevia crap that youre always putting in your tea.

title: Rebels Seize Portions of Strategic City in South Sudan
description: AWERIAL, South Sudan  On the eve of negotiations to end the conflict in South Sudan, rebel forces on Wednesday seized major sections of the city of Bor, giving them a strategic foothold for a possible march toward the capital and transforming the banks of the White Nile into an impromptu camp for the tens of thousands of people who have fled the fighting.

title: Europeans United, in Hating Europe
description: LONDON  It may seem bizarre that two far-right, nationalist politicians  Marine Le Pen of France and Geert Wilders of the Netherlands  have reached across borders to form a Pan-European group dedicated to weakening the European Union. Their aim is a transnational political alliance that would compete in the May elections for the European Parliament; once in power, they would cooperate to try to rein in the power of Brussels.

title: Putin Visits Volgograd, Site of Two Suicide Attacks
description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putin flew Wednesday to Volgograd, the site of two suicide bombings this week, to hold a meeting with national and regional security officials and visit victims of the bombings in a hospital.

title: 2013, by the Numbers
description: A look at the news events, babies, hacking and diplomacy that defined the year.

title: The Best Small-Business Posts of 2013
description: Once again, here at Youre the Boss, we spent the year in the small-business trenches. Rather than hyping the stories of rock star entrepreneurs who never seem to struggle, we focus on the struggle.

title: Daily Report: Judge Upholds Searches of Travelers Devices at Border
description: The governments right to search travelers electronic devices at the border was upheld in a ruling released by a federal judge on Tuesday, which dismissed a lawsuit challenging this policy, Susan Stellin reports.

title: Lebanon Arrests Leader of Qaeda-Linked Group, Reports Say
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The Lebanese military authorities have detained the Saudi leader of a Sunni militant group linked to Al Qaeda that claimed responsibility for a double suicide bomb attack on the Iranian Embassy in Beirut in November, according to Lebanese news media.

title: In Our Pages: January 2
description: 1914: Aero Club Prize to Mr. Wright

title: A Tale of Two Subway Platforms
description: Dear Diary:

title: After Leukemia, New Years Lipstick-Marked Beginnings
description: It was New Years 2013, and I was preparing to take my little girl to see the lights on the Champs-lyses. Bathed, toweled but not yet dressed, she loitered at my side, twirling her chestnut locks around her fingers and making funny faces as I applied lipstick in the mirror.

title: Security Scare Delays Hearing for Musharraf
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  For the second time since treason proceedings were opened against him, Pakistans former military ruler Pervez Musharraf failed to appear before judges, after explosives were again found along his route to a hearing on Wednesday.

title: Freewheeling Fun
description: Reading a poem like Byrons The Destruction of Sennacherib (beloved byprevious generations of schoolchildren), you can practically feel hooves beating the ground beneath you. But in most contemporary childrens books, cars have replaced horses as the source of exciting noises, rhythms and vibrations.

title: Big Data Shrinks to Grow
description: Whats next for Big Data? Maybe a little thinning down of the industry and a little more focus.

title: The State of the Euro, In One Graph
description: Happy New Year! Im trying to organize my thoughts and data on matters European, and I think Ive come up with a useful way to summarize what has been happening in the euro area. In the figure below I compare the ratio of government debt to GDP (from the IMF  year-end number) with the 10-year interest rate (from the ECB) for a number of euro nations; I show two dates, the peak of the euro crisis in 2011 and a relatively recent observation:

title: Up Early and in Line for a Marijuana Milestone in Colorado
description: DENVER  They lined up before dawn and in the snow on Wednesday, baby boomers from Nebraska, retirees from Denver and a young man who had driven all day from Ohio. Some were longtime marijuana users. Some had been arrested for marijuana possession.

title: Rules of Style | Lou Doillon on Looking Kooky and Staying True to Yourself
description: The model and actress Lou Doillon recorded her first album Places, which came out last summer, in just 10 days with no money and zero expectations. Half the songs were written over the previous seven years just sitting around the house. I always lived with guitarists, she said over a cappuccino last fall in the lobby of the Dream Downtown hotel in New York, the morning after a show at the Highline Ballroom. When they would leave, I would just pick up their acoustic guitars and start doing finger picking and write. When she decided to record the album, she told her producer, Lets do it petite. If it works out, good. And if it doesnt? Then I can die in a corner without anyone noticing.

title: ... In Which a Bat Flies Into the Schlag
description: Real Champagne tends to provoke sticker shock in cash-strapped young people hoping to drink their way through New Years Eve. A popular solution is Andr, the saccharine, mass-produced sparkling wine that sells for about $4 or $5 a bottle.

title: Blast Kills Palestinian, a Diplomat, in Prague
description: BERLIN  The Palestinian ambassador to the Czech Republic died on Wednesday after suffering severe injuries caused by an explosive booby trap security system in a safe at his Prague residence that he apparently had triggered by mistake, the police reported. They said there was no indication the explosion was sabotage or a terrorist attack.

title: Highlights From the de Blasio Inauguration
description: Bill de Blasio was sworn in as the 109th mayor of New York City on Wednesday, a few minutes after midnight, but his formal inauguration ceremony on the steps of City Hall began at noon. Times reporters and photographers arrived early to capture the scene, and will continue to cover the event.

title: Next Stop on Odyssey: The Knicks
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Jeremy Tyler was back on the practice court for the Knicks on Tuesday morning as the 15th man. It was no small victory for him.

title: NASA Responds to Beyoncs Use of Challenger Audio
description: Beyoncs new self-titled album has won raves from critics and fans, but now it has come under indirect fire from an unexpected authority: NASA.

title: A 10th Play Is the Charm
description: In an impressive and unusually enduring relationship spanning three decades, the Manhattan Theater Club has produced nine plays by John Patrick Shanley, none of which started on Broadway. But with the 10th, the romantic comedy Outside Mullingar, which is in previews at the Samuel J. Friedman Theater, that streak will change. This show, about two neighboring misfits whose families are in a land dispute in rural Ireland, reunites some of the same Tony-winning artists who worked on Mr. Shanleys only drama to transfer to Broadway, the celebrated Doubt: the superb actor Brian F. OByrne, here playing an introvert living on a cattle farm, and the veteran director Doug Hughes. Debra Messing, who played the scarf-favoring lyricist in the NBC series Smash, makes her Broadway debut as Mr. OByrnes love interest. (261 West 47th Street, Manhattan; 212-239-6200, manhattantheatreclub.com.)

title: The Hazards of Moving Oil By Rail Again on Display, This Time in North Dakota
description: The fiery derailment of a 106-car oil train in North Dakota on Monday is the latest manifestation of the perils that come with expanding shipments of the countrys Bakken oil bounty by rail. The Wall Street Journal has a good update, as does NPR. An Associated Press report included this context:

title: Schumachers Condition Unchanged, Manager Says
description: LONDON  The former grand prix racing driver Michael Schumacher was in a stable condition, with no significant changes in the 24 hours since his doctors met with reporters on Tuesday, his manager said on Wednesday. The doctors had described Schumacher, 44, as being in critical condition, in a medically induced coma and on life-support systems, after two brain operations.

title: To Play a Rooster, Do the Research
description: Bobby Moreno studied birds once he was cast as Odysseus Rex, the title bird of Eric Dufaults dark cockfighting comedy Year of the Rooster. He researched how they walk (sharp and jerky), look (his hair becomes a punk cockscomb in the show) and kiss (more on that later). But he also got into their heads.

title: Finding a Kings Mind, Not Losing It
description: One of the many problems with the role of King Lear, Shakespeares oldest and most irascible monarch, is that by the time an actor is old enough to play it, he may be too old to pull it off.

title: Taking Office, de Blasio Vows to Fix Inequity
description: Bill de Blasio, whose fiery populism propelled his rise from obscure neighborhood official to the 109th mayor of New York, was sworn into office on Wednesday, pledging that his ambition for a more humane and equal metropolis would remain undimmed.

title: 36 Hours in Chicago
description: Chicago is a city that changes noticeably with the seasons. It is endlessly beautiful in the warm months, when the sidewalks transform into cafes, the Lakefront Trail becomes a Divvy Bike highway and the beaches along Lake Michigan might be mistaken for Miami. As the temperatures fall, the city changes from a playground to a cultural promised land  a place of fine and varied food, inventive theater and one of the countrys great live music scenes. From the historic high-rises of the Gold Coast to regal Hyde Park, from Bronzeville to Boystown, from the Indian and Puerto Rican enclaves of Devon Avenue and Humboldt Park, respectively, to the bohemian barrios of Logan Square and Pilsen, Chicago demands hard choices. It rarely disappoints.

title: Classical Playlist: Boston Baroque, Rafal Blechacz, Alexandre Tharaud and More
description: HAYDN: Lord Nelson Mass (with Symphony No. 102 in B flat)Boston Baroque; Martin Pearlman, conductor; Mary Wilson, Abigail Fischer, Keith Jameson and Kevin Deas(Linn)The political turmoil of the Napoleonic Wars raged across Europe when Haydn wrote this Missa in Angustiis (Mass in a Time of Anxiety), which came to be named after Admiral Lord Nelson of Britain. Boston Baroque, led by Martin Pearlman, performs the stormy opening movement with rhythmic verve and intensity. A fine quartet of soloists, including the bright lyric soprano Mary Wilson and the magnanimous bass-baritone Kevin Deas, jostle for the spotlight with the orchestra, which shines in the rambunctious Symphony No. 102. (Corinna da Fonseca-Wollheim)

title: Why Hire a P.R. Firm When Theres TaskRabbit?
description: Several months after Olton Rensch lost his information technology job in a round of layoffs, he heard about a host of new smartphone apps like Sidecar, a ride-sharing app, TaskRabbit, the app marketplace for odd jobs and chores, and Airbnb, a website that connects travelers with housing.

title: At Newark Airport, a 3-D Distraction
description: Post-holiday travelers facing delays at Newark Liberty International Airport currently have something other than departure screens to stare at, thanks to a recently added distraction: a free 3-D movie.

title: Snowboarders Push Into Alaska, by Foot
description: After spending 15 years exploring the peaks of Alaska by helicopter and snowboarding down them, Jeremy Jones started to discover remote mountains under his own power.

title: French Leader Would Reward Companies That Hire More People
description: PARIS  President Franois Hollande, seeking to reduce Frances punishingly high unemployment rate, has called for a responsibility pact with businesses that would reward companies that hire more people with lower taxes and greater flexibility.

title: Danielle Steel Awarded French Legion of Honor
description: Danielle Steel joined the ranks of Douglas MacArthur, Julia Child, Walt Disney, Alan Greenspan and Bob Dylan on Wednesday when she became the latest American to receive Frances highest award, the Legion of Honor.

title: Big Chill in the Big House for Torontos Winter Classic Win
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.  Torontos Jonathan Bernier wore heat packs inside his goalie pants and blocker pad. Several players wore black balaclavas under their helmets; a few wore knit caps atop them. Water bottles froze on the benches. Amid falling snow and bitter cold on New Years Day, more than 100,000 fans packed the Big House to watch the Maple Leafs and the Detroit Red Wings play in the N.H.L.s sixth Winter Classic.

title: Video: Snowboarders Push Deep Into Alaska  by Foot
description: In the past six years, Jeremy Jones has collaborated with Teton Gravity Research to create a trilogy of films: Deeper, Further and now Higher. These films document his efforts to explore and snowboard remote mountains under his own power.

title: Cocktail Culture | A Spot of (Spiked) Tea
description: Around New York, boozy versions of a spot of tea are warming up winter drink menus this season as Manhattan mixologists blend green, black and white tea leaves with a range of spirits and wines.

title: Text of Bill de Blasios Inauguration Speech
description: The following is the complete text of Mayor Bill de Blasios inaugural address, as prepared for delivery.

title: E.U. Labor Market Opens for Romanians and Bulgarians
description: PARIS  The lifting of labor restrictions on Wednesday for Bulgarians and Romanians in nine European Union countries, including Germany, France and Britain, was greeted as both an opportunity and a threat, touching off fear among some about unchecked immigration from Bulgaria and Romania, two of the poorest states in Europe.

title: Showstopper in What May Have Been Manziels Last College Game
description: ATLANTA  Johnny Manziel flung his helmet to the ground, raced to the equipment cart on the Texas A&M sideline and climbed atop it on Tuesday night. He raised his arms over his head and rubbed the tips of his fingers together, sign language for a payday that has just arrived.

title: Tony n Tinas Wedding Coming Back to New York
description: After an interim of apparent wedded bliss elsewhere, the participatory Off Broadway play Tony n Tinas Wedding, last seen flinging ziti and zingers near Times Square in 2010, will be bringing its raucous participatory spirit back to New York City.

title: For New York, a Winning Year. Really.
description: Yes, 2013 was not much of a year for sports teams in the New York metropolitan region. The nine major local sports franchises had more downs than ups and, in addition to being mediocre or worse, were often just plain boring.

title: The Inaugural Address of Bill de Blasio
description: In his inauguration speech in front of City Hall, Bill de Blasio laid out a mayoralty that emphasized social and economic justice.

title: Minneapolis Fire Injures More Than a Dozen
description: An explosion and fire on Wednesday destroyed a Minneapolis building that housed 10 apartments and a grocery, injuring at least 14 people, the authorities said. Most of injuries were burns or broken bones suffered by people who jumped  or were blown  out of rooms on the second and third floors.

title: The 109th Mayor of New York
description: Bill de Blasio claimed his place as mayor on Wednesday. On the steps of City Hall, he was ceremonially sworn in by former President Clinton.

title: Young Poet Speaks at Inauguration
description: Ramya Ramana, the New York City Youth Poet Laureate, delivered the poem New York City at Mayor Bill de Blasios inauguration ceremony.

title: Settlement News to Wait Until Kerry Leaves Israel
description: JERUSALEM  The Israeli government will delay an expected announcement of bids for new settlement construction for the next few days while Secretary of State John Kerry is in the region, an Israeli official said Wednesday, avoiding a potential high-profile clash over the contentious issue.

title: As Latvia Adopts Euro, Future Growth Is Slowing
description: PARIS  Dace Utinane, a doctor at a private health center, frowned during a stroll this week through Riga, the capital of Latvia, as she contemplated her countrys move to become the newest member of Europes currency union.

title: Vote on New Boeing Contract Highlights a Rift in the Machinists Union
description: After Boeings workers in Washington State voted down an eight-year contract extension in November, Boeing wasted little time in soliciting offers from other states to build its new 777X aircraft.

title: 2 Conservatives Join Iran Nuclear Panel
description: TEHRAN  Two members of Irans hard-line-dominated Parliament were added to a supervisory council responsible for monitoring the countrys nuclear negotiating team, Iranian news media reported Wednesday. The additions appeared to strengthen the influence of critics of the talks between Iran and world powers.

title: Would You Rather Run a Restaurant or Sell Tomato Sauce?
description: We just published a case study about the owner of an eight-table Italian restaurant on the cusp of a major decision. Carlos Vega bought the 900-square-foot Father and Son Pizzeria in Guttenberg, N.J., in 2007 and worked long hours perfecting the restaurants house sauce, expanding the menu options and building a vibrant takeout trade. Though the business was profitable, revenues plateaued well short of where he had hoped. Two years in, Mr. Vega found himself debating the pros and cons of two very different paths forward.

title: Some Hefty Chops, Seasoned by Antics
description: During the New York Philharmonics New Years Eve concert at Avery Fisher Hall, the pianist Hyung-ki Joo revealed the three simple steps necessary to make it in the music business: 1. Always smile. 2. Play only music that everyone knows. 3. Show off.

title: A Cleaned-Up Hotel in a Cleaned-Up Times Square
description: It isnt easy for hotels to stand out from their competitors. In 2006, however, the Hotel Carter, at 250 West 43rd Street, found a new way to do so when TripAdvisor readers named it the dirtiest hotel in America.

title: Ariel Sharon, Former Prime Minister of Israel, Is Said to Be Near Death
description: JERUSALEM  Ariel Sharon, the former prime minister of Israel who has been comatose for nearly eight years, edged closer to death on Wednesday evening, suffering from kidney failure.

title: A Stock Exchange Expands Its Global Reach
description: Updated, 10:36 a.m. | The face of the global stock market used to be the classically proportioned exchange building on Wall Street.

title: Civilian Photography, Now Rising to New Level
description: Five years ago, the DJI Phantom 2 Vision would have seemed like a science fiction film prop or a piece of surveillance hardware flown only by the sexiest of superspies. But it is the first camera-carrying drone you may want to own  and you could do that without spending thousands of dollars.

title: Two Graphic Narratives, Inspired by the Fab Four
description: Science is the new rock n roll. Or so the four scientists at the center of the beguiling new Image Comics series Nowhere Men would have you believe. These men have banded together to form World Corp., a research and development company that has a profound influence on the planet through advances in things like cyberoptics and genetics. But ideological shifts and personality clashes cause their alliance to fracture.

title: Cleaning the Mobile Germ Warehouse
description: TAKE a look at your mobile device. Do you see oily fingerprints and lint on the touch screen? Dust and crumbs forming particulate frost in the corners? Is that a hair stuck at the screens edge?

title: Markets Buoyant, Merger Activity Picks Up
description: What may have been the most auspicious deal of late was not the biggest or the most groundbreaking of mergers. It was just one that took a little gumption.

title: Removing Edits in a Document, and Minimizing a Bar of Icons
description: Cleaning Up

title: Resolve to Pay Attention to Resolution Reminders
description: I find New Years resolutions tricky and have avoided them in the past. I have difficulty dreaming up resolutions in the first place, and then I have problems sticking to them.

title: Regaining Footing, and a Leader
description: It seems too simple, too easy somehow, but theres no denying the evidence before our eyes: Community is a worthwhile show again now that Dan Harmon, its creator, is back in his office doing whatever it is he does so obsessively.

title: Friday A/X Pairs at Edgar Kaplan Winter Regional
description: The Friday A/X Pairs at the Edgar Kaplan Winter Regional in New York City, which ended Monday, was won by Joan Brody of Morristown, N.J., and Kent Mignocchi of New York City. They finished two-fifths of a board ahead of John McAllister of Charlottesville, Va., and Ishmael DelMonte from Australia, whose 75 percent second session was not quite enough to snatch victory. Third were R. Jay Becker of New York City and Michael Kamil of Holmdel, N.J.

title: A Mole in Deepest Beige
description: Acting, like spying, is the art of lying persuasively.

title: New Detroit Mayor Sworn In
description: Mike Duggan, a former hospital executive and prosecutor, begins his effort to renew a city long in decline.

title: Analyzing de Blasios Inaugural Address
description: Follow along with this interactive replay of Bill de Blasios inaugural address, as reporters from The New York Times offer context and analysis on the mayors first speech.

title: Banned at Home and Noticed by Oscars
description: Maxim Pozdorovkin thought that once he made it past the airport in Moscow, hed be home free. Mr. Pozdorovkin is a director, with Mike Lerner, of the documentary Pussy Riot: A Punk Prayer, and after two members of that Russian activist group were released from prison in late December, they all put together a screening of the film in their home country, Russia. It was to be the films first showing there, and the first time the two group members, Maria Alyokhina and Nadezhda Tolokonnikova, were to see the documentary, which traces the story of their collective from little-known artists to globally famous political rebels.

title: Hawaii Tourists Revel in Sun, Surf and Semiautomatics
description: HONOLULU  Kenji and Hiromasa Ozawa, a father and son vacationing on the island of Oahu, spent Christmas morning hiking up Diamond Head, a volcanic cone here with sweeping views of Waikiki Beach.

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: Cold Turkey Isnt the Only Route
description: THIS New Years, a good number of those who struggle to control their drinking will resolve to abstain from alcohol. No halfway measures. Quitting is the only way.

title: Body Pulled From Lake in Central Park
description: The body of a man in his 20s was pulled from the Lake in Central Park on Wednesday in what the New York Police Department described as a probable suicide.

title: Boehner on Immigration
description: A selection of Speaker John A. Boehners remarks in recent months on immigration legislation.

title: After a Death, Keeping a Yiddish-Lovers Weekly Conversations Alive
description: For a quarter of a century, Beyle Schaechter-Gottesman gathered friends around her dining room table every Monday afternoon for coffee, tea and Yiddish.

title: High Rollers in a Buying Mood
description: DETROIT  Matt Hlavin, an entrepreneur in Cleveland who owns seven businesses, mostly in manufacturing, bought three Mercedes last year: a $237,000 SLS AMG and a $165,000 S63 AMG for himself, and a $97,000 GL550 sport utility vehicle for his wife.

title: Two Months in a Homeless Shelter Spurred a Teenagers Desire to Study
description: Homeless but Not Hopeless. That had been the title of the essay Oscar Ibarra submitted along with his college applications, inspired by the two months he spent living in a shelter. It was about how I pushed myself to do work even though times got hard for me and my family, Mr. Ibarra said. I thought I might have to drop out of school.

title: A Girls Escape
description: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti  She was a 13-year-old girl who said she was beaten daily by strangers who forced her to work unpaid in their home, and she wanted to escape.

title: Fatal Attacks Strike a Hotel in Somalia
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia  At least six people were killed and many more were wounded after consecutive car bombings and an attack by armed militants at a hotel in Mogadishu on Wednesday evening, officials said.

title: A Business Owner Seeks an Alternative to Seven-Day Workweeks
description: FATHER AND SON PIZZERIA is a 900-square-foot, eight-table restaurant in Guttenberg, N.J., across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Opened in 1971, it was bought in 2007 by Carlos Vega, now 45, from its aging founder. Mr. Vega soon doubled sales by expanding the menu, improving service and selling the restaurants gravy, or red sauce, over the counter in 12-ounce Mason jars.

title: Carrying On a Presidential Tradition, One Leisurely Round at a Time
description: KANEOHE, Hawaii  No one should ever question President Obamas passion for golf. He has played some of the countrys most picturesque courses, held a debt-limit golf summit with Speaker John A. Boehner, taken on Tiger Woods and found time to steal away for a round in political good times and bad.

title: Fiat, in Deal With Union, Will Buy Rest of Chrysler
description: DETROIT  Chrysler, the smallest of the three American automakers, is set to be completely absorbed by an Italian company, Fiat.

title: Plotting Strategic Deals
description: The annual volume of deal-making in the United States was up 11 percent in 2013.

title: Health Law Challenge Opens Up New Front
description: WASHINGTON  In temporarily blocking enforcement of the part of President Obamas health care law that requires many employers to provide health insurance coverage for birth control or face penalties, Justice Sonia Sotomayor on Tuesday opened a second front in Supreme Court challenges to the provision.

title: Totally Final Year-End Quiz
description: One of the great things about being in a new year is getting to wipe 2013 from our minds. Completely. Forever. Except maybe this one last, final, end-of-the-year quiz. (Coming Tomorrow. 2014: Whats Gone Wrong So Far?)

title: James Avery, Fresh Prince Actor, Dies at 68
description: James Avery, who played Will Smiths pompous but well-meaning uncle on the popular 1990s sitcom The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air, died on Tuesday in Glendale, Calif. He was 68.

title: Telling the World It Sells Stethoscopes, Too
description: SOME items that were commonplace when Staples, the office products chain, opened in 1986 may seem like quaint artifacts today but are still, in fact, sold by the store, including typewriters, Rolodexes and daily planners. A new ad campaign by the retailer is not promoting basic office supplies of any era, however, but rather the increasingly vast array of other products it sells.

title: Boy, 7, Is Killed in Fire Begun by Fireplace Spark
description: A 7-year-old boy died on Wednesday morning when a fire ripped through the top floor of a rowhouse in the East Elmhurst neighborhood of Queens, the authorities said.

title: Redskins Coach Search Is Said to Include Fewell
description: The Washington Redskins have requested and received permission from the Giants to interview Perry Fewell for their vacant head coaching job, according to people aware of the conversations between the teams who were not authorized to speak publicly about the job search.

title: Loan Monitor Is Accused of Ruthless Tactics on Student Debt
description: Stacy Jorgensen fought her way through pancreatic cancer. But her struggle was just beginning.

title: Consumers Start Using Coverage Under Health Law
description: WASHINGTON  Kathy Hornbach of Tucson is not wasting any time before using her new health insurance coverage, which took effect on New Years Day. Ms. Hornbach, 57, has an appointment with a cardiologist on Thursday for a stress test.

title: Garnetts Spirits Dip With His Production
description: SAN ANTONIO  Kevin Garnett said Wednesday that this season was more frustrating than any of the previous 18 he had played.

title: Letter Tied to Fight for Independence Is Found in Museums Attic
description: It was lying in a drawer in the attic, a 12-page document that was not just forgotten but misfiled. Somehow it had made its way into a folder with colonial-era doctors bills that someone in the 1970s decreed was worthless and should be thrown away.

title: Whos Who on the Dais
description: Though there was no shortage of fund-raisers and political operatives facing the stage, much of the dais was given over to everyday people. Still, some notable names were in attendance.

title: Boehner Is Said to Back Change on Immigration
description: WASHINGTON  Speaker John A. Boehner of Ohio has signaled he may embrace a series of limited changes to the nations immigration laws in the coming months, giving advocates for change new hope that 2014 might be the year that a bitterly divided Congress reaches a political compromise to overhaul the sprawling system.

title: At Issue in Skakels Libel Suit Against TV Host, Degrees of Tarnish on a Reputation
description: Is a journalist committing libel if he falsely reports that a known traitor like Benedict Arnold is also a shoplifter, or a notorious mobster like John J. Gotti a dognapper?

title: After Pageantry, Tough Stop and Timely Passes Lift Spartans in Rose Bowl
description: PASADENA, Calif.  For all the analysis that precedes a contest like the Rose Bowl, for the hundreds of hours of scrutiny, Michigan States season hinged Wednesday on a quarterback who started the season as a backup and a linebacker who arrived on campus as a walk-on.

title: Totally Final Year-End Quiz
description: Before you forget about 2013 entirely, lets see how well you paid attention to major events. No peeking at the answer key, people, until all questions have been completed!

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Jan. 1, 2014
With Talent Abundant, U.S. Makes Tough Cuts
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.  Jack Johnson, an American-born defenseman, is a 10-time national team member who played on the 2010 United States Olympic team that won a silver medal at the Vancouver Games and came within one goal of the gold. Johnsons patriotism runs so deep that he traveled to Canada at his own expense four years ago to march in the opening ceremony ahead of the hockey competition.

title: Plenty of Reminders of Populisms Limits
description: Shedding coat and gloves, and the last inhibitions of the inside operative, Bill de Blasio used the ice-edged tapestry of his inauguration to make clear that his campaign oratory would become the lodestar for his administration.

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, January 2, 2014
description: We are called to put an end to economic and social inequalities that threatened to unravel the city we love.

title: Major Florida State Wins Live On in Sod Cemetery
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla.  North of Florida States football stadium, next to the practice fields and near a parking lot, there is a cemetery lined by a fence.

title: The Campaign for a Bigger Paycheck
description: Aided by a vast flow of corporate and right-wing money, Republicans have spent years persuading the public that the deficit is the nations biggest financial problem and that austerity is the answer to it. Their success in making that argument  keeping taxes and government investment low  has helped increase American income inequality to crisis proportions: 95 percent of the income gains since 2009 have gone to the top 1 percent. The majority of the country has stagnated or lost ground, leaving the economy sluggish.

title: New Yorkers Assess Their New Mayor
description: In his inaugural address at City Hall, New York's new mayor, Bill de Blasio, promised to follow through on promises to address inequality. The mood among some New Yorkers was positive, but pragmatic.

title: Edward Snowden, Whistle-Blower
description: Seven months ago, the world began to learn the vast scope of the National Security Agencys reach into the lives of hundreds of millions of people in the United States and around the globe, as it collects information about their phone calls, their email messages, their friends and contacts, how they spend their days and where they spend their nights. The public learned in great detail how the agency has exceeded its mandate and abused its authority, prompting outrage at kitchen tables and at the desks of Congress, which may finally begin to limit these practices.

title: Colorado Stores Selling Marijuana Open Their Doors
description: At 40 shops across the state, residents and tourists flashed their identifications and took part in what supporters hailed as a historic departure from drug laws focused on punishment and prohibition.

title: Corrections: January 2, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Burning the Midnight Oil
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  You learn a lot doing this job. Besides learning how to care for the emus and emergency-handcode JSON at midnight (which they definitely dont teach in humor writers school), I am lucky enough to learn about all sorts of things that come out of the crossword puzzles. It goes on constantly, and that perhaps explains why, on the last day of the year which is when I am writing this post, my brain just couldnt find the will to tease Todd Grosss theme out of todays puzzle. When I finally found out what it was, however, I thought it was brilliant.

title: At Inauguration, Seeing Another Sign of Change in What the First Family Wore
description: Bill de Blasio was dressed in a suit that seemed to basically fit. His wife, Chirlane McCray, wore a tailored, aubergine coat, his daughter, Chiara, had on a leopard-print overcoat, and his son, Dante, was in a suit and a plaid scarf, but no tie.

title: Thinking Beyond the Pill
Alfred Marshall, Founder of Stores That Bear His Name, Dies at 94
description: Alfred Marshall, a founder of the Marshalls department store chain, which became a success buying out-of-season, irregular and overstocked inventory from fashionable clothing stores and selling it at a discount, died on Dec. 28 in Boca Raton, Fla. He was 94.

title: Bill Clinton Swears In de Blasio
description: The former president officiated at the swearing-in of New York Citys 109th mayor, Bill de Blasio.

title: With Clintons in His Corner, de Blasio Bolsters Ties to His Partys Gold Standard
description: At an inauguration infused with populist talk about racial tensions, social inequities and the Dickensian conditions of New York Citys poorest residents, Mayor Bill de Blasio had the support of the centrist standard bearers of the Democratic Party: former President Bill Clinton and former Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton.

title: New Years Day, 1864
description: It is easy enough to conclude in hindsight that 1863 was a year of turning points  the Emancipation Proclamation, Gettysburg and Vicksburg most prominent among them  on the Unions road to victory. Indeed, the sesquicentennial commemorations of 2013 featured a wide array of programs, articles, symposiums, forums and blogs with turning points as their theme. But as the year draws to a close, we should pause to remember how uncertain the situation still looked to Northerners in the first days of 1864.

title: Whats Missing in My Byline?
description: If you look closely at my Times byline, beginning with Thursdays column, youll notice something odd. Well, actually, you probably wont notice it.

title: For Prostitutes Jailed in China, Forced Labor With No Recourse
description: BEIJING  Bathed in the fluorescent pink light that signaled she was ready for business, the woman rattled off the occupational hazards of working as a prostitute in China: abusive clients, the specter of H.I.V. and the scathing glares of neighbors that tear at her soul.

title: An Inaugural Pageantry, With Verse, Song and Surprise Meetings
description: There were grandmothers in fur coats, construction workers with gripes about low pay, and friends and former co-workers with memories of basketball games and protests.

title: From Todays Paper: Volcano Rumbles To Life Again In Indonesia
description: Mount Sinabung, which has sporadically erupted since September, started again Wednesday. Some 20,000 have been evacuated.

title: Kale? Juicing? Trouble Ahead
description: I was into health food before it was cool. There were only two other people I knew who frequented my neighborhood health food store in the late 80s: an emaciated man with a gray ponytail and a woman with a surprising amount of underarm hair, who smelled of B.O. and patchouli.

title: Netanyahu Demands Recognition of Israel
description: The Israeli prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, has said that Palestinians recognition of the Jewish state is an issue that underpins all others.

title: Sticking Point in Peace Talks: Recognition of a Jewish State
description: JERUSALEM  As Middle East peace talks churn on, Israel has catapulted to the fore an issue that may be even more intractable than old ones like security and settlements: a demand that the Palestinians recognize Israel as a Jewish state.

title: Peruvian Style Gets a Contemporary Update
description: Mario Testino isnt the only notable celebrating Peruvian style right now. In his exhibition Alta Moda, on view now through March 29 at the Queen Sofia Spanish Institute in New York, the fashion photographer celebrates the countrys early ornate fashion with a series of images of its traditional costumes. Meanwhile, fashion designers are adding to the countrys style legacy, taking cues from early and modern Peruvian artisans. Saturated colors, rich textures and intricate detailing have become urban-jungle-friendly thanks to a slew of ready-to-wear pieces and accessories, like Chlos nubby boucle sheath in playful pastels and Tabitha Simmonss multicolored Peruvian silk espadrilles. Pom poms, tassels and beads appear on many of the playful accessories, including a knit bag from Mochila and a handmade clutch from the Muzungu Sisters, which could almost pass for souvenirs from a trip to Machu Picchu.

title: Cleverly Made Carpets That Look Good Enough to Eat
description: Since joining forces in 2011, the Brooklyn designers Chen Chen and Kai Williams have created a number of surprising products derived from experiments with process. One of the most interesting was their cold-cut coasters, made by wrapping materials such as fishnet and rope around a central wooden rod or bone and then slicing it, like a maki roll. The resulting multicolored disks really do look almost edible. The coasters were the inspiration for a set of four circular rugs the duo created for the luxury custom carpet company Tai Ping, which was unveiled last month at Design Miami. Using a technique the designers came up with to combine multiple fibers, the carpets were fabricated in wool, cotton, chenille, bamboo, PVC, silk and more, giving the appearance of a cross section of a living organism beneath your feet.

title: Ask Well: Is Nail Polish Harmful?
description: Question:

title: The Rich Country Trap
description: Simon Johnson, former chief economist of the International Monetary Fund, is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.

title: New Venture for AllThingsD Journalists
description: Walter S. Mossberg and Kara Swisher, founders of the conference and news business All Things Digital, are expected to start their new venture, ReCode, on Thursday.

title: Talk Radio on WABC Shifts Focus to the Local
description: In the war over talk radio in New York, WABC is going local.

title: Newbery Winner to Promote Her Genre
description: The huge popularity of young-adult books like The Hunger Games series might leave the impression that childrens literature needs no added promotion.

title: Whats on Thursday
description: 7 P.M. (Syfy) PAUL (2011) He looks like any other extraterrestrial, with his otherworldly cast, bald bobble head, big eyes and stick limbs. Until you get to the board shorts and the backpack. In other words, Paul, voiced by Seth Rogen and the title character of this comedy from Greg Mottola, is a little green dude. And he comes in peace, man, despite causing havoc while he tries to phone home. Simon Pegg, above with Paul, and Nick Frost are the best friends, fresh from a Comic-Con convention in San Diego, who run into Paul as they guide their recreational vehicle toward Area 51, the military base in Nevada where the conspiracy minded think the government stashes aliens. Jason Bateman is one of the men in black huntingPaul; Kristen Wiig is the love interest who wears a T-shirt depicting Jesus blowing away Darwin; and John Carroll Lynch is her daddy, a member of the Bible and gun club. As genial, foolish and demographically engineered as it sounds (hailing all fan boys and girls), Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times, Paul is at once a buddy flick and a classic American road movie of self- (and other) discovery, interspersed with buckets of expletives and some startling (especially for a big-studio release) pokes at Christian fundamentalism.

title: Private Schools for Poor Pressured by Right to Education Act
description: MUMBAI  In Dharavi, a Mumbai slum, a ramshackle building houses the Bombay South Indian Adi-Dravida Sangh school, where 1,000 students from poor families take their classes in English, a language increasingly perceived as the key to a white-collar job.

title: With Downed Balloon, China and Japan Cooperate
description: Once in a while in the fiercely contested East China Sea, a bit of international cooperation breaks out.
