description: In this weeks puzzle by Daniel Finkel we continue to follow an itinerant nun who most recently made her way to a shrine in the holy town of Duona. We now join her in some construction work.

title: Numberplay 2013: A Year in Review
description: Happy New Year! We had quite an adventure in 2013, and Im looking forward to continuing the quantitative fun this coming year (check out this weeks challenge below). Before we get too far a short reflection on our recent travels. Numberplay in 2013 featured original problems from many prominent and emerging mathematicians problems that served as terrific platforms for our weekly explorations. A connection to an original creator is a powerful experience, and we were fortunate to have had many, including understanding fundamental origami concepts with Barry Hayes; discovering combinatorics with Joel Spencer, Ron Graham and Bla Bollobs; exploring primes with Bernardo Recamn.

title: Yellen Wins Backing of Senators to Lead Fed
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate confirmed Janet L. Yellen as the chairwoman of the Federal Reserve on Monday, marking the first time that a woman will lead the countrys central bank in its 100-year history.

title: British Regulators Open Investigations Into Co-operative Bank
description: LONDON  British regulators said on Monday that they were starting formal investigations into Co-operative Bank after recent revelations about its former chairman and continuing questions about a capital shortfall of 1.5 billion pounds last year.

title: Eurythmics to Reunite for Beatles Tribute
description: When you think of the Beatles, you think of classic pop harmonies delivered in a British accent and imaginative lyrics that have stood up for half a century. And when you think of these attributes, surely you also think of Eurythmics, John Mayer, Keith Urban and Maroon 5. Or, at least, CBS is hoping that you will, as those are some of the first artists theyve lined up to perform in a television tribute to the Beatles that will be broadcast on the network next month.

title: The Read Around: Video of Nikki Giovanni
description: In The Read Around, a weekly video feature, authors discuss the when, where and how behind their books. Above, Nikki Giovanni discusses her latest book, Chasing Utopia, the beer that inspired its title and why poetry keeps people from feeling lonely.

title: Broad Strokes vs. Pinpoint in Martoma Trial
description: The trial of Mathew Martoma, a former portfolio manager at SAC Capital Advisors, is the big kahuna for federal prosecutors. While they have won convictions in a number of insider trading trials, this is among the most significant cases because of the dollar amount of the trading, approximately $276 million, and the involvement of Steven A. Cohen, SACs founder and owner.

title: Prepping Food and Their Future
description: Next Generation Caterers in the Bronx helps prepare youth for careers in gastronomy. The Neediest Cases Fund paid the fees for its three interns to take the New York State food protection exam.

title: MAN: Fall 2014 Menswear
description: London

title: Topman Lets the London Rains Pour Down
description: LONDON  The coat was a sheer sheet of plastic, revealing a bright red sweater underneath. This shoulders-to-ankles cover-up was just the thing to offset the water that stood in pools on the runway or had been streaming from above  although Londons drenching rains had stopped for a bit.

title: Mutant Petunias Sing the Blues
description: Blue petunias are a rarity in nature and a favorite among gardeners. Now, researchers say they have discovered the genetic glitch that produces the colored flowers.

title: Rose Petal and Vanilla Tea
description: This is a sweet infusion with nothing more than dried rose petals, a vanilla bean and honey. You can find dried rose petals in Middle Eastern markets.

title: Weekend Gun Report: January 3-5, 2014
description: A week after we began the Gun Report, we decided to end each post with Slates gun death tally, an interactive feature which tracked shootings in the news since the Newtown massacre on Dec. 14, 2012. Slate partnered with a Twitter user, @gundeaths, who had been linking to news stories about people killed by guns. No one else in the media was sounding the daily drumbeat of gun violence, and Slate invited readers to contribute details about the shootings it featured every day, giving us a sense of exactly who was getting shot in America.

title: Teodoro Zamoras Commission
description: On a humid November day in 1863, Teodoro Zamora and his two brothers rode to the mouth of the Rio Grande. After tying their horses to a lone tree, they walked to where Col. Edmund Davis of the First Texas Cavalry Regiment stood, waiting.

title: These Females Prefer a Familiar (Fish) Face
description: Female fish are quicker to mate with a male theyve seen before, thanks in part to a neuron that springs to life in the presence of familiar males, researchers say.

title: Today in Small Business: Running Out of Marijuana
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Monday Motorsports: Dakar Rally Underway in Argentina
description: Carlos Sousa of Portugal, driving a Chinese-made Haval H8, which looks something like a BMW X3, took the victory Sunday in the first stage of the 2014 Dakar Rally, which ran from Rosario to San Luis, Argentina. He was closely trailed by three entrants in all-wheel-drive Minis.

title: Iran Urged to Use Influence With Syrian Leader
description: BRUSSELS  Iran could improve its chances of playing at least a limited role in the upcoming peace conference on Syria if it persuaded President Bashar al-Assad to stop the bombardment of Aleppo and allow the delivery of humanitarian aid to besieged towns and cities, senior State Department officials said on Monday.

title: Lea Seydouxs Luxe Combo of Florals, Crystals and Satin
description: The Girl: The French actress and model, who earned raves for her performance in Blue Is the Warmest Color last year, was in London today, where she accepted a nomination for the EE Rising Star Award, to be presented next month at the British Academy Film Awards.

title: Trial on Detroit Swaps Deal Is Delayed
description: A trial over how Detroit should end costly financial contracts with two big banks was suspended Monday after more than a foot of snow fell, paralyzing much of the city and closing the federal courthouse there.

title: U.S. and Iran Face Common Enemies in Mideast Strife
description: TEHRAN  Even as the United States and Iran pursue negotiations on Tehrans nuclear program, they find themselves on the same side of a range of regional issues surrounding an insurgency raging across the Middle East.

title: Anna E. Crouse, 97, Dies; Championed Discount Tickets for Broadway
description: Anna E. Crouse, a onetime actress whose fondest Broadway dream  a healthy Manhattan theater district and affordable tickets for young people  was realized when she helped establish the TKTS booth in Duffy Square, died on Dec. 29 in Manhattan. She was 97.

title: 10 Years for Plot to Murder Cartoonist
description: PHILADELPHIA  A federal judge on Monday sentenced a Pennsylvania woman to 10 years in prison for her part in a plan to murder a Swedish cartoonist whose images of the Prophet Muhammad offended Muslims.

title: Jerry Coleman, 89, Yankee Infielder, Fighter Pilot and Voice of the Padres
description: Jerry Coleman, a former fighter pilot who played in six World Series as an infielder for the Yankees but who made his most lasting mark as a broadcaster, first for the Yankees and then more indelibly for the San Diego Padres, died Sunday near his home in San Diego. He was 89.

title: What Your Cat Is Thinking
description: Cat owners speak to their cats, attribute many complex emotions to them and chide them when they bring small dead rodents into the house. People dont pause to ask what is going on in the mind of the cat during these interactions, and perhaps thats just as well. The role of a pet is to be relentlessly anthropomorphized.

title: Inside the Cat Brain
description: Excerpt from the preface of Cat Sense: How the New Feline Science Can Make You a Better Friend to Your Pet by John Bradshaw.

title: When Doctors Google Their Patients
description: I remember when I first looked up a patient on Google. It was my last day on the bone marrow transplant unit, back when I was an intern. As I stood before the patient, taking her history, she told me she had been a painter and suggested I look up her work on the Internet. I did, and I found her paintings fascinating. Even though our paths crossed fleetingly, she is one of the few patients I vividly remember from that time.

title: Tis the Season to Compensate College Athletes
description: The N.C.A.A. classifies Division I football players as amateurs, not professionals, student-athletes, not employees, which is how colleges get away with paying them nothing.

title: The Disappearing Accent in Pop Music
description: Q. Why do pop music vocalists generally seem to sing without an accent?

title: Weekly News Quiz | Dec. 31, 2013-Jan. 6, 2014
description: Answer the 10 questions below to see what you know about the people and events making news this week.

title: Gerlach Retirement Opens Up Swing District in Pennsylvania
description: Representative Jim Gerlach of Pennsylvania, a perennial target for Democrats who covet his suburban district, announced on Monday that he will retire from the House after six terms.

title: In Video and on Twitter, Glimpses of Rodmans North Korea Trip
description: Dodging tough questions about politics, Dennis Rodman is back in North Korea to play basketball, this time accompanied by former National Basketball Association players who will star in an exhibition game with a local team as part of celebrations Wednesday on the birthday of the countrys leader, Kim Jong-un.

title: In Sirius Offer, John Malone Is Up to His Old Tricks
description: John C. Malone is up to his same old tricks against Sirius XM.

title: Czech Parties Agree to Form Center-Left Coalition
description: PARIS  A leftist former finance minister was expected to become prime minister of the Czech Republic after three political parties signed an agreement on Monday to form a center-left coalition government. The deal helped to bring to a close one of the most acrimonious periods of political crisis in the countrys recent memory.

title: Advertising Age to Reduce Its Print Frequency
description: Advertising Age, the trade publication introduced in 1930, said Monday that it would publish its print edition 25 times a year rather than weekly.

title: British Economic Debate Opens Ahead of 2015 Vote
description: LONDON  With elections 16 months away, British politicians have headed into battle over the economy.

title: As New York Region Braces for Chill, Cuomo Declares Emergency
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo on Monday declared a state of emergency in 14 counties in western New York and announced that parts of the New York Thruway would be closed, as the Buffalo area braced itself for as much as three feet of snow and wind chills of 30 degrees below zero.

title: Jared Leto, in Heels
description: Jared Leto is receiving the first of what may be many honors this season, from the New York Film Critics Circle on Monday night, for his performance as the transgender AIDS patient Rayon in Dallas Buyers Club. Mr. Leto lost nearly 30 pounds for the role and shaved off his eyebrows, among other make-unders. And of course, he was put in womens clothing and makeup, as well as being made to look ill and impoverished.

title: Czech Officials Demand Explanation for Weapons at Palestinian Mission
description: PRAGUE  The Czech authorities, investigating an explosion that killed the Palestinian ambassador to the Czech Republic at his residence in Prague on Wednesday, now say that they found 12 illegal weapons at the Palestinian Mission next door.

title: The Confidence of Jerry Coyne
description: One of the problems with belonging to a faction thats convinced its on the winning side of intellectual history is that it becomes easy to persuade oneself that ones own worldview has no weak points whatsoever, no internal contradictions or ragged edges, no cracks through which a critics wedge could end up driven.This kind of overconfidence has been displayed, at various points in the human story, by everyone from millenarians to Marxists, inquisitors to eugenicists. But right now its vices are often found in a certain type of atheistic polemicist, and in a style of anti-religious argument thats characterized by a peculiar, almost-willed ignorance of why reasonable people might doubt the scientific-materialist worldview.

title: Deadly Hells Kitchen Blaze Traced to Electrical Wire, Fire Dept. Says
description: The fire that left one man dead and other residents displaced from a high-rise building in Midtown Manhattan over the weekend was traced to an electrical power strip, the Fire Department said on Monday.

title: Never Mind the Predictions: What Did We Learn?
description: Im not big on market predictions. In fact, if anyone asks, Im pretty quick to say that I dont know what the markets will do in 2014. If you absolutely must have predictions for the next year, then I recommend you check out Barry Ritholtzs annual list. But if you are interested in something more useful than predictions, I suggest taking a look at what we learned (or had confirmed  again) in 2013.

title: A Long, Frozen Rescue and Sharks on Twitter
description: Nobody had a longer week than the 52 scientists, journalists and tourists waiting to be rescued from a vessel trapped in the frozen waters of East Antarctica. But for fishermen in Maine, where the shrimping season has been canceled because of a dearth of the crustaceans, it will be an even longer winter.

title: The Good Wife and Peter Bogdanovichs Surprise Cameo
description: Warning: this post contains spoilers about Sundays episode of The Good Wife.

title: Palo Alto Networks Acquires  Start-Up Morta Security
description: Palo Alto Networks has acquired Morta Security, a two-year-old Silicon Valley security start-up run by former employees of the National Security Agency and the United States Air Force.

title: Study Ties Diabetic Crises to Dip in Food Budgets
description: Poor people with diabetes are significantly more likely to go to the hospital for dangerously low blood sugar at the end of the month when food budgets are tight than at the beginning of the month, a new study has found.

title: The Forecast on GJ 1214b: Extremely Cloudy
description: Astronomers from the University of Chicago have used the Hubble Space Telescope to observe the weather on a super-Earth planet orbiting a distant star for the first time. Conditions on GJ 1214b are cloudy, with an atmosphere so thick with water vapor or some other heavy molecule that observations of the planets surface are nearly impossible, they report in the journal Nature. Super-Earth planets, which are larger than Earth but smaller than Neptune, are among the most common planets in the Milky Way. To compile their forecast, the team analyzed 96 hours of telescope time over 11 months.

title: Walkabout: Winter Storms Freeze U.S. Flights; How to Rebook if Youre Stranded
description: On Monday, winter storms continued to hobble travel plans across the United States, as thousands of flights have been either canceled or delayed. There have also been flight snafus at Kennedy International Airport, the Bronx and, sadly, Aspen. (USA Today, The New York Times)

title: Laser Hair Removals Risks
description: Her first two laser hair-removal sessions went smoothly, but the third ended with burning pain that persisted for weeks, a 26-year-old Brooklyn woman recalled. Then the marks appeared: long red stripes along the backs of her legs. Over the next few months, the stripes turned dark brown.

title: Departing Broadway Shows Leave on a Box-Office High
description: Numerous Broadway shows started 2014 with million-dollar high notes at the box office, even as some of them ended their runs.

title: After Agreement in N.F.L. Concussion Case, Retirees Will Look at Details
description: The N.F.L. and lawyers for the more than 4,000 former players who said the league hid from them the dangers of repeated hits to the head have agreed on the details of a $760 million settlement that could determine how retirees with head trauma are compensated.

title: 20 Winter Wines for $20
description: Eric Asimov selects 20 fantastic winter wines, all at the price point of $20, presented here in no particular order.

title: When a (Partial) Tweet Becomes an Ad, What Are the Rules?
description: The media world gets weirder every day, but this moment still stands out as something of a stunner  the kind of thing that merits a place on the eternal timeline of How the Internet Flipped the Media World on Its Head.

title: Slow Growth in Health Spending
description: Experts at the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services said in a report that national spending on health care continued to be modest in 2012.

title: A New Test for Malaria, No Blood Required
description: Rice University researchers have developed a rapid malaria test that uses a laser pulse, eliminating the need to draw blood.

title: Your 2014 Resolution: Drink Adventurously
description: Heres my resolution for 2014: Drink adventurously.

title: Another Modest Rise for Health Costs
description: WASHINGTON  National health spending grew slowly for the fourth consecutive year, increasing 3.7 percent in 2012 to $2.8 trillion, the federal government said Monday. But officials disagreed over whether the Affordable Care Act or lingering effects of the recession were primarily responsible for the remarkable trend.

title: Welcome to America. Enjoy the Free Napkins and Straws.
description: Of the many enormously gifted authors now writing about the immigrant experience  including Jhumpa Lahiri, Edwidge Danticat, Dinaw Mengestu, Chang-rae Lee, Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie and Gish Jen  Gary Shteyngart is undoubtedly the funniest (with Junot Daz a close runner-up).

title: Adoption and All That Comes With It
description: Three families who have gone through the process of international adoption and know how difficult the adjustment can be.

title: Energy Bars That Put a Chirp in Your Step
description: How do you make ground-up crickets taste good?

title: Pictures of the Day: Britain and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Wales, Illinois, Bangladesh and Indonesia.

title: Giving Voice, and Finding Her Own
description: The writer Sue Monk Kidd found the voice that her new book needed when she became smitten with an enslaved girl who is only a footnote to history. I could hear Hetty in my head quite clearly, Ms. Kidd said. She would talk and talk and talk and talk to me.

title: Join Us on an Instagram Tour of Our Printing Plant
description: Updated | January 10, 2014

title: Translating a Fellow Passengers Vision of Doom
description: I THINK I have flown on every airline existing on the planet at least once. Family members and people I work with call me a risk because I too often barely make it to flights on time. I like to maximize the time I have, so I do cut it close. On two occasions I had to get out of a taxi and walk along the highway, roller dragging behind me, briefcase tightly tucked under my arm and cellphone blasting calls for help, just to be sure I made my flight.

title: Samsung Electronics Goes Big on Tablets
description: Samsung Electronics, the No. 1 handset maker, beat Apple to making smartphones with larger screens. Now the company wants to make an aggressive play in the tablet market with extra-large tablets.

title: Rebel Infighting Spreads to an Eastern Syrian City
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  An internal war between Syrian insurgents and their onetime allies, members of a transnational jihadist group that even some fighters affiliated with Al Qaeda reject as too extreme, widened on Monday from parts of northern Syria into Raqqa, the largest city in eastern Syria that had been under the groups control, antigovernment activists and fighters said.

title: Asking Siri About Her
description: Updated, 7:08 p.m. | Spike Jonze wrote his near-future love story Her before Apple introduced Siri, but comparisons are inevitable between Samantha, the computer operating system in the movie (voiced by Scarlett Johansson), and Siri, Apples digital assistant, originally voiced by Susan Bennett, a suburban Atlanta voiceover actor.

title: Growth Returns to Tech, but Profits Will Not Be So Easy
description: The good news for the information technology business is that in 2014 it should start growing at a significant rate again. The bad news? It may be less profitable.

title: Bone-Chilling Cold a Crippling Blow to Air Travel
description: The chaos in the nations air travel system worsened on Monday as a wave of frigid weather forced airlines to cancel thousands more flights, stranding passengers from Fort Lauderdale, Fla., to Los Angeles.

title: A Mixed Bag in H.I.V. Prevention (1 Letter)
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: In Defense of DNA Testing (2 Letters)
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: An Army of One, Enhanced by a Chip
description: Gabriel Vaughn, the commando turned human computer at the center of CBSs melodramatic new action series Intelligence, has multiple operating modes. The microchip in his brain makes him a walking Google as well as a one-man surveillance state, able to distract terrorists by reciting their emails to them. Hes also his own wireless hot spot  in Tuesdays pilot, he works the digital lock of a Pakistani interrogation cell from across the room. Where was this guy when it was taking 10 years to find Osama bin Laden?

title: Study Raises Questions for Employer Wellness Programs
description: If you work for a big employer  or even a small one  you probably have encountered some sort of workplace wellness program. You most likely filled out a health questionnaire, which may have led to a recommendation that you attend exercise classes, quit smoking or participate in telephone coaching to help you control diabetes or asthma.

title: A Woman Chasing Disasters, on and Off the News
description: All day long, Mary Jane Paul puts out fires: saving a friend from a possible suicide attempt, tough-talking a niece who wants to do pornography, squaring off against unscrupulous co-workers who want to damage her reputation, talking in depth about her sex life with the wife of the man shes sleeping with.

title: London Fashion Week: Jonathan Saunders Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the London Fashion Week photo diary of Barbara Anastacio.

title: S.N.L. Hires Black Female Cast Member
description: Saturday Night Live concluded its search for a black female cast member on Monday when it hired Sasheer Zamata, a young sketch comedian who has been performing in the New York area for the last four years.

title: A Case of Bad Cop, Good-Looking Cop
description: On second thought, maybe it should be a mans world.

title: In Nod to History, Two Ballet Rivals Spring to Life
description: PARIS  Story ballets. Three acts, characters, costumes, scenery, melodious music. Beloved by mass audiences, theyve been unfashionable with current, forward-thinking choreographers for years.

title: Times Minute | Gay Marriage Blocked
description: Also on the Minute, a key step in a long-running N.F.L. concussion lawsuit and a Beethoven manuscript goes on sale.

title: Times Minute | Gay Marriage Blocked
description: In the Video

title: Loft Life in a Building Once Evacuated Over Matzos
description: Bill Murray sublet for a summer. A contingent of dazzling Danes also moved in. So did the photojournalist Tim Hetherington, whose death in Libya in 2011 caused mourners to gather en masse at the building, known in their circle as the kibbutz because so many photographers lived there.

title: Still Stuck in a Climate Argument
description: When a ship carrying scientists and adventure tourists became stuck in ice in the Antarctic late last month, climate change skeptics had a field day. On Twitter and other social media sites, they pointed out that a group whose journey was meant to highlight the effects of global warming was trapped by a substance that was supposed to be melting.

title: A Search for Self in a Brain Scan
description: St. Louis  I knew I wouldnt find my self in a brain scan.

title: Mapping the Highways of the Brain
description: Deanna Barch and her colleagues are trying to map connections in the human brain. The study is part of the Human Connectome Project.

title: The Brain, in Exquisite Detail
description: ST. LOUIS  Deanna Barch talks fast, as if she doesnt want to waste any time getting to the task at hand, which is substantial. She is one of the researchers here at Washington University working on the first interactive wiring diagram of the living, working human brain.

title: Taking an I.V.F. Journey to Israel
description: Our last round of in vitro fertilization failed.

title: Israelis Document Incitement by the Palestinian Authority
description: Israeli officials noted negative statements about Israel and Jews in official Palestinian Authority media and textbooks.

title: Israeli Official Points to Incitement by Palestinians
description: JERUSALEM  Adolf Hitler is quoted on the Facebook pages  of Palestinian Authority schools. A young girl appears on Palestinian television, describing Jews as barbaric monkeys, wretched pigs and the murderers of Muhammad, the Islamic prophet. Maps on the Facebook page of the Palestinian presidential guards do not show Israel. President Mahmoud Abbas himself embraced as heroes released Palestinian prisoners who killed Israelis.

title: In Performance: Bobby Moreno
description: Bobby Moreno plays Odysseus Rex, a rooster with anger issues, in Eric Dufaults dark comedy Year of the Rooster, at the Ensemble Studio Theater.

title: The Soul Matures, Eclipsing the Pep
description: John Newman

title: Online Retailer Zola Books Buys Bookish
description: Bookish, a struggling website started by three large book publishers less than a year ago, has been sold to Zola Books, a start-up e-book retailer, the parties announced Monday. The purchase price was undisclosed.

title: Prominent Bond Trader Leaves Morgan Stanley
description: A prominent bond trader who was hired to revitalize Morgan Stanleys trading business but whose division racked up sizable losses has left the Wall Street firm.

title: Going Shopping, Honey? Be a Dear and Pick Up My Arsenic
description: Ah, for the days when you could stop by the local pharmacy and pick up some Radium Spray, advertised as the new combination bug killer, disinfectant and furniture polish. The days when you didnt have to worry about your complexion because, as another product proclaimed, a clear, white skin may positively be obtained by using LeFevres Arsenic Wafers.

title: A Device to Put You Into a Video Game
description: One of the stories behind the stories at the 2014 International Consumer Electronics Show is how the drop in the price of sensors  the parts in phones and devices that read motion, temperature, pressure and such  has made whiz-bang gizmos possible and affordable.

title: No Barbarians at the Gate; Instead, a Force for Change
description: Its no longer an insult to be called an activist investor.

title: The Cult Filmmaker Alejandro Jodorowsky on Mandalas, the Aztec Calendar and Papa Freud
description: The cult Chilean director Alejandro Jodorowsky practically invented the midnight movie in the early 1970s. His seminal films El Topo and The Holy Mountain, both shot in Mexico (the latter was financed by John Lennon to the tune of $1 million), were spiritual, strange and visually spectacular. Offering decadent visions of alternate realities and mystic rituals, the films became a favorite with audiences of that era, as well as with generations of (often stoned) college students ever since. The 84-year-old director, who lives in Paris, recently returned to his hometown of Tocopilla, Chile, to make The Dance of Reality, an autobiographical film that also manages to be a hypnotic surrealist fantasia. The film, which hits American theaters in May, received a standing ovation when it premiered at the Cannes Film Festival last year.

title: Is Legalizing Marijuana a Bad Thing?
Understanding the Blind, and Ourselves
description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

description: Who needs a skinny subwoofer? Many of the people who want a subwoofer.

description: To the Editor:

title: Lanvin
description: The prefall collection included separates in neutral tones.

title: New York, the Silicon City
description: FOR all the talk of New Yorks tale of two cities economic divide, last week Mayor Bill de Blasio took charge of a local economy that has far outperformed the rest of the country since the financial collapse  and not just in a small corner of Manhattan, but across the city. Driven by the expansion of the technology and information sector, New York City today has more private-sector jobs than during the 2007-8 peak of the finance-driven boom years.

title: London Fashion Week: MAN Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the London Fashion Week photo diary of Roberta Ridolfi.

title: After Winning Expo, Emirate Fumes at Allies It Says Didnt Back It
description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates  From the start, Dubai took the competition to land the 2020 World Expo rather seriously.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Michael Bays C.E.S. Performance, and Charging Tech Shuttles
description: Every day, The New York Timess staff scours the web for interesting and peculiar items.

title: Footballs Devastating Harvest
description: For a while he didnt move. It wasnt clear that he could. He was stretched out on his stomach, a few concerned people bending over him, a few others kneeling beside him, as if in prayer, which they may have been. It would have been an apt response.

title: Downton Abbey Returns and Sets Ratings Record
description: By any standard, public television has a major hit in Downton Abbey, which returned for its fourth season Sunday night in triumph, setting a record for a season premiere with 10.2 million viewers, and dwarfing most of the shows across commercial television.

title: In Hong Kong, a Glittering Exhibition
description: Newly minted Chinese millionaires may be rushing to buy Chinese art, but the Mengdiexuan family of Hong Kong has already assembled a brilliant collection all its own: hundreds of astonishing pieces from 1500 B.C. to the 18th century.

title: Pitching the Yankees to Fans on Broadway
description: BROADWAY shows typically advertise in New York publications, on websites like Ticketmaster and atop taxis, so regulars at dozens of Manhattan sports bars may be surprised to see a new play about the Yankees, Bronx Bombers, promoted on coasters under their beers.

title: Florida State Defeats Auburn, 34-31, to Win B.C.S. Title Game
description: After trailing for most of the game, Florida State stunned Auburn with a late touchdown to win its first national championship since 1999, 34-31.

title: When Airlines Are Quick to Hit the Cancel Button
description: THERE is reason to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the first scheduled airplane passenger flight in the United States. That flight was right on schedule. After a week like the last one, you might wonder if things have gone downhill since.

title: On a Changing East Village Street, a Source of Continuity Fights for His Job
description: The changes unfolded over decades on Astor Place, slowly transforming the three-block stretch that has long separated the raffish expanse of the East Village and the more proper precincts to the west.

title: High Stakes for Sudan in the Souths Conflict
description: KHARTOUM, Sudan  The United States has demanded negotiations. Uganda has threatened to intervene. China has called for an immediate cease-fire.

title: Cuomo Proposes $2 Billion in Tax Cuts
description: ALBANY  Sounding a refrain that will most likely echo through his re-election campaign this year, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo on Monday announced a sweeping $2 billion tax relief proposal, a catchall of cuts for property and business owners, renters and upstate manufacturers.

title: Howard Permut, Metro-North President, Is Stepping Down
description: After a year marred by a train collision, a workers death and the first passenger fatalities in Metro-North Railroads three-decade history, the agencys president, Howard R. Permut, is stepping down, according to several sources with knowledge of the move.

title: SAC Traders Co-Workers Were Deposed
description: The criminal insider trading case against Mathew Martoma, the former SAC Capital Advisors portfolio manager, was built in part on interviews and depositions by federal authorities with several of his former colleagues at the hedge fund, according to a recent court filing.

title: A Makeover for Maps
description: Like many designers, Eric Rodenbeck has had a long relationship with bar graphs and pie charts. He just thinks they are a little old school for todays data-filled world.

title: Africans Continue to Protest in Israel
description: JERUSALEM  After years of living on the margins of Israeli society, thousands of African asylum seekers flooded the streets of central Tel Aviv for a second day on Monday to protest their treatment by the Israeli authorities and to demand recognition as refugees.

title: A Delicate Balance for the Turnaround Chief of ThyssenKrupp
description: Heinrich Hiesinger was hired as chief executive of Thyssen-Krupp in 2011 to clean up and modernize the storied German industrial giant after its disastrous attempt to go global during the financial crisis. Since then, he has been pushing through an overhaul plan that includes cutting the losses in steel while beefing up what he considers more promising businesses like elevators and factory design and construction.

title: Jordan to Renew Appeal on Syrian Refugees
description: The ambassador to the United Nations from Jordan, the nation thrust into the rotating presidency of a polarized Security Council, said Monday that he would renew his appeal to the 15-member governing body to visit countries that shelter millions of Syrian refugees, including his own, which hosts more than 500,000 Syrians. The ambassador, Prince Zeid Raad Zeid al-Hussein, said he had made the request before to draw attention to the humanitarian crisis facing Syrias neighbors, but received no response. The Council has been deadlocked on Syria, but he declined to ascribe blame. Being on the Council hopefully will make a difference, he said. Jordan took the rotating two-year seat after Saudi Arabia rejected it to protest what it saw as the weak stance of Western powers toward Syria and Iran, the Saudis chief regional rivals.

title: Bodies of 2 American Climbers Found in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES  Two bodies discovered at the bottom of a 650-foot ravine on a mountain in Argentina are believed to be those of two missing American climbers, a local government official said Monday.

title: Never Mind the Rsum. How Hot Is the C.E.O.?
description: Call it the C.E.O. beauty premium.

title: Germany Adds Lessons in Islam to Better Blend Its Melting Pot
description: FRANKFURT  For the first time, German public schools are offering classes in Islam to primary school students using state-trained teachers and specially written textbooks, as officials try to better integrate the nations large Muslim minority and counter the growing influence of radical religious thinking.

title: The Edamame Economy
description: In the age of rail, luxury hotels mimicked European palaces. When rich people arrived at their destination, they wanted to be treated like nobility.

title: Forgetting It All
description: Ive forgotten what its like to remember. Ive lost the mindless confidence that a moment, an idea, a thought will be there for me later, the bravado of breezing through experience in the certainty that it will become part of my self, part of my story.

title: In Jobless Youth, U.S. Is Said to Pay High Price
description: Persistent high unemployment among young people is adding up to $25 billion a year in uncollected taxes and, to a much smaller degree, increased safety net expenditures, a new report says.

title: Bangladeshs Governing Party Wins Vote Amid Unrest
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh  Bangladeshs governing party celebrated its victory in general elections on Monday, dismissing critics who said the votes legitimacy was undercut by violence, low turnout and the absence of the countrys main opposition force from the ballots.

title: Trial to Begin for Martoma, Ex-SAC Trader Who Cut No Deal
description: Prosecutors never thought their insider trading case against Mathew Martoma would go to trial.

title: Saudis Grant to Lebanon Is Seen as Message to U.S.
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  If a wealthy patron were all the Lebanese Army needed to counter the Shiite militant group Hezbollah as the dominant force in the country, the recent $3 billion grant from Saudi Arabia might make a decisive difference in the countrys complex political landscape.

title: Impromptu Coming Out for Olympic Star
description: On Dec. 16, while skating on tour in the French Alps, Brian Boitano said he received a call from the White House gauging his interest in being named by President Obama to represent the United States at the Winter Olympics in Sochi, Russia.

title: The Next Council Speaker
description: On Wednesday, New York City Council members are expected to choose a speaker to lead them and, when necessary, unite them as a counterweight and an alternative voice to the mayors. Or thats how its supposed to work.

title: Polar Chicago
description: Stoic Chicagoans brave negative 38-degree wind chill for work and for leisure.

title: Medical Marijuana in New York
description: Gov. Andrew Cuomo of New York is set to use his executive powers to loosen restrictions on the use of marijuana for medical purposes. The Legislature, where medical marijuana bills have stalled repeatedly in the State Senate, ought to expand and strengthen the governors effort through appropriate legislation.

title: Rumors Fly Among Hasidim About Abducted Mans Death
description: The mourning for Menachem Stark, a Hasidic real estate developer from Brooklyn who was kidnapped and killed last week, was not a quiet affair. As family and friends ascended the steps of his red brick rowhouse on Monday to pay their respects, they were abuzz with a single question: Why had he been killed?

title: Unfair Phone Charges for Inmates
description: The Federal Communications Commission ended a grave injustice last fall when it prohibited price-gouging by the private companies that provide interstate telephone service for prison and jail inmates. Thanks to the F.C.C. order, which takes effect next month, poor families no longer have to choose between paying for basic essentials and speaking to a relative behind bars. The commission now needs to be on the lookout for  and crack down on, if necessary  similar abuses involving newer communication technologies like person-to-person video chat, email and voice mail.

title: Clash of Priorities Sets Up Cuomo-de Blasio Showdown on Pre-K Push
description: It was a political show of force. Nearly every top labor leader in New York City stood side by side on Monday in a Harlem classroom as Bill de Blasio, the newly installed mayor, looked on.

title: Arctic Cold Blankets Midwest, Freezing Routines
description: MINNEAPOLIS  Hildagard Omete, 36, a mother of three who has been unemployed for a year and a half, went job hunting on Monday.

title: Will Digital Networks Ruin Us?
description: The most important book I read in 2013 was Jaron Laniers Who Owns the Future? Though it was published in May, I came to it late in the year. But this turned out to be fortuitous timing. With unemployment seemingly stalled out at around 7 percent in the aftermath of the Great Recession, with the leak of thousands of National Security Agency documents making news almost daily, with the continuing stories about the erosion of privacy in the digital economy, Who Owns the Future? puts forth a kind of universal theory that ties all these things together. It also puts forth some provocative, unconventional ideas for ensuring that the inevitable dominance of software in every corner of society will be healthy instead of harmful.

title: High-Speed Train in California Is Caught in a Political Storm
description: LOS ANGELES  Gov. Jerry Brown of California is riding into an election year on a wave of popularity and an upturn in the states fortunes. But a project that has become a personal crusade for him over the past two years  a 520-mile high-speed train line from Los Angeles to San Francisco  is in trouble, reeling from a court ruling that undermined its financing, and from slipping public support and opponents rising calls to shut it down.

title: Polar Vortex: Temperatures Fall Far, Fast
description: Meteorologists called it weather whiplash  a drop of roughly 50 degrees in a matter of hours that took temperatures from 55 in Central Park on Monday morning to a record low of 5 overnight and an expected high on Tuesday of only 10. The last time temperatures in New York fell that much in such a short time, Warren G. Harding was in the White House.

title: Turning Away From Painful Chapters
A Hiring at Texas Is a Signal of Progress and Fairness
description: There were no tears in Texas, in contrast with four years ago when the impact of an overdue appointment was too much even for a man with the commanding name of Charlie Strong.

title: $18 Billion Price Put on Effort to Block Carp
description: The most effective methods of keeping Asian carp from invading the Great Lakes via Chicagos web of waterways could cost up to $18.4 billion and take 25 years to put in place, the federal Army Corps of Engineers concluded in a study released Monday.

title: Jagr Receives Olympic Spot As Roster Questions Swirl
description: Jaromir Jagr, the 41-year-old Devils wing playing like a man nearly half his age, is headed to the Olympics for a fifth time, as three countries named their rosters for the mens hockey tournament at the Sochi Games next month. But the selections were not without controversy, and more controversy is sure to follow Tuesday, the deadline to submit Olympic rosters.

title: Question Posed
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  Some people have signature words. Mine is awesome. If I like something, it is awesome. Its convenient to have a signature word like this, because then you dont have to remember all the other words that mean exactly the same thing and I can then use the extra space in my brain to figure out what Im going to eat next. Thats a far more efficient use of space, in my opinion.

title: Test Scandal in Atlanta Brings More Guilty Pleas
description: ATLANTA  The cast of characters was mostly former teachers and principals, six of whom pleaded guilty on Monday in a Fulton County courtroom for their part in what has been described as the largest cheating scandal in the nations history. Their pleas bring to 17 the number of educators who have already pleaded guilty, with a handful more in active negotiations.

title: Intel: Inside, Upon, Within, Around
description: Intel is trying to make good on its promises, fast.

title: De Blasio Appoints 6 to His Team
description: Hurrying to fill out his administrations political team, Mayor Bill de Blasio announced six appointments on Monday, naming a longtime Democratic strategist as a senior adviser and lesser-known operatives to oversee his state and federal lobbying offices.

title: Samsung Forecasts Greater Earnings Decline Than Expected for the End of 2013
description: TOKYO  Samsung Electronics, the worlds biggest maker of smartphones, said Tuesday that its earnings in the last quarter of 2013 fell from the previous three-month period as well as from the same period a year ago, heightening investors concerns about competitive pressures in the industry.

title: When the Big Dogs Get Down to Business, Teeth Are Sometimes Bared
description: A new big dog is walking the block in New York City, and on every corner alpha hounds are howling, snarling and pulling at their collars.

title: Rodman Leading Team of Improbable Emissaries
description: One is a recovering alcoholic who said he played in N.B.A. games while drunk. Another is a former 3-point N.B.A. specialist whose estranged wife once doused him in gasoline before attempting to set him on fire. Four others are self-professed street-ball legends.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Jan. 6, 2014
Rodman Returns to North Korea
description: Dennis Rodman went back to North Korea to play basketball on Kim Jong-uns birthday.

title: A New Mayor for Boston
description: Martin J. Walsh was sworn in as the citys new mayor; he replaces Thomas M. Menino, who was in office for 20 years.

title: New Mayor Evokes Bostons Many Hills
description: BOSTON  When politicians here deliver big speeches, they often find it hard to resist the literary trope of the city upon on a hill.

title: Egyptian Bloggers Who Mobilized Support for 2011 Uprising in Jail or Under Threat
description: Last Updated, Tuesday, 2:46 p.m. | Despite an apparent lack of evidence connecting her to the crime, Mona Seif, a scientist and blogger who is also one of Egypts most prominent rights activists, was convicted on Sunday of having taken part in a reported arson attack on the campaign headquarters of Hosni Mubaraks last prime minister, Ahmed Shafik, nearly two years ago.

title: U.S. Outlines Efforts to Reach Plea With Indian Diplomat
description: The office of Preet Bharara, the United States attorney in Manhattan, said in court papers Monday night that prosecutors had engaged in hours of discussion in the hope of negotiating a plea with the Indian diplomat whose recent arrest in New York led to an outcry in India.

title: Travel Disrupted
description: Airline departure cancellations as of 6:30 p.m. Monday.

title: For Survivor of Political Strife, the Journey Continues in the Bronx
description: When they came for Angele Nogue, she was wearing a nightgown. Then 33, she was asleep with her family at their home in Douala, Cameroon, when the police arrived at her door, she says, and took her away. It was February 2008, and the nation was roiling.

title: Corrections: January 7, 2014
description: NATIONAL

title: Run Run Shaw, Chinese-Movie Giant of the Kung Fu Genre, Dies at 106
description: Run Run Shaw, the colorful Hong Kong media mogul whose name was synonymous with low-budget Chinese action and horror films  and especially with the wildly successful kung fu genre, which he is largely credited with inventing  died on Tuesday at his home in Hong Kong. He was 106.

title: Judge Rejects Chicagos Ban on Gun Shops
description: CHICAGO  This citys ban on gun shops violates the Constitution, a federal judge ruled on Monday, dealing the latest setback to politicians here who had put in place some of the nations strictest limits on firearms.

title: Nets Stick to New Years Resolution: Win
description: Among other talents, Kevin Garnett has shown a knack for coining evocative nicknames for his Nets teammates.

title: Saying Police Fed Lies, Witness to 94 Murder Recants
description: For the second time in nearly 20 years, Joan Purser-Gennace took the witness stand in a Queens courtroom, but this time her testimony was starkly different: Much of what she testified to two decades ago  words that helped convict a man of a murder  was a lie, she said, spoon-fed to her by police detectives.

title: A Return to the Ring
description: Pistol Robinson, who tours on the Professional Bull Riders circuit, returned to Madison Square Garden Friday after he broke his legs in an accident in 2012.

title: Yale Professor Died of Overdose, Official Says
description: A Yale professor who was found dead in a New Haven jail cell after he was arrested in November died of an accidental drug overdose, the Connecticut medical examiners office said on Monday.

title: A Conversation With Ralph de la Vega, Chief Executive of AT&T Mobility
description: AT&T wants to be your connection to the Internet wherever you are: through your phone, inside your home and even inside your vehicle.

title: Halton Arp, 86, Dies; Astronomer Challenged Big Bang Theory
description: Halton C. Arp, a provocative son of American astronomy whose dogged insistence that astronomers had misread the distances to quasars cast doubt on the Big Bang theory of the universe and led to his exile from his peers and the telescopes he loved, died on Dec. 28 in Munich. He was 86.

title: Nash Stars, but Rangers Fall to His Old Team
description: The Rangers on Monday were seeking to move two games over .500 for the first time this season, and to turn around their home-ice malaise.

title: Bronson Binger, 83, Who Saved New York Parks and Buildings, Dies
description: Bronson Binger, a New York architect and preservationist who helped wrest Union Square Park in Manhattan from drug dealers but was stymied in an effort to rebuild Wollman Rink in Central Park, died on Dec. 23 in Housatonic, Mass. He was 83.

title: Nuclear Fuel Storage Remains Safe, Panel Members Say
description: WASHINGTON  Most members of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission indicated on Monday that they considered it safe to continue storing most spent nuclear fuel in pools, even though concerns remain about potential accidents and terrorist attacks.

title: When the Future Isnt a Keyboard
description: Intel says it has seen the future, and it doesnt include a keyboard.

title: From Sea to Sea, a Sharp Contrast
description: A polar vortex has pushed frigid air into the heartland, sending thermometers into free-fall and creating unusual contrasts in weather across short stretches.

title: Richard N. Cohen, 90, Dies; Was Director of Times Co.
description: Richard N. Cohen, a member of The New York Times Companys board throughout the 1960s, died on Thursday in Stamford, Conn. He was 90.

title: Lineup Set for Tribute to Music of Paul Simon
description: For the last nine years Michael Dorf, the owner of City Winery, has made an annual trip uptown to raise money for music education programs by way of a tribute concert at Carnegie Hall. This years installment, on March 31, the 10th in Mr. Dorfs series, honors the music of Paul Simon. The preliminary lineup for the concert, which Mr. Dorf is expected to announce on Tuesday, includes Joy Williams (of the Civil Wars), the soul singer Bettye LaVette, the singer-songwriters Bob Mould, Dan Wilson and Ben Sollee, the composer Allen Toussaint and a collaboration between the jazz singer Madeleine Peyroux and Jon Herington, the lead guitarist of Steely Dan.

title: Word of the Day | shimmer
description: shimmer \shi-mr\ verb and noun

title: Enlarging the House of Representatives
description: Bruce Bartlett held senior policy roles in the Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations and served on the staffs of Representatives Jack Kemp and Ron Paul. He is the author of The Benefit and the Burden: Tax Reform  Why We Need It and What It Will Take.

title: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, January 7, 2014
description: It is clear we are increasingly reaching common ground with the Americans. No country should have an eternal enemy, neither we nor the United States.

title: Stealing J. Edgar Hoovers Secrets
description: One night in 1971, files were stolen from an F.B.I. office near Philadelphia. They proved that the bureau was spying on thousands of Americans. The case was unsolved, until now.

title: Burglars Who Took On F.B.I. Abandon Shadows
description: PHILADELPHIA  The perfect crime is far easier to pull off when nobody is watching.

title: Payout May Come for an A.B.A. Team That Is Long Gone
description: The N.B.A. has long hoped to be released from its financial obligation to Ozzie and Daniel Silna, brothers who owned the Spirits of St. Louis in the defunct American Basketball Association.

title: Faulty Websites Confront Needy in Search of Aid
description: MIAMI  Three months after the disastrous rollout of a new $63 million website for unemployment claims, Florida is hiring hundreds of employees to deal with technical problems that left tens of thousands of people without their checks while penalties mount against the vendor who set up the site.

title: Detroit Pensions Are Frozen, Then Thawed
description: DETROIT  The citys emergency manager, Kevyn D. Orr, in an unpublicized move last week, ordered that pension benefits for thousands of public employees be frozen, but said on Monday that he would delay the move to allow for a possible compromise in federally mediated talks.

title: Charges Filed in Attack on Chinese Consulate in San Francisco
description: A Chinese citizen has been arrested in connection with the Jan. 1 arson attack at the Chinese Consulate in San Francisco, the F.B.I. said. According to a statement released by the F.B.I. in San Francisco, Yan Feng, 39, of Daly City, Calif., turned himself in to police officers on Jan. 3 and was arrested without incident. Mr. Feng made his first court appearance on Monday to face two federal charges, arson and damaging the property of a foreign government.

title: Florida State Wins With Auburn-Like Comeback
description: PASADENA, Calif.  A furious second-half comeback. A 100-yard kickoff return. A touchdown drive led by a redshirt freshman quarterback that ended with 13 seconds on the clock.

title: Senate Postpones Vote on Unemployment Benefits
description: Senate leaders on Monday night abruptly postponed a vote to take up a measure extending expired unemployment benefits. Senator Harry Reid of Nevada, the majority leader, was about to call the vote when the Senates No. 2 Republican, John Cornyn of Texas, accused him of manufacturing a political issue by holding a vote with 17 senators absent, mostly because of weather delays. Mr. Reid than gruffly asked for consent to postpone it until Tuesday morning. The measure is expected to fall to a Republican filibuster.

title: Jameis Winston Smiles All the Way Into Seminole Lore
description: PASADENA, Calif.  Late Monday, the celebration continued in the Florida State locker room. Championship hats and T-shirts were everywhere. The room was loud and the mood light.

title: Whats on Tuesday
description: 5:45 P.M. (Sundance) AN EDUCATION (2009) Carey Mulligan stars as Jenny, a willful, Oxford-bound 16-year-old suffering from ennui in the London suburb of Twickenham in 1961. Peter Sarsgaard is David, the older man who introduces her to a world of art auctions and Champagne while appealing to the pretensions of her proper parents (Cara Seymour and Alfred Molina). But soon its apparent that David and his fabulous life arent quite what they seem, though that doesnt stop Jenny from playing along. The filmmakers themselves seem too intoxicated by the mystique of the period to take full account of the sad, bleak aspects of the story they have to tell, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times about this drama directed by Lone Scherfig, written by Nick Hornby and based on a memoir by Lynn Barber. Still, he added, in the end the film is a pleasure  which I dont mean entirely as a compliment.

title: California: Girl Declared Dead Is Transferred
description: The family of Jahi McMath, 13, who was declared brain-dead after complications from surgery last month at Childrens Hospital Oakland, said on Monday that she had been transferred to a facility that will provide her with care. The family and their lawyer declined to identify the facility, citing privacy concerns.

title: As Donations Pour In, Aam Aadmi Party Tries to Transform Campaign Finance
description: MUMBAI  The Aam Aadmi Party, having shaken up the political order in India by its surprisingly strong showing in the Delhi state assembly elections last month, is also making an attempt to change the way the countrys political campaigns are financed.

title: A Once-Troubled Museum Frames a Future in Los Angeles
description: After three years of tumultuous leadership, the Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles said it was nearing the end of a search for a new director and announced on Monday that it had reached a fund-raising milestone that would ensure it does not have to merge with another institution or face dissolution.

title: Emerging Markets Expected to Drive Device Sales
description: LONDON  Consumers in developing countries like Brazil and China are set to continue as the main engine for sales growth for devices like smartphones and tablets in 2014, according to a research report published Tuesday.

title: Test Yourself | History, Jan. 7
description: Take the Quiz

title: 6 Qs About the News | An Instant Archive for the Latest Slang
description: In A Lexicon of Instant Argot, Jenna Wortham writes about Urban Dictionary, the crowdsourced online dictionary that lets anyone contribute words and definitions.

title: Palestinian Pleasures
description: Since the mid-1980s, the visual narrative of Palestinians in the West Bank and Gaza has been predictable: photographs of stone-throwing teenagers confronting Israeli soldiers, refugee camps, mothers mourning children killed in conflicts, and long lines at border crossing points. Particularly dramatic variations on these visual tropes make the front pages and win awards.

title: Should College Football Players Get Paid?
description: The 2013-14 college football bowl season ended Monday night, and even if you missed the Little Caesars Pizza Bowl or the Sheraton Hawaii Bowl, its hard to miss the fact that college football is big business  a multibillion-dollar industry. Top coaches receive sky-high salaries, and many college athletic departments rake in huge sums. But college football players? Zero. N.C.A.A. rules bar college athletes from earning any compensation. Is this fair?

description: Also on the Minute, teaching Islam in Germany and ABC's 'Killer Women' premieres.

title: New York Today: Life-Threatening Wind Chill
Familiar Yet Distant, With Songs and an Edge
description: Neil Young was just a few bars into an indignant old song at Carnegie Hall on Monday night, chugging a terse intro on an acoustic guitar, when he abruptly threw the emergency brake.

title: Maersk to Sell Stake in Denmarks Largest Retailer
description: LONDON  The Danish shipping conglomerate A.P. Moller-Maersk Group said on Tuesday that it planned to sell most of its stake in Denmarks largest retailer for about $3 billion.

title: Purge of Police Said to Be Move by Turkey to Disrupt Graft Inquiry
description: PARIS  About 350 police officers in Ankara, the Turkish capital, were removed from their posts overnight, Turkish news outlets reported on Tuesday, the largest single purge of the police force since a corruption investigation plunged the government into crisis last month.

title: A Conversation With: Author Rana Dasgupta
description: The British-Indian writer Rana Dasguptas new book Capital: A Portrait of Twenty-First Century Delhi is a lyrical and haunting nonfiction account of a city thats gripped by an intoxicating mix of ambition, money, power and rage.

title: Carole Kings You Make Me Feel by Emeli Sande
description: Val Haller, a music-obsessed baby boomer and the founder of the website Valslist.com, matches tracks from her generation to those of her 20-something sons generation.

title: Judge Accuses Spanish Princess of Money Laundering and Tax Fraud
description: PARIS  Princess Cristina, the younger daughter of King Juan Carlos of Spain, was formally accused of money laundering and tax fraud by a magistrate on Tuesday and was summoned to appear in court on March 8. She is the first close relative of a Spanish monarch in modern history to face the prospect of a criminal trial.

title: For a Former Pizzeria Owner, Its All Gravy
description: Last week, we published a case study about a New Jersey pizzeria owner who recently debated two different paths in the food industry: Should he enlarge his tiny restaurant to boost stagnant revenues? Or should he sell the business and start another one to manufacture his restaurants red sauce, which he had been selling over the counter as Jersey Italian Gravy?

description: London

title: Intersection: Brooklyn Heights Vintage
description: Irwin Susskind, a Brooklyn Heights resident for 42 years, says he likes antique clothing and gets a lot of his clothes at thrift shops and street sales.

title: How the Obama Administration Can Get Bluefin Tuna Off the (Wrong) Hook
description: Lee Crockett, who directs the U.S. Oceans program of The Pew Charitable Trusts, sent a compelling Your Dot piece on addressable problems with United States fishing regulations that are perpetuating wasteful catches of bluefin tuna on longlines set for other species. He notes that you can weigh in with a comment to the relevant agency until Friday. Heres his post:

title: European Cable Operator Altice Plans $1 Billion I.P.O.
description: LONDON  The European cable and cellphone operator Altice announced on Tuesday that it planned to raise up to 750 million euros, or $1 billion, through an initial public offering on the NYSE Euronext stock exchange in Amsterdam.

title: Danglers Ahead
description: As Ive noted ad nauseam  here, here and here, for example  danglers in their various forms are one of our most common grammatical lapses. Participle phrases, like comparisons, appositives and other modifying constructions generally must be adjacent to the noun or pronoun they refer to. Otherwise, they dangle  and leave a clumsy or confusing sentence.

title: Must This Lesbian Wear a Dress to an Orthodox Synagogue?
description: Q. Dear Civil Behavior: I am a gay woman who tends to dress and identify on the masculine side. Ill soon be attending a religious service at my extended familys Orthodox synagogue, requiring modest attire, which means that women are not allowed to wear pants and can be denied entry. I think that as long as I dress respectfully and in the spirit of the religious mandates I should not have to compromise on my gender identity and expression. My family says that Im being difficult and that when in Rome  Of course, there is no chance my relatives would dress according to a code I prescribed for an event if it conflicted with their religious identity. So why am I considered difficult for not compromising in the expression of my gender identity when they would be considered justified in not compromising their religious expression?  Name withheld

title: Labor Tactic Raises Fear for France
description: PARIS  Negotiations broke down last weekend at a Goodyear tire factory scheduled for closing in northern France, so employees resorted to a brazen tactic: They kidnapped the bosses.

title: Daily Report: Soft Smartphone Sales Lead to Decline in Samsungs Profit
description: The worlds largest smartphone maker is facing unanticipated challenges, Eric Pfanner reports.

description: Dear Diary:

title: Will Forte Is Just as Surprised as You Are
description: Will Forte was an unexpected winner with the National Board of Review; hell pick up his prize for best supporting actor, for his turn as a son on a road trip with his cantankerous father (Bruce Dern) in Nebraska, at the groups ceremony Tuesday night.

title: Trial Begins for Former SAC Trader
description: Prosecutors had long hoped Mathew Martoma, a former portfolio manager at SAC Capital Advisors, would provide the missing link in their pursuit of the hedge funds owner, Steven A. Cohen. Instead, the insider trading case prosecutors never thought would happen is going to trial, Matthew Goldstein and Ben Protess write in DealBook. Prosecutors first confronted Mr. Martoma in November 2011, asking him to cooperate in their long-running investigation of Mr. Cohen, and they have continued to press him in a number of meetings since. But Mr. Martoma has baffled officials by refusing to cooperate against the boss who fired him in 2010.

title: Christopher Kanes Vision for His First Store
description: LONDON  Christopher Kane is getting ready to open his first store this summer on Londons Mount Street, a shopping area that already has drawn the fashion houses of Balenciaga, Lanvin, Marc Jacobs and Christian Louboutin, as well as Nicholas Kirkwood shoes and Stephen Webster jewelry.

title: New Yorkers Struggle to Shrug Off the Icicles
description: It was 8 degrees at 4:30 a.m., but it felt like minus 12, a fact of which Mike Peters was grimly aware. Mr. Peters, a utility worker, stood neck deep in a two-foot-by-two-foot pit hacked into the pavement of Avenue of the Americas in Greenwich Village, the sidewalk around him slicked with ice that fringed the hole he was in with filthy icicles.

title: Greek Police Hunt for Convicted Terrorist Who Disappeared on Furlough
description: ATHENS  The Greek authorities on Tuesday began a nationwide search for a convicted member of the dismantled November 17 group, once the countrys deadliest guerrilla organization, after he failed to report to the police during a prison furlough, fueling fears of a resurgence of political violence.

title: Low Inflation Worries the Euro Zone
description: PARIS  Consumer prices in the euro zone barely increased last month, raising fears of deflation and putting pressure on the European Central Bank to take further action.

title: Charges for 106 in Huge Fraud Over Disability
description: The retired New York City police officers and firefighters showed up for their psychiatric exams disheveled and disoriented, most following a nearly identical script.

JPMorgan Is Penalized $2 Billion Over Madoff
description: Updated, 9:37 p.m. | Two men who occupy coveted roles in Manhattans power elite, one the citys top federal prosecutor and the other its top banker, sat down in early November to discuss a case that was weighing on them both.

title: Lindsey Vonns Injured Knee Will Keep Her Out of Sochi Games
description: Lindsey Vonn sat on a stone wall at the United States Open in June, waiting for her boyfriend, Tiger Woods, to finish his second round. Four months after major knee surgery, Vonn, the defending Olympic champion in the womens downhill, was already looking eight months ahead.

title: Citizens Financial to Sell Chicago-Area Branches to U.S. Bancorp
description: LONDON  Citizens Financial Group, a unit of the Royal Bank of Scotland, said on Tuesday that it had agreed to sell 94 retail branches, as well as its small business operations in the Chicago area, to U.S. Bancorp.

title: In Performance: Bobby Moreno of Year of the Rooster
description: In Eric Dufaults cockfighting comedy Year of the Rooster, Bobby Moreno plays a menacing bird with issues named Odysseus Rex. In this scene the rooster challenges the sun to a fight. Directed by John Giampietro, the show begins performances on Jan. 9 at the Ensemble Studio Theater, where it had a well-received run last year.

title: Karen Carpenter: Voice of a Lifetime
description: As a sidebar to the Riff column I wrote for this past weekends issue, which drew from the book Im writing about my appreciation of the Carpenters music and the life events of mine it surrounded, here are six takes on Karen Carpenters voice. They include early reviews of Carpenters albums and posthumous nods from the likes of the film director Todd Haynes and the novelist Mary Gaitskill. Their range is a testament to hers.

title: Today in Small Business: Close the S.B.A.?
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

description: First chocolate, now cheese.

description: Whats for Dinner? answers that universal question, offering recipes for simple, relatively quick dishes that use ingredients you can pick up on the way home.

description: Oracle announced on Tuesday that it had agreed to purchase Corente, a cloud-based services company, in a move that pushes the once web-shy technology giant further into the Internet age.

title: In Our Pages: January 8
