title: In Search of the New Smartphone-Connected Boombox
description: Is the portable speaker that can wirelessly stream music from a smartphone todays version of an old-school boombox? Some electronics makers hope so.

title: The Technology Behind the NYTimes.com Redesign
description: The NYTimes.com redesign is more than a fresh coat of paint  in addition to the new look, our article pages also rely on a new framework and codebase to run faster while making future changes easier. Reed Emmons, the development lead on the project, explains how we made this possible.

title: Q. and A. With Frontline': How Do You Catch a Trader?
description: On Tuesday evening, Frontline took a comprehensive look at the investigation of insider trading on Wall Street in To Catch a Trader. This is a report about how hedge funds, including Steven A. Cohens SAC Capital Advisors, sought an edge by gathering information about companies to trade ahead of other investors, reaping outsize gains. Interviews with federal investigators and reporters who followed the story, including The New York Timess Peter Lattman, provide a clear view of how the government built cases that have led to more than 75 convictions.

title: Pet Theories
description: David Brooks: As is well known, the world is divided into two sorts of people: those who divide the world into two sorts of people and those who dont.

title: Man Arrested at Kennedy in Killing of Landlord
description: A Bangladeshi man wanted in connection with the killing of a Brooklyn businessman was arrested on Wednesday at Kennedy Airport, the New York Police Department said.

title: Below the Line: The Makeup of Bad Grandpa
description: Updated, Feb. 14 12 Years a Slave, Gravity, American Hustle, Captain Phillips, Jackass Presents: Bad Grandpa. One of these titles may seem the odd one out in the awards season conversation. But when the Oscar nominees were announced on Jan. 16, Bad Grandpa, Jeff Tremaines hidden-camera comedy, made the cut in the makeup category. It was on a shortlist of seven films that was narrowed to three nominees.

title: Homes for $750,000
description: A look at a contemporary in Connecticut, a home in New Mexico built in a pueblo-style and a shingled house in North Carolina.

title: Burberrys Painterly Journey
description: LONDON  With painterly autumn leaves on silken scarves at Burberry and shined-up sneakers from that most unlikely of country bumpkins, Tom Ford, the London mens wear shows for autumn 2014 seemed to reflect Britains current wet and windy winter.

title: Cuomo Delivers the State of the State Address
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo delivered his annual State of the State address on Wednesday to a mostly supportive crowd, saying that the upstate economy had improved, unemployment had fallen in every region and taxes for every New Yorker were down. Bill de Blasio, the mayor of New York City, was in the audience in Albany on the first official visit of his administration.

title: Letters: Jack London and More
description: Seeing Things

title: Mayoral Ally Elected Speaker, Furthering Citys Liberal Shift
description: The New York City Council unanimously elected a fiercely liberal Democrat from East Harlem as its powerful speaker on Wednesday, eschewing the moderate leadership that had overseen its ranks for a decade and eliminating the last barrier to a government fully in line with the undiluted liberalism embraced by the new mayor.

title: Food Matters | A Peek Inside the Hottest New Restaurant in Paris
description: No one could ever accuse the French chef David Toutain of forgetting his roots. Conveyed to the table by a very serious young woman in a well-cut black pantsuit, a gently curved rectangle of white bisque porcelain contained two salsifies, which had been roasted to a deep ivory color and were accompanied by a white-chocolate cream decorated with wood sorrel and other herbs. You dip the roots into the sauce, the waitress instructed, and be careful, because theyre hot.

title: U.S. Treasury Secretary Urges Germany to Do More on Banks and Economy
description: BERLIN  Jacob J. Lew, the U.S. Treasury secretary, urged Germany and its European partners on Wednesday to take even bolder steps in terms of banking reform, as his German counterpart, Wolfgang Schuble, defended the complicated and still incomplete blueprint agreed to by European finance ministers in December.

title: Steps of a Stage Career, Taken at a Run
description: Sheldon Best did his share of slashing in the play Alice in Slasherland and even more punching in Sucker Punch. Now, in Roy Williamss modernization of the 1959 short story The Loneliness of the Long Distance Runner, Mr. Best is making good on yet another titular promise of physical exertion.

title: Tupac Shakur Musical Sets Broadway Opening Date
description: Holler if Ya Hear Me, a new musical inspired by the work of rapper Tupac Shakur, will begin performances on Broadway at the Palace Theater on May 26, the producers said on Wednesday. The $8 million production is not a musical biography about Shakur, who died in a drive-by shooting in 1996 at the age of 25; rather, the producers said in a statement, it is an original story about friendship, family, revenge, change and hope as poor urban residents struggle against challenges in their lives.

title: Utah Says It Wont Recognize Same-Sex Marriages It Licensed
description: DENVER  The fortunes of 1,300 newlywed same-sex couples in Utah were thrown into turmoil on Wednesday after the governors office announced that it would not recognize their marriages while it presses its legal efforts to limit marriages to one man and one woman.

title: What You Get for... $750,000
description: ESSEX, CONN.

title: Your Favorite Old Haunts
description: Sometimes, it seems, you cant keep a good place down.

title: Classical Playlist: Simone Dinnerstein, Avi Avital, Mark Padmore and More
description: BACH: Inventions & SinfoniasSimone Dinnerstein, pianist(Sony)The pianist Simone Dinnersteins Bach recordings are characterized by her distinctive sound  soft-pawed but determined  and a certain melancholic disposition. But in these Inventions & Sinfonias, too often relegated to the teaching studio, it is the specific motion she gives each piece  as if every contrapuntal line had a physiognomy of its own  that makes this recording so arresting. (Corinna da Fonseca-Wollheim)

title: Dalios Bridgewater Associates Posts Lackluster Returns
description: Ray Dalios Bridgewater Associates, one of the worlds biggest hedge fund firms, had a largely lackluster year when it came to the performance of its two main portfolios.

title: Times Designers Are Monitoring Reaction to the Redesign, With Adjustments Possible
description: Its a big day for digital change at The Times, on both journalistic and business fronts, as the company unveiled a redesign that has been many months in the making, along with its first foray into native advertising. (The Times also updated its iPad app.)

title: Teach the Cold: Science Ideas for Working With Winter Weather
Support at Fed for Slow Stimulus Cuts
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserves decision in December to taper its bond-buying campaign reflected increased confidence in the economy and continued uneasiness about the stimulus effort, according to an official account of the December meeting.

title: If Winter Takes Aim at the Plumbing
description: Homeowners in traditionally frigid regions have learned by necessity how to avoid burst pipes. But with temperatures plunging to record lows recently, people in otherwise temperate areas have heard horror stories of frozen plumbing and the watery, expensive aftermath.

title: Greg Maddux, Tom Glavine and Frank Thomas Elected to Hall of Fame
description: A year after delivering a sobering verdict on the games recent history, baseball writers on Wednesday found three players to celebrate. Greg Maddux, Tom Glavine and Frank Thomas, decorated stars with no connection to the performance-enhancing drug scandal that warped much of their era, were elected to the Baseball Hall of Fame on their first try.

title: Millennials Want Children, But Theyre Not Planning on Them
description: As youve probably heard, the United States sorely lags behind most developed countries when it comes to support for working families, which makes it very difficult for parents (and, in particular, mothers) to work. But most of us cant afford to stop working  our families need our income. So what options do we have?

title: Former German World Cup Player Comes Out as Gay
description: BERLIN  Thomas Hitzlsperger, a midfielder who made 52 appearances for Germanys national team, helped Stuttgart capture the Bundesliga championship in 2007 and played for prominent teams in Germany, England and Italy, made perhaps the biggest news of his career on Wednesday by coming out as a homosexual.

title: Knicks Better, but Miami Game Demands Their Best
description: For perhaps the first time this season, a sane person could argue that things are heading in the right direction for the Knicks. After winning two of three games on a trip to Texas, a swing that is usually brutal, the Knicks handled the Detroit Pistons, 89-85, at Madison Square Garden on Tuesday night, punctuating their best stretch of the season.

title: U.A.E. Releases American Who Was Jailed for Satirical Video
description: An American man who was jailed in the United Arab Emirates for his part in a satirical video is being released this week after serving his sentence, a representative of the mans family said.

title: London Fashion Week: E. Tautz Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the London Fashion Week photo diary of Barbara Anastacio.

title: A Major Addition to Virgin Islands Park
description: Virgin Islands National Park  which already encompasses 60 percent of the tiny Caribbean island of St. John  just got a little bigger.

title: Should Republicans Talk About Poverty?
description: As Republicans marks the fiftieth anniversary of the War on Poverty by groping for a more compelling anti-poverty message, Byron York wonders about the political wisdom of this half-formed focus on the poor:

title: Support for Metro-North Line in Bronx and to Penn Station
description: A sweeping expansion of the Metro-North Railroad that would add four stations in the Bronx and connect the New Haven line to Pennsylvania Station has won the support of a significant ally: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo.

title: 30% of M.&A. Advisory Fees Went to Smaller Firms in 2013
description: The big investment banks, most notably Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase, continue to take the majority of fees from advising on mergers and acquisitions. But boutique and independent investment banks are gaining on them.

title: J. R. Smith Fined $50,000 for Pulling Shoe Antics
description: It was a totally reasonable request. After J. R. Smith was spotted untying one of Shawn Marions sneaker laces in the Knicks win over the Dallas Mavericks on Sunday, N.B.A. officials privately reprimanded him and told him not to do it again. Coach Mike Woodson issued Smith the same warning before Tuesdays game against the Detroit Pistons.

title: Leading Republicans Discuss Poverty
description: Fifty years after President Lyndon B. Johnson declared a war on poverty, the message from Republicans in Congress is that the government has failed in its efforts to address the problem.

title: Bayern Munich Official Suggests Summer Schedule for European Soccer
description: Major League Soccer may have found a new best friend in Karl-Heinz Rummenigge, the top official at the German champion Bayern Munich and the chairman of Europes 207-member club association.

title: Syria Reports 2 Attacks on Chemical Arms Sites
description: GENEVA  Syrias government said Wednesday that insurgents had assaulted two storage sites for some of the deadly chemical weapons components it has pledged to eliminate. It was the first time the Syrian authorities had reported such attacks in the three months since an international effort began to sequester and purge the country of the banned munitions.

title: The Flaming Lips and Imagine Dragons to Join Amnesty International Concert in Brooklyn
description: Amnesty International knew it was on to something when it presenting its Conspiracy of Hope concerts in 1986: by fielding a starry cast of performers, it could not only raise money but, more importantly, bring attention to the slate of human rights issues it was fighting to redress. Amnesty continued to present concerts until 1998, drawing about 1.25 million concertgoers along the way, then bowed out of the concert business.

title: Prison Violence Brings Scrutiny to State in Brazil
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  A series of violent episodes at an overcrowded prison, and video showing inmates gloating over three decapitation victims during a riot there in December, are focusing scrutiny on the deteriorating security situation in Maranho State, the bastion of one of Brazils most powerful political families.

title: De Blasio Invokes Italian Theme for Bonding in Albany
description: ALBANY  When Mayor Bill de Blasio met State Senator Diane J. Savino, a Staten Island Democrat, here on Wednesday morning, they kissed twice, once on each cheek, and shared a warm hug, in part because of something else they share: their heritage.

title: Redefining Whats Possible for Skiers
description: For some professional skiers, helicopter pilots have emerged as essential partners. One such pilot, Tighe Daugherty, has come to specialize in helping skiers reach new terrain in Alaska.

title: Wheelies: The G.M.s Year of the Snake Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Anger in London, as Killing of Unarmed Man That Sparked Riots Is Called Lawful
description: There was visceral anger outside the Royal Courts of Justice in central London on Wednesday, after an inquest jury decided that police officers had acted lawfully when they shot and killed an unarmed man they suspected of carrying a gun in 2011. Protests over the fatal shooting of the man, Mark Duggan, devolved into riots that spread across England shortly after his death.

title: App Smart: Space Games
description: Space games form a class of game app that both harks back to the origins of video gaming and shows off the amazing graphics of a modern smartphone and tablet.

title: Excuses, Excuses, for Not Extending Unemployment Insurance
description: The president on Tuesday called on Congress to extend jobless benefits for the long-term unemployed, saying the insurance program keeps Americans from falling off a cliff. But the Republican leadership  convinced that Americans can pull themselves up and out of the ravine by their bootstraps  finds the extension unnecessary.

title: Today in Small Business: The Most Hyped Start-Up of 2013
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Clothes and Character: American Hustle
description: To Michael Wilkinson, the costume designer for American Hustle, the choices that people make when they dress themselves and the messages that they give out to the world, both consciously and unconsciously, these things matter deeply to me. I have a passion and a fascination for the way people present themselves.

title: Frozen Soundtrack Hits Top of Album Chart
description: The soundtrack to Disneys hit film Frozen has shot to the top of Billboards album chart, becoming only the fourth soundtrack to an animated picture to reach No. 1.

title: Carriers Step Up Battle for Wireless Customers
description: LAS VEGAS  A tug of war has broken out among the major wireless carriers.

title: Anatomy of a Scene: Philomena
description: Stephen Frears narrates a scene from his film featuring Judi Dench and Steve Coogan.

title: Wrist Revolution
description: The Timess Nick Bilton takes a look at smartwatches at the International CES in Las Vegas.

title: In Speech, Cuomo Pledges Lower Taxes and Statewide Pre-K
description: ALBANY  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, entering an election year with no formidable opponent and an improving economy, claimed on Wednesday to have brought New York State back from the brink of financial ruin and unveiled proposed tax cuts and a promise of statewide prekindergarten classes, telling lawmakers that when he became governor, New York was literally a joke on late night TV.

title: Video Game Nostalgic, and Gloriously Lost in Space
description: There are games apps, and there are games apps. Some gamers like the imagination in fantasy games, some thrill to gory shoot-em-ups, others love the wonderfully named MMORPGs (massively multiplayer online role-playing games). Each genre has unique characteristics.

title: Video: Never Going Out of Style
description: Irwin Susskind was strolling down Montague Street in Brooklyn Heights recently, wearing a black turtleneck, khakis and a boxy leather jacket. With the courthouse on one side and the Brooklyn promenade on the other, Montague Street is a shopping hub for Brooklyn residents. Mr. Susskind, who has lived in the neighborhood for 42 years, describes the brownstone-lined area as the best place I know.

title: Adding Sex to the Chinese Dream
description: Experts interpret the Chinese Dream, ran a clinical-sounding headline in China Daily last month.

title: Striking While the Iron Is Hot
description: When Daniel Panner and Maria Chudnovsky married two years ago, he moved to her two-bedroom co-op in Morningside Heights from his studio condominium in the Ansonia on the Upper West Side.

title: Bolshoi to Visit Lincoln Center Festival
description: New York ballet fans should get an unusual chance to see the growing globalization of dance careers this summer without leaving Lincoln Center: David Hallberg is scheduled to dance in June at the Metropolitan Opera House with American Ballet Theater, where he is a principal dancer, and in July at the David H. Koch Theater with the Bolshoi Ballet, which he joined in 2011.

title: Video: Heli Pilot and Skiers Redefine Whats Possible
description: Behind the Line is a video series produced by Teton Gravity Research that takes you into the minds of skiers. In each episode, the athletes will look back on a line, a jump or a session, and discuss the moment.

title: Republican Pollster Teams With Madison Avenue Agencies
description: A familiar name in politics  Frank Luntz, the Republican media strategist, consultant and pollster  is joining forces with Madison Avenue. His company, Luntz Global, which works for corporate clients as well as candidates, is being acquired.

title: Two House Democrats Announce Retirement
description: WASHINGTON  Two House Democrats, Carolyn McCarthy of New York, and Mike McIntyre of North Carolina, on Wednesday announced plans to retire.

title: A Sampler Broad Enough for Voguing and Mary, Queen of Scots
description: Each year in January, several of Manhattans smaller dance spaces present anthologies of work by different choreographers and companies. Out-of-town presenters arrive to shop for items they can show back home, while New York dancegoers can catch up on what they might have missed. At the Joyce Theater  whose weeklong season is called Focus Dance  eight troupes are sharing four programs. Tuesdays opening night was a double bill by the choreographers Vicky Shick and Doug Elkins; the audience abounded with choreographers, presenters and dancers.

title: London Fashion Week: Kent & Curwen Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the London Fashion Week photo diary of Kasia Bobula.

title: Dad, Hes Cute. Are You Sure Hes My Brother?
description: The Spoils of Babylon seems as if it ought to be funnier, or at least more daring, given the personnel involved. But its good for some dumb laughs, and  important in this age when complex television dramas consume so many of our brain cells  it doesnt demand much of a mental commitment.

title: What $250 of Prescription Drugs Looks Like
description: Being able to afford prescription medications in the United States often requires top-notch insurance or plenty of disposable income.

title: Leadership Change May Signal New Start for Billboard Magazine
description: Billboard magazine first appeared in 1894 to cover the outdoor advertising market, reporting on all that is new, bright and interesting on the boards, as it proclaimed in its first issue. But for almost a century now it has been the indispensable organ of the music industry, dutifully covering every staffing change and label deal, and logging hits and flops on its charts.

title: Police Cleared in 2011 Death That Incited British Riots
description: LONDON  The man whose death at the hands of a police officer in 2011 set off riots that shocked Britain was killed lawfully, a jury found on Wednesday, issuing a decision that was sharply criticized by the dead mans family.

title: Same Injury, Different Costs
description: The cost of treating a cut finger in an emergency room varies widely across the country.

title: For Fans of Photographer, a Window of Opportunity
description: Larry Clarks lurid portraits of teenage sex, violence and drug taking hang at the Metropolitan Museum of Art and the Museum of Modern Art, and can sell for tens of thousands of dollars. Now, Mr. Clark, as a kind of thank you to the fans who have made his bleak 1971 photography book, Tulsa, and his 1995 movie, Kids, cult classics, is offering thousands of his one-of-a-kind color snapshots for purchase at $100 apiece at an East Village art space.

title: A New Age for African Artists
description: With the expectations of democracy and liberated by the Internet, the Kenyan artist collective Just a Band has found an international audience for its mix of entertainment and political content.

title: African Artists, Lifted by the Promises of Democracy and the Web
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  They built their reputation with wild music videos featuring a flying animated turtle  and a campy urban hero often considered Kenyas first Internet sensation.

title: Murder Is Just the Start
description: WESTLAKE VILLAGE, Calif.  Early in the first episode of True Detective two solemn cops, played by Matthew McConaughey and Woody Harrelson, arrive at a crime scene and confront a disturbing sight.

title: After a Fall, Ashley Wagner Regains Her Balance
description: BOSTON  Even now, as a candidate for an Olympic medal four years later, Ashley Wagner cannot watch her stumbling performance. She has tried, but she always feels the drop in her stomach.

title: Lessons in a Year of Crises
description: With all the crises in classical music during 2013  orchestras grappling with ominous deficits, ensembles closing down, opera companies going out of business  have we learned anything? Somewhat surprisingly, Michael R. Bloomberg, when he was still the mayor of New York, may have gotten to the heart of the matter in some blunt comments in September.

title: Ralph Lauren
description: The prefall collection included nude and earth tones.

title: Cashing In on Body Parts
description: Judi Henderson-Townsend of Oakland, Calif., runs Mannequin Madness  repairing, recycling, renting and selling mannequins.

title: Volkswagen to Introduce Golf R and Passat Concept in Detroit
description: Volkswagen announced on Wednesday that it would introduce the Golf R, which it said would be available in the United States by early 2015. Although the model for the European market is rated at 296 horsepower, the American model will get 290 horses and be available only as a 4-door.

title: Chamber to Split With Tea Party in G.O.P. Primaries
description: Ahead of primaries that will most likely serve as proxy wars for the overall direction of the Republican Party, the U.S. Chamber of Commerce announced its plans to take sides.

title: ScienceTake: Fluorescing Fish
description: From sea horses that glow red to bright green eels, researchers have discovered 180 species of fish that fluoresce under blue light.

title: Fluorescence Is Widespread in Fish, Study Finds
description: It was the green eel that did it. Scientists from the American Museum of Natural History had been exploring a reef off Little Cayman Island, investigating fluorescent coral and gathering photos for an exhibition.

title: At CES, Waiting for a Wrist Revolution
description: The Wrist Revolution section of the International CES in Las Vegas is supposed to be at the forefront of smartwatches and wrist computers. Yet most of the gadgets on display do not seem ready for prime time.

title: London Fashion Week: Burberry Prorsum Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the London Fashion Week photo diary of Roberta Ridolfi.

title: More Security, Fewer Passwords
description: Among all the shiny gadgets at the International CES, software often gets short shrift, especially unglamorous software for things like authentication.

title: Working Out With a Speedskater
description: The workout for Eddy Alvarez, a United States Olympic Team short track speedskater, is designed in part to keep his body balanced even though he relies on his left side when skating.

title: A Play Is Set in a Hospital, in Two Ways
description: Seven actors sat rehearsing around a makeshift conference table in a Brooklyn hospital, passing around a pack of red Twizzlers. Snowplows grated against the pavement outside, and Long Island Rail Road trains thundered by on the elevated tracks as the actors recited brittle, ominous lines.

title: The Meaning for Businesses in Delawares Judicial Nomination
description: Given that Leo E. Strine Jr. has a reputation for being both brilliant and a workaholic as the head of Delawares Chancery Court, the nations leading court for litigation of business disputes, it is no surprise that he was nominated to become the states next chief judge. But what does that mean for corporate America?

title: Diligence Promised in Studying Looted Art
description: BERLIN  Faced with the monumental task of tracing the owners of hundreds of artworks that resurfaced last year after they were hidden for decades in a Munich apartment, Ingeborg Berggreen-Merkel has a pretty firm idea of how long she and her staff will need. But dont expect her to announce it.

title: Layer It Now, Play in It Come Spring
description: We start the new year thinking ahead  imagine all the wonders we will accomplish in 2014  so the idea of wardrobe refreshers, as fashion retailers like to call them, makes total sense. Here are a few such refreshers, to help you through a frightful winter and to enjoy later, too.

title: Ambitious Redesign of MoMA Doesnt Spare a Notable Neighbor
description: The Museum of Modern Art unveiled on Wednesday a sweeping redesign of its Midtown building, featuring a retractable glass wall, new gallery space and the opening of its entire first floor, including the beloved sculpture garden, free to the public.

title: From Harvard, a Cheaper Storage Battery
description: WASHINGTON  Researchers at Harvard say they have developed a new battery technology that can store energy at lower cost, a development that Energy Department officials say could pave the way for a new generation of batteries.

title: Bare Knuckles and High Heels
description: The supporting actor race is expected to be crowded. Jared Leto, Casey Affleck and Jake Gyllenhaal all underwent dramatic transformations to get into character and their work could mean an Oscar.

title: The Von Zedtwitz Double Knockout in New York
description: One of the most enjoyable events in the Greater New York Bridge Association calendar is the Von Zedtwitz Double Knockout. As the name suggests, a team must lose twice before being eliminated. Its winners over the decades have been a Whos Who of players in region.

title: A Rugged Camera, Despite Design Flaws
description: Nikons new AW1 is a tough little camera. You can bash it on rocks, take it under water and use it in the worst ski conditions. It is solid, workmanlike and it fills a niche between pocket cameras and expensive, professional rigs.

title: Germany Charges Former SS Member in Wartime Killings
description: BERLIN  An 88-year-old former member of an SS armored division that slaughtered 642 villagers in France in 1944 was charged with 25 counts of murder on Wednesday in Cologne, while a German court in another city dropped the case against a 92-year-old former SS member charged with killing a Dutch resistance fighter during World War II.

title: Pictures of the Day: Egypt and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Egypt, Central African Republic, Syria and Indonesia.

title: My, How Youve Changed!
description: As the amoral, drug- and sex-addled right-hand man in The Wolf of Wall Street, Jonah Hill wore a set of gleaming false teeth. They were based on the look of the trader who helped inspire his character, but they made him talk funny.

title: Tom Ford: Fall 2014 Menswear
description: London

title: Fashions Polar Vortex
description: Baby, it may be cold outside, but thats no reason not to look fashionable.

title: A Spot Painting With a Cartoon Past: Hirst Makes a Mickey
description: People see a lot of different things when they look at a Damien Hirst spot painting.

title: Inside With the Outsiders
description: SO MANY MISFITS in this town  the skate brats and the wishy-washy actors and the ball children and the art slackers and the ectomorph poets and the hip-hop arrivistes. Twelve years of the Bloomberg administration may have done a number on middle-class aspirations in New York, but they built a hell of a machine to rage against. Or to aspire to.

title: Times Minute | New Jersey Bridge Scandal
description: Also on the Minute, the MoMA expands and an undersea light show.

title: Times Minute | New Jersey Bridge Scandal
description: In the Video

title: The Girls From Brooklyn Take Manhattan
description: Why bother schlepping to Brooklyn when you can import its zeitgeist-y trappings to Columbus Circle? Such was the spirit at Monday nights premiere of HBOs Girls, now in its third season.

title: The Brooklyn Beard Goes Mainstream
description: The gasps were audible when Jay Carney, the White House press secretary, strolled to the briefing room podium last Monday sporting the unthinkable, at least by Washington standards: a beard.

title: The Deliberations of War
description: Robert M. Gates gives us a forthright, impassioned, sometimes conflicted account of his four and a half years as defense secretary in his fascinating new memoir Duty, a book that is highly revealing about decision making in both the Obama and Bush White Houses.

title: Protecting the N.F.L. Brand
description: On the fifth floor of the N.F.L. offices in Midtown is an area designed to recreate for visitors the in-your-face feel of being on the football field. Giant screens stream live games, and larger-than-life photographs of players plaster the walls. The crowds roar, the music swells.

title: G.M.O. Foods and the Trust Issue
description: To the Editor:

title: In the Name of the Law
description: To the Editor:

title: Tragedy in Custody Cases
description: To the Editor:

title: High-Speed Trains
description: To the Editor:

title: Why Pete Rose Wont Enter the Hall Any Time Soon
description: To the Editor:

title: For Martha Stewart, the Secret Is Routine
description: It turns out that the Bedford, N.Y., bathroom cabinet of Martha Stewart, 72, is as well stocked as its gardening shed. The many products help prime Ms. Stewart for on-air appearances like her show, Martha Stewarts Cooking School, which began airing its third season on PBS last week.

title: Wikipedia-Mania
description: So this is how it begins. One day youre perfectly content with your lot in life. The next, youre browsing Wikipedia and thinking: Wait, how exactly did he get in there? Is he that much more noteworthy than I am? Paul Jolley, who finished ninth on American Idol last season with his rendition of Eleanor Rigby, has a page. Really?

title: Plans for the Museum of Modern Art
description: Map of proposed changes

title: Sales and Events for the Week of Jan. 9
description: Sales

title: For Sleep Apnea Patients, a Possible Alternative to Masks
description: The standard treatment for people with moderate to severe obstructive sleep apnea is a mask worn at night that helps them breathe without interruption. The mask is unwieldy and uncomfortable, however; one study found that46 percent to 83 percent of patients with obstructive sleep apnea do not wear it diligently.

title: When Pop Stars Go Into Rehab
description: When it comes to aging pop stars, were used to one sort of renovation  the kind that involves faces being buffed up. But the DIY Network has found a winning formula that involves a more conventional form of renovation and pairing older stars with older homes.

title: The de Blasios: Dressed for (and by) New York
description: Last Wednesday, as Bill de Blasio, the newly elected mayor of New York, gave his inauguration speech on the steps of City Hall, he did so in an overcoat and a dark blue Corneliani suit. Mr. de Blasio didnt have to go too far to find that suit: It was stuffed away at home, purchased months ago at the mens clothing store Rothmans.

title: U.S. to List Libyan Groups and Militant Tied to Benghazi Attack as Terrorists
description: The State Department is moving to apply the terrorist designation to two Libyan organizations and one militant believed to have played a role in the deadly attack on the American diplomatic mission in Benghazi in September 2012, senior United States officials said on Wednesday.

title: Their Latest Act
description: Leaving their most celebrated residence in Malibu wasnt easy, but an almost net-zero house was one compensation for Tina Beebe and Buzz Yudell.

title: Aspiring to Nothing
description: Tina Beebe, an architectural colorist, painter and landscape designer, and Buzz Yudell, an award-winning architect, have a sneaky way of making everything they touch look easy and inviting. But transitions can be difficult even for those who are accomplished in the art of living well in homes of their own invention.

title: A Classic Rolls Back Into Production
description: The Danish designer Hans Wegner produced several hundred chairs in his long lifetime (he died in 2007 at age 92). The good chair is a task one is never completely done with, he said. No wonder that with such a vast trove to draw on, there has been a steady stream of reissues, most recently, the Swivel chair, revived by PP Mobler, a company in Denmark.

title: Sales at Loll Designs, ABC Carpet & Home and Others
description: From Saturday through Tuesday, Brook Farm General Store will have a moving sale in its Brooklyn shop, discounting many items up to 85 percent (a Falcon enamelware pie set that was $98 is now $65); 75 South Sixth Street (Berry Street), Brooklyn; 718-388-8642.

title: Curves Ahead, Paved in Gold
description: For her latest porcelain tableware, Sarah Cihat, a Brooklyn ceramist, purposely highlighted the imperfect. Ive been playing with a process for making this decayed look for years now, but wanted to do it on a completely usable product, she said. The pieces feature smooth curves with ragged edges, which are emphasized by a paradoxical touch of 22-karat yellow or white gold.

title: Bright Stripes, Big City
description: The Danish textile designer Grethe Sorensens new collection of three vinyl wallcoverings for Wolf-Gordon are based on her random-weave technique, a method for faithfully translating digital patterns to woven fabric. As in her tapestry work, the patterns are inspired by photographed images of blurred city lights, including neon signs, street lamps and car lights.

title: A New Leaf? How About a New Garden?
description: This year, instead of ordering my favorite annual and vegetable seeds for my kitchen garden, I gave myself permission to imagine the garden I will create if Rock, my husband and gardening buddy, and I find the place of our dreams.

title: Do Separate Tubs and Showers Appeal to Buyers?
description: Q. Would our master bathroom be more appealing to buyers if it had a tub that was separate from the shower?

title: Firewood Containers: Put a Little Love in Your Hearth
description: Most interior designers have what Stephen Sills calls little obsessions: small things that seem to merit special attention. For Mr. Sills, a designer based in Manhattan, one of those obsessions has to do with the fireplace.

title: How to Help College Students Graduate
description: AMERICAN students are enrolling in college in record numbers, but theyre also dropping out in droves. Barely half of those who start four-year colleges, and only a third of community college students, graduate. Thats one of the worst records among developed nations, and its a substantial drain on the economy. The American Institutes for Research estimates the cost of those dropouts, measured in lost earnings and taxes, at $4.5 billion. Incalculable are the lost opportunities for social mobility and the stillborn professional careers.

title: Macys Plans to Lay Off 2,500, Though Its Holiday Sales Were Up
description: While it reported solid holiday sales on Wednesday, Macys also announced several cost-cutting measures, including plans to lay off 2,500 employees.

title: Israels Defense Minister Calls Settlers Attacks on Palestinians Outright Terror
description: Israels defense minister, Moshe Yaalon, denounced a campaign of attacks on Palestinian civilians and property by extremist Israeli settlers as outright terror on Wednesday, after two cars were set on fire with Molotov cocktails and Hebrew graffiti  reading price tag and Esh Kodesh revenge  was sprayed on the walls of a West Bank village.

title: How to Talk to Kids About Death
description: Parenting Mistake #529: I promised my 5-year-old daughter, Sonya, that we could visit Grandma Joanie and Grandpa Roger soon.

title: House Republicans Preparing Plan for Immigration Overhaul
description: WASHINGTON  The House speaker, John A. Boehner, and his Republican leadership team are preparing to release their principles for an overhaul of the nations immigration laws later this month, the speaker told his members at a closed-door conference on Wednesday.

title: Greenpeace in New Feud With Russia Over a Ship Seized by Senegal
description: MOSCOW  Having just quieted the furor over its seizure of a Greenpeace International ship in the Arctic, Russia is embroiled in a new dispute with the environmental organization, this time over a Russian fishing trawler accused of poaching in coastal waters off Senegal.

title: As Winter Takes Hold, Plunging Temperatures Test Utilities
description: The short-term price of natural gas in the Northeast eased on Wednesday after surging during the cold snap this week, but many consumers face the prospect of higher bills as utilities seek to pass along the added costs.

title: Celebrating Deep Freeze, Insect Experts See a Chance to Kill Off Invasive Species
description: While some people were cursing a canceled flight or wishing they had donned an extra layer on Tuesday, when temperatures in the region took a deep dive, entomologists, foresters and naturalists were rooting for the mercury to drop even lower. That is because the extreme cold has the potential to beat back some of the invasive insects threatening treasured local tree and plant species.

title: As the Political World Turns
description: Well, that didnt take long.

title: With Help of Victims From 1849, Scientists Decode Early Strain of Cholera
description: Using bits of human intestine stored in a Philadelphia medical museum in 1849, scientists have decoded the genes of an early form of cholera, the deadly diarrheal disease that first swept the globe just a few decades earlier.

title: New Mayor in Seattle to Overhaul Police Dept.
description: SEATTLE  Just two days after his inauguration, even as he joked that he was still waking up in wonder at his amazing new job, Mayor Ed Murray said on Wednesday that he was leaping into an ambitious and perhaps politically risky effort to overhaul the Seattle Police Department.

title: Maytag Repairmans New Job Keeps Him Busy
description: IN 1967, three years after Mr. Whipple began imploring shoppers to stop squeezing Charmin in the toilet paper aisle, another melancholic brand character was introduced, the Maytag Repairman, who described himself in his first commercial as the loneliest man in town  because the appliances never broke. Now the character, who was depicted by several actors over the decades, is getting a tuneup himself, with a new attitude, function  and name.

title: N.Y.U. Project Is Stymied by Incidental Village Parks
description: According to preservationists, Jane Jacobs may have just saved Greenwich Village. Again.

title: Bird Flu Cited by Officials in Death in Canada
description: OTTAWA  Canadas health minister said Wednesday that a person in Alberta died this week of the bird flu virus, the first known fatality from the illness in North America.

title: Chinese Official Criticizes Japanese Shrine Visit
description: The Chinese ambassador to the United Nations, Liu Jieyi, on Wednesday criticized the Japanese prime ministers recent visit to a controversial shrine as an affront to international justice. Speaking to reporters in a rare address in front of the Security Council chambers, Mr. Liu, in answer to a question, offered an impassioned attack on the visit to the Yasukuni Shrine. The shrine honors Japans war dead, including some convicted war criminals.

title: Writer Gives Away Baseball Hall of Fame Vote to Deadspin
description: In November, the website Deadspin opened its campaign to buy the Baseball Hall of Fame vote of a member of the Baseball Writers Association of America and submit its choices under his name.

title: Deaths of United Nations Personnel Rise
description: Deadly attacks against United Nations personnel increased last year, claiming at least 58 lives, according to the United Nations Staff Union. The union said 33 of those killed were peacekeepers and 25 were civilians, including contractors working for the organization. In 2012, 37 United Nations personnel were killed, and in 2011, 36 were killed, the union said. The deadliest attack in 2013 was an ambush in Jonglei State, South Sudan, that killed 12 workers for the United Nations. According to the union, the deaths throughout the year included 16 peacekeepers killed in Darfur and seven in South Sudan.

title: The Bully Was a Dupe
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey has explanations to make, apologies to give and an administrative house to clean now that his top aides and political cronies were shown to have been fully and gleefully aware of the chaos they caused by ordering up lane closings  and a four-day traffic jam  in September at the George Washington Bridge.

title: IBM Is Betting That Watson Can Earn Its Keep
description: IBM wants to build a large and profitable business from what has mostly been a triumph of computing bragging rights, so it is giving Watson $1 billion and a nice office.

title: Gov. Cuomo Begins His Campaign
description: Gov. Andrew Cuomos State of the State address on Wednesday was a campaign speech for re-election in both style and substance. Whether the policies he laid out are good for the people of New York is another matter. Mr. Cuomo proudly recounted his successes  on-time budgets, marriage equality, gun control. But the centerpiece was his plan to cut taxes by $2 billion over the next three years.

title: After 2 Days, No Jury for Insider Trading Case
description: After a full day of questioning dozens of potential candidates in a federal courtroom in Lower Manhattan on Wednesday, lawyers still had not selected the 12-member jury for the insider trading trial of Mathew Martoma, a former hedge fund manager at SAC Capital Advisors.

title: Abortion Restrictions in Texas and Beyond
description: The tenuous state of womens basic right to make their own childbearing decisions was made clear on Monday when a federal appeals court in New Orleans heard arguments on a new abortion restriction enacted in July in Texas  one that requires doctors who perform abortions to have admitting privileges at a nearby hospital.

title: NASA Extends the Life of the International Space Station
description: Instead of splashing into the Pacific Ocean in 2020 as planned, the International Space Station will continue circling Earth for at least an additional four years, NASA announced on Wednesday.

title: Bridge Over Troubled Politics
description: We have been through a lot of political scandals. But never before has the nation been roiled by a conspiracy to create a traffic jam.

title: Libya Warns Oil Tankers Against Dealing With Militias
description: HOUSTON  In a further escalation of tensions with the militias occupying Libyas oil facilities, Prime Minister Ali Zeidan on Wednesday threatened to sink any foreign tankers attempting to load oil supplies from seized port terminals.

title: Progress in the War on Poverty
description: Americas war on poverty turned 50 years old this week, and plenty of people have concluded that, as President Reagan put it: We fought a war on poverty, and poverty won.

title: Blue and White of Dukes Pep Band Gets a Touch of Gray
description: Carl Pieper, a biostatistician at Duke, left his house in Durham, N.C., at 4 a.m. on Dec. 19 to drive to Madison Square Garden. That night, Pieper, who moonlights as a clarinetist, was to play the Garden, which bills itself as the Worlds Most Famous Arena, for the third time in three weeks.

title: Grim Sequel to Iraqs War
description: WASHINGTON  For two years, President Obama has boasted that he accomplished what his predecessor had not. I ended the war in Iraq, he has told audience after audience. But a resurgence by Islamic militants in western Iraq has reminded the world that the war is anything but over.

title: At White House, Its Biden Everywhere After a Memoirs Lashing
description: WASHINGTON  Wednesday was Joe Biden day at the White House.

title: Cuomo Delivers Annual State Address
description: In his 2014 State of the State address, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York called for growth and innovation.

title: Fighting a Pipeline, but Feeling and Fearing Christies Influence
description: Pity Gov. Chris Christie. He sounds so assertive, so obstreperous, so, so ... in charge.

title: Tech Attire, More Beta Than Chic
description: LAS VEGAS  The next computer consumers buy will fit on a wrist or sit atop a nose. At least that is what many tech companies are hoping.

title: Lonely at the Top? Try the Lower Rungs of Professional Tennis
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  James McGee did not last two hours at the 2014 Australian Open, but his brief stay Wednesday morning failed to dampen his mood.

title: In Annual Speech, Vermont Governor Shifts Focus to Drug Abuse
description: MONTPELIER, Vt.  In a sign of how drastic the epidemic of drug addiction here has become, Gov. Peter Shumlin on Wednesday devoted his entire State of the State Message to what he said was a full-blown heroin crisis gripping Vermont.

title: Christies Carefully Devised, No-Nonsense Image in Peril
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey has built a remarkable brand in Republican politics around a simple message: that his bluster and brashness, grating as they might be, were driven by a desire to transcend partisan rancor and petty politics in the service of the public good.

title: Site of Slippage
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  Hang on tight. This is a slippery one, and Im not talking about the tricky clues. Im talking about the earthquakes. [Sudden rumble as pictures fall off the wall, black and white squares go flying, and emus run for their lives.]

title: A Living Time Capsule Shows the Human Mark on Evolution
description: Imagine youre a looking for a place to shoot a monster movie. The plot involves animals kept in suspended animation for seven centuries springing back to life. Chances are you wouldnt pick South Center Lake for your location. The charming 898-acre lake sits on the outskirts of the small town of Lindstrom, Minn., known as Americas Little Sweden. Gothic its not.

title: BlackRock Agrees to End Wall Street Analysis Previews
description: BlackRock, the worlds largest asset management company, has agreed to end its practice of surveying Wall Street analysts to glean clues about their views on companies before those opinions are publicly issued.

title: Sister Wives Clip  Three Bedrooms
description: In a clip from the shows first season, Kody Brown and his first three wives  Meri, Janelle and Christine Brown  discuss their sex lives.

title: Sister Wives Clip  Graduation
description: In an upcoming episode of the TLC show, Sister Wives, the family is focused on planning a graduation party.

title: Behind Inflammatory Email, Aide With a Low Profile
description: Bridget Anne Kelly, the embattled aide to Gov. Chris Christie whose email appears to have instigated the controversial lane closings at the George Washington Bridge in September, is a seasoned operative in New Jersey politics. Until the disclosures on Wednesday, she appears to have maintained a decidedly low public profile.

title: Polygamy as Lifestyle Choice, and a Reality TV Brand
description: LAS VEGAS  Kody Brown, his four wives and 17 children want to be the new face of polygamy, what some consider the next frontier after same-sex marriage.

title: Why Wasnt It Grapes of Glee? Study of Books Finds Economic Link
description: Could the emotional connotations of words in literature be a kind of lagging economic indicator? According to scientists who analyzed a centurys worth of writing, they might: After using big-data techniques to document the frequency of sad and happy words in millions of books, the researchers concluded that the emotional mood of literature reflects the mood of the economy over the previous 10 years.

title: After Winning a Raise, 175 Casino Workers in Queens Lose Their Jobs
description: Scores of workers lined up after a meeting in a party room on the third floor of Resorts World Casino in Queens on Wednesday afternoon to turn in the uniforms they had worn in the casinos buffet restaurant and pick up their final paychecks.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Jan. 8, 2014
In Babysitters Care, Boy, 4, Dies in Midtown
description: New York City detectives on Wednesday were investigating the death of a 4-year-old boy in a Midtown apartment building.

title: 8 Violations for School in Wake of Lab Fire
description: Fire Department investigators have cited Beacon High School in Manhattan for eight violations, finding that dangerous chemicals were being stored unsafely and that safety equipment and practices were lacking in at least three rooms. One was the makeshift lab where two students were engulfed in flames last week when a chemistry demonstration went horribly awry.

title: Nets Kidd Earns Win Against Warriors and Jackson, a Coach Who Inspired Him
description: When the Golden State Warriors last visited New York, almost a year ago, Jason Kidd, then a Knicks point guard, approached Coach Mark Jackson with a handshake and a simple message: Thanks.

title: Fire From Latest Derailment Rages in Canada
description: Accident investigators were unable to approach a train near the border of Maine and the Canadian province of New Brunswick on Wednesday, more than 24 hours after five tank cars containing crude oil and four cars filled with propane derailed and burst into flames. The accident came about five months after a runaway train carrying crude oil derailed and destroyed the downtown of Lac-Mgantic, Quebec, killing 47 people. Officials decided to let the fire from the latest accident burn itself out. This weeks derailment, on the Canadian National Railway, involved a 122-car train from Toronto and will most likely add to the current debate in Canada about transporting oil and petroleum products by train.

title: After a Brush With Death, Focusing on the Next Step
description: The summer before her junior year of high school, Azzurae Wilson joined her father for a road trip to Baltimore to pick up her grandmother. Like many of her peers, Azzurae, 17, decided to share the candid moment with her friends and family on Instagram.

title: Andre Iguodala Lifts the Warriors to a Higher Level
description: How do you improve a team that has a star at nearly every position? For the Golden State Warriors, the answer was getting Andre Iguodala, one of the few players capable of stepping into any role the team requires on any given night.

title: Video Said to Show Brooklyn Abduction Suspect
description: A day after a top-ranking police official visited the grieving family of a Williamsburg man kidnapped and killed last week, detectives released new video late on Wednesday said to show one of his abductors lying in wait hours before the crime.

title: Corrections: January 9, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Senator Signals Support for Sending Helicopters to Iraq
description: WASHINGTON  A powerful Senate Democrat signaled Wednesday that he might allow the transfer of AH-64 Apache helicopters to Iraq as the government in Baghdad struggles to recapture key territory seized by Islamic extremists in the western part of the country.

title: Surveillance Video of Abduction Suspect
description: The Police Department offered this surveillance video hoping the public can identify one of two suspects wanted in connection with the kidnapping and murder of Menachem Stark.

title: Carter Camp, Leader in Wounded Knee Uprising, Dies at 72
description: On Dec. 29, 1890, United States cavalry, in the last battle of the American Indian wars, massacred as many as 350 Lakota Sioux at Wounded Knee in South Dakota. Three generations later, Carter Camp, a 32-year-old Indian militant, retaliated.

title: Masahiro Tanaka Reportedly Arrives in U.S. for Talks
description: The pursuit of Masahiro Tanaka moved into a new stage as Japanese news media outlets reported that Tanaka had arrived in the United States on Wednesday to begin meeting with teams interested in signing him.

title: Al Porcino, First Trumpeter With Leading Jazz Bands, Dies at 88
description: Al Porcino, whose powerful sound and ability to hit the highest of high notes with ease brought him work as the lead trumpeter in some of the most celebrated big bands in jazz, died on Dec. 31 in Munich. He was 88.

title: Varsity Blues (and Reds)
description: A heavy dose of sporty prep is scoring big in resort collections. Oversize varsity letters, all-American shades of blue and red and pleated miniskirts are at the forefront of the trend. From Charlotte Olympias Team Spirit suede sandals, complete with a shiny pompom and large CO monogram, to Equipments collegiate sweater similarly emblazoned with the brands initial, the alumni-weekend style is not just for nostalgic coeds. And to bring it all together, simple stripes nod to standard-issue cheerleading uniforms and letterman jackets  just in time for the Super Bowl next month.

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, January 9, 2014
description: Time for some traffic problems in Fort Lee.

title: A $4 Million Gift for Sphinx Organization
description: TheSphinx Organization, which provides music education programs and performance training for minority students and also presents an annual orchestral concert at Carnegie Hall, has received a $4 million gift from an anonymous donor, its executive and artistic director, Afa S. Dworkin, said on Wednesday. The gift is expected to be announced formally on Thursday. Ms. Dworkin said in an email that the gift would allow the organization to augment its professional, career development and educational pursuits by launching scholarships at pre-college, collegiate and post-graduate levels.

title: The Fed Shifts Ground on Big Banks
description: Simon Johnson, former chief economist of the International Monetary Fund, is the Ronald A. Kurtz professor of entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.

title: The Workout: Speedskating With Eddy Alvarez
description: Being a successful short-track speedskater is no easy feat. Members of the United States team follow a grueling schedule that involves up to eight hours of training, six days a week.

title: Word of the Day | dissolution
description: dissolution \di-s-l-shn\ noun

title: C. T. Hsia, Who Brought Chinese Literature to the West, Dies at 92
description: C. T. Hsia, a scholar who helped introduce modern Chinese literature to the West in the 1960s, providing close analysis and the first English translations of writers who are now widely recognized, died on Dec. 29 in Manhattan, where he taught at Columbia University for three decades. He was 92.

title: Food Companies Have Cut Back on Calories, Study Says
description: How big a difference does cutting 78 calories out of an Americans daily diet make?

title: Two Aces and a Slugger Are Joining the Halls Roster
description: Three players were elected to the Baseball Hall of Fame on Wednesday.

title: Divisional Round Probabilities: Statistics Are Important, but So Is Luck
description: Of the N.F.L.'s eight remaining playoff teams, the luckiest may be the Indianapolis Colts. Not only did they survive a 28-point second-half deficit in the wild-card round, but they were also the team that most overperformed statistical expectations in the regular season.

title: Whats on Thursday
description: 8 P.M. (TCM) STAR OF THE MONTH: JOAN CRAWFORD Turner Classic Movies continues its tribute to Crawford, who made some 80 films in a 45-year career, with Grand Hotel (1932), Edmund Gouldings movie about guests at a luxurious Berlin hotel where, a resident complains: People come, people go. Nothing ever happens. The ensemble for this film, an Oscar winner for best picture, also included Greta Garbo, John and Lionel Barrymore, and Wallace Beery, and was promoted by MGM as the greatest cast ever assembled. Writing in The New York Times, Mordaunt Hall said Crawford did all that is possible to vie with the others in the cast. Above, Crawford and Frederic March in Susan and God, also featured in the tribute.

title: Dennis Rodman Regrets Comments on North Korea Prisoner
description: HONG KONG  Dennis Rodman apologized Thursday for comments suggesting that an American jailed in North Korea deserved his fate. Rodman said he had been drinking at the time.

title: Smoking Prevalence Steady in China, but Numbers Rise
description: After decades of decline, the prevalence of smoking in China has held steady in recent years. Coupled with population growth, this means there are now more smokers in China than ever, according to a new study on global smoking prevalence published this month in the Journal of the American Medical Association.

title: Police Find Dead Tiger in S.U.V. in Wenzhou
description: At first the police in the southeastern city of Wenzhou suspected the two men were loading a human corpse into their S.U.V. The person-shaped object they were carrying was wrapped in a striped tarpaulin, of the kind commonly seen on construction sites across China, and bound in rope.

title: Novartis Faces Possible Criminal Inquiry in Japan
description: TOKYO  The pharmaceutical company Novartis said Thursday that it would cooperate with the authorities after Japans Health Ministry called for a criminal investigation into ads that allegedly claimed additional benefits of its best-selling medicine Diovan based on flawed research.

title: North Korea Rejects Souths Bid for Family Reunions
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea on Thursday rejected South Koreas proposal to hold reunions of elderly relatives separated by the Korean War six decades ago, but it kept the door open for a possible thaw in relations between the two Koreas.

title: JPMorgan Hires I.M.F. Official for Regulatory Role in Asia
description: HONG KONG  JPMorgan Chase has hired the Asia head of the International Monetary Fund for a newly created senior regulatory role in the region, according to a copy of an internal memo sent on Thursday.

title: Test Yourself | English, Jan. 9, 2014
description: Take the Quiz

title: 6 Qs About the News | Energy Bars That Put a Chirp in Your Step
description: In Energy Bars That Put a Chirp in Your Step, Sophie Brickman writes about a new energy bar made out of crickets.

title: Do You Worry We Are Filming Too Much?
description: With our smartphones and tablets, plus indoor and outdoor security cameras, we are recording just about everything and everywhere these days. But are these ubiquitous video cameras taking away our privacy?

title: Times Minute | Christie's Troubled Image
description: Also on the Minute, the new face of polygamy and beards go mainstream.

title: Times Minute | Christies Troubled Image
description: In the Video

title: Latest China-Japan Spat: Whos Voldemort?
description: In the acclaimed Harry Potter series by J.K. Rowling, the villain Lord Voldemort is also known as He-Who-Must-Not-Be-Named, a reference to magical powers so great that most fear to utter his name. But in the latest round of name-calling between China and Japan, Voldemort has become the insult of choice.

title: Chinese Film Director Fined for Exceeding Child Limits
description: HONG KONG  Chinas most internationally known film director, Zhang Yimou, and his wife were ordered by a government office on Thursday to pay a $1.24 million fine for violating family planning limits by having three children.

title: New York Today: Shed a Layer
description: Updated 10:00 a.m.

title: Standard Chartereds Finance Chief to Leave
description: LONDON  Standard Chartered said on Thursday that its chief financial officer, Richard Meddings, would leave as part of a major restructuring that will combine the banks wholesale and consumer businesses.

title: Daily Report: New Wearable Devices Face Some Obstacles
description: At the International CES this week, more than a dozen technology companies showcased Internet-connected watches and glasses capable of running software applications, Brian X. Chen reports.

title: Flashing Red Symbols of Privilege Likely to be Tough to Turn Off
description: NEW DELHI  After Arvind Kejriwal, leader of the Aam Aadmi Party, was sworn in as the chief minister of Delhi, one of the first election promises he kept was to get rid of two perks he said were a hangover from colonial times  the security motorcades that usually follow the chief ministers official car and the flashing red light on the car roof, also known as a red beacon, which is used by government officials to cut through traffic.

title: Turning Body Parts  Mannequin Body Parts  Into a Business
description: Judi Henderson-Townsend has a resolution for the new year: She wants to hit a million dollars in revenue.

title: Cadwalader Picks Woolery as Next Chairman
description: Last February, James C. Woolery left investment banking to return to the practice of law. Less than a year later, he has been tapped to lead his new law firm.

title: Rolls-Royce Approached Wartsila, but Talks Have Ended
description: LONDON  The aircraft engine maker Rolls-Royce said on Thursday that it had been in preliminary discussions about possibly acquiring the Finnish manufacturer Wartsila Corporation, but that those talks had ceased.

title: Britain Keeps Interest Rates Unchanged Amid Signs of Recovery
description: LONDON  The Bank of England on Thursday left its benchmark interest rate unchanged at a record low as Britains economy sputtered toward recovery.

title: Elliott to Accept Increased Tender Offer for Celesio
description: Elliott Management said on Thursday that it would participate in a sweetened tender offer by the McKesson Corporation for the German pharmaceutical wholesaler Celesio, ending an impasse that threatened to block the $8.3 billion deal.

title: The Shroud Over Rwandas Nightmare
description: WASHINGTON  Twenty years ago this Saturday, the commander of United Nations peacekeeping forces in Rwanda wrote a coded cable to his superiors in New York that has come to be known as the genocide fax. Citing inside information from a top-level trainer for a pro-regime militia group, Brig. Gen. Romo Dallaire warned of an anti-Tutsi extermination plot.

title: BlackRock Ends Early Surveys
description: For almost five years, BlackRock, the worlds largest asset manager, has been surveying Wall Street analysts to extract clues about their views on companies before the outlooks were announced publicly. Now, the tactic has been shut down, Gretchen Morgenson reports in The New York Times.

title: As Indies Explode, an Appeal for Sanity
description: On Jan. 16, some 7,000 entertainment industry professionals and journalists will converge on Park City, Utah, hoping for a miracle. Distributors will push past exhibitors who will hustle past programmers, agents and critics, all of whom will be sifting through 117 features and 66 shorts at the Sundance Film Festival, looking for the next big thing: for the new Jennifer Lawrence (class of 2010 with Winters Bone) or for another Beasts of the Southern Wild,""Fruitvale Station or Upstream Color, three of the most talked-about titles from recent festivals. It will be exciting, exhausting and at times exasperating to be in the thick of such coordinated madness.

title: So Many Indie Films, So Many Reasons
description: With nearly 900 films released in New York theaters last year, Manohla Dargis argues that there are too many lackluster, forgettable and just plain bad movies pouring into theaters. Is flooding theaters  especially with indie releases  good for movies and moviegoers alike? With another edition of the Sundance Film Festival about to start next week, she took a casual survey of some 70 film professionals, asking them about the state of indie film. Here is a sampling of their answers, edited and condensed:

title: European Central Bank Set to Do Whatever It Takes to Bolster Recovery
description: FRANKFURT  The European Central Bank is ready to take decisive action to keep Europes tentative recovery afloat, the banks president, Mario Draghi, said on Thursday after the bank left interest rates unchanged at a record low.

title: Mistaken for a Squeegee Guy
description: Dear Diary:

title: The Rubber Duckie Has Hit the Road
description: Theres a bit of a shocker coming out of the inaugural 2014 Winter Bathroom Trends Study just released by Houzz, the home remodeling and design website. Bathtubs appear to be out of favor. More than 4 in 10 respondents said they were leaving them out of their new master bathrooms; among respondents 55 and older, more than half are going tub-less.

title: Anatomy of a Scene: Video of Philomena
description: If you make a film in Washington, you do what Frank Capra did, the director Stephen Frears explained. He was talking about a Lincoln Memorial scene in his drama Philomena, which received Golden Globe nods for best picture, screenplay and actress in a drama (Judi Dench). Based on a true story, it follows the title character on her search for the son she was forced to give up when she was a teenager living in a Roman Catholic home for unwed mothers in Ireland. In this scene she visits Washington with the journalist Martin Sixsmith (Steve Coogan). Mr. Frears commented on the scene and what was required to shoot in the nations capital.

title: Q. and A. | Months After Beating Cancer, Sharon Jones Is Back on the Road
description: Sharon Jones is a whirlwind performer. In concert, the energetic soul singer is known for whipping her braids across her face and darting about the stage while her backing band, the Dap-Kings, swings in the shadows. But Joness braids are gone now. After the 57-year-old was diagnosed last year with bile duct cancer, chemotherapy claimed her locks.

title: K.K.R. Raises $2 Billion Credit Fund
description: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Company is expanding its business of investing in distressed debt, with a new $2 billion fund.

title: The Most Thought-Provoking Allowance Idea of 2013
description: Should parents tie allowance to the completion of regular chores?

title: Turns Out His Blood Runs Green
description: I never wanted to write about the Irish.

title: Holiday Sales Slide 60% at Struggling Barnes & Noble Nook Unit
description: In late 2009, Barnes & Noble introduced its first e-reader, the Nook, and within a relatively short time had picked up 25 percent of the e-book market, slicing into Amazons dominance.

title: Nods to Casual, Chic and Carpet
description: LONDON  My life has changed, Tom Ford said. It is not just about moving to London  it is also having a child. Now I have to go out to the park with Jack. I need a different kind of shoe and casual clothes. I love casual weekends!

title: Updates on Bridge Scandal Surrounding Chris Christie
description: The Lede filed live updates from New Jersey, where Gov. Chris Christie spoke and took reporters questions before meeting with the mayor of Fort Lee, N.J., to apologize for the traffic-clogging toll lane closures his aide and appointees had ordered.

title: Very Sad Chris Christie Extends Apology in Bridge Scandal
description: TRENTON  In a remarkable day of swirling political drama, Gov. Chris Christie tried on Thursday to control the damage from revelations that his administration ordered the revenge-closings of traffic lanes at the George Washington Bridge by firing a top aide, cutting ties with a longtime political adviser and repeatedly apologizing in a nearly two-hour news conference.

title: Legal Experts Weigh in on Citizen Sting Operations
description: NEW DELHI  When Delhis chief minister, Arvind Kejriwal, announced on Wednesday evening that he had created a hotline to help citizens use their phones to conduct sting operations on corrupt state officials, the response from the public was immediate: nearly 4,000 calls poured in by 3 p.m. Thursday, Mr. Kejriwal said.

title: No Comment Necessary: Whoops, My Gun Fired
description: Kentucky State Rep. Leslie Combs brought her Ruger 380 semi-automatic handgun to her office in the Capitol Annex on Tuesday. Nothing unusual about that: She often carries the weapon in her purse. But heres the thing: She accidentally fired it. Whoops. Im a gun owner. It happens, she said.

title: For Couples Split by Distance, Two Screens Can Blink as One
description: FAR-FLUNG lovers once took solace in sharing the same big sky. Now they take it in sharing the little screen. They count down  3, 2, 1  to begin Breaking Bad at the same second. While Facebook-messaging about it on another slice of the laptop screen. While glimpsing each others faces on cellphone video chat.

title: Video: When Actors Sacrifice for Second Billing
description: The Bagger is a competitive-minded professional, which is why, when Casey Affleck  most recently seen as a bare-knuckle boxer in Out of the Furnace  suggested that the two of us would make for a fair fight, we immediately agreed to test it out. Cut to: Mr. Affleck wrapping our hands with boxing tape.

title: French Court Says Fugitive Kazakh Banker Can Be Extradited
description: PARIS  A French court ruled on Thursday that Mukhtar Ablyazov, a Kazakh businessman accused of embezzling as much as $6 billion from a Kazakh bank he once controlled, should be extradited to Ukraine or Russia to face fraud charges.

title: Ombudswoman for I.R.S. Tells Congress It Needs More Funding to Aid Its Work
description: The Internal Revenue Service would do a better job with more money to bolster collection and customer service efforts, the ombudswoman for the nations tax collector said on Thursday in delivering her annual report to Congress.

title: Sue Monk Kidd: By the Book
description: The author of The Secret Life of Bees and, most recently, The Invention of Wings tries to read a poem every morning along with her coffee: Its the most important meal of the day.

title: Eileen Martinson of Sparta Systems on Clarity of Leadership
description: This interview with Eileen Martinson, chief executive of Sparta Systems, a maker of quality-management software, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: Outkast to Reunite at Coachella Festival
description: Shake a Polaroid picture for a few minutes and it eventually develops; give Big Boi and Andre 3000 a little bit longer and eventually things develop for them, too. Those innovative hip-hop stars will reunite as Outkast, the pioneering duo who breathed new cultural life into Polaroids in the ubiquitous hit single Hey Ya!, and will perform as one of the headlining acts at this years Coachella festival, its organizers announced.

title: In Our Pages: January 10
description: 1964: Congressmen Assail Cuba Deal

title: VH1 Offers Its Super Bowl Lineup
description: You might be so busy dancing youll forget about the kickoff. VH1s Super Bowl Blitz, a series of six concerts on the six nights leading up to the Super Bowl on Feb. 2, will include a late-night (11 p.m.) performance in each of the five boroughs of New York, as well as Montclair, N.J., the station announced Thursday. Time Warner Cable has announced a series of Super Bowl events at its Manhattan studios that also include performances.

title: Poetry Pairing | Ozymandias
description: This Poetry Pairing features the classic Percy Bysshe Shelley poem Ozymandias and the Op-Ed Goodbye, Lenin? by Sasha Senderovich.

title: Rylances Shakespeare Shows Recoup on Broadway
description: It wasnt only plays with Hollywood stars like Daniel Craig and Billy Crystal that made money on Broadway this winter. A critically acclaimed double bill of Shakespeare, Twelfth Night and Richard III, starring Mark Rylance  a two-time Tony Award winner but hardly a household name  has recouped its $3.1-million capitalization, the plays producers announced on Thursday.

title: Mikaela Shiffrins Swift, if Unplanned, Ascent to World Champion
description: EAGLE-VAIL, Colo.  Sprinting from her small trophy-filled bedroom, Mikaela Shiffrin, the youngest American skier to be a World Cup champion, dashed around the kitchen looking for a headset to attach to her laptop.

title: Student Crossword | Literary Terms
description: Test your knowledge of literary terms by playing our crossword in print (PDF). You can find the answers here.

title: Haynes and Trucks Leaving Allman Brothers Band
description: Two important, longstanding (though not original) members of the Allman Brothers Band, the guitarists Warren Haynes and Derek Trucks, announced on Wednesday evening that they would leave the band at the end of 2014, when the band completes its celebrations of its 45th anniversary. Both have bands of their own  Mr. Haynes leads the jam band Govt Mule, and Mr. Trucks shares the spotlight with his wife, the singer and guitarist Susan Tedeschi in the Tedeschi Trucks Band  and say that they hope to devote more time to them.

title: Germany to Help in Disposal of Syrian Chemical Weapons
description: BERLIN  German experts will help destroy chemical weapons removed from Syria under the auspices of the United Nations and the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons, the government said Thursday.

title: Christie Embarrassed by Bridge Scandal
description: In addressing the bridge scandal, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey said he felt humiliated by the conduct of some of his associates, adding that he had fired one of his top aides for lying to him.

title: Image of the Day: January 9
Times Minute | Christie Responds
description: Also on the Minute, focus on Iraq and all eyes on Mikaela Shiffrin.

title: Times Minute | Christie Responds
description: In the Video

title: Blast in Pakistan Kills Senior Police Official
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  A senior Pakistani police investigator at the forefront of operations against the Taliban and other criminals in the sprawling, seaside city of Karachi was killed in a huge bomb blast there on Thursday, police officials said. His driver and a security officer were also killed in the attack, and at least 11 people were reported wounded.

title: Vanya and Sonia and Abs and Pecs
description: Jefferson McDonald isnt shedding tears for friends who made New Years resolutions to get in shape. This 26-year-old actor has committed to a routine that includes near-daily workouts, yoga several times a week and basketball in his free time. Say pizza and beer, and machetes shoot from his eyes.

title: Critics Voice Objections to MoMAs Plan to Take Down Folk Art Museum
description: Updated, 6:09 p.m. | To the surprise of perhaps no one, including the Museum of Modern Art, the decision to take down the former home of the American Folk Art Museum as part of a redesign of MoMAs Midtown Manhattan building provoked strong reactions on Thursday from architects and critics.

title: Wheelies: The Vice Presidential Auto Show Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: An Artist Whos Truly Wired
description: For R. Luke DuBois, art has its basis in mounds of data.

title: How British Members of the Academy May Be Leaning
description: Voting for the Oscar nominations has officially closed  the final clicks and ballots had to be accounted for by 5 p.m. Pacific Standard Time on Wednesday  which means that other groups prize choices will not have an effect. But they could still indicate which way the breeze is blowing at the Academy.

title: Should Governor Christie Step Down?
A Way to Carrying Multiple Concealed Devices
description: How would James Bond carry his electronic tablet  assuming he carried a tablet and wasnt so cool?

title: As Iran Nuclear Talks Resume, Ayatollah Criticizes U.S.
description: Irans supreme leader harshly denounced the United States on Thursday as negotiations to conclude an interim agreement in the Iranian nuclear dispute resumed, saying those talks illustrated what he called the hostility of Americans toward Iran and the Muslim world.

title: The Gun Report: January 9, 2014
description: First it was Instagram. Now, Reddit, the so-called front page of the Internet, has been exposed as an active marketplace for assault rifles, high-capacity magazines and other powerful firearms, according to an investigation by Mother Jones. The Guns for Sale page, which counts more than 7,200 subscribers, offers buyers and sellers a forum on the site, which boasts tens of millions of users and drives major traffic to other websites.

title: How Did You Motivate Your Hibernating Teenager to Stay Healthy in Winter?
description: Its winter. In much of the country, its cold, often bleak, snowy, icy, rainy. Its not appealing weather for getting outside and getting moving. Younger children see that differently: They see snow for sledding and ice for sliding, and really, why wouldnt you want to go out? And teenagers who are already active in sports, dance, or enjoy a regular workout routine just keep going. But for teenagers who are even more inclined to hibernate in winter, how can you keep them moving and healthy?

title: A Chunky, Cheerful Tracking Device to Keep Tabs on Your Child
description: Tracking devices make me uneasy, but I have to defer to parental paranoia, which requires knowing where your children are. A watch/tracker/phone, Filip, may help.

title: In Harlem, an African Tasting Plate
description: First, respect: Bebop was born here, on West 118th Street at St. Nicholas Avenue, where in the early 1940s Mintons Playhouse hired as house pianist an unknown named Thelonious Monk, who played the instrument as if nobody knew how before.

title: Ex-SAC Trader Was Expelled From Harvard Law School
