description: UDON THANI, Thailand  It was probably inevitable in a country so obsessed with food and drink that Thailands political turmoil would spill over into beer.

title: Despite Bumps, the Knicks Bandwagon Starts to Roll
description: Without introduction, here are a few events  Episodes? Tragicomedies? Calamities?  that have befallen the Knicks over the past five games.

title: Street Style Photos at Pitti Uomo in Florence, Italy
description: The mens collections were shown this week at Pitti Uomo in Florence, Italy. Here are some from our Instagram feed, for more.

title: Lane Closings Scandal Shows Port Authoritys Status as 2 Warring Fiefs
description: After a top New Jersey official at the Port Authority, David Wildstein, ordered the lane closings at the George Washington Bridge that clogged Fort Lee, N.J., for four days in September, the authoritys New York-appointed executive director, Patrick J. Foye, exploded with anger and ordered the lanes reopened. But then the authoritys New Jersey-appointed chairman, David Samson, expressed outrage over Mr. Foyes outrage, accusing him of leaking the story of the lane closings.

title: Its Time to Update Overtime
description: WASHINGTON  PRESIDENT OBAMA has assured American workers that he wont let Congress keep him from lending a hand during these tough economic times. I will not allow gridlock, inaction or willful indifference to get in our way, he said in a speech last year. Whatever executive authority I have to help the middle class, Ill use it.

title: To Regain Trust, Target Must Do More, Crisis Experts Say
description: With clients over the years like Michael R. Milken (securities fraud), Dominique Strauss-Kahn (rape allegations), Jack Abramoff (bribery) and the Sizzler restaurant chain (salmonella), Marina Ein is well versed in the art and science of crisis public relations.

title: Nelson Ned, Florid Brazilian Balladeer, Dies at 66
description: Nelson Ned, a Brazilian singer of small stature and large voice who was hailed throughout Latin America as the Little Giant of Song, died on Sunday in So Paolo. He was 66.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Inside Bell Labs Carcass, and Encouraging Women Programmers
description: Every day, The New York Timess staff scours the web for interesting and peculiar items.

title: Larry Speakes, Public Face of Reagan Era, Dies at 74
description: WASHINGTON  Larry Speakes, who became the public face of Ronald Reagans presidency when a would-be assassins bullet gravely wounded his boss, press secretary James Brady, died Friday in his native Mississippi. He was 74.

title: Imagining President Christie
description: Let us count the ways that this weeks traffic-jam scandal is actually good for Chris Christies presidential prospects.

title: U.S. Says Iran Wont Attend Peace Talks on Syria
description: WASHINGTON  Iran will not participate in peace talks on Syria that are to be held this month in Switzerland, a senior State Department official said Friday.

title: Dale T. Mortensen, Labor Economist and Nobel Laureate, Dies at 74
description: Dale T. Mortensen, an economist whose pioneering work on labor markets won a Nobel and helped governments and policy makers better understand the stubborn complexities of unemployment, died on Thursday at his home in Wilmette, Ill. He was 74.

title: Sex Is Not Our Problem
description: There is often a simplistic, black-or-white, conservative vs. progressive discussion around the dissolution of the traditional family and high single-parent birthrates in America and what these trends may portend for us as a country.

title: Enrollees at Health Exchanges Face Struggle to Prove Coverage
description: FORT WORTH  Paul D. Donahue and his wife, Angela, are among more than a million Americans who have signed up for health coverage through the federal insurance exchange. Mr. Donahue has a card in his wallet from his insurer to prove it. But when he tried to use it to get a flu shot and fill prescriptions this week, local pharmacies could not confirm his coverage, so he left without his medications.

title: Down to the Last Cigarette?
description: This is certainly turning out to be quite the year for 50th anniversaries. Fifty years ago next month, the Beatles made their U.S. debut on The Ed Sullivan Show. In 1964, President Lyndon Johnson started the War on Poverty. And 50 years ago Saturday, the surgeon general of the United States issued the single most important report that would ever come out of that office. It linked cigarette smoking to illness and death.

title: Seeking Redemption, Sometimes With a Familiar Ring
description: See the ultimate political apology, culled from notable speeches and statements made in the aftermath of wrongdoing or other officeholder embarrassments.

title: Floridas Site Said to Delay Millions in Aid to Jobless
description: MIAMI  The botched rollout of Floridas online system for unemployment claims may have kept jobless Floridians from receiving $20 million in benefits in October and November, according to an informal analysis by a workers rights group.

title: Seahawks Punt Team Is Flashy With Play, Not Name
description: RENTON, Wash.  In a locker room populated by the Legion of Boom and Beast Mode and even a Fat Rabbit, the most dominant unit on the most dominant team in the N.F.C. lacks a catchy nickname of its own. For this, Jeremy Lane, an integral member of that squad, apologizes.

title: Booze, Revisited
description: Dear Readers: Some of you had trouble finding my most recent column, on alcoholism. Since the latest entries are no longer part of Opinionator, the best way to locate my pieces is simply to search for my name in the Timess search engine or go directly to my columnist page. Ive always looked forward to reading your comments, even though the queue sometimes got so busy they had to be turned off  particularly unfortunate in this case since the 100 that were allowed were erudite and touching. Please keep your notes coming, as much as you can! I have a very busy year ahead, but I will be back to you as often as possible, even though it wont be on a regular schedule. You can think of me as a little occasional surprise. Heres to a productive and healthy 2014.  Dick

title: Wall St. Shock: Take a Day Off, Even a Sunday
description: For the ambitious college graduates who flock to Wall Street, working into the wee hours or even pulling all-nighters is an unwritten expectation of the job. Spending both Saturdays and Sundays at the office is the norm.

title: World Bank Is Criticized for Honduran Loan
description: MEXICO CITY  The World Bank ombudsman issued a stinging critique Friday of the banks private-sector arm over a loan to a Honduran palm-oil company engaged in a violent conflict with farm workers over land tenure.

title: Arkansas: Lieutenant Governor Quitting Under Pressure
description: Lt. Gov. Mark Darr, who was facing the threat of impeachment proceedings in the aftermath of a settlement with the states Ethics Commission, said on Friday that he would resign on Feb. 1. Although Mr. Darr, a Republican elected in 2010, had resisted bipartisan demands for his resignation, he agreed to quit as lawmakers openly discussed removing him from office. State investigators determined last month that Mr. Darr had repeatedly broken state law by using more than $31,000 in campaign money for personal reasons, accepting improper contributions and maintaining faulty records. Mr. Darr, who abandoned a bid for Congress after an Arkansas political blogger accused him of the misconduct, said his errors were unintentional but agreed to pay $11,000 in fines.

title: U.S. Advisers Sent to Help Somalia Fight the Shabab
description: WASHINGTON  The Pentagon has sent a small team of uniformed military advisers to Somalia, the first American troops assigned there since 1993, when 18 Americans were killed in the failed Black Hawk Down mission.

title: An Assembly of Quietly Moving Parts
description: The stars of The Record  all 45 of them  do not really do much. They stand stock still on a bare stage, strike some funny poses then walk around a bit. They do a little running, too, and assemble in groups and sometimes stretch out on the floor. Just now and then, one will extend a hand to touch another, or a young woman will fall backward into a mans arms, in a moment of connection that registers with soft surprise.

title: No Jobs, No Benefits, and Lousy Pay
description: There is nothing good to say about the December employment report, which showed that only 74,000 jobs were added last month. But dismal as it was, the report came at an opportune political moment. The new numbers rebut the Republican arguments that jobless benefits need not be renewed, and that the current minimum wage is adequate. At the same time, they underscore the need, only recently raised to the top of the political agenda, to combat poverty and inequality.

title: Bill Conlin, Sportswriter Who Quit After Molestation Claims, Dies at 79
description: Bill Conlin, a sports columnist for The Daily News in Philadelphia who was honored by the Baseball Hall of Fame in 2011 but who left his job later that year amid a storm of publicity over child-molestation accusations, died on Thursday in Largo, Fla. He was 79.

title: Haiti, Unfinished and Forsaken
description: Four years after the earthquake, Haiti is a fragile, largely forgotten country. Its possible that some natural or man-made crisis this year could push it back into the headlines. But sustained attention, with the kind of support from outside that Haiti still needs to rebuild and become more self-sufficient, is mostly gone.

title: Weigh-In Section
description: SATURDAYS PUZZLE  Oh boy. I like Martin Ashwood-Smiths puzzles, but this one really wasnt in my wheelhouse. That doesnt make it a bad puzzle, I just had a tough time solving it because I didnt know much about the things in it. You know youre in trouble when the clue at 1 Across  It has a close Kentucky cousin  has you thinking about bourbon instead of flora.

title: Increased Security for Nuclear Materials
description: There is some rare good news on the issue of securing and containing deadly nuclear materials. In the last two years, seven countries have forsaken their uranium and plutonium stockpiles, bringing the number of nations still possessing appreciable quantities of nuclear fuel usable for bomb-making down to 25. In 1991, the number was 52.

title: Yankees Sign Reliever (Matt Thornton) and Cut Outfielder (Vernon Wells)
description: With a glut of outfielders and a shortage of left-handed relief pitchers, the Yankees swapped out one for the other Friday, cutting Vernon Wells and signing Matt Thornton.

title: A Mr. Feder, Once of Fort Lee, Chimes In
description: A Mr. Richard Feder, famously from Fort Lee, N.J., has a question about the rather infamous closings of lanes to the George Washington Bridge.

title: A Guillotine in Storage Bears Signs of a Role in Silencing Nazis Critics
description: BERLIN  A guillotine used to execute thousands of people during the Nazi era, including a brother and sister who led a group of Munich students known as the White Rose in resistance to Hitler, has been provisionally identified in a storage area belonging to the Bavarian National Museum, museum officials said Friday.

title: Franklin McCain, Who Fought for Rights at All-White Lunch Counter, Dies at 73
description: Franklin McCain, who helped fuel the civil rights movement in 1960 when he and three friends from their all-black college requested, and were refused, coffee and doughnuts at a whites-only lunch counter in Greensboro, N.C., died on Thursday in Greensboro. He was 73.

title: Colts vs. Patriots: A Great Rivalry, Now Revised
description: Since Tom Bradys first career start more than a dozen years ago, the rivalry between the New England Patriots and the Indianapolis Colts has been must-watch football. For years, Brady faced Peyton Manning in a duel of the top two quarterbacks in the N.F.L. With Manning playing in Denver for the Broncos, a second chapter of the rivalry is being established. Now it is Brady versus Andrew Luck, the Colts second-year quarterback and an emerging star.

title: Dropbox Says Site Down After Maintenance Error, Not From Hackers
description: Updated January 11, 9:46 a.m. | A hacker claiming to be a member of the loose hacking collective Anonymous took credit for knocking offline the website of the cloud storage provider Dropbox late Friday. Attempts to reach the site were met with an error message.

title: New Reality for Heat: From Rolling to Resting
description: The Miami Heat appear to be learning from one of their few mistakes.

title: Neiman Marcus Investigates Breach Involving Credit Card Data
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Neiman Marcus is investigating a security breach involving credit card information stolen from its customers.

title: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, January 11, 2014
description: Were going to continue to file and act as if were married. Some people have said thats an act of civil disobedience. If it is, so be it.

title: Pictures From the Week in Business
description: A disappointing jobs report, thousands of airline flight cancellations and an aggressive move to attract cellphone customers.

title: South Sudan: Army Says Its Soldiers Have Regained Control of Northern City
description: South Sudans military on Friday retook Bentiu, the capital of an oil-producing state, from rebels loyal to the former vice president, said a military spokesman, Col. Philip Aguer. Fighting in South Sudan began last month in the national capital, Juba, after President Salva Kiir, left, said that his former vice president, Riek Machar, had attempted a coup. Thousands are believed to have been killed and 200,000 displaced by the fighting, which has involved the countrys largest two ethnic groups, the Dinka and the Nuer. Peace talks are underway in Ethiopia. The militarys claim that it had regained control of Bentiu in the north could not immediately be confirmed. Colonel Aguer accused the rebels of looting the city and burning buildings. The medical aid group Doctors Without Borders also said that its facilities in Bentiu had been looted. It is unacceptable that one of the only humanitarian organizations still providing assistance to the population in Bentiu has been looted, said the groups general director, Arjan Hehenkamp. The United Nations Security Council on Friday urged the warring parties to stop the fighting, continue negotiations and ensure the protection of the countrys oil fields. The Council also asked Mr. Kiir to release political prisoners and urged Mr. Machar to agree to a cessation of hostilities without precondition.

title: St. Johns Pulls Together While Playing Through Grief
description: Steve Lavin, a son of an English professor, is philosophical about life and, in particular, his St. Johns mens basketball team. He searches for themes, uses analogies as often as gestures and, as his father did, takes time to find the exact words to express his thoughts.

title: Corrections: January 11, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Dreaming a Dream for a Daughter Talented in Art
description: So far, Alicia Guillns dreams have come true.

title: For Fund Investors, the Dangers of Rarefied Air
description: THE stock market ended 2013 at record highs and with indicators of investor optimism near best-ever levels. The enthusiasm is understandable after a year that was the strongest for stocks in well over a decade  but whether it is wise is another matter.

title: From Ice Level, Rick Nash Helps Rangers Take Season to New Heights
description: Coming off perhaps their most satisfying win of the season  in Chicago, over the defending Stanley Cup champions, the Blackhawks  the Rangers generated the same kind of success Friday at Madison Square Garden.

title: Guru Funds, Mimicking the Smart Money
description: SUCCESS breeds imitation, whether acknowledged or not. Now, two exchange-traded funds and a mutual fund are being open about their copying: They aim to replicate the investments of the most successful hedge funds and business people.

title: In Search of Europes Growth Stories
description: ALTHOUGH mutual and exchange-traded funds that invest in Europe recently posted strong results for the second consecutive year, the rally has largely been two-dimensional.

title: A Surprising Surge for Industrial Stocks
description: IT may come as a surprise to those who have fretted over the hollowing of American industry, but in a year of big market gains, industrial stocks were among the strongest performers.

title: In Fund Expenses, Tenths of a Point Mean a Lot
description: HOW much a fund costs to run may seem inconsequential, especially now. With the backdrop of a go big or go home stock market that frightens many small investors but can enrich those who take a chance, how could several tenths of a percentage point in operating expenses, one way or the other, really matter?

title: Making the Most of Financial Resources at Hand
description: IF improving your net worth made your list of New Years resolutions, two books  one about the personal investment ideas of John Maynard Keynes and the other from the creator of a relatively new financial website  could help.

title: In a Stellar Quarter, Three Funds That Went Over the Top
description: NEARLY every style of stock fund rose in the fourth quarter of 2013, and the Standard & Poors 500-stock index continued its long sprint, returning 9.9 percent. But the stewards of three of the top-performing mutual funds beat even that heady return, finding gains in sectors as diverse as trucking, technology and automotive paint shops.

title: In the Bond Market, Lower Expectations Became the Reality
description: BONDS lived down to expectations last year. The threat of rising interest rates, which had lurked in the ether for five years, finally materialized, pushing prices lower.

title: Before His Death, Boy Faced Weeks of Abuse, Officials Say
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio ordered an investigation on Friday into the death of a 4-year-old boy who was beaten, tortured and starved for three weeks by his caregiver, as new details of the boys horrific ordeal emerged in court.

title: In Performance: Eric Tucker
description: Eric Tucker plays the title character in Bedlam Theaters production of Shakespeares Hamlet.

title: New Clashes Erupt in Ukraine After Trial
description: At least a dozen protesters were injured in clashes with riot police in Kiev after a Ukrainian court on Friday convicted three men of plotting to topple a statue of Vladimir Lenin in 2011 in Boryspil, a city southeast of the capital. The protesters had denounced the prosecution of the three men as politically motivated and a show trial and pointed to evidence showing that the Boryspil City Council had voted to remove the Lenin statue even before the alleged plot was discovered. About 100 protesters had gathered at the courthouse in Kiev for the verdict. The clashes began after the three defendants were sentenced to six years in prison. Among the injured was Yuri V. Lutsenko, a former interior minister and an outspoken opposition leader who helped coordinate the recent mass demonstrations in central Kiev against the government of President Viktor F. Yanukovich. Local news agencies reported that Mr. Lutsenko had been knocked unconscious. Mr. Lutsenko, who was also an organizer of the 2004 Orange Revolution, is the leader of an opposition party called the Third Ukrainian Republic.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Jan. 10, 2014
Week in Pictures for Jan. 10
description: Subjects include: Cold weather, visitors to Gracie Mansion and an emergency landing in the Bronx.

title: If Couples Could Be Corporations
description: JUST before New Years, I attended a lovely wedding back in Texas, my home state. It couldnt have been nicer: The couple exchanged vows out on a ranch under a perfect sky, and the barbecue and buffalo burgers served in the barn after the ceremony were mighty tasty.

title: Retired Correction Officers Death May Have Stemmed From a Romantic Quarrel
description: In what may have been a romantic quarrel involving one former and two current New York City correction officers, a man was shot and killed early on Friday morning on a Queens street, officials said.

title: LeBron James Seethes, and Nets Are Hotter, Winning 5th in Row
description: LeBron James spent much of Friday night fuming. Almost as soon as he stepped on the court, he was jawing at the referees, shooting them incredulous glares. He slammed the ball to the floor early in the fourth quarter when his teammate Michael Beasley committed an offensive foul. He told a heckler along the baseline to sit down.

title: For Once, Every Player Makes Name for Himself
description: There was never any doubt that two of the N.B.A.s new nickname jerseys would read Big Ticket and Truth, the monikers of Kevin Garnett and Paul Pierce of the Nets, but it is doubtful that anyone in the United States would have expected Andrei Kirilenko to go with .

title: In Bridge Scandal, a Slight Heard Around the World
description: Amid the rivers of invective that Gov. Chris Christies allies spilled as they plotted to cripple traffic in Fort Lee, N.J., was one bitter drop of bile: The citys mayor was referred to as a little Serbian.

title: Whats on Saturday
description: 8 P.M. (HBO) THE PLACE BEYOND THE PINES  (2013) An itinerant motorcycle stunt rider (Ryan Gosling) tries to support a former lover (Eva Mendes, above with Mr. Gosling) and their son by robbing banks, leading to an encounter with a rookie cop (Bradley Cooper) that will have consequences neither can fathom at the time. The most radical aspect of The Place Beyond the Pines is its relentless linearity, the way it tells its story without foreshadowing or flashing back or resorting to other conventional shortcuts, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times about this three-part drama, directed by Derek Cianfrance (Blue Valentine). Watching it is refreshing and absorbing partly because it is rare for a film to show this kind of confidence in its own narrative momentum, which is also a gesture of faith in the audiences willingness to pay attention. He added, Your attention is especially rewarded by the work of Mr. Gosling and Mr. Cooper, who offer contrasting studies in tragic, shortsighted masculine intensity.

title: Cuomo Blocks Liquor License for Caterer in Upper East Side Church
description: An Upper East Side catering hall that has waged a long-running campaign for a liquor license was dealt a major setback on Friday when Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo vetoed legislation tailor-made for the hall.

title: Boy and Elderly Man Killed in Separate Traffic Accidents
description: A boy and an elderly man were struck and killed on Friday in separate traffic accidents on the Upper West Side.

title: Fire Ravages China District Said to Inspire Shangri-La
description: HONG KONG  Fire blazed through an ancient Tibetan neighborhood in southwest China on Saturday, destroying hundreds of wooden homes and shops that have drawn tourists to an area casting itself as the inspiration for mythic Shangri-La.

title: A Hammock In Kentucky?
description: National Review has an actually interesting report by Kevin Williamson on the state of Appalachia, providing a valuable portrait of the regions woes  plus an account of how people turn food stamps fungible by converting them into soda. But the piece also has a moral: the big problem, it argues, is the way government aid creates dependency. Its the Paul Ryan notion of the safety net as a hammock that makes life too easy for the poor.

title: From Todays Paper: Whale Washes Up on a Florida Beach
description: A male sperm whale, said to weigh as much as 15 tons, came ashore on Friday in Boca Raton, Fla. Wildlife officials were unsure of the cause of death and said that a necropsy would be performed. Sperm whales are considered an endangered species.

title: Ermenegildo Zegna: Fall 2014 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Ariel Sharon, Israeli Hawk Who Sought Peace on His Terms, Dies at 85
description: Ariel Sharon, one of the most influential figures in Israels history, a military commander and political leader who at the height of his power redrew the countrys electoral map, only to suffer a severe stroke from which he never recovered, died on Saturday in a hospital near Tel Aviv. He was 85.

title: Algorithm for Your Personal Rhythm
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif.  Jimmy Iovine, whose career as a recording engineer, producer and music executive stretches from John Lennon to Lady Gaga, was proudly showing off some of his hits one afternoon last month at a boutique recording studio here.

title: Consumer Preferences vs. Tax Breaks
description: In a recent column, George F. Will suggests that consumer preferences are always going to win out over big governments finger-wagging and incentives to do whatever it is liberals claim is the right thing. Prognosticating about the future of the Affordable Care Act, universal preschool and a possible minimum wage hike, he extrapolates from the auto market:

title: Sharon, Through the Years
description: As a warrior and political leader whose reputation rose and fell with the times, Ariel Sharon left a profound imprint on Israel.

title: Ariel Sharon, 1928-2014
description: A cunning general who went on to hold nearly every top Israeli government post, Mr. Sharon suffered a stroke in 2006 and fell into a coma from which he never awoke.

title: Joe on WNYCs Money Talking: January 10, 2014
description: Janet Yellen will be the first woman to head the the Federal Reserve when she takes over for Ben Bernanke at the end of January. This week on Money Talking, Joe Nocera and Rana Foroohar from Time magazine discuss the woman who will soon steer the worlds largest economy. Ms. Foroohar said Yellen will focus on how to help ordinary families get back on their feet, while Joe said Yellen is an expert on unemployment who will apply her skills to the nations stubborn unemployment problem.

title: The Raleigh Experiment
description: North Carolina is an interesting place these days, and I mean that in the worst possible way. Its a southern state, but one with a major technology complex, growing foreign investment, and what seemed until recently to be a moderating, increasingly sophisticated political culture. But then came the Republican wave of 2010, and NC was taken over by right-wing radicals, who have  among other things  taken the nations hardest line in cutting benefits to the unemployed.

title: A Last Look at the Media and the Dreaded Polar Vortex
description: I was invited to explore the feeding frenzy surrounding the dreaded polar vortex on the NPR show On The Media. The segment, Sucked Into the Polar Vortex, is fun and brief. Give a listen here (Ill add a transcript link when there is one):

title: The Chatter for Sunday, Jan. 12
description: The fines have been manageable in the context of the banks earnings capacity.

title: The Minimum Wage: Whose Burden?
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: That Thirst to Earn
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Sharing Your Wisdom, Within Limits
description: I am the C.E.O. of a technology start-up with a pretty major presence, especially in our home city. Every day I get a request for a meeting from an aspiring or early-stage entrepreneur. They all say, Can I just pick your brain? If I agreed to even a fraction of these requests, my head would become a colander. Im already seriously slammed: Were growing fast, I travel a lot and, most important, I have lots of young team members who need my time.

title: Dont Snow on His Parade
An Advantage Vanishes for Money Funds
description: When money market mutual funds were invented back in 1971, they offered something new. Investors could earn higher yields than on bank deposits, with nearly the same liquidity and safety. But that has changed. Currently, a money market deposit at Citibank pays about five times as much interest as an investment in the Fidelity Cash Reserves fund  though, in todays low-rate environment, the yields are minuscule.

title: A Market Streak Has Ended, but the Echoes Havent
description: After two improbable, gravity-defying years, the streak is over.

title: The Vicious Circle of Income Inequality
description: Almost every culture has some variation on the saying, rags to rags in three generations. Whether its clogs to clogs or rice paddy to rice paddy, the message is essentially the same: Starting with nothing, the first generation builds a successful enterprise, which its profligate offspring then manage poorly, so that by the time the grandchildren take over, little value remains.

title: Michael Gregoire, on Diversitys Importance
description: This interview with  Michael P. Gregoire, chief executive of CA Technologies, the software makers based in Islandia, N.Y., was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: Syrias Conflict Told Through a Caustic Wit
description: Raed Fares and Razan Ghazzawi are well-known Syrian activists who are wrapping up a speaking tour of North America. Ms. Ghazzawi, a prominent blogger who fled Damascus after facing government persecution and arrest, has traveled across Syria and the Middle East to raise awareness about the human cost of the Syria conflict. Mr. Fares runs an activist media center in the northern village of Kafranbel, which has gained a measure of international attention because of the witty banners and posters, many of them designed by Mr. Fares and his team, that protesters have displayed there.

title: Ariel Sharon, the Ruthless Warrior Who Could Have Made Peace
description: TEL AVIV  POLITICS, to Ariel Sharon, was like a Ferris wheel. But he didnt make do with just staying on the wheel; he did all he could to climb to the top and stay there.

title: Bailout Risk, Far Beyond the Banks
description: Everyone knows that the largest of our nations banks would be destined for a taxpayer bailout if they ran into trouble anytime soon. But which nonbank financial institutions  say, asset management companies offering hedge funds or mutual funds  might also pose too-big-to-fail risks because of their size and interconnections?

title: Light-Bulb Moments for a Nonprofit
description: No baby should die or be disabled because a light bulb cant be replaced. Yet during visits to hospitals in India and other countries, Krista Donaldson often saw lifesaving phototherapy systems, used to treat infant jaundice, languishing in dusty corners because of burned-out bulbs and other seemingly simple problems.

title: Eminent Domain: A Long Shot Against Blight
description: You cant fight city hall, the saying goes. But Gayle McLaughlin, the mayor of Richmond, Calif., a city of 100,000 souls, would tell you that fighting Wall Street is harder. Even for city hall.

title: Dolce & Gabbana: Fall 2014 Menswear
description: Milan

title: In Scandals Wake, McKinsey Seeks Culture Shift
description: Dominic Barton is 51 years old, 6 feet 4 and silver-haired, yet he has the countenance of a choirboy. Born in Uganda, he is the son of a missionary and a nurse, both Canadians. But it could be said that the society to which he really belongs is that of McKinsey & Company.

title: Panthers Out to Disprove Underdog Label in Rematch
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Captain Munnerlyn has played for the Carolina Panthers long enough to know a bad defense. Remember 2011? Their defense was ranked 28th in the N.F.L.

title: France Oil Giant Is Expected to Seek Shale Gas in Britain
description: LONDON  The French oil giant Total is on the verge of becoming the first major oil company to explore for natural gas and oil in shale rock in Britain.

title: Variety: A Physical Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  I loved this one. My inner science geek stands right beside that of Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon (see their notes below), and todays acrostic puzzle was right on my wavelength. Thats a lot funnier if youve studied physics.

title: Arbitrators Ruling Banishes the Yankees Alex Rodriguez for a Season
description: Yankees third baseman Alex Rodriguez was barred for 162 games and the 2014 postseason, the longest suspension for doping in baseball history, after an arbitrator upheld most of the punishment sought by Major League Baseball.

title: Jil Sander: Fall 2014 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Defying Japan, Rancher Saves Fukushimas Radioactive Cows
description: NAMIE, Japan  His may be one of the worlds more quixotic protests.

title: Banks Say No to Marijuana Money, Legal or Not
description: SEATTLE  In his second-floor office above a hair salon in north Seattle, Ryan Kunkel is seated on a couch placing $1,000 bricks of cash  dozens of them  in a rumpled brown paper bag. When he finishes, he stashes the money in the trunk of his BMW and sets off on an adrenalized drive downtown, darting through traffic and nervously checking to see if anyone is following him.

title: Unearthing Nuggets of Gold for NBC
description: STAMFORD, Conn.  Nothing satisfies NBCs crew of Olympic researchers more than discovering something unusual about an athlete heading to the Games. A little-known back story or a strange hobby. A name change or a shifted national affiliation. An injury or a medical condition overcome. And if an athlete is not a household name, all the better.

title: Presidential Run Likely for Egypts Top General
description: CAIRO  Egypts top military officer on Saturday offered the clearest indication yet that he sees this weeks referendum on a revised Constitution as a prelude to a bid for the presidency, moving to consolidate his power after his ouster of President Mohamed Morsi of the Muslim Brotherhood.

title: Raging Fire in Ancient Tibetan Town
description: More than 2,000 firefighters tried over 10 hours to bring a fire under control in Dukezong, an ancient Tibetan town in Chinas Yunnan Province.

title: A-Rods Suspension Reduced
description: The suspension of Alex Rodriguez of the New York Yankees was reduced from 211 to 162 games.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, Jan. 11
description: It was not Gov. Chris Christies week. The New Jersey Republican faced mounting criticism after emails and texts linked his office to lane closures on the George Washington Bridge from Fort Lee, N.J., in September. The closures were apparently retribution for the towns mayor declining to endorse Mr. Christie for re-election. In a two-hour news conference on Thursday, Mr. Christie apologized, saying he was blindsided by the news. He fired Bridget Anne Kelly, his deputy chief of staff who wrote in one email, time for some traffic problems in Fort Lee.

title: Israel and World Grapple With Sharons Mixed Legacy
description: SDEROT, Israel  When the Mark family heard the news about the death of Ariel Sharon on the radio on Saturday afternoon, they immediately turned their car around and headed to his sprawling sheep farm here in the Negev desert, where he is expected to be buried on a hill next to his wife, Lily.

title: Emma Thompson, Bryan Cranston and Other Party Minglers
description: LOS ANGELES  Im going to go tell Bryan Cranston that I worship the ground he walks on, Emma Thompson said Friday at a luncheon for the American Film Institute. She made a beeline for Mr. Cranston, there as the star of Breaking Bad, and began complimenting. That means so much coming from you, Mr. Cranston murmured, as others (Tom Hanks among them) lined up to pay tribute.

title: The Mixed Marriage
description: Lise Funderburg, a journalist, interviewed Yael Ben-Zion, a photographer raised in Israel, about her new book, Intermarried, published by Kehrer, which features families from the Washington Heights neighborhood where she lives with her French husband and 5-year-old twins.

title: For Yanks, Some Payroll Relief Now but Questions Down the Road
description: For more than two years, the Yankees have considered Alex Rodriguezs record-setting contract a burden, a mistake and a hindrance to their planning. With so much money invested in a rapidly declining player, Rodriguezs presence was a reminder of the teams financial folly.

title: Thunder Road
description: WASHINGTON  I HAVE learned two things covering politics.

title: How Can We Help Men? By Helping Women
description: THIS week Maria Shriver brings together a star-studded cast of celebrities, from Hillary Rodham Clinton to Beyonc, to call attention to the economic plight of American women and demand that womens needs be put at the center of policy making.

title: A Longer Life for the Space Station
description: The Obama administrations decision to extend the international space stations time in orbit by at least four years makes good sense. Some $100 billion has been invested to build the station, which was completed less than three years ago. The plan had been to allow the station to plunge into the ocean in 2020.

title: Protect the Presidents Appointments
description: Under the Constitution, the president nominates federal judges, cabinet members and officials for executive agencies, and the Senate votes on their confirmation. But what if the Senate isnt in session? The answer has always seemed clear: The Constitution gives the president the power to fill all vacancies that may happen during the recess of the Senate.

title: The Times, From the Top: Looking Ahead
description: THESE days, when Jill Abramson surveys the papers masthead, she does so with a certain amount of satisfaction. Half of the 10 top-ranking editors in the newsroom, including herself, are women. Thats a long way from a time when women had no presence on the Times masthead; the first on the news side was Carolyn Lee, in 1990 (though Charlotte Curtis preceded her, as an opinion editor, in 1974).

title: End the Corporate Tax?
description: Readers respond to an Op-Ed essay that said abolition of the tax would benefit workers.

title: The Civil Rights of Children
description: Most school officials try to apply disciplinary policies fairly and in compliance with federal laws that forbid racial discrimination. Even so, a large and troubling body of data  some if it gathered by the federal government  shows that black and Hispanic students are disproportionately and unjustifiably subjected to suspension, expulsion or even arrest for nonviolent offenses that should be dealt with in the principals office.

title: Anthony Mandler
description: Anthony Mandler is a film director and photographer probably best known for the noir music videos he has created for pop artists such as Rihanna, Jay-Z, Beyonc, Eminem and Lana Del Rey.

title: The War on Women
description: THE year is new, but we already have a candidate for the most troubling magazine essay of 2014: Amanda Hess on Why Women Arent Welcome on the Internet, in the latest issue of Pacific Standard.

title: If I Had a Hammer
description: MY favorite story in Erik Brynjolfsson and Andrew McAfees fascinating new book, The Second Machine Age, is when the Dutch chess grandmaster Jan Hein Donner was asked how hed prepare for a chess match against a computer, like I.B.M.s Deep Blue. Donner replied: I would bring a hammer.

title: The I in Christies Storm
description: POLITICS boils down to three pronouns: I, you, we. The politician who has them in balance goes a long way.

title: Goodnight. Sleep Clean.
description: SLEEP seems like a perfectly fine waste of time. Why would our bodies evolve to spend close to one-third of our lives completely out of it, when we could instead be doing something useful or exciting? Something that would, as an added bonus, be less likely to get us killed back when we were sleeping on the savanna?

title: A Week of Victories for Cold Weather and Al Qaeda
description: The first full week of the new year dutifully served up some of the themes likely to command attention in 2014.

title: In This Rape Case, the Victim Was 4
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  SHES a 4-year-old girl named Ida, fragile and shy, and when she was raped by a neighbor boy in September, her family tried to have the attacker arrested.

title: When a Food Writer Cant Taste
description: ON that early spring day in San Francisco, I walked out to buy local treats for my birthday party  country bread (sour, with walnuts) from Tartine bakery, tamales from the lady in front of my favorite produce shop, salted caramel ice cream from Bi-Rite and a tub of peanut curry ice cream from Humphry Slocombes.

title: I Crashed the Wrong Shiva
description: YOU get to know all the old people. This is what no one tells you when you live in New York City and decide to work from home, but its true. One generations off-peak hours is anothers hours. There they are, walking their rickety dogs at 10, doing their laundry at noon, checking their mail at 3, asking you if you know how to operate a VCR machine at 6.

title: Matriarchs Duel for Power Threatens to Tilt Bangladesh Off Balance
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh   Two ladies eyed each other from their elegant residences in Dhaka, the Bangladeshi capital, last week, each waiting to see whether the other would blink.

title: Sexual Violence and Impunity, from Kenya to America
description: My Sunday column is from Nairobi, Kenya, about how police corruption and indifference create impunity that allows sexual violence to unchecked. This is a global problem, particularly in poor countries with dubious criminal justice systems but also of course in the United States. As youll see, I argue that we have to change attitudes but above all we have to end the impunity. The organization that I followed in Kenya, Shining Hope for Communities, is doing a terrific job trying to do just that.

title: Chargers Rivers Wears Country Roots on Sleeve and Around His Neck
description: SAN DIEGO  Gone are the days when a quarterback would stand at his locker after a game, freshly showered with a wet head or sweat soaked, grass stained and half undressed, and answer questions from reporters who crowded around. That ritual is now the domain of the proletariat  linemen, linebackers and the like.

title: Cruel Bargain for A-Rod and Boys With Baseball Dreams
description: Before Alex Rodriguez was A-Rod, long before he became a symbol of all thats wrong with baseball, he was simply Alex, a skinny little 8-year-old with dreams of being a pro ballplayer like his father.

title: Heat Are Fine With Learning From Losses
description: The Miami Heat arrived in New York last week in the midst of another marauding march through the regular season. They limped away with a training room full of banged-up players after losses on consecutive nights to the Knicks and the Nets.

title: Tough Suspensions in Sports Dont Always Stick
description: Through the decades, suspensions in sports have come in all sizes and for offenses that include attacking a coach and protesting a war. Often assumed to be career-enders, suspensions have often been shortened or vacated, allowing players to resume doing what they do best, which is to compete on a field, a court or a rink.

title: With N.F.L. Concussion Deal, Two Tiers of Payouts
description: Court settlements are by nature compromises, and compromises are often messy. The proposed settlement of the lawsuits brought by more than 4,500 former N.F.L. players who contended that the league hid from them the dangers of concussions is no exception.

title: Milan Fashion Week: Ermenegildo Zegna Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Sarah Aubel.

title: Setting a Hockey Teams Direction Left and Right
description: Kurt Kehl has an unusual memory. Name just about any N.H.L. player in the last 40 years or so, and Kehl knows whether he shot from the left side or the right side.

title: After Losing Gasol, Grizzlies Find Talent On the Bench
description: Marc Gasol, the Memphis Grizzlies starting center, is one of a number of high-profile N.B.A. stars who have missed a large chunk of this season because of an injury. But in the absence of Gasol, the Grizzlies discovered talent sitting on their bench.

title: Rodriguez Barred From Baseball, but Not From the Public Eye
description: Alex Rodriguez is not going away. An arbitrator has decided that Rodriguez cannot play in 2014, not in the regular season or the postseason, but we will see him again. Rodriguez will make sure of it.

title: Panel Blocks Gas Pipeline in New Jersey Pinelands
description: The New Jersey agency charged with protecting the Pinelands, a vast and fragile expanse of sand pines, gnarled oaks and river deltas, narrowly defeated a proposal on Friday to run a 22-mile natural gas pipeline through it.

title: The 1890 Book I Had to Have
description: Four years ago, while browsing in Second Story Books in Washington, D.C., I noticed a plain clothbound volume among the fine leather-bound tomes locked in a glass case. I had no business looking at any rare books, but that did not stop me from asking if I might see it. A moment later I was holding a copy of How the Other Half Lives, the 1890 classic on the squalor of New Yorks tenements that pricked a nations conscience and became a template for generations of investigative reporters like myself.

title: U.S. Figure Skating Team Awaits Difficult Winnowing
description: BOSTON  Two hours before her long program on Saturday night, Polina Edmunds, 15, took a peek from backstage at the United States figure skating championships. This was her first competition at the senior level. Rarely, if ever, had she skated before an audience this large, with the stakes so high.

title: Skatings New Scoring System Adds to Challenge for American Men
description: BOSTON  As the sun set on the cavernous convention center Friday, five boyish-looking ice skaters laced up their footwear and took turns leaping, gliding and spinning their nerves away, making a chorus of satisfying crunches of skate blades on a fresh sheet of ice.

title: Tennis Tries to Find Balance on Doping
description: Criticized in the past for not being tough enough, tenniss antidoping program faced criticism in 2013 that it was too harsh as two prominent players, Viktor Troicki and Marin Cilic, received suspensions that were reduced on appeal.

title: Milan Fashion Week: Jil Sander Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Kevin Tachman.

title: Taking the Battle to the States
description: A look at the party splits in the states on different issues.

title: A National Strategy Funds State Political Monopolies
description: By his third year as chairman of the Alabama Republican organization, Mike Hubbard believed his party had just about everything it needed to win control of the State Legislature.

title: Six Who Could Challenge the Usual Suspects
description: These six players could challenge the more familiar names at the Australian Open.

title: Versace: Fall 2014 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Its Only A Game
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  Well, that was A-one. I really enjoyed this puzzle by Andrew Chaikin, not just for the great fill and clever theme, but for the fabulous, cryptic-sounding clues that were not actually written to be cryptic. When I eventually realized what was going on.

title: Alex Rodriguezs Statement
description: Alex Rodriguez issued the following statement in response to the arbitrators decision to suspend him for 162 games.

title: This Time, Smith Avoids Sideshow and Just Puts On a Show
description: PHILADELPHIA  The benching of J. R. Smith lasted 12 minutes into its second game. Knicks Coach Mike Woodson could not restrain the capricious and impulsive Smith any longer than that.

title: Harvard-Yale Rivalry Echoes Through the Garden
description: The first Harvard-Yale hockey game was played in 1900 at St. Nicholas Rink off Columbus Avenue in Manhattan. It was so long ago that when the Elis won, 5-4, their fans celebrated with the Yale frog cheer, based on a passage from Aristophanes. Brek-ek-ek-ex, it began, mimicking the chorus of frogs on the banks of the River Styx.

title: Seeking Nuclear-Power Workers of Tomorrow
description: PALACIOS  At first glance, the large, framed photo hanging on a wall at the states largest nuclear power plant seems to tell a simple story. About 200 smiling men and women stand in block formation behind a long-stretching banner  shades of a high school class portrait, though one posed in front of the domes of two nuclear reactors.

title: Milan Fashion Week: Dolce & Gabbana Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: Bloggers Incarceration Raises First Amendment Questions
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala.  For over six years, Roger Shuler has hounded figures of the state legal and political establishment on his blog, Legal Schnauzer, a hothouse of furious but often fuzzily sourced allegations of deep corruption and wide-ranging conspiracy. Some of these allegations he has tested in court, having sued his neighbor, his neighbors lawyer, his former employer, the Police Department, the Sheriffs Department, the Alabama State Bar and two county circuit judges, among others. Mostly, he has lost.

title: In Scandal, Turkeys Leaders May Be Losing Their Tight Grip on News Media
description: ISTANBUL  Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan has labeled an investigative reporter who has published a number of leaked documents related to a widening corruption scandal a traitor. Mr. Erdogans lawyers have also filed suit against a newspaper columnist, once a reliable supporter of the prime minister, for his critical Twitter messages.

title: Kiss and Tell: Gene Simmons and Paul Stanley Talk Shop
description: Even if you like the rock band Kiss, and the bratty superhero antics of its founders, Gene Simmons and Paul Stanley, their appearance at the end of John Varvatoss show in Milan qualified as a cringe moment. With models standing around them, the rock legends fist-pumped the air  Mr. Simmons stuck his tongue out, of course  and Mr. Varvatos looked pleased to be with his new mates. His clothes this season have a sleek toughness, with scaly metallic finishes and feathered fabrics that made you think of animals. Maybe thats a link to Kiss. Still, the groups presence seemed out of context, like someone photo-bombing your wedding pictures. Well, someone with clown makeup and a cherry-red tongue.

title: Keeping Public Buildings Free of Guns Proves Too Costly for Kansas Towns
description: WICHITA, Kan.  Reasoning that more guns mean greater safety, Kansas lawmakers voted last year to require cities and counties to make public buildings accessible to people legally carrying concealed weapons.

title: A Cheerleader for Others, Virginia Governor Stands on His Own
description: RICHMOND, Va.  Bill and Hillary Rodham Clinton toasted Terry McAuliffe, the incoming governor of Virginia, at a private dinner here Friday evening. Then they walked with him through the State Capitol on Saturday morning on the way to his inauguration and sat on the rain-soaked steps outside, smiling broadly under an umbrella as he took the oath not long after noon.

title: Prepared for Seattles Noise, the Saints Cant Overcome Seattles Players
description: SEATTLE  For their return to that caldron of cacophony called CenturyLink Field, the New Orleans Saints reconstructed the stadiums atmosphere. Tried to, rather.

title: Water Ban Continues
description: Residents in Charleston, West Virginia, and nearby communities have been warned to stay away from tap water for drinking and washing.

title: 9-Year-Old Killed by Taxi Was Spirited and Wise
description: A 9-year-old boy who was one of two people struck and killed by separate vehicles on the Upper West Side on Friday night was described by his family on Saturday as a spirited third grader with a fanatical devotion to the New York Knicks.

title: Wait Continues for Safe Tap Water in West Virginia
description: CHARLESTON, W.Va.  As hundreds of thousands of residents faced a third day without water because of a chemical spill in a local river, a water company executive said on Saturday that it could be days before it was safe for them to drink tap water again.

title: Staying Drug-Free, and Providing for His Son the Right Way
description: It has taken a while, but Justen Henderson, 25, has learned from his mistakes.

title: Villanova Rediscovers 3-Point Touch, and St. Johns Loses Way
description: Eighth-ranked Villanova found the separation it needed to avoid an upset against St. Johns in the final six and a half minutes of a 74-67 victory Saturday at Madison Square Garden.

title: Rising Tide Is a Mystery That Sinks Island Hopes
description: LAGO ENRIQUILLO, Dominican Republic  Steadily, mysteriously, like in an especially slow science fiction movie, the largest lake in the Caribbean has been rising and rising, devouring tens of thousands of acres of farmland, ranches and whatever else stands in its way.

title: Delay in Plan to Drug Screen Applicants for Unemployment Aid
description: Texans applying for unemployment benefits will be subject to a new drug screening procedure in a program scheduled to take effect Feb. 1. But the Texas Workforce Commission said it would not be able to start the program on the states timetable because the United States Labor Department had not set the required parameters.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Jan. 11, 2014
Another Academic Group Considers Israel Censure
description: CHICAGO  A movement to pressure and isolate Israel gained further ground among American academics on Saturday, when the Modern Language Association took a step toward approving a resolution calling on the State Department to contest what it characterized as Israels discriminatory denials of entry to American scholars seeking to visit the West Bank to work at Palestinian universities.

title: A Coarse Pleasure in Stories of Impostors
description: In 1985, when the novelist and playwright James Magnuson first accepted a job teaching creative writing at the University of Texas at Austin, he harbored a fair amount of skepticism toward the academic world. In the past, he had taken what he called an outsiders pride in being able to support himself as a writer without having to teach. He wondered too if both the teachers and the students in creative writing programs were prone to taking themselves too seriously.

title: Goalie Gets Back on His Game in a Town Full of Tough Critics
description: Over the last two decades, playing in Philadelphia has been a nightmare for Flyers goalies.

title: Predicting the Future in 13 Races
description: Ross Ramsey, the executive editor of The Texas Tribune, writes a regular column for The Tribune.

title: Violence Replaces Rejoicing After Central African Leaders Resign
description: BANGUI, Central African Republic  Sporadic looting, gunfire and a handful of deadly clashes, including some with French soldiers, took the place of celebrations here after the forced resignation of President Michel Djotodia and Prime Minister Nicolas Tiangaye on Friday.

title: 2 Far-Right Greek Lawmakers Are Accused of Criminal Activity
description: ATHENS  Two lawmakers from Greeces far-right party, Golden Dawn, were ordered to be taken into custody late on Saturday on charges of joining and directing a criminal organization. The decision was part of a government crackdown on the party, which has been condemned by European authorities as neo-Nazi and violent.

title: Record-Setting Night for a Patriot (Not Brady) Eliminates the Colts
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  The shootout between Tom Brady and Andrew Luck in Saturday nights divisional playoff game was a riveting duel for three quarters. It had everything a postseason game should have, with Luck cast as the resolute heir apparent who played brilliantly as he tried to knock off Brady, the Patriots longtime king of playoff excellence.

title: Judy Protas, Writer of Slogan for Levys Real Jewish Rye, Dies at 91
description: You dont have to be Jewish to write an ad for rye bread that has endured in public memory for more than half a century, but in Judy Protass case it certainly didnt hurt.

title: GMC Canyon Is a Midsize Striver
description: DETROIT  General Motors introduced its step-up entry in the midsize pickup market on Sunday, a day ahead of the opening of press previews for the Detroit auto show. The 2015 GMC Canyon takes its place in the G.M. lineup just a bit upstream of the 2015 Chevrolet Colorado, which was introduced at the Los Angeles auto show in November.

title: Indonesia Announces Export Ban on Raw Ore
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Indonesia, one of the worlds biggest producers of minerals including gold, nickel, copper, tin and thermal coal, implemented a new law Sunday banning the export of unprocessed ore.

title: Aliisa Rosenthal and Samuel Hodges
description: Aliisa Rachel Rosenthal and Samuel Hazen Hodges were married Saturday evening at Antoines Restaurant in New Orleans. Dana F. Worth, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Eve Rudin, Elliott Kleinman
description: Rabbi Eve Sandra Rudin and Rabbi Elliott Adam Kleinman are to be married Sunday at the Woodlands Community Temple in White Plains. Rabbi David Ellenson is to perform the ceremony.

title: A Surprise for the Holidays
description: Dr. Rebecca Jacqueline Aspden and Larry Demetrious Waddell are to be married Sunday at the Hay-Adams Hotel in Washington. The Rev. Michael W. Caine, a minister of the United Church of Christ, is to officiate.

title: Meredith Small and Scott Wallace
description: Meredith Ashley Small, a daughter of Neal C. Small and Cherie L. Small of Dallas, was married Saturday at her parents vacation home in Victor, Idaho, to Scott Trevor Wallace, a son of Leneta J. Wallace of Sherman, Tex., and the late Don Wallace. Justin A. Small, the brother of the bride, who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Rachel Hilzinger, Ross Monten
description: Rachel Colleen Hilzinger and Ensign Ross Alan Monten were married Saturday afternoon at Trinity Episcopal Church in Santa Barbara, Calif. The Rev. Mark E. Asman, the rector of the church, performed the ceremony.

title: Lauren Baer and Emily Meyers
description: Lauren Elizabeth Baer and Emily Margalit Meyers were married in New York Saturday evening by Rabbi Bruce S. Warshal, with Cantor Lori Corrsin taking part. The ceremony was held at Temple Emanu-El, where Ms. Baers paternal great-granduncle, the late Dr. Julius Mark, was the senior rabbi from 1948 to 1977.

title: Adrianna Giuliani and Jim Bevilaqua
description: Adrianna Lara Giuliani and Jim Joseph Bevilaqua were married Saturday at the Bowery Hotel in New York. The Rev. Alma Daniel, an interfaith minister, performed the nondenominational ceremony.

title: Nina Vertlib and Jared Eisenberg
description: Nina Vertlib, the daughter of Marina and Alexander Vertlib of Walnut Creek, Calif., was married Saturday evening to Jared Eli Eisenberg, a son of Andrea and Mark Eisenberg of Dorchester, Mass. Nicole Berne, a friend of the couple who received a one-day solemnization certificate from Massachusetts, officiated at the Melville Park Bed & Breakfast in Dorchester, which is owned by the grooms parents.

title: Caroline Shnay, Samuel Goldberg
description: Caroline Fay Shnay and Samuel Hankin Goldberg were married Saturday evening at the Plaza in New York. Rabbi Dovi Scheiner officiated.

title: Alexandra Parsons and Mark Andrews IV
description: Alexandra Geddes Parsons, a daughter of Kathryn M. Parsons and J. Geddes Parsons of Hobe Sound, Fla., was married Saturday evening to Mark Edwin Andrews IV, the son of Elizabeth Quay Andrews and Mr. Andrews III of New York. The Rev. Matthew Heyd, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of the Heavenly Rest in New York, where he is the rector.

title: For TV Fans, Cramming In Sundays Best
description: Pity the DVR, destined to be overworked on Sunday night.

title: New York Times Hires Bloomberg Reporter in China Controversy
description: A Bloomberg News reporter who recently left the news organization over a controversy involving an unpublished article from China has joined The New York Times.

title: The Glow Stick Fiasco
description: Elliott Klienman had a grand vision involving thousands of glow sticks. Eve Rudin messed it up.

title: Playing Second Fiddle for a Chance at First Place
description: Serving as a champions second can pay off for players seeking to improve their own games.

title: For Financier, a Final Try to Avoid U.S. Charges
description: A lawyer for Florian Homm, a German financier wanted by United States authorities, says he will appeal to the Italian Ministry of Justice in a last-ditch attempt to prevent the former hedge fund manager from being extradited to Los Angeles to face charges of securities fraud.

title: Teenager Arrested and Charged in Killing of 16-Year-Old in Brooklyn
description: A teenager was arrested on Saturday in the fatal shooting earlier this month of a 16-year-old boy who was heading home from a birthday party in the Brownsville section of Brooklyn.

title: Corrections: January 12, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: After Surgery, Murray Lowers His Sights
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  For years, Andy Murrays right hand shot so frequently to his back after arduous or even routine points that it sometimes seemed permanently attached. Murray looked, at times, like an old man, or at least a man far older than 26.

title: Bottega Veneta: Fall 2014 Menswear
description: Milan

title: When Divorce Magnifies Adoptions Losses
description: Last summer, en route to pick up my youngest daughter from a weeklong sleepaway camp in Connecticut designed specifically for adopted children, I was half-certain I would find her wailing about having been miserable, friendless and infected with Lymes disease. Would she run into my arms and dissolve into tears? This was her first time alone and away from home. That she might have enjoyed herself, made friends and been tick-free seemed like too much to wish for.

title: Milan Fashion Week: Versace Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Filippo Mutani.

title: Salvatore Ferragamo: Fall 2014 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Whats on Sunday
description: 8 P.M. (NBC) THE 71ST ANNUAL GOLDEN GLOBE AWARDS Tina Fey and Amy Poehler (above right, with Ms. Fey) host these awards  often considered predictors of the Oscars  sponsored by the Hollywood Foreign Press Association and broadcast live. In the motion picture drama division, the nominees are 12 Years a Slave, Captain Phillips, Gravity, Philomena and Rush, for best picture; Cate Blanchett, Sandra Bullock, Judi Dench, Emma Thompson and Kate Winslet, for best actress; and Chiwetel Ejiofor, Idris Elba, Tom Hanks, Matthew McConaughey and Robert Redford, for best actor. In the comedy or musical division, the nominees are American Hustle, Her, Inside Llewyn Davis, Nebraska and The Wolf of Wall Street, for best picture; Amy Adams, Julie Delpy, Greta Gerwig, Julia Louis-Dreyfus and Meryl Streep, for best actress; and Christian Bale, Bruce Dern, Leonardo DiCaprio, Oscar Isaac and Joaquin Phoenix, for best actor. Woody Allen will receive the Cecil B. DeMille Award, although he is not expected to attend. Awards will also be handed out for television work. A countdown to the ceremony begins at 4 on E!, which moves to red carpet coverage at 6. NBC will report on arrivals, starting at 7. And E! will visit after-parties at 11.

title: What to Look for on the Globes Red Carpet
description: This much is clear about this years Golden Globes. Whether Lupita Nyongo wins the award for best supporting actress at Sunday nights ceremonies (an award for which she is the heavy favorite) or not, the young Kenyan actress will stride the red carpet beforehand as a bona fide star of the fashion world.

title: Milan Fashion Week: Neil Barrett Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Sarah Aubel.

title: Golden Globes Predictions (and Hopes)
description: LOS ANGELES  The Golden Globes are mostly an excuse to drink, laugh and sing off-key along with the hosts Tina Fey and Amy Poehler. But the awards also serve as a warm-up to creaming your officemates in your Oscar pool.

title: In Our Pages: January 13
description: 1939: Father Kills Son To End Lifetime Suffering

title: Disruptions: At CES, a Big Stage for Big Dreams but Fewer Surprises
description: LAS VEGAS  Marissa Mayer and 50 Cent. Budgee the robot and Parrot the drone. Smartwatches and curving TVs, all sprinkled with Hollywood stardust.

title: Hungry? Buy This Billboard
description: Eric Justusson, a software engineer, was walking to work from Brooklyn across the Manhattan Bridge when he first saw the enigmatic billboard, the words Easy As in gigantic letters followed by a 12-foot-high picture of a slice of pie. For BJ Gruber, an actor who lives in Astoria, Queens, it was the words Cool As A, followed by a photo of a cucumber slice that he spotted while driving on the Brooklyn Queens Expressway. Soledad Tejada, a high school student from Brooklyn, noticed one with The Big and a tremendous hunk of cheese in her home borough.

title: Live Stream | Pradas Fall 2014 Collection at Milan Fashion Week
description: The latest mens collection from Prada at Milan fashion week.

title: Antigovernment Protesters Try to Shut Down Bangkok
description: BANGKOK  Antigovernment protesters seeking to block next months elections in Thailand seized control of major roads in Bangkok on Monday as they began their campaign to shut down the city.

title: Lone Survivor a Surprise Hit at Box Office
description: Moviegoers have stubbornly refused to care about war movies set in Afghanistan, contributing to modest prerelease expectations for Peter Bergs Lone Survivor. But ticket buyers, especially those in heartland states, surprised Hollywood over the weekend and powered Lone Survivor (Universal Pictures) to an estimated $38.9 million in sales, roughly double the total that most analysts expected and easily enough for first place at the North American box office.

title: As Usual, Patriots Find Talent Where Others Fear to Tread
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  The bearded Julian Edelman wore a flat cap and a trench coat, standing at his dressing stall, when the four-touchdown man of the late-night hour, LeGarrette Blount, walked by, still in his game jersey, No. 29.

title: Negotiators Put Final Touches on Iran Accord
description: PARIS  Iran and a group of six world powers completed a deal on Sunday that will temporarily freeze much of Tehrans nuclear program starting next Monday, Jan. 20, in exchange for limited relief from Western economic sanctions.

title: Milan Fashion Week: John Varvatos Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Kevin Tachman.

title: Praise and Criticism as Sharons Body Lies in State
description: JERUSALEM  In life, former Prime Minister Ariel Sharon was a polarizing figure, particularly after his turnabout from a builder of Jewish settlements to a man who forced their evacuation.

title: Charlize Therons Influence, Anderson Coopers Help
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif.  Even to the most hedonistic Hollywood player, the party onslaught leading up the Golden Globes can seem a little, you know, excessive. Enter the Help Haiti Home benefit, now in its third year, which donated money to the J/P Haitian Relief Organization, as well as to typhoon relief efforts in the Philippines.

title: Wagner on U.S. Team as Officials Choose Reputation Over Result
description: BOSTON  Her free skate was not yet complete, but Gracie Gold, 18, landed a double axel and smiled and pumped her fists.

title: A Busy Doctors Right Hand, Ever Ready to Type
description: DALLAS  Amid the controlled chaos that defines an average afternoon in an urban emergency department, Dr. Marian Bednar, an emergency room physician at Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital Dallas, entered the exam room of an older woman who had fallen while walking her dog. Like any doctor, she asked questions, conducted an exam and gave a diagnosis  in this case, a fractured hand  while also doing something many physicians in todays computerized world are no longer free to do: She gave the patient her full attention.

title: The Anti-Scientific Revolution in Macroeconomics
description: Well, now Im in Dublin to receive the James Joyce Award; life is interesting, although it does tend to get in the way of blogging.

title: Christies Potential 2016 Rivals Tread Carefully
description: Gov. Chris Christies potential rivals for the White House in 2016 stepped gingerly around the scandal involving road closures and political retribution in New Jersey, saying on Sunday that they were waiting for more details to come out.

title: Senior Libyan Official Assassinated, First Since Qaddafi Era
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  A Libyan deputy cabinet minister was killed by gunmen on Saturday evening in the first assassination of a senior government figure in the country since the ouster of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi more than two years ago.

title: Prada: Fall 2014 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Milan Fashion Week: Bottega Veneta Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Filippo Mutani.

title: In Alex Rodriguez Decision, the Devil Is in a Lack of Detail
description: Since early August, The Wolf of East 161st Street has been playing in the Bronx and theaters everywhere, with Alex Rodriguez as the star.

title: Francis Looks to the Developing World in Appointing New Cardinals
description: ROME  Pope Francis continued reshaping the hierarchy of the Roman Catholic Church on Sunday by appointing his first group of cardinals with an emphasis on Asia, Africa and Latin America, even as he also made omissions that signal his distaste for the traditional clerical career ladder.

title: Q. & A.: Wu Wei Reflects on Reform, Now and in the 1980s
description: Wu Wei is a former Chinese official who in the 1980s was heavily involved in developing the Communist Party chief Zhao Ziyangs plans for measured political reform. Mr. Wu also served as a secretary to Bao Tong, the senior aide to Mr. Zhao. Those reforms collapsed in 1989, when the party patriarch, Deng Xiaoping, turned against Mr. Zhao and ordered troops to suppress student protests based in Tiananmen Square in Beijing. Mr. Wu was detained and investigated after the June 4, 1989, crackdown, and later went into publishing and business. He has remained a close observer of Chinese politics, and last year his book On Stage and Backstage: Chinas Political Reform in the 1980s was published in Hong Kong.

title: 1924: Thaw Sets in at Chamonix, Keeping Olympic Skaters Off Ice
Spanish Opera House to Lose Crumbling Facade by Star Architect
description: MADRID  In the latest development in the ongoing travails of Santiago Calatrava, the Spanish architect, construction workers are due to start removing the crumbling mosaic facade of Valencias opera house on Monday.

title: In Tight Game, 49ers Experience Conquers Panthers Exuberance
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  In many ways, the Carolina Panthers and the San Francisco 49ers were mirror images of each other during the regular season, so it was fitting that the two teams shadowed each other for most of their divisional playoff game Sunday.

title: Milan Fashion Week: Missoni Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Filippo Mutani.

title: Visa Trims Slogan to Expand Meaning
description: IN a world where time-pressed people type u 2 for you too; say because to introduce a noun or adjective rather than a full clause, as in because doughnuts; and use abbreviations like ftw (for the win), marketing and media phrases are also increasingly being compressed. For instance, commercials for Alka-Seltzer Plus keep the words Oh, what a relief it is from their vintage predecessors while eliminating the Plop, plop, fizz, fizz. The sequels to The Fast and the Furious go by titles like Fast & Furious 6. And Masterpiece Theater on PBS is now Masterpiece.

title: 12 Years a Slave, American Hustle Take Top Honors at the 2014 Golden Globes
description: Dave Itzkoff and Jon Caramanica live-blogged the 71st annual Golden Globes on Sunday night, with contributions from Melena Ryzik and others.

title: A Family Drama, and a Balancing Act
description: Peter Paige gets just a tiny bit agitated when asked about the amount of sex on his television show The Fosters. Were dealing with two women who are raising five kids! he exclaims. Sometimes they can sneak away. But mostly they need to make lunches or monitor homework or drive someone to a piano lesson. Who has the time?

title: If the Fur Doesnt Drive You Crazy, the Virus Will
description: Syfy has been trying to step up its game lately, and two new shows make respectable additions to its lineup, even if they do work tried-and-true subject matter.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Jan. 13
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Not Just Another Ex-Con Hoping for Hip-Hop Glory
description: Animation is best suited for what might not be believable, even if seen. And our era of extreme progressivism notwithstanding, the idea of a gay white hip-hop thug still remains, for many, the stuff of fantasy.

title: Now You See the Motorcycle, Now You Dont
description: Some skills arent particularly television friendly, and magic, especially the small-scale kind like the card trick, is one of them. If youre not witnessing it live at fairly close range, you have to take it on faith that something magical happened, and that no camera manipulation was involved.

title: Economic Reports for the Week of Jan. 13
description: BANK EARNINGS JPMorgan Chase and Wells Fargo, set to report fourth-quarter results on Tuesday, will kick off a flurry of bank earnings. The banking giants, analysts say, will most likely face sluggish demand from borrowers whose appetite for refinancing has been sapped by rising rates. For JPMorgan Chase, the nations largest bank, the quarterly report comes after a string of costly government settlements, prompting analysts to predict that high legal costs could hamper profit. All told, JPMorgan will have paid some $20 billion to resolve government investigations in the last 12 months alone.

title: Talking About Their (Iron-Fisted) Generation
description: Among indicators of an actors commitment, heres an impressive one: sticks with a production despite a parent refusing contact as a result. Such (spoiler alert) has been the consequence for Viviana Hernndez in El Ao en Que Nac (The Year I Was Born), a play by the Argentine director Lola Arias playing at La MaMa as part of the Public Theaters Under the Radar Festival. It makes sense that Ms. Hernndez would stay; she is, after all, telling the story of her life in this production, in which nine Chileans, born between 1976 and 1984, knit together a history both sweeping and deeply intimate.

title: A Personal Revolution Is Set Amid an Epic One
description: Deborah Samson is 22 and free of indenture, but addicted to adventure. She has left the church, and yet she is a believer of sorts, in independence for the American colonies and for herself. She recoils at orders to serve at table, and yet she yearns to serve in arms.

title: Playing Composer, of Course, to Impress
description: At a time when opportunities for gifted emerging opera composers blazing all manner of new stylistic trails appear to be proliferating, theres something to be said for a company willing to go to bat for fresh pieces by veteran creators working in conventional modes. Not long ago, that company likely would have been the Dicapo Opera, which performed an estimable service in championing composers like Thomas Pasatieri, Tobias Picker and Conrad Susa.

title: In Baraka, Inspiration Came With Provocation
description: Im not the right age for Amiri Baraka, not exactly. Or rather: Im not the right age to have seen his changes as they happened. Mr. Baraka, who died last week at 79, passed through so many different phases, from middle-class kid in Newark to aspiring Beat poet to founder of the Black Arts movement to leftist activist to academic. For me, he arrived as an author looking back, already armed with his own self-reflection: He published his memoir, The Autobiography of LeRoi Jones, in 1984, when I was in high school, though the book didnt make its way into my hands or my brain until a few years after that.

title: Actors Jam Meeting to Seek Higher Pay for Tours
description: More than 350 Actors Equity members packed a union hall and overflow room on Friday to demonstrate visibly their concern about lower salaries for musical theater performers on national tours, a source of intensifying frustration that has led Equity leaders to schedule a town hall meeting with members on Jan. 27.

title: Networker
description: Twenty years ago, my wife and I bought a weekend house in the town of Garrison, N.Y., in the lower Hudson Valley. We love the place for its scenic beauty, its peace and quiet, and its old-fashioned sense of community. For us, its a refuge from the pace of city life, a place with an easygoing mix of lifestyles and a widely shared ethos about preserving what makes it special.

title: Everybody
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  One of the things I like most about solving crossword puzzles is that its an ALL-inclusive pastime. Anyone can do it, if they are so inclined. And today, Lynn Lempel starts our solving week by inviting ONE AND ALL to solve her puzzle.

title: With a Happy Refrain: MGMs Magic Era
description: Why is it that with few exceptions visionary film producers go largely unrecognized by the public while directors and movie stars become legends? That question informed Going Hollywood: MGM Musicals, the ebullient season-opening program of the 92nd Street Ys Lyrics & Lyricists series on Saturday night, hosted by the director and choreographer Kathleen Marshall.

title: Forget the Domestic. Try the Imported. Its Less Fizzy.
description: The narrowed cat eyes that suddenly widen into a maniacal blue-eyed stare, the pleated platinum hair of a 40s femme fatale, the deployment of a voice that can rise to a furious yowl by an imperious diva sheathed in black satin: No expressionistic detail was overlooked in Ute Lempers new show, a kind of best-of concert, which began a run at 54 Below on Wednesday evening.

title: A Victim Becomes Triumphant
description: Thumbprint, an earnest new chamber opera, has going for it an inspiring true story. The work, which had its premiere on Friday at the Baruch Performing Arts Center as part of the festival Prototype: Opera/Theater/Now, is about Mukhtar Mai, a Pakistani woman who was gang-raped in 2002 as payback for an honor crime allegedly committed by her brother. While custom called for rape victims to kill themselves to avoid dishonor, Ms. Mukhtar spoke out, bringing her assailants to justice. She went on to become a human-rights activist, opening schools and running an ambulance service and a womens aid group in her village.

title: Editorial Cartoon
description: Dennis Rodman helps Kim Jong-un score propaganda points.

title: Denver Art Museum Gets Impressionist Trove
