description: The Denver Art Museum is announcing Monday that it has received the largest gift of paintings in its history, a group of 22 Impressionist works  by artists including van Gogh, Monet, Czanne, Manet and Renoir  from the collection of Frederic C. Hamilton, an oil and gas magnate who has been the museums chief benefactor for several decades. The works include van Goghs 1887 Edge of a Wheat Field With Poppies, which will be the first van Gogh in the museums collection. Besides European works the donation includes pieces by major American Impressionists like Childe Hassam and William Merritt Chase. The gift has forever changed the museums ability to deliver world-class exhibitions and programs, said Christoph Heinrich, the museums director, and it transforms Denvers holdings of Impressionism into one of the most important in the Western states. The paintings, mostly landscapes and seascapes, will be given a dedicated home in the museums newest addition, by the architect Daniel Libeskind, which opened in 2006. Mr. Hamilton, who served as chairman of the museums board from 1994 until last year, led the fund-raising effort for that $110 million expansion, and the building now bears his name.

title: Q. and A.With John Kerry
description: If President Obama is the nations highest-ranking recreational basketball player, then Secretary of State John Kerry is probably the top hockey player. Kerry was awarded several medals for his Vietnam War service, served 28 years as a senator from Massachusetts and ran for president in 2004, but sometimes it seems that his proudest moments have taken place on a rink.

title: U.S. Teams for the World Youth Teams Chosen at Atlanta Trials
description: This years World Youth Teams Championships will be in Istanbul from Aug. 13 to 23. The United States Bridge Federation is sending five teams, and it recently organized trials in Atlanta to select them.

title: Hollandes Companion Is Hospitalized
description: PARIS  Valrie Trierweiler, the companion of President Franois Hollande and Frances de facto first lady, was admitted to a hospital on Friday after learning along with the rest of France that Mr. Hollande is apparently having an affair with another woman.

title: Madeline Arakawa Gins, Visionary Architect, Is Dead at 72
description: Madeline Arakawa Gins, a poet-turned-painter-turned-architect who publicly forswore mortality  and whose buildings, by her own account, were designed to pre-empt death for those living in them  died on Jan. 8 in Manhattan. She was 72.

title: Is the United States a Racial Democracy?
description: I.

title: Milan Fashion Week: Salvatore Ferragamo Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Sarah Aubel.

title: Favorites and Discoveries Among a Superabundance of Jazz
description: Heres what you could have heard at around 6:45 on Saturday evening, during the earliest shift of that days programming for the 10th annual NYC Winter Jazzfest: Extravagantly detailed large-canvas compositions, courtesy of Darcy James Argues Secret Society. A deep meld of Afro-Cuban music and modern jazz by Michele Rosewomans New Yor-Uba. Acoustic folk singing emulsified into a satiny blend by Tillery. Complex rhythmic calculus refashioned into body blows, by the guitarist Miles Okazaki or by one of two dynamic young drummers, Mark Guiliana and Ted Poor.

title: Interview: Kevin Spacey
description: The actor discusses "House of Cards" on the red carpet.

title: Afghan Police, Often Derided, Face Another Drawback: Missing Pay
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Outgunned by the Taliban and often derided by some as little more than uniformed thieves, police officers in Afghanistan do not have an easy job. But in recent months, their lives have gotten even tougher: Afghanistans police officers have not been paid since November, and some have not seen a paycheck since October.

title: The War on Poverty, Then and Now
Uncovering Racial Disparities in Sleep Health
description: To the Editor:

title: The Southwests Population
description: To the Editor:

title: The Next Frontier in Fertility Treatment
description: ANDY INKSTER, a transgender man, had always wanted biological children. So when he embarked on the transition from female to male at age 18  changing his name, taking testosterone and eventually undergoing surgery to remove his breasts  he left his female reproductive organs intact.

title: Interview: Cast of 'Brooklyn Nine-Nine'
description: The cast discusses their sitcom.

title: Golden Globes Red Carpet Fashion
description: Established stars and newcomers made their entrances at the Golden Globes in Beverly Hills, Calif.

title: More Movies at Sundance Are Sidestepping the Big Screen
description: LOS ANGELES  What will be the difference between this years Sundance and the Sundance of 2006, when independent film was last riding high?

title: Steve McQueen & Bianca Stigter
description: A talk with the the director Steve McQueen and his partner Bianca Stigter.

title: Texas Vote-Buying Case Casts Glare on Tradition of Election Day Goads
description: DONNA, Tex.  In this Rio Grande Valley town of trailer parks and weedy lots eight miles from the Mexico border, people call them runners or politiqueras  the campaign workers who use their network of relatives and friends to deliver votes for their candidates. They travel around town with binders stuffed with the names and addresses of registered voters, driving residents to and from the polls and urging those they bump into at the grocery store to support their candidates.

title: Enemies of the Poor
description: Suddenly its O.K., even mandatory, for politicians with national ambitions to talk about helping the poor. This is easy for Democrats, who can go back to being the party of F.D.R. and L.B.J. Its much more difficult for Republicans, who are having a hard time shaking their reputation for reverse Robin-Hoodism, for being the party that takes from the poor and gives to the rich.

title: Dudes and Other Distractions in Milan
description: This morning I visited Antonio De Matteis, the chief executive of Kiton, in the companys new offices in Milan  the former Palazzo Ferre  and he told me something that warmed my heart: you should be able to sleep in your clothes. When a garment feels good and is well made, as a Kiton suit or coat certainly is, you should be able to wear it without sense of care, even if your natural inclination is to baby a very expensive, handmade jacket. Mr. De Matteis, from years of experience, from generations of being Italian, wouldnt dream of such fussiness. He removed his jacket and slipped it on backward, showing how he wears it to sleep on a plane.

title: Its Brooklyn, Basketball and Branding as Nets Head to London
description: After playing five games in eight days, the Nets find themselves with something of a holiday. They were headed to London on Sunday night, preparing to play the Atlanta Hawks at O2 Arena on Thursday night, the only game they are scheduled to play for the next eight days.

title: Syria Rebels Turn Against Most Radical Group Tied to Al Qaeda
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  As a government warplane soared over the northern Syrian city of Raqqa recently, a fighter from the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria, the countrys most radical group linked to Al Qaeda, watched from behind an antiaircraft gun mounted on a pickup truck. Fighters and activists from rival insurgent factions urged him to fire. He did not.

title: Heroic Measures
description: LISA BONCHEK ADAMS has spent the last seven years in a fierce and very public cage fight with death. Since a mammogram detected the first toxic seeds of cancer in her left breast when she was 37, she has blogged and tweeted copiously about her contest with the advancing disease. She has tweeted through morphine haze and radiation burn. Even by contemporary standards of social-media self-disclosure, she is a phenomenon. (Last week she tweeted her 165,000th tweet.) A rapt audience of several thousand follows her unsparing narrative of mastectomy, chemotherapy, radiation, biopsies and scans, pumps and drains and catheters, grueling drug trials and grim side effects, along with her posts on how to tell the children, potshots at the breast cancer lobby, poetry and resolute calls to persevere.

title: Interview: Jemima Kirke
description: The actress discusses Girls.

title: Dance Band Experiments With Three-Way Stereo
description: Pop musicians have been tinkering with the possibilities of stereo sound for decades. In the 1960s, for example, the Beatles sometimes separated individual instruments between left and right channel, and the Velvet Underground took that to an extreme on songs like The Murder Mystery.

title: As Conjugal Visits Fade, a Lifeline to Inmates Spouses Is Lost
description: PARCHMAN, Miss.  To spend time alone with the man she married four months ago, Ebony Fisher, 25, drives nearly three hours through the flat cotton fields of the Mississippi Delta until she pulls into a gravel lot next to the states rural penitentiary.

title: Clashes Between Militants and Army Spread in Iraq
description: BAGHDAD  A confrontation between Iraqi insurgents and government forces in the western city of Falluja edged closer to the capital on Sunday, after clashes between militants and the army left at least 14 people dead in the Abu Ghraib district in Baghdad Province, according to security officials.

title: Are Big Banks Out of Control?
A Flashback to the Reign of J. Edgar Hoover
description: I was a college sophomore in April 1971, still mourning the death of Jimi Hendrix, when I learned that a campus organization to which I belonged was being spied on by the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The news landed in the mailbox of the Black Student Union  at what is now known as Widener University, not far from Philadelphia  in an envelope stuffed with documents that had been stolen from an F.B.I. office in nearby Media, Pa.

title: Missing Executive Actions
description: President Obama has often issued executive orders to get around recalcitrant Republicans in Congress or to clarify existing policy. Yet there are some areas where the president has been too reticent. The start of a new year is a good moment to point out some matters ripe for executive action.

title: Where Free Speech Collides With Abortion Rights
description: BOSTON  A couple of mornings a week, Eleanor McCullen stakes out a spot outside the Planned Parenthood clinic here and tries to persuade women on their way in to think twice before having an abortion.

title: NBCs News Unit Teams With Video Start-Up NowThis News
description: Broadcasting executives realize that viewers increasingly get their news by glancing on their smartphones instead of spending a half-hour in front of the television.

title: The Basketball Players Guide to the (European) Galaxy
description: ALICANTE, Spain  You are a star high school basketball player, a whirlwind on the court. You score points, get rebounds and cover the ball on the defensive end. You get a scholarship and enjoy college. The N.B.A. draft is approaching and you cant wait to cash in.

title: Treading Water on Syria
description: Nearly three years after the fighting began, many of the most dire predictions about Syrias civil war have come true. The conflict has not only engulfed the country, killing more than 130,000 people and forcing more than nine million civilians out of their homes. Increasingly, it has metastasized across the region, destabilizing neighboring countries and serving as a magnet for militants, or would-be militants, including some from the United States.

title: For Manning, Win Brings Big Relief and Bigger Rematch
description: DENVER  For exactly a year, Peyton Manning had lived with the duplicitous burden of being the N.F.L.s best quarterback and an underachieving one. On Sunday, the anniversary of a stinging home loss to the underdog Baltimore Ravens, Manning and Broncos fans awoke to a full-page photograph of the quarterback under a dark cloud against a towering Denver Post headline: A Legacy Under a Cloud.

title: Critics Say Spill Highlights Lax West Virginia Regulations
description: Last weeks major chemical spill into West Virginias Elk River, which cut off water to more than 300,000 people, came in a state with a long and troubled history of regulating the coal and chemical companies that form the heart of its economy.

title: Saving Relics, Afghans Defy the Taliban
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Every piece of antiquity that is restored to the halls of the bombed, pillaged and now rebuilt National Museum of Afghanistan sends a message of defiance and resilience.

title: A Daunting Task
description: Mike Fisher, an archaeologist from the University of Chicago, is working with a team that is cataloging, classifying and restoring the National Museum of Afghanistans collection of artifacts.

title: The Heirs of Tarkenton Scramble, and Throw, to a New Era
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Colin Kaepernick, the San Francisco 49ers third-year quarterback, stood outside a crowded interview room Sunday waiting his turn to face the news media.

title: Big Changes for the Big 3
description: The Detroit auto show is ready to shine a light on developments for American automakers. As General Motors shed government ownership and Ford gambled on a redesign, Chrysler took on an Italian accent.

title: Buffing a Battered Citys Image
description: DETROIT  Ever since Detroit filed for bankruptcy six months ago, political and business leaders here have insisted that the citys long-awaited comeback has already begun.

title: Struggle to Reach Olympics Is the Familys, Too
description: BOSTON  Watching Gracie Gold smile for the cameras after being named to the United States Olympic team on Sunday makes one forget that there is a heartbreaking downside to such thrilling moments.

title: Bigger and Lighter, the Mercedes C-Class Will Flex Its Muscles
description: DETROIT  With the aluminum diet all the rage in automaking capitals, Mercedes has dished up a lighter, yet more potent C-Class sedan to cement its status as the companys best-selling model around the world.

title: Clinic Director Says He Injected Rodriguez
description: A day after Yankees third baseman Alex Rodriguez received a season-long ban for doping, Anthony Bosch, the man who says he supplied Rodriguezs performance-enhancing drugs, said in a taped interview Sunday that he had personally given him injections.

title: Roger Ailess Permanent Pushback Campaign
description: Roger Ailes, the chairman of Fox News Channel, has little left to accomplish in a remarkable television career. He has made billions for his owners, created an entirely new genre of TV and, in doing so, he has changed the way politics is conducted. His business legacy is secure.

title: Ian Barbour, Who Found a Balance Between Faith and Science, Dies at 90
description: Ian Barbour first studied science, then religion, but instead of concluding that the two are in eternal conflict, he helped create an academic realm where they share common ground.

title: N.F.L. Explores New TV Deal
description: The N.F.L. is looking to sell six to eight of the 13 games it carries Thursday nights on NFL Network to one of its existing broadcast or cable partners  CBS, Fox, NBC or ESPN  or TNT, which once carried games.

title: Watching Downton Abbey': A Shocking Crime
description: It was the Downton Abbey episode that shook Britain, and now it is Americas turn to react.

title: A Songwriter Who Found Her Voice
description: For purposes of transparency in advertising, Beautiful: The Carole King Musical should probably be titled Brooklyn Girl. This renaming would allow theatergoers to know exactly what to expect of the friendly, formulaic bio-musical that opened on Sunday night at the Stephen Sondheim Theater, starring an immensely likable Jessie Mueller.

title: Quotation of the Day for Monday, January 13, 2014
description: This law is access balanced with speech balanced with public safety. It has worked extremely well.

title: Cost of Cool in India? An iPhone
description: BANGALORE, India  After deliberating for months, Abhilash Sathyendra, a 25-year-old equity adviser in Mysore, India, bought his first Apple phone. He paid 9,000 rupees, or $150, upfront for a black iPhone 4s and swiped his credit card for the remainder, six no-interest monthly payments of $62.50.

title: At 28, Abbott Wins 4th U.S. Figure Skating Title
description: BOSTON  Jeremy Abbott said he knew his last United States Figure Skating Championships would end in tears, regardless of how his axels, spins and footwork played out on the ice.

title: Bonded by Geography, Divided by Politics
description: Residents in the twin ports of Duluth, Minn., and Superior, Wis., find their lives diverging, now that Minnesota is governed by Democrats, and Wisconsin by Republicans.

title: News From the Advertising Industry
description: Accounts

title: U.S. Soccer Coach to Take 26 to Camp in Brazil
description: No player left behind.

title: Twinned Cities Now Following Different Paths
description: DULUTH, Minn.  The soaring Blatnik Bridge spans a modest body of water but a political gulf.

title: Vugar Gashimov, a Bold Grandmaster of Chess, Dies at 27
description: Vugar Gashimov, a chess grandmaster from Azerbaijan, who was one of the worlds top players for a decade and who helped lead his team to the gold medal in the European Team Chess Championship in 2009, died on Friday in Germany, where he had reportedly been receiving treatment for a brain tumor. He was 27.

title: Litigation Finance Firm Raises $260 Million for New Fund
description: An upstart investment firm that bets on lawsuits has raised hundreds of millions of dollars for its second fund.

title: A Bridge to Scandal: Behind the Fort Lee Ruse
description: By his own account, Mark Sokolich rarely asks people for anything. When you ask, he said, you usually have to give.

title: Upstate, Opposition to a Casino Is a Surprise
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y.  With its rich history of horse racing and a 19th-century gambling parlor so opulent that it drew comparisons to Monte Carlo, this upstate enclave would seem to be a natural choice to receive one of the states new full-scale casinos.

title: Heavy Hitters on Pariahs Row, Shunned by Hall of Fame
description: In 1999, Mark McGwires ostentatious power was worshiped by the actress Heather Locklear in a Nike commercial. Two envious pitchers, Greg Maddux and Tom Glavine, watched the scene and resolved to become more like McGwire.

title: Corrections: January 13, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Girls Returns, and a New Day Begins
description: Given the much remarked upon narcissism besetting the girls of Girls, what better way to open the new season than with a shot of each of them waking up?

title: Fire at Manhattan Bank Burns for 30 Hours
description: A six-alarm fire at a Citibank branch in Morningside Heights in Manhattan burned for more than 30 hours on Saturday and Sunday, drawing over 200 firefighters before it was extinguished, fire officials said.

title: Assemblyman to Resign Over Harassment Claims
description: A state assemblyman from western New York, Dennis H. Gabryszak, said on Sunday that he would step down amid mounting accusations that he sexually harassed women who worked in his office.

title: Lundqvist Gives Little Yet Again, and the Flyers Pay a Familiar Price
description: The Philadelphia Flyers made their first visit this season to Madison Square Garden, where the Rangers used three first-period goals and a smothering defense to top their longtime rivals at home for a seventh straight time.

title: Tense Talks With U.S. Agencies Up Until Indian Diplomat Departed
description: It was 5:47 p.m. on Wednesday when the United States approved Indias request that Devyani Khobragade be accredited to that countrys United Nations mission, conferring on her the privileges and immunities accorded diplomatic envoys.

title: An Unemployed Cook Grasps a Bit of Hope on One of Winters Coldest Days
description: The night before his big interview, Gregory Brandon crawled into bed and prayed. That I get the job, he said quietly. That everything will be all right. Then he tossed and turned until he finally emerged from his blankets at about 6 a.m.

title: Is It a Ceremony or a Party? Perhaps Its a Stylish Mix
description: It was a tale of two red carpets.

title: Lo Mein Brings Us Together
description: Dear Diary:

title: A Mother Faces More Travails After the Loss of a Son
description: Active is the word Martha Rodriguez, 55, uses to describe her son, Alexander Espinal-Rodriguez.

title: Need Cash? Own a Bentley? Take a Pawn Ticket
description: Walk into the Suttons & Robertsons showroom on the East Side of Manhattan and it looks like any high-end retailer or auction house: necklaces glittering with diamonds, sapphires and emeralds fill the display cases, and sterling silver knives, forks and spoons sit on a wooden table fit for a monarch. In the private room in back are bigger, shinier versions of the jewels out front.

title: Quick Exit for Venus Williams at Australian Open
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  For Venus Williams, a win in reach instead became another frustratingly early loss at a major tournament.

title: CUNY Hopes to Dismiss Brooklyn College Official Over Financial Inquiry
description: The Graduate Center for Worker Education, a tiny outpost of Brooklyn College in Lower Manhattan, has long been a busy place. For three decades, it has attracted students from across New York, minted hundreds of graduates of its masters program in urban planning and administration, and housed the noted labor studies journal Working USA.

title: The Weeks College Basketball Games to Watch
description: Now that Florida State has been crowned the national champion of college football, the spotlight shifts to basketball and a freshman class that includes the expected top N.B.A. draft picks Andrew Wiggins of Kansas and Jabari Parker of Duke. Here are some games to watch this week.

title: Adding to Christies Troubles, a Rift With a Former Mentor Widens
description: Gov. Chris Christie often dates his entry into politics to age 15, when, driven by his mother, he arrived at the doorstep of Thomas H. Kean, a state assemblyman who was pondering a run for governor, and asked for advice about getting involved.

title: List of Golden Globe Award Winners
description: Motion picture, drama: 12 Years a Slave

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Jan. 12, 2014
N.B.A. Game of the Week: A Philosophical Difference
description: Every week, The New York Times will choose one essential game to watch, highlighting hot teams, winning and losing streaks, and statistical intrigue in the N.B.A.

title: Wanted: More Worker-Owners
description: Nancy Folbre is professor emerita of economics at the University of Massachusetts, Amherst.

title: Denver Art Museum Gets a Trove of Impressionist Works
description: The Denver Art Museum announced that it had received the largest gift of paintings in its history, a group of 22 Impressionist works  by artists including van Gogh, Monet, Cezanne, Manet and Renoir  from the collection of Frederic C. Hamilton, an oil and gas magnate who has been the museums chief benefactor for several decades.

title: The Empty-Diet-Claim Season
description: I dont need a calendar to know that a new year has begun. I can tell by the deluge of new diet books that arrive in the office mail  more than two dozen since mid-December. On a whim, I weighed them all: over 25 pounds of mostly bad advice, about as much as many readers hope to lose before they have to shed the concealing garb of winter.

title: Word of the Day | megalomania
description: megalomania \me-g-lo-ma-ne-, -ny\ noun

title: Popular Demand
description: Yahoo led all news and information sites in 2013 in visits.

title: MTVs 16 and Pregnant, Derided by Some, May Resonate as a Cautionary Tale
description: WASHINGTON  Kailyn Lowry, at age 17, decided to let MTV film her pregnancy and the birth of her first child in the hope of persuading other young men and women to wait to start a family.

title: GE Capital to Help Set Up Loyalty Programs for Retailers
description: Its logo may not be prominent in stores, but GE Capital Retail Bank has a hand in the branded credit cards of tens of thousands of retailers, including J.C. Penney, Walmart and the Gap.

title: Aiming to Push Genomics Forward in New Study
description: Here comes genomics, Take 2.

title: Whats on Monday
description: 10 P.M. (13) AT BERKELEY (2013) Without narration or identifying the people interviewed  from the humblest janitor to the most esteemed professor  Frederick Wiseman chronicles the history and teaching process of the University of California, Berkeley, while mulling the effect of capitalism on state-funded public education. Mr. Wiseman has made his share of grim documentaries in which people are processed and oppressed by bureaucracy, Stephen Holden wrote in The New York Times of this four-hour film, presented here by Independent Lens. At Berkeley is not one. Its cautiously upbeat attitude is expressed in a directors note: I think it is just as important for a filmmaker to show people of intelligence, character, tolerance and good will, hard at work, as it is to make movies about the failures, insensitivities and cruelties of others. Amen.

title: Blending Genders, for Some Laughs at the Golden Globes
description: The British actress Emma Thompson tossed her shoes across the stage and slurped a martini, Dean Martin-style. Jennifer Lawrence wore her hair almost West Point short, while the actor Jared Leto and the composer Alex Ebert put up their flowing locks in loose chignons.

title: Bragging Rights to Share at the Golden Globes
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif.  American Hustle left a messy Golden Globes as the big winner on Sunday, capturing three major awards, including best comedy. But voters stayed true to form and spread their love around, handing best drama to an otherwise ignored 12 Years a Slave and best director to Alfonso Cuarn, for Gravity.

title: Photo Replay: Jan. 6-12
description: Sports clearly require excellent hand eye coordination, but frequently a contests outcome is determined by a little extra reach!

title: Golden Globe Winners Reviewed
description: The Times critics review Golden Globe-winning films 12 Years a Slave, American Hustle and Gravity.

title: United States Figure Skating Championships
description: The sights of the 2014 United States Figure Skating Championships.

title: A Conversation With: Deepak Kapur, Chairman of India National PolioPlus Committee
description: On Monday, India completes three years without a single new polio case. India is finally on the brink of being polio-free, nearly 30 years after the Global Polio Eradication Initiative was established. Celebrations around the country will mark this feat in global health, with cities like Lucknow, Hyderabad and New Delhi lighting up their landmarks.

title: From Todays Paper: Breeches of Etiquette
description: A couple of riders on the London metro drew some sidelong glances as they took part in the No Trousers Tube Ride on Sunday, part of an international No Pants Subway Ride event. The annual happening was started in New York by a comedy group in 2002, and has since become a rite of winter in which pants-less people casually wait at stations along a subway line and hop onboard. Groups in dozens of cities across the world are said to be participating in the event.

title: Bowed and Remorseful, Former Red Guard Recalls Teachers Death
description: Updated, 3:54 a.m. ET | Nearly half a century after Bian Zhongyun was beaten, kicked, tormented and left to die, bloody and alone, at the Beijing girls school where she was deputy principal, a daughter of the Communist Party elite has offered public penance  of a kind that instantly brought controversy  for her part in one of the most notorious killings of the Cultural Revolution.

title: Forecast for Meteorologists Workweek: Busy
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  On the first two days of the Australian Open, players gulped water and applied ice packs to foreheads while on changeovers. Fans lathered on sunscreen, wore hats, sought shade. A heat wave has arrived, with temperatures expected to climb well over 100 degrees Fahrenheit.

title: Test Yourself | E.L.L. Practice, Jan. 13, 2014
description: Take a quiz and find teaching ideas based on two articles, and a series of images, about the kind of fractured writing that can result when English is translated into or blended with other languages.

title: 6 Qs About the News | All Eyes on the Golden Globe Awards
description: In Bragging Rights to Share at Globes, Brooks Barnes and Michael Cieply write about Sundays Golden Globe awards.

title: Plans for a Replica of Titanic Floated in China
description: A company in southwestern China has announced plans to build a full-scale replica of the Titanic, the passenger ship that famously sank in 1912. The Seven Star Energy Investment Group, based in Sichuan Province, said it would spend spend 1 billion renminbi, or about $164 million, to build an ocean liner that would be moored on a river bank as a tourist attraction.

title: Cops, Clowns and Cameras
description: Jill Freedman was always attracted to closed societies, groups that didnt much want her as a member. But her persistence always paid off.

title: How Can a Reputation Be Improved?
description: Have you ever seen someone you know, or a celebrity youve read about, successfully transform a negative reputation or image?

title: Youre All Losers
description: The other day someone  I dont remember who or where  asked an interesting question: when did it become so common to disparage anyone who hasnt made it big, hasnt gotten rich, as a loser? Well, thats actually a question we can answer, using Google Ngrams, which track the frequency with which words or phrases are used in books:

title: Amec Agrees to Buy Swiss Rival for $3.2 Billion
description: LONDON  Amec, the British engineering and project management company, said on Monday that it had agreed to acquire a Swiss-based rival for cash and stock in a deal valued at $3.2 billion.

title: Israel Bids Farewell to Sharon, a Complex Man
description: SDEROT, Israel  Ariel Sharon, the fighter and farmer from Israels founding generation who became a prime minister both revered and reviled, was buried here Monday on a hill overlooking his family ranch, amid twin ceremonies in which he was eulogized as a courageous commander and pragmatic politician who relentlessly defended the land he loved.

title: Times Minute | Golden Globes Results
description: Also on the Minute, Iran's nuclear deal to take effect and the one-party rule.

title: Times Minute | Golden Globes Results
description: In the Video

title: New York Today: Hows He Doing?
description: Updated 10:45 a.m.

title: Swiss Teenager Beats Date-Krumm in a Battle of Generations
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Six months after winning the junior championship at Wimbledon, 16-year-old Belinda Bencic took the court Monday at the Australian Open against a woman old enough to be her mother.

title: Tang Wei, Film Star, Reported Victim of Phone Scam
description: It was her graphic onscreen sex scenes with Tony Leung Chiu-Wai in Lust, Caution, under the direction of Ang Lee, that placed Tang Wei in the firmament of Chinese stars. She might have become an even bigger household name after the film was released in 2007 if prudish Chinese officials had not put her on an industry blacklist. Producers and directors avoided working with her for years, until at some point she was deemed to have been rehabilitated. She is now acting in films that are shown in mainland Chinese theaters.

title: Protesters, Angry at Premier, Fill Bangkoks Central Business District
description: BANGKOK  Thousands of protesters who had spent the night on the streets of Bangkoks central commercial district marched to government offices early Tuesday as part of a so-called shutdown of the city, a largely peaceful demonstration aimed at removing the government of Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra.

title: Sanofi Unit to Buy $700 Million Stake in Rare Disease Company
description: LONDON  The biotechnology unit of the French drug maker Sanofi agreed on Monday to buy a 12 percent stake in Alnylam Pharmaceuticals for $700 million as part of an expanded alliance to develop treatments for rare genetic diseases.

title: Matchmaker, Matchmaker, Find Me a Job
description: Its no coincidence that Sanjeev Agrawal, the co-founder and chief executive of Collegefeed, compares finding a job with dating. Finding The One (or at least The One Thats Good Enough) in both jobs and love is difficult under the best of circumstances, and its even harder if you dont know where or how to start your search.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | Jan. 13, 2014
description: Update: Jan. 14, 2013

title: Would You Pay $698,000 for a Head Shop?
description: In my posts I occasionally take a look at businesses for sale, which can offer interesting lessons for both buyers and sellers. This post looks at a specialty retail shop, whats known as a head shop.

title: My Old Osaka Home: Suntory of Japan to Buy Maker of Jim Beam
description: Few spirits are as American as bourbon. But the maker of some of whiskeys most iconic brands, including Jim Beam and Makers Mark, will soon belong to an acquisitive Japanese beverage maker.

title: Daily Report: Apple Makes Its Bid for Bigger Share of Indian Smartphone Market
description: After deliberating for months, Abhilash Sathyendra, a 25-year-old equity adviser in Mysore, India, bought his first Apple phone. He paid 9,000 rupees, or $150, upfront for a black iPhone 4s and swiped his credit card for the remainder, six no-interest monthly payments of $62.50, Saritha Rai reports.

title: 5 Chinese I.P.O.s Shelved After Regulator Stiffens Rules
description: HONG KONG  Five companies halted plans to sell shares on Monday after Chinas securities regulator moved to tighten restrictions on new listings, the latest sign of challenges as the mainland seeks to reopen its stock markets to new offerings after a yearlong ban.

title: Ranbaxy Says F.D.A. Lists Possible Violations at Punjab Drug Plant
description: MUMBAI  Ranbaxy Laboratories, Indias largest drug maker, said Monday that the United States Food and Drug Administration had raised concerns about possible violations in manufacturing practices at a plant in the northern state of Punjab.

title: Thank Ackman for the Beam Deal
description: Monday ushered in the first big deal of 2014: Suntorys takeover of Beam Inc. But the deal may not have been possible without William A. Ackman.

title: Chevrolet Doubles Up for Car and Truck of the Year
description: General Motors kicked off the 2014 North American International Auto Show in style Monday, sweeping the awards for the North American Car and Truck of the year with its new Chevrolet Corvette Stingray sports car and Silverado pickup.

title: Why Barington Still Opposes Dardens Plan to Spin Off Red Lobster
description: The Barington Capital Group, the activist hedge fund pushing for change at Darden Restaurants, has already said that it is not happy with the companys plans to spin off its Red Lobster chain.

title: Suntorys Deal for Jim Beam
description: Suntory, known for producing Japans first whiskey, has agreed to acquire the maker of Jim Beam and Makers Mark bourbons, among other spirits, for $13.6 billion, DealBook reports. Including the assumption of debt, the deal is valued at $16 billion. Suntory is offering Jim Beam shareholders $83.50 a share in cash, 25 percent above the companys closing price on Friday.

title: Mens Milan Fashion Week: Prada Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: Gucci: Fall 2014 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Utah, in Opposing Gay Marriage, Finds Three Arguments Are Better Than One
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Courts order last week halting same-sex marriages in Utah was two sentences long. It was provisional and cryptic, and it added nothing to the available information on where the Supreme Court stands on the momentous question of whether there is a constitutional right to same-sex marriage.

title: Hedge Fund Backs Mens Wearhouse Bid for Jos. A. Bank
description: One of the biggest investors in Mens Wearhouse is officially on board with the retailers $1.6 billion hostile bid for Jos. A. Bank.

title: Success, European Style
description: Since Im in Ireland, I should give a belated plug to the very good piece by Fintan OToole debunking talk about Irish recovery.

title: Elliott Turns Its Attention to Juniper Networks
description: Days after throwing its weight around at Riverbed Technology and Celesio, the hedge fund Elliott Management has begun a campaign for change at Juniper Networks, the networking equipment company.

title: Refreshing the Lunch Box for a New Season
description: The fresh start that sparks in many of us in the new year can sputter out when the first day of school rolls around and those of us who send packed lunches with our children are faced with the gaping maws of empty insulated bags, waiting to be filled.

title: Supreme Court Wont Hear Arizona Appeal on Abortion Ban
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday declined to hear an appeal from Arizona officials seeking to revive a state law that barred most abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy. The justices offered no reasons for turning down the appeal, as is their custom.

title: Mediterranean Diet for Diabetes
description: More good news on the Mediterranean diet. Sticking to a Mediterranean-style diet may help reduce the risk for Type 2 diabetes, even when people dont lose weight or increase exercise levels.

title: Hudson River Club Forwards Chevron Grant to Group Fighting Oils Harms in Ecuador
description: The Mouse That Roared comes to mind in pondering a move made in recent days by a tiny, barebones Hudson River environmental and sailing group, The Beacon Sloop Club. The club, which has a tree growing through the roof of its rickety headquarters on the waterfront 50 miles north of New York City, was one of two local groups receiving $1,000 checks from Chevron in November for help advising the oil giant in its cleanup efforts at the site of a former Texaco facility in the nearby community of Glenham, N.Y. (Chevron merged with Texaco in 2000.)

title: Image of the Day: January 13
Carrot, Squash and Potato Ragout With Thai Flavors
description: This is inspired by a recipe in Patricia Wellss Vegetable Harvest. The flavors are both sweet and pungent. Serve it on its own or over rice; Thai purple sticky rice looks particularly pretty against the orange vegetables but any type of rice will do. Im very happy serving this over brown rice.

title: The Chrysler 200 Gets a Reboot
description: Introduced on Monday, Jan. 13: 2015 Chrysler 200

title: Roasted Carrots With Turmeric and Cumin
description: These are based on Suzanne Goins turmeric-spiced root vegetables from her wonderful new book The A.O.C. Cookbook. I use her technique for roasting the carrots, and use the same spices she uses, but I make the dish with a little less olive oil and butter to cut down on calories. Suzanne serves her mix of carrots, turnips, parsnips and rutabagas with Greek yogurt seasoned with kaffir lime juice and zest, and mint chutney. They are also delicious on their own.

title: Roasted Sweet Potato Oven Fries
description: I dont know what I like best about these sweet wedges  the way the sweet potato skins crisp and caramelize, the creamy texture of the sweet flesh, or the subtle flavors of the spices and infused oil.

title: Grated Carrot Salad With Dates and Oranges
description: The influences here are Moroccan. The orange juice brings out the sweetness of the carrots. The juices combine in a delectable way, the salad sweetened all the more by the dates and cinnamon.

title: Turkish Pumpkin Soup
description: This is an intriguingly sweet winter squash soup, based on a recipe by Ghillie Basan from her wonderful book, Classic Turkish Cooking. The sweetness comes from the squash itself and the allspice and cinnamon, with the addition of only a teaspoon of honey or sugar. The sour and spicy yogurt and chile garnish make a great flavor contrast.

title: Q. and A. With Stuart Elliott
description: Stuart Elliott, the advertising columnist, answers questions from readers each week. Questions can be sent to stuarte@nytimes.com.

title: Accounts and People of Note in the Advertising Industry
description: Bel Group, Paris, expanded its relationship with Y&R, part of the Young & Rubicam Group division of WPP, by naming the agencys Chicago office, known as Y&R Midwest, as agency of record for Bel Brands USA, Chicago, handling duties like brand strategy and social media for cheeses that include the Laughing Cow and Boursin. Spending was estimated at $15 million to $20 million. Y&R already handles Bel Group advertising in markets like Australia, Canada and Europe. The Bel Brands USA account had previously been handled by the Chicago office of Havas Worldwide, part of the Havas Creative unit of Havas.

title: Airbus Led Rival Boeing in Jets Ordered Last Year
description: TOULOUSE, France  In their rivalry as the worlds leading makers of passenger aircraft, Airbus captured the lead in jets ordered last year, but Boeing delivered more planes to customers.

title: Another Mayor Felt Christie-Tied Reprisal
description: The night he was elected mayor of Jersey City in May, Steven Fulop got a call from Gov. Chris Christie congratulating him and offering whatever help he could  a pledge that was followed up by texts and emails from Mr. Christies campaign and State House aides, who set up a days worth of meetings with high-level commissioners in what they promised would be the beginning of a happy relationship.

title: In Our Pages: January 14
description: 1889: Fake Francs Found in Paris

title: Ford F-150 Is Now a Lighter Hauler
description: Introduced on Monday, Jan. 13: 2015 Ford F-150

title: The Souths Greatest Governor
description: Most prominent Civil War figures made a name for themselves through either a military or political career. A few, like Henry Watkins Allen, did both, first as a renowned colonel and later as governor of Louisiana. In fact, Allens term as governor undercuts the widespread assumption that Confederate administration was everywhere incompetent and inefficient. As the historian E. Merton Coulter wrote, It was Henry W. Allen who showed the rest of the Confederate governors how good a Confederate state governor could be.

title: Fox Announces Return for 24 and Start of an Updated Cosmos
description: PASADENA, Calif.  The Fox network made a series of program announcements Monday, including the starting dates for two of its most anticipated projects: the return of the former hit 24 and an update of the famed Cosmos series.

title: Weekend Gun Report: January 10-12, 2014
description: Last March, after a night of drinking, Caleb Gordley, 16, sneaked into a house two doors down from his own and was shot and killed by its owner in Loudoun County, Va.Immediately after the shooting, Calebs parents said they forgave their neighbor, believing it to be accidental.

title: Spalding Gray Prize Goes to Richard Maxwell
description: The Spalding Gray Award, an annual prize named for the monologuist who died in 2004, will be given to the playwright and director Richard Maxwell, the consortium that oversees the prize announced on Monday. The prize includes a $20,000 commission to create a new work that will be given a full production at each of the organizations in the consortium. They are P.S. 122 in New York; the Andy Warhol Museum in Pittsburgh; On the Boards in Seattle; and the Walker Art Center in Minneapolis.

title: Suntorys Deal for Beam Continues a Boom in Alcohol M.&A.
description: Suntorys $13.6 billion deal for the maker of Jim Beam is the third-largest acquisition by a Japanese company of a non-Japanese company, according to Thomson Reuters, based on a $16 billion valuation that includes the assumption of debt.

title: No Comment Necessary: Brit Hume Explains Christie
description: Via Media Matters

title: Stern-Mackenzie One-Round War
description: Its war. You size up your warriors  all three of them. Theres strongest A, next-strongest B, and weakest C. Your opponent has three different-strength warriors as well. Warriors will fight in pairs (each warrior fights just one fight), and whichever side wins the most contests is the victor.

title: Extremist Militant Group in Syria Retakes Ground Lost to Rival Rebels
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Making good on threats to contest attacks by former allies on its power and claimed turf, the extremist militant group the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria has retaken significant parts of the territory in northern Syria that rival insurgent groups had wrested away last week, rebel representatives said on Monday.

title: Foundations Aim to Save Pensions in Detroit Crisis
description: National and local philanthropic foundations have committed $330 million toward a deal to avoid cuts to Detroit retirees pensions and to save the Detroit Institute of Arts renowned collection, federal mediators involved in the citys bankruptcy proceedings announced on Monday.

title: Syrians May Allow the Delivery of Some Aid
description: PARIS  The Syrian government has told Russia that it is prepared to allow the delivery of humanitarian aid to some besieged areas in Syria, including East Ghouta, a suburb of Damascus where 160,000 people have been without assistance for a year, Russian and American diplomats said on Monday.

title: Email Correspondence Regarding Steven Fulop, Mayor of Jersey City
description: Documents released Monday show that Gov. Chris Christies administration aggressively courted the mayor, then abruptly cut ties after he informed them that he would not endorse the governor for his re-election.

title: Today in Small Business: Learning From the Big Sites
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Times Minute | Farewell to Ariel Sharon
description: Also on the Minute, Dennis Rodman returns to Beijing after his visit to North Korea and saving Afghan artifacts.

title: Times Minute | Farewell to Ariel Sharon
description: In the Video

title: Miladys, a SoHo Stalwart, Shuts Its Doors
description: It was a safe bet that nobody at Miladys on Sunday night cared much about the Golden Globes or the newest installment of Downton Abbey.

title: Across Wall Street, Efforts to Revise a Hard-Charging Culture
description: The high-achieving college students bound for Wall Street jobs have heard the stories of long nights and weekends spent at the office, a grueling schedule etched into big bank culture.

title: Europe Opens Inquiry Into Licensing of U.S. Films and TV
description: LONDON  The European Commission said on Monday that it had opened an investigation into the ways that major United States film and television studios license their content to European pay-TV providers  practices that the commission said might violate European antitrust rules.

title: Taylor Swift or Sofia Vergara? Quick, Next Party!
description: LOS ANGELES  Theres a complicated calculus to attending Golden Globes after-parties. Like the show, theyre all in the Beverly Hilton complex, but in far-flung corners. So theres a scramble as guests and celebrities migrate from one to the other, running through the lobby, where fans congregate with cameras.

title: Toyota Presents a Curvaceous Extrovert
description: Introduced on Monday, Jan. 13: Toyota FT-1 Concept.

title: Biden Gives Eulogy at Sharons Funeral
description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. spoke at Ariel Sharons funeral in Jerusalem.

title: For Prada and Gucci, a Similar View of Fall Fashion
description: What do Prada and Gucci have in common? Milan, fleets of P.R. people. Both brands are also designed by women  Miuccia Prada and, at Gucci, Frida Giannini  but this scarcely accounts for their remarkable agreement this season at the mens fall shows.

title: Guggenheim Will Invite Architects to Imagine a Finnish Outpost
description: The on-again-off-again proposal to build an outpost of the Guggenheim Museum in Helsinki, Finland, appears to be on again. After city officials there shot down the idea of building the $185 million museum in May 2012, it voted on Monday to reserve a parcel of land on the citys South Harbor waterfront for the prospective institution. This gives the Guggenheim the green light to start an open international architectural competition to determine who would build the museum.

title: Justices Cite History as They Voice Doubts on Obamas Recess Appointments
description: WASHINGTON  In an extended argument that contained large doses of constitutional history and practical politics, the Supreme Court on Monday seemed skeptical of the Obama administrations contention that it could bypass the Senate to appoint officials during short breaks in the Senates work.

title: Burton Lifland, Judge Who Oversaw Madoff Bankruptcy, Dies at 84
description: Burton R. Lifland, the judge who was overseeing the winding down of Bernard L. Madoffs Ponzi scheme, died on Sunday, according to the clerk for the Federal Bankruptcy Court in Manhattan.

title: Scenes of Protest in Bangkok
description: Demonstrators filled the citys central commercial district Monday as part of an effort to overthrow Thailands prime minister, Yingluck Shinawatra.

title: One Womans Dying Wish: A Monthlong Farewell Party
description: Marcy Glanz had been battling uterine cancer since early 2011, but in late November she was given grim news by her doctors  her cancer was so severe that she had only several weeks to live.

title: Times Up for Ticking as Wearability Supplants Reliability in Watch Pitches
description: For decades, Timex has been promoted with the theme It takes a licking and keeps on ticking and variants like Life is ticking and, most recently, Love what makes them tick. Now, time has run out on the venerable slogan and its descendants as Timex takes a new tack that reflects the changing role of watches.

title: So Long BMW 1 Series, Hello 2 Series
description: Introduced on Monday, Jan. 13: BMW 2 Series Coupe

title: Directors Guild Names Its 5 Documentary Nominees
description: Updated, 2:05 p.m. |  Last week, the Directors Guild of America released the five feature directors up for its top prize. Now comes the groups documentary choices, all of which are also on the Academys shortlist:

title: Alice Munro to Beam In for Night at Symphony Space
description: The Canadian writer Alice Munro couldnt make it to Stockholm in December for the ceremony commemorating her Nobel Prize because of health concerns, but Ms. Munro will visit New York  virtually, anyway  later this month.

title: Armond White Expelled From Critics Group
description: Updated, 3:25 p.m. |  The New York Film Critics Circle took the rare step Monday of expelling Armond White, the film critic for CityArts, and of suspending the New York Post film critic Lou Lumenick for a year. The group confirmed the moves in a statement.

title: The Playlist | The Diverse, Influential Sounds Behind James Vincent McMorrows Sophomore Album
description: James Vincent McMorrows debut album, 2011s Early in the Morning, was a promising, if sometimes frustrating, collection of indie folk songs  the kind of tuneful music one is likely to hear during the more earnest moments of a hit TV drama, or in a dimly lit pub. The Irish singer-songwriters full-length follow up, Post Tropical, out tomorrow on Vagrant Records, takes McMorrows intimate lyrics and hushed vocals and soaks them in 90s R&B and early 2000s hip hop, often with stunning results. (For proof, listen to the epic Red Dust,in which McMorrow bares his soul over a thumping hip-hop beat before the song gives way to lush synths and a falsetto that calls to mind Jeff Buckleys best work on Grace.)

title: Enhancements for Expedia
description: Expedia, the travel booking website, has stepped up its search game in recent weeks, adding three features to help travelers find  and organize  the best flights possible.

title: A Bold Move by Suntory
description: For a Japanese corporation, Suntory Holdings has an especially aggressive corporate slogan: Yatte Minahare, which roughly translates as Go for it.

title: A Sort of Season for Ennio Morricone
description: The first part of 2014 is slowly shaping up as a low-key Ennio Morricone festival. The Italian composer, who turns 85 in November, is best known for his film scores  some 450 of them, including The Good, the Bad and the Ugly, with its unmistakable, undulating ocarina figure; and The Untouchables and The Mission, both packed with gripping, dramatic string writing. And though he conducts rarely in the United States (his last visit to New York was a Radio City concert in 2007), he will be leading a freelance orchestra and choir in two concerts in March  his Los Angeles conducting debut, at the Nokia Theater in on March 20, and a performance at Barclays Center in Brooklyn on March 23.

title: Recalling Past Threats, Afghans in Tranquil Valley Work to Keep It That Way
description: BAZARAK, Afghanistan  Even among Afghans, who are generally wary of outsiders, the members of the ethnic Tajik population of the Panjshir Valley are an unusually suspicious lot. So it is their good fortune to have been blessed with the closest thing to a naturally occurring keep out sign: a deep and narrow gorge at the valleys mouth that seems tailor-made for obstruction and ambush.

title: Christie Faces Audit Over Use of Hurricane Relief Money
description: Federal investigators have ordered an audit to determine whether Gov. Chris Christies administration improperly spent millions of dollars of relief meant to encourage tourists to visit New Jersey after the devastation of Hurricane Sandy.

title: McKesson Comes Up Short on Celesio Tender Offer
description: LONDON  The McKesson Corporation said on Monday that it had failed to receive the minimum shareholder support needed for its $8.3 billion acquisition of the German pharmaceutical wholesaler Celesio, despite a sweetened tender offer last week.

title: After Beam Deal, Few Big Liquor Mergers Left
description: A big whiskey acquisition is a shot in the arm for the global spirits industry, but there may not be many more substantial liquor deals to strike.

title: BMW Introduces Its M&M Boys
description: Introduced on Monday, Jan. 13: 2015 BMW M3 and M4

title: California Democrat to Retire From House
description: WASHINGTON  Representative George Miller, Democrat of California, announced Monday that he would retire at the end of his term, after 40 years in Congress.

title: Poverty and Inequality, in Charts
description: Jared Bernstein is a senior fellow at the Center on Budget and Policy Priorities in Washington and a former chief economist to Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.

title: Recalling a Poets Vigil for a Life-Extending Gift
description: According to the latest research, anything could be anything. This is, to my ear, as crisp and withering a distillation of modern medical care as youll find, especially as experienced by a patient desperate for something a bit more concrete.

title: Golden Globes Telecast Draws Nearly 21 Million Viewers
description: LOS ANGELES  The combination of hit movies like Gravity being honored, the return of Tina Fey and Amy Poehler as hosts and intense marketing on social media drove the 71st Golden Globes to a total audience of 20.9 million viewers, an increase of 6 percent from 2013.

title: Ford Reveals 2015 F-150
description: Paul Stenquist describes the importance of the Ford 2015 F-150.

title: Chrysler 200 Is Redesigned
description: Jerry Garrett describes the new Chrysler 200.

title: DiCaprio Nabs Some Treats, and Coogan Assesses the Guest List
description: LOS ANGELES  Where were we in the Globes after-party shuffle? Oh, right: at 10:15, Andrew Dice Clay and Alyssa Milano were waiting patiently in the line to get into the Warner/InStyle party. Over at HBO, held atop and around the Beverly Hilton pool, Sofia Vergara was, indeed, taking selfies, and guests like Hayden Panettiere and Stephen Merchant milled around. Some cast members of Girls remained, but Lena Dunham was long gone.

title: Push to Combat Insider Trading May Go Too Far
description: Last week, BlackRock, the asset management giant, agreed to a settlement with New York State to stop conducting surveys of investment analysts.

title: Weekly News Quiz | Jan. 7-13, 2014
description: A political scandal, a chemical spill, the Golden Globes and a same-sex marriage battle: how many of the 10 news stories below have you followed this week?

title: Calls for Oversight in West Virginia Went Unheeded
description: CHARLESTON, W.Va.  The accidents kept coming, and so did the calls for a plan to improve West Virginias chemical safety regulations.

title: What Patients Dont Tell Their Doctors
description: A patients wife was on the phone, her voice hesitant, unhappy. She didnt bother with small talk. I need to talk to you about Toms drinking, she said.

title: Skeptical of Facebook, Until the Checkbook Came Out
description: A year ago, Josh Miller said that Facebook may have an irreversibly bad brand. Soon after, Mr. Miller, a co-founder of a start-up called Branch Media, was giving Facebook some unsolicited advice, suggesting that it turn to Nike for strategic inspiration.

title: A Salad of Roasted Carrots and Miso Dressing Without the Greens
description: The Restaurant Takeaway column is devoted to restaurant dishes you can make in your own kitchen, tested and tweaked for home cooks.

title: The AMG Treatment Spreads to the Small Mercedes Crossover
description: Introduced on Monday: Mercedes-Benz GLA45 AMG

title: Behind the Cover Story: Elizabeth Weil and the Newly Grown-Up Shaun White
description: Elizabeth Weil, a contributing writer for the magazine, wrote this weeks cover story about the snowboarder Shaun White. Weil is the author of the book No Cheating, No Dying: I Had a Good Marriage, Then I Tried to Make It Better.

title: In Command
description: As I was reading Duty, probably one of the best Washington memoirs ever, I kept thinking that Robert M. Gates clearly has no desire to work in the federal government again in his life. That evidently is a fertile frame of mind in which to write a book like this one.

title: Monday Motorsports: Three Deaths Mar Dakar Rally
description: Three people died last week during the middle stages of the grueling, two-week-long Dakar Rally.

title: 2014 Detroit Auto Show: Photo Gallery
description: A collection of the new models, like the Cadillac ATS, introduced at the North American International Auto Show in Detroit, including slide shows, videos and First Glance critiques.

title: Mens Milan Fashion Week: Calvin Klein Collection Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Kevin Tachman.

title: Best-Selling Science Books
description: 1 DAVID AND GOLIATH by Malcolm Gladwell. Little Brown. How disadvantages can work in our favor, from the author of The Tipping Point and Outliers. (1)

title: Sacrificing Gated Safety for a Lover and Herself
description: Chang-rae Lees new novel is part folk tale, part picaresque adventure, part dystopian satire. It signals a bold departure from both the carefully observed realism that distinguished Mr. Lees powerful earlier books Aloft (2004) and A Gesture Life (1999)  and the historical vistas of The Surrendered (2010). In eschewing one of his most potent gifts as a writer  his ability to map the inner lives of his characters with sympathy and precision  Mr. Lee has produced an ungainly and strangely inert novel. Instead of creating a palpably real flesh-and-blood heroine, he has chosen to center his book on an anime-like character named Fan; and instead of creating a fully imagined fictional realm (as Kazuo Ishiguro did in his bravura sci-fi-like novel, Never Let Me Go, from 2005), hes dropped Fan into a futuristic world that seems at once overly familiar and unconvincing.

title: Quail to Serve With Loire Valley Reds
description: You may not associate the Loire Valley with game, but the hunt, especially for birds, is important in this region of France. I had that in mind when I decided on a seasonal preparation for quail to serve with the deliciously sturdy cabernet francs we tasted.

title: Revisiting the Reds of the Loire Valley
description: Imagine a somewhat small region farmed primarily by myriad family grape growers, many of whom have made wine for generations. They work diverse soils, and because the reds are mostly from a single grape, comparing wines from a multitude of terroirs is fascinating.

title: Printing the Windows 8 Calendar
description: Q. I use the Windows 8 Calendar app on my computer and would like to print out the monthly view of my schedule to have a paper copy. How do I do this? I press Control+P when I have the calendar page open and nothing happens.

title: Scene City: Partying After the Golden Globes
description: InStyle and Warner Bros. hosted their annual bash following the awards ceremony.

title: Ronaldo Dethrones Messi as World Player of Year
description: It did not matter that the voting went mostly as expected; Cristiano Ronaldo cried anyway.

title: Former Marcos Aide Sentenced in Art Sale
description: A former personal secretary to Imelda R. Marcos was sentenced on Monday to two to six years in state prison in New York for conspiring to sell Impressionist masterpieces belonging to the Philippine government that disappeared when Ferdinand Marcos was ousted as president.

title: Volkswagen Makes the Golf R an Even Hotter Hatch
description: Introduced on Monday, Jan. 13: 2015 Volkswagen Golf R

title: Nutcracker Mans Secret: He Didnt Crack Nuts
description: An ancient human ancestor who lived in East Africa millions of years ago  nicknamed Nutcracker Man for his big, flat molars and powerful jaws  didnt actually eat nuts, researchers say.

title: In the Z06, More Sting for Stingray
description: Introduced on Monday, Jan. 13: 2015 Chevrolet Corvette ZO6

title: The Flood Next Time
description: The little white shack at the waters edge in Lower Manhattan is unobtrusive  so much so that the tourists strolling the promenade at Battery Park the other day did not give it a second glance.

title: A Rising Tide, the Doctors Scribe, Sparky on the Operating Table
description: A look at the growing threat of coast flooding in a time of climate change; the stenographer in the doctors shadow; reconstructive surgery of all kinds for what ails your pet.

title: Tent City in Central African Republic Swells as Violence Grips Capital
description: BANGUI, Central African Republic  The streets of this capital citys center are nearly empty. A few citizens slowly walk the wide boulevards, outnumbered by French troops patrolling after recent deadly violence. The battered buildings remain, but much of the citys population has disappeared.

title: Why We Buy in a Marked-Up Market
description: When dividends are included, 2013 was the fifth consecutive year of positive performance in the stock market (as measured by the annualized Standard & Poors 500 return). The stock market is now up more than 200 percent from the bottom of the financial crisis in March 2009. Returns since those dark days have been unbelievable, including the markets most recent performance in 2013 of around 30 percent.

title: Has Christie Lost His Credibility?
description: New Jersey Governor Chris Christies troubles are not going away. Questions about whether the governors team was responsible for a giant traffic jamin Fort Lee, N.J., convulsed the national news shows over the weekend. More subpoenas are expected, probably for staff members Mr. Christie fired last week. Added to the pyre, federal investigators are now looking into whether the governor misused almost $5 million in Hurricane Sandy relief funds for his Stronger than the Storm ads featuring himself and his family in the months before his re-election.

title: Rodriguezs Gummies: Files Detail Doping, Down to Milligram
description: Alex Rodriguez took an energy cocktail on Mondays and a therapy cocktail on Fridays.

title: Older Pool of Health Care Enrollees Stirs Fears on Costs
description: WASHINGTON  People signing up for health insurance through the Affordable Care Acts federal and state marketplaces tend to be older and potentially less healthy, officials said Monday, a demographic mix that could threaten the laws economic underpinnings and cause premiums to rise in the future if the pattern persists.

title: Health Exchange Enrollment Ended With a Surge
description: More than eight million people signed up for private insurance in federal and state exchanges during the initial enrollment period, exceeding the administrations original goal of seven million.

title: The Short, Exuberant Life of Sam Berns
description: Judging from media appearances last year that brought him a kind of celebrity  first as the subject of an HBO documentary, then as a speaker at a TEDx conference  Sam Berns seemed to be far healthier than anyone could have anticipated back in 2005, when I wrote about him for the magazine. My article focused on his mothers search for a cure for his disease, progeria, a rare genetic disorder that makes children seem to age before your eyes, with damage to organ systems  particularly the heart, skin and bones  usually seen only in the very old.

title: Hard-Liners in Iran Offer Mild Praise for Interim Nuclear Agreement
description: TEHRAN  Iranian hard-liners on Monday cautiously welcomed the completion of an interim nuclear agreement that will provide Tehran with some relief from Western economic sanctions in return for a suspension of certain nuclear activities for six months.

title: Of New Atheists and Noble Lies
description: I began last week by responding to Jerry Coynes broadside against my Christmas column, so I suppose its fitting to begin this one by responding to Noah Millmans lament that I need to argue with better atheists, instead of weak combatants like Coyne. My facile response to that line is that Ill argue with better atheists when Americas flagship journal of liberal opinion publishes better atheists attacking things Ive written; my more serious response is that my quarrel with atheism grows cooler and more modest the more serious (in my admittedly-biased view) the atheist in question. Ill elaborate on that a bit below, but first, heres Millmans more serious complaint about my response to Coyne:

title: Readers Lash Out About Bill Kellers Column on a Woman With Cancer
description: Bill Kellers column in The Times on Monday about Lisa Bonchek Adams has generated a great deal of negative response. Xeni Jardin, the well-known writer who blogs on Boing Boing, sometimes about her own experience with cancer, was outraged, calling it bullying.

title: Globes Highlights and (of Course) Lowlights
description: LOS ANGELES  It used to be that the best part of awards shows, for those watching at home, was dissecting everyones outfits. Now that that happens on screen, too  and online, and often in real time  the best part is dissecting everything, the missteps and scripted and unscripted high points, all capturable and re-viewable in GIF form.

title: Exploring Planetary Mass
description: A newly discovered planet weighs the same as Earth but is 60 percent larger in diameter. That means the planet, KOI-314c  shown in an artists conception  has a very thick, gaseous atmosphere. To determine its weight, astronomers used a method called transit-timing variation: They measured how long it took the planet to orbit its star and how that time was affected by its gravitational pull toward another planet.

title: Porsche 911 Targa Has a Retro Look and a Space-Age Top
description: Introduced on Monday, Jan. 13 : 2015 Porsche 911 Targa 4

title: The 71st Annual Golden Globe Awards
description: Last night, the annual Golden Globe Awards ceremony was preceded, as it always is, by an impressive parade of television and film stars going down the red carpet. The Twittersphere was abuzz with trends such as baby bumps and burly beards, and some of the most award-winning looks in front of the Beverly Hilton Hotel happened in groups of three.

title: Gaming Commission Names Equine Medical Director
description: In an effort to enhance the safety of horses and jockeys at New York racetracks, the New York State Gaming Commission announced Monday the appointment of Dr. Scott E. Palmer as its first equine medical director.

title: According Animals Dignity
description: As of late Monday afternoon, when I was finishing this column, the most frequently emailed story on The Timess website for the previous week wasnt about the polar vortex, Chris Christie or Downton Abbey.

title: For Google, a Toehold Into Goods for a Home
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Google, which dominates much of life on the Internet, has been trying to expand beyond computers and telephones to living rooms, cars and bodies. It made its way a bit further into peoples homes on Monday when it agreed to pay $3.2 billion in cash for Nest Labs, which makes Internet-connected devices like thermostats and smoke alarms.

title: Big Offer for Time Warner Cable Unsettles the Cable Industry
description: Charter Communications sought to upend the cable television industry on Monday, offering $37.8 billion to acquire Time Warner Cable, the countrys second-largest cable operator.

title: Fins to Feet
description: New specimens of Tiktaalik, a transitional fish, show two pairs of fins that functioned like limbs.

title: An Ancient Fishs Four-Wheel Drive
description: Based on fossils found a decade ago, scientists had assumed that the earliest known species of fish to make the momentous transition to four-legged animals, capable of living and moving about on dry land, had developed a kind of front-wheel drive. They used enhanced forward fins to crawl out of shallow waters, and only later adapted their rear fins into limbs.

title: As Christie Faces New Questions, State Lawmakers Expand Investigation
description: As Gov. Chris Christie prepared to deliver his annual State of the State address on Tuesday, he faced new questions just days after he dismissed two aides, including his longtime political adviser Bill Stepien, in a political payback scandal that involved manufacturing a huge traffic jam last September at the George Washington Bridge.

title: Inspiration From the Horse Pasture Finds Its Way Into Show Poster
description: DETROIT  Lindsey Simon is a truck lover, so checking out the redesigned Ford F-150 will be one of the first things she does when she visits the North American International Auto Show. But not the very first thing  that will be to make a beeline for the Michigan Hall in Cobo Center, where her grand prize-winning poster will be displayed when the show opens to the public on Jan. 18.

title: Rising Sea, Sinking Land
description: Tide gauges along the East Coast show a long-term increase in relative sea levels.

description: Lawrence Ulrich presents the Mercedes Benz GLA 45.

title: Would a Pregnancy Through a Donor Egg Feel Like Mine?
description: I dont exactly know how we found ourselves talking to a doctor about egg donation.

title: A Solution That Now Looks Crazy
description: How the Federal Government Destroyed the Mental Illness Treatment System: That subtitle is the opening shot across the bow in this jeremiad of a book by the psychiatrist Dr. E. Fuller Torrey. It could just as well have read: How a group of well-intentioned, starry-eyed idealists made a hash of mental health care.

title: PETAs Donation to Help Save Lives, Animal and Human
description: An animal welfare group is donating $1 million worth of costly training mannequins to medical schools in nine countries to accomplish two goals: giving doctors more modern training, and saving the lives of about 1,000 animals a year.

title: McConaughey Shimmies, Samberg Remembers
description: LOS ANGELES  The backstage press room at awards shows is where winners get to reveal a little of themselves, regain their composure and thank whomever they were too flustered to acknowledge on stage. I forgot to thank the Hollywood Foreign Press and my parents, thats how stunned I am, said Andy Samberg, a surprise winner for his role on the comedy series Brooklyn Nine-Nine.

title: Bloomberg Gets a Royal Welcome at His Company
description: Bloomberg L.P., the financial news and data company, has rolled out the red carpet for its owner and founder, Michael R. Bloomberg.

title: Treasury Departments Alcohol Shopping List
description: The Treasury Department is requesting a list of every alcoholic beverage thats being sold at every store and online retailer.

title: A Planet Where a Cigar Factory Can Have Feelings
description: As abandoned cigar factories go, this one is remarkably articulate.

title: Rebuilding Our Badly Broken Pets
description: DAVIS, CALIF.  Classical music played in the background as a team of surgeons leaned over Mischa, who lay anesthetized on the table, mouth wide open, tongue lolling to the side, all four legs in the air. The owners of the 7-year-old German shepherd had rushed her to the veterinary hospital at the University of California, Davis, after she ran in front of a small private plane and was clipped in the jaw by a propeller.

title: More Cat Sense
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Scientists Find Rare Hybrid of Two Other Dolphin Species
description: The clymene dolphin is a hybrid of two other species, a phenomenon that is rare among mammals, a new study reports.

title: Credit Suisse Tells Junior Bankers to Take Saturdays Off
description: Updated, 5:52 p.m. | Credit Suisse is making an effort to improve working conditions for junior bankers, following similar moves from leading investment banks.
