description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: Glimpses of a North Korea Seldom Seen in the West
description: PBSs Frontline enjoys some morbid good timing on Tuesday night, presenting its report Secret State of North Korea in the wake of the execution last month of Jang Song-thaek, uncle of the North Korean dictator Kim Jong-un, and the return to the country this month of the former N.B.A. player and amateur diplomat Dennis Rodman.

title: With Ruling, Funds to Aid Desegregation in Arkansas Are Ended
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark.  A federal judge on Monday gave final approval to a legal settlement that would allow the state to phase out payments of millions of dollars to three school districts to fund desegregation efforts, bringing to a close a court battle that has lasted over three decades.

title: A Mental Alarm Clock
description: Q. Why do I wake up at exactly the same time every night, without any stimulus? It has happened all my life, and it doesnt even matter what time I went to bed.

title: Nine-Nine and Fox Enjoy Upset at Globes
description: PASADENA, Calif.  This is what it has come to for broadcast television: When a new network show wins a major award, its the upset of the night.

title: Keeping Their Eyes on the Score
description: MIAMI  Miami City Ballet, widely known as one of the worlds leading exponents of choreography by George Balanchine, also has a record of new choreography. Its current quadruple bill, labeled See the Music, opens with Balanchines Concerto Barocco (1941) and has Nacho Duatos Jard Tancat (1983), a new company acquisition, as a centerpiece. But it also features two works recently made for the troupe, Justin Pecks Chutes and Ladders (2013, to the first movement of Benjamin Brittens String Quartet No. 1) and Alexei Ratmanskys Symphonic Dances (2012, to Rachmaninoffs 1940 work of that name).

title: Pictures of the Day: Central African Republic and Elsewhere
description: Photos from South Sudan, Central African Republic, Israel and Thailand.

title: Like Solos, but Joined in a Slinky Procession
description: The choreographer Danah Katz waited until the end of her new work, Thousand Plateaus, to make a significant disclaimer. This is an experiment for all of us, she said on Sunday at the 92nd Street Y, surrounded by the four other members of her company, Danaka Dance; the piece, she added, is still in its pilot period.

title: Proposed Metro-North Link Could Wake Up Sleepy Co-op City
description: It is quiet in Co-op City, the nations largest housing cooperative, even though some 50,000 people live there. So quiet that the sound of footsteps crunching on icy sidewalks was louder than the wail of distant police sirens on Friday afternoon. So calm that fewer than a dozen people boarded the express bus, the fastest link to Midtown Manhattan, for its hourlong 2 p.m. trip.

title: Times Minute | Audit Over Sandy Funds
description: Also on the Minute, rising sea levels and a new owner for Jim Beam.

title: The Whole World Gets Into the Groove
description: Are you ready to party with us? asked Baloji, a Congolese singer, songwriter and rapper, as he kicked his band into a sunny, danceable three-chord soukous groove during Globalfest 2014 at Webster Hall on Sunday night. The song bounded along with lyrics in Lingala. Eventually, in English, Baloji gave instructions for a dance step: Run for cover  protect yourself, because the army is shooting on you, you, you, you and your people, he said. So if you want to stay alive, stay down, down, down, he continued, cuing the audience to crouch.

title: Times Minute | Audit Over Sandy Funds
description: In the Video

title: Soloist and Conductor in One Pair of Shoes
description: Like many top-tier violinists and pianists, Pinchas Zukerman has balanced a regular concert schedule of solo, chamber and concerto performances with his career as a conductor.

title: The Museum With a Bulldozers Heart
description: Last year, the Museum of Modern Art caused a ruckus with a plan to raze its neighbor, the former American Folk Art Museum building, designed by Tod Williams and Billie Tsien. So MoMA trustees hired the architecture firm Diller Scofidio & Renfro to explore alternatives to demolition that would still permit expansion.

title: Leno Holds His Feelings Tight as He Prepares to Exit Tonight
description: In the months and weeks leading up to his departure from his long, successful run as host of the Tonight show, Jay Leno has steered clear of any interviews dealing with his feelings about the impending change in his career. He remains aloof from all that in a session with his longtime friend Jerry Seinfeld for Mr. Seinfelds web series Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee.

title: Frozen Insects, Glowing Fish and a Futuristic Suit
description: Winter tightened its grip last week, making life tough for New Yorkers and other invasive species. Fortunately, we should fare better than the hemlock woolly adelgid.

title: Threes a Trend | Man Skirts
description: In London, a trio of provocative mens wear designers gave gender boundaries a nudge, sending out decidedly masculine interpretations of skirt and dress silhouettes. The kilt figured prominently in Sarah Burtons latest collection for Alexander McQueen  no surprise, given her predecessors heritage and fondness for Scottish history and costume. Recent London College of Fashion graduate Sebastiaan Groenen debuted his line Sebastiaan Pieter in a small, provocative presentation that, in his words, explored lengths unfamiliar in Western mens wear, such as a black crewneck sweater attached to a knit skirt with a mildly salacious slash at the midriff, revealing skin and a trouser waistband beneath. And Christopher Shannon showed a pair of heavy-gauge bi-layer sweaters that extended almost to the floor; their side slits bared taut, worked-out legs that looked anything but femme.

title: Dont Try Wooing Action Star Maggie Q with Shark Fin Soup
description: A new video is making the rounds in the effort to blunt Chinas appetite for shark fin soup and the resulting global decline in many shark species.

title: Albums From Bruce Springsteen and Jennifer Nettles of Sugarland
description: BRUCE SPRINGSTEEN

title: Kicking Back: Nature of Choreography Revised, With Beer Cans
description: Debate swirling around the wave of dance presentation in museums hasnt dissipated over the last couple of years. For one thing, economic inequality between the dance and art worlds isnt likely to go away. Over the weekend at MoMA PS1, the Swedish choreographer Marten Spangberg added another layer to the conversation with La Substance, but in English, a four-and-a-half-hour work performed Sunday afternoon as part of the American Realness festival.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Ubers Taxi Troubles in France, and Why Her Might Offer a Glimpse of the Future
description: Every day, The New York Timess staff scours the web for interesting and peculiar items.

title: Three Former Rabobank Traders Charged in Libor Case
description: The Justice Department filed criminal charges on Monday against three former traders from the Dutch lender Rabobank, the latest step in the wide-ranging investigation into the banking industrys manipulation of interest rates.

title: Protecting a Source, James Risen Takes His Case to the Supreme Court
description: The Times reporter James Risen took his case to the Supreme Court on Monday, asking that his effort to protect his confidential source be protected.

title: Tide Gauges Needed for Research Are Often Victims of Storms
description: As the waters of Hurricane Sandy rose higher and higher on Oct. 29, 2012, an instrument on a pier at Sandy Hook, N.J., recorded the ominous tidal surge. The reading hit eight feet above sea level, then nine, then 10  and every few minutes, the gauge faithfully transmitted its readings to a satellite flying overhead.

title: Fifth & Pacific Discloses Executive Compensation
description: The Fifth & Pacific Companies, which used to be known as Liz Claiborne and will now be known as Kate Spade & Company, announced several management changes last week. In a regulatory filing on Monday, the company provided details about compensation.

title: Scene City: The Wrap Dress, Still Flirty at 40
description: A birthday party for Diane von Furstenbergs emblematic wrap dress.

title: Overcoming Shyness to Inspire a Seatmate
description: OTHER than a couple of trips to Mexico, one of which involved sneaking a drive from Phoenix into Tijuana with my best friend when we were teenagers, I never really traveled out of the country until I was well into my 20s. Now, as a leadership consultant, author and someone who climbs mountains, Im always flying. I try to put up with all of the hassles without making too much of a fuss.

description: Isis Miller, a 27-year-old barista in the Wynwood neighborhood in Miami, looks to Katharine Hepburns style for her fashion inspiration.

For Sundays Golden Globes, Young traveled to Los Angeles to dress the Game of Thrones star Emilia Clarke, who landed on multiple best-dressed lists in a custom embroidered strapless peplum dress by Proenza Schouler. Here, Young recounts her whirlwind weekend.

description: Google has announced it is buying Nest Labs, maker of smart thermostats and smoke alarms, for $3.2 billion in cash. At times like this, its normal to ask what is in it for each side.

description: A young woman, lured to North Dakota for a truck-driving job in the oil industry, shares her agonizing existence in an isolated boomtown.

title: Assemblyman From the South Bronx Is Convicted on Bribery and Extortion Charges
description: Eric A. Stevenson, a New York assemblyman, was convicted on Monday of taking more than $20,000 in bribes in return for helping four businessmen build an adult day care center in his South Bronx district.

title: Stung by Scandal, Giant Pension Fund Tries to Make It Right
description: After a pay-for-play scandal tarnished its reputation, the nations largest public pension fund turned to a courtly native of Quebec to help it restore order and improve performance in a crucial investment sector.

title: How Was Your Stay? Post It
description: Matthew Kolodny, a consultant based in Chicago, used TripAdvisor to help choose a hotel for a recent yearlong assignment in Abu Dhabi.

title: Running on Fumes in North Dakota
description: Since around 2006, North Dakotas oil boom has been a beacon for recession-ravaged Americans. The oil towns in the western part of the state are a land of possibility and opportunity, a Kuwait on the prairie, where the American Dream is alive and well in the rural heartland. Or at least thats the sales pitch that has lured thousands of job seekers.

title: Europeans Struggle to Set Derivatives Rules
description: Faced with intense lobbying from the oil and commodity industries, the European Union plans what could be a last-ditch effort on Tuesday to reach agreement on one of the biggest issues to come out of the 2008 financial crisis: how to rein in trading of derivatives and other complex instruments.

title: China: Village Blast Kills 14
description: An explosion on Monday afternoon in a village near Kaili in the southwestern province of Guizhou killed 14 people and injured seven, state news media reported. The news reports said that the authorities suspected that some people at the site had been engaging in illegal gambling, and that the police had begun a criminal investigation of the explosion.

title: Rap Lyrics on Trial
description: SHOULD rap lyrics be used in court as evidence of a crime?

title: Nigerian President Signs Ban on Same-Sex Relationships
description: A tough ban on same-sex relationships that threatens violators with 14-year prison terms has been quietly signed into law by the president of Nigeria, Africas most populous nation, a step that rights advocates have long feared not only as a repression aimed at gays but as an affront to basic freedoms of speech and assembly.

title: Seeking Bigger Role, Bradley Invests His Future in M.L.S.
description: Over the last decade, Michael Bradleys career path has seemed as pragmatic as one of his lateral passes, as persistently frontward as one of his box-to-box runs. It drove him along an ascendant path, to the top European leagues, to an indispensable role on the United States national team. But in recent days has come a dizzying improvisation.

title: His Heart, My Sleeve: Writing About My Brother
description: On my 40th birthday, I began writing an essay about my brother, Robert, who, for the previous 16 years, had been in and out of mental hospitals. My intention was to write about his life as a patient, and also about the life hed led before, when he was a bright, gifted young man who showed no signs, until his first breakdown at the age of 19, that any mental problems were likely or inevitable.

title: The Leadership Revival
description: If you are in politics or public life, you probably had some moment of spine-tingling transcendence. Maybe you read the Declaration of Independence or watched the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.s mountaintop sermon, or read Nelson Mandelas 1964 speech from the dock.

title: Iraq: Deadly Bombings Erupt in Baghdad
description: At least 29 people were killed as car bombs struck several Shiite neighborhoods in northern Baghdad on Monday. The deadliest bombing, in a market in the working-class Shaab neighborhood, killed at least 11 people, according to witnesses and officials. More than 8,000 Iraqis were killed last year as security deteriorated, and hundreds more have died this month. In recent days Sunni militants, including some linked to Al Qaeda, seized control of the western city of Falluja, challenging the authority of Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki. The violence on Monday coincided with a visit to Iraq by the United Nations secretary general, Ban Ki-moon, who appeared to scold Iraqs political elites for not working together to stop the senseless deaths of Iraqi women, children and men, according to a text of his remarks on the United Nations website. The challenges facing Iraq require all political leaders to fulfill their responsibilities to ensure social cohesion, dialogue and progress over political obstacles, Mr. Ban said.

title: Despite Renovations After Hurricane, Unease Persists in the Rockaways
description: The buildings are offset by the Atlantic, a pastiche of warm tones and cool grays, jutting balconies overlooking tranquil landscaped gardens and million-dollar views. The apartment complex is in the Arverne section of the Rockaway Peninsula; it looks as if it could be Boca Raton, Fla.

title: Secretive Apple Squirms in Gaze of U.S. Monitor
description: Most companies are reluctant to open themselves to outside inspection. Yet Apple is even resisting someone who was appointed by a court to do exactly that, leading to an unusual public feud between the worlds biggest technology company and the Justice Department.

title: Dastardly, British and Brand New to the Super Bowl
description: PAUL REVERE is recalled for shouting  whether or not he really did  The British are coming! The British are coming! Repeat that another time and you will summarize the plot of the first commercial that Jaguar will run during a Super Bowl.

title: The Asbestos Scam, Part 2
description: Six weeks ago, I wrote a column about a ridiculous lawsuit being brought by Carolyn McCarthy, a congresswoman from Long Island. A smoker for most of her life, McCarthy has lung cancer. Yet her lawyers claimed that it was her exposure to asbestos, through the work clothes of her father and brother, both boilermakers, that triggered her cancer. Though McCarthy certainly deserves our sympathy as she fights cancer, it is hard to see her lawsuit as anything but an undeserved money grab  and the latest twist in asbestos litigation, the longest running tort in American history, with no end in sight.

title: Inquiry Begins Into Airliner That Landed in Wrong Place
description: Federal safety officials said on Monday that they were investigating why a Southwest Airlines plane landed at the wrong airport, a general aviation airfield near its destination with a shorter runway and no control tower.

title: In All but the Name, a New Nissan Maxima
description: Introduced on Monday: Nissan Sport Sedan Concept

title: Another Step Toward Nuclear Sanity in Iran
description: If all goes according to plan, Iran will begin freezing and then rolling back its most worrisome nuclear activities on Monday under an agreement reached over the weekend with the United States and other major powers. This would be the most significant restraint ever on a program that has threatened international stability since it was first disclosed in 2002 and an undeniably important step toward the peaceful resolution of a serious dispute. Even so, dangerously misguided forces, including leading Democrats and Republicans in Congress, are working to sabotage it.

title: Obama Fights a Push to Add Iran Sanctions
description: WASHINGTON  With the United States and Iran about to embark on a critical phase of nuclear talks, President Obama is waging an intense rear-guard action to prevent Senate Democrats from supporting strict new sanctions that could upend his diplomatic efforts.

title: Abortion Rights: A Good Ruling Stands
description: The Supreme Court made a good call, announced on Monday, not to review a 2013 ruling by the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, which struck down Arizonas 20-week abortion ban as unconstitutional. For women in Arizona, the appellate ruling is critically important in protecting their reproductive rights.

title: Abortion Rights: Uphold Buffer Zones
description: Abortion is one of the most emotionally fraught issues in American society, and public discussion often turns into an attack on the women who choose to exercise their constitutionally protected rights.

title: Alex Rodriguezs Alleged Drug Regimen
description: The arbitration ruling released on Monday includes a drug and supplement regimen that Anthony Bosch said he designed for Alex Rodriguez.

title: Think Back: The Military Budget
description: United States military spending has ballooned since World War II, although Americans have historically been reluctant to go to war. The Timess Sam Tanenhaus explains why.

title: Ford Remakes F-150, the Nations No. 1 Vehicle
description: DETROIT  The heady combination of growing sales and big profits has spurred automakers to reinvest heavily in new models and make major changes to some of their most prominent vehicles.

title: House and Senate Negotiators Agree on Spending Bill
description: WASHINGTON  House and Senate negotiators reached accord on a trillion-dollar spending plan that will finance the government through September, reversing some cuts to military veterans pensions that were included in a broader budget agreement last month and defeating efforts to rein in President Obamas health care law.

title: The Man Behind Alibabas Eventual I.P.O.
description: JPMorgan Chase has called. So has Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley. Joe Tsais phone is ringing off the hook these days, and you would be forgiven if you have never heard of him.

title: Japans Leader Pledges Aid on Africa Tour
description: TOKYO  Japans prime minister finished a three-nation tour of Africa on Monday in which he offered aid and development projects potentially worth billions of dollars to help his nation catch up with Chinas enormous footprint on the continent.

title: Gov. Jan Brewer of Arizona Overhauls Child Welfare System
description: PHOENIX  Gov. Jan Brewer abolished Arizonas beleaguered Child Protective Services on Monday, immediately transferring the task of safeguarding abused and neglected children to a new cabinet-level division over which she will have direct oversight.

title: Aide Fired by Christie Is Called Loyal Team Player, Not Rogue Operative
description: Bridget Anne Kelly is devastated that Gov. Chris Christie denounced her as stupid and a liar  but she also is distraught over how much her actions have damaged him politically.

title: Guardian Deletes Column About a Cancer Patient
description: The British newspaper The Guardian on Monday removed from its website a controversial column by one of its writers that discussed a womans use of Twitter to chronicle her struggle with cancer. In removing it, The Guardian cited an investigation into the column.

title: Volvo Builds an Ambassador for Future Models
description: Introduced on Monday, Jan. 13: Volvo Concept XC Coupe

title: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, January 14, 2014
description: They dont want anyone checking their work.

title: A VW Passat That Sips Fuel Like an Econobox
description: Introduced on Monday, Jan. 13: Volkswagen Passat BlueMotion Concept

title: Enemies of Mexican Drug Gangs Pose a Security Challenge
description: MEXICO CITY  The scenes are incongruous. Inside the heavily guarded colonial state government building in Michoacn on Monday, a solemn lineup of officials vowed that the federal government would restore authority to a region that has descended into lawlessness.

title: New Mexico Judge Affirms Right to Aid in Dying
description: A state court in New Mexico said Monday that terminally ill residents have a constitutional right to obtain aid in dying, a ruling that could make New Mexico the fifth state to allow doctors to prescribe fatal drug doses that suffering patients can use to end their lives.

title: Pope With the Humble Touch Is Firm in Reshaping the Vatican
description: VATICAN CITY  Less than a year into his papacy, Pope Francis has raised expectations among the worlds one billion Roman Catholics that change is coming. He has already transformed the tone of the papacy, confessing himself a sinner, declaring Who am I to judge? when asked about gays, and kneeling to wash the feet of inmates, including Muslims.

title: Corrections: January 14, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Nonsense
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  Nice and smooth, but a whole lot of nonsense. Allow me to explain so you will GROK what Im saying.

title: In Court Fight, Rodriguez Comes Out Swinging Against Players Union
description: It was hardly a surprise that lawyers for Alex Rodriguez went to federal court in Manhattan on Monday to try to halt his season-long doping suspension. What was intriguing was the degree to which the lawsuit they filed to vacate the suspension ended up targeting Rodriguezs own union, contending that it abdicated its responsibility to defend the Yankees third baseman as baseball moved to suspend him.

title: Charges Seen as Unlikely in Scrutiny by the I.R.S.
description: WASHINGTON  F.B.I. investigators do not believe Internal Revenue Service officials committed crimes in the unusually heavy scrutiny of conservative groups that applied for tax-exempt status, a law enforcement official said Monday.

title: Russia: American Journalist Is Barred
description: David Satter, an American journalist and the author of three books on Russia and the Soviet Union, said Monday that he had been barred from the country by the Russian security services. Mr. Satter had been working in Moscow as an adviser and a contributor to Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty, which is financed by the American government. In a telephone interview from London, Mr. Satter said the Russian Foreign Ministry told him last month that he had been approved to receive a new visa, but that when he went to pick it up at the Russian Embassy in Ukraine he was told that he had been barred from Russia. An embassy official said the competent organs had declared his presence in Russia to be undesirable, Mr. Satter said. The American Embassy in Moscow has lodged a formal protest. Kevin Klose, the president of Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty, called the visa denial a fundamental violation of free speech and journalistic liberty.

title: Crowd-Pleasing Blasts, With Civil War Roots
description: PHILADELPHIA  The Philadelphia 76ers like to save their most impressive entertainment innovation for the fourth quarter. So with two minutes left in a recent game, and only after free T-shirts had wafted from the rafters in parachutes and acrobats had dunked off trampolines, did they finally bring out the big gun.

title: Tepid U.S. Sales Are a Drag on Volkswagens Ambitions
description: DETROIT  Volkswagen has outlined ambitious plans to become the worlds top-selling automaker within the next four years, but its lackluster sales in the United States have been a significant drag on meeting that goal.

title: China: Doctor Is Sentenced in a Case of Baby Trafficking
description: A court on Tuesday sentencedZhang Shuxia, an obstetrician in Shaanxi Province, to death but with two years reprieve for stealing seven babies and selling them. Death sentences with two years reprieve are almost always changed later to life sentences.

title: New Yorks Mortgage Bank Hunter May Not Be Able to Direct His Spoils
description: More than a year back, the New York State attorney general, Eric T. Schneiderman, came home bearing a legal pelt.

title: With Fate of Safe Deposit Boxes Unknown, Bank Customers Fret After Blaze
description: For many people, a bank is a place to safeguard family heirlooms and vital documents from the unpredictable turns of life: theft, fire, flood. But over the weekend, a Citibank branch in Upper Manhattan burned for more than a day, leaving the building a burned-out husk and the fate of the banks 300 safe deposit boxes unknown.

title: Four Talented Brothers, in the Devils Familiar Mold
description: Travis Zajacs face brightens when he talks of long days with his three younger brothers at their favorite rink back home in Winnipeg.

title: No-Tailgating Rule Spurs Events, but None Dare Call Them Super Bowl Parties
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Tailgating will not be permitted in the parking lot at MetLife Stadium before the Super Bowl, so officials from this town  the very town in which the stadium is situated  called a news conference with officials from the neighboring town of Secaucus on Monday to announce alternatives.

title: Man Killed During Argument Over Texting at Movie Theater
description: MIAMI  An argument over texting at the movies ended in a cellphone users death on Monday afternoon when a retired police officer in the audience shot him at a theater near Tampa, Fla., the authorities said.

title: A Case of Amateurish Cloak-and-Dagger
description: Proof that Alex Rodriguez has gone from defiant to desperate came Monday in the form of a federal lawsuit. In it, he sued not only Major League Baseball to overturn his 162-game ban but also his own players union, which has done its best  often successfully  to protect him for years.

title: Texas: High School Is Evacuated
description: About 3,600 students were evacuated from Seven Lakes High School in the Houston suburb of Katy on Monday morning after the authorities there discovered a suspicious device in a backpack, officials said. Officials with the Katy Independent School District initially described it as a potential explosive device, but it was determined to be a homemade weapon known as a zip gun. An unidentified student was in custody, and a school spokesman said charges were pending. The fear of an explosive device prompted a large police response by the Harris County bomb squad, the F.B.I. and other agencies.

title: Mixed Reports on State Health Exchange
description: ALBANY  New York is enrolling a significant number of young subscribers on its health insurance exchange, but many of those already enrolled have raised questions about rules that limit which doctors they can see, or are having problems finding out if their doctors are covered, according to testimony at a State Senate hearing on Monday.

title: California: Octuplets Mother Charged
description: Natalie Suleman, who gave birth to octuplets in 2009, has been charged with welfare fraud, the Los Angeles district attorneys office said Monday. Ms. Suleman, 38, who is known as Nadya Suleman, is accused of failing to report nearly $30,000 earned from public appearances and video royalties since she applied for public assistance last year. A mother of 14, she illegally received more than $16,000 in welfare, the criminal complaint charges.

title: F.B.I. Arrests Fund-Raiser for Congressman
description: A Texas woman who was a friend of and fund-raiser for Representative Michael G. Grimm has been charged with illegally funneling more than $10,000 into his 2010 campaign, according to court papers and people with knowledge of the case. The charges suggest that a two-year-old federal investigation into his fund-raising is still active.

title: Defense-Minded Knicks Win Their Fifth in a Row
description: The Knicks and the Phoenix Suns did not always play well Monday night. They played hard. They played it close. And eventually they played into overtime.

title: Some West Virginia Residents Can Finally Use Water Again
description: After officials in West Virginia announced on Monday that a ban on tap water was being lifted, many residents were excited to take a shower again.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Jan. 13, 2014
Sam Berns, 17, Public Face of a Rare Illness, Is Dead
description: Sam Berns, a Massachusetts high school junior whose life with the illness progeria was the subject of a documentary film recently shortlisted for an Academy Award, died on Friday in Boston. He was 17.

title: How the Courts Constrain Tax Reform
description: Bruce Bartlett held senior policy roles in the Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations and served on the staffs of Representatives Jack Kemp and Ron Paul. He is the author of The Benefit and the Burden: Tax Reform  Why We Need It and What It Will Take.

title: Word of the Day | anesthetic
description: anesthetic \a-ns-the-tik\ noun and adjective

title: Thai Leader Vows to Keep Job Amid Protests
description: BANGKOK  As antigovernment protesters continued their occupation of crucial parts of Bangkoks main commercial and business districts, Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra on Tuesday said she was protecting democracy and would not resign.

title: Over the Side With Old Scientific Tenets
description: Here are some concepts you might consider tossing out with the Christmas wrappings as you get started on the new year: human nature, cause and effect, the theory of everything, free will and evidence-based medicine.

title: After a Loss, Siblings Try to Reconnect
description: Silence has settled where animated banter and familial laughter were once the norm. The dynamic between Jasmine Morales, 25, and the two siblings who live with her has been thrown off kilter.

title: Newsstand to Reopen, After de Blasio Helps
description: A month after closing a newsstand on Astor Place that had been operated for 26 years without the proper license, New York City officials have reversed course, agreeing to let the stand reopen and to grant the longtime operator the necessary license.

title: Injuries to Domestic Helper Cast Light on Abuses in Hong Kong
description: An alleged beating of an Indonesian domestic helper by her Hong Kong employer has drawn new attention to the treatment of the hundreds of thousands of such workers in the territory, raising questions about whether the authorities are vigilant in preventing abuses in such cases.

title: Robert Pastor, 66, Dies; Guided Panama Treaty for Carter
description: Robert A. Pastor, a White House aide under President Jimmy Carter who shepherded the 1977 Panama Canal treaties to ratification  and was punished for it 17 years later, when conservatives defeated his nomination to be ambassador to Panama  died on Wednesday at his home in Washington. He was 66.

title: Governor Hopes Speech Will Obscure a Scandal
description: In a political high-wire act, Gov. Chris Christie will try on Tuesday to refocus attention from a controversy over a vindictive traffic jam to the day-to-day work of governing, by outlining plans to extend the school day, lower taxes for homeowners and reduce urban crime.

title: Whats on Tuesday
description: 9 P.M. (Esquire) FRIDAY NIGHT TYKES Theres no quitting in football. But theres plenty of blood, sweat and tears when youre a baby linebacker exhausted in 99-degree heat, and the coach orders you to bear-crawl across the field. I dont care how much pain youre in! Charles Chavarria, a former Marine, bellows at his team, the Junior Broncos. You dont quit! This new reality show follows five San Antonio teams of 8- and 9-year-olds as they try to pass, run and tackle their way to the top of the Texas Youth Football Association, where ranting coaches, obsessive parents and helmet-to-helmet hits are de rigueur. Sometimes, parents say I may be crossing a little bit of a line, Mr. Chavarria says. They need to toughen up. If you dont push your kids, youre accepting failure.

title: Electrical Problem Blamed in Shangri-La Fire
description: A fire that destroyed hundreds of structures in a Tibetan area in southwestern China was caused by an electrical problem that ignited a curtain, a county official said.

title: A Dark Look at Modeling in China
description: The insider essay on modeling in China opens with the American author, Meredith Hattam, sitting on a train from Chengdu to Beijing with a 16-year-old Ukrainian friend, Lana. The friend is eating a hard-boiled egg. Ms. Hattam makes it clear that eggs are all Lana will eat for the next 10 days because the modeling agency in Beijing that employs the two of them has cut Lanas weekly allowance due to her weight. Lana had violated the strict measurement standards laid out in her three-month modeling contract.

title: The Skate Escape
description: BANGALORE, Karnataka  On a warm December evening, one of the pioneers in Indias skateboarding scene was giving a private lesson to a 7-year-old girl on dropping in, a terrifying move for novices in which skaters prop their boards up on the edge of a ramp and plunge down the incline.

title: Kerry Urges Syrian Rebels to Go to Peace Meeting
description: ROME  Secretary of State John Kerry told the Syrian opposition that support for the group could be reduced if it decided not to attend the coming peace conference in Switzerland, Western officials said on Tuesday.

title: Test Yourself | History, Jan. 14
description: Take the Quiz

title: 6 Qs About the News | Rising Tide Is a Mystery That Sinks Island Hopes
description: In Rising Tide Is a Mystery That Sinks Island Hopes, Randal C. Archibold reports on the sudden growth of the largest lake in the Caribbean.

title: Breathing In vs. Spacing Out
description: Two and a half millenniums ago, a prince named Siddhartha Gautama traveled to Bodh Gaya, India, and began to meditate beneath a tree. Forty-nine days of continuous meditation later, tradition tells us, he became the Buddha  the enlightened one.

title: Do TV Shows Like 16 and Pregnant Promote or Discourage Teenage Pregnancy?
description: Do TV shows like 16 and Pregnant and Teen Mom glamorize being a teenage mother or present a cautionary tale?

title: Generation Y-Me
description: We boomers havent heard much about the generation gap lately, although it was a big topic, the stuff of newsweekly covers, decades back. But Im wondering if this phenomenon  fundamentally different perspectives on goals, behavior and values, based largely on ones age cohort  resurfaces in later life.

title: The New York Portfolio Review, Part II
description: What happens when you  O.K., we  put together 150 photographers with 75 top editors, curators, book publishers and gallerists for two days of photo critiques, networking and fun? Well, assignments, shows and sales, for starters. More important, popular demand that we do it again.

title: Egyptians Vote on New Constitution in Referendum
description: CAIRO  Egyptians trundled to the polls on Tuesday for the third referendum in three years to approve a new constitution, this time to validate the military ouster of their first fairly elected president, Mohamed Morsi of the Muslim Brotherhood.

title: Times Minute | Alex Rodriguez Sues
description: Also on the Minute, West Virginia's water and criticism of MoMA.

title: New York Today: Comeback City
description: Updated 10:02 a.m.

title: Times Minute | Alex Rodriguez Sues
description: In the Video

title: Lowes Backs Recommendation Site for Home Projects
description: SEATTLE  Anyone who has gone through a home improvement project knows what a hassle it can be to find a trusted professional to do electrical, plumbing and other work. The big retailer Lowes is backing a website that it believes can make the process better for its customers.

title: Dont Trust This Spy
description: WASHINGTON  Jonathan Jay Pollard liked to imagine his life was greater than it was. He told fanciful tales to peers while at Stanford in the 1970s, including that he was a Mossad officer and that he had once been captured and tortured by Arabs.

title: With Familiar Racket and a New Ring, Caroline Wozniacki Is Hoping to Rise Again
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  For Caroline Wozniacki, who spent 67 weeks from 2010 to 2012 ranked No. 1, reaching back to the past for an old, familiar companion just felt right.

description: John P. Havens, who resigned as chief operating officer of Citigroup in 2012 when Vikram S. Pandit was ousted as chief executive, has found a new home.

title: Egypts Constitution
description: Voters went to the polls on Tuesday.

title: Celesios Shares Tumble After Failed Bid by McKesson
description: LONDON  Shares ofthe German pharmaceutical wholesaler Celesio fell nearly 6 percent in trading on Tuesday morning after the McKesson Corporation failed to garner enough shareholder support for its proposed $8.3 billion acquisition to proceed.

title: Dsquared2: Fall 2014 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Scores Die in Ferry Accident as They Flee Violence in South Sudan
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  It happened during a panic that has unfolded with frightening regularity in recent weeks. Fighters were advancing. Crowds of civilians fled to the river to escape the violence, rushing into barges to cross the White Nile. Amid the frenzy, officials said Tuesday, more than 200 people were killed when the ferry carrying them to safety went down.

title: When My Son Flew Out of the Nest
description: Physicists discover particles the way shop owners catch embezzlers: not by seeing them, but by noticing something is missing (in high-energy physics, particles are inventory, energy cash). They smash large particles, then tally up the energy and smaller particles produced. If the reckoning is incomplete, another tiny particle must have been there.

title: Oyster, a Start-Up for E-Reading, Raises $14 Million
description: With Netflix soaring, investors are betting that a start-up based on the same business model  but for e-books  will succeed as well.

title: Hampered by Legal Costs, JPMorgans Profit Falls 7.3%
description: Updated, 9:48 a.m. |

title: From Hunger to Fame, With a Shoestring Menu
description: SOUTHEND-ON-SEA, England  First she stopped heating her apartment, putting furniture in front of the radiators to try to forget they were there. She unscrewed most of the light bulbs, turned off the hot water, and sold her iPhone, her watch, her television and even her curtains to feed herself and her 2-year-old son.

title: French Leader Brushes Aside Questions Over Affair
description: PARIS  It was arguably the most important speech of Franois Hollandes presidency. His job approval remains at nearly the lowest level of any president in French history. His economic policies have failed to make major inroads in addressing chronic unemployment and persistent deficits. His Socialist Party is restive.

title: Euro Zone Factory Output Rallied in November
description: PARIS  Factories in the euro zone ramped up output in November after two months of decline, according to data released Tuesday, the latest sign that economic growth in the region might be picking up steam.

title: Tiger Attacks Terrify Villagers Near Southern Hill Station
description: Over 300 forest and police officers are on the hunt for a tiger that has killed three villagers near the hill station of Ooty in Tamil Nadu, attacks that have terrified local residents and shut down a popular tourist site.

title: Today in Small Business: Facebooks Star Rankings
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: In Performance: Roger Guenveur Smith of Rodney King
description: This weeks video features Roger Guenveur Smith in a scene from his monologue Rodney King, about the construction worker whose videotaped 1991 beating by the Los Angeles police incited deadly protests after the officers were acquitted the following year. The show plays Wednesday and Saturday at the Public Theater as part of the Under the Radar Festival.

title: Billions and Billions
description: [PLEASE NOTE: After Deadline will be on vacation next week and will return on Tuesday, Jan. 28.]

title: Come Together, From the Beatles to the Arctic Monkeys
description: Val Haller, a music-obsessed baby boomer and the founder of the Web site Valslist.com, matches tracks from her generation to those of her 20-something sons generation.

title: Australians Grand Slam Hopes Wilt in Melbourne Heat
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  The pause lasted for maybe five seconds but it felt more like five hours. It came at the beginning of Lleyton Hewitts news conference Tuesday, after his ouster from the first round of the Australian Open.

title: Wells Fargos Earnings Rise 10%, Slightly Ahead of Estimates
description: Updated, 9:30 a.m. | Wells Fargo, which has come to dominate mortgage lending since the financial crisis, said on Tuesday that its fourth-quarter earnings rose 10 percent from the same period in 2012.

title: Score Composer as Method Actor
description: LOS ANGELES  Alexander Ebert was a surprise winner at the Golden Globes, for his score for J.C. Chandors All Is Lost. But the transition to composer is just the latest in a string of professional transformations for Mr. Ebert, currently best known as the frontman of the indie band Edward Sharpe and the Magnetic Zeros.

title: A Cinematic Rescue on 23rd Street
description: Dear Diary:

title: Elliott Maintains Pressure on Riverbed to Pursue a Sale
description: Elliott Management has a lot on its plate at the moment, including taking on a huge target in Juniper Networks.

title: Daily Report: With $3.2 Billion Deal for Nest, Google Makes a Play for Your Home
description: Google, which dominates much of life on the Internet, has been trying to expand beyond computers and telephones to living rooms, cars and bodies, Claire Cain Miller reports. It made its way a bit further into peoples homes on Monday when it agreed to pay $3.2 billion in cash for Nest Labs, which makes Internet-connected devices like thermostats and smoke alarms.

title: Mens Milan Fashion Week: Antonio Marras Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Filippo Mutani.

title: Profit Falls at JPMorgan
description: JPMorgan Chase reported a 7.3 percent drop in fourth-quarter earnings on Tuesday, underscoring how expensive it has been for the bank to obtain peace with Washington, Jessica Silver-Greenberg reports in DealBook. The net earnings of $5.28 billion, or $1.30 a share, fell slightly below Wall Street analysts expectations of $1.35 a share.

title: JPMorgan Continues to Tally Up Its Legal Headaches
description: For JPMorgan Chase, legal costs continue to be a millstone.

title: Activist Investor Takes Bob Evans Farms to Court
description: The hedge fund Sandell Asset Management is bringing out the big guns.

title: Eminence Plans Proxy Challenge at Jos. A. Bank
description: Eminence Capital has already declared its support for Mens Wearhouse and its $1.6 billion hostile takeover bid for Jos. A. Bank and taken the company to court.

title: Citing Charging Concerns, Tesla Issues a Recall
description: Tesla is issuing a recall action concerning about 29,000 charging adapters for its 2013 Model S electric cars because of a potential fire hazard, the automaker has informed the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration in a letter sent to the agency over the weekend.

title: Ford Gambles on the F-150
description: Ford has unveiled its new F-150 with an aluminum body. The truck may pose an interesting marketing challenge for a company with the slogan Ford Tough.

title: Honda Introduces Honda 2015 Fit
description: Cheryl Jensen analyzes the Honda 2015 Fit.

title: How Have Tools Like Google and YouTube Changed the Way You Work?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Francine Prose and Rivka Galchen discuss how the Internet has changed the way they research and write.

description: Chris Jensen reveals the Volvo Concept XC Coupe.

title: Evening Hours | Grace and Merriment
description: Welcome Winter.

title: Mens Milan Fashion Week: Belstaff Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Kevin Tachman.

title: In Our Pages: January 15
description: 1889: Elephant Kills Boy

title: A High-Tech Genesis Shows Hyundais Future Path
description: Introduced on Monday, Jan. 13: 2015 Hyundai Genesis

title: Conservative Group to Air Ads Attacking Health Law in Michigan and Iowa
description: One of the countrys most well-funded conservative groups is betting that public anger against President Obamas signature health initiative is broad and deep enough to expand the field of competitive Senate races this November.

title: Task Force Report Urges Municipalities to Stop Hiding Fiscal Troubles
description: WASHINGTON  After years of painful service cuts and devastating bankruptcies, culminating in the financial collapse of Detroit, state and local governments are being urged to stop using budget gimmicks that obscure the true extent of their money problems.

title: Sarah Paulson Learns to Withhold Judgment
description: LOS ANGELES  Accepting the award for best drama at the Golden Globes, the 12 Years a Slave director Steve McQueen called Sarah Paulson the Bette Davis of America. Ms. Paulson is a theater, film and television veteran, most recently seen in the FX series American Horror Story. In 12 Years, she plays the wife of Michael Fassbenders sadistic plantation owner; her character, Mistress Epps, has some sadistic streaks of her own, which perhaps seem even crueler judged against her gender.

title: Ex-SAC Capital Trader Found His Way to Stanford After Harvard Expulsion
description: It has been a bit of a mystery figuring out how Mathew Martoma, who is on trial on federal insider-trading charges, was accepted into Stanford Business School after being expelled from Harvard Law School for forging his transcript. Typically, universities do not look too kindly on academic violations when considering whether to admit applicants.

title: Satchmo at the Waldorf to Open Off Broadway
description: Satchmo at the Waldorf, Terry Teachouts one-man play about Louis Armstrong, will have its Off Broadway premiere at the Westside Theater. It begins previews on Feb. 15, and opens on March 4.

title: Feigning Deafness, Giving Your Dogs Email and Other Reader Tips to Thwart Privacy Grubbers
description: After venting my frustrations with an (admittedly very sweet) cashier lady and the entire data mining industry last Friday, I was thrilled to hear from hundreds of simpatico readers who had experienced similar, frustrating encountersand a few who werent afraid to administer some digital justice of their own.

title: After Cancer Disruption, a Determined Comeback
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Ross Hutchins is a cancer survivor, but he does not, he will not, define himself that way. He is not happy just to be here, back on a tennis court, back in a Grand Slam. He appreciates the sympathy, but please, enough.

title: Google Effect Stirs Several Stocks
description: Google has raised the temperature in one small corner of the deal world.

title: Red Tape Snarls Projects in India
description: MUMBAI, India  The Mumbai Trans Harbor Link, a 14-mile series of pillars supporting an eight-lane highway and a rail line, was supposed to be an artery relieving pressure on Indias financial capital, while feeding a new city and fresh growth.

title: Little Harm to Boy Who Fell Into Manhole
description: As every New Yorker knows, the citys sidewalks and streets are poked through with innumerable openings  grates and holes and precarious metal doors that sometimes bend to heart-jumping angles under the weight of a passing pedestrian.

title: Auto Loans Bring Growth, and Scrutiny, for Banks
description: Car loans may be a boon to banks experiencing lackluster mortgage demand, but automobile lending has come with its own headaches recently.

title: Times Minute | Christie's Address
description: Also on the Minute, Egypt goes to the polls and a new, lighter, Ford truck.

title: Times Minute | Christies Address
description: In the Video

title: Richard Ayoade Movie on the New Directors/New Films Slate
description: Richard Ayoades follow-up to his feature-directing breakthrough, Submarine, is one of the seven selections for the annual New Directors/New Films series presented by the Film Society of Lincoln Center and the Museum of Modern Art, those organizations said Tuesday.

title: Rebuffing F.C.C. in Net Neutrality Case, Court Allows Streaming Deals
description: WASHINGTON  Internet service providers are free to make deals with services like Netflix or Amazon allowing those companies to pay to stream their products to online viewers through a faster, express lane on the web, a federal appeals court ruled on Tuesday.

title: Google Fans the Flame of Connectivity
description: Google has turned up the temperature on the Internet of things. The companys decision to pay $3.2 billion for Nest Labs, a maker of smart thermostats, signals a shift in Silicon Valleys arc of disruption. Sending data to people on the go looks rather ho-hum next to a future where consumers communicate with, and control, their products remotely.

title: Girl You Know Its True! An Opera Inspired by Milli Vanilli Is Set for Brooklyn Run
description: If Anna Nicole Smith and Jerry Springer can be opera subjects, why not Milli Vanilli? Surely you remember Milli Vanilli, the pop vocal duo  Fab Morvan and Rob Pilatus  who left the record business in disgrace in 1990, after it was revealed that their live performances were lip-synced to recordings, which turned out to have been made not by Mr. Morvan and Mr. Pilatus, but by studio singers.

title: 2 Injured in Shooting at New Mexico School
description: A 12-year-old boy opened fire with a shotgun on Tuesday at the middle school he attends in Roswell, N.M., striking two among the dozens of students who were gathered inside a gym waiting for the first bell to ring, the police and witnesses said.

title: Subarus Pocket Rocket Gets a Distinct Look
description: Introduced on Tuesday, Jan 14: 2015 Subaru WRX STI

title: RC F Adds Hot Sauce to Lexus Line
description: Introduced on Tuesday, Jan. 14: Lexus RC F Coupe

title: The Moto X Heads to Europe
description: LONDON  Motorola Mobility is bringing its struggling high-end smartphone to Europe.

title: Mens Milan Fashion Week: Giorgio Armani Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: Ian McKellen and Nobel Winners Join Protests Against Russias Anti-Gay Laws
description: LONDON  With the Sochi Winter Olympics three weeks away, the British actor Ian McKellen and 27 Nobel laureates have signed an open letter to President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, demanding that he repeal recent legislation that is widely condemned for discrimination against gays.

title: Big Fees for Advisers if Charter Wins Over Time Warner Cable
description: Charter Communications finally unveiled a takeover bid for Time Warner Cable on Monday, offering $37.8 billion for its much bigger rival.

title: A Conversation With T-Mobile US Executives
description: T-Mobile US, the fourth largest carrier in the United States, started 2014 with an aggressive move: It offered to pay for customers termination fees to break up with a rival carrier and switch to T-Mobile.

title: Flaws in Chemical Laws in the Context of the West Virginia Spill
description: Two staff scientists at the Environmental Defense Fund have helpfully asked and answered the following question in the context of the large and disruptive chemical spill in West Virginia:

title: Image of the Day: January 14
As Parents Age, Asian-Americans Struggle to Obey a Cultural Code
description: SOUDERTON, Pa.  Two thick blankets wrapped in a cloth tie lay near a pillow on the red leather sofa in Phuong Lus living room. Doanh Nguyen, Ms. Lus 81-year-old mother, had prepared the blankets for a trip she wanted to take. Shes ready to go to Vietnam, Ms. Lu said.

title: SACs Cohen Enjoys a Different Type of Court Scene
description: On Monday, a former portfolio manager at SAC Capital Advisors, Mathew Martoma, sat stonefaced in a courtroom in Lower Manhattan, facing insider trading charges.

title: Central African Republic Violence Ebbs, but U.N. Warns of Flare-Up
description: GENEVA  As a measure of calm returned to the capital of the Central African Republic on Tuesday after weeks of bloody turmoil, the United Nations human rights office warned that the violence could quickly reignite and released a report implicating Chadian members of the African peacekeeping mission in attacks on civilians.

title: Guild Nominations That Could Skew Your Oscar Pool
description: LOS ANGELES  Awards-watchers pay close attention to editing guild prizes because a nod for best editing is considered a near-absolute necessity for a film to eventually win a best picture Oscar. As the guild notes, No film has won best picture at the Oscars without also having received at least a best editing nomination since Ordinary People in 1981.

title: As Gears Multiply, a Transmission Maker Prospers
description: DETROIT  The proliferation of gear ratios in modern automatic transmissions  even 6-speeds are seeming slightly behind the times now  has been good to at least one company.

title: Judge Rejects N.F.L. Settlement, for Now
description: The judge presiding over the proposed $765 million settlement between the N.F.L. and more than 4,500 retired players who sued the league and accused it of hiding the dangers of concussions has raised significant questions about whether there will be enough money for all of the payouts, medical tests and treatment.

title: A Flawed Man as Lightning Rod and Empathetic Stumbler
description: A quarter-century ago, Roger Guenveur Smith cajoled his friend Spike Lee into writing him into the script for Do the Right Thing. (He played Smiley, the mentally disabled man clutching a photograph of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and Malcolm X.) Now Mr. Smith, who has since constructed stage monologues around figures like Huey P. Newton and Frederick Douglass, has turned his wry attentions to an even more ferocious racial conflagration, this one all too real.

title: Thailand Protests Are Captured in Social Media and Onstage
description: In the boldest move in two months of demonstrations against the government of Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra, Bangkoks central commercial district has been swarmed by antigovernment protesters, and on Tuesday, the second day of the so-called shutdown of the city and its consequences were widely tracked on social media.

title: Odds and Ends from the Detroit Auto Show
description: At the show, the spotlights are trained upon the next big things. But in the corners you can find oddities.

title: Infiniti Mixes Formula One With Red Bull
description: Introduced on Tuesday, Jan. 14: Infiniti Q50 Eau Rouge concept

title: Invitation to a Dialogue: An Angry Republican
Kerry Brushes Aside Israeli Officials Reported Criticisms of Peace Effort
description: KUWAIT  Secretary of State John Kerry brushed aside reports Wednesday that Israels defense minister has dismissed his Middle East peace push as nave and messianic, stressing that he was determined to continue his efforts to secure a peace treaty between Israel and the Palestinians.

title: Herb Alperts Next Gig in Manhattan: An Art Show
description: Herb Alpert, the musician, composer and record industry executive, is bringing his other passion  art  back to New York City. His giant totem sculptures are coming to New Yorks Dante Park later this month, and Mr. Alpert will also have an exhibit of smaller bronze totems at ACA Galleries in Chelsea, beginning Jan. 16.

title: Whats a Recess Appointment?
description: There was a lot of talk about the meaning of words at the Supreme Court on Monday  not exciting words like life, liberty, or equality, but more pedestrian words, like the, recess, and happen  as the justices considered for the first time what, exactly, the recess-appointments clause of the Constitution actually allows.

title: Voting Under Heavy Security in Egypt
description: Egyptians lined up to vote on a new constitution under the watch of the security forces and military leadership of Gen. Abdel Fattah el-Sisi. A bomb exploded early in the day, but no one was injured.

title: Prototype Sets Stage for New TLX
description: Introduced on Tuesday, Jan. 14: 2015 Acura TLX Prototype

title: Justices Raise Bar for Suing Foreign Companies
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Tuesday made it harder to sue foreign companies in American courts, prompting a justice in a concurrence to accuse the majority of creating a new rule of constitutional law that is unmoored from decades of precedent.

title: The Gun Report: January 14, 2014
description: Last week, Democratic Rep. Leslie Combs, a state representative from Kentucky, accidentally fired a gun in her Capitol Annex office. A House colleague, who was present at the time, said she was emptying a semi-automatic handgun and, thinking it was empty, pointed it away and down and pulled the trigger. No bullet fragments traveled outside the office.

title: Protests Over Mississippi Plant Follow Nissan to Detroit
description: DETROIT  Labor activists are using the larger stage of the North American International Auto Show to highlight complaints about conditions at Nissans plant in Canton, Miss. Before dawn on Monday, demonstrators from the United Automobile Workers stood in front of Cobo Center, where the show was being held, carrying yellow signs reading, Tell Nissan: Labor rights are civil rights.

title: Video: Despite Growing Military Budget, an Undercurrent of Skepticism
description: The continuing debate over military spending originated as a debate, at the time of the nations founding, over whether America should have a military at all. At the time even conservatives like John Adams and Alexander Hamilton, both partial to strong central government, had their doubts.

title: Sothebys Report Defends Chinese Scroll It Sold as Authentic
description: SHANGHAI  Sothebys said Tuesday that an ancient calligraphy scroll the auction house sold in September for $8.2 million was authentic, despite recent claims by a group of Chinese art historians who insisted it was likely a 19th-century reproduction.

title: Sled Dog Days
description: A look at sled dog racing, perhaps one of the first extreme sports, through the lens of the Times photography archive.

title: New Michael Lewis Book on Financial World Will Be Published in March
description: Michael Lewis, whose colorful reporting on money and excess on Wall Street has made him one of the countrys most popular business journalists, has written a new book on the financial world, his publisher said on Tuesday.

title: Johnny Knoxvilles Makeup Passes the Street Test
description: LOS ANGELES  Johnny Knoxville is not a member of the Academy, nor is the Jackass star likely to be anytime soon. But he could be part of an Oscar-nominated movie: Jackass Presents: Bad Grandpa, his feature-length hidden-camera comedy, is on the shortlist for best makeup. And Mr. Knoxville is very invested in its chances.

title: Sled Dog Days
description: Winter packed a punch last week. Most of the country hunkered down, taking shelter from the Arctic temperatures, but for dog sledding, the season has only just begun.

title: Coffee as a Memory Booster
description: In addition to its other well-known effects, a cup of coffee might improve your memory.

title: Cocktails Under an 18th-Century Fresco in Milan to Fete a New Star at T
description: WhoTs editor in chief, Deborah Needleman, hosted a mix of style connoisseurs, ranging from the fashion arbiters Suzy Menkes, Jim Moore and Tim Blanks, to some of their most illustrious Italian subjects: Diego Della Valle of Tods, Frida Giannini of Gucci and three generations of Missonis, including Rosita, Luca and Margherita.

title: Longtime Morgan Stanley Banker Said to Retire
description: LONDON  A longtime media and telecommunications banker at Morgan Stanley in London has decided to retire after 25 years with the investment bank, according to a person briefed on the matter.

title: Are Potential Cable Mergers Good for Consumers?
description: With the specter of consolidation looming over the cable operator industry, eyes are already turning to Washington, where regulators are bound to look closely at the antitrust issues surrounding any potential merger.

title: Federal Officials Return Looted Antiquities to India
description: Relations between India and the United States thawed a bit Tuesday as federal officials returned three stolen antiquities worth about $1.5 million to the Indian Consulate in New York, among them a 350-pound sandstone sculpture snatched from an Indian temple in 2009 that had been among Interpols Top 10 stolen works of art.

title: A Coupe for Cadillacs BMW-Battling Line
description: Introduced on Tuesday, Jan. 14: 2015 Cadillac ATS coupe

title: Tunisian Constitution, Praised for Balance, Nears Passage
description: TUNIS  Tunisias National Constituent Assembly is close to passing a new Constitution that legislators across the political spectrum, human rights organizations and constitutional experts are hailing as a triumph of consensus politics.

title: Heroes, Just for One Day
description: LOS ANGELES  Three of the top five grossing movies of 2013 involved superheroes  men in tights or high-tech suits or women who know their way around weaponry. (Thats Man of Steel, Iron Man 3 and the No. 1 grossing film, The Hunger Games: Catching Fire.) On Tuesday, the Academy announced that the theme for this years Oscars is movie heroes. Coincidence? Do you also believe bridges close for no reason?

title: Springsteen and Clapton to Headline New Orleans Jazz Festival
description: Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band, Eric Clapton, Phish and Christina Aguilera are among the artists who will headline this years New Orleans Jazz & Heritage Festival, its organizers said on Tuesday. The festival, which is celebrating its 45th anniversary and will be held at the Fair Grounds Race Course from April 25 through 27 and May 1 through 4, will also feature the Canadian indie-rock ensemble Arcade Fire (which will be fresh off its earlier headlining slot at the Coachella festival in California), as well as performers like Robin Thicke, Vampire Weekend, Robert Plant, Trey Songz, Public Enemy and Chaka Khan.

title: Bridgegate, Benghazi and the I.R.S. Scandals, Compared
description: Republicans with the unenviable task of defending Chris Christie seem to have been given talking points of the yeah, but what about variety. Over the last few days, many have tried to downplay the politically motivated traffic jam by comparing it to Benghazi and the allegation that the Internal Revenue Service targeted conservative groups.

title: Bobby Flays Next Course
description: Last month, on the day after he turned 49, Bobby Flay could be found where most of his fans expect him to be: racing around with a knife in a big room bathed in spotlights.

title: No Bluster as Christie Moves From Scandal to His Agenda
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, scrambling to regain his political footing, delivered a high-stakes State of the State address on Tuesday that mixed arms-length expressions of contrition, a defiant assertion that his troubles are no excuse for inaction and a jarringly timed demand for bipartisanship.

title: Appeals Court Opinion Rejecting F.C.C. Net Neutrality Rules
description: A federal appeals court threw out Federal Communications Commission rules that require Internet service providers to give all traffic equal access through their networks.

title: Black Sabbaths 1970s Albums to Be Sold on iTunes
description: The very short list of high-profile artists whose music is not on digital services just got a little shorter with the arrival of Black Sabbaths classic 1970s albums on iTunes.

title: Tours for the Younger Traveler
description: As a traveler, Im in a transition zone. I used to just show up in place with a backpack, a Rough Guide and not much else. The planning was always vague because anything else defeated the point: Tomorrow, who knew?

title: Always Journeying to Someplace New Gets Old Fast
description: In his early years, Daniel Klein darted through Europe like a bird of passage, moving from town to town under the same vagabond spell that draws so many young backpackers today.

title: Text of Christies State of the State Address
description: The following is the text of Gov. Chris Christies State of the State address, as prepared for delivery.

title: Mens Milan Fashion Week: DSquared2 Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Sarah Aubel.

title: Oddities From the Corners of the Detroit Auto Show
description: The press days of auto shows are well known for their bright lights, loud music and hordes of journalists scrambling for the position most advantageous for executive interviews and photos. But only during news conferences. Along the fringes, often in a corridor, visitors to any auto show can often find the strange and interesting.

title: Nader, an Adversary of Capitalism, Now Fights as an Investor
description: The next step is to organize the shareholders. Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, was on the phone, outlining to me his latest cause: plunging into capitalisms muddy waters and fighting for shareholder rights.

title: Snowden to Join Board of the Freedom of the Press Foundation
description: Washington  Edward J. Snowden, the former National Security Agency contractor whose leaks of secret documents set off a national and global debate about government spying, is joining the board of a nonprofit organization co-founded by Daniel Ellsberg, the well-known leaker of the Pentagon Papers during the Vietnam War.

title: A Warhol Show at a Dali Museum
description: The Pop artist and the Surrealist, who were once acquainted, meet again when the Dali Museum in St. Petersburg, Fla., stages Warhol: Art. Fame. Mortality, Jan. 18 through April 27.

title: A Feverish Welcome for Indian Diplomat in Hometown of Mumbai
description: MUMBAI  For the crowd of about 60 people waiting at the airport here on Tuesday for Devyani Khobragade, the Indian diplomat who was indicted in the United States on charges of visa fraud, the gathering was as much a show of support for Ms. Khobragade as it was a protest against the Americans who, in their view, had humiliated her and her country.

title: Pictures of the Day: Egypt and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Egypt, South Sudan, Central African Republic and Pakistan.

title: Bridging the Gap Between BlackBerry and iPhone
description: Despite the popularity of touch-screen smartphones, some BlackBerry users have clung to their phones equipped with tactile keyboards. For those reluctant to let go of their BlackBerry, Typo Keyboard is here to help with the transition to a touch screen.

title: Mets Costume Institute to Be Renamed for Anna Wintour
description: When it reopens in May, the Metropolitan Museum of Arts fabled Costume Institute will be renamed the Anna Wintour Costume Center.

title: Listen to What Your Plants Have to Say
description: Some gardeners swear by talking to their plants to help them grow; now, those plants can talk back.

title: Documents Spur British Inquiry Over 1984 Raid at Indian Shrine
description: LONDON  Thirty years after Indian troops stormed the Golden Temple at Amritsar, leaving hundreds dead, the British government said Tuesday that it would open an investigation after the release of documents suggesting that British special forces had helped to draw up a plan to attack the building.

title: Is Marriage Promotion Possible?
description: Now that theres actually some slight movement in the Republican Party in the direction suggested by Grand New Party,the book I co-authored with Reihan Salamway back in the misty days of 2007-2008, I suppose I should be grateful to Slates Matt Yglesias for doing his part to make our ideas seem as reactionary as possible. In a post accusing conservatives of having a phantom agenda on marriage promotion, Yglesias raises the question of how, exactly, a movement usually suspicious of governments effectiveness expects the state to somehow intervene effectively in peoples most intimate decisions, and then offers the following reading of our book:

title: Life as a Jewish Ghost in Modern Germany
description: Yascha Mounks book about growing up Jewish in Germany, Stranger in My Own Country, is rickety, not fully assembled, more the frame of a book than the sanded and stained product. Mr. Mounk is a young graduate student at Harvard, born in 1982, and his book is learned but at times not so wise.

title: Another Democrat in Tight House District Wont Run Again
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Bill Owens, a Democrat who has clung to his seat in a politically divided district along New York States Canadian border by narrowly winning his last two re-election fights, said on Tuesday that he would not run for a third full term.

title: The Politics of the Binding of Isaac
description: Take now your son, your only son Isaac, whom you love, and go to the land of Moriah; and offer him there for a burnt offering on one of the mountains which I will tell you.  Genesis, 22:2.

title: Ad Hits Kay Hagan on Health Care
description: Senator Kay Hagan of North Carolina is among the Democrats whom Americans for Prosperity is targeting, appealing to dissatisfaction with the Affordable Care Act.

title: Mutual Funds in the Fourth Quarter of 2013
description: Highlights of mutual fund performance.

title: Judge Reinstates Some Federal Oversight of Voting Practices for an Alabama City
description: WASHINGTON  A federal judge in Alabama on Monday reinstated federal oversight over the voting practices of a city there, in what election law specialists said was the first such move since the Supreme Court struck down part of the Voting Rights Act in June.

title: Motherlode Must-Read: The Baby Chase: How Surrogacy Is Transforming the American Family
description: The Baby Chase: How Surrogacy Is Transforming the American Family, by Leslie Morgan Steiner, was among the best books on family from 2013. Ive been meaning to share it with you for some time, and Amy Kleins post about donor eggs (Would a Pregnancy Through a Donor Egg Feel Like Mine?) and the resulting discussion of the medicine and ethics of egg donation, and in particular overseas egg donation, provided a perfect opportunity. If youre at all curious about egg donation and surrogacy (in fact, if youre just a curious reader at all), The Baby Chase makes a fascinating read.

title: Behind the Olympics: Teaching About Russia in the Putin Era
description: Overview | What is it about Russia and the Olympics? Back in 1980, some 65 nations including the United States boycotted the Summer Games in Moscow (PDF) over the invasion of Afghanistan by the communist-led Soviet Union, as Russia was then known. Thirty-four years later, the athletes are returning  this time to the Black Sea resort of Sochi for the 22nd Winter Olympics  and so is the controversy.

title: Ad Hits Patrick Murphy on Health Care
description: Representative Patrick Murphy of Florida is among the Democrats whom Americans for Prosperity is targeting, appealing to dissatisfaction with the Affordable Care Act.

title: Los Angeles Opera to Present Figaro Trilogy
description: Opera fans will be able to trace the development of one its most famous characters, Figaro, from barber to bridegroom to older-but-still-wily servant next season when the Los Angeles Opera presents its Figaro Trilogy.

title: A Visitors Luxury Room
description: The first time I ate at Villard Michel Richard, the latest restaurant to dance among the frescoes and marble pilasters of the Villard mansion in Midtown, I strongly suspected that I was in an awful hotel restaurant.

title: Living in Rowayton, Conn.
description: In this 1.4-square-mile coastal village in Norwalk, Conn., the most coveted homes are near the downtown, on the water, or in a beach association.

title: Where Norwalk and Darien Collide
description: The coastal village of Rowayton, in Norwalk, is no place for anonymity. A 1.4-square-mile peninsula that hooks into Long Island Sound as if anchoring the entire city, it packs so much into so little space that running into neighbors on the narrow streets, in the compact parks, and along the single commercial strip is both inevitable and heartily encouraged by an energetic civic association.

title: Ad Hits Joe Garcia on Health Care
description: Representative Joe Garcia of Florida is among the Democrats whom Americans for Prosperity is targeting, appealing to dissatisfaction with the Affordable Care Act.

title: Art Matters | Two Downtown Manhattan Gallerists Join Forces Upstate
description: Retrospective, the newest art gallery in the hamlet of Hudson, N.Y., inaugurated its space this past Saturday night with Gamblers Choice, a sold-out show of bright, cartoon-inflected paintings by the 27-year-old Brooklyn-based artist Jamian Juliano-Villani. Seemingly worlds away from the white-cube spaces of Chelsea two hours to the south, Retrospective features vintage checkerboard floors and a sculptural tree branch in the bathroom that serves as a toilet paper holder. The project is the brainchild of the art dealers Zach Feuer and Joel Mesler, fixtures of the New York and Los Angeles art worlds. Feuer, who moved upstate several years ago and commutes to his eponymous Chelsea gallery, says he wanted to try something outside the pressure cooker. Even Retrospectives name alludes to what Mesler, the owner of Untitled Gallery on the Lower East Side, called the speed of the art world  in which younger and younger artists land exhibitions surveying their already oversize careers. But Retrospective also sounds like an 80s rock band, he adds.

title: For 2 Wall Street Regulators, More Belt-Tightening
description: Two primary regulators of Wall Street are preparing, once again, to make the most of scarce resources.

title: Seeking Ways to Help the Poor and Childless
description: Last Friday at the Food Bank for New York on 116th Street, I caught a glimpse of the many shapes of need.

title: Unemployment Extension Is Stalled, With 2 Proposals Defeated in the Senate
description: WASHINGTON  Unemployment benefits for 1.3 million of the long-term unemployed  and millions more in the future  were imperiled on Tuesday after Senate efforts to reach accord on legislation to revive them collapsed in partisan finger-pointing.

title: A Major Renovation on the Doorstep of Queens
description: Created in 1909, Queens Plaza in Long Island City was intended as an attractive gateway to the borough for which it was named. But in more recent decades it became known as a haven for drug-dealing and prostitution and as a filthy, noisy eyesore where pedestrians risked their lives as they tried to cope with multiple lanes of traffic.

title: The Regency Bar & Grill, and More Restaurant Openings
description: Headliners

title: Obama to Place Some Restraints on Surveillance
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama will issue new guidelines on Friday to curtail government surveillance, but will not embrace the most far-reaching proposals of his own advisers and will ask Congress to help decide some of the toughest issues, according to people briefed on his thinking.

title: Unexpected Works, Familiar Composers
description: Some composers are so strongly associated with one genre that its easy to forget that they dallied in others. A lone string quartet is among the handful of nonvocal works in Verdis huge catalog. A Trio for Violin, Clarinet and Piano is one of only a few instrumental works by Gian Carlo Menotti, who composed dozens of operas and musical theater and choral works.

title: SPX Reaches Accord With Relational Over Board Seats
description: The SPX Corporation, an industrial equipment maker, said on Tuesday that it had struck an agreement with the activist investment fund Relational Investors that could give Relational up to two board seats over the next two years.

title: Clip: 'Generation War'
description: A scene from the film, directed by Philipp Kadelbach.

title: Those Ripples in the Water of the Bayou
description: Phil Robertson has run his mouth; an endless number of commentators have fumed or crowed about what he said; and now comes the day of decision. The first new episodes of A&Es Duck Dynasty since that controversy are being broadcast on Wednesday night, and people who were fans of the show before Mr. Robertsons attention-getting remarks about gays and blacks have to decide whether theyre still fans.

title: New Classical Notes From Underground
description: It used to be that the virtuoso pianist Yefim Bronfman was not someone you expected to encounter playing in a subterranean East Village club that houses all kinds of contemporary music. Mr. Bronfman has been known for brilliant accounts of mainstream Romantic piano concertos, like Tchaikovskys First, a work he played this September at Avery Fisher Hall with the New York Philharmonic.

title: A History Lesson, Airbrushed
description: Generation War, which was broadcast as a mini-series on German television last year, is perhaps more interesting as an artifact of the present than as a representation of the past. As the Second World War slips from living memory, as Germany asserts its dominant role in Europe with increasing confidence, and as long-suppressed information emerges from the archives of former Eastern bloc countries, the wars cultural significance for Germans has shifted.

title: The Echoes of War, From One Century to the Next
description: Context may not be everything in music but it can count for a lot. And the context for a performance of Shostakovichs imposing wartime Symphony No. 7 (Leningrad) at Carnegie Hall on Monday evening was cryptically hailed in its title: Shostakovich for the Children of Syria.

title: How Much Time Warner May Be Worth to a Suitor
description: Charter Communications says it is offering a full price for Time Warner Cable. At $132.50 a share, its proposal amounts to a 40 percent premium above where Time Warner Cables stock was trading in June, before rumors of a deal surfaced. We think a lot of the premium is already in the stock, Charters chief executive, Thomas M. Rutledge, told DealBook on Monday.

title: Oklahomas Ban on Gay Marriage Is Unconstitutional, Judge Rules
