Lobbyists are heartbroken  or not. Lisa Rosenberg falls into the former camp. Shes the government affairs consultant for the Sunlight Foundation in its long struggle to make the Senate abandon Dickensian ways of print and join the computer age, allowing constituents a far timelier look at campaign finance reports.

title: The Wrong Guidepost on Unemployment
description: Jared Bernstein is a senior fellow at the Center on Budget and Policy Priorities in Washington and a former chief economist to Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.

title: Poetry Profiles: Coffee House Press
description: The latest in a series of occasional profiles of poetry publishers. These questions were answered by Chris Fischbach, a longtime editor at Coffee House Press who became publisher in 2011.

title: How Banks Work, as Told by ABN Amros Chairman in Drag
description: In his former life as the finance minister for the Netherlands, Gerrit Zalm was known for his serious demeanor. But as chairman of ABN Amro, he has taken on a decidedly lighter tone on occasion.

title: Westminsters New Agility Trial to Include Mixed Breeds
description: Alfie is an athletic, charming 7-year-old poodle-terrier who, because of his mixed heritage, cannot compete in the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show, which is for purebred dogs.

title: In Defeat for Tea Party, House Passes $1.1 Trillion Spending Bill
description: WASHINGTON  The House voted overwhelmingly on Wednesday, 359 to 67, to approve a $1.1 trillion spending bill for the current fiscal year, shrugging off the angry threats of Tea Party activists and conservative groups whose power has ebbed as Congress has moved toward fiscal cooperation.

title: CUNY Picks James Milliken as New Chancellor
description: The City University of New York, the countrys third largest public university system, turned to Nebraska for its next leader on Wednesday, choosing James B. Milliken, a onetime New York lawyer and longtime college administrator, as its chancellor.

title: How to Choose an Air Travel Search Site
description: Which airline booking sites offer the cheapest airfares?

title: With Dodgers, Clayton Kershaw Becomes First $200 Million Pitcher
description: Clayton Kershaw won two National League Cy Young Awards, three earned run average titles and two strikeout titles and made three trips to the playoffs before turning 26 years old. Now he has another distinction: Kershaw is baseballs first $200 million pitcher.

title: Some Girls Just Know Things
description: Before people are even seated for Bronx Gothic at Danspace Project, Okwui Okpokwasili is moving. Her back to the audience, she does a shimmying, herky-jerky kind of dance. It seems like a private ritual, a gathering of forces or, maybe, a summoning of the muse. And it goes on so long, 20 minutes or so, that you worry shell knock herself out. Or exhaust your patience.

title: Romance Novelist Wins Big Valentine
description: St. Martins Press is making a very big bet that Americans are still hot and heavy for romance novels.

title: Paris Mens Fashion Week: Haider Ackermann Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Virtuoso Poignancy Unfettered by Concepts
description: For more than 30 years, the known quantity of attending Puccinis La Bohme at the Metropolitan Opera has been Franco Zeffirellis colorful, minutely detailed and popular production. Audiences erupted with amazed ahs and applause when the curtain first went up in 1981 on the Act II scene depicting the Caf Momus and the milling crowds (with some 240 choristers and extras) on a hilly street in the Latin Quarter of Paris. The audience did so again when La Bohme returned to the Met stage on Tuesday night.

title: Tenement Museum to Expand Its Space and Programming in Nearby Building
description: Visitors who enter 97 Orchard Street on the Lower East Side walk into a different century.

title: Pictures of the Day: India and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Syria, Indonesia, Israel and India.

title: Carlyle Said to Strike Deal for Johnson & Johnson Testing Division
description: The Carlyle Group has all but clinched a deal to buy Johnson & Johnsons clinical testing arm for about $4.1 billion after several weeks of negotiations, a person briefed on the matter said on Wednesday.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Dorsey on Disrupting Receipts, and Implications of the Net Neutrality Ruling
description: Every day, The New York Timess staff scours the web for interesting and peculiar items.

title: Unkempt Yet Profound, a Cult Band Returns for More Interpretation
description: JERSEY CITY  After a 15-year absence, the reunited Neutral Milk Hotel could have satisfied its fans at the Loews Jersey Theater here on Tuesday night with a rote run-through of the music it recorded in the 1990s. But the band did more than that: It revved up and magnified all the impulses that collide in Jeff Mangums songs, which have continued to collect and baffle fans since Neutral Milk Hotel released its last studio album, In the Aeroplane Over the Sea, in 1998. The band used to play clubs; now it is headlining sold-out theaters.

title: Woodson Offers Clues to Most Recent Benching of Smith
description: The big mistake was to assume that there had been some resolution to the J. R. Smith soap opera. Instead, it continued after Coach Mike Woodson benched Smith in the Knicks loss to the Charlotte Bobcats on Tuesday night.

title: 5 Years Later, Still Feeling Impact of Plane Down in the Hudson
description: Plane down in the Hudson. No sign of it at 42nd and 12th Avenue. Where was it? Moving downstream, or downtown, fast.

title: Can Heavier People Really Be Healthier?
description: Scientists call it the obesity paradox, the notion that being overweight or moderately obese lowers the risk of an early death. They have documented the phenomenon in large population studies and in groups of patients with chronic diseases like hypertension and Type 2 diabetes.

title: Twenty Years On, an Icy Rivalry Still Has Heat
description: The Price of Gold, making its debut on Thursday in ESPNs 30 for 30 series, is a serious documentary about the 1994 kneecapping (to use President Obamas word) of the figure skater Nancy Kerrigan by thugs who later said they were in league with her great rival, Tonya Harding.

title: Lockout Over, Minnesota Orchestra Faces Challenges as It Salvages Its Season
description: The end of the corrosive 15-month lockout of the Minnesota Orchestra on Tuesday was greeted with relief by musicians, management and fans, who took to the Save Our Symphony Minnesota Facebook page and other websites to praise the impending return of music to Orchestra Hall.

title: Times Minute | Why Birds Fly in V's
description: Also on the Minute, more relief aid for Syria and the model Karolina Kurkova's career beyond the runway.

title: Go Big and Tell the Truth
description: MILAN  A woman, looking at the fall mens shows here, feels cheated. Pullovers are big this season, but a woman would be lucky to find one in the vegetable-tone colors that Massimo Piombo offered, and with the nice touch of extra-wide ribbing, a detail that transformed his Shetlands into something special.

title: Times Minute | Why Birds Fly in Vs
description: In the Video

title: What Do Students Need Most? More Sleep
description: When I travel around to schools to speak to students, I deliver one line in my talk that kills, each and every time. The students do not simply laugh, they whoop and holler, throw their heads back in open-mouthed guffaws and shake their heads in disbelief. I would love to lay claim to the funniest educator joke of all time, but sadly, I dont have that kind of comic game. Im not even aiming for their funny bone when I proclaim, In order to function at your mental and physical best, adolescents should be getting at least nine hours of sleep a night.

title: Detroit Symphony Agrees to New Contract With Musicians
description: The Detroit Symphony Orchestra, which endured a bitter six-month strike a few years ago, settled its latest contract eight months early, orchestra officials announced Wednesday.

title: Not So Golden
description: It was not a particularly good night for women over 60 at the Golden Globes on Sunday, and not just because Meryl Streep (64) lost to Amy Adams (39), Judi Dench (79) lost to Cate Blanchett (44), and June Squibb (84) lost to Jennifer Lawrence (23).

title: Hustle, Gravity and Slave Jump to Fore in Oscar Race
description: LOS ANGELES  Oscar voters set up a three-way slugfest on Thursday, with the visual wizardry and box office might of Gravity going up against the historical heft of 12 Years a Slave and the 1970s-era hairdos and cleavage of American Hustle.

title: The (Auction) House Doesnt Always Win
description: When Christies sold Jeff Koonss Balloon Dog (Orange) for $58.4 million in November, it seemed as if the auction house had just earned a pretty penny.

title: Raf Simons: Fall 2014 Menswear
description: Paris

title: Even Jeans Need a Break Once in a While
description: So, jeans are over? It was announced last week that Gwen Stefani was collaborating with Michael Glasser, the man behind 7 for All Mankind and other denim labels, on a line of nondenim pants, the aim being to replace the jeans in our closets with casual, sort-of-slouchy trousers. Unlikely as it is that well be jettisoning our jeans anytime soon, it could be said that, in 2014, they do look a little ... safe. Should you want to give your precious denim a break, here are our six style essentials: 1. black trousers with a bit of souped-up detail, like this Acne pair with knee patches, to wear interchangeably with black jeans; 2. prints that could be crazy vacation pants but also cool with a big sweater and parka on the weekend; 3. leather in a new relaxed shape; 4. pants in an unexpected color, for work and beyond; 5. cropped pants to wear with heels (a little ankle is always sexy); and 6. a chic pair of white pants, for evening.

title: Buyer of $142.4 Million Bacon Triptych Identified as Elaine Wynn
description: The mystery began the moment a telephone bidder bought Francis Bacons triptych Three Studies of Lucian Freud for $142.4 million at Christies New York in November.

title: Trials for U.S. World Youth Team
description: At the trials to select the United States entries for this years World Youth Teams Championships in Istanbul, Jimmy Wang, Erli Zhou, Edmund Wu and William Zhu had two chances to qualify for the under-26 open event. After losing the USA-1 final to Adam Kaplan, Zach Brescoll, Marius Agica, Owen Lien, and the brothers Adam and Zach Grossack, they played 48 boards against the winners of the match between the losing semifinalists: Greg Herman, Anam Tebha, Drew Cavalier and Alex Hudson.

title: Walking in Paint-Spattered Footsteps
description: Lisa Cooley stood for a moment, a crowd of museumgoers swarming around her, looking at a black-and-white photograph of Jasper Johns paintings installed at the Galerie Ileana Sonnabend in Paris in 1962. But when she spoke, it was not about the quality of the work displayed, the era in which it was made or even about the artist who created it.

title: Emails Raising Questions About the Polanski Case
description: LOS ANGELES  Internal court emails have raised new questions about the conduct of the judges in the statutory rape case against the film director Roman Polanski.

title: Public Hospitals Hope to Attract More Upscale Patients Under Affordable Care Act
description: Todd Obolsky lives in a studio apartment in Manhattan, drives a leased Toyota Corolla and occasionally splurges on experimental cuisine in the East Village. When the Affordable Care Act allowed him to buy insurance for the first time in years, he was so price-sensitive that $30 a month made a difference in which plan he picked.

title: After Hours | A Bronx Schoolyard Rivalry, Told Through Dance
description: The new year is kicking off with a host of dance and performance festivals, including Abrons Arts Centers American Realness, the Public Theaters Under the Radar and P.S. 122s Coil. Last night, at Danspace Project, Coil debuted Bronx Gothic,a mesmerizing and sometimes harrowing solo piece, long in the making, by the writer and dance artist Okwui Okpokwasili. Raised in the Bronx by Nigerian immigrant parents, Okpokwasili has collaborated with the conceptual artist and choreographer Ralph Lemon and appeared in films including I Am Legend. She begins this show even before the audience has settled in, quaking in a corner, her back to the crowd.

title: Pointing a Finger on Facebook
description: Itay Hod has been a journalist for more than 15 years. He has reported on health issues for NY1, done segments for CBS News on gay rights, covered the Oscars for Logo, and written articles for The Daily Beast about lesbian pornographers and American Idol winners.

title: Baryshnikov Plans Fund-Raising to Give Artists Space
description: Mikhail Baryshnikov, the founder and artistic director of the Baryshnikov Arts Center, is opening a campaign to raise $1 million for artistic fellowships named for the composer John Cage (1912-92) and the choreographer Merce Cunningham (1919-2009). The effort, to be announced on Thursday, is intended to give artists a place to work, specifically in Studio 6A, a 43-foot-by-43-foot top-floor space at the Baryshnikov Center in Midtown Manhattan.

title: After Crisis, Iceland Holds a Tight Grip on Its Banks
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland  An angular glass building on the waterfront here used to be the headquarters of a banking giant with operations in Europe, North America and the Middle East.

title: Obama's Remarks in North Carolina
description: During a visit to Raleigh, President Obama spoke about manufacturing.

title: How to Make Smart Televisions a Little Less Dumb
description: They all looked the same. Rectangular, thin, bright and blaring.

title: That Nose, That Chin, Those Lips
description: When Nino Dean looks in the mirror, the face staring back at him is eerily evocative of Vanessa Paradis, the French chanteuse and former paramour of Johnny Depp.

title: Beauty News
description: With the new year comes a number of new ways to pamper yourself.

title: A.P. Cameraman Detained in Egypt After His Images Appear on Al Jazeera
description: A cameraman covering the constitutional referendum in Egypt for The Associated Press was arrested on Wednesday while transmitting live video from a polling place in Cairo.

title: Police Chief Says 12-Year-Old Gunman Planned Attack in New Mexico
description: The head of the state police in New Mexico said Wednesday that the 12-year-old suspect in the shooting at a Roswell middle school had planned the attack but chose his victims at random. Two students, an 11-year-old boy and a 13-year-old girl, were seriously wounded after they were shot inside the schools gym around 8 a.m. Tuesday.

title: Openings and Events for the Week of Jan. 16
description: Openings and Events

title: H.I.V.-Positive Person, Told Otherwise, Is Being Sought
description: For the last six weeks, Walter Reed National Military Medical Center has been engaged in a highly unusual effort to identify an individual who is H.I.V. positive but was wrongly informed that he or she was H.I.V. negative after a mix-up of blood samples taken at the hospital.

title: Washington Post and Politico Talk About a Rift
description: Top editors at The Washington Post and Politico tried on Wednesday to mend a rift between the two news organizations.

title: School Discipline: What Works Best?
description: To the Editor:

title: Port Authority Politics
description: To the Editor:

title: Children in Poverty
description: To the Editor:

title: College Athletes in Class
description: To the Editor:

title: Asking More of Students
description: To the Editor:

title: Popes View of Women
description: To the Editor:

title: The Global Village Rolled Up in a Carpet
description: This week at the International Furniture Fair in Cologne, Germany, Danskina, the Dutch rug company, is presenting its first collection under its new design director, Hella Jongerius.

title: Look Before You Climb
description: Maison Martin Margiela, the Paris-based fashion house founded by the reclusive Belgian designer, who parted ways with the business in 2009, has an idiosyncratic, avant-garde style that can go anywhere. Collaborating with LAtelier dExercices, a French company, the design team is producing objects for the home that mix irony, mystery and humor, such as eggs filled with fortune-cookie-type messages and a melted wax candleholder. One of the groups favored memes is trompe loeil, and it has created a series of black-and-white photographs of architectural details, which are printed on an easily repositioned adhesive fabric. The latest, an atmospheric staircase, would add wit and misdirection to any room and bring a new dimension to a cramped studio apartment. The mural measures 7.4 feet by 3.9 feet and is $320. Information: 888-266-1737 or sweetbellausa.com. or at Top Hat, 245 Broome Street, 212-677-4240.

title: Where Are the Jellyfish, Exactly?
description: How to add a swimming pool with an ocean view to an inland suburban retreat? Put it on the roof. When designing the Jellyfish House, a summer home for a Dutch family in the coastal town of Marbella, Spain, Wiel Arets, an architect with offices in the Netherlands and Switzerland, turned the pool into a central feature of the three-story building by elevating it.

title: Perfection By the Book
description: Jessica Lamb-Shapiro began writing her new book, Promise Land (Simon & Schuster; $25), as a way to make sense of the immense body of self-help literature, from the dawn of religion to modern home management. Wildly funny, it takes a few dark turns as well.

title: Pro-Progressive Is Better Than Anti-Christie
description: Were a week into Chris Christie Bridgegate and Im already bored, not because I dont think the truth should be ferreted out in the bright light of day, but because the political discussion about it appears to be devolving into pettiness.

title: The Power Behind the Throne
description: What youll need to replace your toilet.

title: Whose Mall Is It?
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  LAST Saturday, security officers stopped two tall young black men at the entrance of JK Iguatemi, a luxury shopping mall in So Paulo. The young men were wearing flashy tennis shoes and brand-new soccer jerseys. What are you doing here? I heard the guards ask. We came to buy something, explained one. My cousin here is a soccer player. From Bragantino.

title: Seizing the Throne
description: A few months ago the strangest thing happened with two of our toilets. The water level on both lagged well below normal, even though the pipes were clear. We assumed that the problem was in our septic system. Our plumber suspected otherwise.

title: Walmart Is Facing Claims That It Fired Protesters
description: The National Labor Relations Board, in a sweeping complaint filed on Wednesday, said that Walmart illegally disciplined and fired employees after strikes and protests for better pay.

title: Cultivating Hudson: Enter the Tastemakers
description: HUDSON, N.Y.  Ann Marie Gardner has a buzzword for the urban-rural confluence she sees fueling this towns most recent boomlet as a cultural hub. Rurbanism, as she describes it, is when urban expats bring their cultural touchstones and appetites with them when they move to a place like Hudson.

title: Puzzle of Super Bowl Security Has to Include New Pieces
description: As is the case for other major sporting events, securing the Super Bowl is a complex and nerve-racking task that involves the coordination of many law enforcement agencies, the use of technologies like cameras and radiation detectors, and the identification of potential troublemakers.

title: The Coldest Yard
description: LOS ANGELES  IF I were to attack you and slam you to the ground as you stood in line for your morning coffee, you might not get up. But if I put a helmet on you and put you on a football field, then did the exact same thing, youd pop up and ask for another. There is something powerful about football, something that grants men temporary invincibility, makes them immune to pain and anguish.

title: Sheila Guyse, Singer and Star in Race Movies, Dies at 88
description: Sheila Guyse, a popular actress and singer who appeared on Broadway and in so-called race movies in the 1940s and 50s, and who for a time, despite limited opportunities in the entertainment industry, appeared headed for broader fame, died on Dec. 28 in Honolulu. She was 88.

title: Have Your Job and Moonlight, Too
description: ALMOST a century ago, a hit song lamented the difficulty in persuading American soldiers who saw the world during the Great War to return to their rural homes. The title said it all: How Ya Gonna Keep Em Down on the Farm? (After Theyve Seen Paree).

title: Weighing In at the End
description: Three-Fourths of an Ounce, a new line of condolence products including memorial candles and jewelry, is named after measurements taken by the early 1900s Massachusetts doctor Duncan MacDougall. After studying terminally ill people and euthanized dogs, he concluded that a body lost three-quarters of an ounce at the moment of death, so a soul must weigh that much. (Scientists, however, have since discredited his methods and data.) The designer Ted Muehling has contributed polished quartz ovals ($200 each) that weigh, yes, 0.75 ounces. His staff grinds the stones at a workshop behind his Manhattan boutique, on machines with wet sandpaper wheels that emit mournful sounds as they spin. Mr. Muehling, who was brought up Catholic, said the translucent stones remind him of his childhood image of the soul as an internal vapor that grows cloudier with every sin. The polished talismans are also ecumenically reminiscent of crystal orbs that Buddhist temple statues carry and pebbles that Jews place on gravestones. Information: 3-4oz.com.

title: Theft at Target Leads Citi to Replace Debit Cards
description: Citibank plans to reissue all customer debit cards involved in the data breach at Target, making it the second major bank to do so since the attack was disclosed last month.

title: Sales at Ralo Tibet Carpet, Jayson Home and Others
description: During Ralo Tibet Carpets warehouse sale, through Sunday, many rugs are up to 70 percent off (a 6-by-9-foot Trellis Red rug, regularly $7,130, is $3,565); 29 Howard Street (Broadway), 212-966-7661, tibetcarpet.com.

title: Pendant Lamps: Theater of Suspension
description: Will Meyer and Gray Davis consider themselves maniacs about the lighting in the spaces they design. If nothing else, Mr. Meyer, 45, said, It needs to make people look attractive.

title: Should We Install Underfloor Heat in the Bathroom?
description: Q. Our bathroom is always colder than the rest of our house. Should we install underfloor radiant heating when we remodel?

title: Giants Fire Two Longtime Assistants
description: The sweeping shake-up of the Giants offensive brain trust continued Wednesday when the longtime assistants Mike Pope and Jerald Ingram were fired.

title: Yahoo Parts Ways With Its No. 2 Executive
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Yahoos No. 2 executive, Henrique de Castro, has been fired by his boss, Marissa Mayer, a little more than a year after she wooed him away from Google to help her turn around the struggling Internet company.

title: Federal Contracts Plunge, Squeezing Private Companies
description: The big business of Washington  federal contract work  is losing some steam.

title: Phones in Subway: On Elevated Lines, Hear the Future
description: Slang and Mandarin commingle on the No. 7 line during the evening rush, and teenagers arrange their meeting spots by text on the N at Coney Island, the Wonder Wheel rising through train car windows at sunset.

title: Far West Got Drier Last Year, Data Shows
description: Drought conditions in California and elsewhere in the Far West intensified last year, government scientists said Wednesday, adding to concerns about water supplies in the region.

title: Lebanese Bombers Death, and Life, Leave Questions
description: HNAIDER, Lebanon  The last time his mother saw him, he joined the family for dawn prayers as usual. A few hours later, the 19-year-old engineering student had vanished. No one saw him leave, his cellphone was off and text messages went unanswered.

title: Ken Landwehr, Who Played Key Role in Capture of Serial Killer, Dies at 59
description: Lt. Ken Landwehr, a homicide detective in Wichita, Kan., who played a pivotal role in the capture of the serial killer known as B.T.K., whose terrorizing spree went unredressed for more than 30 years, died at his home on Monday in Wichita. He was 59.

title: In N.F.L. Suit, Judge Flags Provision Protecting N.C.A.A.
description: The federal judge who rejected the N.F.L.s concussion lawsuit settlement Tuesday raised a fundamental concern about the deal: whether the $765 million set aside for payouts and medical testing would be enough over the suits 65-year life.

title: The State of the Speeches
description: Lets discuss state of the state speeches.

title: New York City to Pay $18 Million Over Convention Arrests
description: New York City will pay nearly $18 million to settle civil rights lawsuits filed on behalf of roughly 1,600 people who claimed they were wrongfully swept up in mass arrests during the 2004 Republican National Convention, lawyers for the city and plaintiffs said on Wednesday.

title: U.S. to Expand Rules Limiting Use of Profiling by Federal Agents
description: The Justice Department will significantly expand its definition of racial profiling to prohibit federal agents from considering religion, national origin, gender and sexual orientation in their investigations, a government official said Wednesday.

title: Dissent, Guns & Ammo
description: It was a rare peek behind the Oz-like curtain of gun journalism in its role as the gun industrys mouthpiece: A respected columnist was dismissed from Guns & Ammo magazine in October after he dared to write the obvious  that all constitutional rights, including the right to bear arms, are and need to be subject to legitimate regulation. This was heresy for Second Amendment absolutists.

title: False Reasons for Filibustering Jobless Aid
description: Republican senators are pulling out every fake excuse they can think of for filibustering an extension of jobless benefits for the long-term unemployed on Tuesday. The majority leader, Harry Reid, was mean to us and wouldnt let us offer amendments, they say. Democrats refused to pay for the benefits. Its President Obamas fault people cant find work because he wont approve the Keystone XL oil pipeline.

title: Hauling Bags and Cleaning Planes for Little Pay and No Vacations of Their Own
description: Norman Echeverris life once glowed with promise. He held a job at a company in Medelln, Colombia, had a car, laughed, played cards with friends.

title: Chinese Activists Test New Leader and Are Crushed
description: BEIJING  The 20 or so activists gathered at an isolated guesthouse on the outskirts of the capital, leaving their cellphones behind to avoid detection by the police. Chinas first leadership change in a decade was fast approaching, and the group saw an opening for a movement to fight injustice and official corruption.

title: A Disappointing Internet Decision
description: In a discouraging ruling, a federal appeals court on Tuesday struck down regulations that prohibited phone and cable companies from charging different rates for delivering different types of content to consumers or even blocking certain content.

title: A Culture of Violence
description: In the South Pacific island nation of Papua New Guinea, one of the worlds most violent places, nearly every woman has experienced some form of domestic abuse.

title: Mixed Results for Mideast Democracy
description: A constitution is supposed to be a set of governing principles around which citizens can unite and peacefully build a democratic state. Tunisia is providing a constructive path to this goal. Egypt is not. Sadly, Egypt is on the verge of enacting a Constitution that would effectively legitimize last years coup and further enable the kind of authoritarian system that the 2011 revolution was intended to displace.

title: Long-Running D.C. Show Faces a Major Plot Twist
description: WASHINGTON  This weeks news that Representative George Miller, Democrat of California, is planning to retire at the end of the year reverberated around the House of Representatives, where Mr. Miller has served since 1975.

title: Fuchsia Would Have Killed Her
description: To please a friend, a designer with an aversion to color decided she could stomach turquoise.

title: Just for You, Blue
description: What do you do when you love bright color but dont want to be overwhelmed by it? Hire a designer who works almost entirely in white.

title: A Fine Line Between Summer Sizzle and Too Darn Hot
description: As the soccer world sweats and frets at the prospect of a summer World Cup in Qatar, the rest of the sports world gets on with business at usual: making elite athletes perform in extreme heat.

title: Illinois: Diocese Releases Papers on Abuse by Priests
description: The Catholic Archdiocese of Chicago released 6,000 pages of documents on sexually abusive priests on Wednesday to victims lawyers. The files pertain to 30 priests, 14 of whom are dead and all removed from ministry. Most of the abuse occurred before the mid-1990s. The archdiocese said in a statement that it did not hide abuse or protect abusers, and that it reported all the cases to the civil authorities. But victims lawyers said the documents showed a pattern of covering up. The archdiocese agreed to release the documents in 2006 during settlements with victims, but it took eight years to negotiate thedetails. The lawyers plan to release the documents next week.

title: Obama on Surveillance Through the Years
description: Throughout his political career, President Obama has expressed a range of views on balancing national security needs with personal rights and freedoms.

title: As Inquiry Widens, Port Authority Chief May Lose His Low Profile
description: He has been a close adviser to three New Jersey governors and was appointed state attorney general by a fourth. He was a co-founder of one of the states largest law firms. And for two years he has led the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey. Yet outside of New Jersey political and legal circles, David Samson, 74, has steadfastly maintained a low profile.

title: How Brave Girls Helped Crack a Taboo
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  For a window into rape culture, consider an 11-year-old girl named Flevian, who says that her grandfather has been raping her almost daily since she was in the first grade.

title: Obamas Path From Critic to Overseer of Spying
description: WASHINGTON  As a young lawmaker defining himself as a presidential candidate, Barack Obama visited a center for scholars in August 2007 to give a speech on terrorism. He described a surveillance state run amok and vowed to rein it in. That means no more illegal wiretapping of American citizens, he declared. No more national security letters to spy on citizens who are not suspected of a crime.

title: What Some Waiters Never See
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  Solving crossword puzzles sometimes feels to me like Im watching a magic trick being performed. If its a particularly clever idea, like the one we have today by Elizabeth A. Long, you might even want to applaud when you tumble to the trick or get to the reveal.

title: School in India Ensnared in U.S. Diplomatic Spat
description: NEW DELHI  A handout for new teachers at this citys exclusive American Embassy School, an academic oasis for children of American diplomats and other expatriates, offers some unusual guidance to female teachers whose husbands will also be teaching at the school.

title: Israels Efforts to Limit Use of Holocaust Terms Raise Free-Speech Questions
description: JERUSALEM  Israel is on the brink of banning the N-word. N as in Nazi, that is.

title: Corrections: January 16, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Van Is Found; Ties to Killing Are Sought
description: Investigators have located a minivan they believe may have been used to abduct a Brooklyn real estate developer who was killed this month, the police said on Wednesday.

title: Winning Powerball and Lottery Numbers for Jan. 15, 2014
Los Angeles Museum Names a New Director
description: LOS ANGELES  After a six-month search that fueled intense speculation, the Museum of Contemporary Art here has confirmed that Philippe Vergne, director of the Dia Art Foundation in New York, has been chosen as its new director.

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, January 16, 2014
description: Ive kept them warm when its cold, Ive kept them dry when its wet, and Ive fed them when theyre hungry.

title: A Quandary for Mexico as Vigilantes Rise
description: ANTNEZ, Mexico  Word spread quickly: The army was coming to disarm the vigilante fighters whom residents viewed as conquering heroes after they swept in and drove out a drug gang that had stolen property, extorted money and threatened to kill them. They even had to leave flowers and other offerings at a shrine to the gangs messianic leader.

title: Cuomo Has Raised Over $33 Million for Re-election Bid
description: As he prepares to seek re-election in November, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has already amassed more than $33 million to finance his bid for a second term, his campaign team said on Wednesday.

title: Early Tallies Show Revised Charter Passing in Egypt
description: CAIRO  A revised Constitution validating the military takeover in Egypt this past summer appeared headed for lopsided approval by more than 90 percent of the votes cast, according to early tabulations in the official and private news media on Thursday, as international monitors raised alarms about the fairness of the plebiscite.

title: Workers at an Amazon Warehouse Reject Forming a Union
description: In the first unionization vote ever held at an Amazon facility in the United States, a small group of technical workers at the companys warehouse in Middletown, Del., voted overwhelmingly on Wednesday against forming a union.

title: De Blasio Announces Steps to Reduce Traffic Deaths
description: Along a Queens corridor busy with traffic, Mayor Bill de Blasio took a moment on Wednesday to stand at the memorial of an 8-year-old boy killed by a turning truck steps from his school.

title: French Leaders Policy Proposals Seek Centrist Path
description: PARIS  President Franois Hollande startled the usually staid world of European economic policy with proposals to take France in a centrist direction with tax cuts for companies, reductions in public spending and a business-friendly tone.

title: For an Immigrant, a New Home Brings Comfort but Also Isolation
description: In 2002, Yefim Zadov, then 68, came to the United States from Ukraine, looking to change a life that had deteriorated into loneliness and poor health.

title: A 5-Foot-7 Ranger Makes Tremendous Strides
description: When Mats Zuccarello started this season with no points in seven games, there was enough consternation among Rangers coaches that he was a healthy scratch against the Philadelphia Flyers on Oct. 24.

title: China: Success Claimed in Test of Weapons-Delivery System
description: Chinas Defense Ministry said that it had successfully tested a glider that can travel many times the speed of sound, following a report in the online Washington Free Beacon. Such systems, lobbed high into the atmosphere and then guided down to a distant target, can be used to carry conventional or nuclear weapons past missile defense systems, which are designed to intercept slower missiles at lower altitudes or intercontinental ballistic missiles in space. The ministry said the system was not aimed at any specific country and gave no indication of whether China would deploy armed gliders.

title: Notes on Blindness (Audio Description)
description: After the writer John Hull became completely blind in 1983, he kept an audio diary of his experience. A short film by Peter Middleton and James Spinney is a dramatization using those recordings.

title: Notes on Blindness
description: After the writer John Hull became completely blind in 1983, he kept an audio diary of his experience. A short film by Peter Middleton and James Spinney is a dramatization using those recordings.

title: Notes on Blindness
description: After the writer John Hull became completely blind, he kept an audio diary of his experience. A short film by Peter Middleton and James Spinney is a dramatization using those recordings.

title: Steinbrenner Calls Alex Rodriguez an Asset
description: In his first public comments since Alex Rodriguezs drug-related suspension was reduced to 162 games, Hal Steinbrenner called Rodriguez an asset and did not rule out his return to the Yankees in 2015, when his suspension is supposed to end.

title: Notes on Blindness
description: After the writer John Hull became completely blind in 1983, he kept an audio diary of his experience. This short film is a dramatization using those recordings.

title: U.S. Olympian Explains Positive Test
description: Sarah Robles, an American Olympian who received a two-year suspension after testing positive for a banned substance, said the test result was because of a hormonal precursor supplement sometimes used in the course of medical treatment for polycystic ovary syndrome. I accept the conditions of my suspension, Robles said. I made a choice to take care of my health as advised by my doctor. She said she hoped to compete for a weight-lifting spot at the 2016 Summer Games in Rio de Janeiro.

title: Conference Championship Probabilities, and How the Patriots Run
description: The Patriots running game is finally getting its due. After a 234-yard, 6-touchdown explosion to defeat the Colts in the divisional round, the New England rushing attack is suddenly in the spotlight.

title: A Christies Auction Honors the Passing of a British Design Giant
description: Every now and then an auction comes along which throws light upon hidden secrets of the design world. On Jan. 22, Christies London will offer Michael Inchbald: A Legacy of Design, an auction of the varied estate of the talented (but in America, underappreciated) British designer who died last year at the age of 92. His career spanned nearly five decades and included many public and private commissions in the U.K. Among the most notable were the interiors of the Berkeley and Savoy Hotels and projects for the Duke of St. Albans and the filmmaker John Schlesinger (Darling, Marathon Man). Inchbald executed his interiors in diverse styles, ranging from 60s groovy to richly baronial. Throughout all of his work, however, there are unexpected juxtapositions of objects and a deep understanding of the role of lighting to create atmosphere.

title: Matching Jewelry Is Anything but Stuffy
description: Matching your bracelet to your necklace may sound old-fashioned. But the demi-parure  the classic coordinating jewelry set, favored by style icons like Diana Vreeland and Grace Kelly in their heyday  is making a comeback. Not long after Kate Middleton was spotted wearing the style, a host of modern collar-cuff pairings are popping up in designers resort collections. Saint Laurent and St. John offer subdued takes on the trend in gold and clear crystals, while Balenciagas stone-embroidered padded tubes feel at once organic and futuristic. Other versions look downright rock n roll, such as Ca & Lous geometric shapes in rose-gold and Givenchys black and white stones dangling from oxidized metal chains. Whether worn with a cocktail dress or thrown atop a T-shirt for a touch of sparkle, each pair is an instant outfit-maker.

title: An Occupy Wall Street Offshoot Has Its Day
description: Simon Johnson, former chief economist of the International Monetary Fund, is the Ronald A. Kurtz professor of entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.

title: Officer Is Arrested in Bronx Crash
description: An off-duty police detective has been arrested in a hit-and-run crash that occurred in the western Bronx more than a year ago, the police said Wednesday.

title: Notes on Blindness
description: After the writer and theologian John Hull became completely blind in 1983, he kept an audio diary of his experience. This film is a dramatization using those recordings.

title: Securing the Super Bowl
description: A stretch of Broadway in Manhattan will be transformed into Super Bowl Boulevard, creating concerns in addition to those about security at the game itself.

title: Military Opens Investigation Into Photos of Dead Iraqi Militants
description: The United States military said it had begun an inquiry after photographs that appeared to show Marines burning the dead bodies of Iraqi militants appeared on a gossip website.

title: Whats on Thursday
description: 9 P.M. (Lifetime) UNDER THE GUNN Auf Wiedersehen, Heidi Klum. Tim Gunn steps into hosting mode in this new competition series, in which the Project Runway alumni Mondo Guerra, Anya Ayoung-Chee and Nick Verreos must show off their artistic vision and business savvy  while proving themselves as mentors  as they oversee their own fashion empires with teams selected from 15 burgeoning designers. The designer Rachel Roy, the stylist Jen Rade, and Zanna Roberts Rassi, the senior fashion editor of Marie Claire, are the judges.

title: In a Confrontation, a Secret Is Revealed
Thailand Protests Wane Despite Calls to Shut Down Bangkok
description: BANGKOK  Antigovernment demonstrators marched to government offices on Thursday, but their numbers were far lower than they were earlier in the week, when they started their campaign to shut down Bangkok.

title: Worlds Biggest Annual Human Migration Begins in China
description: With a military-style precision that framed something very human and messy, the worlds biggest annual human migration  the Chinese Lunar New Year festival, known as Spring Festival  officially got under way in the first second of Thursday, Jan. 16, and will last 40 days, Chinese officials said.

title: With $613 Million at Stake, an Albany Rivalry Is Said to Escalate
description: ALBANY  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has asked people if they think Eric T. Schneiderman, the attorney general of New York State, wears eyeliner.

title: Party Issues Rules to Curb Naked Corruption
description: Its official: No more naked officials rising in the ranks, the Chinese Communist Party has decreed.

title: Egypts Crackdown Belies Constitution as It Nears Approval
description: CAIRO  A new constitution revised after the military takeover was headed to ratification by more than 95 percent of the votes cast, official Egyptian news media said Thursday, even as the authorities stepped up a crackdown on journalists and dissenters that human rights advocates said belied the charters promises of free speech.

title: In Wilting Heat, Sharapova Escapes 2nd Round
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  As her match dragged more than three hours, Maria Sharapova stomped and grunted and stole glances at her box. Her face twisted into grimaces. She seemed happiest on changeovers, underneath the shade of an umbrella, an ice vest draped over the back of her neck.

title: A Village Takes Small Steps Toward Reconciliation After Muzaffarnagar Riots
description: FUGANA, Uttar Pradesh Four months after religious violence shattered generations of coexistence in the rural hinterland of western Uttar Pradesh, community leaders are trying to get Hindus and Muslims to talk to each other again as the first step to removing the fear and bitterness that divides villages in the Muzaffarnagar district.

title: E-Commerce Competition Intensifies in China
description: TOKYO  An arms race between the two most powerful Internet companies in China has escalated again, with one of them, Tencent, announcing an investment that pushes it further into e-commerce  territory long controlled by its rival, Alibaba.

title: Outspoken Uighur Scholar Detained in Beijing
description: Updated, 5:35 a.m. | A prominent Uighur economist known for his criticism of the discrimination the predominantly Muslim ethnic group faces in China has been detained by the police, his wife said.

title: European Car Sales Ended Year on High Note, Sort Of
description: PARIS  European car sales ended 2013 on a strong note, raising hopes of a market rebound, despite another year of contraction.

title: U.N. Panel Questions Vatican on Handling of Clergy Sexual Abuse
description: GENEVA  The Vatican faced a barrage of pointed questions from a United Nations panel on Thursday about how it had handled decades of reports of clergy sexual abuse, the first such prolonged interrogation by an international body and a moment long awaited by abuse victims in many countries.

title: Airpocalypse Smog Hits Beijing at Dangerous Levels
description: On Thursday, some residents of Beijing woke up with splitting headaches. A curtain of haze had fallen across the city of more than 20 million. It was the first airpocalypse of the year in the Chinese capital and nearby provinces, and it had come appropriately enough one year after a similar event had led to widespread anxiety.How does the smog differ from the apocalypse? Joe Wong, a comedian from northeast China, wrote on his microblog on Wednesday night, when the pollution levels had begun surging. After the apocalypse, you no longer worry about the smog.

title: Blast in Lebanon Kills at Least 3
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden car in a town in northeastern Lebanon on Thursday, killing at least three people and wounding more than 20, Lebanons National News Agency reported.

title: Jeffrey Wrights Gold Mine
description: This is a relationship that could bring us all the things we desire, Jeffrey Wright said. He was sitting with Samuel Jibila under an awning rigged from rusty metal sheets in front of Jibilas decrepit house in Sierra Leone. Jibila is the traditional ruler  the paramount chief  of Penguia, a little domain of jungly hills and dusty villages 250 miles from the capital. Wright is an actor who lives in Brooklyn. He has won a Tony, an Emmy and a Golden Globe and most recently appeared as Beetee in The Hunger Games: Catching Fire. And for the last decade, he has been traveling to this isolated area near the Guinea border to run his small gold-exploration company, Taia Lion Resources. He wanted to maintain Jibilas faith in his company, in his plans, but Jibila, who was surrounded by lesser chiefs in glossy robes, wasnt feeling faithful.

title: Youth in Iran: Inside and Out
description: If Iranian youth culture was portrayed in a BBC drama, it might be called Inside, Outside, or even Righteous, Raucous. That is the duality present in Hossein Fatemis An Iranian Journey, a series that shows young peoples public modesty and piety vanishing once they escape the wary gaze of authority. These youths play music, drink, smoke, commingle and enjoy other intemperate  i.e., regular  Western activities. They are online, on Facebook, and are politically engaged and simmering, craving freer speech but stifled by the ayatollahs rules.

title: Word of the Day | labile
description: labile \la-bi(-)l, -bl\ adjective

title: Test Yourself | English, Jan. 16, 2014
description: Take the Quiz

title: 6 Qs About the News | Program to End Homelessness Among Veterans Hits Milestone in Arizona
description: In Program to End Homelessness Among Veterans Hits Milestone in Arizona, Fernanda Santos reports on Phoenixs successful effort to provide housing for all of its chronically homeless veterans.

title: France by the Numbers
description: You shall not crucify mankind upon a croissant dor. That was Alan Taylors response (in correspondence) to Franois Hollandes embrace of Says law  he literally said that supply actually creates demand  together with a shift to, again in his own words, supply-side policies. Kevin ORourke also weighs in, as did Ambrose Evans-Pritchard . Mark Thoma is your go-to site for the rapidly growing avalanche of horrified snark.

title: Times Minute | Mutts Take On Westminster
description: Also on the Minute, a widening Air Force scandal and the fate of "Alpha House."

title: In Greece, Elites Are Starting to Feel the Pain
description: ATHENS  Since the countrys financial meltdown, Greeks have protested what many here criticize as the unfairness of the biting austerity measures that have raised taxes and trimmed salaries and benefits for average Greeks, while the elite escaped similar burdens or being held accountable for their part in creating the mess in the first place.

title: Times Minute | Mutts Take On Westminster
description: In the Video

title: How Much of a Priority Do You Make Sleep?
description: You may feel as if there just isnt enough time in the day to get a good nights sleep. To get everything done that you need and want to do, you end up going to bed too late and then waking up too early. Or you may think sleep is something you dont mess around with, and no matter what, you make sure to get your eight hours or more every night.

title: Trial Opens Into Killing of Lebanese Premier, Absent the Accused
description: LONDON  Almost nine years after Rafik Hariri, the former Lebanese prime minister, was killed by a truck bomb, an international tribunal opened hearings into the case on Thursday in a courtroom in the Netherlands with lawyers and judges clustered around a mock-up of the crime scene on the Beirut waterfront.

title: New York Today: Water Main Break, Day 2
description: Updated 10:08 a.m.

title: Grabbing the Wolf's Tail
description: GARDEZ, Afghanistan  The Taliban are still here, a pharmacist who sells medicine to remote villages in the southeast told me last month in this shabby frontier town. People are anxious about 2014 because the troops are leaving.

title: Think Like a Doctor: A School of Red Herrings
description: The Challenge: Can you figure out what is wrong with a 29-year-old former volleyball player who develops some odd aches and pains and a swollen foot?

title: Apollo to Buy Out Chuck E. Cheese Parent for $1.3 Billion
description: Its where a kid can be a kid. Can it also be where a private equity firm reaps a big return?

title: Finding Rewards, Financial and Spiritual, in E-Waste
description: Traci Phillips, 42, started a recycling company, Natural Evolution, more than a decade ago, after realizing the hazards associated with electronic waste. Dead cellphones, dilapidated computers, broken video-game consoles and other thrown-away gadgets are laden with toxins like lead, mercury and arsenic. The United States alone produces three million tons of e-waste a year, a figure thats expected to rise as tech companies churn out new products and consumers snap them up.

title: Investors Turning to Riskier Investments for Returns, BlackRock Survey Finds
description: Investors looking for bigger returns are increasingly turning to riskier but potentially more rewarding opportunities like real estate and hedge funds, according to BlackRock.

title: Carpet Bombing: How One Business Is Trying to Get Rid of Bad Reviews
description: Businesses have always lived by word of mouth, but in the old days the process was diffuse, hidden, incremental. Then Yelp kicked things up a few notches. It was bad news for bad businesses.

title: Daily Report: No. 2 Out at Yahoo
description: Yahoos chief operating officer, Henrique de Castro, has been fired by his boss, Marissa Mayer, a little more than a year after she wooed him away from Google to help her turn around the struggling Internet company, Vindu Goel reports.

title: Wary Goldman Reduces Pay Ratio, Even as Profit Rises
description: Updated, 7:45 p.m. | Faced with continuing declines in one of its core businesses and an uncertain regulatory environment, Goldman Sachs is keeping a close eye on what it pays its employees.

title: Carlyle Buys Johnson & Johnson Testing Division for $4.15 Billion
description: The private equity firm Carlyle Group said on Thursday that it had agreed to acquire the clinical testing division of Johnson & Johnson for $4.15 billion, its first big buyout of the year.

title: One Good Man to Save the World
description: Say what you will about Vladimir V. Putin, but he seems to have been very, very good for screen villainy. Despite the collapse of the Soviet Union, Soviet-style skulduggery has remained a durable narrative clich in recent movies that feature Russian bad guys doing their dastardly worst at home or abroad, from Iron Man 2 to Jack Reacher, Safe, A Good Day to Die Hard. In Kick-Ass 2, one sadistic sicko, a former K.G.B. agent, is even called Mother Russia and wears a red bikini top with a hammer and sickle over each breast. The Ruskie heavy in Jack Ryan: Shadow Recruit played by Kenneth Branagh may be less stacked, but hes scarcely subtler.

title: At SAC Trial, Doctor Tells of Surprise at Ex-Traders Drug Trial Knowledge
description: Dr. Joel S. Ross took the witness stand for a second day at the insider trading trial of Mathew Martoma, a former hedge fund manager at SAC Capital Advisors. During his testimony, Dr. Ross told the jury of seven men and five women how Mr. Martoma knew so much detail about a confidential presentation on a clinical drug trial that Dr. Ross had attended, it was like he was in the room with me, Alexandra Stevenson reports in DealBook.

title: A Vermeer, With a Cellphone
description: Dear Diary:

title: Del Potro Falls, Hours After 110-Degree Heat Causes Halt in Play
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Temperatures spiked to incredible heights again at the Australian Open on Thursday, so high that play was suspended for four hours. When the days matches were completed early Friday, the temperature had not fallen significantly, but a title contender had.

title: In Assam, an Idea Whose Time Has Not Yet Come
description: NEW DELHI  In Mumbai, where Jahnu Barua makes documentary films, a normal Indian lunchtime of 2 p.m. more or less corresponds to midday, when the sun is highest overhead. But when Mr. Barua goes back to his home state of Assam, especially during the winter months, the afternoon light is waning by the time lunch rolls around, and is completely gone by the time most people get out of work around 5.

title: Citigroups Earnings Jump 21%, but Still Disappoint Analysts
description: Citigroups top executives have been asking investors to be patient with their turnaround plans.

title: Ranking the Biggest Restaurant Leveraged Buyouts
description: Apollo Global Managements $1.3 billion takeover of the Chuck E. Cheeses restaurant empire means a number of things.

title: Earnings Soar Beyond Forecast at BlackRock
description: The giant money manager BlackRock reported strong fourth-quarter profit on Thursday, as new money flowed into a wide range of its investment products.

title: Seeking Bigger Sweet Spot, Roger Federer Hopes His Racket Will Grow on Him
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  In the obsessive, superstitious, fine-tuned realm of tennis equipment, the best players hope to fiddle least with two main pieces: their shoes and their rackets.

title: U.N. Says Executions in Syria by Rebels May Be War Crimes
description: GENEVA  A recent series of mass executions attributed to jihadist rebels in Syria may constitute war crimes and crimes against humanity, Navi Pillay, the United Nations human rights chief, said on Thursday.

title: In Our Pages: January 17
description: 1889: Pope Urges Monks to Sell

title: Rick Owens: Fall 2014 Menswear
description: Paris

title: American Home Owners, Living Larger Again
description: That rattling noise you hear is the average American family moving about in the average American house, which  after a brief pause, due to the downturn  is continuing its historical march to massiveness.

title: When Slavery and Its Foes Thrived in Brooklyn
description: Heroic terra-cotta busts of Columbus, Franklin, Shakespeare, Gutenberg, Beethoven and Michelangelo gaze down from the lovingly restored 1881 facade of the Brooklyn Historical Society, reminding the approaching visitor of what the place was once meant to represent. The founders of the society  which is now celebrating its 150th anniversary  conceived of its building in Brooklyn Heights as a repository of history that would aspire to the greatest achievements of European civilization. And why not? Brooklyn was the third-largest city in the United States, the architect was George B. Post (who later designed the New York Stock Exchange), and the societys founders were among the elite.

title: E. L. Doctorow: By the Book
description: The author of Andrews Brain and Ragtime sometimes puts down a book because he can see where the storys going. As you practice your craft, you lose your innocence as a reader.

title: Victoria & Albert Museum to Overhaul Baroque and Rococo Galleries
description: Londons Victoria and Albert Museum has announced that it will overhaul its Baroque and Rococo galleries to let in more light and better install 1,100 gems from its collection  including items designed for Marie Antoinette, Catherine the Great and Napoleon.

title: Surprises and Snubs:  Bold Choices Like Wolf Rewarded; Veterans Like Hanks Ignored
description: LOS ANGELES  The Academy may not be as stodgy as people thought. In its nominations it overlooked films and performances that many considered classic Oscar bait, choosing instead to reward indie films and those with bold acting and filmmaking choices.

title: Raf Simons and the Heart of Art
description: PARIS  Color! Craft! The American flag rolled into soft sculptures framing the runway. Embroidered hands clutching the hem of a jacket. Stripes at the collar, wrists and hem of a tailored coat. And the word Father appearing clearly between the splatters of paint.

title: Hurt by Slower Sales of Smartphones, Best Buy Has Bleak Holiday Results
description: SAN FRANCISCO  A slowing smartphone market and aggressive price-cutting by competitors have struck at the heart of Best Buy, the large electronics retailer.

title: This Weeks Forecast: What Flu Season May Look Like
description: Jeffrey Shaman, an environmental health scientist at Columbia University, hopes that he and his colleagues will someday change the nightly news. The way you get pollution reports and pollen counts on the local weather report, you could also have a flu forecast on there, said Dr. Shaman.

title: Formula One Chief Faces Bribery Trial
description: LONDON  A court in Munich said on Thursday that it would proceed this spring with a trial on bribery charges against Bernie Ecclestone, the 83-year-old Englishman who has been Formula Ones all-powerful overseer for more than 35 years.

title: New Ratings Agency Hopes to Compete With Big 3 Outside U.S.
description: LONDON  Challengers have come and gone, but no viable alternative has emerged to supplant the so-called Big 3 credit rating agencies when it comes to international debt financing.

title: Divisions in the Foreign-Language Category
description: The nominations in the best foreign language film category contain no big surprises, but have produced a divided field. Three of the nominations are from Europe, and are powered by strong individual performances from their leading actors. The remaining two are the Cambodian and Palestinian submissions and depend more on the strength of the story they tell than their cast.

title: Probiotics May Ease Stomach Upset in Babies
description: A new clinical trial suggests that a daily dose of a probiotic may ease digestive upset in babies.

title: Matthew McConaughey, a Nominee Who Writes His Congressman
description: LOS ANGELES  You know its coming: All right, all right, all right, Matthew McConaughey said, on the phone from Malibu moments after receiving an Oscar nomination for his performance as Ron Woodroof, the cowboy-turned-activist stricken with AIDS in Dallas Buyers Club.

title: Maupin Takes Final Tales on the Road
description: The author Armistead Maupin begins a tour this month to promote The Days of Anna Madrigal, the last novel in his Tales of the City series. First published in 1976 as a serial in The San Francisco Chronicle, the stories were praised for bringing the gay, lesbian and transgender subjects and story lines of San Francisco to the general public.

title: Goldman Sachs Keeps a Lid on Pay
description: Goldman Sachs, a bank once famous for its rich bonuses, is clamping down on pay.

title: Political Conflict and Art Dominate Documentary Field
description: The nominations in the best feature documentary category set up an almost Manichaean split in the field. Three of the films address various forms of political conflict, while the other two, 20 Feet From Stardom and Cutie and the Boxer, take a look at overlooked artists and their relationship to the artistic process.

title: A Hiring by Christie Raises Questions Over Cooperation
description: TRENTON  As the New Jersey Assembly voted unanimously on Thursday to authorize an investigation into abuses of power by Gov. Chris Christies administration, Mr. Christie seemed to be maneuvering against the inquiry, hiring a high-powered defense lawyer and resisting questions about whether he would cooperate with the Legislatures efforts.

title: Whats in a Name? The Equus Bass770
description: DETROIT  Equus is Latin for horse. Its also English for a certain Hyundai model, but dont tell that to Equus Automotive. Michael Qualid, a spokesman for the company, said that Equus didnt know the name had been in use on Hyundais premier luxury model when Equus opened in 2006, but he expressed hope that the Korean automaker would not come after a niche marque over its name.

title: Poetry Pairing | Sarabande
description: This Poetry Pairing features Sarabande by Lucie Thse and the article Beneath Martiniques Beauty, Guided by a Poet by Sylvie Bigar.

title: Alex Rodriguez Seems to Accept That Suspension Will Stand
description: Alex Rodriguez appears a step closer to accepting the likelihood that he will not be playing major league baseball in 2014. But he is also confident he will be back.

title: Image of the Day: January 16
Index of Millions of New York History Records Available Free Online
description: Updated, Jan. 21

title: Paris Mens Fashion Week: Valentino Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: U.N. Says Lag in Confronting Climate Woes Will Be Costly
description: Nations have so dragged their feet in battling climate change that the situation has grown critical and the risk of severe economic disruption is rising, according to a draft United Nations report. Another 15 years of failure to limit carbon emissions could make the problem virtually impossible to solve with current technologies, experts found.

title: David O. Russell Has Said His Thank-Yous
description: LOS ANGELES  I told everybody thank you already last night, said the director David O. Russell, whose four stars in American Hustle all became Oscar nominees this morning.

title: Louis Vuittons Satellite View
description: PARIS  It was digital travel  online, via satellites  NASAs maps from outer space, said Kim Jones, the designer of the sky blue, all-embracing runway that was the backdrop for the Louis Vuitton show on Thursday.

title: Harvey Weinstein vs. the National Rifle Association
description: Philomena and August: Osage County did well for the Weinstein Company in the nominations, even if another of its hopefuls, Lee Daniels The Butler came away empty-handed. But Harvey Weinstein still managed to grab attention in a different way by announcing on Howard Sterns radio show that he was joining Meryl Streep  picking up her 18th nomination, for best actress for August  in a secret anti-gun movie project.

title: Louis Vuitton: Fall 2014 Menswear
description: Paris

title: Lots of New Patients, Too Few Doctors
description: The first thing my new patient did when she walked into my office was breathe an enormous sigh of relief. It was so hard to get this appointment with you, she said. It took weeks!

title: Gravitys Special Effects Flashback
description: Flashback: Britain, the mid-70s. A teenage lad goes to visit his uncle at work and beholds before him a veritable magic shop.

title: Facebook Rolls Out Its Version of Trending Topics
description: Facebook is finally rolling out its version of trending topics on a widespread basis  and its not using Twitter-style hashtags to organize them.

title: A Game for Would-Be Deal Makers
description: For young finance professionals, an investment banking deal usually conjures up images of spreadsheets, weekend work and late-night emails from managers.

title: Times Minute | Oscar Nominations
description: Also on the Minute, a grim climate study and a sampling of a sitzprobe.

title: Times Minute | Oscar Nominations
description: In the Video

title: The Wolf of Wall Street, in the Hunt for Oscars
description: The debauched tale of Jordan Belforts rise and fall has prompted a lot of controversy.

title: Sabine Heller of A Small World, on Teaching Yourself
description: This interview with Sabine Heller, chief executive of A Small World, an online travel and lifestyle community, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: How Jared Leto Did Not Get the News
description: With Los Angeles shrouded in darkness as the Oscar nominations were being announced early Thursday, Jared Leto was doing his best to pretend to sleep and wondering if perhaps his performance as the transgendered Rayon in Dallas Buyers Club had been overlooked.

title: Motherlode in The Timess Redesign
description: As Im sure youve noticed, Motherlode (along with all of the other blogs at The Times) has joined the redesign, with a streamlined appearance and new navigation tools. For starters, and most importantly on a blog where reader interaction is a big part of the experience, you can pop up the comments as you read the post by clicking on the number of comments at the top of the post next to the headline. Comments still arent available for readers on mobile apps. (For this reason, I am considering a weekly post highlighting the best commentary.)

title: A Veteran Returns to Gettysburg
description: Growing up just outside Gettysburg, Pa., Jessica Dickey knew from an early age that she was surrounded by a complicated history. On the roads outside her home were signs marking where the Union and Confederate troops had marched. Downtown were buildings flecked with bullet holes. I was always so intrigued by the idea of the presence of the past, the ghosts of the past, Ms. Dickey said.

title: Treasury Sells $3 Billion Stake in Ally Financial
description: The Treasury Department said on Thursday that it had sold $3 billion worth of its shares in Ally Financial, bringing taxpayers stake in the auto lender below 50 percent.

title: On Spying, Woes of Obama Echo Those of Past Presidents
description: WASHINGTON  In his first Inaugural Address, President Obama stirred liberals by proclaiming that we reject as false the choice between our safety and our ideals.

title: A Death-Squad Leader Feels Honored
description: The director Joshua Oppenheimer was at his fathers home outside Washington, D.C., when he got the news that his documentary, The Act of Killing, had received an Oscar nomination in the best feature documentary category. But he wasnt just with his family when the announcement was made: watching with him on Skype from the other side of the world were members of the Indonesian crew that at some personal risk, helped him make his ground-breaking film about the mass killings carried out by the Indonesian armed forces and paramilitary death squads in the 1960s.

title: Amy Adams, Still a Newbie Even 5 Nominations Later
description: First of all, this is Amy Adamss fifth Oscar nomination, and she has yet to win. Doesnt she feel the Academy is being a little sadistic by putting her through this cycle of hype all over again?

title: Snubs and Favorites of the Oscars Field
description: The Academy Award nominations for 2014 included a few surprises, but American Hustle and Gravity lead the field.

title: 36 Hours in Sydney
description: In ever-sunny, easygoing Sydney, dont let the famous attractions circling the handsome harbor consume all your attention. Focus instead on the evolving neighborhoods where art spaces are cropping up beside train tracks, and innovative, chef-driven restaurants are opening at a rapid clip. If youre searching for flash, look to Darling Harbour, where celebrity chefs like David Chang and Luke Nguyen have opened outposts in the Star, a ritzy casino and entertainment complex that reopened in 2011 after a renovation costing around $800 million. For more discreet indulgences, seek out the diminutive drinking dens that now pepper the city, the result of a change in local liquor licensing laws that finally made business viable for small bars. Then when its time to dry out, the natural beauty of Australias most populous city will be waiting along the sandy beaches that lie just minutes from downtown. And dont worry, youre bound to pass a certain opera house along the way.

title: Lets Cease the Insults, North Korea Says to South
description: SEOUL, South Korea  For years, North and South Korea have hurled invective at each other that would do Shakespearean characters proud.

title: Leonardo DiCaprio Didnt Exercise His Producers Prerogative
description: LOS ANGELES  Leonardo DiCaprio was at home having breakfast  coffee and eggs, with tomatoes  as he discussed his multiple Oscar nominations for The Wolf of Wall Street.

title: Time Warner Is Planning a Move to Hudson Yards
description: Time Warner Inc. announced on Thursday that it plans to move its headquarters from Columbus Circle to a new, 80-story skyscraper on the Far West Side of Manhattan, ensuring the development of a vast neighborhood made up of office towers, residential buildings, a shopping mall and a park, all built over a 13-acre railyard.

title: Ford Mustang and Volvo Concept Win Design Awards
description: DETROIT  The Ford Mustang and Volvo Concept XC Coupe won the annual Eyes on Design awards presented at the Detroit auto show on Tuesday.

title: Why It May Take More Than Former Google Stars to Turn Yahoo Around
description: The Googleization of Yahoo has hit an expensive speed bump.

title: Free Markets, Infidelity and the President of France
description: PARIS  Is it worse to be an ardent advocate of the free market than a suspected adulterer?

title: A Reader Behind Bars
description: I am not proud of it, but I will admit to having felt a twinge of envy when I read, over the holidays, of President Obamas latest book purchases. How amazing would it be to have the president buy, and read, your novel?

title: New Foundation to Focus on Publishing Art Books
description: Art books, monographs and catalogs are essential for historians, collectors and artists, but they rarely make money. Often oversized and lavishly illustrated on high-quality glossy paper, they are expensive to produce for the relatively tiny number of institutions and individuals who buy them.Enter theArtist Book Foundation, a new nonprofit organization dedicated to publishing fine-art references that otherwise would not be seen. Next month, it will release Trucks: Recent Works by John Himmelfarb, to accompany a new traveling exhibition of that Chicago artists work that opened last week at theBrauer Museum of Art at Valparaiso Universityin Valparaiso, Indiana.

title: Steve Coogan Shares His Victory March
description: LOS ANGELES  Steve Coogan is playing catch-up.

title: Today in Small Business: Name Your Own Price
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: An Osteoarthritis Primer
description: Maybe we should rewrite that quote usually attributed to Benjamin Franklin. Nothing is certain except death, taxes  and arthritis, the leading cause of disability in the United States.

title: Deep Emotions Explored in Song
description: Many orchestras talk up the idea of adventurous programming. The Riverside Symphony, founded in 1981 by the conductor George Rothman and the composer Anthony Korf, has been putting the concept into practice for decades. This accomplished ensembles next program, on Saturday at Alice Tully Hall, is titled Shadow and Light and is typically intriguing.

title: Sally Hawkinss Jet-Lagged Euphoria
description: The little golden man is, at this point, rather immaterial. To hear Sally Hawkins tell it, she has already won.

title: Authorities Comb New Jersey Woodland in Hunt for Missing Reporter
description: LONG HILL TOWNSHIP, N.J.  Using all-terrain vehicles, rubber rafts and aluminum motorboats, hundreds of law enforcement officers and volunteers scoured a dense, swampy woodland in central New Jersey on Thursday in search of a Wall Street Journal reporter who went out for a walk last weekend and never returned.

title: Clothes Inspired on Demand
description: The resourceful American Folk Art Museum continues to explore new ways of using its collection, and in particular to involve living artists in its exhibitions. Its previous attempt, last falls alt_quilts, presented quilts from its collection and the quiltlike works of three contemporary artists, with weak results. Now, the museum has turned to the fashion world in Folk Couture: Fashion and Folk Art, which opens on Tuesday. To explore the idea of fashion designers finding inspiration in all sorts of unexpected places, 13 New York-based designers have been invited to create garments inspired by works they select from the museums collection.

title: Endurance as Art Form
description: Its been almost two years since Sarah Michelson commandeered the fourth floor of the Whitney Museum of American Art, transforming several thousand square feet into the gleaming terrain for Devotion Study #1  The American Dancer. Some audience members walked out. Others sat transfixed as Ms. Michelsons dancers rose to the punishing task of walking backward, in circles, for a spectacularly long time, never doubting (or so it seemed) that their bodies would carry them through.

title: Back Together After a Breakup
description: Jeff Mangum, the songwriter who leads Neutral Milk Hotel, defused some suspense with his 2011-12 solo tours. Those were his first consistent reappearances since the group quietly disbanded after touring for its beloved 1998 album, In the Aeroplane Over the Sea, an oblique yet impassioned set of songs inspired by thoughts of Anne Frank, with Mr. Mangums ceaseless strumming punctuated by jaunty trombone tunes and outbursts of distortion. Mr. Mangum stayed largely out of sight as the albums reputation spread and solidified, but his solo concerts showed him fully in command. Now, with the band, patient fans should hear the trombone, too. Elf Power shares the bill.

title: Guinea Worm Said to Infect Few in 2013
description: Only 148 cases of Guinea worm disease were found in the world in 2013, a 73 percent drop from the 542 cases found one year earlier, the Carter Center announced Thursday.

title: What Was Behind All Those Whacks?
description: Christina Ricci showed early that she could play creepy: One of her first film credits is as Wednesday Addams in the 1991 movie The Addams Family. So the role of Lizzie Borden, the odd Massachusetts woman accused of killing her father and stepmother with an ax in 1892, seems a logical fit. Lizzie Borden Took an Ax, a telling of the real-life story being shown on Saturday at 8 p.m. on Lifetime, isnt shy about speculating on what actually happened in the Borden household in Fall River that bloody August day, though that has remained in dispute for more than a century. The movie also presents the record of Lizzies arrest and trial, whose conclusion wont be spoiled here for the sake of those not up on their murder history. The cast includes Billy Campbell as Lizzies lawyer and Clea DuVall as her sister, Emma. Also listed are credits for three Jump Rope Girls. You can probably guess why, though the film reminds us that the oft-chanted rhyme is inaccurate. The figures of 40 and 41 whacks are greatly inflated.

title: Mets Parnell Says Hell Be Ready for Opening Day
description: In September, as the Mets 2013 season was coming to a close, Bobby Parnell, the teams closer, made a rare appearance in the clubhouse. He had been out since July with a herniated disk in his neck, and recently had surgery on it. As he visited with his teammates, he wore a big neck brace and looked thinner. Manager Terry Collins, for one, seemed worried about his appearance.

title: Unknown No Longer
description: Until his eerie gay murder mystery, Stranger by the Lake, was shown last fall at the New York Film Festival, the work of the French director Alain Guiraudie was almost unknown in the United States. Concurrent with the theatrical opening of that movie, the Film Society of Lincoln Center will begin a weeklong retrospective of his work, running Friday through Jan. 30, that spans two decades.

title: Paris Mens Fashion Week: Louis Vuitton Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Wheelies: The Better Efficiency Now Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Ethan Hawke, Adapted Screenplay Nominee for Original Characters
description: Question to Ethan Hawke (currently on a layover in Houston, after leaving his family on a beach in Tulum, Mexico, because he had to fly to Los Angeles to collect another movie award):

title: Turning the Mini-Series Inside Out
description: It doesnt get much better, in mini-series land, than the consummation of a forbidden love. The writers of The Spoils of Babylon liked the idea so much, they did it twice: first, in a steamy scene in a trashy San Francisco hotel room; then, with an encounter on the beach, straight out of The Thorn Birds.

title: Jonah Hill Would Like to Thank Those Teeth
description: LOS ANGELES  Before he talked to the press, Jonah Hill got on the phone with his director, Martin Scorsese, and his co-star, Leonardo DiCaprio, to congratulate one another on the five nominations that their film, The Wolf of Wall Street, received. It took Leo about 45 minutes to figure out how to conference us all together, Mr. Hill said, perhaps exaggerating just a tad. It was very sweet.

title: Soderbergh to Direct New Play at Public Theater
description: The Oscar-winning film director Steven Soderbergh (Traffic) will make his New York theater debut this spring staging the Off Broadway world premiere of a new drama, The Library, about the effects of gun violence on a high school student, played by the movie actress Chloe Grace Moretz (Kick-Ass, the 2013 remake of Carrie). The Public Theater, which will produce The Library, made the show announcement on Thursday.

title: Letters: The Trip to Echo Spring
description: Intoxicating Prose

title: To Sit and Sing: A Musical Tradition
description: A behind-the-scenes look at the sitzprobe for the musical The Bridges of Madison County. This theater tradition is the first time a shows cast and full orchestra practice face-to-face.

title: Youve Got Another Chance, Broadway
