description: DURING last summers contentious primary campaign, Bill de Blasio managed to get himself selected as his partys candidate for mayor of New York without the support of the Democratic Partys once-powerful county organizations. Historically, thats quite an achievement. Even Ed Koch, the man who helped put a stake in the heart of Tammany Hall in the early 1960s, had the tacit backing of machines in Brooklyn and the Bronx when he captured the mayoralty in 1977.

title: Ways to Look at Income Inequality
description: To the Editor:

title: Last-Ditch Effort Emerges to Restore Order in Central African Republic
description: BANGUI, Central African Republic  By midafternoon, a hot breeze blows down empty corridors of the mostly vacant national assembly building here. Hundreds of grim soldiers, their uniforms looted or hidden away, mass in civilian clothes after going AWOL for months. Around abandoned university buildings, idle students loiter, their classes long canceled.

title: After Slow Execution, Renewed Death Penalty Debate and Threat of Lawsuit
description: A 53-year-old convicted killers unusually slow death while being executed with an untested combination of drugs in Ohio on Thursday has renewed the debate over lethal injection and the death penalty.

title: How Should We Treat Our Fellow Creatures?
description: To the Editor:

title: Beasts of the East Display Some Offensive Flair in the A.C.C.
description: Many Atlantic Coast Conference basketball fans expected the newcomers from the Big East  Syracuse, Pittsburgh and Notre Dame  to introduce a rough-and-tumble style that would be irritating to watch.

title: The Investigation Into the New Jersey Bridge Scandal
description: To the Editor:

title: Canceling Each Others Votes
description: The two senators from Wisconsin disagreed on more votes last year than any other pair representing the same state.

title: Bill With Antigay Provisions Is Blocked by Ugandan Leader
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Ugandas president has refused to sign a bill that would impose harsh sentences for gay people, including life imprisonment, temporarily sidestepping a clash with foreign donors who have condemned the legislative push for years.

title: Traffic Jam Investigator Offers Ulterior Motive
description: Four months after the streets of Fort Lee, N.J., were suddenly gridlocked, speculation continues to swirl about what really motivated allies of Gov. Chris Christie to engineer the mess. For some clue-seekers, a construction site at the west end of the George Washington Bridge has spurred a collective Aha!

title: Unto the Breach
description: On Wednesday, a letter landed in my email inbox from Gregg Steinhafel, the chief executive of Target. He wanted me to know that there was a decent likelihood that some of my personal information had been stolen by criminals who had forced their way into our systems, as Steinhafel put it, and pulled off one of the biggest data breaches in history.

title: Two Senators Have Little but a State in Common
description: WASHINGTON  He offered to explain the intricacies of the federal budget. She reminded him that she had majored in math.

title: Yankees Sign Five Players, Flirting With Payroll Threshold
description: The Yankees settled all of their arbitration-eligible cases on Friday as their payroll crept closer to the $189 million threshold for luxury-tax purposes. If the Yankees were to sign the coveted Japanese pitcher Masahiro Tanaka before the Jan. 24 deadline, they would almost certainly surge past the mark.

title: Resisting Mobile Hurts Nintendos Bottom Line
description: SEATTLE  Nintendo has peered into its future, and the picture isnt pretty.

title: 384 Priests Defrocked Over Abuse in 2 Years
description: The Vatican defrocked 260 priests for the sexual abuse of children in 2011 and 124 more in 2012 after the scandal exploded in Europe and beyond and bishops forwarded hundreds of cases to the Vatican, according to statistics compiled by The Associated Press.

title: Sometimes Nazi Is the Right Word
description: TEL AVIV  NAZI is a short word. It has only two syllables, like rac-ist or kill-er. Democracy, on the other hand, is a long word with lots of syllables that is very tiring to say. It may not be as tiring as saying freedom of expression or social justice, but still, there is something really exhausting about it.

title: Leaders Begin Citys Left Turn With Sick Pay Proposal
description: New York Citys top elected officials said on Friday that they would greatly expand the reach of a measure mandating paid time off for sick workers, a cherished cause of the national left that had long been resisted by local business leaders.

title: Twitters Product Chief Leaves the Nest
description: Michael Sippey, the vice president of product at Twitter, announced on Friday that he would step down from his position  the first high-level departure from the social network company since it went public in November.

title: The President on Mass Surveillance
description: In the days after Edward Snowden revealed that the United States government was collecting vast amounts of Americans data  phone records and other personal information  in the name of national security, President Obama defended the data sweep and said the American people should feel comfortable with its collection. On Friday, after seven months of increasingly uncomfortable revelations and growing public outcry, Mr. Obama gave a speech that was in large part an admission that he had been wrong.

title: A Good Start for Health Care Sign-Ups
description: Enrollments in health insurance plans through state and federal exchanges are rising rapidly, especially among young adults, making it likely that the Affordable Care Act will achieve a large and stabilizing mix of enrollees by the end of the open enrollment period on March 31. Some 2.2 million people signed up in the first three months, from Oct. 1 through Dec. 28.

title: City Newcomer Is Let Down by a Stranger, Then the Police
description: Fredrick Brennan, 19, moved out of his mothers home in New Jersey in August and into an apartment in Brooklyn that his boss helped him find. This leap was far greater than the 120 miles or so on a map.

title: After a Prolonged Execution in Ohio, Questions Over Cruel and Unusual
description: As the lethal drugs flowed into his veins in the Ohio death chamber, Dennis B. McGuire at first went unconscious and his body was still, his daughter, Amber McGuire, said Friday.

title: North Carolina: Judge Blocks Ultrasound Requirement
description: A federal judge on Fridaydeclared unconstitutional the states ultrasound requirement for women seeking abortions, saying it violated the First Amendment by requiring doctors to display a fetal image and describe it even to women who covered their eyes and ears.Judge Catherine C. Eagles of the Middle District of North Carolina called the law, passed in 2011, an impermissible attempt to compel doctors to deliver the states message in favor of childbirth and against abortion.The state has not said whether it will appeal to the Fourth Circuit, in Richmond, Va.A similar law in Texas was upheld by the Fifth Circuit, in New Orleans, and is in effect.

title: After Leaving Office, Bloomberg Is More Hands-On at Old Company
description: At editorial meetings in Bloomberg L.P.s headquarters this week, Michael R. Bloomberg gave clear signs that he would not be taking a hands-off approach as he returned to his old company.

title: Shaun White Reasserts Snowboard Dominance, in Just a Day
description: MAMMOTH LAKES, Calif.  In just over 24 hours, Shaun White went from being violently splayed on the snow to looking positively ready for his quest for dual gold medals in Sochi.

title: Bloomberg to Push G.O.P. for Immigration Action
description: Former Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg of New York will be in Washington on Friday to pressure Republican lawmakers to take up an overhaul of immigration laws. The meeting, his first major public policy event since his term ended, is pegged to President Obamas State of the Union address on Jan. 28. The meeting will include prominent Republicans and U.S. Chamber of Commerce representatives. Speaker John A. Boehner and his leadership team are preparing a policy blueprint that is likely to include at least some path to legal status for 11 million undocumented immigrants in the country.

title: Help With Medical Bills
description: In September 2012, as Gladys Puglla was thanking everyone for coming to a community organization board meeting, she blacked out from a stroke. It felt, she recalled, as if my soul was leaving my body.

title: The $1 Trillion Question
description: I think you should develop a position on the Omnibus Spending Bill.

title: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, January 18, 2014
description: When you cut through the noise, whats really at stake is how we remain true to who we are in a world that is remaking itself at dizzying speed.

title: Wisconsins Odd Couple in the Senate
description: Senators Ron Johnson and Tammy Baldwin hold the record for the two senators from the same state who have voted in opposition most frequently.

title: Corrections: January 18, 2014
description: NATIONAL

title: Exchange Some Words
description: SATURDAYS PUZZLE  Ive come to the conclusion that there are two people inside David Steinberg. Ive met him, and theyre both lovely people. But it has become increasingly clear that while he is chronologically a teenager, there is also an old soul inside him struggling to get out.

title: Skeletons Predecessor Is Still Alive at Cresta Run
description: ST. MORITZ, Switzerland  Alexandros Kefalas had just plunged down a bobsled run more than a mile long at almost 80 miles an hour. His time was 1 minute 11.93 seconds, only a second slower than that of the fastest rider during a recent practice here. But in skeleton a race is often decided by hundredths of a second.

title: Punishing Lords of Baseball Along With Their Fallen Idols
description: Many are calling on Alex Rodriguez to drop his lawsuits against baseball and ride off into oblivion. His critics are clamoring for A-Rod to take his medicine.

title: A Sneaky Path Into Target Customers Wallets
description: It was, in essence, a cybercriminals dream.

title: The Mystery of Three Letters That Disappeared
description: JERSEY CITY  Sometimes artists rework their paintings, touching up a face here or lightening the background there. Sometimes, as in the case of the mural with the disappearing logos, it is done for them, and not for artistic reasons.

title: In Keeping Grip on Data Pipeline, Obama Does Little to Reassure Industry
description: WASHINGTON  Google, which briefly considered moving all of its computer servers out of the United States last year after learning how they had been penetrated by the National Security Agency, was looking for a public assurance from President Obama that the government would no longer secretly suck data from the companys corner of the Internet cloud.

title: U.S. Military Deaths in Afghanistan
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,291 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans recently:

title: Egypt: Clashes Erupt During Protests
description: Egypts security forces killed at least two protesters and arrested more than a hundred on Friday during demonstrations around the country against the military government, the state news media reported. In recent days millions voted to approve a new constitution validating the military takeover last summer. Fridays clashes are the first evidence that the new charter is unlikely to resolve the complaints of the protest movement, the terrorist threat from a budding insurgency or Egypts deep divisions. At least one protester was killed in Fayoum, south of Cairo, and another on the outskirts of Cairo. Separately, a report from Democracy International, an election-monitoring group that sent 80 observers to track the constitutional referendum, said it had serious concerns about the political environment of the voting, with arrests and detention of dissenting voices and no real opportunity for those opposed to the governments road map of the proposed constitution to dissent.

title: Fighting to Keep a Life Built in the United States
description: Things have not gone according to the plan hatched long ago by Beatriz Riveras family.

title: South Africa: Rhino Killings Increase
description: Poachers killed 1,004 rhinos in South Africa last year, up from 668 in 2012, as they continue to hunt the animals for their valuable horns, the South African government reported Friday. The Department of Environmental Affairs blamed poachers who cross the border from Mozambique to South Africa, then sell the horns to places like Vietnam and China, where they are symbols of wealth and are used in potions. The number of rhinos illegally killed in South Africa has been climbing since at least 2010, when 333 deaths were reported. Susie Ellis, of the global nonprofit group International Rhino Foundation, said the latest figure was almost certainly an undercount. Those are only the deaths that we know about, she said. Traffic, an international wildlife watchdog group, said Mozambique treated rhino-related crimes as misdemeanors.

title: Turkey: Contentious Medical Bill Signed
description: Over the objections of human rights and medical groups, President Abdullah Gul signed a measure into law on Friday that makes it a crime to administer emergency first aid without government authorization. Critics contend that the law could be used by the police and prosecutors to intimidate and punish doctors and other medical workers for treating protesters wounded in demonstrations against the government, like those in Turkey last year. Passing a bill that criminalizes emergency care and punishes those who care for injured protesters is part of the Turkish governments relentless effort to silence any opposing voices, said Dr. Vincent Iacopino, senior medical adviser at Physicians for Human Rights, one of the groups that had campaigned against the legislation. If convicted, violators could be imprisoned for up to three years and face fines of nearly $1 million.

title: To Rambo Hit-Man Case, Add an Element of Houdini
description: When charges were announced last fall against Joseph Hunter, a former Army sergeant accused of being a contract killer, the authorities revealed that one of his nicknames was Rambo.

title: Japan: Lawmaker Defends Shrine Visit
description: A top Japanese lawmaker on Friday denounced American criticism of Prime Minister Shinzo Abes visit last month to a Tokyo war shrine, comparing it to American politicians paying their respects at Arlington National Cemetery. The lawmaker, Koichi Hagiuda of Mr. Abes governing Liberal Democratic Party, said it was unfair for the United States to expect Japanese leaders to refrain from visiting the Yasukuni shrine, which honors the nations war dead, when American politicians can freely honor their fallen soldiers. If Japan says, Its unfavorable to pay a visit to Arlington National Cemetery, do they refrain from going there? Mr. Hagiuda, a special adviser to Mr. Abe, was quoted as saying by the Kyodo News Agency. I assume the United States will say, Its none of a foreign countrys business. Mr. Hagiuda was responding to an American government statement expressing disappointment with Mr. Abes visit to the controversial Shinto shrine on Dec. 26. Washington feared such a visit could anger other Asian nations, where Yasukuni is viewed as a symbol of Japans refusal to come to terms with its brutal 20th-century militarism because it honors all war dead, including convicted war criminals. The shrine also houses a museum that views World War II as a noble struggle by Japan to liberate Asia from white imperialism.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Jan. 17, 2014
In Small Town in Canada, Celebrating Hockey With Songs
description: LLOYDMINSTER, Alberta  Thousands of miles wide, Canada is girded by a narrow belt of population stretched thin across its vast landscape. Hockey is the common experience shared in every large city and small town along the way.

title: Hospital Is Occupied by Protesters
description: Facing a renewed threat of a shutdown, hospital workers occupied Interfaith Medical Center in Brooklyn Friday afternoon as the hospitals chief executive shut himself inside his office until the police arrived to escort him out, witnesses said.

title: Water Is His Life, Particularly When It Starts Gushing in All the Wrong Places
description: The message came in Wednesday at 12:29 a.m.

title: Knicks Dream of Home Streak Runs Into Ugly Truth
description: It was the start of a rare opportunity for the Knicks. Their game Friday night against the Los Angeles Clippers launched an eight-game homestand, their longest such stretch at Madison Square Garden since 1986. About two hours before tipoff, Coach Mike Woodson felt bold enough to float the unthinkable.

title: A Tale of Two Protesters
description: Once captivated by the energy that stirred in the streets, activists in Egypt and Ukraine are beginning to recognize that protests are limited in creating the change they desire.

title: Suchitra Sen, Actress Famed in Bengali Cinema, Dies at 82
description: Suchitra Sen, one of Indias best-known movie actresses, who remained famous more than 30 years after she made her last film, died on Friday in Calcutta. She was 82.

title: Outside Convention Hall, New Cars Often Arent on the Mind
description: DETROIT  Inside the North American International Auto Show, the cars are the stars and the razzle-dazzle is nonstop. But outside Cobo Center, where the exhibition opens to the public on Jan. 18, a bankrupt but sometimes surprisingly optimistic city goes about its business. Here are a few scenes from outside the show:

title: Whats on Saturday
description: 9 P.M. (Showtime) SILVER LININGS PLAYBOOK (2012) Pat Solatano (Bradley Cooper, above), who has returned to the home of his parents (Jacki Weaver and Robert De Niro) after eight months in a mental institution, following a violent crime, tries to tackle the world  and reclaim his estranged wife, Nikki, who took out a restraining order against him  through a physical and psychological regimen he created while locked away. Then he meets Tiffany (Jennifer Lawrence), a heartbreaker who persuades Pat that she can circumvent the law by passing a letter from him to Nikki  if only hell enter a dance contest with her. Soon, she is leading, and he is following. For all its high-flying zaniness, the movie has the sting of life, and its humor feels dredged up from the same dark, boggy place from which Samuel Beckett extracted his yuks, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times about this best picture Oscar nominee directed by David O. Russell, which also earned nominations for Mr. Cooper, Ms. Weaver and Mr. De Niro, and a win for Ms. Lawrence. Silver Linings Playbook is crammed with people talking and shouting and weeping and also yielding to what are sometimes called boundary issues but which here turn out to be the mad, loving scrambling of people finding and saving one another, Ms. Dargis added. These are characters who get in one anothers faces and occasionally punch a loved one right in the kisser. They must go on, they cant go on, but together they do.

title: Deadly Attack at Kabul Restaurant Hints at Changing Climate for Foreigners
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  As country director for the International Monetary Fund, Wabel Abdallah spent years navigating the shoals of scandal in Afghanistans financial sector. Vadim Nazarov, a top political officer at the United Nations, dedicated himself over the past nine years to looking for a peaceful solution to the Afghan war. Dhamender Singh Phangurha, a British candidate in the coming elections for the European Parliament, was here on a consulting contract.

title: A Stampede of Mourners in India Kills at Least 18
description: MUMBAI, India  At least 18 people were killed and 46 were injured in a stampede in an exclusive Mumbai enclave early Saturday morning as mourners paid their respects to a spiritual leader who died Friday.

title: Scrambled Eggs With Tomatoes, Greek Style
description: In this Sundays magazine, Mark Bittman shares some recipes from Diane Kochilas, an American chef of Greek descent, and expresses relief to discover that her recipes are simpler than he had imagined. Thats certainly the case with Kochilass strapatsada, which can be made in five minutes.

title: Mens Paris Fashion Week: Comme des Garons Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Louise Damgaard.

title: The Chatter for Sunday, Jan. 19
description: Looking at the rapid growth weve seen in bourbon over the recent years, Beam is doing a good job seizing the moment.

title: Orchestrating the Orecchiette
How to Suppress the Apology Reflex
description: Editors note: Heres one of our favorite stories from the archives, now being featured in our Smarter Living collection.

title: Craft Beer, the (Very) Limited Edition
description: Two weeks ago, a beer drinker in Fresno, Calif., called Hill Farmstead Brewery in Vermont to ask where he could buy its craft beers. You have to drive to the airport, get a ticket, fly to Burlington, rent a car and drive an hour and a half to the brewery, the owner, Shaun Hill, replied with a laugh. But he wasnt joking.

title: Advice to Customer Service: Dont Blame the Computer
description: EMAIL: haggler@nytimes.com. Keep it brief and family-friendly, include your hometown and go easy on the caps-lock key. Letters may be edited for clarity and length.

title: A Netflix Scoreboard: 3 Emmys, a Golden Globe and a Soaring Stock
description: I confess: Im one of those people who binged on House of Cards last February when Netflix released all 13 episodes in one fell swoop.

title: A Philandering French President, a Complex Election in Egypt
description: The Middle East was much in the news these past days, with all its maddening ambiguities and conflicts on full display.

title: Mens Paris Fashion Week: Berluti Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Sarah Aubel.

title: The Rationality Debate, Simmering in Stockholm
description: Are people really rational in their economic decision making? That question divides the economics profession today, and the divisions were evident at the Nobel Week events in Stockholm last month.

title: Girish Navani, on Why Titles Dont Matter
description: This interview with  Girish Navani, C.E.O. of eClinicalWorks, a provider of clinical information systems, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: Inspecting a Student Loan Spigot
description: A few days after Christmas, ITT Educational Services, one of the nations largest operators of for-profit technical schools, reported some unwelcome news. The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau had warned the company that it might seek penalties and remedies against it for possible student loan violations.

title: Tackling Inequality
description: Tackling Inequality

title: Film Gives a Peek at the Romney Who Never Quite Won Over Voters
description: SALT LAKE CITY  Mitt, the documentary about Mitt Romneys failed quest for the presidency, begins on Christmas Eve 2006, with Mr. Romney, his wife, Ann, and their five sons sitting in their Park City house, weighing the pros and cons of a Romney candidacy.

title: Rivalry Between Seattle and San Francisco Heats Up the West Coast
description: The Seattle Seahawks and the San Francisco 49ers act like the N.F.L.s fiercest rivals, which might seem strange for teams that have never met in the playoffs. Stranger still, the tensions origins trace to five years ago, when both teams were bad and their current coaches led college programs.

title: Yahoos Asian Lifeline
description: Yahoos core business has been eroding. Its lost ground in display advertising and in online search, and the Wall Street consensus is that its revenue declined last year.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Rodriguez Ban Teaches Lessons, Albeit Late

title: Joe on WNYCs Money Talking: January 17, 2014
description: This week on Money Talking, Joe Nocera and Rana Foroohar of Time magazine discuss the connection between the upcoming World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, and the idea of privacy thats been put front and center by the N.S.A. leaks and the Presidents new reforms. Joe also discusses the data breach at Target, which is the subject of his column today.

title: The Source | Paolo Soleri in Conversation With Doug Aitken
description: Reality is a process, says the Italian-American architect Paolo Soleri, who passed away last year at the age of 93. So we are a tiny, tiny, tiny, tiny, little processing plant. Soleri, who is best known for Arcosanti, his experimental planned community in the Arizona desert, talks to the artist Doug Aitken about the importance of the unknowable. The interview is part of the Source, a series of candid video conversations with several dozen noteworthy figures about their creative process, currently on view in a custom pavilion at the Sundance Film Festival.

title: Variety: Cryptic Crossword
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  I believe this is Daniel Raymons first cryptic crossword puzzle published in The New York Times, and if this one is any indication, hes got a nice cryptic career ahead of him. This was a fun one.

title: The Myth of the Deserving Rich
description: Many influential people have a hard time thinking straight about inequality. Partly, of course, this is because of Upton Sinclairs dictum: its hard for a man to understand something when his salary depends on his not understanding it. Part of it is because even acknowledging that inequality is a real problem implicitly opens the door to taking progressive policies seriously.

title: Armys New Rhythm
description: American soldiers are struggling to find relevance in the face of an uncertain future.

title: In Denver, Fans Are Bullish on the Broncos, but Wary of the Patriots
description: DENVER  On a sun-splashed Friday afternoon that felt more like spring than the prelude to an A.F.C. championship game, this football-crazed city showed a self-assured calm before the storm blowing west out of New England.

title: Eagle Scout. Idealist. Drug Trafficker?
description: Ross Ulbrichts last moments as a free man were noisy enough to draw a crowd. Employees at the Glen Park branch of the San Francisco library heard a crashing sound and rushed to the science fiction section, expecting to find a patron had hit the floor. Instead, they found a handful of federal agents surrounding a slender 29-year-old man with light brown hair and wearing a T-shirt and jeans.

title: Dizzying Heights, With Risks
description: KEMP, Tex.  The life of an all-terrain vehicle racer is a peripatetic one, big on low-budget adventures but small when it comes to paychecks. The best racers in the nation were here in October for the ATV Pro Challenge in Memory of Caleb Moore, which offered $30,000 in total prize money, a record for the sport. As on most weekends on the ATV tour, however, it meant that competitors shared recreational vehicles and campers as well as fuel pumps and any other part that failed.

title: Defying Gravity
description: Extreme sports have grown in popularity, but as athletes scale the heights to became stars, debilitating injuries or death can result.

title: Still Waiting for New Royalty in Mens Game
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  One court on Saturday at the Australian Open provided a window into the future of mens tennis, the possibilities and pitfalls on display.

title: Patients Costs Skyrocket; Specialists Incomes Soar
description: CONWAY, Ark.  Kim Little had not thought much about the tiny white spot on the side of her cheek until a physicians assistant at her dermatologists office warned that it might be cancerous. He took a biopsy, returning 15 minutes later to confirm the diagnosis and schedule her for an outpatient procedure at the Arkansas Skin Cancer Center in Little Rock, 30 miles away.

title: Threes a Trend | Clutching Mens Bags, Big or Small
description: Its a source of mild debate in the style-obsessed sphere whether Victoria Beckham truly originated, or at the very least popularized, the style of clutching  as opposed to toting or carrying  a leather handbag as one would a more diminutive evening style. This manner of wearing a large bag  with an arm slipped through both handles, the one hand supporting the bottom while the straps fall to the side  was surprisingly adopted by some major fashion houses for their mens wear runway presentations. The slick dudes at Gucci looked no less manly carrying soft pastel leather bags in this fashion, nor did Tomas Maiers athletic guys wearing the houses signature leather bags. At Valentino, an actual clutch replaced the large bag style, but the stylistic technique remained the same. And aside from the aesthetic affectation, this method also provides an added amount of security. It would certainly require a skilled purse snatcher to disentangle the bag from its owner.

title: At Center Stage Again, Stephens Looks to Rise
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Sloane Stephens, one of the fastest players on the WTA Tour, is a slow starter. She has fallen behind in the first set of her first three matches at the Australian Open and won two of those sets.

title: G.O.P. Advice for Christie: Pick a Better Team
description: On a conference call with Gov. Chris Christies most loyal donors a few nights ago, his brother, Todd, pressed for last-minute cash to pay for the governors inauguration, a daylong fete ending on Ellis Island.

title: Rules for Equal Coverage by Employers Remain Elusive Under Health Law
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration is delaying enforcement of another provision of the new health care law, one that prohibits employers from providing better health benefits to top executives than to other employees.

title: Dior Homme: Fall 2014 Menswear
description: Paris

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu: Jan. 19
description: In a speech Friday, President Obama vowed to make significant changes to the surveillance programs, run by the National Security Agency, but included important qualifiers to his promises. The president accepted some of the recommendations from an independent panel that argued late last year for significant curbing of N.S.A. power and the imposition of more oversight. But  he left some grumbling that the overhaul will not do enough to protect civil liberties.

title: Jersey Sponsor Threatens to Bolt Over Anelka
description: Pepe Mel, the new manager of West Bromwich Albion, is looking forward to his first match in charge when his club hosts Everton on Monday in Englands Premier League.

title: With Plan to Overhaul Spying, the Divisiveness Is in the Details
description: WASHINGTON  The roiling debate over security and liberty did not end with President Obamas newly announced overhaul of surveillance practices. Rather, it now enters a volatile next phase as intelligence agencies and a divided Congress try to turn principles into policy.

title: Syrian Opposition Votes to Attend Peace Talks
description: SILIVRI, Turkey  Under intense international pressure and facing a boycott from a third of its members, the National Coalition for Syrian Revolutionary and Opposition Forces voted Saturday to send a delegation to an international peace conference aimed at ending Syrias civil war.

title: An Interview With Mitt Romney
description: SALT LAKE CITY  Mitt Romneys long journey in search of the presidency began on Christmas Eve in 2006, in Park City, Utah, as he and his family considered the burdens of a presidential bid. On Friday, Mr. Romney returned to where it all started, attending the Sundance Film Festival for the premiere of Mitt, a 94-minute documentary chronicling both his 2008 and 2012 campaigns.

title: Among the Best, but Having to Wait
description: MAMMOTH LAKES, Calif.  The goal of this winters Olympic qualifying events in snowboarding is to find the Americans most likely to win a medal in Russia next month.

title: Trade and the Environment
description: One of the most laudable American goals in negotiating the trade agreement known as the Trans-Pacific Partnership with 11 other countries was to strengthen environmental protections around the world. But a draft chapter of the agreement made public last week by WikiLeaks shows that many of the countries involved in the talks are trying to undermine that goal.

title: Ann Cavoukian
description: Ann Cavoukian is the information and privacy commissioner in Ontario, Canada, and a longtime advocate of default online confidentiality. Her concept of privacy by design, which was developed in the 1990s and encourages embedding privacy protections in information technology and business practices, has recently gained renewed attention and proclamations of support from regulatory agencies worldwide.

title: Peeling Away the Plastic
description: SALT LAKE CITY  ITS hard to imagine anything more painful than going through the presidential campaign all over again with Mitt Romney.

title: A Step Toward Restoring Voting Rights
description: Only seven months after the Supreme Court shattered the Voting Rights Act, a bipartisan group of lawmakers has come up with a bill that would go a long way toward putting it back together. If they can persuade Republicans in Congress to set aside partisanship and allow it to pass, they would begin to restore justice to a deeply damaged electoral process. It would be an ideal way to observe the Rev. Martin Luther King Jr.s birthday this week.

title: At Last, Conservative Reform
description: IN American life, political ideas that lack partisan champions are regarded suspiciously, like an attempt to cheat at cards or pay for dinner with counterfeit cash. Because we have only two parties, because those parties are ideologically disciplined, and because everyone is obsessed with the other sides unrighteousness, theres a sense that if you arent fully on board with an existing partisan agenda, you dont have any business getting mixed up in the debate.

title: Neglected Topic Winner: Climate Change
description: HERES a scary fact about America: Were much more likely to believe that there are signs that aliens have visited Earth (77 percent) than that humans are causing climate change (44 percent).

title: Obamas Homework Assignment
description: PRESIDENT OBAMA will deliver his State of the Union address on Jan. 28, but, for my money, his secretary of education, Arne Duncan, already gave it. Just not enough people heard it.

title: For the Love of Money
description: IN my last year on Wall Street my bonus was $3.6 million  and I was angry because it wasnt big enough. I was 30 years old, had no children to raise, no debts to pay, no philanthropic goal in mind. I wanted more money for exactly the same reason an alcoholic needs another drink: I was addicted.

title: Disaffected Republicans
description: Readers respond to a Jan. 15 letter in which Robert L. Bryant, a lifelong Republican, decried the choices my party has presented to me.

title: Thanks, Mom and Dad, for All Your Support
description: Parents web searches show that gender roles continue.

title: Smoking Is Worse Than You Imagined
description: The latest surgeon generals report on the health effects of smoking  issued at the 50th anniversary of the pathbreaking 1964 report  offers astonishing new evidence of just how much harm tobacco is causing. Despite the many gains in reducing risks over the past half-century, researchers keep finding new and insidious ways in which smoking is harming the smokers themselves and nonsmokers who breathe in toxic fumes.

title: Google, Tell Me. Is My Son a Genius?
description: MORE than a decade into the 21st century, we would like to think that American parents have similar standards and similar dreams for their sons and daughters. But my study of anonymous, aggregate data from Google searches suggests that contemporary American parents are far more likely to want their boys smart and their girls skinny.

title: The Cruelest Pregnancy
description: WHAT would Marlise Munoz have made of all of this?

title: Sex and the Single Senior
description: WHAT is happening in retirement communities, assisted living facilities and nursing homes? You might imagine quiet reading, crossword puzzles, bingo, maybe some shuffleboard. Think again. Think about sex  unsafe sex.

title: Obama, Melville and the Tea Party
description: IN 2009, shortly after Barack Obamas successful campaign for the White House, the McNally Jackson bookstore in Manhattan organized a display of about 50 books that Mr. Obama had read as a young man. The titles were eclectic, with a good number by African-American authors, including Ralph Ellison, James Baldwin and Toni Morrison.

title: South Sudan Recaptures Town From Rebels
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Amid signs that a cease-fire agreement could be close, the government of South Sudan said Saturday that it had won a significant military victory, recapturing the strategic town of Bor from rebel forces.

title: You Can Tell Everybody This Is Your Song
description: FOR most of my 20s I played in the indie rock band Sleater-Kinney. We wrote songs, we recorded them, we toured. In my 30s, though, things changed. I started spending most of my time writing or working on the TV show Portlandia. I havent played many live shows in the past decade, but somehow I feel as if Im still on tour  not just with my bandmates, but with everyone. So I thought Id try writing a song again, so Id have something to play.

title: Is the Fifth Republic Burning?
description: HOUSTON  FUTURE historians of France may well decide that the Fifth Republic died as it was born: in a traffic incident.

title: Reaching the Top at Every Rung
description: Jon Cooper has yet to coach a full season in the N.H.L., yet his Tampa Bay team is among the best turnaround stories in the league. The Lightning entered Friday in third place in the Eastern Conference after finishing last season 28th in the 30-team league.

title: Madisons Privacy Blind Spot
description: IN his opinion last month regarding the constitutionality of the National Security Agencys phone-data collection program, Judge Richard Leon wrote that James Madison, who cautioned us to beware of the abridgment of freedom of the people by gradual and silent encroachments by those in power, would be aghast.

title: Lean Times for the Lakers
description: The two most decorated teams in N.B.A. history squared off Friday, but the game hardly brought back memories of Bill Russell facing Wilt Chamberlain or Larry Bird battling Magic Johnson.

title: How I Stopped Procrastinating
description: I learned something about a year ago that I wish Id learned much sooner. And it happened only after I woke up one morning and couldnt walk. An X-ray revealed that my hip cartilage had made a unilateral decision to jump ship. I liked my hip cartilage. I thought wed be together forever.

title: A Monster of the Dunk Shows Finesse as a Playmaker
description: After the Los Angeles Clippers 109-95 destruction of the Knicks on Friday night, a reporter was moving through the visiting locker room, asking each Clippers player for his favorite Blake Griffin dunk.

title: What Happens When the Poor Receive a Stipend?
description: Growing up poor has long been associated with reduced educational attainment and lower lifetime earnings. Some evidence also suggests a higher risk of depression, substance abuse and other diseases in adulthood. Even for those who manage to overcome humble beginnings, early-life poverty may leave a lasting mark, accelerating aging and increasing the risk of degenerative disease in adulthood.

title: Celtics Banking on Rondo, for Now
description: BOSTON  In the summer of 2007, Wyc Grousbeck, a co-owner of the Boston Celtics, went for a quiet, solitary walk along a beach on Cape Cod. He had his cellphone, and when it rang, he was ready for the call and even readier for his response.

title: Bankability Can Desert Tainted Athletes
description: In the 1990s, Alex Rodriguez starred in a commercial for Nike that looked like yet another creative campaign by the sports apparel giant. It was amusing and effective and reflected positively on Rodriguez.

title: Iowa States Legacy of Fervor and Success Is Handed Down
description: AMES, Iowa  Forty-five minutes before Iowa State and Kansas tipped off last Monday, members of the Eby family, all in gold I.S.U. shirts, settled into their seats at Hilton Coliseum. Jeff Eby, who raises corn and soybeans on his 1,000-acre farm in Adel, about 40 miles southwest of here, has been coming to Cyclones mens basketball games since he was a boy. For 2012-13, he eagerly bought season tickets.

title: After Love Unravels in Media, Indian Politicians Wife Is Found Dead
description: NEW DELHI  He was a smooth-talking politician from South India with an international reputation from his time at the United Nations. She was a beautiful Kashmiri from the north when they met in 2009 in middle age and began a relationship partly played out in the media, and social media, glare.

title: Eddie the Eagle Soars With His Feet Mostly on the Ground
description: WOODCHESTER, England  It is perhaps a mild indictment of ski jumping that outside of a few countries in Europe and Asia, the two most famous jumpers are a Slovene who careened off a slope in the 1970s and a jolly Briton who finished last in the Calgary Olympic Games a quarter-century ago.

title: Mayor of Hoboken Says Hurricane Relief Was Threatened
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  A swing through Florida proved no sunny retreat for Gov. Chris Christie on Saturday, as well-organized protesters hounded him outside a Republican fund-raiser here, a powerful ally in the New Jersey State House rebuked the governors office and new allegations emerged that his administration tried to intimidate a New Jersey elected official.

title: Greek Prosecutors Focus on Corruption at the Top
description: ATHENS  Since the countrys financial meltdown, Greeks have protested what many here consider the unfairness of the austerity measures that have raised taxes and trimmed salaries and benefits for average Greeks, while the elite escaped similar burdens or being held accountable for their part in creating the mess in the first place.

title: Readers and Climate Change
description: Thanks so much to all of you for responding to my request two weeks ago for neglected topics for me to weigh in on this year. There were 1,300 comments that came pouring in, many with multiple ideas, and Im still thinking them through. Todays column takes off on one of the suggestions that came up regularly: climate change. Its not 100 percent neglected of course, but I think its vastly undercovered considering the scale of the issues. So read the column and share your thoughts below.

title: Olden Goldies
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  Hands up if you like spoonerisms. For those of you just joining us, a spoonerism is a word or phrase in which letters or syllables are swapped. That can happen with tips of the slung, sorry, slips of the tongue, and today Dan Schoenholz has spoonerized a set of seven oldies songs.

title: Overwhelming Vote for Egypts Constitution Raises Concern
description: CAIRO  Secretary of State John Kerry on Saturday raised concerns about the fairness of a referendum on Egypts revised Constitution after the military-led government announced that it had passed with an extraordinary 98.1 percent of the vote.

title: Chemical Spill Muddies Picture in a State Wary of Regulations
description: CHARLESTON, W.Va.  Here in West Virginia, residents were still reeling from the chemical spill that left more than 300,000 people without usable water for days, many of them still frightened and unsure whether official assurances that they could once again drink tap water or bathe their children were true.

title: Region Boiling, Israel Takes Up Castle Strategy
description: JERUSALEM  After a Katyusha rocket fired from Lebanon landed in Israel last month, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu blamed Hezbollah, the Shiite militia, and its Iranian backers. But Israeli security officials attributed the attack, as well as a similar one in August, to a Sunni jihadist group linked to Al Qaeda.

title: After Years at War, the Army Adapts to Garrison Life
description: FORT DRUM, N.Y.  Spec. Perez Brown Jr. spent three years in the Army and two tours in Afghanistan, where on his 23rd birthday a homemade bomb blew up a vehicle in his convoy and he came close to driving over another one just down the road. That second one might have been for me, he said.

title: Bachelor Stars Comments on Gays Spark Uproar
description: PASADENA, Calif.  ABC faced a potential crisis on Saturday over one of its longest-running hits when a storm erupted here over homophobic comments made by the star of the reality series The Bachelor.

title: De Blasio Picks Mark Peters, a Former Prosecutor, to Oversee Investigations
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio announced on Saturday that he had picked a respected former prosecutor and civil rights lawyer to fill the top position at the citys Department of Investigation, an anticorruption agency that will soon take on an expanded role in overseeing the New York Police Department.

title: Jamaican Bobsledders Seek Money for Sochi Trip
description: With a little bit of perseverance, Jamaicas Winston Watts has appeared to qualify as a bobsled pilot at next months Olympics. Without a little bit of money, though, the latest edition of the Jamaican bobsled team might not actually appear in the Sochi Games.

title: Torn Between Higher Taxes and Border Hassles
description: LAREDO  Braving the unusually cold temperatures one recent afternoon, Aurelia Alcantar crossed the Puente de las Amricas international bridge from Mexico into this South Texas town. She was going shopping, and crossing the border let her avoid a recent tax increase in her hometown, Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas.

title: Its Here: A Library With Nary a Book
For Cubs Fans, Everlasting Hope With Dread to Match
description: CHICAGO  A legion of die-hard Cubs fans converged here at a downtown hotel this weekend for the teams annual fan convention. They were children and adults, wearing blue-and-red jerseys, hats and face paint, armed with baseball cards, pennants and posters to be autographed.

title: Run for Speaker as a Marker for Republicans
description: Ross Ramsey, the executive editor of The Texas Tribune, writes a regular column for The Tribune.

title: A Consultant Who Stumped for Cruz Makes a Bid for Congress
description: In 2012, Katrina Pierson was crisscrossing Texas in her spare time to help Ted Cruz become the states next United States senator. At Republican club meetings, public rallies and on Twitter, she praised Mr. Cruzs tenacity and commitment to repealing the Affordable Care Act.

title: Determined to Miss Nothing, Russia Trains All Eyes on Sochi
description: SOCHI, Russia  This may now be the safest city in Russia.

title: Strong Showing for U.S. at Youth Championships
description: The vitality of the United States scholastic chess programs was on display last month at the World Youth Chess Championships in the United Arab Emirates, where 94 Americans took to the boards.

title: The Surprise Wedding
description: When guests arrived at what they were told was Rebecca Garcia and Andrew Spiegels engagement party, they found the space decorated for a wedding.

title: Remembering Amiri Baraka With Politics and Poetry
description: Amiri Barakas funeral began with a wordless tribute on Saturday morning: A procession of African drums and jazz trumpets followed the writers coffin through Newark Symphony Hall.

title: After Cancer, Tour Guide Plans Next Destination
description: Name a place, and Edicson Valderrama, international tour guide, will give you the story.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Jan. 18, 2014
Building Faces Wrecking Ball. So Does Couples Friendship.
description: As in any fight between longtime friends, there are raw emotions, tarnished memories, tears.

title: Ex-Official Claims to Speak for Sidelined Syrians
description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates  For years, Jihad Makdissi was the urbane, outward-looking face of the Syrian government, proclaiming its views in perfect English as the Foreign Ministrys spokesman. Then, about a year ago, he resigned and fled here, withdrawing his support from President Bashar al-Assad without throwing it to the opposition, quietly waiting, he said, for his chance to be of use.

title: In Syria, Former Official Says, Nobody Is Winning
description: The following are excerpts from an interview with Jihad Makdissi, a former Foreign Ministry spokesman in Syria who fled in 2012 as the government of President Bashar al-Assad cracked down on antigovernment protesters. Mr. Makdissi, however, has not supported the rebels. He casts himself as a voice for the Syrians who remain on the sidelines, skeptical of the armed uprising but still wanting change.

title: Arnold R. Pinkney Dies at 83; Steered 1984 Jesse Jackson Run
description: There are always more slaves than slave masters, the Rev. Jesse Jackson roared in a speech in Selma, Ala., early in his 1984 presidential campaign. We can win! We got masters degrees in disappointment and Ph.D.s in how to overcome!

title: Chryssa, Artist Who Saw Neons Potential as a Medium, Dies at 79
description: Chryssa, a Greek-born American sculptor who in the 1960s was one of the first people to transform neon lighting from an advertising vehicle into a fine art medium, died on Dec. 23. She was 79.

title: Roy Campbell Jr., Avant-Garde Jazz Trumpeter, Dies at 61
description: Roy Campbell Jr., who carried the soulful swagger of hard-bop trumpet into the jazz avant-garde, of which he became a pillar, died on Jan. 9 at his home in the Bronx. He was 61.

title: Corrections: January 19, 2014
description: NATIONAL

title: American Hustle Wins SAG Award for Top Film
description: LOS ANGELES  American Hustle, the 1970s caper comedy from the director David O. Russell, took the top prize, for best ensemble, at the Screen Actors Guild Awards here Saturday.

title: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, January 19, 2014
description: It may be better to wait and see, but waiting doesnt make you money. Its Let me do a little snip of tissue and then they get professional, lab and facility fees. Each patient is like an ATM machine.

title: Caitlin Homberger, Nicholas Green
description: Dr. Caitlin Healy Homberger and Nicholas Glenn Green were married Saturday at McCradys, a restaurant in Charleston, S.C. Judge David C. Norton of the United States District Court in Charleston, for whom the groom was a law clerk, officiated.

title: Alicia Susser, Adam Epstein
description: Alicia Caryn Susser, a daughter of Andrea Susser and Allen Susser of Wayne, N.J., was married Saturday evening to Adam Mark Epstein, the son of Carol Epstein and Gary Epstein of Henderson, Nev. Rabbi Stephen Wylen officiated at the Tribeca Rooftop, an event space in Manhattan.

title: Michelle Yetter and Jeremy Cline
description: Michelle Elizabeth Yetter, the daughter of Connie F. Glang of Riverside, Calif., and Gary A. Yetter of Moreno Valley, Calif., was married Saturday to Jeremy Waters Cline, a son of C. Rebecca Cline and Gary W. Cline of New Haven. The Rev. Maria LaSala, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at the Dwight Hall Chapel at Yale University in New Haven.

title: A Thousand Violins Fill the Air
description: Janet Yichieh Lee and James Hong Shin are to be married Sunday at the Parker, a hotel in Palm Springs, Calif. Eliot Davidoff, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, is to officiate.

title: Daira Avila and Charbel Barakat
description: Dr. Daira Maria Avila and Charbel J. Barakat were married by the Rev. Elie Saade on Saturday at the St. Jude Melkite Catholic Church in Miami, with Msgr. Pablo Navarro taking part.

title: Jacqueline Kelly and Nicholas Moscow
description: Jacqueline Christine Kelly, a daughter of Linda Kelly and Stephen C. Kelly of New Windsor, N.Y., is to be married Sunday to Nicholas John Moscow, a son of Melinda L. Moscow and John W. Moscow of New York. The Rev. William Scafidi, a Roman Catholic priest, is to perform the ceremony at Sacred Heart Roman Catholic Church in Newburgh, N.Y.

title: Nicole Blank and Brian Koles
description: Nicole Blank, a daughter of Bonnie K. Blank and Mark B. Blank, both of Miami, was married Saturday evening to Brian Wayne Koles, the son of Judy F. Koles of Melville, N.Y., and Martin N. Koles of Forest Hills, Queens. Rabbi Edwin Goldberg performed the ceremony at the Bath Club, an event space in Miami Beach.

title: Sari Abraham and Matthew Imberman
description: Sari Lisa Abraham, the daughter of Lynn Abraham and Seth G. Abraham of Manhattan, was married Saturday evening to Matthew Todd Imberman, a son of Susan Imberman and Dr. Steven Imberman of Manalapan, N.J. Rabbi Daniel Alder officiated at Gotham Hall, a Manhattan event space.

title: Amanda Echalaz and Robert Meya
description: Amanda Echalaz and Robert Kruedener Meya were married Saturday evening at the New Leaf Restaurant in Fort Tryon Park in Manhattan. Sabrina R. Martin, a friend of the couple who was ordained by the American Marriage Ministries for the occasion, officiated at a ceremony that was led by Francis J. Foley III, a senior judge on the Windham District Superior Court in Willimantic, Conn.

title: Serena Williams Tumbles in Australian Opens Fourth Round
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  For almost a year, Serena Williams won professional tennis matches at an improbable 96 percent clip. Since her exit from the 2013 Australian Open, she had played 80 matches and had won 77 of them.

title: Deadly Bomb Blast Rocks Pakistan Military Compound
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  A bomb exploded inside a vehicle at a Pakistani military compound in the countrys northwest on Sunday, killing at least 20 members of a paramilitary unit and wounding 30 more, a security official said.

title: Whats On Today?
description: 1:30 P.M. (Showtime2) AMLIE (2001) Audrey Tautou, above, in her breakthrough role, plays a French sprite working as a waitress who lays out elaborate practical jokes as payback for those who offend her friends. When she falls in love with Nino (Mathieu Kassovitz), Amlie finds herself incapable of revealing her feelings and instead turns Paris, recreated through sets and computer-generated imagery, into a kind of treasure hunt as she leaves clues about her identity, and he trails after her. Writing in The New York Times, Elvis Mitchell called this comedy from Jean-Pierre Jeunet, whose original title was Le Fabuleux Destin dAmlie Poulain, a sugar-rush of a movie. It has, he said, a hypnotic sense of romance; its a fable filled with longing, with a heroine who constantly flirts with failure. The films fastidious complex of flesh and fantasy is a dazzling achievement, he added. There is no denying, he said that Amlie is, to paraphrase its title, fabulous.

title: In Our Pages: January 20
description: 1914: Fine Sport Up the White Nile

title: Europes Dominance Faces a Challenge in a FIFA Bid
description: ZURICH  Jrme Champagne has spent most of his career in soccer behind the scenes, quietly operating in the shadows with little fanfare or credit. But on Monday, Champagne, a Frenchman who once served as FIFAs deputy general secretary, is set to become front-page news in Switzerland and beyond.

title: Lanvin: Fall 2014 Menswear
description: Paris

title: At Kenzo, a Techno Take on Sportswear
description: PARIS  Designing mens wear with techno-conscious eyes produces regular clothes with a digital spin, and can even bring subtle changes to apparently simple sportswear.

title: When Elite Parents Dominate Volunteers, Children Lose
description: One long-ago day my mother took cupcakes to school wearing a pale yellow coat  not warm enough for the winter day, but she wanted to look nice. A classmate admired her. I was a little proud. I hoped to impress this classmate, or anyone. My dad was an alcoholic. A friend with a similar childhood calls it impoverished. I lacked currency: cash or social sway.

title: Punk Hangs In There
description: PARIS  How can a 40-year-old rebellion, triggered by young men now well into their 60s, keep hanging in there for male fashion?

title: Bangkok Protests Hit by Two Explosions
description: BANGKOK  More than two dozen people were injured in twin explosions at an antigovernment demonstration in Bangkok on Sunday, a further escalation of violence in Thailands protracted political crisis.

title: UI, the NAIRU, and the ZLB
description: I see from Mark Thoma that Chris Dillow is doing battle with the usual idiots suspects, who are once again accusing me of hypocrisy or something for saying that increased unemployment benefits would, under current conditions, reduce unemployment. But your textbook says that UI raises unemployment!

title: The Pope and Chris Christie
description: Sometimes, when you read a news report, you remember connections that, while not invalidating the reporting at all, nonethless shed a different light on some aspects of the story. So it was with todays Times report on the internal recommendations Chris Christie has been getting within the GOP. Quoted at some length was a guy named Ken Langone:

title: Familiar Rivals Meet Again, With the Same Result
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  For Kevin Anderson, running into an old familiar face just doesnt have the same appeal it once did.

title: Sumptuous and Ubiquitous: Berluti and Will Smith
description: PARIS  As I settled into my seat a few minutes before the start of Berlutis fall mens show here Friday night, another reporter asked me if I had just arrived that day.

title: Mens Paris Fashion Week: Herms Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: Sundance: A Gay-Wedding Reception While the Litigation Continues
description: PARK CITY, Utah  Same-sex marriage, or at least a big celebration of it, came sweeping back to this state over the weekend courtesy of Hollywood occupiers.

title: Disruptions: Looking for Relief From a Flood of Email
description: On Dec. 31, I had 46,315 unread emails in my inbox. On my first day back to work in the new year, I had zero.

title: Fresh Views on Climate Scientists as Advocates
description: Updated, 4:54 p.m. | If You See Something, Say Something, is the headline on a Sunday Op-Ed article by Michael E. Mann, the Penn State climate scientist who, after years of attacks from groups fighting restrictions on greenhouse gases, has become a prominent climate and political campaigner, as well.

title: Mens Paris Fashion Week: Kenzo Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Erin Baiano.

title: Two Are Wounded After Israel Orders Airstrike in Gaza
description: JERUSALEM  The Israeli military said it carried out an airstrike in Gaza on Sunday aimed at eliminating an Islamic Jihad operative responsible for recent rocket fire against southern Israel, part of a growing cycle of border clashes in recent weeks that reflect the fragility of the 14-month cease-fire between Israel and the Palestinian coastal enclave.

title: 1914: A Map of Tango
description: This is the map of the kingdom of king Tango. The white parts indicate countries it has subjected to his law. The black parts show those who do not recognize his sovereignty yet. We have, otherwise, marked with a black spot the French cities where bishops have forbidden the faithful to dance tango in their diocese.  The New York Herald, Paris Edition, Jan. 20, 1914 (From Le Matin)

title: Lanvin: The Sum of All Looks
description: PARIS  How rare it is to find a show that has everything: slim tailoring, high tech fabrics, colorful accessories, arty drawings, covetable sneakers  and an overall look that sums up mens wear today.

title: At Umit Benan, an Homage to Jackie Robinson
description: PARIS  Walking into the Turkish designer Umit Benans show here, his first in Paris after several seasons in Milan, you noticed that the set resembled a soccer pitch in slight disrepair, an effect accentuated by the chain link fence separating the audience from the runway, parts of it torn away, as if by age or neglect.

title: Mens Paris Fashion Week: Officine Generale Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Louise Damgaard.

title: Four Traffic Fatalities in Two Days As Mayor Vows to Make Streets Safer
description: A large highway sign flashed orange warnings to pedestrians. Patrol officers in neon vests directed traffic; others gave tickets to drivers and nearly a dozen jaywalkers. And at each corner of West 96th Street and Broadway on the Upper West Side of Manhattan on Sunday, residents warned one another to use caution: The traffic here can be deadly.

title: A Fast Start for Ride Along at the Box Office
description: The action comedy Ride Along burned rubber at North American theaters, taking in a projected $47.8 million for the four-day Martin Luther King Jr. holiday and leaving another new film, Jack Ryan: Shadow Recruit, choking on its fumes. Ride Along (Universal Pictures), featuring Ice Cube and the increasingly popular Kevin Hart, cost about $25 million to make and continues a winning streak at the box office for movies with predominantly black casts. About 50 percent of opening-weekend ticket buyers were black, with Hispanic moviegoers making up 30 percent, according to Universal.

title: Chris Chataway, British Runner and Politician, Dies at 82
description: Chris Chataway, a British runner who helped Roger Bannister achieve the first sub-four-minute mile, then broke world records himself before becoming a member of Parliament and a cabinet minister, died on Sunday in London. He was 82.

title: Mens Paris Fashion Week: Ami Alexandre Mattiussi Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Olympics Security Worries U.S. Officials
description: WASHINGTON  Tensions rose Sunday over security preparations ahead of the Winter Olympics in Sochi, as several congressional leaders expressed concern about Russias willingness to share information about terrorist threats, while President Vladimir V. Putin asserted that he would do whatever it takes to protect the thousands of visitors arriving soon for the Games.

title: A Tiny Antenna Threatens the TV Networks Airspace
description: When the case of American Broadcasting Companies v. Aereo comes before the Supreme Court in April, it will feature two American archetypes in a battle that could upend the television industry.

title: Derp Pirate Roberts
description: We finally saw American Hustle last night; it was a lot of fun, although heavy-handed in parts (I would have lost the microwave scene). But if this story on the arrest of the man accused of being Dread Pirate Roberts is any indication, being in the FBI these days is a lot more fun (unless youre really into Amy Adamss cleavage, which I can understand) than it was in the Abscam days.

title: Thom Browne: Fall 2014 Menswear
description: Paris

title: In Ukraine Protests Over New Laws, Sticks and Stones Are Met With Tear Gas
description: MOSCOW  A large rally in Kiev, Ukraine, that was called in part to protest a new set of laws cracking down on public protests turned violent on Sunday when men in balaclavas attacked the police with sticks and threw firecrackers and cobblestones at them.

title: Congressional Leaders Suggest Earlier Snowden Link to Russia
description: WASHINGTON  The heads of the House and Senate Intelligence Committees suggested on Sunday that Edward J. Snowden, the former National Security Agency contractor, might have been working for Russian spy services while he was employed at an agency facility in Hawaii last year and before he disclosed hundreds of thousands of classified government documents.

title: A Real-Life Mother and Son Share Memories and Grief
description: Feidlim Cannon got drunk over dinner the night he asked his mother, Ann, to make a theater piece with him. He needed the courage, he says.

title: Seahawks Fans Act as Extra Player, Tormenting Opponents and Eardrums
description: SEATTLE  Is the 12th Man a man or a myth? Fans in this football-mad city talk about him like a trusted uncle or a fabled warrior. Flags flap in his honor. Placards with his telltale number are plastered in shop windows like totems.

title: The Federal Budget, Per Person
description: See a selection of programs in the spending bill (and a couple of others), expressed in cost per U.S. resident.

title: Central African Town Is Left Charred, Empty and Hopeless Amid Violence
description: BOSSANGOA, Central African Republic  The rutted roads through this regional capital are strangely empty.

title: Iran Welcomes Start of Nuclear Deal
description: TEHRAN  Iranian officials said they expected positive economic changes with the lifting of some sanctions against the country as part of a deal struck with world powers, which begins on Monday.

title: Back in China, Watching My Words
description: Helen Gao writes an occasional column on overseas education for cn.nytimes.com, the Chinese-language website of The New York Times. This piece is adapted from a column published shortly after the Lunar New Year in 2013.

title: NBC Plans Live Peter Pan for Next Holiday Season
description: PASADENA, Calif.  NBC will go back into its past for its next attempt at live musical theater on television, bringing back the classic Peter Pan for a holiday season viewing next Dec. 4.

title: Protests in Kiev Turn Violent
description: Protesters attacked the police with sticks and threw firecrackers at them, while the officers responded with tear gas during a rally in Kiev, Ukraine, on Sunday.

title: Poor Mummy, Tossed Around and Then Stashed in a Closet
description: The comic payoffs arrive only sporadically in the new production of Joe Ortons Loot at the Lucille Lortel Theater. Those deliciously perverse epigrams whiz through the air, and the corpse of a beloved wife is frantically hauled about a parlor like a medicine ball being flung around at a gym. But the deadpan style that best serves these antics often slips into a kind of winking archness that announces an awareness of the inspired lunacy of it all. The production, directed by Jesse Berger for the Red Bull Theater, hits its marks with an air of studied effort that tends to put the brakes on the mayhem.

title: Gold and Survival, Yes, but Scripts and Stars, Too
description: Scan the our shows section of Discovery Channels website, and it becomes clear that someone in the executive department is obsessed with cold weather, survival and gold. Frozen Planet, Yukon Men, Alaska: The Last Frontier, Gold Rush, Bering Sea Gold and more are there.

title: A Little Help From a Friend of Buttercup
description: Very soon now, the airwaves will be jammed with remembrances of the Beatles first appearance on The Ed Sullivan Show, because theres nothing the baby-boom generation likes better than commemorating 50th anniversaries. If you stare hard enough at the clips of those screaming young female fans from February 1964, you can see an unspoken question in their eyes: Will one of these guys, in 2014, be singing a song aimed at my grandchildren or even my great-grandchildren about dressing up as a superpower-endowed little girl?

title: Tunefully Purveyed Snake Oil, Anyone?
description: On Jan. 7, two days before the Metropolitan Operas revival of Bartlett Shers 2012 production of Donizettis LElisir dAmore was scheduled to open, the company announced that the soprano Anna Netrebko had the flu and would not perform the role of Adina. Curiously, the announcement specified that Ms. Netrebko, probably the most celebrated soprano in opera right now, would miss the first two performances but planned to return for the third. Singers grappling with an illness usually cannot anticipate how long their incapacity will last.

title: Tipping a Hat to Country Music Pioneers
description: If there were an appropriate emoji ideogram for the Bristol Sessions, the 1927 recordings that helped start the framing of what we now know as country music, it wouldnt be a cartoon face conveying anger, sadness or gratitude  nothing that simple. It might be one of the lesser-known ones: the image of Japanese-carp wind socks on a flagpole, the flags flown on Childrens Day in Japan representing high hopes to navigate the currents of an uncertain life and grow up with health and courage.

title: Repertory of Mandolin Is in Motion
description: Pianists can spend a lifetime learning a vast established repertory, but a greater degree of creativity is essential for double bassists, trumpeters or mandolinists hoping for careers in the spotlight.

title: Where Guitars Sound Like Orchestras or Brawling Geese
description: When the guitarists Fred Frith and Nels Cline played their first public duet on Saturday night at Subculture, it didnt always sound like guitar music. It sounded, at times, like a sanitation trucks trash compactor, like an orchestra tuning up, like a brawl between flocks of geese, like a creaky water pump, like a collapsing carillon and like a slowed-down train wreck.

title: Bulgarian Architects State-Sponsored Whimsy
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria  Delcho Delchev came back.

title: Leaping and Twirling, but Emphasizing Much More
description: If dance is a form of wordless communication, what are the members of Parsons Dance trying to tell us? That theyre happy to be onstage? That they feel really good? That they think they look great and hope we agree?

title: A Comics Fifth Second Chance
description: NEWARK  Deep into a raucous comedy set at Symphony Hall here on Friday night, Katt Williams briefly halted his mockery of the Boston Marathon bombers, the Roman Catholic Church and racially inclusive cereal commercials for a moment of sincerity.

title: Economic Reports for the Week of Jan. 20
description: GATHERING IN DAVOS The World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, will begin with a ceremony on Tuesday evening. World leaders scheduled to attend the forum include Shinzo Abe, prime minister of Japan; David Cameron, prime minister of Britain; Benjamin Netanyahu, prime minister of Israel; and Hassan Rouhani, president of Iran. The United States will be represented by Jacob J. Lew, the Treasury secretary; Penny Pritzker, secretary of commerce; and Gina McCarthy, administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, who will discuss President Obamas climate action plan. This years celebrity in residence is Matt Damon, who will receive an award for his charitable work. Some of the speeches and panels will be posted on the forums website, weforum.org.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Jan. 20
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes the regular weekly auction on Tuesday of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Wednesday.

title: Hearing Genuine Voices of Midcentury Fiction
description: Just over half a century ago, Harry Schwartz, a city planner, and his wife, Lynne Sharon Schwartz, an editor at The Writer magazine, were sitting in their Boston apartment with friends and talking about American fiction.

title: Hes Hard as Nails, Hard to Nail Down, Too
description: Tucked away at the end of Gabriel Shermans disingenuous Roger Ailes biography, there is a note on sources that should have opened the book. Mr. Sherman has done a lot of interviewing, but there are so many citations of author interview with a person familiar with the matter that The Loudest Voice in the Room may set a record for blind items and the untrustworthiness they engender. It would have helped to know right from the get-go why Mr. Sherman found this kind of journalism necessary.

title: Thai Democracy in a Nutshell
description: Ultimately, the Thai military will determine the winner.

title: Saint Laurent: Fall 2014 Menswear
description: Paris

title: Paramount Takes Step With Digital Film
description: Paramount Pictures became the first major Hollywood studio to stop delivering movies on 35-millimeter film in the United States, offering them only in digital format, The Los Angeles Times reported. The change reflects a shift toward use of digital projection. Only about 8 percent of about 40,045 United States theaters screens are equipped to show movies only in a film format, according to the National Association of Theater Owners, The Los Angeles Times said. Statistics compiled by the Motion Picture Association of America showed that the number of nondigital screens in the United States dropped to 6,387 by the end of 2012, from 33,319 in 2008. The last Paramount picture delivered to some theater owners in a film format was Anchorman 2: The Legend Continues, The Times reported. Many of the remaining film-only screens are in small towns, where owners have been hard pressed to afford a conversion.

title: Finals for U.S. World Youth Teams
Moral Support Is Family Tradition for Seahawks Wilson
description: SEATTLE  Benjamin Wilson arrived in Seattle near midnight Saturday.

title: Repeated Phrase
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  Every year, on the third Monday in January, we as a nation pause  hopefully  to remember a fallen leader who died as a result of his quest for peace and equality, not as a result of being a warmonger. I cant think of a better reason for a holiday.

title: N.F.L. Conference Championship Sunday
description: The Broncos defeated the Patriots for the A.F.C. title, while the Seahawks got past the 49ers in the N.F.C.game.

title: Michael Kinsley to Join Vanity Fair and Write a Monthly Column
description: Michael Kinsley will join Vanity Fair as a contributing editor, stepping down as editor at large of The New Republic, and leaving its masthead for the first time since 1976.

title: Manning Reclaims the Biggest Stage
description: DENVER  The family reunion was at Peyton Mannings corner locker. It might have otherwise looked like an afternoon barbecue with a father, Archie Manning, and his three sons, Cooper, Peyton and Eli, smiling and talking football.

title: Fifty States of Fear
description: The British philosopher Bertrand Russell, writing as World War II was drawing to a close in Europe, observed that neither a man nor a crowd nor a nation can be trusted to act humanely or to think sanely under the influence of a great fear. Russells point was that irrational fear can propel us into counterproductive activities, ranging from unjust wars and the inhumane treatment of others to more mundane cases like our failure to seize opportunities to improve our everyday lives.

title: MoMAs Plan to Raze Its Neighbor
For Policies That Are Fair to Both Men and Women
description: To the Editor:

title: Land Rights and the Poor
description: To the Editor:

title: Employer Wellness Plans
description: To the Editor:

title: Care for Rape Victims
description: To the Editor:

title: In a City on Okinawa, Mayors Re-election Deals a Blow to Marine Base Relocation Plan
description: TOKYO  Efforts to relocate a Marine air base that has been a longstanding irritant in ties between Japan and the United States suffered a new setback on Sunday when voters in a small Okinawan city re-elected a leftist mayor who promised to block construction of a replacement site.

title: Chinas Web Junkies
description: A short documentary about a Chinese boot-camp-style treatment center for young men addicted to the Internet.

title: Reviving a Life Saver, the Tourniquet
description: As far back as Alexander the Greats campaigns, tourniquets were wartime staples, used to stanch the bleeding of wounded soldiers. But they became a last resort for both military and civilian emergency personnel after World War II, when medical experts blamed the prolonged cutoff of blood for frequent amputations.

title: Chinas Web Junkies
description: Compulsive Internet use has been categorized as a mental health issue in many countries, including the United States, but China was among the first to label Internet addiction a clinical disorder.

title: Brazils Latest Clash With Its Urban Youth Takes Place at the Mall
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  The images have already been so jolting to Brazils elites that President Dilma Rousseff has convened a meeting of top aides to form a response and business owners have obtained injunctions to shut them down: thousands of teenagers, largely from the gritty urban periphery and organizing on social media, going on raucous excursions through shopping malls.

title: Confident Nets Spoiling for Rematch With Knicks
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Their rivalry is still just budding, but the Nets are hoping to use an embarrassing loss to the Knicks last month as fuel when the teams meet for the second time this season, Monday at Madison Square Garden.

title: Proposed Abortion Restrictions in Spain Face Backlash
description: MADRID  Prime Minister Mariano Rajoys proposal to enact some of the toughest abortion restrictions in Europe has exposed his already unpopular government to a building political backlash and criticism from the European Parliament, while reinvigorating his Socialist opponents and opening divisions in his own conservative Popular Party.

title: Hasbro Gives Its Transformers Toys a New Look
description: When Hasbro conceived its Transformers toy line 30 years ago, the concept was simple: robots that turned into vehicles faster than you could say more than meets the eye.

title: Life as a Female Journalist: Hot or Not?
description: LOS ANGELES  IN 2009, I wrote a cover story for Wired magazine about the anti-vaccine movement and profiled Paul Offit, a leading proponent of vaccines for children. Dr. Offit is a man. I am a woman. That was sufficient grounds for things to get ugly.

title: Many Choices for Tanaka With Deadline Approaching
description: Masahiro Tanakas baseball fate will be decided by Friday afternoon, and it appears that more than a half-dozen teams have made bids for him or are prepared to. The Yankees, the Los Angeles Dodgers, the Arizona Diamondbacks, the Chicago White Sox and the Chicago Cubs are said to be among the teams in hot pursuit of Tanaka, a Japanese right-handed pitcher.

title: Fixing Disability Courts
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  ITS hard to imagine a more cynical fraud. According to an indictment unsealed last week by the Manhattan district attorneys office, post-9/11 phobias of airplanes and skyscrapers were among the fictitious ailments described by retired New York City police officers and firefighters who, in a scheme involving as many as 1,000 people, are accused of ripping off the Social Security disability system by filing false claims.

title: Trying to Salvage Garbage Time
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  When the Knicks played the Nets on Dec. 5 at Barclays Center, the game presented the rare opportunity for Carmelo Anthony to watch the final minutes of a blowout win from the bench. He enjoyed the experience.

title: The How Are You? Culture Clash
description: WHEN an American asks me this question, its like a wall of ice crashing down between us.

title: The Undeserving Rich
description: The reality of rising American inequality is stark.
