description: Bruce Bartlett held senior policy roles in the Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations and served on the staffs of Representatives Jack Kemp and Ron Paul. He is the author of The Benefit and the Burden: Tax Reform  Why We Need It and What It Will Take.

title: Truck Hits Bronx House, Killing Driver
description: A concrete pump truck crashed into a home in the Bronx on Monday evening, killing the driver and destroying the front of the building.

title: Word of the Day | underlying
description: underlying \n-dr-li-iN\ adjective

title: Whats on Tuesday
description: 9 P.M. (13, 49) SALINGER (2013) With Paul Alexanders book Salinger as his starting point, Shane Salerno layers biographical material with archival photographs, re-enactments and interviews with high school students, celebrities and even murderers to shed light on J. D. Salinger, above  from his World War II experiences and relationships with younger women to his decision to live in a fortress of privacy. Philip Seymour Hoffman, Edward Norton, John Cusack, Martin Sheen, Tom Wolfe and Gore Vidal offer perspective. Writing in The New York Times, A. O. Scott called the film, presented here by American Masters, less a work of cinema than the byproduct of its own publicity campaign. He added: It does not so much explore the life and times of J. D. Salinger as run his memory and legacy through a spin cycle of hype. Salinger moved to the woods of New Hampshire partly to escape the intrusions and indignities of American celebrity culture. Salinger is that cultures revenge.

title: Shanghai Doctor Dies of Bird Flu
description: Shanghai health officials say that a doctor has died of H7N9 bird flu, adding to concerns about a recent upturn in the diseases spread in China.

title: For Aam Aadmi Interns, Politics Involves Paperwork and Occasional Screaming Protest
description: MUMBAI  In the second week of his internship with the Aam Aadmi Party, Nitish Sharma, a final-year law student, found himself in a crowd of men wearing white Gandhi caps at the gates of Raj Bhavan, the Maharashtra state governors sparkling mansion perched on the edge of the Arabian Sea.

title: For Micahs Birthday, His Grandfathers Blessing
description: At 91, my father, Irving Effron, can barely remember his childrens names, though he has acute recollections of long-forgotten battles that he fought as a Marine in the Philippines during World War II. My mother, Ruth, grieves for the loss of the guy who swept her off her feet on a Rockaway beach the summer after he came home from the war. That guy was here up until a few years ago, when dementia set in and Irvings rare good days became something to cherish, even as his bad days became more numerous.

title: In China, a Week Full of Trials Over Dissent
description: Updated, 7:52 p.m. |

title: 32 Arrests at Rally for Airport Workers Near La Guardia
description: The police arrested 32 people outside La Guardia Airport on Monday afternoon at a march in support of airport contract workers having a paid holiday on Martin Luther King Jr.s birthday.

title: Pakistan Goes After Militants in Northwest
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Pakistani jets pounded suspected militant hide-outs in North Waziristan on Monday night for the first time in years, signaling that the government was prepared to take the fight to the center of the insurgency that has racked Pakistan. There were at least 40 casualties in the airstrikes.

title: A Conversation With: Author Jerry Pinto
description: Jerry Pintos first novel, Em and the Big Hoom, referring to the narrators nicknames for his parents, was released last year after decades of introspection and dozens of scrapped drafts. In the years he was working on the novel, he also published 14 works of nonfiction and poetry, as well as worked as a journalist in his native city of Mumbai. Indias biggest names in literature have heaped praise upon his fiction debut, although in reality his novel straddles an immensely porous border between fiction and memoir.

title: Test Yourself | History, Jan. 21
description: Take the Quiz

title: 6 Qs About the News | Reconsidering Life Sentences for Juvenile Offenders
description: In Juveniles Facing Lifelong Terms Despite Rulings, Erik Eckholm writes about the question of mandatory life sentences for juveniles convicted of murder in the United States.

title: Human Rights Watch Criticizes Inaction on Syria
description: BERLIN  The advocacy group Human Rights Watch sharply criticized international powers on Tuesday for the way they are dealing with the civil war in Syria, saying that the desire to bring President Bashar al-Assads government to the negotiating table should not become a pretext for failing to protect civilians caught in the conflict, which has claimed more than 100,000 lives.

title: Agitating for Justice and Freedom With a Camera
description: Like an Old Testament prophet, the photographer Danny Lyon has agitated for his fellow man to pursue justice and freedom. This was not always a popular message, nor a lucrative one, but that wasnt how he saw his role.

title: Do You Apologize Too Much?
description: Most of us say things like um, you know and like as meaningless conversational filler, but in a recent essay, one woman writes in The Times about realizing how often she said sorry  and how she broke the habit.

title: Suicide Bomber Strikes in South Beirut, Killing at Least 4
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A suicide bomber blew himself up early Tuesday in a neighborhood in south Beirut where the Shiite militia and political party Hezbollah holds sway, the most recent in a series of such attacks that have targeted civilian areas across Lebanon in recent months.

title: Times Minute | Syria Peace Talks
description: Also on the Minute, Brazil's youth protest in malls and the Jamaican bobsled team works to afford Sochi.

title: Times Minute | Syria Peace Talks
description: In the Video

title: New York Today: Major Snowstorm Barrels In
description: Updated 12:54 p.m.

title: In Files, a History of Sexual Abuse by Priests in Chicago Archdiocese
description: CHICAGO  One priest, the Rev. William J. Cloutier, was accused of raping a boy in his summer cottage, locking the door when the 13-year-old started screaming, and then brandishing a handgun while threatening to kill him if he told anyone. Another, the Rev. Robert C. Becker, would take boys to a trailer where, they said, he slept beside them and molested them. And the Rev. Joseph R. Bennett was accused of raping a girl with the handle of a paten, a plate used to hold eucharistic bread.

title: Bosnias Lessons for Syria
description: WASHINGTON  DESPITE the last-minute diplomatic row over the cancellation of the United Nations invitation to Iran, the Geneva II peace talks between the government of Bashar al-Assad and the Syrian opposition are scheduled to start today, with support from NATO members and Russia. But the process faces daunting challenges.

title: Daily Report: Homegrown Social App Dominates Chinese Market
description: Weixin (pronounced way-shin) is this countrys killer app, a highly addictive social networking tool that allows smartphone users to send messages and share news, photos, videos and web links, much like Americas WhatsApp, or Line, a Japanese communications and messaging app. In the United States, a similar version is known as WeChat, David Barboza reports.

title: Peaceful Swiss Resort Takes On Troubles of Syrian War
description: MONTREUX, Switzerland  The expectant melancholy typical of resort towns in the winter has given way here, at least in the center of this lakeside village, to something edgier, as if a piece of the Green Zone had levitated here from Baghdad.

title: Why 2013 Was Our Best Year Ever (Except for One Crucial Metric)
description: January has rolled around again, and its time for me to take stock of how my business performed in 2013. This has been an annual event for me (these are my corresponding posts for 2012, 2011, and 2010). And this is the executive summary: great year! In fact, it was the best ever  with the exception of one important metric.

title: Work Weekends and Long Hours, Fund Manager Advises Young Bankers
description: LONDON  Credit Suisse may be encouraging its young bankers to shun the office on weekends if they are not working on a big deal. And Goldman Sachs might have a junior banker task force to examine how to make the lives of lower-ranking analysts and associates more efficient and humane.

title: The Nobility of Mens Wear
description: PARIS  Noble is a weird word to use for a modern male wardrobe. Some of the clothes are bound to be sporty, rather than the familiar uniform of smart suits and military coats once associated with a nobleman.

title: Geneva II
description: The Syria peace conference gets off to a bad start.

title: Ukraines Opposition Says Government Stirs Violence
description: KIEV, Ukraine  As demonstrators in ski masks scuffled with the police here on Tuesday evening, opposition leaders accused the government of provoking the very violence it has been condemning in an effort to discredit and possibly split the protest movement.

title: For Canadian Teenager, to Believe Is to Belong
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Eugenie Bouchard is in the Australian Open semifinals because she never thought she was not supposed to be.

title: In Performance: Peggy Shaw of Ruff
description: In this weeks video the Obie-winning performer and writer Peggy Shaw performs a scene from her solo show Ruff, about her life before and after having a stroke in 2011. The production, co-written and directed by Lois Weaver, continues through Jan. 26 at La MaMa.

title: Chanel: Spring 2014 Couture
description: Paris

title: Whos In and Whos Out at Davos
description: The World Economic Forum in Davos, which begins this Wednesday, is as notable for its attendees as for its absentees, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in the DealBook column. While this years guest list includes prime ministers, chief executives of some of the largest financial institutions and at least one movie star, others in the financial worlds inner circle are, perhaps surprisingly, electing not to go to Switzerland.

title: Arab vs. Russian Soccer Teams
description: Dear Diary:

title: A Conversation With: Graphic Novelist Vishwajyoti Ghosh
description: Vishwajyoti Ghosh, a graphic novelist and artist based in Delhi, is curator of the book This Side That Side: Restorying Partition, an anthology of graphic narratives from India, Pakistan and Bangladesh. His first graphic novel, Delhi Calm, was published in 2010. At the Jaipur Literature Festival, Mr. Ghosh spoke with India Ink about the significance of collaborating with 48 different contributors, and what it means for younger generations to retell the history of Partition in a graphic format.

title: Apax Partners to Acquire All of Online Auto Sales Company Trader Media
description: LONDON  Funds advised by the European private equity firm Apax Partners agreed on Tuesday to buy out its joint venture partner and acquired the stake it did not own in the Trader Media Group, which operates the automobile website AutoTrader in Britain and other online brands.

title: Amid Scandal, Christie Sounds Note of Optimism at Inauguration
description: TRENTON  A subdued-looking Gov. Chris Christie, bedeviled by doubts about his leadership style and political tactics, took the oath of office on Tuesday at the lowest point in his governorship, determined to re-establish a bond with scandal-weary citizens of New Jersey and remind them of what it was they liked about him.

title: Caution at Unilever as Its Sales Slow Down
description: LONDON  The global economy might be slowly recovering and consumers gradually gaining confidence. But Unilever, one of the worlds largest consumer products companies, remains cautious.

title: Activists Accuse Tech Community of Throwing San Francisco Under the Bus
description: The luxury buses that ferry tech workers from San Francisco to Silicon Valley every morning were originally a solution to several problems: how to painlessly get workers to their jobs while being environmentally conscious while getting another two hours of work out of everyone. The Wi-Fi password on Googles buses was DontBeEvil.

title: Cindy Bruna Transforms Backstage at Giambattista Valli
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures the transformations of the Spring 2014 Couture Collections in Paris. Here, the model Cindy Bruna before (left) and after (right) makeup by Val Garland and hair by Orlando Pita.

title: Sundance: Family Ties Behind the Scenes and in the Audience
description: PARK CITY, Utah  A breed apart? Not this Sundance.

title: Deal Makers Hope for Merger Magic
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  Amid the frenzy of meetings at the World Economic Forum in Davos last January, the heads of the global advertising rivals Publicis and Omnicom found time for an informal chat.

title: Wawrinka Outlasts Djokovic in a Marathon Match
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Stanislas Wawrinkas forehand sailed wide on break point in the fourth set, and Novak Djokovic screamed. Then he screamed again. Then he screamed once more. He screamed as if he won the tournament. He screamed as if he won the lottery. He screamed so loud for so long the chair umpire issued a warning.

title: U.S. Delegation to Press Issues Like Climate Change and Syria
description: WASHINGTON  When the American delegation arrives in Davos, Switzerland, this week, it will be with a more triumphalist message than in years past.

title: Obama Will Meet With Pope
description: President Obama, who has taken to citing Pope Francis as his rhetorical ally in his campaign to combat inequality in incomes and opportunity, will meet with the pontiff in March during a European trip, the White House announced on Tuesday.

title: In Our Pages: January 22
description: 1939: Unemployed Invade Matches

title: At Chanel Couture, Running Shoes and Dancing
description: PARIS  At the Chanel couture show on Tuesday morning, held as usual at the Grand Palais and featuring yet another of Karl Lagerfelds fantastical sets, attendees were greeted by a shimmering silver and white room, complete with rows of comfortable couches facing an undulating white wall. It felt as if we were entering an upscale nightclub, perhaps one that might have been featured in a Busby Berkeley film.

title: Pre-K Plan Puts Cuomo at Odds With de Blasio on Funding
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo on Tuesday unveiled a budget plan containing a glittering prize for Mayor Bill de Blasio: money for the prekindergarten classes that he had made a centerpiece of his insurgent bid for mayor.

title: Valli: Girly, Young and Fun
description: PARIS  Lets give a name to Giambattista Vallis flirtatious collection of super-short dresses, the skirts flipping up toward a female erogenous zone: Hoop-l-l!

title: Davos Draws Social Media Scrutiny
description: Its January, and for some of the movers and shakers in business and banking, that means its time to meet with other members of the global elite at an Alpine ski resort in Switzerland.

title: Activist Investor Rewards Streamlining at Dow Chemical by Taking a Big Stake
description: Updated, 7:34 p.m. | When the activist investor Daniel S. Loeb met with representatives of Dow Chemical in December, the company had already stolen his thunder.

title: Finding a Doctor Who Supports Genetic Screening During I.V.F.
description: Now remember, were not judging doctors based on personality, Solomon reminded me for the gazillionth time. I nodded. Were looking for the best treatment plan.

title: Top Wonkblog Columnist to Leave Washington Post
description: Ezra Klein, an analyst, columnist and pundit who runs The Washington Posts Wonkblog, will leave the newspaper, taking two of his colleagues with him, according to an internal memo sent on Tuesday.

title: At Chanel, Look at the Shoes!
description: PARIS  Look at the shoes!

title: Man Arrested in the Killings of His Wife and Children
description: A man wanted in the stabbing deaths of his wife and two young daughters over the weekend has been arrested in Texas, the New York Police Department said on Tuesday.

title: Vivendi Said to Consider Sale of SFR to Numericable
description: Vivendi, the French conglomerate that once owned Universal Studios, is considering selling its mobile and Internet unit to the cable operator Numericable, according to a report from Bloomberg News on Tuesday.

title: The Read Around: Rebecca Mead
description: Rebecca Mead, author of My Life in Middlemarch, says that reading and rereading George Eliots masterpiece has helped shape her own life.

title: The Read Around: Video of Rebecca Mead
description: In The Read Around, a weekly video feature, authors discuss the when, where and how behind their books. Above, Rebecca Mead discusses My Life in Middlemarch, a combination of biography, literary criticism and memoir about George Eliots masterpiece.

title: Threes a Trend | Two-Faced Coats
description: Double-faced cashmere is one of the softest, most luxurious fabrics around  specially woven with two right sides, or faces, so that the wearer feels the ultrasoft fiber both on the inside and out. Its a hallmark of many high-end fashion collections, as theres no difference in quality between the front and the back of the fabric. And the drape of a coat made with this material, unencumbered by the usual structure, is loose and fluid, like a bathrobe. At Valentino, a new capsule, haute couture collection for men included a classic, double-faced cashmere coat in camel that looks as luxurious as it feels. Varied versions of the high-class standby included Tomas Maiers olive offering at Bottega Veneta, which he layered over equally cozy, athletic-style pants and zip top. And at Louis Vuitton, the designer Kim Jones draped a gray, peaked lapel coat over the shoulders of a suit and tank top, for the height of elegance.

title: Which Authors or Books Have Worked on You as Negative Influences?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Thomas Mallon and Daniel Mendelsohn discuss their negative influences: works that have inspired them to take an opposing approach in their own writing.

title: Encore, for the Norwegian Curlers and Their Pants
description: LAS VEGAS  The sun had set on the Strip and some members of the Norwegian curling team were taking a break from competing in a tournament here. They were ready to hit the town, the Bellagio, perhaps, and maybe dinner at Caesars Palace. But the men knew that tourists would not recognize them as Scandinavian stars of an obscure sport.

title: JPMorgan Is Said to Drop Out of Another Offering in China
description: Updated, 8:16 p.m. | JPMorgan Chase has removed itself from a potential $1 billion share sale by a Chinese chemical company as an investigation in the United States into hiring practices in China by JPMorgan and other Wall Street banks moves forward, people with direct knowledge of the matter said on Tuesday.

title: Thai Leaders Declare State of Emergency in Bangkok
description: BANGKOK  The embattled government of Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra declared the imposition of emergency rule in Bangkok and surrounding areas on Tuesday, suggesting a more aggressive posture toward protesters who have occupied parts of the city during the past two months and are seeking to overthrow the government.

title: How to Unblock Adobe Reader in Safari
description: Unblocking Adobe Reader in Safari

title: English F.A. Charges Anelka Over Contentious Gesture
description: LONDON  After a delay of more than three weeks, the governing body of English professional soccer said Tuesday that it had formally charged a French player, Nicolas Anelka, with making a racially or religiously abusive gesture when he celebrated a goal for his club, West Bromwich Albion, with the so-called quenelle salute, which is widely criticized as anti-Semitic.

title: Interview: Bradley Cooper
description: At the Critics' Choice awards, Bradley Cooper talks with Melena Ryzik about the performances and hairstyles of "American Hustle."

title: Why Bitcoin Matters
description: Editors note: Marc Andreessens venture capital firm, Andreessen Horowitz, has invested just under $50 million in Bitcoin-related start-ups. The firm is actively searching for more Bitcoin-based investment opportunities. He does not personally own more than a de minimis amount of Bitcoin.

title: Accounts and People of Note in the Advertising Industry
description: John Anicker, president for operations at Hornall Anderson, Seattle, was promoted to president and chief executive. Jack Anderson, who had been chief executive, becomes chairman, a new post. Hornall Anderson is part of the Diversified Agency Services division of the Omnicom Group.

title: Q. and A. With Stuart Elliott
description: Stuart Elliott, the advertising columnist, answers questions from readers each week. Questions can be sent to stuarte@nytimes.com.

title: Activist Investor Joins Mondelez International Board
description: Mondelez International, the snack company that Kraft Foods spun off in 2012, announced on Tuesday that it had added the activist investor Nelson Peltz to its board, as Mr. Peltz seemed to end his push for a merger between Mondelez and PepsiCo.

title: Times Minute | Chicago Church Sex Abuse
description: Also on the Minute, abortion in politics and Japan's dolphin hunt.

title: Obama Evolves on Marijuana
description: In 2010, the White Houses National Drug Control Strategy memo included a reminder that the Obama administration firmly opposes the legalization of marijuana or any other illicit drug. The 2013 update of that memo reiterated that the administration rejects legalization.

title: Breaking Free From Winters Hold With a Lemony Escarole Soup
description: As winter tightens its frigid grip, I turn to chicken soup for consolation.

title: The Twist to This Pro Bono Campaign? The Rights are Priced
description: Among the marketing tactics most criticized  and mocked  for their excesses, perhaps Public Enemy No. 1 is when corporations pay outsize sums for naming rights to stadiums, ballparks, arenas, lounges and other facilities. Now a nonprofit organization has adapted the practice for its own charitable purposes.

title: Running Economies Into the Sand
description: Hmm. Allies of the Cameron government are now taunting Hollande as having run the French economy into the sand  presumably by contrast with the British triumph. How does that look in terms of, you know, actual numbers?

title: Today in Small Business: Letmein
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Video: Bradley Cooper and That Perm
description: LOS ANGELES  Quick, viewers of American Hustle: can you separate Christian Bales swindler Irving Rosenfeld from his elaborate comb-over or Bradley Coopers tightly wound F.B.I. agent from his coiled perm? (To say nothing of high-maintenance wife Jennifer Lawrences towering updo.) The David O. Russell film was nominated for an Academy Award for its costume design but, in a highly noted snub, not for its hair or makeup.

title: Paris Couture Week: Dior Spring/Summer 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Couture Week photo diary of Schohaja.

title: A Dylan Tribute Concert Is Getting New Life
description: TheBob Dylanreissue machine has already refurbished Mr. Dylans complete catalog and has regularly revisited the vaults to offer compilations of outtakes and rarities. Now, Columbia Records historical division, Legacy Recordings, has turned its attention to a Dylan footnote, though a hefty one,the concert the label presentedat Madison Square Garden on Oct. 16, 1992, to commemorate the 30thanniversary of its relationship with Mr. Dylan. A remastered high-definition video version, on DVD and Blu-ray, and a refreshed two-CD edition, are due outMarch 4. Both versions will include extra performances and rehearsal material.

title: Protesters Make Do with Donated Snacks and Lack of Toilets
description: NEW DELHI  Since he began his protest on Monday, coughs and sniffles have punctuated the speeches by Arvind Kejriwal, Delhis chief minister and leader of the Aam Aadmi, or Common Man, Party. A thin gray scarf, tied around his head vertically, protected his ears in a minimalistic way, reminiscent of a lonely security guard. He was the Common Man with the common cold.

title: Delhi Chief Minister Calls Off Protest After Deal to Put Two Police Officials on Leave
description: NEW DELHI  Arvind Kejriwal, Delhis chief minister, called off his partys sit-in protest over womens safety on Tuesday night after the central government agreed to place on leave two police officials who the Aam Aadmi Party accused of failing to protect women.

title: Vitter to Run for Louisiana Governor
description: Senator David Vitter, a Republican once tarred by scandal, announced on Tuesday that he will run for governor of Louisiana.

title: Apple Wins Temporary Stay on Court Monitor
description: Apple won a small victory on Tuesday in its attempt to oust a court-appointed monitor who is responsible for overseeing the companys compliance with federal antitrust laws.

title: Fiat Completes Acquisition of Chrysler
description: A classic American car manufacturer has officially become 100 percent Italian.

title: The Collections | The Top Five Fall/Winter 2014 Mens Wear Shows in Paris
description: It was another great season for mens wear in Paris, which wrapped up over the weekend. Some credit has to be handed to the beautiful City of Lights itself, a stunning backdrop for the Fall/Winter 2014 collections. Some of the designers presented their most thoughtful and memorable shows yet, including the following top five.

title: Readers Respond: Managing an Overflowing Inbox
description: If you were one of the people who sent me an email last year and I didnt respond, Im sorry. As I noted in my column this week, I probably deleted it.

title: Image of the Day: January 21
Urban Grit in Phillys Fishtown
description: In the Fishtown area of Philadelphia, Sarah Anderson, a boutique owner, says her style is inspired by 70s B-level horror movies.

title: The Trap of Too Many Choices
description: I recently got a new smartphone. In the setup process, I was presented with all sorts of options. Selecting a language was pretty easy, but I had to think harder about some of the other ones. Did I want the phone to use my location? Did I want to share data anonymously? Did I want to log in with an existing account or did I need to set up a new one?

title: Turkish Leader, Amid Scandal at Home, Visits Brussels to Try to Repair Ties
description: PARIS  Buffeted by a corruption scandal and accusations of creeping authoritarianism, Turkey faces long odds in its bid to join the European Union even as the countrys prime minister, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, visited Brussels on Tuesday to try to repair a badly frayed relationship with Europe.

title: Bouchra Jarrar: Spring 2014 Couture
description: Paris

title: Gay Couple? Are You Amending a Tax Return?
description: Tax season is not traditionally a time of year Americans look forward to. But this year may be different  at least for some.

title: Horizon:  Artifacts of the Mayans; Tales of the City Finale
description: ART

title: More Producers Secrets: Captain Phillips and the Defining Screen Test
description: The producer Michael De Luca let an audience of indie filmmakers and wannabes in on some secrets at a discussion at Sundance on Tuesday morning. But Mr. De Luca, whose credits include The Social Network, Moneyball, Magnolia and the coming film adaptation of 50 Shades of Grey, already revealed some secrets at the Producers Guild nominee panel in Los Angeles, which he attended last week as a producer of Captain Phillips, a contender for the best picture Oscar.

title: Caramoor Sets Lineup for Summer Festival
description: The Caramoor Center for Music and the Arts has announced the classical music and operaprogramming for this summers festival, which will open on June 21 and run through Aug. 6. The performances, held on a 90-acre estate in Katonah, N.Y., include an opening-night concert in which the violinist Joshua Bell will be the soloist in the Sibelius concerto, part of a program by the Orchestra of St. Lukes, Cristian Macelaru conducting.

title: A Paul Taylor Dance Reunion at Koch Theater
description: The Paul Taylor Dance Company has announced that it has added an extraperformance to its season at the David H. Koch Theater, on March 23 at 6 p.m., for which 46 of the companys alumni have accepted Mr. Taylors invitation to appear onstage beside members of the current company.

title: Ars Nova to Stage New Play From Debate Society
description: The Debate Society, the quirky three-person theater troupe, will follow up its breakthrough hits Buddy Cop 2 and Blood Play with Jacuzzi, which focuses on a group of characters who populate the 7th-best ski resort in southwest central Colorado.

title: DNA Confirms Body Parts Belong to Missing Boy With Autism
description: First there was the disappearance: a 14-year-old boy with autism last seen walking out of his school by the Queens waterfront last fall. Then there were the months of searching, the posters of a fresh-faced teenager that a city came to know simply as Avonte.

title: France to Return 3 Artworks Looted in World War II
description: PARIS  Frances culture minister, Aurlie Filippetti, on Tuesday pledged to return three artworks looted in World War II without delay, including a 17th-century landscape by the Flemish painter Joos de Momper.

title: Funds Created to Offload Credit Risk From Big Projects
description: The Mariner Investment Group, a $10 billion global alternative investment firm, has created two funds that will buy up credit risk from deals used to finance large projects in areas like infrastructure, transportation and energy, allowing financial institutions, including European banks, to free up capital they would otherwise need to hold under regulatory requirements.

title: Martoma Defense Walks a Tightrope
description: The trial of Mathew Martoma presents a challenge often seen in recent insider trading prosecutions: how to mount a defense denying any wrongdoing when the defendant is unlikely to testify. One way to persuade a jury to return a not-guilty verdict is by focusing on the ordinary nature of the trading to raise questions about whether any confidential information was even used.

title: Weekly News Quiz | Jan. 14-Jan. 20, 2014
description: Droughts, dogs, football, movies and more: how many of the 10 questions below can you answer correctly?

title: After Hours | At Town Hall, A Chance to Shamelessly Worship the Indomitable Carol Channing
description: Gay men of a certain age have strong feelings about Broadway divas, who modeled an outsize swagger in an era when they themselves couldnt. Of all the give-em-heck floorboard belters in this particular canon, few have attained the sainted status of Carol Channing, the blond-mopped, lisping Hello Dolly icon who turns 93 next week with her stage brio intact. When she was helped onstage last night at Town Hall for a special birthday tribute, grinning widely and wearing a white boucl jacket and slacks, the cavernous house, packed mostly with middle-aged and older gay men, jumped to its feet and, for 10 minutes straight, released the sort of primal roar that might have accompanied a winning Superbowl pass.

title: Bananas are Chemicals, Too
description: Via a Facebook post by longtime science writer Boyce Rensberger of a piece on the science and technology website IO9, I found a set of clever and provocative illustrations created by James Kennedy, a high school chemistry teacher in Melbourne, Australia.

title: U.S. and Russia Discuss Olympic Security
description: BRUSSELS  Even as Russia imposes the most intensive security apparatus in Olympic history, the top military officers from the United States and Russia have opened discussions about using sophisticated American electronic equipment in a new effort to help secure the Winter Games in Sochi next month.

title: Residential Sales Around the Region
description: Information on sales in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Christie Sworn In for Second Term
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey took the oath of office at the War Memorial Theater in Trenton on Tuesday.

title: America to Obama: Were Not Listening
description: President Obama has come before the American people so many times now to promise transparency, declare his respect for civil rights and privacy, and vow to create a rational policy on government spying, that no one seems to be listening anymore.

title: Everything Is Strange, and Therein Lies the Point
description: Romantic love in the films of David Lynch is more than passion; as often as not, it is a dangerously morbid obsession expressed in songs that thread through the soundtracks like the tempting voices of sirens. The title song of Blue Velvet; Roy Orbisons In Dreams, from the same movie; and Chris Isaaks Wicked Game, from Wild at Heart, are prime examples of songs that dangle the keys to supernatural mysteries.

title: Conjuring the Global Dangers of Water
description: The PBS science program Nova has been trying to quicken its pace lately, generating episodes pegged to newsmaking events like Hurricane Sandy and the Boston Marathon bombing. Killer Typhoon, about the catastrophic storm in the Philippines in November, is the latest, and from it we learn once again that water is something to be feared.

title: Data Breaches Are Scary, but Dont Panic. React.
description: Its always upsetting when you are notified by a business, whether it is a credit card issuer or a retailer, that your personal or financial information may have been stolen in a data breach. The recent incident at Target stores, one of the largest corporate breaches in recent years, affected millions of people.

title: Here Lies Love Will Return to the Public Theater
description: The critically acclaimed musical Here Lies Love, which uses discotheque atmospherics to explore the celebrity life of former first lady of the Philippines, Imelda Marcos, will return starting March 24 to the Public Theater for an open-ended run, one of the producers, Joey Parnes, said on Tuesday.

title: Weekend Gun Report: MLK Edition
description: Friday marked the 25th anniversary of the Cleveland Elementary School shooting in Stockton, Calif., the first mass shooting of schoolchildren in American history. In the space of three minutes, five kids ranging in age from 6 to 9 were killed and 29 others were wounded, as was a teacher.

title: As Images of Attacker are Shared, Thai Government Issues Emergency Rule
description: As my colleague Thomas Fuller reported from Bangkok on Tuesday, the government in Thailand has declared the imposition of emergency rule to start on Wednesday.

title: Wheelies: The More Emotional Camry Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: At Raos in Los Angeles, Red Sauce and Rivalry
description: LOS ANGELES  Seward Street runs through a patch of film production studios and empty lots in Hollywood. It is dimly lit, usually deserted and a little spooky at night. But the other Friday evening, the red glow of a neon sign splashed across the road. A security guard and a parking valet stood out front, and a steady stream of people walked into what is, as it turns out, a restaurant, a Rat Pack outpost of dark wood, red leather booths and twinkling year-round Christmas lights.

title: Discovery Takes Controlling Stake in Eurosport
description: Discovery Communications on Tuesday said it had taken a controlling 51 percent stake in Eurosport International, a pan-European sports media group, in a deal that values the company at $1.2 billion.

title: Numb to Violence? Fans, Maybe, but Not Players
description: SEATTLE  The National Football League markets and manufactures controlled violence and mayhem better than any other league in the history of organized sports.

title: Catching the Olympic Spirit in Lake Placid, N.Y.
description: The Sochi Winter Olympics in Russia open in about two weeks with peerless sports pageantry and a cavalcade of athletic accomplishment that will captivate the world. Sitting at home, it will be easy to get caught up in the Olympic spirit gazing from afar at what seems like a picture-perfect snow globe setting where various acts of derring-do and stylish grace are celebrated with medals and everlasting tribute.

title: An LED Bulb Is Both Dimmable and Affordable
description: Heres a bulb you might think about licking rather than lighting. Philipss cut the weight of its new SlimStyle lamp down to about three ounces by eliminating the heat sink found in most other LED lamps.

title: J. Mendel | The Company
description: Gilles Mendel on the history and heritage of J. Mendel.

title: Pussy Riot Coming to Brooklyn
description: Pussy Riot is coming to Brooklyn.

title: Sundance: A Veterans First Visit
description: PARK CITY, Utah  Though hes only made three features, Anton Corbijn could be considered something of a veteran filmmaker here at Sundance, where indie directors borrowing favors from family rule the scene.

title: J. Mendel | The Fur
description: Gilles Mendel discusses the making of a fur dress for his Spring 2014 show.

title: J. Mendel | Behind the Dress
description: Gilles Mendel discusses the process in which a dress is made.

title: J. Mendel | The Show
description: The gown and the fur dress at the Spring 2014 runway show.

description: To Restock: Williamsburg Offers a New Cookware Outlet

title: G.E. to Buy Health Care Analytics Firm
description: General Electric announced on Tuesday that it had agreed to purchase API Healthcare, a software and analytics firm that helps medical companies manage their work force.

title: Outside the Fall/Winter 2014 Berlin Mens Shows
description: A glimpse at what guys are wearing this season.

title: Curtain Call | Paris Men's Fashion Week
description: To mark the conclusion of Paris Men's Fashion Week, we catalog the bows  some proud, some playful, some humble, some all of the above  of 15 fashion visionaries.

title: A Welcome Formula for Dow Chemical
description: The activist investor Daniel S. Loeb is putting the right accelerant into Dow Chemical. Shares of Dow jumped more than 7 percent at one point on Tuesday after Mr. Loeb called for a split of its petrochemicals and specialty chemicals businesses. He may be overly optimistic about the financial benefits, but a rough sum of the parts suggests merely breaking up Dow, a $52 billion company, could increase its value by a fifth.

title: German Energy Official Sounds a Warning
description: BERLIN  Germanys new energy minister on Tuesday struck a sobering tone about the countrys ambitious goals for making its energy sector more reliant on renewable sources, saying that rising costs risked losing public support and jeopardizing the powerful German industrial base.

title: A Rare View of Wildebeest Calves
description: August is the prime month for safarigoers to visit the Serengeti in Tanzania for the migration of the wildebeest, but travelers who want to escape the crowds during this peak time and still want to see these animals would do well to head to the southern Serengeti during calving season.

title: Are You Lonesome Tonight? From Elvis Presley to Kacey Musgraves
description: Are You Lonesome Tonight?

title: Narcissa Opens in the Standard East Village
description: Headliners

title: East Coast Storm Brings Snow and Disruptions to the New York Region
description: New Yorkers are used to a lot of overheated discussion about impending snow.

title: He Is the Captain Now (at Least Everyone Tells Him So)
description: As far as film debuts go, its hard to find a more auspicious one than that of Barkhad Abdi, playing the Somali pirate who kidnaps Tom Hanks in Captain Phillips. Mr. Abdi, a limo driver in Minneapolis when he was cast from an open call, learned about acting on the fly from the director, Paul Greengrass, whom he credited with helping craft his performance.

title: Play against the Clock
description: Solve Crosswords against the clock

title: A Miniaturized Controller for iOS Games
description: Entrepreneurs are bringing gaming accessories into the world of apps.

description: Scenes from the Paris Couture Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Pictures of the Day: New Jersey and Elsewhere
description: Photos from New Jersey, South Sudan, Central African Republic and Bulgaria.

title: Justices Appear Divided on a Sweeping Challenge to Public Workers Unions
description: WASHINGTON  A broad challenge to public sector unions was met with a mixed response on Tuesday at the Supreme Court.

title: Heir Apparent at Pimco to Step Down
description: Updated, 8:36 p.m. | The giant asset manager Pimco lost its heir apparent and most prominent spokesman on Tuesday when Mohamed A. El-Erian unexpectedly announced that he was stepping down from the company.

title: Excluded Iran Says Its Role at Talks on Syria Will Be Missed
description: TEHRAN  After Iran was invited to and then disinvited from a coming peace conference on Syria within the span of 24 hours, Iranian officials and commentators said on Tuesday that it was the attendees who would be missing out.

title: Language by the Book, but the Book Is Evolving
description: OXFORD, England  To compile a dictionary of nearly every word in the English language was an endeavor typical of Victorian times, complete with white-bearded gentlemen, utter confidence and an endearingly plodding pace. After a quarter-century, the first installment emerged in 1884. Its contents? A to Ant.

title: Ex-Governor of Virginia Is Indicted on Charges Over Loans and Gifts
description: Former Gov. Bob McDonnell of Virginia and his wife, Maureen, were indicted Tuesday by a federal grand jury on charges of accepting more than $140,000 in loans and gifts in exchange for promoting the business of a political patron who was seeking special favors from the state government.

title: Theyre Young, Female and, Darn It, Need to Work
description: For so long, women tried to succeed as much as men.

title: A New York Home for Riiss Other Half
description: Ted Gup, a professor of journalism at Emerson College, has donated a first edition copy of Jacob Riiss How the Other Half Lives  a searing expos of life in New York tenements, published in 1890  to the New-York Historical Society, the society announced on Tuesday. The copy was owned by Riis, who not only wrote for How the Other Half Lives, but also illustrated it with his own photographs. It includes his signature and a date (Nov. 15, 1890), as well as marginal annotations that expand on some of the ideas in the text.

title: Factoring in the Mystique of Long Lines
description: Independent thinkers find this hard to admit, but when you see crowds of New Yorkers standing outside a bakery or putting their names on the list at the door of a restaurant, more often than not the food theyre hanging around for is worth eating.

title: A Change in the Kitchen
description: Last week at Marea, a New York haunt of the powerful and the polished, Lauren DeSteno moved up from executive sous-chef to chef de cuisine. It may sound like a mere tweak of a title, but in a small way it is revolutionary.

title: Taking On a Master and His Many Complexities
description: The Takacs Quartet played Bartok, long one of its specialties, in two superb concerts over the weekend at Zankel Hall. Not only was the music making excellent, but I was also reminded throughout the performances of the clean, resonant acoustics of this subterranean space, which is celebrating its 10th season.

title: Two Troupes Evoke Endlessness in Words and Movement
description: In an attempt to evoke eternity, three dancers play triangles, chant overlapping phrases and contort themselves into elaborate yoga poses. Later, three other dancers count to 3,000, as they go through ballet steps and banal conversations that strive for Freudian uncanniness. Its another evening at the American Realness Festival, the experimental performance series that closed on Sunday.

title: Recessions True Cost Is Still Being Tallied
description: On Sept. 15, 2008, the investment bank Lehman Brothers collapsed after a long struggle to avoid bankruptcy, paralyzing the worlds financial networks and tipping the United States economy into an abyss from which it has not yet fully emerged.

title: Trotskys Pursuer Finds a Pursuer to Call His Own
description: If Gabriel Garca Mrquezs Love in the Time of Cholera turned the romance novel into literature, and Mario Vargas Llosa, with Conversation in the Cathedral, applied French 1950s nouveau roman techniques to the political thriller, the Cuban writer Leonardo Padura, known for detective thrillers, has made his entrance to the Latin American Modernist canon by writing a Russian novel.

title: American Starts a Luxury Resort to Share the Argentina He Loves
description: VISTA FLORES, Argentina  It is hard to find fault with lunch at Siete Fuegos, the restaurant at the new Vines Resort & Spa in the Mendoza province. The steak is grilled to medium-rare perfection. The sparkling torronts wine nicely complements the homemade dulce de leche ice cream. The open-air dining room looks upon acres of vineyards set against the snow-capped Andes.

title: 2 Friends Reach Across the Aisle on Immigration
description: WASHINGTON  The two women might at first seem more like political rivals than a reminder of the way things used to work in Washington.

title: To See or Not to See? A Season for High Art
description: Not all potential theatergoers look to New Yorks stages hoping to see singing Mormons or the warbling witches of Oz, and this season, producers would give their horses, if not their kingdoms, for their attention and ticket-buying dollars.

title: Times Minute | Syrian Peace Negotiations
description: Also on the Minute, TV on your cellphone and women in the elite kitchens.

title: Times Minute | Syrian Peace Negotiations

title: Hotel Review: Arts Boutique Hotel B in Lima, Peru
description: Rates

title: Search for the Next Big Thing Yields Soaring Valuations
description: You probably saw that Google is paying $3.2 billion in cash for Nest Labs, a maker of smart thermostats that has no profit and perhaps $300 million in revenue.

title: Kasparovs Moves in Run for Chess Office Raise Ethical Concerns
description: Garry Kasparov, the former chess world champion, announced in October that he was running for president of the World Chess Federation, the games governing body. He also announced a slate of candidates who were his nominees to lead the organization in various geographic regions.

title: Homes a Short Walk From Princeton Prove a Tough Sell
description: A development in Princeton, N.J., was intended to entice wealthy buyers with the promise of luxury living in a vibrant downtown setting.

title: Key Witness in Martoma Trial Says He Lied to F.B.I.
description: Dr. Sidney Gilman, the governments star witness in its case against Mathew Martoma, a former SAC Capital Advisors portfolio manager, testified on Tuesday that he lied to F.B.I. agents and regulators for nearly a year about passing inside information to Mr. Martoma.

title: Puzzles, Mysteries and a Dragon
description: THE ROOM TWO

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate
description: Recent Sale

title: $1 Billion for a Perfect N.C.A.A. Bracket, Courtesy of Warren Buffett
description: Each March, tens of millions of brackets are filled out in the hopes of predicting the outcome of the N.C.A.A.s mens basketball tournament. But the odds that a bracket will be perfect, that is, every game guessed correctly, are long  to the tune of 9.2 quintillion to one.

title: Several Chefs Cooking a Latin Recipe, Blending Melodies and Genres
description: Folk, pop and classical music meet in unlikely places in South America. That was one recurring motif, along with nimble fingers, attention to detail and a sense of humor, in Monday nights concert at Merkin Concert Hall. It was the evening half of the New York Guitar Festivals free pair of concerts, Guitar Marathon: Las Americas, which was recorded for WNYCs Soundcheck. The afternoon show had featured North American music, down through Mexico. The evening concert was a quintuple bill largely chosen by its headliner, the Brazilian guitarist Badi Assad, with musicians from Brazil, Uruguay and Peru and a repertoire that also embraced Argentina and Venezuela.

title: Jonathan J. Landau
description: Mr. Landau, 39, is the chief executive of the Fortis Property Group, a private real estate development and investment company based in Brooklyn that focuses mainly on office and residential properties. The company is involved in several multifamily projects in the New York area, including condominium buildings in North Williamsburg and Brooklyn Heights.

title: Joplin Will Make Way For Joneses on Broadway
description: A Night With Janis Joplin, a Broadway musical that has been a modest seller at the box office, will close in February and then aim to reopen in March at another space in New York City, the producers announced on Tuesday evening. They declined to specify a closing date or identify the possible new space, only saying in a statement that they were finalizing a wonderful option to move to another venue.

title: Pope Urges Davos Notables to Remember the Less Fortunate
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  Participants of the World Economic Forum, from corporate chieftains to government ministers, are expected  encouraged, actually  to spend their time amid the snowy hills of Davos networking and talking shop.

title: Woman Posts Video of Phone Confrontation Accusing Ex-Teacher of Sexual Abuse
description: A 28-year-old California woman posted on YouTube last week a secret telephone recording of her confrontation with a former middle school teacher who acknowledged sexually abusing her as a 12-year-old. The former teacher expressed regret for her actions during the recorded conversation, which has gone viral online.

title: What Is Working in New York
description: The following are updates on basic services following the snowstorm.

title: Fraudulent Asbestos Suits
description: To the Editor:

title: The Rwandan Genocide
description: To the Editor:

title: Video Shows Torontos Mayor Using Jamaican Patois in Obscene Rant About Police Surveillance
description: Last Updated, 7:23 p.m. | Two months after he claimed to have embraced sobriety, Mayor Rob Ford of Toronto was caught on video late Monday complaining about police surveillance of him and his associates in a drunken, obscenity-laced rant peppered with Jamaican patois.

title: Trade and the Environment
description: To the Editor:

title: The Costs of a Trip to the Doctor
Armani Priv: Spring 2014 Couture
description: Paris

title: Curtain Call | The Designers of Paris Mens Fashion Week Take Their Bows
description: Designers project their personalities not only through their collections but also in their appearances at the end of their runway shows. To mark the conclusion of Paris Mens Fashion Week, we catalog the bows  some proud, some playful, some humble, some all of the above  of 15 fashion visionaries.

title: Excerpt: Broad City
description: The new Comedy Central series features Ilana Glazer and Abbi Jacobson, two popular online comedians. Amy Poehler is a producer.

title: Twitter Q. and A. on Syria Peace Talks
description: As diplomats and politicians gathered in Switzerland for a highly anticipated peace conference on Syria, Anne Barnard, The Times's Beirut bureau chief, answered readers questions via Twitter on the continuing conflict and the expectations for the talks. She discussed the exclusion of Iran from the conference, opportunities to improve the delivery of humanitarian aid and prospects for the future.

title: Abundance Doesnt Mean Health
description: The relatively new notion that around a third or more of the worlds population is badly (mal) nourished conflates hunger and diet-spawned illnesses like diabetes, both of which are preventable.

title: The Holes in a Theory of Suicide
description: Forensic experts said a theory that Michelle OConnell shot herself with her boyfriends gun lacked credibility.

title: WikiLeaks, Drought and Syria
description: In the 1970s, I got both my bachelors and masters degrees in modern Middle East studies, and I can assure you that at no time did environmental or climate issues appear anywhere in the syllabi of my courses. Today, you cant understand the Arab awakenings  or their solutions  without considering climate, environment and population stresses.

title: S.&P.s Account of an Irate Treasury Secretary
description: Government officials made no secret of their displeasure when Standard & Poors downgraded the debt of the United States in 2011.

title: Lex Fenwick, Dow Jones Chief, Resigns in Shift by News Corp.
description: Lex Fenwick, the hard-driving chief executive who stumbled in his efforts to transform Dow Jones, the publisher of The Wall Street Journal, has resigned effective immediately as the company rethinks its strategy.

title: IBM: The Cloud Taketh Away
description: If you wondered why IBM has moved so fast on cloud computing in the past couple of months, look at Tuesdays earnings report. Then get ready for even more action, including sales of business units and staff cuts.

title: Sarah's Uncertain Path
description: Profiling a pregnant teenager in Missouri, this short documentary provides a window into rural poverty in America's heartland.

title: Apple iPhone Sales Expected to Break Records
description: Last year analysts and critics said Apple iPhone sales would continue to drop. Some said this was because the phones design wasnt different enough from previous models. Others predicted declines because of the iPhones screen size, saying it was too small compared with all those XL and XXL Android smartphones.

title: Same-Sex Newlyweds Sue Utah After Series of Rulings
description: DENVER  The legal saga in Utah over same-sex marriage grew even more complicatedon Tuesdayas four couples who had married during the brief window they could do so sued the state over its recent decision not to recognize their marriages or provide any new state benefits to same-sex newlyweds.

title: Sarahs Uncertain Path
description: Sarah, the subject of this Op-Doc video, lives in a rural town in western Missouri. She is in 10th grade. For generations almost no one in Sarahs family has finished high school. Sarah vows that she does not want to follow in those footsteps. But how will her life be different? She became pregnant at 15. Her son will be born in February.

title: The Women in the Kitchen
description: A wave of female chefs like Lauren DeSteno is rising through the culinary ranks. More than ever, women fill the jobs that will produce the next generation of restaurant leaders.

title: States Cutting Weeks of Aid to the Jobless
description: RIEGELWOOD, N.C.  After losing her job as a security guard in June, Alnetta McKnight turned to food stamps and unemployment insurance to support herself and her 14-year-old son. But her jobless payments ran out after 20 weeks, and now they are living on close to nothing.

title: Disarming the White House
description: WASHINGTON  AMID the coverage of the Christie controversy and the latest budget deal, it was easy to miss the news about last weeks oral arguments before the Supreme Court in the case of National Labor Relations Board v. Noel Canning. And yet the Canning case represents the biggest threat to presidential power in decades, and the stakes in the decision are extremely high.

title: Tenniss New Concern: Data Harvesting
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  The strangest story of this Australian Open so far involved a man, a smartphone, a consultant service for online gambling, a tennis match, an arrest, allegations of corruption, a new law and much confusion. Naturally, it unfolded without precedent.

title: Verizon Plans to Buy Intel Media Division to Expand Its Television Services
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Verizon Communications wants to make TV available whenever customers have an Internet connection, and on whatever screen they are looking at. On Tuesday, the company announced a shot in the arm for those ambitions.

title: Bee Deaths May Stem From Virus, Study Says
description: The mysterious mass die-offs of honeybees that have wiped out roughly a third of commercial colonies each year since 2006 may be linked to a rapidly mutating virus that jumped from tobacco plants to soy plants to bees, according to a new study.

title: Investors Seek Yields in Europe, but Analysts Warn of Risk
description: LONDON  When Ireland recently made its first offering of new debt since leaving its bailout program, the Irish prime minister, Enda Kenny, was already focused on where the money would come from next.

title: Trying to Control Nerves That Conjure Up Threats
description: There are triggers everywhere, Khristina Olivo said. They surround her.

title: Banks Take On European Debt, Despite Underlying Problems
description: ATHENS  A wave of euphoria has swept over financial markets because investors now think Europes sovereign debt crisis may be ending. But the enthusiasm masks a lingering problem. The harsh austerity programs used to regain their confidence have fanned deep recessions and high unemployment across Southern Europe.

title: Visiting Scene, Court Calls Forth Memories of Massacre at a Mall
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Stephen Juma stood in front of the Westgate shopping mall on Tuesday for the first time since the haunting Saturday four months ago when he was directing traffic outside the parking lot. He spoke flatly as he recalled how three gunmen leapt from a car and began shooting, shattering a nations sense of security.

title: Texas Prepares to Execute Mexican Despite Concerns That His Arrest Violated Law
description: HOUSTON  Texas officials moved ahead with their plans to execute a Mexican citizen convicted of killing a police officer, even as pressure continued to mount from the State Department, the Mexican government and an international human rights commission to halt the execution because the arrest 20 years ago violated international law.

title: $2 Billion Deal in Works for Puerto Rico
description: Puerto Rico, which is battling a financial crisis of high unemployment and a crushing debt load, is under pressure to show investors and credit-rating agencies that it can still borrow money from the capital markets.

title: As Losses Mount, Knicks Play Down Pointed Remarks
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Coach Mike Woodson said Tuesday that he was unfazed by Tyson Chandlers pointed remarks about the Knicks defensive schemes after a blowout loss to the Nets on Monday. Having players publicly voice their frustrations is less than ideal, he said, but at least it shows that they care.

title: Wartime Claim to Fame Divides 2 Italian Towns
description: NETTUNO, Italy  The landing of Allied forces 70 years ago who went on to liberate Rome in World War II is now the focus of a conflict between two seaside towns over which one has the right to commemorate the event.

title: Food Banks Anticipate Impact of Cuts to Food Stamps
description: WASHINGTON  Late last year, staff members at the Capital Area Food Bank here began fielding requests for larger deliveries from the dozens of soup kitchens and food pantries that it supplies as more and more people showed up seeking help.

title: The Washington Post is De-Kleining
description: Ezra Klein of Wonkblog is leaving the Washington Post. Not news, exactly  the impending move has been all over the blogs for a while. But now its official. And may I say respectfully to the Post: You idiots!

title: Knicks Not a Pretty Picture When Painted by Numbers
description: An old Johnny Mercer song said you should accentuate the positive and eliminate the negative. For the Knicks, at the seasons midpoint, that is proving to be a difficult task.

title: Old McDonalds
description: THERES an old Italian saying, A tavola non si invecchia, which means: At the table, you dont grow old. All of us, of whatever age, need to socialize in public places to feel connected and alive.

title: Yale Students Tangle With University Over Website
description: The idea did not seem controversial at first: Peter Xu and Harry Yu, twin brothers who are seniors at Yale University, set out to build a better, more user-friendly version of the universitys online course catalog. But as Mark Zuckerberg found when he decided to build a better version of Harvards undergraduate student directory, these things can take on a life of their own.

title: How Gov. Christie Moves Forward
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, in his second inaugural address on Tuesday, promised to avoid what he called the attitude of Washington, D.C. Those in the nations government, he said, believe that I am always right and you are always wrong.

title: Sexual Orientation Is No Basis for Jury Exclusion, a Federal Appeals Court Rules
description: WASHINGTON  Gay men and lesbians may not be excluded from juries based on their sexual orientation, the federal appeals court in San Francisco ruled on Tuesday.

title: A Cap on Wall Street Bonuses?
A Rebuff to Overbroad Watch Lists
description: Public trials are a cornerstone of a democratic society. But in the looking-glass world of legal challenges to the federal governments terror watch lists, even people who succeed in showing that they were mistakenly included on such a list have no easy path around the walls of official secrecy and obstruction.

title: Another Syria Peace Conference
description: Few peace conferences have been set up amid the unrelenting pessimism that surrounds the talks involving Syria that open Wednesday in Switzerland. But while a peace agreement is unlikely to be reached anytime soon, the meeting can still produce useful results. That has to be the approach of the conveners, including the United States, Russia and the United Nations. Crucial early goals should include a cease-fire and the delivery of humanitarian assistance to millions of desperate civilians.

title: At Senior Bowl, the Focus Is on the Ground Game
description: MOBILE, Ala.  If the playoff performances of the bruising Seattle Seahawks running back Marshawn Lynch did not illuminate how much the N.F.L. still values the rushing game, the scene Monday at Senior Bowl practices brightened the picture even more.

title: Buses for Tech Workers in San Francisco Will Pay Fee
description: SAN FRANCISCO  A transit agency here voted unanimously on Tuesday to start a pilot program to oversee tech company buses, but the volatile issue is a long way from being defused.

title: Snowden Denies Suggestions That He Was a Spy for Russia
description: WASHINGTON  Edward J. Snowden on Tuesday adamantly denied as absurd and smears the suggestion by the leaders of the House and Senate Intelligence Committees that he might have been a Russian spy when he downloaded archives of classified National Security Agency documents and leaked them to journalists.

title: Bankruptcy Case Lifts Curtain on Bike-Share Operator
description: OTTAWA  The bankruptcy protection filing of the Canadian company that has supplied the bicycles and the technology behind most of the bike-sharing programs in major American cities is revealing a complicated and messy financial foundation.

title: Broken at the Bridge, a Basic Law of Politics
description: Here are two reasons Gov. Chris Christie and his people are hiring top-shelf criminal defense lawyers.

title: No Fines for Stores Displaying a Dress Code
description: As a result of a settlement reached Tuesday with New York City, seven small stores owned by Hasidic merchants in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, will not have to pay any fines for posting signs in their windows saying: No shorts, no barefoot, no sleeveless, no low-cut neckline allowed in this store.

title: Corrections: January 22, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: For U.N. Chief, a Dance of Diplomacy Is Halted by a Misstep
description: UNITED NATIONS  Over the weekend Ban Ki-moon, the United Nations secretary general, with a reputation for being risk averse, took a significant risk. He choreographed a precise diplomatic sequence on Syria that relied on others to perform their roles equally precisely. The choreography did not go as planned, and Mr. Ban stumbled under the spotlight.

title: Knicks Have a Star Magnet: Courtside Seats
description: They call it Celebrity Row, the six prime courtside seats in Madison Square Garden reserved for the three most prominent celebrities (plus guests) at any given Knicks game. For the game against the Miami Heat on Jan. 9, they were filled by an actor, a musician and a model: David Duchovny, Paul Simon and Kate Upton.

title: More Problems for American Couple Accused in Qatar
description: An American couple accused in Qatar of starving their 8-year-old adopted African daughter to death were gratified a few months ago when a judge temporarily released them from prison after nearly a year, with orders to remain in the wealthy gulf emirate pending verdicts in a case that defense lawyers said was so flimsy it should be dismissed.

title: Hitches in Compromise at a McDonalds
description: Maybe it was the snow. Or a lack of communication.

title: 2013 Listed as One of the Warmest Years on Record
description: Two government agencies said Tuesday that 2013 was among the warmest years in the global temperature record, though they differed on exactly where it ranked. The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration ranked it as the fourth-warmest year since 1880, tied with 2003. NASA, which uses slightly different methods to compile global temperatures, ranked 2013 as the seventh-warmest year, tied with both 2006 and 2009. Both agencies say that the 14 warmest years in the historical record have all occurred since 1998. Australia was a global hot spot in 2013, suffering the warmest year on record in 104 years. But the United States, which had set a record in 2012, had only its 37th warmest year on record in 2013.

title: Out of Hamlets Shadow Again, and Into the Spotlight
description: Dear Rosencrantz. Gentle Guildenstern. The Prince of Denmarks old school friends have been popping up around town in this Shakespeare-soaked season, though usually they stay in the background, onlookers and minor players amid the brooding and bloodshed of Hamlet.

title: A Mapped Out Story
description: Administrivial Alert! In the Thursday, January 23, 2014 puzzle, there are elements in the print version that cannot be replicated electronically. We recommend using the PDF for the best solving experience.

title: A Start-Up Run by Friends Takes On Shaving Giants
description: EISFELD, Germany For more than 93 years, the Feintechnik factory in this small German town an hour north of Nuremberg has produced billions of razors, its machinery transforming steel by the ton into the mathematically precise blades that end up in low-end safety blades and the hardest-to-manufacture five-blade razors.

title: A Movie Date, a Text Message and a Fatal Shot
description: WESLEY CHAPEL, Fla.  Theres a sticker on the door of the Grove 16 Theater just outside Tampa: no weapons.

title: Cost of Educating New York Citys 4-Year-Olds Proves Difficult to Calculate
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio promised to provide prekindergarten classes to every 4-year-old in New York City for $342 million a year. Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said he could do the same  at a fraction of the cost.

title: Chief of Chicago Hospitals Will Return to New York
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio on Tuesday named new leaders for New York Citys $7 billion public hospital system and its Department of Small Business Services, emphasizing a need to expand and preserve health care in all neighborhoods and to assist immigrant-owned businesses and those in boroughs outside Manhattan.

title: Adored Walrus Goes to Texas as Aquarium Renovates
description: Mitik has left the building.

title: Letting Go of a 4-Year-Old Who Was Beaten and Burned
description: Even in a city accustomed to the rhythm of crime and violence, this stood out. A 4-year-old boy, dead, prosecutors said, after a caregiver beat, tortured and starved him.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Jan. 21, 2014
Photo Archive Is Said to Show Widespread Torture in Syria
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Emaciated corpses lie in the sand, their ribs protruding over sunken bellies, their thighs as thin as wrists. Several show signs of strangulation. The images conjure memories of some of historys worst atrocities.

title: John Dobson, an Inventive Itinerant Guide to Stargazing, Dies at 98
description: Hour after hour, night after night, decade after decade all over planet Earth, John Dobson rolled his homemade telescopes to street corners and national parks to show people the heavens. Look at Saturn, he would say. No charge.

title: Scrappy Islanders Overcome Rangers Two-Goal Cushion
description: The Islanders find ways to perform the unusual at Madison Square Garden. After Rick Nash scored two first-period goals for the recently dominating Rangers, the visitors appeared to be on the ropes.

title: U.S. Military Eyes Afghan Force of 10,000, or a Pullout
description: WASHINGTON  The Pentagon has proposed to President Obama that 10,000 American troops remain in Afghanistan when the international combat mission there ends after this year, or none at all, senior government officials said Tuesday.

title: Blatche Puts on a Show as the Nets Keep Rolling
description: Andray Blatche put his shoulder down and charged right past Kyle OQuinn, rose to the basket and rattled it with a one-handed, windmill slam. The play was quickly shown over and over on the Barclays Center scoreboard, even as play continued on the other end, and fans gasped each time at its intensity.

title: Indonesia: Leader Expresses Support for Abused Maid
description: President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono joined thousands of Indonesian migrant workers abroad and at home on Tuesday in expressing outrage at the alleged torture of an Indonesian maid by her Hong Kong employer. In his first publicized comments on the case, Mr. Yudhoyono insisted that the law will be upheld during a phone call with the maid, Erwiana Sulistyaningsih. Ms. Erwiana, 23, returned to Indonesia this month and is being treated at a hospital in the central Java town of Sragen for physical abuse. Mr. Yudhoyonos comments came a day after the police in Hong Kong arrested a 44-year-old woman in connection with the alleged abuse of Ms. Erwiana. On Sunday, thousands of foreign domestic workers rallied in support of her in the city.

title: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, January 22, 2014
description: It is very rare to have this kind of government-backed, industrial, machinelike, systematic torture and killing of human beings, the likes of which we havent seen since Nuremberg.

title: In Front of Small Crowd, Devils Come Up Big Against Blues
description: NEWARK  The few hardy fans who made it through the snowstorm to Prudential Center on Tuesday night saw the Devils skate to their biggest victory of the season, a 7-1 trouncing of the usually strong St. Louis Blues.

title: New Security Report Confirms Everyone Is Spying on Everyone
description: Lest we forget, the National Security Agency is in good company.

title: Word of the Day | interdict
description: interdict \in-tr-dikt\ verb

title: Just Compensation for Jurors
description: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago. He is the author of The Redistribution Recession: How Labor Market Distortions Contracted the Economy.

title: A Conversation With: Author Vikram Chandra
description: Vikram Chandra, a writer and professor at the University of California, Berkeley, explored the underworld of Bombay, now known as Mumbai, in his 2006 novel Sacred Games. In it, he looked at the links between organized crime, Bollywood stars, beggars and spies, and his book demonstrated how, despite problems like caste wars and corruption, India manages to hold itself together.

title: Minicars Are Worst Performers in Small-Overlap Front Crash Test
description: A group of 11 minicars did the worst of any class of vehicles tested so far in the Insurance Institute for Highway Safetys newest and toughest trial, the small-overlap front crash test.

title: Whats on Wednesday
description: 10 P.M. (Ovation) THE FASHION FUND Emerging designers compete to be named the Council of Fashion Designers of America 2013 Vogue Fashion Fund winner  with its $300,000 grant and yearlong mentorship  in this new series, which covers studio visits, a Vogue photo shoot and a presentation at New York Fashion Week. The selection committee includes Anna Wintour, above, the editor in chief of Vogue; Diane von Furstenberg, the president of the council; Jenna Lyons, the president and creative director of J. Crew; and Andrew Rosen, the chief executive of Theory. In this premiere episode, the group deliberates over hundreds of applicants in an effort to determine the final 10.

title: A Leader of Pro-Government Faction Is Shot in Thailand
description: BANGKOK  A leader of a pro-government faction was shot and wounded outside his home in northeast Thailand Wednesday, one day after Thailands prime minister declared the imposition of emergency rule in Bangkok and surrounding areas as tensions in the country escalated.

title: Report Details Overseas Accounts of Chinese Elite
description: Chinese elites have set up extensive offshore companies that allow them to conceal funds abroad, according to a new report from the International Consortium of Investigative Journalists. The report, which is based on leaked documents covering thousands of tax haven clients, lists more than a dozen of Chinas wealthiest people as well as relatives of top officials, including the Chinese leader Xi Jinping, and descendants of Communist Party red nobility.

title: Facing Outcry on East Side, Mayor Admits Snow Removal Efforts Fell Short
description: As the snowstorm grew in intensity on Tuesday evening, whipping through the streets on the Upper East Side of Manhattan, something quickly seemed amiss. Where were all the plows? Why was the citys wealthiest enclave a slushy, frozen mess?

title: Protests for Xu Zhiyong
description: One of China's best known legal activists, Xu Zhiyong, went on trial Wednesday in Beijing. Dozens of protesters staged a brief and noisy show of support for him.

title: Syrian Peace Talks Open With Vitriol, as Official Rails at Rebels
description: MONTREUX, Switzerland  From its early moments on Wednesday, the long-delayed peace conference on Syria was marked by acrimony when Syrias foreign minister described Syrian rebels as evil and ignored appeals by Ban Ki-moon, the United Nations secretary general, to avoid invective or even to yield the floor.

title: Test Yourself | Math, Jan. 22, 2014
description: Our weekly math problems are written by teachers at Math for America.

title: Roger Federer Finds a Higher Level as Other Stars Fall
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  All week at the Upset Open, the favorites have fallen as if engaged in a game of superstar dominoes. Serena Williams toppled first. Then Maria Sharapova. Then Novak Djokovic. Then Victoria Azarenka.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Norwegian Curlers Are Back, and So Are Their Pants
description: In Norwegian Curlers Are Back, and So Are Their Pants, Mary Pilon writes about the Norwegian curling teams colorful attire.

title: Unrest Deepens in Ukraine as Protests Turn Deadly
description: KIEV, Ukraine  A deepening civil uprising in Ukraine turned deadly on Wednesday, and this embattled capital veered toward chaos, after at least three demonstrators died during clashes with the police and the first direct negotiations between President Viktor F. Yanukovich and opposition leaders yielded only threats and ultimatums.

title: Supporters Protest as China Puts Rights Advocate on Trial
description: The Chinese authorities put one of the countrys best-known legal advocates, Xu Zhiyong, on trial on Wednesday. His alleged crime: instigating street protests during which participants railed against official corruption and criticized education policies they said discriminate against rural children.

title: Israeli Strike Kills 2 Palestinians, One a Militant, in Gaza
description: JERUSALEM  An Israeli airstrike in the northern Gaza Strip early on Wednesday killed two Palestinians, one of them a militant who Israel said had been responsible for recent rocket attacks against southern Israel.

title: Your Next Job Application Could Involve a Video Game
description: Brittni Daron jumped through a lot of hoops before she landed her job as a solution consultant at Oracle. At the tech giant, as at other firms in Silicon Valley to which she applied, she endured weeks   and occasionally months  of phone interviews, in-person interviews, mock presentations, personality tests and technical tests for both the skills she claimed to have and those she didnt. This might sound a little ridiculous, but its not unusual. Ive met lots of job seekers in the last few years who underwent a similar form of H.R. torture  spelling quizzes, math exams and oddball brainteasers (If you were a pizza-delivery man, how would you benefit from scissors?)  only to walk out of the interview room wondering what theyd really just been tested for. Basically, I could never figure out what they got out of it that qualified or disqualified me for the job, Daron told me.

title: Do Parents Have Different Hopes and Standards for Their Sons Than for Their Daughters?
description: Parents want all their children, whether they are boys or girls, to be happy and successful. Yet a recent study of Internet search data suggests that American parents do in fact hold different expectations for their children based on sex. For one, they want their boys to be smarter and their girls skinnier.

title: Black Performers, Fading From Frame, and Memory
description: The harder you look at Carrie Mae Weemss Slow Fade to Black  blurred, soft-focus images of mid-20th century stars like Marian Anderson, Dorothy Dandridge, Billie Holiday and Eartha Kitt  the more you see.

title: Yahoos Mayer Views 2014 as Tech Tipping Point
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  The rapid adoption of smartphones and the applications that run on mobile devices will make 2014 a tipping point that radically changes the way people work and live, said Marissa Mayer, Yahoos chief executive.

title: Speaking Out Against Votes Date, a Thai Citizen (and Election Panel Member)
description: BANGKOK  Like the protesters trying to overthrow the Thai government, Somchai Srisutthiyakorn says he is against holding elections next month and does not think they will help resolve the countrys increasingly violent political turmoil.

title: New York Today: A Foot of Snow, a Tough Commute
description: Updated 12:27 p.m.

title: Times Minute | Olympic Security Concerns
description: Also on the Minute, the World Economic Forum starts today and a look at the Knicks' courtside "celebrity row".

title: Times Minute | Olympic Security Concerns
description: In the Video

title: Wheelies: The Calling All Aluminum F-150 Mechanics Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Couture Looks
