description: Some of the images from the summer 2014 couture shows in Paris.

title: Negotiating Conflicts, Part 5: A Tug of Wills
description: Sheila Heen, an expert in negotiation and difficult conversations, is answering reader questions about how to resolve disputes within families and in other parts of life.

title: Hit 60 and the Must-Have Lists Change
description: There was a lot of old lady stuff I swore years ago I would never do: Take an aqua exercise class, bring groceries home in a wheelie cart, address a waiter as Young Man, own a plastic pill box with the days of the week on it. And I am proud to say I have yet to address a waiter as Young Man.

title: Why Rovio Looks to Coca-Cola For Inspiration
description: Peter Vesterbacka is the chief marketing officer for Rovio, the Finnish gaming and entertainment company behind the Angry Birds franchise. A former executive at Hewlett-Packard, he joined Rovio in 2010, and has helped to steer the company from its Finnish roots to become a global brand with more than two billion downloads for its Angry Birds games. Mr. Vesterbacka is now in charge of expanding Rovios brand, including a push into emerging markets like China and new areas like movies and theme parks. The following is an edited interview.

title: The Start-Up Vortex of Doom
description: Starting a tech company is expensive. Thats why those who start one  unless they can do everything themselves, including designing, coding and selling  must accept fund-raising as an early goal.

title: Big Web Crash in China: Experts Suspect Great Firewall
description: Updated, 10:30 p.m. |

title: The Old King of the New Spain
description: MADRID  You know a monarchy is in trouble when the queen is jeered at the Royal Theater, of all places, and by a classical music audience. This happened to Queen Sofa of Spain last year in Madrid  a scene then repeated elsewhere with other members of the royal family.

title: SkyBridge Capitals Founder Sees Potential of Activist Investors
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  The official themes of the World Economic Forum this year may include innovation and sustainability.

title: Chinese Web Outage Blamed on Censorship Glitch
description: Chinese authorities on Wednesday suggested that a major disruption of the Internet in China this week was the work of hackers. But others blamed the massive outage on a malfunction of the governments own Great Firewall, the sprawling, hidden infrastructure used to restrict what ordinary Chinese can see online.

title: How Inactivity Changes the Brain
description: A number of studies have shown that exercise can remodel the brain by prompting the creation of new brain cells and inducing other changes. Now it appears that inactivity, too, can remodel the brain, according to a notable new report.

title: On Davos Panel, Calls to Curb Government Data Collection
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  The intersection of technology and privacy issues presents a unique challenge for businesses as governments increasingly seek to collect vast amounts of data on the public, a group of business and political leaders said on Wednesday.

title: Weak I.P.O. a Seeming Setback for Hong Kongs Superman
description: HONG KONG  Is Hong Kongs Man of Steel getting a bit rusty?

title: Europe, Facing Economic Pain, May Ease Climate Rules
description: LONDON  For years, Europe has tried to set the global standard for climate-change regulation, creating tough rules on emissions, mandating more use of renewable energy sources and arguably sacrificing some economic growth in the name of saving the planet.

title: Daily Report: San Francisco to Charge Tech Buses a Fee in Pilot Program
description: A San Francisco transit agency voted unanimously on Tuesday to start a pilot program to oversee tech company buses, but the volatile issue is a long way from being defused, Malia Wollan and David Streitfeld report.

title: El-Erian Resigns From Pimco
description: In 2012, William H. Gross, the founder and co-chief investment officer of the Pacific Investment Management Company, known as Pimco, called Mohamed A. El-Erian his heir apparent. But on Tuesday, Mr. El-Erian, Pimcos chief executive and co-chief investment officer, unexpectedly announced that he would step down from his position in March, Nathaniel Popper and Matthew Goldstein write in DealBook. The news shattered any hope that Mr. El-Erian would be the firms next leader and called into question who would become the public face of the asset manager.

title: Poem for a Snowy Winter
description: Dear Diary:

title: VMware Buys Mobile Security Firm for $1.54 Billion
description: Looking to shift its software offerings, VMware has struck a $1.54 billion deal to bolster its mobile technology.

title: Manuela Frey Transforms Backstage at Bouchra Jarrar
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures the transformations of the Spring 2014 Couture Collections in Paris. Here, the model Manuela Frey before (left) and after (right) makeup by Tom Pecheux and hair by Madeleine Cofano.

title: Music Directors Named for Ojai Festival
description: Presumably this years Ojai Music Festival in California, scheduled for June 12 to 15, with Jeremy Denk as its music director, is sufficiently settled that its artistic director, Thomas W. Morris, is looking ahead. Mr. Morris announced on Tuesday afternoon the music directors for the next three years. Steven Schick, the percussionist and conductor, will oversee the 2015 festival. The opera and theater director Peter Sellars, who has staged several productions at Ojai, will take over in 2016. And the conductor Esa-Pekka Salonen, who was the festivals music director in 2001, will return to lead the festival in 2017.

title: In an Emergency, Call 100. Or is it 1098? Or 103?
description: BANGALORE  Have you had lunch? the caller inquired solicitously of the Bangalore police constable who was answering calls on the emergency hotline, and then wanted to know what she had eaten. The constable told him to hang up.

title: Party City to Try Again to Go Public
description: Party City Holdco Inc., the party supply retailer that runs about 850 stores, has filed documents to raise as much as $500 million through an initial public offering.

title: It Is Time to Rethink Insurance Regulation
description: David Zaring is assistant professor of legal studies at the Wharton School of Business at the University of Pennsylvania.

title: Sold on Yankees, Masahiro Tanaka Gets $155 Million
description: They met with Masahiro Tanaka for almost three hours at a private residence in Beverly Hills, Calif., on Jan. 8, and the length of the session left the Yankees feeling encouraged. After all, their eight-member delegation had been allotted only one hour to meet with Tanaka, the prized Japanese right-handed pitcher, and his agent, Casey Close, but instead the give-and-take kept going and the Yankees kept making their pitch.

title: Another Terrible Day for Pakistan as Polio Workers Shot
description: Just days after India was declared polio-free, three health workers vaccinating against the disease in neighboring Pakistan were shot and killed. According to the group Human Rights Watch, at least 22 polio vaccination workers were killed and 14 wounded there in 2012 and 2013. Working as part of a team is hazardous duty in Pakistan, where (as the Times reported earlier this year) anger over American foreign policy has led to a disastrous setback for the global effort against polio. This summer, Pakistan was believed to be closer than ever to eliminating the disease with only 21 reported cases as of July 2013, but by the end of the year that number had risen to 85 for the year, up from 58 in 2012.

title: Muddy Waters Turns Up Heat on Auditor of Chinese Firm
description: Carson C. Block has already issued a blistering critique of NQ Mobile, a Chinese mobile security company. Now, he is going after NQ Mobiles auditor.

title: The First Amendment Protects Abortion Providers, Too
description: On Friday a district court judge in North Carolina issued a ruling that blocked the states ultrasound law from going into effect  a move worth celebrating on the 41st anniversary of Roe v. Wade, and at a time when Republican-led states are rushing to enact aggressive new abortion restrictions.

title: Financial Sector Can Help Bolster Africas Economy, Panelists Say
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  One of the stated aims of this years World Economic Forum is inclusion. A panel discussion on Africas future, one that included two sitting presidents from that continent, did its best to emphasize that theme.

title: How to Help Homeless Families
description: Seeing Dasani Coates standing alongside the dignitaries at Mayor Bill de Blasios inauguration earlier this month was a heartening sign. In December, the 12-year-old girls struggles living with her family in a decrepit city shelter had been vividly captured in this newspaper in Andrea Elliotts series Invisible Child.  Dasanis story struck a chord. More than 2,200 readers commented online, expressing sentiments that ranged from admiration for her grit to outrage at the Dickensian circumstances in which she lived. De Blasio had laid out an aggressive agenda to help the citys most vulnerable residents, promising to expand affordable housing and revive rental-assistance programs for homeless families. Here was a gesture to suggest he was serious.

title: Trove Is a Treasure for News Junkies
description: Donald E. Graham has sold The Washington Post, but hes not quite done shaking up the news business.

title: Image of the Day: January 22
Outside the Fall/Winter 2014 Paris Mens Shows
description: A glimpse at what guys are wearing this season.

title: Bitcoin a Fools Gold Standard
description: I cannot judge whether Bitcoin represents a technological breakthrough, but I am confident that the pseudocurrencys popularity shows widespread economic amnesia. If Bitcoin ever became a real currency, it would suffer from the crippling problems of the gold standard.

title: In Our Pages: January 23
description: 1889: A Parisian Jack the Ripper

title: Armani Celebrates His Couture Line
description: PARIS  For One Night Only  though actually for two days, ending Thursday  Giorgio Armani is displaying the progress of his Armani Priv line.

title: Ex-Goldman Trader Tourre Fights S.E.C. Penalties in Fraud Case
description: Fabrice Tourres Wall Street career is over.

title: Arizonas First Concours Crowns a 25 Hispano-Suiza Best in Show
description: PHOENIX  Amid the madness of the annual Scottsdale auctions, Arizona held its inaugural concours d'lgance on Jan. 12, giving the state a chance to show its stuff in the elite realm of high-end classic cars. When all the gleaming cars had been judged, a 1925 Hispano-Suiza H6B Cabriolet de Ville won the best in show at the 2014 Arizona Concours d'lgance.

title: Letters: Little Failure and More
description: Curses, Hopes and Fears

title: What Handel Heard on the Way to the Forum
description: In the era of Netflixs acerbic political satire House of Cards, its not hard to see the appeal of Handels Agrippina, which made its composers international reputation when it opened in Venice in 1709. The operas ancient Rome is a hotbed of deception and infighting, but music of dazzling variety and eloquence shoots it through with humanity.

title: Some Businesses Go Creative on Prices, Applying Technology
description: Many business owners struggle with pricing. Should their first concern be covering costs or figuring out what the market will bear? How do they determine what the market will pay without raising prices high enough that some customers flee? And can they offer discounts without damaging their price brand?

title: Today in Small Business: Anticipatory Shipping
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Have You Tried Any New Pricing Strategies?
description: Weve just published an article about how small companies are starting to use pricing strategies and technologies that previously had been available only to large companies.

title: Philharmonic Lines Up Joan and a Dvorak Festival
description: There will be new music and world premieres, and not just in the Contact! series of contemporary music. There will be a week of film scores, and a festival devoted to Dvorak. And Avery Fisher Hall will once again be adapted to present a staged event: Arthur Honeggers dramatic oratorio Joan of Arc at the Stake.

title: What Would Ron Woodroof think?
description: Hell yeah!

title: A Gilded Goddess Would Rather Be in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA  Can we speak frankly? New York really didnt deserve Diana.

title: Einhorn Discloses Stakes in BP and Anadarko
description: The hedge fund manager David Einhorn has made a pair of bets on the oil sector.

title: At Davos, Debate on Whether Banks Have Learned Their Lessons
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  Paul Singer, the founder of the hedge fund Elliott Management, said on Wednesday that he remained skeptical that the financial markets were safer despite the changes enacted in the banking industry and by regulators after the financial crisis.

title: Times Minute | Inactivity and the Brain
description: In the Video

title: Times Minute | Inactivity and the Brain
description: Also on the Minute, peace talks on Syria and "Broad City" premieres.

title: Whats in Your Fish Oil Supplements?
description: Millions of Americans take fish oil supplements to promote heart and vascular health. But a new analysis suggests that some consumers may not always get what they are paying for.

title: Conservatives and the CBO
description: Conservatives have recently made a horrifying discovery: if you look not at nominal but at real incomes, Census data do not show a rising tide raising all boats  they show income actually falling for the bottom quintile. Some of them have responded by turning to a CBO report that took account of transfers and taxes, and shows the income of the bottom fifth rising a bit  18 percent  between 1979 and 2007.

title: On Drones, Keeping the Public in the Dark
description: We dont get to say this very often on The Times editorial page, but Senator John McCain was absolutely right last week to decry a secret deal in the 2014 spending bill. He pointed out that the bill contained a classified section that prohibited the Pentagon from taking over the C.I.A.s role in carrying out drone strikes, as President Obama has proposed.

title: Ominous Text Message Sent to Protesters in Kiev Sends Chills Around the Internet
description: As my colleague Andrew Kramer reported, protesters and journalists standing in the vicinity of fighting between the riot police and demonstrators in Kiev on Tuesday received an ominous text message on their phones: Dear subscriber, you are registered as a participant in a mass disturbance.

title: Between Couture Shows, a Fashionable Party
description: On Tuesday evening, in the break in the couture schedule between Bouchra Jarrar that afternoon and Armani Priv that night, many in the fashion crowd gathered at the residence of the United States ambassador on the Rue du Faubourg St.-Honor (currently without an actual ambassador since Charles Rivkin ended his tenure this summer) for a party to honor Richard Baker, the chief executive of Hudsons Bay Company, which recently acquired Saks Fifth Avenue. That morning, Mr. Baker had been to the Chanel show, his first time at couture.

title: A Safe Harbor Without Full Protection
description: A recent ruling by a bankruptcy judge in New York adds to a growing body of opinions that appear to leave the door open for actions under state law that would normally be prohibited in federal bankruptcy proceedings.

title: A Young Picky Eater Surprises His Parents in the Kitchen
description: Have a picky eater? Christine Zanchi and her husband, Fran Nostrame, an I.T. operations engineer at I.B.M., do. They have twin 4-year-old sons, both of whom critiqued what was on the table before they even sat down. They considered one twin, Andrew, the picky one. He turned his nose up at most everything while his brother Nathaniel ate and tried more foods.

title: Talent Agency Specializing in TV News Is Acquired
description: N. S. Bienstock, the best-known and largest agency serving television news personalities and producers, including Anderson Cooper and Bill OReilly, has become a unit of the United Talent Agency, the major Hollywood representation firm.

title: Caroline Shaw: 'Improvisation'
description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning composer Caroline Shaw performs an improvised piece with violin, voice and a loop station.

title: Feeling For | A Modern Heirloom from Fine Jewelrys Heiress Apparent
description: Among the usual presentations by the fine-jewelry stalwarts of the Place Vendme happening this couture week, one newcomer stands out. This Thursday, the young designer Charlotte Dauphin de la Rochefoucauld  of the aristocratic French family  will debut her label, Dauphin, with a collection of 21 sparkling yet streamlined styles that she describes as an ode to a contemporary woman. Her pieces have a pared-down, architectural quality, with contours molded to accommodate the bodys movements; this standout rose-gold-and-diamond collar took nine months to shape so that it sits on the shoulders and collarbone just so. Its a marvel of minimalism  yet totally regal.

title: Rene Fleming to Sing National Anthem at Super Bowl
description: When the soprano Rene Fleming steps up to the microphone at MetLife Stadium to sing The Star-Spangled Banner on Feb. 2, she will be the first opera singer ever to sing the anthem at the Super Bowl. Thats odd, given the songs range (an octave and a half) and difficulty, but so far the closest the NFL has come to having an opera star sing the anthem was in 2002, when it tapped Mariah Carey, whose mother was an opera singer (and who had the necessary range).

title: An Old Tale for a New Year
description: New York City, which has the largest Chinese population of any city outside Asia, will celebrate the Lunar New Year with a bang onJan. 31, heralding the start of the Year of the Horse. According to The Race for the Chinese Zodiac, by Gabrielle Wang, with illustrations by Sally Rippin, horses are funny, popular, fearless and hard-working.  They are also confident, spirited, honest, sensitive and brave. Those born in1930, 1942, 1954, 1966, 1978, 1990 and 2002 (and any babies expected in 2014) can count themselves lucky to be born under the energetic Equus.

title: Chilean League Fines Club for Map of Palestine on Jersey
description: A club in Chile that is popular among fans of Palestinian descent has been fined by the countrys soccer league for wearing game jerseys in which the No. 1 was depicted by a 1947 map of Palestine before the creation of Israel.

title: Violent Protests in Ukraine
description: Scenes from Kiev, where two protesters were killed during clashes with the police.

title: Quiet in the Caribbean
description: I wrapped my arms around Leonardo, our moto driver, as he pushed our overloaded Yamaha across the hot, potholed concrete.

title: Restaurant Report: Fishing With Dynamite in Manhattan Beach, Calif.
description: When putting together Fishing With Dynamite, David LeFevre had a specific sort of nostalgia in mind. The floor tiles are stripes of red, orange and blue; the chef and owner said they reminded him of the classic Ocean Pacific T-shirt with a sunset emblazoned across the chest. Beneath the bar, skateboard trucks have been repurposed as hooks for purses, and Japanese lobster buoys hang from the ceiling. It took probably 50 visits to flea markets over two years, said Mr. LeFevre about compiling items to decorate his East Coast-meets-West Coast seafood restaurant, which opened in April. It was tough to describe, but I knew when people saw it, they would be like, Oh, God, the space is so comfortable and right.

title: Singing, Dancing and Economics
description: January is a heady, if exhausting, month in New York for lovers of experimental theater. If you didnt get your fill at the Under the Radar or the Coil festivals, fear not. Just around the corner is more venturesome theater, this time from the acclaimed collective Rude Mechanicals from Austin, Tex. The company has previously presented its productions The Method Gun and Dionysus in 69 in the city. Those shows illustrated the companys interest in exploring the history of theater making; the latest production tilts toward Hollywood.

title: A Note on the Political Economy of Populism
description: All indications are that President Obama will make inequality the central theme of his State of the Union address. Assuming he does, he will face two different kinds of sniping. One will come from the usual suspects on the right, shrieking class warfare. The other will come from a variety of people, some of them well-intentioned, arguing that while sure, inequality is an issue, the crucial thing now is to get the economy growing and create more jobs; these people will argue that populism is a diversion from the main issue.

title: VMware Looks to Improve Its Cloud With AirWatch
description: For the technology world, 2014 has become momentous quickly, with billions of dollars moving around and thousands of people losing their jobs. It is all happening as the industry builds for the dominant feature of the next few decades: supercomputing everywhere.

title: Video of Vigil for Purdue Student Shot and Killed in Classroom
description: More than 1,000 students and staff members at Purdue University gathered in the bitter cold for a candlelight vigil Tuesday night to remember 21-year-old Andrew Boldt, who was shot and killed inside a classroom in the universitys Electrical Engineering Building by a fellow teaching assistant.

title: London Theater Journal: Running Their Mouths
description: LONDON  For all those arriving here limply from distant shores, theres a guaranteed cure for jet lag at the Harold Pinter Theater. Its called Mojo, and it turns out to be the West Ends version of a quad espresso, laced with steroids.

title: Car Seats to Face Crash-Test Standards
description: DETROIT  Federal regulators moved on Wednesday to address a glaring hole in auto safety rules by proposing new crash-test standards to better protect children in car seats.

title: Jean Paul Gaultier: Spring 2014 Couture
description: Paris

title: In Performance: Caroline Shaw
description: I dont really call myself a composer, Caroline Shaw told Zachary Woolfe, writing for The Times, despite the fact that she won the 2013 Pulitzer Prize in Music for Partita for Eight Voices, a vocal work that Mr. Woolfe described as a dazzling, emotionally generous take on a Baroque dance suite.

title: Chinese Activists Lawyers Call His Trial Unfair
description: BEIJING  The central actors in the trial of one of Chinas most influential legal activists remained largely silent on Wednesday morning to protest what they said were flaws in the countrys politicized judiciary.

title: At a Mexican Hotel, Plump a Pillow, Adopt a Pet
description: Travelers dont need frequent flyer points to get a free night at an upscale hotel in Mexico. They just need to be willing to go home with a little extra baggage.

title: Snow Jobs
description: David Brooks: Gail, Im starting this conversation off on a train leaving a very snowy New Haven. The original plan was to make it home to Washington, but Im pretty sure that in an hour or so the train will be inundated by snow. Mass panic will overtake the passengers. There will be an apocalyptic war of all against all in the snack car, as various passengers claw for the few remaining turkey sandwiches while I am scrunched over in the corner hoarding the little bottles of Chablis. Picture that Cormac McCarthy novel, The Road. Youll have the general idea.

title: Former Foxconn Managers Detained in a Bribery Case
description: SHANGHAI  Authorities in Taiwan detained several former managers of Foxconn Technology on Wednesday as part of a widening investigation into whether they accepted millions of dollars in bribes from the companys supply-chain partners.

title: Japans Leader Revels in Limelight at Davos
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  Few of the panels organized by the World Economic Forum this year had drawn as much anticipation as the one featuring Japans prime minister, Shinzo Abe.

title: U.S. Panel Suggests Ways to Reduce Voting Delays
description: WASHINGTON  A bipartisan panel created by President Obama after many voters waited hours to cast ballots in 2012 on Wednesday recommended ways to keep delays to no more than a half-hour. But changes are up to the states and 8,000 local jurisdictions, where voting laws have been a partisan battleground since the 2000 presidential recount.

title: Classical Playlist: Olivia Block, William Christie, Raschr Saxophone Quartet and More
description: BLOCK: KarrenOlivia Block, electronics, field recordings(Sedimental)Known as a designer of aural environments, the Chicago musician Olivia Block gets lumped together with electronic improvisers and installation artists. That might not be altogether wrong, but the two tremendous pieces that constitute her newest LP are as rigorously assembled, finely detailed and dramatically taut as any modern composition you might care to name, each evoking a dreamlike story without words. (Steve Smith)

title: Bankers Urge Britain to Remain Part of European Union
description: LONDON  The British Bankers Association and Citigroup have filed notice with the British government strongly backing a single market, the European Union. The two are emphatically encouraging Britain to step up its influence in Brussels rather than pull back as public sentiment in Britain for inclusion in the European Union wanes.

title: When They Dont Know They Are Ill
description: Soon after his wife was diagnosed with frontotemporal dementia, Bill Floyd consulted a neurologist who had been a member of his church. People with this illness dont know they have it, the doctor warned. They dont understand that anything is wrong.

title: Obama Seeks to Raise Awareness of Rape on Campus
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Wednesday renewed pressure on colleges and universities to prevent and police sexual assaults on their campuses, creating a task force of senior administration officials to coordinate federal enforcement efforts.

title: Art About Nothing. No, Really.
description: The acoustics in the Werner and Elaine Dannheisser Lobby Gallery, on the fourth floor of the Museum of Modern Art, arent so great  or not ideal, at least, for dancing nonstop while reciting John Cages seminal Lecture on Nothing, as Eszter Salamon does in her 2010 solo Dance for Nothing.

title: Paris Couture Week: Alexandre Vauthier Spring/Summer 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Couture Week photo diary of Erin Baiano.

title: Crowdfunding Tips for Turning Inspiration Into Reality
description: MIKE WHITEHEADS big idea was to design a better cast-iron skillet. Stephanie Turenkos big idea was to make an animated short film about her Ukrainian grandmother. Colin Owens big idea was to manufacture a hard-to-steal bike light.

title: Skier Flirts With Danger
description: In this episode of Teton Gravity Researchs Behind The Line, professional skiers Todd Ligare and others discover a technical line in Alaska that requires jumping two crevasses.

title: Americans Scramble for Propane Amid High Prices and Bitter Cold
description: As a second arctic blast barreled through most of the Midwest and Northeast this week, Americans who use propane to heat their homes are scrambling to deal with sharply higher prices and a limited access to the fuel.

title: Nuclear Corps, Sidelined in Terror Fight, Produces a Culture of Cheating
description: WASHINGTON  Top military officials were quick to voice outrage over revelations last week that 34 officers responsible for launching the nations nuclear missiles cheated on monthly proficiency tests, but few expressed surprise.

title: Bigger Role for Video Games Is Planned at Tribeca Film Festival
description: The annual Games for Change festival, which promotes the development and distribution of video games with an educational or social-minded focus, will partner with the 2014 Tribeca Film Festival, the organizers announced this week. While video games have had a presence at the film festival  Rockstars L.A. Noire was featured in 2011, and Sonys Beyond: Two Souls was included in 2013  this partnership represents a more formal integration of games and films.

title: Shifts in Art Market at Center of Loeb-Sothebys Debate
description: Daniel S. Loeb is wrestling with Sothebys over a new art paradigm. Mr. Loeb, the founder of the hedge fund Third Point, is essentially estimating the the auction house should be more like its privately held archrival Christies.

title: Next for Tony-Winning Actor Porter: Writing a New Play
description: New works by Billy Porter (the star of Kinky Boots), David Ives (Venus in Fur) and the New York premiere of a comedy by Theresa Rebeck (Smash) will make up the 2014-15 season at Primary Stages, the Off Broadway company announced on Wednesday. Casting and run dates are to be announced.

title: Pain Relievers May Amplify Flu Spread
description: Taking drugs like aspirin, acetaminophen or ibuprofen when you have the flu reduces fever and makes you feel better, but it may have unintended consequences.

title: Video: Skier Flirts With Danger, and Almost Pays
description: Behind the Line is a video series produced by Teton Gravity Research that takes you into the minds of skiers. In each episode, the athletes will look back on a line, a jump or a session, and discuss the moment.

title: Goodyear Reaches Severance Deal With French Union
description: PARIS  Striking workers at a Goodyear tire plant in France agreed on Wednesday to accept severance pay that they said was three times as much as the company had initially offered, clearing the way for the facility to close after a bitter conflict that escalated into a boss-napping.

title: Santander Consumer Prices I.P.O. at $24 a Share
description: Updated, 7:10 p.m. | Santander Consumer USA, the American auto-lending arm of the Spanish banking giant Grupo Santander, priced its initial public offering at $24 a share, a person briefed on the process said late Wednesday.

title: Andreessen Horowitz Invests in Human Resources Firm Zenefits
description: Venture capitalists, it seems, are crazy about human resources software.

title: The Gun Report: January 22, 2014
description: Dinyal New, 41, lost her only children to gun violence in the span of 19 days. Lee Weathersby, 13, who was a strong student at Alliance Academy in east Oakland, Calif., was gunned down as he made his way home from a party at the Boys & Girls Club on New Years Eve.

title: App Smart: Tracking Food Intake
description: The Timess Kit Eaton discusses three apps to help you keep tabs on what you eat.

title: Watch What You Eat, Using Your Phone as a Guide
description: I have always been skinny, but I do need to watch what I eat. So I count my calories  with the help of smartphone and tablet apps.

title: Dabbling in Microsoft Is Enough for Gates
description: Bill Gates, the chairman and former chief executive of Microsoft, is more involved with the company now than he has been in years. But he does not  repeat, not  want to run it.

title: Report Says Chinas Elite Use Offshore Companies
description: BEIJING  Members of the Chinese elite, including some of the countrys most politically connected figures, have set up a large number of offshore companies that allow them to conceal billions of dollars abroad, according to a report released Wednesday by the International Consortium of Investigative Journalists, a Washington-based group that works with a number of news organizations around the world.

title: Springsteen Is No. 1
description: This week on the music charts, Bruce Springsteen has racked up yet another No. 1.

title: Below the Line: Production Design on 12 Years a Slave
description: After envisioning larger-than-life sets for Wes Anderson, the production designer Adam Stockhausen had to make the transition from whimsical to historical for 12 Years a Slave. The designer, who along with the set decorator Alice Baker, is up for an Oscar for the film, said that there are similarities between Mr. Andersons more upbeat projects (Moonrise Kingdom, the upcoming Grand Budapest Hotel) and Steve McQueens somber slave drama.

title: Vintage Tools Help Turn Appetizers Into a Meal
description: Like a glass of prosecco before a more robust wine, Haydns sunny string quartets are often served as an appetizer to a weightier work. But the London Haydn Quartet  has sought to elevate the status of Haydns some 75 string quartets, exploring the many neglected gems of his vast catalog.

title: NBC Looks to Cosby to Revive Its Comedy Prospects
description: Few performers in history have meant more to a network than Bill Cosby has to NBC, so it is hardly surprising that NBC has reached out again to the famous comic in what appears to be another hour of comedy need.

title: Living in Manhasset, N.Y.
description: An affluent Nassau County hamlet within the Town of North Hempstead is an easy commute from Manhattan.

title: Couture in Paris
description: Couture designers show their collections in Paris

title: A Place on Manhattanites Map
description: Patrice Burke and her husband, Tim, are on the verge of moving into a two-bedroom two-and-a-half-bath house across from a small park in the heart of Manhasset, steps from the train station. Its a wonderful neighborhood, where people really care about their kids, and other peoples kids, said Ms. Burke, who has a 2-year-old son but has had longer experience with child care in the community as an occasional babysitter for her brothers children, now 8 and 11.

title: Renowned Scholar in Egypt Charged With Espionage
description: CAIRO  An internationally respected Egyptian political scientist said Wednesday that prosecutors had filed espionage charges against him, making him the second such scholar targeted this month in a widening crackdown on dissent against last summers military takeover.

title: New Forces Join Lawsuit Fighting Palisades Tower
description: Two months after work began on LG Electronics USAs new headquarters in Englewood Cliffs, N.J., new opponents have jumped in the battle to scale back the project, which they see as a blight on the Hudson River landscape.

title: Yanks on a Budget? Yeah, Right
description: Youre rich and youre famished and youre eager for something new. You find the fanciest restaurant, order everything on the menu and raise a toast. Problems solved. This is going to cost you, but you knew that when you walked in.

title: A Race Against Time for a Second Child
description: Updated, 9:27 a.m. |

title: Scene City: Another Night for Armani
description: Giorgio Armani hosts Only Night Only fete during Paris Couture Fashion Week.

title: Justices Seem Stumped on Calculating Damages Over Child Pornography
description: WASHINGTON  In a Supreme Court argument on Wednesday that was part math problem and part seminar on the nature of culpability, the justices seemed to agree on just two things.

title: A Long and Winding Road
description: Sometimes when Im facing uncertainty or upheaval, I try to think back to what I expected life to be like as a professional soccer player when I first made that my goal.

title: An Upbeat Brown Urges California to Save Surplus
description: SACRAMENTO  When Gov. Jerry Brown stepped up on Wednesday to deliver his 11th State of the State speech  a record for California, he was told  the governor momentarily put aside his prepared remarks to offer a more casual greeting.

title: Airy Enough to Take Flight
description: Magical handwork separates haute couture from the rest of fashion, but it depends on modern ideas to be relevant. Looking at the Paris spring shows online, what stands out are lightness and agility, soothing colors and a reductive view of luxury that feels unusually sensitive to the times.

title: Putins Olympic Fever Dream
description: Anatoly Pakhomov was elected mayor of Sochi after the type of ersatz campaign that passes for democracy in Russia. It was 2009, and he had been appointed acting mayor  effectively the local manager of the massive construction project already underway  and in Russia incumbency means victory. His many prospective challengers included a K.G.B. veteran accused of poisoning the fugitive secret-service officer Aleksandr Litvinenko with polonium; a prima ballerina who had become even more famous after the Bolshoi dismissed her for being overweight; and a pornographic actress, Yelena Berkova, who ran a campaign ad that showed her gamboling topless along one of the Black Sea beaches that first made Sochi popular in the early 20th century.

title: Treasury Secretary Sends Warning on Debt Limit
description: WASHINGTON  Treasury Secretary Jacob J. Lewwarned Congress on Wednesday that the government would most likely exhaust its ability to borrow in late February, setting up yet another fiscal showdown with Republicans, and this time earlier than congressional leaders had anticipated.

title: Absence of Snow Brings Out Hikers and Horses in Yosemite
description: One skiers drought is a potential hikers gift.

title: Expanding the Meaning of One Night
description: PARIS  One night only? the editor of a prominent fashion magazine asked as she glanced at the invitation summoning her and practically the entire fashion crowd gathered in Paris for the couture shows this week to a dinner party being hosted by the designer Giorgio Armani. If so, it must be the longest night in history.

title: Rangers Trade Del Zotto to Predators
description: The Rangers traded defenseman Michael Del Zotto, who was once considered one of their most promising prospects, to the Nashville Predators on Wednesday for defenseman Kevin Klein.

title: I Watched The Film The Song Remains The Same
description: A new song by Sun Kil Moon.

title: The Tea Party and Conservative Reform
description: My Sunday column hailed recent forays by Senators Mike Lee and Marco Rubio as evidence that finally, finally, the ideas that conservative policy reformers have been batting around for a few years may be getting some traction in actual Republican politics. Along the way, I briefly characterized the Tea Party-versus-establishment battle thats dominated G.O.P. politics as having a policy substrate, but too often just being about posturing and score-settling. This was, of course, a simplification of a more complex story, and I appreciate the response from Mike Needham of Heritage Action a figure, its fair to say, much involved in the grassroots-establishment fight because it gives me an opportunity to expand and clarify a bit.

title: Ready to Strut in Ready-to-Rent
description: All the world is, alas, no longer a stage. Tis a red carpet.

title: Interpreting the Data: 10 Ways to Teach Math and More Using Infographics
description: From stock prices and unemployment rates to trends in tuition and quality of life, the ability to understand and interpret quantitative data is more important than ever in understanding the world.

title: Traveling Back in Time From the Left, With Context
description: Billy Yalowitz is a young man caught between generations. In East Towards Home, his one-act musical drama, the fictional Billy is a Jewish New Yorker, a self-described red-diaper baby (Mommy and Daddy were Communists) born too late for his parents revolution. Mostly hes a Woodstock-era kid who gets stuck regularly in the apartment-building elevator being interrogated by old ladies whose distinguishing accessory is an omnipresent shopping cart.

title: Paris Couture Week: Giorgio Armani Priv Spring/Summer 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Couture Week photo diary of Louise Damgaard.

title: Robot Vacuum Makes War on Cat Hair
description: The robots are coming. Every week, it seems, announcements hail a coming era of personal robots: machines that will ingratiate themselves into our homes by liberating us from despised chores like folding fitted sheets.

title: Roomba 880: A Clean Sweep
description: The Timess Damon Darlin tests out the Roomba 880, which is quite an expensive vacuum cleaner that is worth the premium.

title: Hints of Sierra Leones Progress From an Unexpected Source
description: One morning last April I was in Freetown, Sierra Leones capital, reporting the story that ran in the magazine this past weekend about Jeffrey Wrights attempt to mine gold in the countrys hinterlands. I first spent time in Sierra Leone 14 years ago, during its horrific civil war. Now I followed Wright  along with a team from a major expat mining company that he hoped would become his partner  into Sierra Leones statehouse. They were going to meet with the countrys president, Ernest Bai Koroma, to make sure they had the governments support.

title: New Products for Aging Hair
description: Keratin, a protein found in hair, is the star ingredient of many anti-aging products, though Dr. Alan J. Bauman, a hair expert, pointed out that you cant put keratin back into hair; you can only fill it in temporarily. Here are a few recommendations.

title: In Cape Town, Fashion With a Side of Fries
description: Step in to I Love My Laundry in Heritage Square in Cape Town, and youll think youve entered a glamorous wine bar or supper club. Youd be only partly right. The narrow room is dominated by a communal table flanked by 16 upholstered high-back chairs, and at a glance it seems that the only nod to the locations peculiar name is the clotheslines strung with artwork, prints and pillowcases for sale, or the price tags attached to wine bottles with clothespins. But listen closely and you just might hear the whir of washing machines. I Love My Laundry is a dim sum bar. And an art and wine shop. And a weekly private fondue party. Its also a front  literally  for a laundromat. In fact, laundry delivery is the core business.

title: Valentino: Spring 2014 Couture
description: Paris

title: In Milwaukee, a District for a Bite or a Brew
description: Walkers Point is historically a factory ward and still home to a sprawling Allen-Bradley plant, operated by Rockwell Automation, and its landmark clock tower. In the past two years, small start-ups have re-energized this working-class neighborhood south of the Milwaukee River. Its cache of brick warehouses has drawn transplants including public Radio Milwaukee, which moved in last fall, and an outpost of the local Stone Creek Coffee. Now the citys go-to district for innovative artisanal food, it also has a nice smattering of antiques shops for between-bites browsing.

title: Icahn Adds eBay to His Targets in Technology
description: Updated, 7:08 p.m. | As if taking on Apple wasnt enough, the activist investor Carl C. Icahn has another big technology company in his sights: eBay.

title: Bunking With the Stars at Sundance
description: PARK CITY, Utah  The leftover lobster was up to no good.

title: An Extra 2 Seconds Means the World
description: Rachel Joyces second novel, Perfect, is better and less treacly than her first, The Unlikely Pilgrimage of Harold Fry. It is eerier, too. Ms. Joyce builds her novel around two 11-year-old English boys who have heard that the year 1972 will be two seconds longer than other years and wonder about the cosmic consequences this change may have. It should go without saying that Ms. Joyce makes the two seconds matter a great deal.

title: Times Minute | Deadly Protests in Kiev
description: Also on the Minute, Mayor Bill de Blasio responds to snowplowing complaints, and a pair of unlikely celebrities.

title: Times Minute | Deadly Protests in Kiev
description: In the Video

title: Tempting and Dangerous. They Sing, Too.
description: Do you know what it means to be the insensate apparatus of a homicidal mythological order? The composer and soprano Kate Soper, portraying Polyxo, one of three mellifluous murderesses of ancient legend, poses that question not long into Here Be Sirens, her substantial new musical-theater piece. The Morningside Opera is presenting the works premiere engagement at Dixon Place on the Lower East Side.

title: Portable Charger Adds New Feature: Speakers
description: Typically, when a technology company expands its product line, it sticks to its strengths. PowerStick.com, the Canadian company behind the handy PowerStick portable charger, has lately been upgrading its line to offer new features, like increased battery life and solar technology.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ukraine and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Ukraine, Gaza Strip, Pakistan and Philadelphia.

title: Push Comes to Shove in Brooklyn
description: Snow fell at a punishing slant across the darkened warehouses along Union Street in Gowanus, Brooklyn. It couldnt be further from the sunny retirement communities of Florida, but inside one former factory, the spirit of St. Petersburg lived on.

title: Caucus Click: Ruing Roe
description: On the anniversary of the Supreme Courts Roe v. Wade decision, abortion opponents gather in Washington for the annual March for Life, and, despite the exceptional cold, this year was no exception as hundreds of thousands marched through the capital.

title: Sundance: Reactions From the Secret Screening of Nymphomaniac
description: PARK CITY, Utah  It was the whisper heard up and down the mountains and across the packed restaurants and pop-up lounges of Main Street here  which film would be the top-secret surprise screening that publicists and festival organizers at Sundance started touting early this week? Promising a highly anticipated film by a major filmmaker that should not be missed, the guesses included Wes Andersons Grand Budapest Hotel, Lars von Triers epic Nymphomaniac and  jokingly  the next Tyler Perry or Muppets movie.

title: Englands Angry Young Man Returns as a Live Wire With Attitude
description: A sense of isolation seems an unlikely affliction for the protagonist of the new stage adaptation of The Loneliness of the Long Distance Runner, the story by Alan Sillitoe that was made into a classic 1962 British movie. As portrayed by a dynamic Sheldon Best in Roy Williamss contemporary rewrite, at the Atlantic Theater Companys Stage 2, the disaffected Colin bounces around the stage with a buoyant energy thats matched by his assertiveness and his verbal agility. Far from being a moody sort festering with grievances against a culture determined to put him in a box, this Colin seems to have enough drive to punch his way through any barriers.

title: For Tresses Feeling Their Age
description: Is hair the new skin? Serums, BB creams, massages and lasers are among the new products and services addressing the issue of womens aging locks. Many go well beyond covering the gray, which has been the markets focus (indeed, Diane Keaton let her gray shine, to widespread acclaim, at the Golden Globes).

title: A Vogue Alum Dives Into Digital With Zappos
description: IN THE 11 MONTHS since the fashion eminence Andr Leon Talley parted company with Vogue, he has pursued a number of new gigs. Since February, he has been an editor at large for the Russian version of Numro magazine. There was talk of a late-night TV show, which has not gotten off the ground. Nothing has happened with that recently, no meetings, nothing is happening, Mr. Talley said. (My Ed McMahon would be Gloria von Thurn und Taxis, he joked.) Recently he interviewed Diane von Furstenberg for Entertainment Tonight.

title: A Tudor Soap Opera Fills a Stage
description: STRATFORD-UPON-AVON, England  Thomas Cromwell, the guileful right hand to King Henry VIII, was said to be fluent in many tongues and adept at double talk in all of them. But I imagine even he would be impressed by the act of translation that is taking place in his name at the Swan Theater here.

title: A How-Not-To Manual for Working Politicians
description: Former Gov. Bob McDonnell of Virginia and his wife, Maureen, were accusedTuesdayof taking more than $160,000 in loans and gifts in a quid-pro-quo relationship with a favored campaign donor, Jonnie R. Williams, Sr. The couple denied the charges and the courts will ultimately settle the accusation of criminality. Still, the federal indictment, with its glittery descriptions, reads as a How-Not-To manual for working politicians.

title: The Womens Under-26 Trial for World Youth Teams
description: Only three teams entered the womens under-26 trial in Atlanta at the beginning of this month. A round robin eliminated one, and the other two played a 96-board match to determine the American entry in the World Youth Teams Championships.

title: Feeling For | An Eco-Lightbulb that Looks Better Naked
description: Old-fashioned filament bulbs may cast a warm, flattering light, but their century-old technology leaves a substantial carbon footprint. Whats more, theyre in trouble with the law. A federal regulation passed in 2007 calls for the production of energy-wasting incandescents to effectively cease as of Jan. 1 of this year  though existing bulbs will remain on store shelves, and ambience-minded interior designers aware of the regulation have for several years been furtively stockpiling them. Last week, Congressional Republicans  apparently not fans themselves of the ghoulish glow of energy-efficient compact fluorescent (C.F.L.) bulbs  attached a provision to the new spending bill that eliminates funding for the laws enforcement.

title: The Bubble Canard
description: Ah, this one never goes away. Ill leave the cleanup in the excellent hands of Dean Baker. Hes right to say that anyone trying to make this particular claim is revealing whats wrong with them, not with me. But Id quarrel with his either a fool or a liar line; why not both?

title: In the Founders Footsteps
description: The experience of Balanchine choreography in performance is as intensely multilayered as anything in the arts. A little ballet, less than 20 minutes long, can plunge us into consuming revelations of style, expression, drama, history, morality, entertainment; into a demonstration of dancing to music as the most exciting interconnection of time and space possible; into complex overlaps among classicism, Romanticism and modernism; into the tension between pure form and poetic communication. And into the capacity of human beings to demonstrate the ideal.

title: Wells Fargo Sells Servicing Rights on $39 Billion in Mortgages
description: In another sign of the banking industrys retreat from the mortgage market, Wells Fargo is selling servicing rights on $39 billion of home loans to a nonbanking firm.

title: Bugs in Chrome Browser Could Give Access to Microphones
description: Web developers can exploit bugs in Googles Chrome browser to listen through a computers microphone  even if the browser window is not open, according to a developer who publicly reported the vulnerability Wednesday.

title: Gaining Accolades, Friends and Steam
description: LOS ANGELES  Lupita Nyongo was giving a surprise birthday party for her best friend, Ben Kahn. She pulled out a tray of sweets  vegan, gluten free, she noted  and organized a rendition of Happy Birthday as Mr. Kahn, 32, who has known Ms. Nyongo since their college days, grinned. He was being feted at a glittery, exclusive soiree here, surrounded by Hollywood luminaries.

title: When Your Smartphone Shuts Down From the Cold
description: Imagine this: Youre shoveling snow in the blistering cold from another arctic blast. You stop for a moment and pull out your smartphone to see the temperature  Is it minus 10degrees yet? It feels like minus 30.  then your phone shuts off. You frantically press the power button a few times. Nothing. Its dead, or at least it seems that way.

title: Excerpt: 'Rake'
description: Greg Kinnear stars as a troubled lawyer in this new Fox comedy.

title: The Euthanasia of the Rentier
description: A commenter quotes John Maynard Keynes:

title: Hes a Train Wreck, but Still Kinda Cute
description: He is late, yes, but he is under a lot of pressure. He cant understand why she cant understand.

title: A Stifled Soul Toughs It Out With At-Home Acts
description: Towheads, a film written and directed by and starring Shannon Plumb, is a whimsical yet deeply disturbing story about the infantilization and isolation of a stay-at-home mom in Brooklyn. Penelope (Ms. Plumb) is a creative woman with two young children who is trapped under the economic thumb of her husband, Matt, a film director (played by Ms. Plumbs husband, the director Derek Cianfrance). Matts face is not shown, a treatment similar to the handling of adults in a Peanuts animated special.

title: Openings, Events and Sales Starting the Week of Jan. 23
description: Hitting the Racks

title: Verizon Publishes First Transparency Report on Data Requests
description: Verizon Communications on Wednesday published a so-called transparency report describing when and why it receives requests for customer data, like phone records or emails, from law enforcement and government agencies.

title: The Source | Theaster Gates
description: Doug Aitken interviews the artist Theaster Gates.

title: Paris Couture Week: Valentino Spring/Summer 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Couture Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Snowfall in New York
description: After a foot of snow hit New York City overnight, travelers complained of canceled journeys and uncleared streets. In his first major test the new mayor, Bill de Blasio, defended the city's response.

title: Fraternity Suspended After King Day-Themed Party Mocks Blacks
description: Arizona State University suspended a fraternity, Tau Kappa Epsilon, after members organized a Martin Luther King Day Black Party, mocking African-Americans. The fraternity urged guests to show up wearing hoodies, baggy basketball jerseys and bandannas and then share photos of themselves on social media platforms, using hashtags #blackoutformlk, #ihaveadream and #mlkparty.

title: A Chat With Greenpeaces Departing U.S. Chief on Old and New Environmentalism
description: I was able to fit in 15 minutes this afternoon for an exit interview, in essence, with Phil Radford, who is leaving Greenpeace after 10 years of old-fashioned and innovative environmental activism, five at the helm of the organizations American branch.

title: Lenovo Near Deal for IBMs Server Business
description: Lenovo is close to finalizing a deal for IBMs low-end server business, according to people briefed on the process.

title: Footage of Mayhem on the Streets of Kiev
description: As my colleague David Herszenhorn reports from Kiev, at least two protesters were shot to death on the streets of the Ukrainian capital on Wednesday during pitched battles between the riot police and demonstrators.

title: When Making Money Is an Obsession
Tsongass Cancer Battle
U.S. Military Deaths in Afghanistan
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,293 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the death of the following American recently:

title: The Middle-Class Squeeze
description: To the Editor:

title: Occupy Starbucks?
description: To the Editor:

title: At Resting Place for Frances Great Men, Calls to Include More Women
description: PARIS  As the builders were putting the final stones in place on the Panthon, Frances monument to some of its most important figures, a young Napoleon wrote, Men of genius are meteors destined to burn to light their century.

title: Purpose After the War
description: To the Editor:

title: Child Hunger in Afghanistan
description: To the Editor:

title: Strong Finish to 2013 for Netflix as Profit and Subscriptions Soar
description: Netflix racked up another quarter of impressive growth to finish 2013, surpassing 30 million paid subscribers in the United States for the first time and predicting continued growth through the first quarter of this year.

title: A New World Around Every Corner
description: Not unlike Christopher Columbus, Joseph Gonzalez is in search of the New World. And he has found it some 480 times.

title: Finding a Needle in a Digital Haystack
description: PLEASANTON, Calif.  LAST year the private sector spent $67.2 billion on cybersecurity services. Nevertheless, according to a recent investigation by Verizon, 60 percent of successful hacks were not detected until months after the attacks began. In the wake of recent high-profile hacker attacks against Target, Neiman Marcus and other retailers, the obvious question is: Why hasnt all that money done any good?

title: A Second Chemical Was Part of West Virginia Chemical Spill, Company Reveals
description: The chemical spill that left 300,000 West Virginia residents without usable water involved more chemicals than the company responsible had previously reported, officials revealed this week, leading the states Department of Environmental Protection to order that company to give a full accounting of the chemicals that had leaked into the Elk River.

title: Abortion Opponents March in Washington on Anniversary of Roe v. Wade Decision
description: Thousands of abortion opponents descended on Washington for the annual March for Life rally on Wednesday on the 41st anniversary of the decision in Roe v. Wade, the landmark Supreme Court case that legalized abortion.

title: Owning Up to Being a Home-Schooling Parent
description: Sitting across from the principal, I tried to argue  in a logical, lawyerly way  that my third graders standardized test scores were compelling evidence that she needed more than Clifford, the Big Red Dog. Although my daughter was bored to distraction by the simple books the teacher assigned, maybe I should have thought twice before requesting special treatment.

title: U.S. Offshore Wind Farm, Made in Europe
description: MIDDLEBOROUGH, Mass.  Carl Horstmann strode around the floor of his factory here, passing welders honing head-high metal tubes as sparks flew. He is one of a dying breed: the owner of Mass Tank, a steel tank manufacturer in a down-at-the-heels region that was once a hub of the craft.

title: Serena Williams May End Boycott of Event at Indian Wells
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Thanks in part to a movie about Nelson Mandela, Serena Williams has moved toward ending her more than decade-long absence from a high-profile tour event in Indian Wells, Calif.

title: Own Less, Live More
description: An Oregon couple is liberated by a house that is cheap to operate and small enough to vacuum in five minutes.

title: Freedom in 704 Square Feet
description: Early in their marriage, Lily Copenagle and Jamie Kennel began crafting a plan for living, scribbling house designs and lists of must-haves on notepads and paper napkins.

title: Weve Got Your Number
description: A generation ago, the Supreme Court was faced with deciding whether the police needed a warrant before installing a newfangled device at a telephone company switching office that could record the numbers dialed from a particular telephone. The answer the court gave was no.

title: The Source | Theaster Gates in Conversation With Doug Aitken
description: I have this great problem of space, Theaster Gates says. When planners use words like blight and underdeveloped, its like actually what you are talking about is available land. The artist and urban planner talks to Doug Aitken in an abandoned property on Chicagos South Side that he calls the Archive House. By adding a reading room and a space for records, Gates has reimagined the property as a hub for artists. Gates (who chatted with Perry Chen of Kickstarter in a conversation published by T last year) has made it his mission to repurpose unused buildings to transform local communities. The interview is part of the Source, a series of candid video conversations with several dozen noteworthy figures about their creative process, currently on view in a custom pavilion at the Sundance Film Festival.

title: Michigan Governor Asks State Lawmakers to Provide $350 Million for Detroit
description: DETROIT  With time growing short for leaders here to file a plan for this citys emergence from bankruptcy, Gov. Rick Snyder on Wednesday urged Michigans Legislature to provide $350 million to lessen possible cuts to the pensions of Detroit retirees and save the citys art collection from the threat of sale.

title: A Tell-All Born From Goldman Gossip
description: The parody Twitter account @GSElevator, a stream of darkly funny, frequently callous anonymous snippets purportedly overheard in elevators at Goldman Sachs, has offered comments on a dizzying range of topics to its more than 600,000 followers.

title: Reading Books Is Fundamental
description: The first thing I can remember buying for myself, aside from candy, of course, was not a toy. It was a book.

title: The Luck of the Pontiff
description: President Obama is going to visit the pope! Hes been to the Vatican before, but not with this pope, who is perhaps the only person in the world almost everybody likes.

title: Lessons Learned, H&M Returns to Super Bowl With New Beckham Spot
description: THE Seattle Seahawks are not the only ones returning to the Super Bowl for a second appearance. So, too, is the retailer H&M, coming back with a commercial that seeks to build on what the company learned two years ago.

title: Tiger Woodss Schedule Is Unexpectedly Open After Lindsey Vonns Season-Ending Injury
description: SAN DIEGO  For someone who feels as much at home here as a Torrey pine, Tiger Woods enters this weeks Farmers Insurance Open feeling strangely out of sorts. Because of the PGA Tours switch to a wraparound schedule that began in October instead of January, Woods, the worlds top-ranked player and the reigning player of the year, will make his season debut Thursday from a pot-bunker-size hole in the FedEx Cup playoff race.

title: Gay Marriages Confront Catholic School Rules
description: SAMMAMISH, Wash.  Eastside Catholic prides itself on teaching acceptance. At the end of Crusader Way, by the schools entrance, banners hang celebrating relationships and exhorting passers-by to remember to take care of each other. Students use a sign-language gesture to remind one another of the schools emphasis on unconditional love.

title: Martha Beck, Who Founded the Drawing Center in New York, Dies at 75
description: Martha Beck, an art curator who made use of a converted warehouse to found the Drawing Center, an alternative museum in downtown Manhattan that provided a first showplace for emerging artists and an unlikely setting for rarely seen drawings by the likes of Michelangelo, Rembrandt and Czanne, was found dead on Jan. 6 in her apartment in Manhattan. She was 75.

title: Giants Hire Another Assistant for Offense
description: For the second time this month, the Giants hired a quarterbacks coach from the N.F.C. North to help resurrect their downtrodden offense.

title: Modern Family Matters
description: When I asked readers for neglected topics that journalists should cover more in 2014, one of the suggestions was a delicate but vital topic: family breakdown and the rise of single-parent households.

title: No Luck for a Growing Family
description: It all started with small talk.

title: Exporting U.S. Rules for Foreign Banks
description: One of the biggest loopholes on Wall Street may soon close.

title: Ukrainian Standoff
description: The standoff in Kiev, Ukraine, is now two months old, and it has claimed its first fatalities: two men who died of bullet wounds and a third who fell to his death. With tensions at a dangerous level, and Ukraines citizens inflamed by both economic policy and new laws against public assembly, President Viktor Yanukovich met with the three most prominent opposition leaders: the popular boxer Vitali Klitschko, the former economics minister Arseniy Yatsenyuk, and the far-right nationalist Oleg Tyagnibok.

title: Details Slip By Insider Trials Main Witness
description: Dr. Sidney Gilman, the governments most important witness in the insider trading trial of Mathew Martoma, a former SAC Capital Advisors portfolio manager, showed signs of a faulty memory on the stand on Wednesday.

title: A Plan to Make Voting Easier
description: A superb report released Wednesday by the Presidential Commission on Election Administration can be summarized in one quick sentence: There are many ways to make voting easier in America. There shouldnt be the slightest whiff of controversy or partisanship about that concept, or the important suggestions made in the report. But, of course, there is, and that makes the commissions persuasive logic and research all the more valuable.

title: Heavy Load in Japan, but a Star Is Used to It
description: When a high-profile Japanese pitcher comes to the United States, the news cycle breaks down into three parts: How good is he? How much will he cost? How much has his arm been abused?

title: Leaning Right in Hollywood, Under a Lens
description: LOS ANGELES  In a famously left-leaning Hollywood, where Democratic fund-raisers fill the social calendar, Friends of Abe stands out as a conservative group that bucks the prevailing political winds.

title: Political Rumble Over Pre-K
description: Leave it to New Yorks top two political alpha males: Gov. Andrew Cuomo and Mayor Bill de Blasio are locked in a contest over something they both agree on. Mr. de Blasio wants to offer free, full-day prekindergarten to every 4-year-old in New York City and pay for it by raising taxes on wealthy residents. Mr. Cuomo is promising to pay for full-day prekindergarten across the entire state, without any tax increase.

title: State Dept. Learned in November of Photos Said to Show Torture in Syria
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration first learned last November about a harrowing trove of photographs that were said to document widespread torture and executions in Syrian prisons when a State Department official viewed some of the images on a laptop belonging to an antigovernment activist, a senior official said Wednesday.

title: De Blasio Sets Ambitious Goal for Affordable Apartments
description: After Mayor Edward I. Koch instituted his housing plan in the 1980s, New York City created tens of thousands of affordable apartments by renovating vacant buildings in neighborhoods that had been ravaged by arson and abandonment.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Jan. 22, 2014
New Push Is Made to Free an American While Iran Is at the Negotiating Table
description: Advocates for a former Marine imprisoned in Tehran more than two years ago are seeking to use a diplomatic window created by the temporary nuclear agreement with Iran to gain his release.

title: Cousins, Across the Color Line
description: EL CERRITO, Calif.  I learned about her through the comments section of an article in Publishers Weekly. I had recently published a book of poems crafted out of family stories, and it had been written up, along with a brief interview. In the interview, I reckon with the complicated history of my family  I am a white descendant of Thomas Jefferson  and the fact that some of my ancestors were slave owners from 1670 until the Civil War.

title: Seahawks Richard Sherman, Like Cornerbacks Before Him, Plays Man-to-Man and Goes Toe to Toe
description: SEATTLE  I spent three seasons of my college football career at Morgan State University backpedaling.

title: Enjoying a Total Meltdown
description: Jeff Zimmerman, 45, a glass artist, has described his work as a series of controlled accidents. The latest results of his live-and-let-melt sensibility went on display this week at R & Company (formerly R 20th Century) in TriBeCa. It is Mr. Zimmermans fourth solo show, and it features the crinkled vessels hes become known for, along with mirrors embedded with reflective glass orbs, geometric pendant lamps and a giant undulating chandelier.

title: Fighting Extremism on a Broader Level
Helping Poor Defendants Post Bail in Backlogged Bronx
description: In October, James Broadus II, then 31, was arrested in Co-op City, the Bronx, and charged with petty larceny and assault. He was accused of taking a book bag from one man and choking another. A judge set bail at $1,000.

title: Comment by Cuomo Outrages Republicans
description: ALBANY  Still searching for a way, and a person, to beat Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo this fall, the states Republican Party may have, at least temporarily, found a talking point: comments by the governor that candidates who are extreme conservatives  which he defined as pro-assault weapon and anti-abortion  have no place in the state of New York.

title: When Political Spouse Helps Cause a Downfall
description: Virginias first lady needed a designer dress for her husbands inauguration.

title: Organizer Says It Will Reinstate Appearance Fees for Top Racers
description: In a reversal, Competitor Group, the organizer of dozens of high-profile running events around the world, said it would immediately reinstate appearance fees for elite athletes.

title: In New Jersey, Claims Elevate Mayors Profile
description: Friends call Dawn Zimmer the accidental politician.

title: Lee and Morty Kaufman: Cleaning Up in Their 90s
description: Valley Stream, N.Y.  I was retired for 30 years, until at the age of 90 I got swept up in this commercial bit, Morty Kaufman said.

title: Corrections: January 23, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Turkey: More Police Are Fired or Reassigned
description: Nearly 500 police officers were either fired or reassigned on Wednesday, local news outlets said, part of what appears to be a purge related to a graft inquiry that has already ensnared many of the prime ministers allies. News reports said at least some of the reassigned officers took part in the large corruption investigation. Government critics fear the continuing changes in personnel  hundreds of police officers have already been purged  are meant to derail the investigation. Government officials insist, however, that the changes are legitimate efforts to eliminate what they call a parallel state. That refers to those in the judiciary and the police force loyal to a rival of Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan. Wednesdays reshuffle followed the relocation on Tuesday of nearly 100 judges and prosecutors, a move made during Mr. Erdogans first visit in five years to Brussels, where he confronted European Union officials concerns about the separation of powers and a free judiciary in Turkey.

title: If You Want to Be Loved, Be Lovable
description: Administrivial Alert!In todays (Thursday, Jan. 23, 2014) puzzle, there are elements in the print version that cannot be replicated electronically. We recommend using the PDF for the best solving experience.

title: Family of South Carolina Boy Put to Death Seeks Exoneration 70 Years Later
description: SUMTER, S.C.  After South Carolina electrocuted George J. Stinney Jr. in 1944, his family buried his burned, 14-year-old body in an unmarked grave in the hopes the anonymity would allow him to rest in peace.

title: Iran: Surge in Executions Worries Rights Experts
description: United Nations human rights experts called on Wednesday for an urgent halt to a surge in executions in Iran in recent weeks, observing that the more moderate tone adopted on human rights since President Hassan Rouhanis election last year has yet to yield any moderation in the countrys punitive practices. Iran reportedly hanged 40 people in the first two weeks of January, 33 of them in the last week, Ahmed Shaheed, the United Nations expert monitoring human rights in Iran, and Christof Heyns, the organizations expert dealing with summary executions, said in a joint statement released in Geneva. The hangings carried out by Iran since the start of the year follow the execution of 625 people, including 28 women, and a number of political detainees in 2013, an increase of more than 100 over the number of recorded executions the previous year, Mr. Shaheed said.

title: South Korea: Kidnapped Trade Official Is Rescued
description: A South Korean trade official kidnapped by gunmen in the Libyan capital of Tripoli was rescuedon Wednesdayby local security forces, who raided the kidnappers hide-out, the South Korean Foreign Ministry said on Thursday. The official, Han Seok-woo, the head of the Tripoli office of the government-financed Korea Trade-Investment Promotion Agency, suffered no injuries during the rescue operation, the ministry said in a statement. The four kidnappers were arrested by the Libyan security officials, the statement added. Mr. Han, 39, was on his way home from work on Sundayafternoon when four gunmen stopped his car. South Korea then issued a warning against traveling to Libya and asked the 551 South Korean nationals there to leave.

title: With Virginia Way, State Thought It Didnt Need Rules
description: WASHINGTON  The gift-giving scandal that federal prosecutors described in evocative detail in their indictment on corruption charges Tuesday of former Gov. Bob McDonnell of Virginia and his wife, Maureen, would be ample evidence of a possible crime in some states.

title: New Speaker Gives Her Allies Plum Posts
description: Two weeks after prevailing in a bitter race for City Council speaker, Melissa Mark-Viverito on Wednesday distributed the spoils of her victory, rewarding allies and punishing at least a few adversaries as she assigned plum Council posts.

title: Some Parents Bemoan Icy Treks as de Blasio Stands by Choice to Keep Schools Open
description: Anthony M. Armstrong, principal of Middle School 74 in Bayside, Queens, was having a miserable morning. He was groggy from a night of worrying about slippery sidewalks, and a tire on his Chevrolet Equinox had nearly gone flat on his way to work.

title: Arizona Fraternity Party Stirs Concerns of Racism
description: TEMPE, Ariz.  Arizona State University is investigating accusations that members of a fraternity gave a party to commemorate Martin Luther Kings Birthday at which nonblack students mocked blacks by donning loose basketball jerseys, flashing gang signs and drinking from hollowed-out watermelons.

title: Fire Destroys Biodiesel Refinery in Mississippi
description: A small biodiesel refinery that turns chicken fat into truck fuel was reduced to ashes on Wednesday by powerful explosions and a huge fire.

title: Hendrickson, Ailing Star in Ski Jump, Is Named to U.S. Team
description: Sarah Hendrickson, the reigning world champion in the womens ski jump, was named to the United States Olympic team Wednesday even though she has not competed this season.

title: A Secluded Compound in St. Thomas
description: This cliffside beach compound has island-stone walls embedded with coral and shells. It overlooks a quiet cove.

title: House Hunting on ... St. Thomas
description: A BEACH BUNGALOW IN SECRET HARBOR

title: The Call of the Worn
description: I admit it, Im a hoarder, said Annie Hurlbut Zander, who often gets messages from antiques dealers telling her theyve got something weird she needs to see. Thats kind of what happens when you get a reputation for oddball stuff.

title: Douglas Davis, Newsweek Critic and Internet Artist, Dies at 80
description: Douglas Davis, who had parallel careers as an art critic for Newsweek and as an artist himself, doing work that explored the possibilities of video and the Internet as creative and interactive mediums, died on Jan. 16 in Queens. He was 80.

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, January 23, 2014
description: I have never seen a bigger outage. Half of the worlds Internet users trying to access the Internet couldnt.

title: Knicks Defensive Disarray in Loss to 76ers Puts Woodson on the Spot
description: The list of items that have haunted Knicks Coach Mike Woodson started early this season  practically from opening night. There were personality conflicts with Iman Shumpert, then J. R. Smith, then Chris Smith, then Beno Udrih. Critics nitpicked Woodsons lineup choices before games and then admonished him over his time management at the end of games. Woodson was not being tough enough on players. He was being too tough on players.

title: Philadelphia Principals Fired in Cheating Scandal
description: Three Philadelphia Public Schools principals were fired last week after an investigation into test cheating that has implicated about 140 teachers and administrators, a spokesman for the district said Wednesday.

title: Leslie Lee, Playwright Who Enlarged Black Life Onstage, Dies at 83
description: Leslie Lee, a playwright whose award-winning work, much of it with the Negro Ensemble Company, focused on stretching the boundaries of the African-American experience as it was portrayed on the stage, died on Monday in Manhattan. He was 83.

title: What You Get For  $700,000
description: A trilevel penthouse in St. Louis, a 1920s house in Madison, Wis., and a foursquare in Denver

title: What You Get For ... $700,000
description: ST. LOUIS

title: Sugar Bowls and Creamers: Adding Sweetness and Light
description: Like many people, Jane Kim enjoys a good cup of coffee. But as an architect who has designed several coffee shops, she has given more thought than most to what makes for a satisfying coffee-drinking experience.

title: John J. McGinty III, Who Gave Away His Medal of Honor, Dies at 73
description: John J. McGinty III, a retired Marine Corps officer who received the Medal of Honor for saving the lives of dozens of his men during an enemy attack in Vietnam, but later relinquished it for religious reasons, died on Friday in Beaufort, S.C. He was 73.

title: These Can Go Anywhere
description: Among the eclectic goods at the 60th Winter Antiques Show, which opens Friday, will be a set of library steps. Its an unusual piece of furniture, said Wendell Castle, 81, who designed the piece in 1977 as a departure from staircases, which were more his usual thing. Speaking from his studio in Scottsville, N.Y., he added: You dont have to have a specific site. I always like to make things that can go anywhere.

title: A Niche for Oomph
description: PIQ, a gift shop that opened last week at Grand Central Terminal, in a space formerly occupied by Pylones, is, like its predecessor, wildly colorful. But the similarities end there. The Pylones look was about cuteness, and I was tired of cuteness, said Frdric A. Rambaud, a founder of the Sarut Group, which manages Pylones stores in New York (two remain) and an owner of the new PIQ. Theres a new aspect in retail thats a mix of day-to-day with designer toys. So the grandmother can come in and find something for the grandchildren, and at the same time find something for herself.

title: Sales at Canvas, From the Source and Others
description: Everything on Arcadia Homes website is 30 percent off, through Jan. 31 (a reverse painted mirror jewelry box, regularly $260, is $182; a hand-felted wool flowers tree skirt, regularly $340, is $238); use code HAPPY at checkout, arcadiahomeinc.com.

title: Into Everyday Life, a Few Drops Fall
description: Ruan Hoffmann, who was born in Pretoria, South Africa, did not set out to be a product designer. He considers his expressionistic ceramic pieces to be art, not craft, and has shown them in galleries and museums throughout Africa and Europe. But after an exhibition of his work at the Anthropologie store in Rockefeller Center in 2011, the retailer encouraged him to create for a mass audience.
