Mr. Hoffmann set about designing everyday products that would enhance peoples lives. Its a big thing to ask of ordinary objects, he said. Its a lot to wish for from a shower curtain, for instance, but then again it could be the catalyst for a daydream. The Jardin Des Plantes collection, which will be introduced on Thursday, includes dinnerware, bedding, curtains, hardware, wallpaper, vases and, yes, a shower curtain ($108). The rest of the items are from $10 to $1,298. Information: 800-309-2500 or anthropologie.com.

title: For the Laid-Back, a Limited Edition
description: David Weeks designed Semana, a leather-and-steel lounge chair, in 1999, but couldnt find sturdy enough fabric for its production. (Habitat in London was able to solve that problem and sold the chair for 10 years, paying Mr. Weeks a royalty.) Then, while vacationing in Marfa, Tex., last year, he discovered Big Bend Saddlery, whose eighth-of-an-inch-thick leather had the heft he had long sought.

title: Hosts Pride Rests on an Aging, and Aching, Star Skater
description: It has long been difficult to imagine Russias first Winter Olympics without Yevgeny Plushenko, and now that will no longer be necessary.

title: Faded Beauty
description: In a life-size cabinet of curiosities in Kansas City, Mo., the strange and quirky intermingle, and reupholstering is frowned upon.

title: Texas Executes Mexican Man for Murder
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Despite opposition from the State Department, Mexican officials and Latino advocates, Texas executed Edgar Arias Tamayo on Wednesday night, putting to death a Mexican citizen whose case raised questions about the states duty to abide by international law.

title: Resorts Artistic Streak
description: Usually, we see a designers sketches as insight into the creative process behind the final product. But in the resort collections, scribbles are front and center on statement garments and accessories. Chicken scratch has become a new way of coloring inside the lines, like on a Cedric Charlier shirt with a black scribbled collar set atop a salmon sketch pattern, or on a leather Balenciaga dress covered entirely in childlike scrawl. And as one standout piece  a herringbone-scribbled Marc Jacobs bag with a cheetah-print flap and pink-and-white handle  proves, these artistic accessories look best paired with other eye-catching patterns and colors.

title: A Swedes Second Set of Heartfelt Electronic Beats
description: My music is the opposite of an escape, says Eric Berglund, the mastermind and sole member of the Swedish synth-pop act CEO. Over the years, Berglund has become an iconic figure in the Swedish musical landscape, creating glossy arrangements equally indebted to Top 40 and experimental dance music. Before striking out on his own, Berglund was one half of the alt-pop duo The Tough Alliance, which during the mid-2000s helped to popularize the Balearic style, a more chilled-out, polycultural brand of dance pop inspired by Ibizas club D.J.s. The two also founded the Gothenburg-based record label Sincerely Yours, whose signees  including jj, Air France and The Honeydrips  share a similar sensibility.

title: Financial Reform Remains a Work in Progress
description: Simon Johnson, former chief economist of the International Monetary Fund, is the Ronald A. Kurtz professor of entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.

title: Word of the Day | lexicon
description: lexicon \lek-s-kn also -kn\ noun

title: Li Na Gets Back to Open Final; Wawrinka Reaches His First
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  The Li Na experience continued Thursday afternoon in what was billed as a news conference but came across more like a one-woman show. Li alternated between funny, introspective, philosophical and bemused.

title: Watchdog Report Says N.S.A. Program Is Illegal and Should End
description: WASHINGTON  An independent federal privacy watchdog has concluded that the National Security Agencys program to collect bulk phone call records has provided only minimal benefits in counterterrorism efforts, is illegal and should be shut down.

title: Upward Mobility Has Not Declined, Study Says
description: The odds of moving up  or down  the income ladder in the United States have not changed appreciably in the last 20 years, according to a large new academic study that contradicts politicians in both parties who have claimed that income mobility is falling.

title: Hoboken Mayor Is Said to Have Told of Threat
description: Federal authorities in New Jersey have interviewed several witnesses who said the mayor of Hoboken told them in May about a state officials threat to withhold hurricane recovery funds if the mayor did not support a development project favored by the governor, people briefed on the matter said on Wednesday.

title: Security Check Firm Said to Have Defrauded U.S.
description: The company that conducted a background investigation on the contractor Edward J. Snowden fraudulently signed off on hundreds of thousands of incomplete security checks in recent years, the Justice Department said Wednesday.

title: A Japanese Thread in the Bronx
description: It all began with Hideki Irabu, who joined the Yankees in 1997 but never lived up to the initial fanfare that greeted him. Hideki Matsui did fulfill expectations, arriving in 2003 and becoming a steady and admirable presence in the Yankee lineup through 2009. After Matsui came Kei Igawa, a left-hander who was unable to pitch effectively in the major leagues.

title: Whats on Thursday
description: 9 P.M. (Discovery) THE FIGHTERS In the gritty neighborhood of South Boston, boxing has a rich heritage as not merely a pastime but a way of life. But the sports popularity has declined over the past 20 years, and Peter Welch, the gym owner and former fighter above, is determined to bring it back. In this new series, Mr. Welch works with trainers from rival boxing gyms across the city, who will choose their top amateur fighters to represent them in bouts. After seven days of intensive training, the fighters will take their professional futures  and their reputations  to the ring.

title: Governor Says Its All Settled but the Money
description: Andrew M. Cuomo arrived at The New York Times in an expansive mood on Wednesday.

title: Cuomo Sweetens Pre-K Deal: Whatever Mayor Needs
description: A day after Mayor Bill de Blasio rebuffed his proposal to set aside $1.5 billion to pay for prekindergarten classes, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo came back on Wednesday with a new offer: a blank check.

title: A Conversation With: Pankaj Ghemawat, IESE Business School Professor
description: Pankaj Ghemawat, a professor of global strategy at the IESE business school in Madrid, and Steven Altman, a senior research associate at IESE, released the2013 Depth of Globalizationreport in November, which measures the globalization levels of 139 countries based on flows of trade, capital, information and people. The study found that India, ranked 123rd, was one of the least globalized economies.

title: Lupita Nyongo: Impostor to Ingnue
description: This years Oscar ingenue is Ms. Nyongo of 12 Years a Slave. She says it took encouragement to get over the feeling of being an outsider, a phenomenon she dubs acute impostor syndrome.

title: Chinese Rights Advocate Releases Statement on Goals
description: One of Chinas best-known human rights advocates, Xu Zhiyong, went on trial in Beijing on Wednesday, accused of disturbing order by organizing public gatherings calling for equal rights to education and for officials to reveal their wealth. Mr. Xu remained silent in protest for much of the prosecutions case, but then tried to defend himself in a statement to the court.

title: Test Yourself | English, Jan. 23, 2014
description: Take the Quiz

title: Couture Styles
description: More images from the summer 2014 shows, including Armani Priv, by Giorgio Armani, and John Paul Gaultier.

title: 6 Qs About the News | A Feminist Moment in the Food World
description: In A Change in the Kitchen, Julia Moskin writes about how a new vanguard of women is emerging as the next generation of leaders in the nations best restaurants.

title: U.S. and Iran Offer Clashing Accounts of the Civil War in Syria
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  Secretary of State John Kerry and President Hassan Rouhani of Iran offered clashing accounts on Thursday of the civil war in Syria, and the role that Tehran is playing in the conflict.

title: Lonnie Holley, the Insiders Outsider
description: One night in October, just a couple blocks from Harvard Square, a young crowd gathered at a music space called the Sinclair to catch a performance by Bill Callahan, the meticulous indie-rock lyricist who has been playing to bookish collegiate types since the early 90s. Callahans opening act, Lonnie Holley, had been playing to similar audiences for two years. A number of details about Holley made this fact surprising: He was decades older than just about everyone in the club and one of the few African-Americans. He says he grew up the seventh of 27 children in Jim Crow-era Alabama, where his schooling stopped around seventh grade. In his own, possibly unreliable telling, he says the woman who informally adopted him as an infant eventually traded him to another family for a pint of whiskey when he was 4. Holley also says he dug graves, picked trash at a drive-in, drank too much gin, was run over by a car and pronounced brain-dead, picked cotton, became a father at 15 (Holley now has 15 children), worked as a short-order cook at Disney World and did time at a notoriously brutal juvenile facility, the Alabama Industrial School for Negro Children in Mount Meigs.

title: Where the Ice, and the Population, Is Thinning
description: The landscape in Ciril Jazbecs photographs of the Arctic is impressive, but not nearly as captivating to him as the people whose daily routines have been affected by rising temperatures and tides. I am interested in the people, he said. Climate change is merely in the background.

title: Why Do We Like to Watch Rich People on TV and in the Movies?
description: A recent Room for Debate post begins, Several Academy Award contenders like The Wolf of Wall Street and American Hustle glorify white-collar criminals and scammers, and many reality TV shows embrace the wealthy, too. A new series, #RichKids of Beverly Hills, is the latest example of our enthusiasm for ogling the filthy rich. Why are we so obsessed with watching the antics of the 1 percent?

title: Lenovo Agrees to Buy IBM Server Business for $2.3 Billion
description: Lenovo said on Thursday that it would pay $2.3 billion for IBMs low-end server business, successfully concluding a deal that had fizzled a year earlier after the two parties failed to agree on a price.

title: China Tries to Close Provincial-Sized Hole in Economic Statistics
description: The growth figures for Chinas provinces add up to more than the national total with several yet to report, a discrepancy that experts say can be chalked up to politics and poor bookkeeping.

title: Man Posts Bail Amid Claims He Relayed Scores to Bettors
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  A British man facing charges that he illegally relayed information from the Australian Open was allowed to post $9,000 bail Thursday to get his passport back.

title: Times Minute | New Surveillance Report
description: Also on the Minute, Catholic schools reaction to same-sex marriage and the Yankees' latest spending spree.

title: Privacy Concerns a Challenge for Retailers
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  As technology rapidly increases the amount of personal data that is readily available, companies are trying to strike a balance between better tailoring their message to consumers and protecting an individuals privacy, said Doug McMillon, the incoming chief executive of Wal-Mart Stores said on Thursday.

title: Times Minute | New Surveillance Report
description: In the Video

title: New York Today: Deep Freeze
description: Updated 11:07 a.m.

title: A French Clowns Hateful Gesture
description: PARIS  Sixteen years ago, the leader of the far-right National Front, Jean-Marie Le Pen, deemed the Holocaust a detail in the history of the Second World War. Today, a popular comic known as Dieudonn MBala MBala (his stage name is simply Dieudonn) claims not to know, between the Jews and Germans, whos telling the truth  but I have my own little ideas on the subject. We know what those ideas are: Dieudonn invited onstage at one of his shows Robert Faurisson, a theorist of Holocaust denial, who argues that the extermination of the European Jews is a Jewish invention.

title: Tanaka Heads for a Strange Land With a Title in His Sights
description: TOKYO  Major league sluggers hit hard. Coaches are careful with pitch counts. And New York has bad weather.

title: 2 Wall Street Moguls Champion Gay Rights
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  When the World Economic Forum made inclusiveness one of its pillar themes, it was safe to assume the assembled corporate leaders would discuss economic issues.

title: Caution in Davos Over Report of Growth in Europe
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  An index of industrial activity in the euro zone has reached its highest level since mid-2011, according to a report released on Thursday. But policy makers, business leaders and economists gathered at the World Economic Forum here seem deeply skeptical about whether growth will be strong enough to cut high levels of youth unemployment in the bloc.

title: Deciding How Much Employees and Owners Should Make
description: In my last post, I wrote about my decision not to pay year-end bonuses. As usual, I received some insightful comments in response, including several suggesting that I start sharing more information with my employees so that they have a better sense of how the company is doing. This is something I have thought about quite a bit and I intend to do.

title: Investigative Stories Delve Into the Use of Offshore Companies by Chinese
description: The first big China investigative story of the year has come from the International Consortium of Investigative Journalists, which on Tuesday published, in tandem with several Western news organizations, a detailed look at the widespread use of offshore companies and tax havens by Chinese businesspeople and relatives of Communist Party leaders.

title: Bolshoi Theater Names New Music Director
description: The Bolshoi Theater has named Tugan Sokhiev of the Orchestre National du Capitole in Toulouse, France, as its new music director and chief conductor, the theater announced earlier this week. He fills the vacancy left by Vassily Sinaisky, who resigned abruptly last month.

title: Daily Report: N.S.A. Surveillance Program Is Illegal, Watchdog Says
description: An independent federal privacy watchdog has concluded that the National Security Agencys program to collect bulk phone call records has provided only minimal benefits in counterterrorism efforts, is illegal and should be shut down, Charlie Savage reports.

title: Abes Version of History Doesnt Sit Well With Chinese
description: Historians and columnists have made comparisons between Britain and a rising Germany in 1914 and the current tensions between Japan and China; a hot topic at the start of the centenary year of World War I.

title: When One Person Lives a Lie
description: In the Jan. 16 Unhitched column (In a Confrontation, a Secret Is Revealed), Deborah Wells-Clinton and Phil Clinton discussed their 28-year marriage and the enormous secret he had kept from her: Mr. Clinton is gay. Their split, after such a long union, was difficult, but they were able to retain a friendship.

title: Staring at You, Staring at Me
description: Whats in a face? The first and final images in Godfrey Reggios brooding, wordless film Visitors are of a gorilla staring into the camera. You can read anything you want into the beasts inscrutable gaze. Its deep-set eyes may convey primeval wisdom or atavistic aggression, or both, depending on your mood and the impulse to anthropomorphize what you see.

title: AOL Buys Gravity, a Firm That Personalizes Web Searches
description: AOL, the giant Internet portal turned media company, said Thursday morning that it had acquired Gravity, a company that allows users to personalize their Internet and social searches through filters.

title: Another Rights Advocate, Hou Xin, Is Tried in Beijing
description: A Chinese rights advocate who was part of a group calling for an end to corruption and for officials to disclose their financial assets was tried in Beijing on Thursday on charges of gathering a crowd to disturb public order, her lawyer said.

title: Nokia Struggles to Project a Bright Future Without Phones
description: LONDON  Microsofts push into the smartphone market may not get off to the best start.

title: Lenovo in Deal for IBMs Server Unit
description: Lenovo announced on Thursday that it would acquire IBMs low-end server business for $2.3 billion, signaling the successful completion of a deal that fell through a year ago, Neil Gough and David Gelles write in DealBook. The server unit, which includes IBMs x86 server business, brings in an estimated $5 billion in revenue a year.

title: A Near Bizarro World Taxi Confession
description: Dear Diary:

title: NewsCred, a Content Marketing Start-Up, Raises $25 Million
description: Doug Pepper, a venture capitalist, spent two years researching one particular type of start-up, those that help companies find articles and other content to use in marketing.

title: As Seen in Goodfellas: Arrest Is Made in 78 Lufthansa Robbery
description: The crime gripped the publics imagination, for both its magnitude and its moxie: In the predawn hours of Dec. 11, 1978, a group of masked gunmen seized about $6 million in cash and jewels from a cargo building at Kennedy International Airport.

title: Raid in Delhi Neighborhood Rattles African Residents
description: NEW DELHI Over the past week, an uncomfortable spotlight has fallen on Khirki Extension, a sprawling residential colony in south Delhi that is home to many of Delhis African residents.

title: Court in Russia Says Associate of Ex-Oil Tycoon Should Be Freed
description: MOSCOW  Taking a cue from President Vladimir V. Putins support of amnesties and pardons before the Winter Olympics, the Russian Supreme Court ruled Thursday that the business partner of the former oil tycoon Mikhail B. Khodorkovsky should be released from prison.

title: Apprenticeships Could Help Reduce Youth Unemployment, Business Leaders Say
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  An old concept may be coming back into vogue as business leaders and governments struggle with ways to address high unemployment rates among young people after the financial crisis: the apprenticeship.

title: South Sudan Cease-Fire Signed After More Than a Month of Fighting
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  The government of South Sudan and rebels loyal to the countrys ousted former vice president signed a cease-fire agreement on Thursday, holding out the prospect of peace after more than a month of fighting that has torn the new nation apart.

title: Sundance: The One Filmmaker Who Doesnt Want a Distribution Deal
description: PARK CITY, Utah  Distribution is typically the much-sought-after prize for filmmakers here at the Sundance Film Festival, and the higher the price, the better. Not so for the director Sam Green, whose unusual film, The Measure of All Things is billed as a live documentary.

title: Paris Couture Week: Viktor & Rolf Spring/Summer 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Couture Week photo diary of Sarah Aubel.

title: Claims of Police Brutality in Ukraine Amid Talks to Quell Unrest
description: KIEV, Ukraine  As opposition leaders negotiated with President Viktor F. Yanukovich to defuse Ukraines violent civil uprising, new evidence emerged of brutality by the authorities, including a video of a protester stripped naked except for boots by a group of officers from the feared Berkut riot police.

title: Virginias New Attorney General Opposes Ban on Gay Marriage
description: Asserting that Virginia had too often been on the wrong side of justice on civil rights matters, the state attorney general asked a federal court on Thursday to invalidate the states ban on same-sex marriage, calling the law unconstitutional and oppressive.

title: No Comment Necessary: Permission to Use Water Cannons
description: A British police association wants the home secretary, Theresa May, to authorize the use of water cannons by any police force in England and Wales  as a way to deal with possible protests against austerity measures.

title: Snow Rhino, Fort Greene
U.S. Weighs Pursuit of Death Penalty for Suspect in Boston Bombing
description: BOSTON  Since the federal death penalty was reinstated, in 1988, attorneys general have authorized it for about 500 defendants. By the end of the month there may be yet another: the accused Boston Marathon bomber, Dzhokhar Tsarnaev.

title: Bixi Stumbles, but Bikes May Still Benefit Bank Sponsors
description: There is an adage that half of all money spent on advertising is wasted, we just dont know which half.

title: In Our Pages: January 24
description: 1939: Call to Service by Chamberlain

title: Chang-rae Lee: By the Book
description: The author of On Such a Full Sea has been rereading the classics he tackled in college  big, complex works which I found arresting and difficult then and find arresting and difficult now.

title: Journeyman Playwrights Latest Journey
description: This is wild, George Brant murmured, struggling to be heard as the AC/DC anthem Back in Black blared and rehearsal got underway for his play Grounded.

title: The Next Big Picture
description: At first glance, viewers of What Is a Photograph? opening on Jan. 31 at the International Center of Photography, will not even recognize the work on the wall as photographic. There is no easily identifiable subject, no clear representational form.

title: Our Bodies, Our Apps: For the Love of Period-Trackers
description: My period was late.

title: Asia Is No. 1 Market for Mobile Apps, Study Says
description: The smartphone and tablet phenomena began in the United States, after Apple introduced the iPhone and the iPad. But most of the sales from mobile software are coming from Asia.

title: Huge Super PAC Is Moving Early to Back Clinton
description: The Obama political operation that once buried Hillary Rodham Clintons White House ambitions is now rapidly converging around her possible 2016 presidential bid, conferring on Mrs. Clinton enormous early advantages in money, expertise and voter targeting techniques.

title: Kerry Cooper of Choose Energy, on Career Management
description: This interview with Kerry Cooper, the chief executive of Choose Energy, an energy marketplace, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: Many Regulations Stifle Innovations, Panelists Contend
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  Government efforts to protect the investing public have had the unanticipated consequence of making it prohibitive for start-ups to seek a public offering, said Bill Gross, chairman of the technology incubator Idealab.

title: Amid Debate on Migrants, Norway Party Comes to Fore
description: MORTENSRUD, Norway  Lise and Kjetil Ulvestrand came to this town south of Oslo in 2005 for the space, the views, the forest and the cheaper rents. Ms. Ulvestrand, a former development worker in Latin America and a social worker with Norways immigrants, says she is comfortable around foreigners and different cultures.

title: Senator Is Lobbying for Inquiry on Herbalife
description: The hedge fund manager William A. Ackman walked the halls of Congress last year, telling any lawmaker who would listen that he believed Herbalife, a nutritional supplements company, was a fraud. He finally got a break on Thursday, when Senator Edward J. Markey of Massachusetts sent letters to federal regulators urging them to investigate the company.

title: Universal Plans to Expand Harry Potter Theme Park
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Forget the long lines for the rides at Universals Wizarding World of Harry Potter here. Nearly four years after opening, the attraction is still so popular that visitors routinely wait more than an hour just to get into a shop that sells wands.

title: Everything New Is Old Again
description: Logistical note: Ill be traveling the next couple of days  family, not work  so little if any blogging. Also, for those who like to plan their TV viewing far in advance, next week Ill be doing SOTU commentary on CNN. I believe Ive been assigned to discuss Michelle Obamas wardrobe, or something.

title: Much Transformed, Jersey City Is Ready to House Super Bowl Teams
description: JERSEY CITY  In recent years, the Jersey City waterfront, with its sweeping view of Manhattan, has gone from a scruffy neer-do-well near the wrong end of a Hudson River tunnel to a gentrifying bedroom community for younger Wall Street commuters, who say it is more convenient than Brooklyn neighborhoods like Williamsburg or Fort Greene, and also more affordable.

title: 1924: Black Flags Fly All Over Russia To Mourn Lenin
description: MOSCOW  Lenin, the founder of Bolshevism, died this morning [Jan. 22]. After an illness lasting nearly two years, his condition became suddenly worse yesterday, and at five this morning he lost consciousness, death following two hours later from paralysis of the nerve centres. He was fifty three years old.

title: After Shaky Beginning, Sides Report Progress at Syria Peace Talks
description: GENEVA  The fragile efforts to begin a diplomatic process to end the war in Syria seemed on Thursday night to be on track to produce a first round of negotiations, even though the two sides did not appear ready to meet face to face as had initially been hoped.

title: Fashion, Fairness and the Olympics
description: The February issue of Vogue, which will begin to show up on newsstands this week, includes details and a photo of something new from the celebrated fashion designer Alexander Wang, but its not quite like anything hes done before, and its more than a piece of apparel. Its a statement of solidarity, a cry of protest and a sign of just how many people from just how many walks of life are determined not to let the Olympics come and go without shining a light on Russias discrimination against, and persecution of, L.G.B.T. people.

title: Mirage by CEO
description: The worldwide premiere of CEOs single from their sophomore album, Wonderland.

title: Poetry Pairing | Winter: A Dirge
description: This Poetry Pairing features Winter: A Dirge by Robert Burns and the Opinion article A Year in Trees by Bill Hayes.

title: English National Opera Music Director to Depart
description: The English National Opera announced a surprise shakeup of its artistic administration on Thursday morning. Edward Gardner, the 39-year-old conductor who has been the companys music director since 2007, and whose work has been highly regarded critically and successful with audiences, will leave the company after the 2014-15 season to become chief conductor of the Bergen Philharmonic Orchestra in Norway. He will return to the company as a guest conductor in 2016.

title: Village Council in India Accused of Ordering Rape
description: NEW DELHI  A young woman in West Bengal was gang-raped this week on the order of a village council, to punish her for planning to marry a man from outside the village, according to the Indian police.

title: CreatureCast: Swimming With Cilia
description: Cilia are hairlike structures that project from cells. They can move in coordinated, rhythmic waves that propel organisms through water.

title: Moving, Without Feet to Do So
description: Cilia are hairlike structures that project from cells. They can move in coordinated, rhythmic waves that sweep fluid across the cell surface. If cells are fixed in place, this creates a current of fluid; the cilia that line our respiratory tract remove mucus and debris in this way. If the cilia are on the outside of the organism, the current they create can move the entire organism. This episode of CreatureCast presents two organisms that use cilia for locomotion. One is small and unicellular, the other is a much larger animal.

title: Video: Lupita Nyongo
description: Lupita Nyongo, the actress who plays the tortured slave Patsey in 12 Years a Slave, is this seasons classic ingenue: nominated for an Oscar for her very first feature film role. But as the Bagger writes Thursday, Ms. Nyongoo has at times felt overwhelmed by the red-carpet attention: I think everything in my life has prepared me for this, she said of playing Patsey, and then nothing has prepared me for the red carpet. Read what else she had to say here.

title: Image of the Day: January 23
Indictment Against Members of the Bonanno Family
description: Read the full indictment against several members of the Bonanno crime family.

title: Lenovo Sees Server Deal as Part of PC Plus Strategy
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  By agreeing to buy IBMs low-end server business for $2.3 billion, Lenovo of China instantly vaulted itself into the top ranks of the sector.

title: 36 Hours in Basel, Switzerland
description: For a few days each year, Basel briefly turns into the capital of the world  or at least of the art world. But even when the giant Art Basel fair isnt taking place (June 19 to 22 this year), this small city in northwest Switzerland offers plenty of pluses for fans of culture: wonderful museums, world-class architecture, quirky bars and polished restaurants, as well as easy access to France and Germany, its two neighbors in the so-called Dreilndereck, or three-country region. Fly into Basels airport, technically situated on French soil, and take the public transportation links out to Weil am Rhein, a German suburb. While many of the traditional timbered houses proudly display 13th-century construction dates, many of the best attractions arrived just in the past few years.

title: Behind Staid Steel, a Percolating Boardroom Drama
description: Updated, 12:57 p.m. | When Craig S. Shular, the chief executive of a small steel company called GrafTech International, retired on Tuesday, it looked like just another management changeover at a midmarket industrial company.

title: Putting New Spin on Sin City, Las Vegas Woos G.O.P. for 2016 Convention
description: LAS VEGAS  Almost every imaginable convention has found its way to the Strip. There have been gatherings devoted to electronics, pizza, computers, kitchen equipment and concrete  not to mention guns, butter and pornography. But in the more than a century that there has been a Las Vegas, the city has never hosted a national political convention. Republicans and Democrats have kept their distance from a place that proudly has claimed the mantle of Sin City.

title: Santander Consumer Shares Rise in Debut
description: Santander Consumer USAs new deal with Chrysler may have helped the companys debut on the New York Stock Exchange on Thursday, as shares rose 5 percent, closing at $25.20.

title: London Theater Journal: Stripped of Illusions, but Still Glittering and Gay
description: LONDON  This is not perhaps a moment  is it ever?  that you need to be reminded that the world can be cruel and dangerous. The various screens in your life  television, laptop, smartphone  will readily confirm this observation at the push of a button. The dire news they offer is unlikely to make you feel good.

title: Times Minute | Hillary's New 'Super PAC'
description: Also on the Minute, an ultimatum from Ukraine's opposition leaders, and Las Vegas courts the 2016 Republican National Convention.

title: Times Minute | Hillarys New Super PAC
description: In the Video

title: Justin Bieber Arrested in Miami Beach
description: Updated, 5:27 p.m. | He has been investigated in connection with an egging, spray-painted walls on several continents and lashed out at photographer.

title: Smut, Refreshed for a New Generation
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn.  Between a detention center and a post office here, theres a large, unremarkable building on a corner. Other than a few parked cars near a loading dock, theres not much life outside its off-white walls. But walk through the rickety front door and up the concrete stairs, and whats inside makes the old Times Square look like Mayberry: thousands of boxes filled to overflowing with sexually explicit films and artifacts.

title: Quantifying Europes Too Big to Fail Problem
description: Blistering complaints that banks are too big to fail are usually heard from the Occupy Wall Street side of the barricades.

title: Teaching Doctors the Art of Negotiation
description: By the time I rushed to his room, my patient had already ripped out his I.V., packed his knapsack and was making his way to the door, his hospital gown, on backward, flapping like a cape over the jeans he had hurriedly slipped on. He told me he felt fine now, after coming in feverish and sweating a few nights back, and despite his poorly controlled H.I.V. and the strong possibility that the lump in his neck was lymphoma. We had been waiting several days for the biopsy results, but now he had had enough.

title: Alana Zimmer Transforms Backstage at Jean Paul Gaultier
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures the transformations of the Spring 2014 Couture Collections in Paris. Here, the model Alana Zimmer before (left) and after (right) makeup by Lloyd Simmonds and hair and masks by Odile Gilbert.

title: Wheelies: The Fisker for American Workers Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Anatomy: Stranger by the Lake
description: The director Alain Guiraudie narrates a scene from his drama.

title: Sunshine May Benefit Blood Pressure
description: Exposure to sunlight may be a factor in lowering blood pressure.

title: How Our Hillary Clinton Cover Came About
description: When we created the cover of this Sundays magazine to accompany Amy Chozicks article about Hillary Rodham Clintons influence on the various people within her political universe, the immediate idea that came to mind was Clintons face embedded on a planet. . .

title: Colin Jost to Replace Seth Meyers on Weekend Update Segment
description: Lorne Michaels, executive producer of Saturday Night Live, on Thursday named Colin Jost to be the new co-anchor of the programs Weekend Update segment, replacing Seth Meyers.

title: Student Contest Winners | The 2013 Year in Rap
description: In December, we invited students to write raps about the news of 2013.

title: Today in Small Business: Founded During the Recession
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Healthier Options in the Air
description: Health-conscious fliers trapped at 30,000 feet no longer have to slim-pick between cans of Pringles and bags of Chex Mix, at least on Delta Air Lines. On transcontinental flights, the carrier recently added wraps made by Luvo, a packaged food maker that uses natural ingredients.

title: Penguin Announces a Makeover for Inspector Maigret
description: Sherlock Holmes isnt the only pipe-smoking classic detective getting a 21st-century reboot. Inspector Jules Maigret, the stolid Parisian gumshoe created by the Belgian writer Georges Simenon, is about to get his own brand makeover, thanks to a joint effort by Penguin Books and Penguin UK to release all 75 Maigret novels in new English versions by leading literary translators.

title: Long Live The Little Prince
description: The little-known New York roots of a French classic are unearthed in The Little Prince: A New York Story, a Morgan Library exhibition that explores the origins of the deceptively profound childrens book. Exiled from France after the German occupation, the author and pilot Antoine de Saint-Exupry spent the early 1940s in Manhattan, where he gave life to the story of a stranded pilots friendship with an otherworldly little boy. He wrote and illustrated The Little Prince in homes on Central Park South and Beekman Place and at a Long Island summer retreat and the 52nd Street studio of a friend that later became the French restaurant La Grenouille. The slim novella  which is being adapted for an upcoming 3-D animated film voiced by Rachel McAdams, James Franco and Marion Cotillard  celebrated its 70th anniversary last April and is Frances most-read work. But its undeniable New York influences are rarely explored.

title: Carlyle Co-Founders Formula for Success: Study the Humanities
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  David M. Rubenstein, the co-founder of the Carlyle Group, believes American students have lost a valuable skill that can help them succeed in business and life: critical thinking.

title: NT Live: Rory Kinnear in 'Hamlet'
description: Rory Kinnear as the title character in the National Theater's production of "Hamlet," which was first broadcast in December 2010.

title: Off Off Off Broadway (at Your Multiplex)
description: Coming soon to a movie theater near you: Orlando Bloom!

title: U.S. and Canada Urge New Safety Rules for Crude Oil Rail Shipments
description: In a joint move that highlighted growing concerns about the safety of crude oil transportation by rail, officials from the United States and Canada issued a series of recommendations on Thursday, including that oil-laden trains avoid populated and sensitive areas.

title: Line Cooks Pt
description: St. John Frizell runs a small bar and restaurant, Fort Defiance, in the Brooklyn waterfront neighborhood of Red Hook. He is a bartender of the sort often referred to as a mixologist and a restaurateur of skill and passion. His customers are local sharpies and art producers, date-nighters whove driven in from Park Slope, families with three generations in tow. The restaurant is a warm destination for those seeking a good drink and a simple meal amid people with similar desires.

title: Anatomy of a Scene: Video of Stranger by the Lake
description: The French director Alain Guiraudie has been making films for two decades, but his latest, Stranger by the Lake, is the only one to receive distribution in the United States. It opens Friday at the Film Society of Lincoln Center and the IFC Center. The Lincoln Center organization is also presenting a film series centered on the filmmaker, which will include a comprehensive survey of his work. In this video, he narrates a scene from his new film, where a playful lake swim turns into something much darker.

title: Excerpt: 'Outside Mullingar'
description: Brian F. OByrne and Debra Messing in a scene from John Patrick Shanleys play Outside Mullingar, on Broadway at the Samuel J. Friedman Theater.

title: Video From NASA on 10th Anniversary of Mars Rover Program
description: When the Mars rovers Spirit and Opportunity landed 10 years ago to explore the Martian surface and geology, they were supposed to spend only three months on the job. But, year after year, the rovers exceeded expectations as they steadily provided NASA scientists with evidence that Mars once had plentiful water at its surface.

title: Lessons From Blackstone for BlackRock
description: Is it time for BlackRock to revisit its Blackstone heritage?

title: In Lengthy Session, House Lives Up to Do-Nothing Label
description: The House held one of its longest sessions in months this week, even though no legislative business was accomplished.

title: Bacharach Reimagined Extends Run
description: The Off Broadway premiere of Whats It All About? Bacharach Reimagined will be extended a second time in its current run at New York Theater Workshop, the theater has announced.

title: A Loophole for Rapists Is Eliminated in Morocco
description: Two years after a 16-year-old Moroccan girl who was forced to marry the man accused of raping her committed suicide, opening a fierce debate in Morocco, the Islamist-led government has answered calls for change.

title: Modern Love | Star-Struck
description: An entertainment reporter infatuated with Hollywood's most famous starlets has difficulty finding real love.

title: Amazon Publishing Starts a Christian Imprint
description: Amazon Publishing on Thursday announced that its book empire was expanding to include Waterfall Press, a Christian imprint to provide spiritual refreshment and inspiration, according to a statement announcing the new imprint. The Waterfall titles, fiction and nonfiction in several genres, will be put out by Brilliance Publishing, part of the Amazon.com group of companies.

title: IBM Happy to Be Rid of Low-End Server Business
description: Lenovo of China, already the worlds largest maker of personal computers, has purchased from IBM one of the worlds largest computer server businesses, for what seems like a rock-bottom price. Lenovo gets market share in an area where it is a small player. IBM is shedding a business that was killing its profitability in higher-margin software and services.

title: U.S. Attorney Subpoenas Christies Campaign and New Jersey G.O.P.
description: Federal prosecutors in New Jersey have issued grand jury subpoenas to Gov. Chris Christies re-election campaign and to the state Republican Party as part of a preliminary inquiry into accusations that aides to Mr. Christie shut down access lanes to the George Washington Bridge as political retribution, the lawyer for the campaign and the party said Thursday.

title: Bristling Interrupts Amity in Panel on U.S.-China-Europe Ties
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  When asked whether China, the United States and Europe can all play nicely together, attendees of the World Economic Forum would be expected to be largely optimistic, even if they disagreed on a few particulars.

title: If Justin Bieber Werent Famous
description: A foreign national living in the United States on a work visa is arrested on suspicion of driving under the influence of marijuana, alcohol and prescription drugs, while drag racing in a residential area. Given the climate of hostility toward immigrants in many parts of the country, and the Obama administrations love affair with deportation, youd expect him to be sitting in a holding cell awaiting a one-way trip out of the country.

title: Administration Is Finalizing Budget
description: President Obama will send his annual budget to Congress on March 4, about a month late because of lawmakers tardy agreement on the current fiscal years federal spending.

title: Rene Martins Pregnancy Costs
description: Rene Martin and her husband must negotiate all costs with the hospital, procedure by procedure.

title: Reading Club | Our Favorite Comments on Invisible Child: Dasanis Homeless Life
description: Sadness, anger, hope and the desire to stop talking and start doing something about homelessness: these were the dominant reactions to the series Invisible Child: Dasanis Homeless Life among the 190 students who participated in our most recent installment of The Learning Networks Reading Club.

title: Stolen Landolfi Violin Is Recovered
description: A rare violin by the Italian luthier Carlo Ferdinando Landolfi, one of three instruments stolen last week from a house in Abcoude, a small town in the Netherlands, was recovered on Thursday, when two men tried to sell it to a violin maker in The Hague, a Dutch news site reported. The violin dates from 1731, although there are few extant Landolfi instruments from before around 1750. It is said to be worth about $205,000. The owner of the violin shop, who had heard about the burglary, notified the police when he was offered the violin. The police arrested the two men, but the other two stolen violins have not yet been found.

title: How Hollywood Ruined Me for Romance
description: I once fondled Angelina Jolies elbow.

title: Comparing Two Operations
description: Like many medical products or procedures, joint implants cost far more in the United States than in many other developed countries.

title: 3 Dead in Clash at Police Station in Western China, Report Says
description: BEIJING  Three ethnic Uighurs were shot and killed last week outside a police station in Chinas far west Xinjiang region during a fight with security guards who blocked them from entering the building, Radio Free Asia reported Thursday.

title: Blues Help Honor Teammates Sister
description: The St. Louis Blues, making their only trip to the New York metropolitan area this season, arrived Tuesday. They played the Devils in Newark that night, faced the Rangers in Manhattan on Thursday night and were to play the Islanders on Long Island on Saturday afternoon.

title: Yemen Takes a Step Toward Law Ending Child Marriage
description: Yemen has taken a step toward outlawing child marriages.

title: A Soup Saved From the Cold
description: First comes the giant bowl of broth, sallow, glazed with oil and flecked with what looks like soot. Then the waiter, holding a small saucer in one hand, tips in a raw quail egg.

title: Living With Cancer: Life of the Party
description: The prospect of a party frightened me  probably because the enforced isolation of cancer treatments has rendered me hypersensitive. It was raining outside and festivities would not begin until after 8 p.m. But my husband and I had promised to attend the celebration of a book publication. So we dragged ourselves to Judith and Aidans house where I hoped to find a comfortable chair in which I would not look like the battle-ax at Mrs. Dalloways party whom everyone had thought long dead.

title: E.V.s Could Be Key Part of a Changing Electrical Grid
description: Electricity, like gasoline, is mostly available at whenever the customer wants it, in whatever quantity is needed. But as their numbers increase, electric cars could potentially demand enormous amounts of power. Meeting that demand at a time when the electric system is already fully loaded could be expensive if it requires construction of new power plants  specially purposed for handling peak demand  that would be needed only a few hundred hours a year.

title: Sikhs Fight Back Against New Pentagon Dress Code
description: WASHINGTON  American Sikh leaders, disappointed that new Pentagon dress code requirements released on Wednesday do not go as far as the Sikhs would like, are turning to Congress to increase the pressure on the military.

title: An Online Test Suggests You Could Have A.D.H.D., Too
description: Even some of the fields longtime advocates say the zeal to find and treat every A.D.H.D. child has led to too many people with scant symptoms receiving the diagnosis and medication.

title: A Pregnant Teenager, Still Hopeful Against Long Odds
description: When you can only see where you have already been, what do you aim for?

title: Seen on the Street | Outside the Spring/Summer 2014 Paris Couture Shows
description: A glimpse at what ladies are wearing this season.

title: Lis New Role in a Grand Slam Final: Favorite
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  For the third time in the last four years, Li Na is one of the last two women standing at the Australian Open.

title: Wedding Q. and A.
description: Reciprocity and Guest Lists

title: The Weekly Health Quiz
description: In the news: smoking, fishy fish oils and highway safety.

title: Key Witness Says Leader of SAC Was F.B.I. Target
description: The man whose shadow has been hanging over the insider trading trial of Mathew Martoma, the former SAC Capital Advisors trader, took center stage on Thursday when the prosecutions top witness said F.B.I. agents told him the governments true target was Steven A. Cohen, SACs billionaire founder.

title: Art Meets Environmental Activism in The Crossroads Project
description: This months blast of arctic air may have roused climate-change skeptics. But the composer Laura Kaminsky and the painter Rebecca Allan were unfazed. Holed up in their apartment in Riverdale in the Bronx on one of the coldest days in decades, these longtime artist-activists were doing what came naturally: fighting the planets warming.

title: From Upstate to the West Village
description: Back when Phyllis Erikson, formerly Phyllis Ricciardi, was growing up on Staten Island, there was nothing there except houses, she said, so we came into the city a lot. She remembers cutting class at Curtis High School for an adventure in Greenwich Village.

title: The Gun Report: January 23, 2014
description: Republican South Carolina Senator Lindsey Graham was in the state capital on Tuesday advocating for child gun locks, just as lawmakers there are contemplating two bills aimed at increasing gun rights.

title: Savannah Starts a Bike Program
description: Savannahs Chatham Area Transit (CAT) will officially begin its new public bicycle sharing program on Friday, making it one of a growing number of major metropolitan areas in the United States to do so in recent years, and the first in Georgia.

title: On the Amend
description: Years ago, as an unmarried woman, I lived with a man but had a brief affair with a younger man while we were together. My partner never knew about it  really  and we stayed together for many years. Ultimately, we broke up but remain friends. Recently, my former partner received an amends letter from my young fling, who is now in a 12-step recovery program. (Apologizing to those you have wronged is one of the steps.) In his letter, he outed me by apologizing for our affair. This has caused significant awkwardness in my friendship with my former lover. Does the flings recovery trump my private life?

title: A Fearsome Portrayal of a Powerful, Angry Man
description: Here is a man that you can open yourself up to and be filled to bursting, Rose Maxson says in August Wilsons Fences, recalling her reaction to meeting her future husband, Troy. Here is a man that can fill all them empty spaces in her heart. Indeed, Troy is a physical and emotional titan. Theres no empty space he cant fill, except for the one inside his own soul.

title: Argentinas Currency Falls Sharply Against the Dollar, Stirring Inflation Fears
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Argentinas currency, the peso, plunged more than 8 percent on Thursday against the dollar after the countrys central bank tried to stem a decline in international reserves. The sharp decline, with the peso dropping the most since Argentinas 2002 financial crisis, raises concerns that inflation could accelerate even further.

title: At World Economic Forum, Even the Serious-Minded Like to Party
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  For a certain crowd, the big topic in Davos this year has nothing to do with Syrian peace talks, cybersecurity issues or other geopolitical gravitas.

title: Curtain Call | Paris Couture Collections
description: To mark the conclusion of the Paris Couture collections, we catalog the bows  some proud, some playful, some humble, some all of the above  of 11 fashion visionaries.

title: Shanghai Test Scores and the Mystery of the Missing Children
description: Is the education system in Shanghai, Chinas largest and most internationalized city, really a paradigm of academic excellence and educational equity, or does its stellar performance mask a grimmer reality, in which one of the worlds largest barriers to education opportunities plagues tens of thousands of its residents?

title: Interview: Nick Cave
description: Nick Cave, the subject of the documentary 20,000 Days on Earth, speaks with Melena Ryzik at the Sundance Film Festival.

title: Contrasting Big and Little at a Tapas Bar
description: With its warm, cozy atmosphere, Plancha Tapas and Wine Bar is the kind of place where diners settle in enjoying table conversation as they sip their wine, nibble cheeses and meats from overflowing boards, and anticipate the often innovative small plates to come.

title: Whom to Follow, Mr. Commissioner? Dont Mind if We Do!
description: Welcome to Twitter, Police Commissioner William J. Bratton  or shall we say @CommissBratton. Soon youll forget how you ever wasted time without it.

title: Barcelona President Quits Amid Lawsuit
description: The president of F.C. Barcelona, Sandro Rosell, resigned on Thursday, a day after a Spanish court accepted a lawsuit accusing him of misappropriating funds as part of the $78 million transfer of the Brazilian soccer star Neymar last summer.

title: Introducing Erica Bell and Katie Finnegan, New Business Group Members
description: Three new business owners have joined the She Owns It business group. This post introduces two of them.

title: New Enlistee to Ezra Kleins Journalism Venture
description: Matt Yglesias, an influential commentator on politics and economics, will leave Slate to join the new venture of the departing Washington Post analyst Ezra Klein, Slates editor, David Plotz, said Thursday.

title: Deficits and Conservative Reform
description: Turning from Mike Needhams critique to the other end of the political spectrum, I see that Jonathan Chait used my column on reform conservatism to take a break from his usual pattern of explaining why the Republican Party is necessarily a tool of plutocratic interests, now and forever, world without end, and to allow that yes, maybe the next Republican president might do something that might conceivably benefit someone other than the super-rich  but that this would only happen in a replay of the George W. Bush administration, where Republicans learned to stop worrying and love deficit spending once again:

title: Video: Nick Cave at Sundance
description: PARK CITY, Utah  Sundance is as much a home for musical performances as movies. At this years festival there have been buzzed-about shows by Rick Ross; Damon Albarn of Blur and Gorillaz; Stuart Murdoch, of Belle & Sebastian, who made his directorial debut here with God Help the Girl, a musical about the indie scene in Glasgow; and Jenny Lewis, also here with a film, Song One, the Anne Hathaway vehicle for which Ms. Lewis, late of Rilo Kiley, co-wrote music. And Nick Cave, the Australian rocker, is the subject of an unusual documentary, 20,000 Days on Earth.

title: The Thinking Persons White Wine
description: If youre looking for a winter-weight white wine, one thats substantial enough to warm the insides yet elegant enough to dance intimately with many different foods, Ive got a name for you: Savennires.

title: A Code of Honor, Not a Referee, Keeps Curlers Honest
description: LAS VEGAS  The curling stones were aligned, brooms were in hand, and the three ice sheets were spritzed with deionized water. Forty-eight curlers were set to compete in the World Continental Cup here last weekend, a critical warm-up for many who were bound for the Winter Olympics in Sochi, Russia.

title: Korean Dishes, Mild, Medium and Fiery
description: In the space once occupied by the Aria and Kang Suh restaurants, Korea Garden continues to bring to lower Westchester the flavors of increasingly popular Korean food in a vast, roomy dining hall.

title: Advertising Disorder
description: Even some of the fields longtime advocates say the zeal to find and treat every A.D.H.D. child has led to too many people with scant symptoms receiving the diagnosis and medication.

title: Neiman Marcus Data Breach Worse Than First Said
description: The theft of consumer data from Neiman Marcus appears far deeper than had been disclosed originally, with the luxury retailer now saying that hackers invaded its systems for several months in a breach that involved 1.1 million credit and debit cards.

title: Police Commissioners Tweet Sends a Message of Contrast
description: The messages appeared unexpectedly, live missives posted online from inside one of the New York Police Departments most cloistered gatherings: a weekly, closed-door CompStat meeting at 1 Police Plaza.

title: Microsoft Earnings Illustrate Move to Devices and Services From Software
description: SEATTLE  A picture of the new Microsoft, one transformed from a software factory into a maker of devices and online services, came into sharper focus on Thursday.

title: Larry Poons: New Paintings
description: Danese/Corey

title: Davina Semo: Ruder Forms Survive
description: Marlborough Chelsea

title: Jackie Nickerson: Terrain
description: Jack Shainman

title: American Beauty
description: Susan Inglett Gallery

title: Simplest Means
description: Jeff Bailey Gallery

title: Whats Behind Time Warner Cables Response to Charters Offer
description: Time Warner Cables response to Charter Communications $37.8 billion offer is all about subtlety.

title: An Office, and Its Staff, at the Edge
description: They say politics makes strange bedfellows, but surely thats because politics is just another kind of job. For most of us, the strange bedfellows were most likely to encounter are the ones at the office or the plant or wherever it is we happen to work.

title: Pictures of the Day: Syria and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Syria, South Africa, Ukraine and Virginia.

title: Paris Couture Week: Elie Saab Spring/Summer 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Couture Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: Robert Browning to Present New Series of Concerts
description: Robert Browning, the entrepreneur who almost single-handedly created and filled New Yorkers passion for world music, had an idea in 2011 that it might be fitting to retire. He was 70, and had presented over 1,800 concerts of virtually every imaginable variety of ethnic music, first for the Alternative Center (which was later called the Alternative Museum) and later at the World Music Institute, which he founded in 1986.

title: Microsoft Suggests Wider Options for Foreign Data
description: For years, Microsoft has let its customers in Europe, including businesses and organizations, keep their online data close to them. The company operates big data centers in Amsterdam and Dublin for that very purpose.

title: F.T.C. Chides Nissan Over Deceptive Truck Ad
description: Everyone knows by now  if there ever was a question  that cars cant jump on trains. It says so right at the bottom of the screen during those Nissan Rogue ads, which also carry the label, Fantasy. Do not attempt.

title: Brevan Howard, Europes Largest Hedge Fund, Apologizes for Poor Results
description: For at least one hedge fund, sorry does not seem to be the hardest word.

title: Sounds to Complement Red and White at Long Island Wineries
description: The weather was frigid and the vines around the Raphael winery in Peconic were bare, but flames crackled in a fireplace inside the spacious beamed tasting room as more than 100 people gathered on a recent Saturday afternoon to sip wine and listen to Rob Europe, a guitarist and singer, perform along with several other musicians.

title: A Class Where Recess Never Ends
description: FORGET about the treadmill, the stair climber, the boot camp torture sessions. Exercise should be fun. To prove it, some fitness centers have introduced recess classes that aim to make a trip to the gym less of a chore and more of a romp on the playground.

title: Live From Canada, Its Alice Munro
description: Two literary giants loomed over the crowd at Symphony Space on Wednesday night, and I dont mean that metaphorically. Alice Munro and Margaret Atwood conversed on a large screen during an installment of the Selected Shorts series devoted to Ms. Munro, who won the Nobel Prize in Literature in October.

title: With No Regrets, Living Her Life as a Bossa Nova
description: Are you always this happy? Rodolfo asks Gloria, shortly after catching her eye. They are at a nightclub where middle-aged residents of Santiago, Chile, dance and flirt, and where Gloria, in her 50s and long divorced, occasionally goes to attract the attention of a silver-haired Romeo. Rodolfo, who has a kind, crumpled face and a winningly uncertain manner, makes Gloria laugh with this pickup line. No, she says, sometimes in the mornings she is sad, and in the afternoons, too.

title: Dont Expect Job Data Alone to Persuade Fed on Rates
description: Just over a year ago, the Federal Reserve changed its guidance on how long it planned to keep interest rates very low.

title: The Look of Afrofuturism in Harlem
description: A certain strain of late-20th-century pop music, pioneered by artists like Sun Ra, George Clinton and Lee (Scratch) Perry, drew on science fiction, electronic instruments and experiences of racial marginalization to forge an aesthetic called Afrofuturism.

title: A History of Misunderstandings, Lies and Violence
description: Gen. Muhammad Zia ul-Haq, the wily military dictator who ruled Pakistan for much of the 1980s, was famous for, among other things, his gleaming teeth, which he used to dazzle visitors with a smile that left them guessing about his true intentions.

title: Complaints About Closings
description: If you, like so many others, have a gripe about your last mortgage closing, federal regulators want to hear about it.

title: Food Fresh and Local at Farmers Markets, Well After the Frost
description: Kendrya Close approached the first installment of the Morris County Winter Farmers Market with a little trepidation.

title: Walmart Fund to Support U.S. Manufacturing
description: WASHINGTON  William S. Simon, chief executive of Walmart for the United States, said on Thursday at the United States Conference of Mayors that the company was providing a $10 million fund to promote American manufacturing in a public push to sell more American-made products.

title: Acrostic
description: Acrostic puzzle for January 26, 2014

title: Deep Reader
description: Rarely attempted, and still more rarely successful, is the bibliomemoir  a subspecies of literature combining criticism and biography with the intimate, confessional tone of autobiography.

title: If It Pleases the Gods
description: The myths of Greek antiquity are shot through with stories of murder, rape, incest and cannibalism. On Mount Lykaion (wolf mountain) in Arcadia, annual traditions honoring Zeus re-enacted a seminal rite of human sacrifice. In Platos Republic, the casual observation is made that in Athens anyone who wished to injure an enemy could commission a magician to cast a harmful spell; for with their incantations and magic formulas they say they can persuade the gods to serve their will. Similarly, archaeologists have discovered grotesque little voodoo-like figures bristling with spikes, and curse tablets that were inscribed with malevolent prayers during this Golden Age of humanism and reason. Spirits and dark ancestral memories haunted the landscape of enlightened Athens.

title: With Brother in Big Game, Eli Manning Plays Concierge
description: What do two N.F.L. quarterbacks who happen to be brothers talk about when one of them is playing in the Super Bowl at the others home stadium?

title: The Big Uneasy
description: As a young boy, Scott Stossel, the editor of The Atlantic magazine, worried every time his parents left: Theyd die, he would think, or else abandon him. Years later, wild with stage fright, he hid in a bathroom to avoid getting a trophy on the dais. By adulthood, Stossel was saddled with often incapacitating nerves. His new book, My Age of Anxiety, uses his experience as a guide through the disorder, tracing its legacy in thought and culture. He seeks to understand what anxiety is and what it means; he probes the conditions ambiguities. The result is ambitious, and bravely intimate: a ruminative book that often breaks into a thrilling intellectual chase.

title: The Golden Girls, in a Shade of Pink
description: To feel the love for The Golden Girls, one of the best-written and -acted sitcoms of the 80s and 90s, you have only to see the capacity crowd gathered for Thank You for Being a Friend, at the Laurie Beechman Theater on Wednesdays. A woman at my table announced before the show that she could recite whole passages from the series. So you have to wonder what that audience takes away from this drag parody, directed by Nick Brennan, which is so raunchy and overwrought, its hard to call it affectionate.

title: Landlords Seek the Upper Hand
description: Ask Real Estate is a new weekly online column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: Mirror, Mirror: Sundance Hits 30
description: PARK CITY, Utah  It was a blast from the indie past to watch Richard Linklater soak in the applause of the Sundance Film Festival audience on Sunday after the premiere of his transporting new movie, Boyhood. Mr. Linklaters first official Sundance appearance was in 1991, with Slacker, one of the emblematic titles of the American independent scene of that period. Since then, he has repeatedly returned to this festival, which, like Mr. Linklater, has pushed boundaries, experimented with form and transcended setbacks. When he was called to the stage by John Cooper, the festivals director, it felt as if Sundance was both mining its history and looking ahead to a new age.

title: Robots in Attendance
description: Using cheaper parts and improved technology, some enterprising couples are rewiring robots to make an entrance at their weddings.

title: Pleasures of Utility, Comfort and Decoration
description: Polar vortex or not, a great many artworks, artifacts and the like have taken up temporary residence on the Upper East Side over the last few days. Cozily ensconced in the Park Avenue Armory, they form the Winter Antiques Show, which is celebrating its 60th anniversary.

title: An Elegant Space, Cocktails to Match
description: Del Posto, the Italian restaurant owned by Mario Batali, Lidia Bastianich and Joe Bastianich, is inarguably spacious: 18-foot-high ceilings, 11,000 square feet for dining, only 35 tables in the main rooms, all of them seemingly occupied throughout the night by guests venturing through tasting menus of five and eight courses.

title: Heritage, Still Hackish
description: Suddenly the buzz is that the Heritage Foundation is coming back to its senses. The supposed evidence of this shift is the foundations decision to hire Stephen Moore, formerly of the WSJ editorial page, as its chief economist.

title: Pottery, the Paranormal and Other Visions
description: New Yorks art fairs are often filled with work by contemporary artists, but here are two that artists themselves might like to attend. With objects culled from attics, forgotten storerooms and the bottom of the sea, or thrown more recently by potters, the fairs this year also seem marked by the marvelous, fantastical and paranormal.

title: In Ukraine, the Chilling Winds of Change
description: The photographer Boris Mikhailov, born in Ukraine in 1938, has become widely known in late career for his wry and wrenching pictures of post-Soviet life. His series Case History (seen at MoMA in 2011) unnerved viewers with large-scale color portraits of homeless people in Ukraine, pictures that seemed to violate the codes of serious documentary photography. The subjects flashed naked flesh to the camera and had been paid and fed by the photographer.

title: A Sensualist Finds Religion
description: Antonio Canova (1757-1822) produced some of the sexiest sculptures in the history of European art. A good example is in the Metropolitan Museum of Arts European sculpture court: Reclining Naiad, a life-size marble representation of a fit young woman lying naked on a sheet over a bearskin, her most impressive feature being her exquisitely supple backside. But if thats how you think of this artist, you may be shocked by the museums exhibition Antonio Canova: The Seven Last Works.

title: Times Minute | Real-Life 'Goodfellas'
description: Also on the Minute, collecting cash in protests in Thailand and an overachieving Mars rover.

title: Times Minute | Real-Life Goodfellas
description: In the Video

title: 9/11 Museum to Charge $24 Admission
description: The foundation that oversees the National September 11 Memorial Museum at the World Trade Center voted on Thursday to charge visitors $24 for admission to the underground museum that is scheduled to open this spring. The above-ground memorial that occupies the footprints of the twin towers  and has hosted 11.5 million visitors since it opened two years ago  will continue to be free.

title: Exhibitions Final Stop After Cold War Shutdown
description: A short-lived traveling art show that caused an outcry in 1946 but that now looks tame has been meticulously reinstalled with documentation about how government maneuverings shut it down. Art Interrupted: Advancing American Art and the Politics of Cultural Diplomacy, an exhibition of paintings that the United States government briefly owned at the outset of the Cold War, opens on Saturday at the Georgia Museum of Art in Athens in the final stop of a tour.

title: After a Failed Tender Offer, McKesson Clinches Deal
description: After a failed bid to gain control of the German pharmaceutical wholesaler Celesio, the health care company McKesson Corporation announced on Thursday that it had gained enough shareholder support to push a deal through.

title: McMorris Rodgers to Deliver Republican Response to State of the Union
description: Republicans have selected their official responder to President Obamas State of the Union address on Tuesday night: Representative Cathy McMorris Rodgers, a member of the party leadership from Washington State.

title: Seized by Nazis, Now for Sale
description: First came the book, and now, on the eve of The Monuments Men the movie, Sothebys in New York is selling three paintings recovered by this fabled group of experts who rescued artworks stolen or confiscated by the Nazis during World War II.

title: Why So Little on the March for Life in Thursdays Times?
description: Hundreds, if not thousands, of New Yorkers  many of them Catholics  piled onto buses in the freezing cold and headed down to Washington this week for the 41st annual March for Life, the worlds largest anti-abortion gathering.

title: T. Rowe Price Wants Time Warner Cable and Charter to Talk
description: T. Rowe Price, one of the biggest investors in the country, wants Time Warner Cable and Charter Communications to sit down at the bargaining table.

title: The Grammys, a Night for Cheers (and Often Gasps)
description: THE Grammy Awards are so predictable. Except when theyre unpredictable.

title: Sundance Q. and A. | Shailene Woodley
description: This series introduces some of the standout, rising stars from the 2014 Sundance Film Festival.

title: An Ex-Byrds Album Is Given New Flight
description: Some albums find an unexpected afterlife. They may have been ignored or reviled upon release; they may have been out of sync with the trend of the moment; they may have had bad business luck. Then, years or decades later, word of mouth and word of Internet start to bubble up from musicians, collectors, longtime fans and new acquaintances. It doesnt hurt if the songs are oblique and tormented, if the album and musician have troubled back stories or if newer music has vindicated sounds that went unappreciated at the time.

title: Mix and Match for a Savory Taste of Korea
description: Yama Dora, a neighborhood Korean restaurant and sushi bar in East Haven, specializes in Korean barbecue, which is an event as much as a dish. Your choice of beef, pork, chicken or shrimp, soaked in a robust marinade, is grilled in the center of the table. A collection of flavorful side dishes (banshan) such as kimchi, pickled daikon and sesame-and-garlic-sauted spinach is brought to the table along with the barbecue. Diners wrap the grilled meat in lettuce leaves with a dab of pungent and salty fermented bean paste, and share the side dishes.

title: The Bahamas on the Radar
description: For several years, wealthy New Yorkers, even those relatively unscathed by the financial crisis, seemed to put their second-home dreams on hold. But as the real estate market in the city has strengthened, many of these high-end buyers have started shopping for beachfront retreats again.

title: Dangerous Undertow in a Cruisers Haven
description: Not every mystery is a whodunit. In Alain Guiraudies Stranger by the Lake, a murder takes place early on, in full view of the audience and a crucial witness, a young man named Franck (Pierre Deladonchamps). Franck has spent the afternoon  as he apparently spends many afternoons  on a stretch of beach that serves as a gay cruising spot. Earlier, he had a brief flirtation with a muscular, mustachioed swimmer, only to be shooed away by someone who seemed to be a jealous boyfriend. Now, from behind a scrim of trees, just before darkness falls, Franck sees the two men together in the water and watches as horseplay turns to homicide.

title: At Times, Nice Guys Finish Second
description: Voters will learn a lot about Mitt Romney from Mitt, a new documentary having its premiere on Netflix on Friday.

title: Play with a Friend
description: Solve Crosswords with a friend

title: Still Revealing New Facets, After Sparkling for Half a Century
description: George Balanchines full-length Jewels, new in 1967, remains a perfect education in the art of ballet  in particularthe diversity of ballet as he refashioned it in the mid-20th century. I go on learning from it myself. Part of its fascination is that its three parts  Emeralds (to pieces by Faur), Rubies (to Stravinskys Capriccio for Piano and Orchestra) and Diamonds (to the last four movements of Tchaikovskys Third Symphony)  are so unalike. Emeralds is Romantic-medievalist, French, seeming to occur in a large garden, deep glade or forest. Rubies is 20th-century American, indeed New York: merry, hard, dense, high-rise. Diamonds is imperial Russian, courtly.

title: What Would Truly Honest Movie Posters Look Like?
description: Dont Torrent It. Dont Watch It On Your Phone

title: A Duo Face Off While Staying on the Same Page
description: Brad Mehldau, the casually graceful post-bop pianist, and Mark Guiliana, the gracefully casual deep-groove drummer, faced each other across the stage at the Highline Ballroom on Wednesday night, as if to give shape to the idea of back-and-forth exchange. Things didnt shake out that neatly or equitably. But the duo, which goes by Mehliana, delivered a credible mash-up of sensibilities in the show, an experiment in the emerging field of beat science and a treatise on the ageless art of tension and release.

title: I Now Present Mr. and Mrs. Jetson
description: In the world of the future, science-fiction movies tell us, robots may do just about everything. But you might figure that the business of marrying would be an exception and remain the province of the heart and soul rather than of sensors and circuit boards.

title: Events in Westchester for Jan. 26 to Feb. 1
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: Swashbuckling Beneath a Not-So-Jolly Roger
description: With Michael Bays name in the credits as an executive producer, youd expect Black Sails to be big and loud, if nothing else. And this new pirate drama, beginning Saturday on Starz, does boast an imposing 140-foot facsimile of a sailing ship, which makes a particular impression when its beached for some early-18th-century nautical maintenance.

title: With Strain on Electric Grid, a Push to Prioritize Conservation
description: The polar vortex that swept across much of the nation early this month knocked two North Texas power plants offline just as residents began turning up the heat and revving up power use. Grid operators fixed the problem, but not before warning consumers that they were a step away from resorting to shutdowns.

title: Hispanic Groups Start $5 Million Voter Registration Drive
description: WASHINGTON  The nations largest Hispanic group kicked off an effort on Thursday to register a quarter of a million new Hispanic voters by the midterm elections in November.

title: This Week's Movies: Jan. 24, 2014
description: The New York Times movie critics on "Gloria," "Visitors" and "Stranger by the Lake."

title: Bradley Cooper Will Play Elephant Man on Broadway
description: Bradley Cooper, whose movie career has boomed since he was last on Broadway, will return to the New York stage this fall in the title role of The Elephant Man, the shows producer confirmed on Thursday.

title: Testimony of a Cleareyed Witness
description: Color and class are still the great divides in American culture, and few artists have surveyed them as subtly and incisively as Carrie Mae Weems, whose traveling 30-year retrospective has arrived at the Guggenheim Museum. From its early candid family photographs, through series of pictures that track the Africa in African-America, to work that explores, over decades, what it means to be black, female and in charge of your life, its a ripe, questioning and beautiful show.

title: Theater Listings for Jan. 24-30
description: Theater

title: Events on Long Island for Jan. 26 to Feb. 1
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: Google Tools for Globetrotters
description: O.K., Glass, I said, peering at a photo of a Spanish street sign through Google Glass, the lens-less augmented-reality glasses. Translate this. I gently tapped, then swiped my pointer finger along a narrow touch pad on the side of the Glass frame as if scrolling through the contact list on my iPhone  only I was scrolling through the names of romance languages, each of which appeared on a tiny virtual screen in the distance, in line with my right eye. When the word Spanish materialized, I tapped the side of the glasses to select it, a process you need do only once to lock in a language for an entire trip. Seconds later, the street sign was in English: Attention, area of construction. No trespassing.

title: Capturing the New York of the 1960s and 70s
description: If we had known that the scrawny guy onstage at that Greenwich Village folk club might someday amount to something, wed have all been there, camera in hand, to document the event. But we didnt, so we werent. Fred W. McDarrah, on the other hand, made it a point to be there: when Bob Dylan first performed in New York; when Jack Kerouac and Allen Ginsberg held court at house parties in Greenwich Village, or Andy Warhol at his studio, the Factory; when the hippies or the gay liberation movement found their voices; when downtown New York was the incubator for the cultural movements that shook the world. Mr. McDarrah, who died in 2007, was the first photo editor and for decades the only staff photographer of The Village Voice. He had a front-row seat for multiple revolutions, with access that photographers today cannot imagine. You could be standing three feet from Jimi Hendrix at a cocktail party and start shooting, said Mr. McDarrahs son Patrick, 47. You could never just do that now with Jay Z. Back then, said Mr. McDarrahs other son, Timothy, 51, Wed answer the phone and it would be, Hi, its Andy, is Freddie there?

title: Should Pope Francis Rethink Abortion?
description: Pope Francis has raised expectations of a turn away from the dogmatic intransigence that has long cast a pall over the religious life of many Roman Catholics. His question Who am I to judge? suggested a new attitude toward homosexuality, and he is apparently willing to consider allowing the use of contraceptives to prevent sexually transmitted diseases. But his position on what has come to be the hierarchys signature issue  abortion  seems unyielding.
