description: florid \flor-d, flr-\ adjective

title: Top Republicans to Call for Legal Status for Some Immigrants
description: WASHINGTON  The House Republican leaderships broad framework for overhauling the nations immigration laws will call this week for a path to legal status  but not citizenship  for many of the 11 million adult immigrants who are in the country illegally, according to aides who have seen the partys statement of principles. For immigrants brought to the United States illegally as young children, the Republicans would offer a path to citizenship.

title: Hong Kong Man Seeking to Issue Book About Xi Is Held in China
description: HONG KONG  Three months ago, Yiu Mantin, a retired engineer from Hong Kong, crossed into mainland China for a short visit, as he had done many times. But this time he disappeared into the hands of the police, and his family and friends believe he was singled out because of his second career  book publishing  and especially because he planned to distribute a withering denunciation of President Xi Jinping.

title: Whats On Tuesday
description: 6 P.M. (Starz Cinema) ORANGES AND SUNSHINE (2011) Emily Watson, above, portrays Margaret Humphreys, a social worker in Nottingham, England, who, starting in 1986, exposed the deportation of as many as 130,000 children from orphanages and group homes in Britain to Australia between the 1940s and 1967. One deportee, now an adult, recalls that he was told, at 10, that he was being sent to a sunny paradise where he could pick oranges off trees. Instead, many of the youngsters found themselves forced into hard labor and enduring physical cruelty and sexual abuse at places like the Bindoon Boys Town, presided over by the Christian Brothers, a Roman Catholic order. The victims were informed that their parents were dead, while their parents  mainly unwed mothers deemed unfit  were told that their children had been placed for adoption in better homes. This film presents a chilling portrait of bureaucratic stonewalling and denial as Margaret presents her evidence to politicians who meet her accusations with indifference and skepticism, express only a vague regret and assume no responsibility, Stephen Holden wrote in The New York Times about this drama, directed by Jim Loach from Ms. Humphreyss 1994 book, Empty Cradles.

title: Pete Seeger, Champion of Folk Music and Social Change, Dies at 94
description: Pete Seeger, the singer, folk-song collector and songwriter who spearheaded an American folk revival and spent a long career championing folk music as both a vital heritage and a catalyst for social change, died on Monday in Manhattan. He was 94.

title: How Rahul Gandhi Did in His First TV Interview
description: NEW DELHI  It was a highly anticipated TV eventon Mondaynight: Rahul Gandhi, the leader of the Congress Partys election campaign, sat down with Arnab Goswami of Times Now, the mostaggressive journalist on an English-language television network in India, for the politicians first formal TV interview.

title: Mass Slaughter of Vulnerable Shark Species in China, Wildlife Group Says
description: Tipped off by a Chinese wildlife protection group that a shark slaughterhouse of vulnerable species, including the whale shark, was operating in a town in Zhejiang Province on Chinas eastern seaboard, the activists Alex Hofford and Paul Hilton traveled there to take a look.

title: Former Military Chief Refuses to Testify in Bosnia Genocide Trial
description: LONDON  Ratko Mladic, the former Bosnian Serb military commander facing war crimes charges in The Hague, refused to testify on Tuesday at the trial of his former political ally, Radovan Karadzic, saying he did not wish to prejudice his own case and was medically unfit to give evidence.

title: Test Yourself | History, Jan. 28
description: Take the Quiz

title: 6 Qs About the News | South Bronx Students May Have Found Site of Slave Burial Ground
description: In South Bronx Students May Have Found Site of Slave Burial Ground, Lisa W. Foderaro writes about a student project that may have uncovered forgotten history.

title: Building a Harley Faster
description: While working the line at Harley-Davidsons factory in York, Pa., Mark Dettinger noticed a small problem. The plastic piece that held electrical parts to the front of a motorcycle, a piece about the size of a hardcover book, wasnt fitting correctly. Every time a new bike came down the line, it took a few extra shoves to push it into place. In fact, it took an extra 1.2 seconds. But Dettinger, who had spent some 20 years at the York plant, knew that every second counted. With 400 motorcycles built each shift, on two shifts a day, an extra 1.2 seconds per bike added up to 2,200 lost bikes annually. Millions could be lost in revenue. Maybe it wasnt such a small problem.

title: 1964: Sen. Smith Becomes First Woman To Seek Presidential Nomination
description: Margaret Chase Smith announces her run for the presidency. Northeast Historic Film

title: Making Pictures, Finding Solutions in Nicaragua
description: The health crisis Ed Kashi encountered among sugar cane workers in Chichigalpa, Nicaragua, last year was stark. Over the course of two weeks he spent in the area, there was a funeral every day for workers who had died of chronic kidney disease. Though he had gone there on a commission for a nongovernmental organization that was helping the workers, he left convinced that he had to continue his documentation on his own.

title: The Crowdfunding Site Indiegogo Raises $40 Million
description: Several years ago, the notion of crowdfunding  asking strangers to contribute money to help and idea or project become a tangible reality  seemed like a far-fetched way to successfully and repeatedly finance creative and business ventures.

title: Who Does Hip-Hop Belong To?
description: After Sundays Grammy Awards, Macklemore sent a public apology via text to Kendrick Lamar, whom he had just beaten out for best rap album. Macklemore, who is white, bested four black musicians, including Mr. Lamar, in winning his award in this historically black music genre. Should Macklemore be apologizing? Did he rob the other award contenders? Is this just another example of whites appropriating and profiting from historically black music, as some might say Elvis Presley and other early rock n roll musicians did in the 1950s? Can music transcend race or ethnicity to belong to its fans? Or is our history too scarred by inequality?

title: Ukrainian Prime Minister Resigns as Parliament Repeals Restrictive Laws
description: KIEV, Ukraine  Mykola Azarov, the prime minister of Ukraine, resigned on Tuesday, hours before a planned vote of no confidence by Parliament that could have stripped him of his powers.

title: In State of the Union Address, Obama Vows to Act Alone on the Economy
description: WASHINGTON  After five years of fractious political combat, President Obama declared independence from Congress on Tuesday as he vowed to tackle economic disparity with a series of limited initiatives on jobs, wages and retirement that he will enact without legislative approval.

title: Argentina on the Brink
description: More than a decade after it defaulted on its foreign debts, Argentina is again facing a financial crisis caused largely by misguided government policies.

title: Pete Seeger is Gone, but His Circles of Song Ring On
description: Pete Seeger spent his life surrounded by circles of song with varying dimensions.

title: What Does It Mean When a Gay Son Takes His Husbands Surname?
description: Q. Dear Civil Behavior: My husband and I are thrilled that our son, who is in his late 20s, will be marrying his boyfriend in California this spring. I was not so happy, however, when he told me hell be dropping our last name and taking his fianc's. When I married my husband in the early 80s I hyphenated my name, which felt like a good compromise. My husband and I are very hurt by our sons decision, particularly since neither of us know any other same-sex couples who have chosen to do this (and wed hoped to have grandchildren that carry on our family name). I also worry what this says about the dynamics of their relationship. I dont want to be the mom who meddles with her sons happiness, but am I right to be concerned? And how should I go about expressing my feelings?  Anonymous

title: The Contract Is Signed. And Now the Negotiation Begins.
description: We are trained in business that the ultimate goal is to get our client to sign on the dotted line. Once theres a signature on a contract, our job as deal maker is done. All thats left is to deliver on our end of the agreement.

title: Daily Report: U.S. Eases Some Rules on Data Disclosure
description: The Obama administration says it will allow Internet companies to give customers a better idea of how often the government demands their information, but will not allow companies to disclose what is being collected or how much, Matt Apuzzo and Nicole Perlroth report.

title: A Top Manager Resigns From Chinas Foreign Exchange Agency
description: SHANGHAI  An American-trained fund manager who returned to China to help invest the worlds largest foreign exchange reserves has left his government position, the Chinese state-run news media reported on Tuesday.

title: Bank of Montreal Parent Acquires British Asset Manager for $1.2 Billion
description: LONDON  In a bid to expand its wealth management offerings in Europe, the Bank of Montreals parent company said on Tuesday that it would acquire F&C Asset Management of Britain for 708 million pounds, or about $1.2 billion.

description: The country unveils an inclusive new constitution.

title: Palestinian Leader Says He Can Accept Israeli Military in West Bank for 3 Years
description: TEL AVIV  President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority said in an interview shown Tuesday that he could accept an Israeli military presence in the West Bank for a three-year transition period as part of a peace deal. But Mr. Abbas said whoever proposes 10 or 15 years for a transition was not serious about an agreement.

description: The terrors of the lawn look as though they are swimming as they tunnel, but they put a lot of force behind their shovel-like paws.

title: Uncovering the Secrets of Mole Motion
description: The question of how moles move all that dirt when they tunnel just under the surface of lawns has never attracted the extensive study that other forms of locomotion  like the flight of birds and insects, or even the jet-propulsion of jellyfish  have.

title: Can You Spell That, Please?
description: Publishing tens of thousands of words a day, on tight deadlines, we know we cant avoid all errors. But its frustrating to run correction after correction for certain mistakes that are predictable and therefore eminently avoidable. In my last post, I talked about millions and billions. This week, consider Katherine and Katharine.

title: In Performance: Okwui Okpokwasili of Bronx Gothic
description: This weeks video features Okwui Okpokwasili in a scene from Bronx Gothic, her solo show which grew out of a series of notes passed between two 11-year-old girls. Directed by Peter Born, the piece, which Ms. Okpokwasili wrote and stars in, continues through Feb. 1 at Danspace Project at St. Marks Church.

title: Operas Filled With Forbidden Love in Madrid
description: MADRID  Wagners Tristan und Isolde, a tale of forbidden, ill-fated love, was presented at the Teatro Real this week when one of the major events of the international opera season was also taking place at the theater: the Tuesday premiere of the composer Charles Wuorinens Brokeback Mountain, an adaptation of the acclaimed short story by Annie Proulx, who wrote the libretto. The Tristan, in a production by Peter Sellars, with video by Bill Viola, is a powerful staging that is new to Madrid. On Monday, the house was packed for the fifth performance of the run, attended by Queen Sofa of Spain, who waved to onlookers from the royal box, though among the applause there were scattered boos that could have been motivated by any number of political and economic issues.

title: Lawmakers Go on the Record for Clinton
description: On Monday, Hillary Rodham Clinton again said she had not yet decided whether she would run for president in 2016. That has not stopped the Democratic Party from coalescing around her.

title: Casablanca Capital Urges Changes at Cliffs Natural Resources
description: The activist hedge fund Casablanca Capital disclosed on Tuesday that it had taken a 5.2 percent stake in the mining company Cliffs Natural Resources and urged it to spin off its international assets and make other changes.

title: Time Warner Cable Can Take Heart in History of Failed Hostile Bids
description: If Time Warner Cable manages to avoid a takeover by Charter Communications, will its stock price plummet?

title: French Court Rejects Residency Request by Roma Family
description: PARIS  A French court rejected on Tuesday a request for residency from the family of Leonarda Dibrani, a teenage Roma girl whose expulsion from France sparked days of protests and a national controversy last year.

title: Egypt Locks Morsi in Soundproof Cage During Trial
description: CAIRO  Mohamed Morsi, the deposed Egyptian president, appeared in public on Tuesday for the second time since his detention after the military takeover in July, this time locked in a soundproof glass cage as the defendant at a criminal trial.

title: A Romance 38 Years in the Making
description: LOS ANGELES  One of the surest signs of a films front-runner status is its ability to be parodied. So its got to be good news for Spike Jonze and the team behind Her that the film has attracted plenty of knock-offs, from Saturday Night Lives version with Jonah Hill, Me, to the countless takes on YouTube, like Troubleshooting her, which imagines a software upgrade that helps fix the problems that develop when you fall for your computer. (Would you like Element Software to send you a new OS1 that is not looking for anything serious right now? Reassure you that your ex-OS1 didnt deserve you, and that youll meet someone new, besides he or she was, like, crazy anyway?)

title: Money and Class
description: My post on Americans starting to recognize class realities has brought some predictable reactions, which Id place under two headings: (1) But they have cell phones! and (2) its about how you behave, not how much money you have.

title: Syrian Talks Disrupted by Congresss Approval of Aid to Rebels
description: GENEVA  New fireworks erupted at talks between the Syrian government and the opposition here on Tuesday, as the government sharply criticized a recent decision by the United States Congress to approve continued support for the Syrian rebels, and the United Nations top mediator decided not to continue talks in the afternoon.

title: Tension Grows Between Japan and China
description: Relations between China and Japan have been strained since World War II. But now, the regional clash is having a global economic effect, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in the DealBook column. The battle was on full display last week at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, setting off fears that the souring relationship could pose direct economic risk to businesses across the globe. And there may be no one to defuse the situation.

title: Sign of a Chill: E.U. Doesnt Set Table for Putin
description: BRUSSELS  President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia has for years trumpeted grand ambitions for Moscows relations with the European Union, pushing to break down visa barriers and urging the creation of what he calls a harmonious economic community stretching from Lisbon to Vladivostok.

title: Tax Gains in Europe Lift Profit 90% at Ford
description: DETROIT  Ford Motor, the nations No. 2 automaker, said on Tuesday that its fourth-quarter earnings rose 90 percent, to $3 billion, mostly because of favorable tax benefits related to investments in its European operations.

description: Fantex, a start-up looking to sell stocks tied to athletes future earnings, is getting back in the game after taking a couple of hits.

title: Adding Up the Costs of Data Breaches
description: There seems to be an announcement almost weekly that a retailer has been the victim of a cyberattack in which consumer information has been stolen. Has this become the next wave of 21st century white-collar crime as the world of electronic credit and payments opens up companies to more and more thefts of financial information?

title: Food Matters | A Paris Restaurant Where Dessert Is Whats for Dinner
description: Its time to rethink the conventions of a meal, says the French restauranteur Philippe Baranes. Thats just what hes done with Pariss first all-desserts restaurant, Dessance  the name is a neologism that combines dessert with the French word for birth, naissance  which recently opened in a 17th-century townhouse in the citys Marais district. Some people find it confusing or even disturbing, but theres no reason a dish cant be savory and sweet at the same time, he says. My idea was to break the cloisonnd way in which we think about food. The menu at Dessance doesnt run toward the pastries, cakes and tarts that a desserts-only concept might imply, but rather offers a small but intriguing collection of dishes that can be eaten as both desserts and main courses, including, for example, a surprising combination of violet-colored vitelotte potato pure with raw and poached apples, arugula and marjoram granit.

title: Tribeca Film Festival Starts a Music Video Contest
description: The Tribeca Film Festival is collaborating with Genero, a company that makes connections between musicians and filmmakers on a contest that it is calling Tribeca Interactive & Interlude: A Music Film Challenge. The idea: make a music video for one of three recently released songs  Damon Albarns Heavy Seas of Love, Aloe Blaccs Ticking Bomb or Ellie Gouldings Dead in the Water. The prize, one for each song, is $10,000 and a trip to New York to attend the festival, which runs April 16 to 27. And the videos will be used in the promotional campaigns for the recordings.

title: R.B.S. to Reduce Foreign Exchange Benchmark Offerings
description: LONDON  The Royal Bank of Scotland said on Tuesday that it would reduce the range of foreign exchange benchmarks it offers to clients who trade currency markets.

title: The Editorial Boards SOTU Wish List
description: President Obama will deliver the annual State of the Union address tonight at 9 p.m. As someone who has covered these speeches since 1989, I sometimes wish the president would just send a written report up to Congress, which is all that is required by the Constitution, instead of giving a speech that is too politically massaged, filled with too much ritualistic applause, goes on too long and is watched by a dwindling number of Americans.

title: Tarantino Sues Gawker for Posting Film Script
description: LOS ANGELES  Quentin Tarantino filed a suit against Gawker Media, accusing the web news service of illegally posting on its Defamer site a link to his unproduced script titled The Hateful Eight, The Hollywood Reporter said on Monday.

title: Share Your Story About Postpartum Depression
description: Setting up a nursery and bringing home a newborn evokes images of blissful mothers, delighting in the joys of parenthood. But the experience of pregnancy and caring for a baby can also cause feelings of depression, anxiety and, in rare cases, psychosis. Pam Belluck, a New York Times health reporter, will be examining new efforts by scientists and doctors to better understand the causes and consequences of postpartum mood disorders.

title: Albert Cashiers Secret
description: In the spring of 1914, a Civil War veteran named Albert Cashier arrived at the Illinois state hospital for the insane with symptoms of advanced dementia. As a young private, Cashier had fought at the siege of Vicksburg, where he and his comrades broke the spine of the Confederacy, and his name was inscribed on the Illinois victory monument there. He had lived out the intervening years in modest circumstances, working as a farm hand, a laborer and, on occasion, a street lamplighter, one of the many former soldiers whose civilian lives never achieve the glory of their wartime service. He was destined for the same obscurity in death, had it not been for a secret that the state hospital made public: Albert Cashier was actually a woman named Jennie Hodgers.

title: More Ships Sailing the Caribbean
description: A fleet of new ships in the Caribbean could mean not just greater selection but better deals for tropics-bound sailors. In November, the year-old, 3,502-guest MSC Divina began sailing year-round to the Caribbean from Miami. The new 4,000-passenger Norwegian Getaway launches Feb. 8, offering Caribbean itineraries from its home port, also Miami. In May, Princess Cruises introduces the 3,560-passenger Regal Princess in the Mediterranean; it will move to Fort Lauderdale in November to serve the eastern Caribbean. Making its debut in November, Royal Caribbean Internationals 4,905-passenger Quantum of the Seas will offer regular Caribbean and Bahamas sailings from Cape Liberty, N.J.

title: Lloyds Banking Group to Cut More Than 1,000 Jobs
description: LONDON  The Lloyds Banking Group said on Tuesday that it would eliminate an additional 1,080 jobs as part of a restructuring plan first it began in 2011.

title: King Kong Will Stomp Onto Broadway in December, Producer Says
description: The next big-budget musical heading to Broadway, King Kong, featuring a 20-foot-tall puppet in the title role, will open at the Foxwoods Theater in December, according to the chairman of the Australian production company mounting the show.

title: Turkeys Central Bank Aggressively Raises Rates

title: Cherished Beams of Sunlight, as Captured by Readers
description: As New York City grows ever more vertical, sprouting fresh batches of breathtakingly high towers by the year, one of the casualties has been natural sunlight. Streets, stoops and parks are growing darker, and peoples apartments are too, which we explored in an article last month. We asked readers to submit their experiences of light and shadow in New York City, and discovered anew how deeply personal light, and its absence, is for people living in this space-deprived town.

In the 70s, he ran a beachside cafe in Greece that was frequented by yachts tracing paths through the Aegean Sea. In the 80s, he transformed a 1924 Moroccan-style villa in Palm Springs into the lush, hallowed retreat Korakia Pensione. Hes gutted a

title: Authorities Name the Rest of Task Force on Seized German Art
description: BERLIN  Thirteen experts in art history, provenance research and restitution issues have been appointed to assist German authorities in establishing the history of hundreds of artworks discovered in the Munich apartment of Cornelius Gurlitt, the son of a well-known Nazi-era art dealer.

(And the even newer advances in apologizing for success through that borrowing.)

title: Smear Today, Gone Tomorrow?

Today the story is in the Times. Ms. Guadagno sure seems like a real piece of work  as do several other close associates of governor yells-at-people.

description: Some moderate Republicans are finally worried enough about alienating large chunks of the American electorate that they are considering the idea of giving legal status to millions of undocumented immigrants in the United States  and even citizenship to a much smaller group.
