Whether debating football-related controversies, making predictions, analyzing ads, writing descriptions, understanding data and statistics or learning about head trauma, we have ideas for using The Times and the Learning Network to do it.

title: Video of Palestinian President is Shown at Tel Aviv Conference
description: As my colleague Jodi Rudoren reported, the Palestinian president has said in a recorded interview that he could accept an Israeli military presence in the West Bank for a three-year transition period as part of a peace deal.

title: On the Problem of Defining Upper Class
description: Aha. When I wrote about the problem of saying where upper class begins, I somehow forgot that the whole thing was explained long ago by Gordon Gekko:

title: Louis C. K. to Release His First Feature Film Online
description: The great white whale for Louis C. K. completists is now in sight. On Wednesday at noon, he will release Tomorrow Night, his rarely seen first feature film (which he wrote, directed and played a cameo role in) on his website where it will be available for $5. The movie was shown at the Sundance Film Festival in 1998 but never got distribution.

title: Jimmy Carter Book on Womens Rights Is Set for March Release
description: Simon & Schuster will publish a new book by Jimmy Carter on the treatment of women, the publisher said on Tuesday.

title: Ukraines Uncertainties Include Financial Aid
description: KIEV, Ukraine  As Ukraines political crisis has deepened, an economic question looms: Will Russia continue to bail out the country if it again tilts to the West?

title: A Video Lesson in Picture Framing
description: Each frame does something different to the picture, says Rita Konig, Ts European editor. In this new video for T, she takes a trip to the Lacy Gallery in West London to have a print of a red onion by the artist Rory McEwen framed. Along the way, she shares her sometimes unorthodox philosophy on picture framing, then goes on to offer a few thoughtful pointers on picture hanging as well.

title: Reflections on Falluja and the Impermanence of Victory
description: Before there was a battle for Falluja, we threw darts.

title: Kocherlakota and the Cultists
description: Narayana Kocherlakota, president of the Minneapolis Fed, is the prodigal son of monetary stimulus. He was the Feds leading hawk a few years ago, reflecting in part the ultra-freshwater macro doctrines of the Minnesota econ department and his banks closely associated research department. But he did something amazing: he looked at evidence, listened to his critics, and changed his views  becoming the Feds leading dove.

title: Serbian Ex-Fugitives Mladic and Karadzic Reunite in Court
description: PARIS  One is a former warrior known as the Butcher of Bosnia who spent more than 15 years on the run in his native Serbia, where he was finally captured.

title: Super Bowl Attracts a Marijuana Message
description: New Jersey probably looks a lot like home to the Denver Broncos. The billboards, anyway.

title: With Eye on Spain, Liberty Said to Join Hunt for ONO
description: LONDON  On the heels of its $13.7 billion deal on Monday to buy the Dutch cable operator Ziggo, John C. Malones Liberty Global media company is now reported to be in talks to acquire the Spanish telecoms operator ONO, according to The Financial Times.

title: The Gun Report: January 28, 2014
description: More than 7,000 children and teenagers were hospitalized for firearm injuries in 2009, according to a study in Februarys Pediatrics. That works out to twenty young people per day. Six percent of those hospitalizations resulted in a death.

title: A Familiar Trip for a Pre-Crisis Buyout
description: Another big pre-crisis buyout is heading for an unexpectedly safe landing. Seven years after taking travel technology company Sabre private for $5 billion, owners TPG and Silver Lake Partners are making the round-trip return to public markets. Its one of many boom-time deals whose badly timed takeoff led to a bumpy ride.

title: Second Outdoor N.H.L. Game in the Bronx Is a Hot Ticket
description: Ticket demand for the Rangers-Islanders game at Yankee Stadium on Wednesday night has increased, a sign that the N.H.L.s strategy of staging two outdoor games in the metropolitan area during Super Bowl week is succeeding.

title: State of the States
description: The State of the State speech, that annual display of policy and pride, can be a call to action, plea for patience and, in some cases, an early look at a re-election platform.

title: Report Says BBC Executives Oversight of Digital Project Was Flawed
description: LONDON  An independent report published on Tuesday accused the BBC of significant management failings in connection with an abandoned 126 million pound digital project, saying the broadcaster failed to assess the initiative properly or provide adequate oversight of its progress.

title: Pakistani University Cancels Event Promoting Teenagers Memoir
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  Malala Yousafzai may be a global celebrity, but in her home province, she remains a focus of controversy.

title: Thai Aristocrat Joins Political Fray, Backing Elections
description: BANGKOK  With a buzzer installed in her house to summon her servants and a royal title that helps secure choice tables at Bangkok restaurants, Malinee Chakrabandhu is a bona fide member of the Thai aristocracy.

title: Complete Ben Jonson Released Online
description: Shakespeare may get all the love on the modern stage, but his contemporary Ben Jonson has just grabbed a share of the limelight in cyberspace.

title: A Small Window Into Apple, Courtesy of Tim Cook
description: Apple sold more iPhones and iPads over the last quarter than any other quarter. Yet Apples profit was flat compared with last year, and iPhone sales were down in North America, raising questions among investors about how much room Apple has to grow.

title: Pigs in Blankets, Artful Pie Pans, Gluten-Free Cakes and More
description: To Snack: Wee Pigs Till the Wee Hours

title: Beyonc Doesnt Faze Frozens Songwriters
description: LOS ANGELES  Frozen, the Disney-animated and Oscar-nominated hit, is also one of the longest-running blockbusters of the season, with a 10-week streak at or near the top of the box office. The company announced that a sing-along version of the film would be shown at more than 1,000 theaters around the country on Friday even as its directors, Jennifer Lee and Chris Buck, are in Japan, in advance of its March 15 opening there. (Thats more international dollars for Disney, if the popularity of a foreign language-version of the films theme song, Let It Go, is to be believed. )

title: What Were Reading Now
description: The U.S. Department of Agriculture briefly suspended poultry processing at one of the biggest Foster Farms plants in California because it was infested with live cockroaches. But Bill Marler asks, why does the U.S.D.A. and its food inspection service have the authority to shutter a plant for cockroaches but not for salmonella?

title: Introducing Jennifer Blumin, New Business Group Member
description: In my last post, we met two of three new members to join the She Owns It business group.This post introduces the third.

title: For Fliers, a Month Marked by Cancellations
description: The new year has gotten off to a rough start for fliers, with winter storms causing tens of thousands canceled flights in the first few weeks of 2014 (more than in January 2012 and January 2013 combined) and a forecast that has both airlines and passengers bracing for another blow this week.

title: Pete Seeger
description: The folk musician and activist at the Beacon Sloop Club.

title: Super Bowl Teams Meet the Media
description: Images from the N.F.L.s Super Bowl media day on Tuesday at the Prudential Center in Newark, where hundreds of reporters interviewed players from the Seattle Seahawks and the Denver Broncos.

title: A Softer Front Page: The Readers React
description: Consider the media habits of Mathew Ingram, a senior writer on media and technology at GigaOm, the online news site.

title: Robert Diamonds New Firm Hires Executive From J. C. Flowers
description: As Robert E. Diamond Jr.  builds his new firm  his latest venture since leaving Barclays as chief executive  he has hired some experienced help to serve by his side.

title: Times Minute | State of Union Preview
description: On the Minute, a look ahead to this evenings State of the Union address  from President Obamas tone to the expected Republican response.

title: Harkness Foundation for Dance Names New Director
description: For more than three decades, Theodore S. Bartwink, the executive director of the Harkness Foundation for Dance, has helped distribute millions of dollars in grants to scores of dance companies. But with Mr. Bartwink now 85, and recovering from injuries he sustained when he was struck by a car last year, the foundation announced that he would be retiring.

title: Living in Mendham Borough , N.J.
description: A Morris County town with a direct train line to Manhattan and nearby corporate employers.

title: An Outpost of New England
description: Does it still exist, the town with a mud hole for fishing, a four-lane bowling alley, and Labor Day festivities with a 70-year history? A place where the schools and the scenery are far above average?

title: Printing a Photo From a Phone
description: Q. I have a photo on my phone that I want to print out and give to a friend, but how do I get it off my phone? Do I need a special photo printer or can the regular printer I use do it?

title: Keep the Joy, Take Back the Fun
description: Is life as a parent all joy and no fun? Thats the premise, or at least the title, of Jennifer Seniors book on The Paradox of Modern Parenthood. Janet Maslin reviewed the book for The Times under the wonderful headline My Kids Idle for a Second? Oh, Horrors! (You can hear Ms. Senior talk about the book in the video below this post.)

title: Nocturnalist at the Super Bowl | First Stop, the Barker Bowl
description: Its been a while since we dusted off the gowns and hit a party in the name of journalism; too long, 760 days too long in fact  not that weve been counting every agonizingly boring night since we last assumed our alter ego Nocturnalist and hit the town, notebook in hand.

title: Dreaming About a Summer Rental? Act Soon
description: The race is on. There may be snow on the ground but if you want to rent a summer house in some of the most competitive markets in the northeast  the Hamptons, Cape Cod, the Jersey Shore  its time to put down your shovel and pick up your checkbook. Novice renter? Not to worry. Heres a primer.

title: Hotel Review: Lumeria Maui
description: Rates

title: Restaurant Report: Tosca Cafe in San Francisco
description: After working our way through gridlock around the bar, my husband and I reached the gatekeeper at the dining room. It was 7:15 on a Wednesday evening, and the wait for a table, we were told, would be 45 minutes to an hour and a half.

title: TV Stations in Los Angeles to Share a Channel to Free Up Spectrum
description: WASHINGTON  Two broadcast television stations in Los Angeles will become the first participants in a pilot test of the governments plans to eventually free up and auction off more airwaves for use in wireless broadband, officials said on Tuesday.

title: U.N. Takes New Steps in Central African Republic
description: UNITED NATIONS  The United Nations Security Council voted unanimously on Tuesday to impose a travel ban on and freeze the assets of people suspected of war crimes in Central African Republic, as the European Union prepared to send a battalion to protect civilians from an unrelenting sectarian war there.

title: A Swipe at Traditional Banking at a Forum Illuminating Bitcoin
description: A hearing Tuesday on the regulatory future of Bitcoin instead turned into a forum on the shortcomings of the traditional banking industry.

title: Prince Files Lawsuit Over Links to Music File-Sharing Sites
description: Prince Rogers Nelson  the artist known as the artist formerly known as Prince  has filed a lawsuit in Federal District Court in San Francisco against 22 Internet users who, the singers lawyers say, are responsible for posting links to unauthorized recordings of his concerts. The filing, which was first reported on Torrent Freak, a website devoted to file sharing and copyright issues, describes the 22 bloggers as part of a network who used their blogs and Facebook pages to distribute the recordings. Prince hopes to recover $1 million from each. Only two of the 22  Dan Chodera and Karina Jindrova  are listed by their real names. The others are listed by Internet handles like PurpleHouse2, PurpleKissTwo and TheUltimateBootlegExperience.

title: Times Minute | State of the Union Preview
description: In the Video

title: Irish Government Ordered to Compensate Abuse Victim
description: DUBLIN  The European Court of Human Rights ruled on Tuesday that a 49-year-old Irish woman was entitled to compensation for the governments failure to protect her from sexual abuse as a child when she attended a publicly financed Roman Catholic primary school in the 1970s.

title: More Than Just a Pretty Seed
description: Pomegranates are beautiful, of course, but they can seem more suitable for garnishing than gratification.

title: Clip: 'Charlie Victor Romeo'
description: A scene from the film directed by Robert Berger, Patrick Daniels, and Karlyn Michelson.

title: Super Bowl Visitors Guide
description: A guide to all things Super Bowl XLVIII around the New York/New Jersey metro area.

title: Pictures of the Day: Central African Republic and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Central African Republic, Syria, China and Greece.

title: From a Nest of Rhythm, Teaching the Young to Fly
description: Many ballet dancers, after retiring, go on to start their own schools. Jacques dAmboise, who had a celebrated career of almost 35 years with New York City Ballet, found his second calling even before he left the company, when he established the National Dance Institute in 1976. This is no elite ballet academy but a far-reaching nonprofit that teaches kids about the joy of movement (something that strict classical training cant always claim to do). The real lessons, of course, are in areas like self-confidence and teamwork.

title: The Price for Super Bowl Volunteers
description: Volunteerism has become as much a part of the Super Bowl as the Roman numeral identification of games, allowing those who cannot attend the games to be a part of the festivities by welcoming those who can.

title: A Critique of an Upbeat Assessment of Nuclear Powers Prospects
description: The Union of Concerned Scientists, a nonprofit group long focused on risks attending the use of nuclear energy, has posted a critique of the pro-nuclear letter from four longtime analysts that was the focus of a recent piece here titled More Views on Nuclear Power, Waste, Safety and Cost.

title: Moscow 57 on Delancey Street and More Restaurant Openings
description: Headliner Moscow 57

title: Fine Tempura, Piece by Delectable Piece
description: TOKYO  Last year at a counter in a small restaurant here, I ate tempura that seemed elevated to an art form, like the finest sushi.

title: Whats In It | Protein Bars
description: Protein bars offer convenience, but they can also contain as much sugar as a candy bar and the calorie count of an entire meal.

title: A Look Inside the Protein Bar
description: Protein is the hot ingredient of the moment in processed foods, joining the terms organic and low-fat as a major selling point to pitch to health-conscious shoppers. While carbohydrates and many fats are still widely regarded as suspect, protein is being proudly added to products throughout the grocery store, especially the snack aisle, which has made way for a new star: the protein bar. But a closer look shows that its blessings are mixed.

title: With Social Medias Rise, the Pulpit Isnt Just the Presidents Anymore
description: WASHINGTON  Twitter has fast become the conventional-wisdom clearinghouse and real-time echo chamber for major political events, so it was not surprising Tuesday evening when Twitter also became the forum where opinion on President Obamas State of the Union address seemed to crystallize before he had even finished speaking.

title: Profit Surges for AT&T, Outstripping Expectations
description: SAN FRANCISCO  AT&T finished 2013 strong despite aggressive moves from T-Mobile US, the smaller wireless carrier.

title: New York Property Managers Devise Survival Plans for the Next Disaster
description: In the hectic days that followed Hurricane Sandy, the only place that John Ambrosini could find cell service was on a hill near his home on the North Shore of Long Island.

title: Fred and Barney Would Feel Right at Home
description: The steakhouse is in trouble. Not financial trouble, because new ones keep opening, but spiritual trouble. Its soul is unwell. Because many other restaurants now offer better beef, the steakhouse serves little purpose except as a stage set for the dwindling number of occasions that require men to bond by spending money and consuming red meat together.

title: With Ad Dollars Elusive, Yahoos Revenue Falls
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Under the turnaround plan devised by Yahoos chief executive, Marissa Mayer, the company gained traffic and mobile users in 2013 and introduced a bevy of products, like a slick digital food magazine and a mobile weather app.

title: Wall Street Listens for Litigation and Tax Clues in Obamas Speech
description: Like last year, Wall Street might not be at the top of President Obamas agenda in his State of the Union address on Tuesday night. But that doesnt mean the financial community wont be listening for certain cues.

title: Severe Cold Moves New Yorks Homeless to Seek Help
description: Anthony Scott managed to survive in the nooks and crannies of Manhattan for two winters, burrowing under piles of blankets and cardboard on West 31st Street if he could not find a spot at Pennsylvania Station, the Port Authority Bus Terminal or on the E train.

title: The Star Treatment for a Little-Known Work
description: Im a little ashamed to admit I wasnt entirely looking forward to the pianist Marc-Andr Hamelins recital on Monday evening at Zankel Hall. The centerpiece was a rare performance of the Sonata in E minor (Op. 25, No. 2) by Nicolas Medtner (1880-1951), a Russian composer  well known neither in his time nor ours  championed by Mr. Hamelin.

title: Kellogg Foundation to Give  $40 Million to Aid Detroit Institute of Arts
description: The W.K. Kellogg Foundation announced Tuesday that it would contribute $40 million toward the broad philanthropic effort announced earlier this month to try to save the collection of the Detroit Institute of Arts and to avoid cuts to municipal pensions in Detroits federal bankruptcy case.

title: Lower Manhattan Landlords Compete for BNY Mellon
description: A venerable Wall Street firms search for a new home has set off a fierce competition among developers in Lower Manhattan, highlighting the challenges in a commercial district that has acres of vacant office space even as towers are under construction.

title: The Urban Home Away From Home
description: But why that McDonalds?

title: Marinara Sauce
description: Every home cook should have a basic marinara sauce in his or her repertoire. Julia Moskin makes a simple recipe from Lidia Bastianichs book, Lidias Commonsense Italian Cooking.

title: Its Not About 007, but It Sort of Is
description: To answer your main question first: about 10 minutes.

title: Marinara Worth Mastering
description: The first thing to know about marinara: its not a synonym for tomato sauce.

title: Erskine Bowles to Lead Morgan Stanley Board
description: Morgan Stanley announced Tuesday that Erskine Bowles, who has served as a director of the board since 2005, had been named as lead director.

title: Yahoo Earnings Shed More Light on Alibabas Growth
description: Yahoo is nominally the focus of its fourth-quarter earnings report, but another company is receiving just as much scrutiny: Alibaba of China.

title: Interview: Alfre Woodard
description: Melena Ryzik speaks to the actress at the Screen Actors Guild awards.

title: In Search of Confidence
description: The consumer confidence figures just released showed an increase, but they remain at a level that is historically low.

title: Video: Alfre Woodards Sole Scene
description: LOS ANGELES  Alfre Woodard has just one scene in 12 Years a Slave, but it is a pivotal one for the film and for the screenwriter, John Ridley. The moment, which was not in the Solomon Northup memoir on which the film is based, involves the slaves Patsey (Lupita Nyongo) and Solomon (Chiwetel Ejiofor) visiting another plantation for a tea party of sorts held by a slave turned favored lady, Mistress Shaw (played by Ms. Woodard). Mr. Ridley invented the scene, and it was the most difficult thing he wrote, he said, containing one of the few touches of humor in the film.

title: For Soggy Everton, No Bright Side in Loss to Liverpool
description: LIVERPOOL, England  Everton Manager Roberto Martnez is a genuinely upbeat man, a coach who can seemingly find positives in anything. When his former team, Wigan, was relegated from the Premier League last year, he admitted to disappointment, but noted that the club was on fantastic financial footing and had a promising football philosophy.

title: An Iraq Blasted Open, Sketched From the Inside
description: The literature of American warfare tends to land in overlapping waves, like an invasion. First come the novels by the war correspondents. Then, in time, fiction begins to arrive from the returning combatants. Only later, like cries of the wounded after a barrage subsides, can the other side finally make itself heard.

title: Comparing Obamacare to Its Alternative
description: FROM the moment the ink dried on March 23, 2010, Republicans said they intended to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act. They have voted more than 40 times to wipe the law from the books. But Republicans have never gotten around to describing, in detail, the set of policies they believe should replace Obamacare. That is, until yesterday.

title: An Artistic Life Retraced, in Fantasy and Memory
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  The best thing about Douglas Dunns dances is how they are unlike anyone elses. His eclectic works also differ from one another, but they all seem to express a particular, peculiar sensibility: elegant, eccentric, serious, wry, fascinated by contradictions, susceptible to beauty but skeptical, too.

title: In a First, Northwestern Players Seek Unionization
description: CHICAGO  The increasingly contentious and complicated relationship between the N.C.A.A. and its top amateur athletes took another step toward a legal showdown on Tuesday when a group of Northwestern football players appealed to the National Labor Relations Board with the first effort by college athletes to join a labor union.

title: A Medici to Spray Paint and Graffiti Artists
description: Times have changed, Aaron Goodstone said stoically, eyeing the spruced-up brick tenement at Ridge and Stanton Streets on the Lower East Side, now hip, where his friend Martin Wong once lived. Thirty years ago, when Mr. Goodstone was a teenage graffiti artist, he vied with drug dealers for the corner pay phone to reach Wong in his buzzerless sixth-floor walk-up: a salon, a studio, an archive and a refuge among the crumbling buildings and gated storefronts.

title: Live Coverage of Obamas 2014 State of the Union Address
description: President Obama delivers his State of the Union address Tuesday night, and Times reporters and editors are providing analysis during the speech.

title: House Votes to Restrict Payments for Abortions
description: WASHINGTON  The House of Representatives voted on Tuesday to impose tighter restrictions on federal payments for abortions, thrusting the issue of a womans right to terminate a pregnancy into the polarizing politics of an election year.

title: Agnes Varis Trust to Give $3 Million to Gibney Dance
description: The Agnes Varis Trust will give $3 million to Gibney Dance, the formerly all-women dance troupe that is known for its social activism and is about to expand its operations to 280 Broadway in Lower Manhattan.

title: Answers to a Puzzling Deal at Alibaba Remain in the Shadows
description: The Chinese Internet giant Alibaba is looking to join the ranks of Google and Microsoft with an initial public offering that could give it a value of more than $100 billion. But the companys recent acquisition of the Hong Kong-listed company Citic 21CN shows just how much we still dont know about Alibaba and its business.

title: Military Is Asked to Return Guantnamo Inmate to Yemen
description: WASHINGTON  A lawyer for a Yemeni man who has been held for 12 years without trial at the prison at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, asked a parole-style military board on Tuesday to recommend that he be sent home, where he planned to teach and possibly start a milk and honey farm or work for his fathers tailoring business, according to a prepared statement.

title: Met Opera Reports Falling Attendance
description: Although the Metropolitan Opera is raising more money from donors and earning more from its Live in HD movie theater presentations, it is making less at the box office, selling just 79 percent of its seats in the 2012-13 season, it announced in a financial filing.

title: Capturing Footballs Snaps, Crackles and Pops in Madden NFL
description: BURNABY, British Columbia  The football players strutted down a 40-yard strip of synthetic turf, yelling, jumping and flailing their arms to whip the fans into a frenzy. But there was no stadium and no crowd here on this recent day, only a barnlike studio with an animator directing the mock celebration and a few computer technicians recording the movements with dozens of high-speed motion-capture cameras that zero in on 65 reflective markers Velcroed to the players uniforms.

title: Examining the Timing of J.C. Penneys Poison Pill Change
description: J.C. Penneys announcement on Tuesday that it had set a new, lower threshold for its poison pill raises the question: Why now?

title: Gallery | A New Book Looks Back at Miami Beachs Legendary, Soon-to-Be-Revived Surf Club
Drama Where Youd Want It the Least: In the Cockpit
description: The visible action in Charlie Victor Romeo, a new 3-D film adaptation of a stage play first performed in 1999, consists of unfamiliar actors in familiar uniforms reciting verbatim dialogue from official transcripts. Directed by Robert Berger, Patrick Daniels and Karlyn Michelson, it is a curious hybrid of documentary and experimental theater. It is also one of the most terrifying movies I have ever seen.

title: The Source | Beck
description: Doug Aitken interviews the musician and singer Beck.

title: Improving Care of the Mentally Ill
description: To the Editor:

title: For the Elderly, a Welcome Place to Meet
For a Better Family Life
description: To the Editor:

title: What Private Equity Is Listening for in the State of the Union
description: In his State of the Union speech on Tuesday night, President Obama is expected to highlight a willingness to bypass Congress to get things done. That new stance could make private equity bosses nervous.

title: To Hear Your Banjo Play
description: Pete Seeger plays at a square dance in an edited clip of the 1946 film, To Hear Your Banjo Play.

title: Planned Comcast Tech Center Raises Sights in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA  The city that once boasted that no building would be higher than William Penns hat atop City Hall is getting a new skyscraper, to be the citys tallest and more than twice as high as the iconic statue.

title: Alan B. Abramson
description: Mr. Abramson, 67, is the president and chief executive of Abramson Brothers, a family owned commercial real estate company that owns and manages office buildings, mainly in Midtown. The company was founded in 1957 by Mr. Abramsons father and uncle, Manville and Junius Abramson.

title: Meeting the Cost of Conceiving
description: Melanie Martin, a surgical nurse in San Diego, said she and her husband cut every corner they could think of to save up enough money to pay for conceiving a child through the technique known as in vitro fertilization.

title: Seeking Better Legal Help for Immigrants
description: In the next several days, the deans of the nations top law schools will be notified of a new job opportunity for their graduating students. Applicants must be high achievers who want to be part of a groundbreaking start-up, live in New York City, train with veteran lawyers and help create a new paradigm in immigration representation.

title: Confronting Old Problem May Require a New Deal
description: We look back upon the Great Depression as a discrete event with a beginning and an end; a long and profound economic shock but one that turned out to be nonetheless temporary. In the 1930s, however, many feared that what John Maynard Keynes clinically called equilibrium at less than full employment might, in fact, be the new normal  forever.

title: The Next Accident Awaits
description: WASHINGTON  THE United States is facing an industrial chemical safety crisis. The horrifying chemical spill that recently contaminated the drinking water of hundreds of thousands of people in West Virginia is the latest in a relentless series of disasters and near-misses across the country.

title: Madden NFL: The 33rd Team
description: A group of athletes, animators and technicians use motion capture technology to make the football video game Madden NFL as realistic as possible from every tackle to scrimmage line fidget.

title: After Crisis, Greeks Work to Promote Social Economy
description: ALONIA, Greece  The feisty owner of a small family business that makes detergents has never had time for anticapitalist firebrands. So he was suspicious and skeptical when he was approached by left-leaning activists campaigning to purge profiteers from the market.

title: Texas: Woman at Center of Struggle Will Be Cremated
description: The brain-dead pregnant woman who was taken off life support after her familys battle to gain custody of her body from a Fort Worth hospital will be cremated, her mother said Tuesday. Marlise Muoz, 33, had been on life support since November against her familys wishes. The hospital had refused to disconnect her, citing a Texas law that prohibits doctors from withdrawing life support to pregnant patients. The hospital removed her from the machines on Sunday after a judges order. She was 22 weeks pregnant. Her fetus, which the hospital said was not viable, was a girl.

title: An American Family Returns to the Table
description: A brand that garnered brickbats  and bouquets  last year for its take on modern family life is returning with another 30-second parable about diversity, this time during Super Bowl XLVIII, the years biggest showcase for advertising.

title: Hedge Funds Sniff for Even Bigger Payouts From Banks
description: One of the biggest bets on Wall Street rests on a theory that also deeply unsettles Wall Street.

title: Morrie Turner Dies at 90; Broke Race Barriers in Comics
description: Morrie Turner, a cartoonist who broke the color barrier twice  as the first African-American comic strip artist whose work was widely syndicated in mainstream newspapers, and as the creator of the first syndicated strip with a racially and ethnically mixed cast of characters  died on Saturday in Sacramento. He was 90.

title: Text and Video of Obamas State of the Union Address
description: Following is the transcript of President Obamas State of the Union address, as transcribed by the Federal News Service.

title: Afghan Justice Proves Complicated in Killing of 9-Year-Old Boy
description: HERAT, Afghanistan  The case has consumed this city in western Afghanistan for over a year: A 9-year-old boy, Ali Sena Nowruzi, is kidnapped on his way to school by his trusted friend and bodyguard, and then is found beaten to death.

title: A Man of No Words, the Seahawks Lynch Finally Delivers a Few
description: NEWARK  The mercurial Seattle Seahawks running back Marshawn Lynch was fined $50,000 by the N.F.L. this month for declining to speak with the news media this season.

title: Prisoner of the Green Room
description: Well, Im at CNN; said my pre-SOTU piece. Now to sit through the speech, and comment after. Unfortunately, it seems that nobody brought the bourbon. .

title: Fragile Five Is the Latest Club of Emerging Nations in Turmoil
description: The long-running boom in emerging markets came to be identified, if not propped up, by wide acceptance of the term BRICs, shorthand for the fast-growing countries Brazil, Russia, India and China. Recent turmoil in these and similar markets has produced a rival expression: the Fragile Five.

title: SACs Counsel Testifies at Insider Trading Trial in Unexpected Move by the Defense
description: Peter Nussbaum, the general counsel of SAC Capital Advisors, took the witness stand on Tuesday in a bold and surprising move by the defense at the insider trading case of Mathew Martoma, a former SAC trader.

title: Frigid Blast Disrupts Life in South and Midwest as Emergencies Are Declared
description: CHICAGO  In Alabama, snow made roads impassable and forced some schools to prepare to keep students overnight. Many people in metro Atlanta planned to sleep in offices and hotels. And here in Chicago, where winter usually brings a shrug, parents scrambled to find day care after public school classes were canceled Tuesday for the fourth day this month.

title: Rebels in Syria Claim Control of Resources
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Islamist rebels and extremist groups have seized control of most of Syrias oil and gas resources, a rare generator of cash in the countrys war-battered economy, and are now using the proceeds to underwrite their fights against one another as well as President Bashar al-Assad, American officials say.

title: Pete Seeger, Neil Young and the Importance of Letting Go
description: Four decades later, Pete Seeger couldnt let it go.

title: Video Notebook: Fans at Media Day
description: Fans who attended media day on Tuesday shared their impressions.

title: For $28.50, All the Super Bowl Hype a Fan Could Stand
description: NEWARK  Super Bowl media day has its traditions. Reporters and other credentialed people, some in character costumes, ask the teams players serious and inane questions.

title: Roadblocks on Health Reform
description: Onerous restrictions imposed by Missouri on federally approved counselors who help people understand and enroll in health insurance plans under the Affordable Care Act have rightly been blocked by a federal district judge in Kansas City. Although the ruling by Judge Ortrie Smith applies only to Missouri, its reasoning applies to similar laws or regulations adopted by more than a dozen Republican-led states that are doing their best to sabotage health care reform.

title: Iran: U.N. to Visit Uranium Mine
description: United Nations nuclear inspectors arrived in Iran on Tuesday to examine a uranium mine in the southern part of the country, Iranian news agencies reported. Their visit is part of a temporary international agreement aimed at resolving the longstanding dispute over the Iranian nuclear program, which Iran says is for energy and medical use but which Western nations and Israel suspect is a cloak for developing the ability to make bombs. Under the accord, which took effect on Jan. 20, Iran agreed to freeze most uranium-enrichment activities for six months and allow inspectors more intrusive access, in return for a relaxation of some Western economic sanctions. An exact date and a location have not been set for talks aimed at achieving a permanent agreement.

title: More Winter, Less School
description: Schools open. Im cheering, kids arent. I just went over to the dark side.

title: A Courts All-Hands Approach Aids Girls Most at Risk
description: SAN LEANDRO, Calif.  Toni J., an effervescent 16-year-old who talks on speed-dial, lives with 11 family members in West Oakland, on a street buffeted by gang activity and poverty. Her mother died of an overdose, her father in a revenge shooting. In ninth grade, she was raped while on probation for shoplifting.

title: China: Chicken Sales Suspended Over Concerns About Avian Flu
description: As the Chinese get ready for Lunar New Year feasts, several areas in China have banned the sale of live chickens, and the Hong Kong government started culling 20,000 of the birds on Tuesday, as fears grew over the spread of avian influenza. The decision to kill the chickens, all from a single Hong Kong market, came after officials detected a new case of the deadly H7N9 virus in a bird imported from mainland China, across the border from Hong Kong in Guangdong Province. In southeastern China, New Years festivities often include the killing of a chicken. Contact with live poultry remains the main means of transmission for the virus. The H7N9 virus was first detected in March, and more than 200 cases have been reported so far, with roughly 50 deaths tied to the flu.

title: Video Notebook: Richard Sherman
description: Richard Sherman of the Seattle Seahawks spoke to the media on Tuesday about being at media day and his reputation as a talker.

title: Outsiders, Not Auto Plant, Battle U.A.W. in Tennessee
description: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn.  At the Volkswagen plant nestled in Tennessees rolling hills, a unionization drive has drawn national attention as business groups worry about organized labors efforts to gain its first foothold at a foreign-owned automobile plant in the South. In a region known as anti-union, many view VWs response as unusual, if not topsy-turvy.

title: Prisoner of the Green Room 2
description: OK, since there isnt any bourbon I guess Ill try some live-blogging.

title: Japan: Report of Possible Talks With North Korea to Thaw Ties
description: Japanese and North Korean officials may have held secret talks over the weekend in Vietnam, Kyodo News reported Tuesday, in an attempt to thaw frozen ties between the two nations. The Japanese news agency cited an unnamed Japanese diplomat as saying officials from the two nations were in Hanoi on Saturday and Sunday and may have met there. However, the top Japanese government spokesman, Yoshihide Suga, denied Tuesday that a meeting had taken place. Japan cut off talks in 2012 after North Korea launched a rocket over Japan.

title: Any Question Thrown at Him, Richard Sherman Has It Covered
description: NEWARK  The spectacle within the spectacle began at 12:45 p.m. Tuesday, when Richard Sherman, escorted by security through a horde of photographers, arrived at his podium. Over the next hour he answered questions from Deion Sanders and Randy Moss. He finished lyrics to Beyonc songs and was given an Xbox One.

title: Comcast Profits Up Sharply, Along With TV Subscribers
description: Comcast, the nations largest cable provider and the owner of NBCUniversal, on Tuesday reported a sharp increase in profit for the fourth quarter of 2013, helped by an increase in television subscribers after six years of decline.

title: Why Kerry Is Scary
description: TEL AVIV  It is pretty clear now that Secretary of State John Kerry will either be Israels diplomatic salvation or the most dangerous diplomatic fanatic Israel has ever encountered. But there isnt much room anymore for anything in between. This is one of those rare pay-per-view foreign policy moments. Pull up a chair. You dont see this every day.

title: Dealing With Pot
description: DENVER  Theres a lot of giggling in Colorado, and about Colorado, these days.

title: Drug Shows Promise in Advanced Prostate Cancer When Used Before Chemotherapy
description: The prostate cancer drug Xtandi prolonged lives and delayed tumor progression when used before chemotherapy in a study of men with advanced cases of the disease, researchers said on Tuesday.

title: Remembering a Sharp-Witted Academy Veteran
description: Updated, 8:12 a.m. | LOS ANGELES  Id vote for Anchorman 2, but theyd know the ballot was mine.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: Popular Flood Insurance Law Is Target of Both Political Parties
description: A major flood insurance bill was a rarity when it passed what is widely derided as a do-nothing Congress in 2012, but a year and a half later, there is now an enthusiastic bipartisan effort to gut it.

title: Using His Voice to Bring Out a Nations
description: Pete Seeger sang until his voice wore out, and then he kept on singing, decade upon decade. Mr. Seeger, who died on Monday at 94, sang for children, folk-music devotees, union members, civil-rights marchers, antiwar protesters, environmentalists and everyone else drawn to a repertoire that extended from ancient ballads to brand-new songs about every cause that moved him. But it wasnt his own voice he wanted to hear. He wanted everyone to sing along.

title: Open-Source System to Be Offered by Dell
description: Dell said it would offer networking equipment that was built with nonspecialized semiconductors and an open-source operating system, as opposed to the highly proprietary gear and software from like Cisco Systems and Hewlett-Packard. While that is unlikely to be a huge business soon for Dell, it lends credibility and muscle to what has been a growing effort to dislodge these incumbents through cheaper, easier-to-build equipment. If Dell and others can do that, a result would be lower costs at the large data centers run by Google, Facebook and large banks and companies. Cheaper networking could also make the Internet even more ubiquitous.

title: DeVry Becomes an Unlikely Olympic Powerhouse
description: They have no mascot or motto, no home rink, oval or stadium. They have no hockey team, curling squad or figure skaters. They have no coaches, no athletic director, and their basketball team once lost by 117 points.

title: Pitcher Refuses to Wear Cap That His Injury Helped to Bring About
description: In an effort to protect pitchers from line drives, Major League Baseball approved a padded-cap design Tuesday for optional use this season. But a pitcher whose injury helped accelerate the effort, Brandon McCarthy of the Arizona Diamondbacks, deflated much of the excitement by declaring he would not use it.

title: Similar to a Yodel
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  Its always fascinating how word people tend to see things that I would bet many people might overlook. It just so happens that somewhere there exists a whole list of people whose names contain letters that spell out something they are connected to, and Michael Black has found four of them.

title: For Seeger, Years of Singing and Sailing to Save His Hudson River
description: As much as he was known around the world as a troubadour of idealism, Pete Seeger was at bottom a plain-spoken citizen of Beacon, N.Y.

title: Obama Calls for a Year of Action
description: In his State of the Union address, President Obama said that 2014 could be a breakthrough year for America, but that Washington needed to rebuild trust with Americans.

title: Obama Urges Immigration Overhaul
description: President Obama said the system needed to be fixed if the United States was serious about economic growth.

title: Principles? What Principles?
description: To help appreciate President Obamas fifth State of the Union address, with its to-do list of executive actions and its implicit fatalism about working with Congress, I suggest a preliminary visit to that citadel of reason, the Republican Party. There, the great minds and loud voices of the right are debating whether to adhere to the strategy of confrontation and sabotage that appeases the radicals in the conservative base, or to introduce a measure of pragmatism that might broaden the partys appeal.

title: Looking Callous at the SOTU
description: Having covered more State of the Union addresses than I care to count, I know perfectly well that the applause breaks are ritualistic. But during tonights speech, there were several moments that were emblematic of the partisan divides in this country, and the callous nature of Republican domestic policy.

title: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, January 29, 2014
description: Im eager to work with all of you. But America does not stand still  and neither will I. So wherever and whenever I can take steps without legislation to expand opportunity for more American families, thats what Im going to do.

title: Capitalism vs. Democracy
description: Thomas Pikettys new book, Capital in the Twenty-First Century, described by one French newspaper as a a political and theoretical bulldozer, defies left and right orthodoxy by arguing that worsening inequality is an inevitable outcome of free market capitalism.

title: The Diminished State of the Union
description: Every winter since 2009, President Obama has stood at the podium of the House and pleaded for the cooperation of Congress. For the last three State of the Union speeches, he has largely been ignored. That has left a growing trail of unfinished business: background checks for gun buyers, immigration reform, a higher minimum wage, tax fairness, universal preschool.

title: Dont Expect Offensive Chill in Night Air
description: When the Rangers and the Islanders met eight nights ago at Madison Square Garden, some of the hottest hands in hockey were on display.

title: Greed Just Took Me, Recalls a Father Who Led a Secret Life of Crime
description: Salad was being served.

title: As Facebook Turns 10, Zuckerberg Wants to Change How Tech Industry Works
description: SAN JOSE, Calif.  Mark Zuckerberg was in his element.

title: Hardened, Obama Strikes Tough Tone for Modest Agenda
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas State of the Union address represented a study in scaled-down ambition.

title: Obamas Magic Three
description: Hands down, the passage of the State of the Union that brought the broadest smile to my lips and even had my heart doing a little jig was the oratorical triptych near the top. You know the one Im talking about.

title: Obama on Raising the Minimum Wage
description: The president said he would issue an executive order in the coming weeks to increase the minimum wage for federal contractors to $10.10 an hour.

title: Knicks Are Tough to Figure Out, and on This Night, Tough to Stop
description: Everything was open for the Knicks on Tuesday night: backdoor layups, 3-pointers, the lane. After Tyson Chandler converted an alley-oop dunk in the second quarter, he gave himself a good three seconds to stare menacingly at the crowd before retreating on defense.

title: Interview: Terence Winter
description: The Oscar-nominated screenwriter speaks with Melena Ryzik about "The Wolf of Wall Street" at the Critics' Choice awards.

title: Estimate for Statewide Pre-K in New York Puts Schools Chief in a Tangle
description: New York States top education official was caught in a battle between city and state leaders on Tuesday after he suggested that providing universal access to prekindergarten would cost substantially more than what Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo had proposed.

title: Corrections: January 29, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Two Men, Long on N.F.L.s Radar, Are Charged With Making Counterfeit Tickets
description: A small-time counterfeiting team that had apparently forged dozens of Super Bowl tickets was arrested at a White Castle restaurant in the Bronx on Monday, the authorities said.

title: N.Y. Judge Alarms Gay Parents by Finding Marriage Law Negates Need for Adoption
description: When Amalia C. and Melissa M. decided to start a family, they went through the well-trodden steps most same-sex couples take in New York City.

title: In France, a Battle to Keep Menus Fresh
description: PARIS  Sit down at a cute Parisian bistro and the chances are the onion soup, the pat and the boudin blanc set before you werent prepared from fresh ingredients delivered that morning.

title: Super Bowl Fans, Do Not Forget: Its New Jersey
description: NEWARK  As the rest of the world streamed into the colossal Prudential Center on Tuesday for a religious service known as Super Bowl media day, a singular, defiant voice called from black loudspeakers propped outside a nearby tractor-trailer.

title: Obamas State of the Union Address
description: In his annual address before Congress, President Obama promised to confront growing economic inequality and outlined a list of actions he would take without Congressional approval.

title: Snow, Ice and Wind No Issue for Citi Bikes Die-Hards
description: It was easy to imagine the blue bikes in fair weather, spinning over the East River during the morning commute, or toward the sidewalk cafes of SoHo for a twilight meal.

title: Text and Video of the G.O.P. Response to Obamas Speech
description: Following is the transcript of the official Republican response to President Obamas State of the Union address, as transcribed by the Federal News Service.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Jan. 28, 2014
G.O.P. Response to Obamas Speech
description: Representative Cathy McMorris Rodgers of Washington State delivered the official Republican rebuttal to President Obamas State of the Union address.

title: Dashing for Big Yardage, Not for Shot at Medals
description: Denver Broncos kick returner Trindon Holliday could not help wondering what might have been had he pursued his dream of competing in the Summer Olympics.

title: Texas: Candidates Daughters Respond to Criticism
description: The two daughters of Wendy Davis, a candidate for governor, put out an open letter on Tuesday in response to a newspaper article questioning aspects of her account of rising from teenage mother to Harvard Law School graduate. The Dallas Morning News reported this month that the daughters of the Democratic candidate stayed with her second husband in Texas while she attended school and that he won custody when the couple divorced. Ms. Daviss campaign has said the couple had joint custody. Republicans and conservatives accused her of misleading voters. Dru Davis, 25, said in her letter, Sadly I feel the need to be crystal clear on the malicious and false charge of abandonment as nothing could be further from the truth.

title: Bernard Perlin, a New York Painter of Varied Styles, Dies at 95
description: Bernard Perlin, an American painter who displayed a mastery of light and line across seven decades and a wide range of work, including wartime propaganda posters, street scenes of New York and effervescent views of Italy, died on Jan. 14 at his home in Ridgefield, Conn. He was 95.

title: What the State of the Union Address Means for 2014
description: What President Obamas speech means for the midterms, his agenda and his relationship with Congress.

title: Im Looking Through You
description: The least productive Congress in nearly half a century has rarely looked more out-of-sorts than during the speech that put its members on notice for their irrelevance. That, essentially, was the triumph of the rhetorical trick President Obama employed in his fifth State of the Union address.

title: Big and Fast Tight End Poses a Threat to an Intimidating Secondary
description: NEWARK  To find the end zone against a hard-hitting Seattle secondary known as the Legion of Boom, the Denver Broncos may have to rely on a player some call Mr. Red Zone. The name sounds like a comic book character, but Sunday in Super Bowl XLVIII, the performance of Julius Thomas, the Broncos tight end, will go a long way in determining how well Denvers offense fares against the N.F.L.s No. 1 defense.

title: In L.A., Blurring the Line Between Art and Housewares
description: Its no surprise that many sculptors have a yen for making furniture. After all, the tools are right within reach, and the process isnt that different. In Los Angeles, which has a long history of furniture manufacturing and an abundance of interior spaces to fill, a growing number of young artists are making forays into the realm of domestic utility. Theres a lot of sculpture out there that doesnt want to admit to being furniture, says the local artist Michael Rey, who has of late branched into objects that retain his affinity for the visual language of cartoons and 90s pop culture.

title: Exercise to Age Well, Whatever Your Age
description: Offering hope and encouragement to the many adults who have somehow neglected to exercise for the past few decades, a new study suggests that becoming physically active in middle age, even if someone has been sedentary for years, substantially reduces the likelihood that he or she will become seriously ill or physically disabled in retirement.

title: Shes a 29er
description: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago. He is the author of The Redistribution Recession: How Labor Market Distortions Contracted the Economy.

title: Word of the Day | imprecation
description: imprecation \im-pri-ka-shn\ noun

title: State of the Union, as It Was Spoken and as Decoded
description: WASHINGTON  In an excellent scene from Mitt, the new documentary about the former Massachusetts governor Mitt Romneys two presidential campaigns, the filmmaker asks one of Mr. Romneys sons, Josh, whether all the hassle and indignity of campaigning is worth it. Josh Romney hesitates, saying that he had been so trained to deliver scripted happy talk in media interviews, that this might be hard. To actually speak my mind is very different, he finally says.

title: Whats on Wednesday
description: 10 P.M. (ABC) NASHVILLE Juliette (Hayden Panettiere) surprises Jeff (Oliver Hudson) by refusing to apologize for her behavior during her induction into the Grand Ole Opry. Luke (Will Chase) introduces Rayna (Connie Britton, above) to someone who could help make her distribution deal a reality and then surprises her with a Nascar vehicle promoting her brand. And Deacon (Charles Esten) discovers that his own deal might not be what he anticipated.

title: Obama on Army Ranger Remsburg
description: The president introduced Congress to Sgt. First Class Cory Remsburg, who was severely injured by a roadside bomb in Afghanistan and whom Mr. Obama first met in 2009.

title: The Inner Sanctum
description: Diagram showing how far apart were the offices of Gov. Chris Christie and the deputy chief of staff fired for her role in the Fort Lee lane shutdown.

title: Air Force Expands Inquiry Into Cheating
description: Defense Department officials said on Tuesday that 30 more Air Force members had cheated on tests of their knowledge of how to launch nuclear missiles, doubling the number caught up in the scandal. The expanded list comes two weeks after the Air Force announced that a drug inquiry had been widened to include a scandal in which 34 officers responsible for safeguarding nuclear weapons had cheated, or were aware of cheating, on monthly tests.

title: Rep. Michael Grimm Threatens an NY1 Reporter
description: WASHINGTON  Footage showed Representative Michael G. Grimm physically threatening a reporter in the Capitol, shining a harsh light on the embattled Staten Island Republican in the hours after President Obamas State of the Union address here on Tuesday.

title: McCain Calls China a Rising Threat in Baucus Confirmation Hearing
description: President Obamas choice to be ambassador to China sat through a tough-sounding lecture in Washington on Tuesday from a Senate colleague who accused Beijing of regularly abusing human rights and planning to reassert its historic regional dominance. He then said that he largely agreed.

title: Islamist Party in Tunisia Hands Power to Caretaker Government
description: TUNIS  Tunisias Islamist party Ennahda ceded poweron Tuesdayto a caretaker government, ending a strife-ridden two years as the countrys first elected government after the Arab Spring of 2011. The government departed under pressure, criticized for failing to halt rising terrorism and steady a faltering economy, but Ennahda was nevertheless assured of its place in Tunisian politics.

title: A Pocket Guide to the 2014 Kolkata Book Fair
description: KOLKATA  The 38th Kolkata Book Fair may have lost the Kolkata Literary Meet, which has spun off into a standalone event, but it has filled the void by adding the three-day Kolkata Language and Literary Festival, which is set to be inaugurated by Shashi Tharoor, the minister of state for human resource development.

title: 2014: Pauls State of the Union Response
description: The Republican senator from Kentucky released his own response to the State of the Union address.

title: A Soprano Is Facing Star-Spangled Jitters
description: The soprano Rene Fleming  who has sung at the World Series, at the Queen Elizabeth II Diamond Jubilee Concert in front of Buckingham Palace and at a gala before President Obamas 2009 inauguration  sounded awed. If youd said six months ago, Youre going to be singing in the Super Bowl,'  she said, Id have said, Not possible, no way.

title: For Christie, Politics Team Kept a Focus on Two Races
description: His campaign called them the Top 100, the swing towns that Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey wanted to win as he prepared for a re-election campaign. Capturing these towns, sometimes referred to as mini-Ohios or mini-Floridas, would validate the governors argument that he would be the most broadly appealing Republican choice for president in 2016.

title: European Deal on Winding Down Failed Banks in Peril
description: BRUSSELS  Barely a month after European officials announced the creation of a system for winding down failed banks, it appears the plan could fall victim to a disagreement between member states on the European Council and the European Parliament.

title: Test Yourself | Math, Jan. 29, 2014
description: Our weekly math problems are written by teachers at Math for America.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Beings Not Made for Space
description: In Beings Not Made for Space, Kenneth Chang writes about the health challenges of human spaceflight.

title: Operatic Cowboys in Love, Onstage
description: MADRID  When the news came five years ago that Charles Wuorinen was writing an opera based on Brokeback Mountain, the 1997 Annie Proulx short story that was made into an Oscar-winning film in 2005, it seemed at first a baffling mismatch of composer and subject. Mr. Wuorinen, 75, built his reputation as and remains an unabashedly complex Modernist. Brokeback Mountain is the immensely sad tale of the impossible love between two Wyoming cowboys.

title: Dozens of Rebels Killed After Philippine Peace Deal Is Struck
description: MANILA  More than 40 people were killed and a school district supervisor was kidnapped in separate episodes around the island of Mindanao, days after a landmark peace deal was struck with the largest Muslim insurgency group in the Philippines, officials said Wednesday.

title: Confessions of a Tiger Couple
description: One gray afternoon in November, on the eve of the Harvard-Yale football game, Amy Chua and Jed Rubenfeld were preparing for their postgame party. Furniture had been moved, vulnerable rugs had been rolled into corners. Their older daughter, Sophia, a junior at Harvard, had just called, and Chua returned to the living room bearing some news for her husband.

title: Just When You Thought Quinoa Couldnt Be Crunchier
description: Not long ago, quinoa was as mysterious as dark matter. Few could even pronounce the name of this ancient, disk-shaped super grain from the Andes, mistakenly calling it kwih-NO-ah (its KEEN-wah). It tasted a little strange, home cooks didnt know what to do with it and only vegan restaurants put it on menus.

title: Scars, Visible and Invisible, in Bosnia
description: It seemed like a simple question: How old are you?

title: How Long Is It O.K. to Linger in a Cafe or Restaurant?
description: McDonalds, Starbucks and other cafes and restaurants have become popular gathering spots for everyone from teenagers to the elderly. This month a McDonalds in Queens finally arranged a truce after months of mounting tension with a group of elderly Korean patrons who have been using the restaurant as a meeting place for several hours each day. Do you ever think about overstaying your welcome in a public space?

title: Shell Selling a Stake in Brazilian Oil Project
description: LONDON  Royal Dutch Shell said on Wednesday that it had agreed to sell a minority interest in an offshore Brazilian oil project to Qatar Petroleum International, the emirates vehicle for oil and gas investments abroad, for about $1 billion.

description: Also on the Minute, behind the scenes of Madden NFL and this month's Recipe Lab featuring marinara sauce.

title: Flat Sales of Wii U Put Nintendo in the Hot Seat
description: TOKYO  Nintendo said on Wednesday that poor sales of the Wii U game console had caused a big drop in revenue in the first nine months of its financial year, adding pressure on the company to execute a strategic turnaround.

title: President Karzais Perfidies
description: President Hamid Karzai of Afghanistan seems to have decided that there is nothing lost, and maybe something to be gained, in destroying his relationship with the United States. While such behavior may serve his interests, it does not serve his long-suffering countrys.

title: Wheelies: The Export Import Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Touring States, Obama Pushes Modest Agenda
description: WEST MIFFLIN, Pa.  As President Obama took to the road on Wednesday to promote an opportunity agenda that he vowed to enact with or without Congress, lawmakers began sorting through issues on which they may yet come together during what promises to be a treacherous midterm election year.

title: U.N. Inspectors Visit Uranium Mine in Iran, Media Report
description: LONDON  United Nations nuclear inspectors began a visit on Wednesday to a uranium mine in southern Iran, state media reported, describing Tehrans readiness for the scrutiny as a good-will gesture to demonstrate peaceful intent.

title: The Co-Founder Dilemma
description: The idea for Posse struck me while relaxing in my apartment one Sunday afternoon. I didnt know how to run a technology company, wasnt at all confident the idea would work, and feared I might end up with egg on my face. In the interests of spreading the personal and financial risk, I asked a few friends to help.

title: Fido Prefers Organic
description: I was invited for dinner at some old friends place the other day and I thought it would be nice to go to my local Greenwich Village pet store and pick up a treat for their dog, Manny. It is not that I am so crazy about Manny, who is a mix of a poodle and something even more annoying; I have had mixed feelings about him ever since he ate one of my sneakers. I just thought I would get him something he might enjoy chewing on as a diversionary tactic.

title: The State of the Union, by the Numbers
description: The figures behind the language of this year's State of the Union address.

title: Daily Report: Yahoos Revenue Falls, Though Alibabas Rises On
description: Despite the turnaround effort led its chief, Marissa Mayer, Yahoo is still falling further and further behind in the race for Internet advertising. The company said on Tuesday that revenue and operating profits declined in the fourth quarter of 2013 and would continue dropping in the first quarter of this year, Vindu Goel reports.

title: Apple Store Update: Is It a Clue That a New Apple TV Is on the Way?
description: When most companies add a new section to their website, few people notice. But most companies arent Apple.

title: Ruling Looms in Italy for Amanda Knox in 07 Killing
description: FLORENCE, Italy  For years, the fate of Amanda Knox has been in the hands of a succession of Italian courts, called on to determine whether on the night of Nov. 1, 2007, she killed Meredith Kercher, her roommate and fellow foreign exchange student in the university town of Perugia. On Thursday, a court in Florence is expected to present its ruling.

title: Russia Defers Aid to Ukraine, and Unrest Persists
description: KIEV, Ukraine  A former Ukrainian president warned on Wednesday that the country is now on the brink of civil war, and Russia added to the gloom by announcing the suspension of its financial aid package, which was all that had been keeping Ukraine solvent.

title: Strong Chrysler Earnings Help Fiat Turn Profit
description: DETROIT  The worlds newest auto giant on Wednesday chose a formal name, Fiat Chrysler Automobiles, and a borderless corporate structure that spans the Netherlands, Britain, Italy and the United States.

title: Can Accessories Make Google Glass More Stylish?
description: Even self-described tech geeks want to make Google Glass look a little less geeky before they wear it.

title: State of the Union Highlights Economic Inequality
description: In his State of the Union address before Congress on Tuesday night, President Obama promised to do something about economic disparity in a year of action, vowing to act alone if necessary. While Mr. Obama covered a broad swath of issues, his message centered on income inequality. Those at the top have never done better, he said. But average wages have barely budged. Inequality has deepened. Upward mobility has stalled.

title: Barclays to Cut Up to 400 Jobs in Its Investment Bank to Trim Costs
description: LONDON  The British bank Barclays is preparing to eliminate as many as 400 jobs in its investment bank as part of an effort to trim costs, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: Hedgies Versus Teachers
description: So one thing I learned last night is that the right has a new meme: inequality is the fault of the government  you see, its all those overpaid government workers.

title: Video: Proud of Wolfs Language
description: LOS ANGELES  Terence Winter read The Wolf of Wall Street, Jordan Belforts memoir of his shady financial, narcotic and sexual dealings, before it was even published. I got the book when it was still in galley form from the producer Alexandra Milchan, he said. I could not put it down. I read it in one sitting.

title: Sothebys, Under Pressure, to Pay Special Dividend and Buy Back Shares
description: When the billionaire hedge fund manager Daniel S. Loeb and a group of activist investors emerged as the biggest shareholders in Sothebys last year, it looked as if a battle was brewing at the auction house.

title: German Leader Criticizes U.S. Over Pervasive Surveillance
description: BERLIN  Chancellor Angela Merkel took perhaps her sharpest swipe yet at pervasive American intelligence surveillance, saying on Wednesday that Washington had endangered its standing by violating the freedom of the individual, a value for which it is admired abroad.

title: Whatever It Takes? No, It Takes Whatever
description: I think Josh Marshall gets this right. Obama came across relatively relaxed last night, basically because he knows two things: he isnt getting anything substantive out of the GOP, but hes achieved a lot, and his signature achievement is looking increasingly secure. The real theme of the SOTU was Whatever.

title: Reader Idea | Writing Book Reports With Help From New York Times Book Reviews
description: All this week, we are featuring Great Ideas From Readers, lesson plans from teachers who teach with The Times. If youve used The Times in your classroom and would like to see your idea on our blog, write in and tell us what youve done.

title: Dow Chemical Resists Spinoff Proposal and Increases Stock Buybacks
description: Updated, 10:48 a.m. | Dow Chemical on Wednesday appeared to rebuff a proposal by an activist hedge fund manager, as it also announced measures intended to make shareholders happy.

title: Making the Case for Ambitious Diplomacy
description: For a few moments during President Obamas State of the Union address on Tuesday evening, he sounded as if he was channeling Secretary of State John Kerry.

title: Atlanta Officials Gamble on Storm and Lose, and Others Pay the Price
description: ATLANTA  There are bad commutes, and then there is what happened here this week.

title: After Ill Break You in Half, Grimm Apologizes
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Michael G. Grimm of Staten Island, once considered a rising star in the Republican Party, touched off a political firestorm after delivering unusually vitriolic threats against a reporter inside the United States Capitol building on Tuesday night, just moments after the State of the Union speech.

title: Playing With Toys and Saving Lives
description: Apollo 13 is a good movie, but one 95-second stretch is what turned it into it a geek classic. Their Command Module disabled, three astronauts use the Lunar Module as a lifeboat. Carbon dioxide is building up. The Command Modules filters are available to scrub the air, but theyre square, and the receptacles for them on the Lunar Module are round. Well, I suggest you gentleman invent a way to put a square peg in a round hole  rapidly, the flight director Gene Kranz in Houston tells his engineers.

title: Attack on Gay Journalist Not a Hate Crime, Police Say
description: The police on Wednesday charged a Queens man in the beating of a gay journalist in Midtown Manhattan but said the attack was not a hate crime.

description: Following Tuesdays State of the Union address, Representative Michael Grimm of Staten Island threatened an NY1 political reporter, Michael Scotto.

title: The Sunny Side of the Unemployment Report
description: David A. Rosenberg, the chief economist at Gluskin Sheff, a Canadian research firm, is not known for his rose-colored glasses. Indeed, when he was at Merrill Lynch in New York, there were complaints that he was too negative.

title: Tension Builds in Israeli Coalition at a Critical Juncture in Peace Talks
description: TEL AVIV  Simmering tension between Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel and one of his right-wing political partners boiled into open hostility on Wednesday, threatening to reshape Israels governing coalition at a critical juncture of the American-brokered peace talks with the Palestinians.

title: My Coach, the Bully
description: When Dr. Nancy Swigonski, a pediatrician who often talks with families about bullying, saw a local high school coach yelling at players, calling them stupid and lazy, she tried to speak with her.

title: The Source | Beck in Conversation With Doug Aitken
description: Its such a dispersal, making a song, Beck says. Hoping something works, or connects, somewhere, with somebody. In conversation with Doug Aitken, the genre-hopping 43-year-old musician and producer likens songwriting to sculpture, calling it just shaped chaos. The interview is part of the Source, a series of candid video conversations with several dozen noteworthy figures about their creative processes, currently on view in a custom pavilion at the Sundance Film Festival.

title: Justice Dept. Vows to Find Hackers of Target
description: WASHINGTON  Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. said Wednesday that the Justice Department was committed to finding the hackers behind the holiday season theft of credit card data from millions of Target customers.

title: Flipping the Switches on Facebooks Privacy Controls
description: FACEBOOK is all about sharing.

title: A Trainer and Father, Supporting Both Sides of a Rivalry
description: The Montreal Canadiens and the Boston Bruins will meet at TD Garden on Thursday night in the 723rd regular-season game between the two Original Six franchises.

title: Social Liberalism as Class Warfare
description: MySunday columntried to take the ongoing debate over marriage and upward mobility in a slightly different direction, by prodding social liberals to acknowledge the ways in which their own ideological vision and its victories  legal and cultural both  have played a role in the married, two-parent familys decline. I dont think my argument has won many converts, but rather than respond to the responses right nowI wanted to highlight one of the arguments that inspired the column in the first place:This essay from Steve Randy Waldman(the brother, I believe, of the novelist Adelle Waldman, familiar to my readers from an earlier round ofkulturdebating), which makes the case that marriage promotion as social conservatives often describe it is a destructive cargo cult, with altars and rings standing in for the runways and tarmacs that World War II-era South Sea Islanders allegedly built in the hopes of attracting military airplanes.

title: Movement Seen in Talks Over Syria, Despite Gap
description: GENEVA  After five days of deadlock and dispute in the Syrian peace talks, opposition negotiators on Wednesday seized on hints of government willingness to discuss political transition as evidence of progress. Yet the United Nations mediator dampened expectations, saying he did not anticipate any substantial result from the current round of talks, which are scheduled to end Friday.

title: Thomas M. Sherak, Head of the House of Oscar, Dies at 68
description: Thomas M. Sherak, a film studio executive who as president of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences helped expand its mission beyond the annual awarding of Oscar statuettes, died on Tuesday at his home in Calabasas, Calif. He was 68.

title: As I Was Saying About Web Journalism ... a Bubble, or a Lasting Business?
description: Last week, it occurred to me that the departure of Ezra Klein, the creator of The Washington Posts influential Wonkblog, to join the young company Vox Media was a bit of a moment  an inflection point in the emergence of a news economy online. When I pitched a column about it, my long-suffering editor said, Please dont explain the Internet to people, David.

title: Fed Decision Day: What to Watch For
description: President Obama gave a long speech Tuesday night about the things government can do to help the economy without ever mentioning the Federal Reserve. Presidents rarely do. But its also the case that folks at the White House, like most Fed officials, think the central bank already has done as much as it should.

title: Portrait of the Artist as a Child
description: Why is it that little children, who romp gleefully though museum halls in their preschool years, grow into kids who would rather do anything than walk through an exhibition? If only they knew how much they have in common with the men and women who made the work on the gallery walls, rebels all. Three new books, one each on Vasily Kandinsky, Alexander Calder and Pablo Picasso, present the artists in imaginative and appealing ways that should leave adults surprised by what they learn and children feeling theyve encountered brilliant kindred spirits.

title: Carnegie Hall Plans South Africa Festival This Fall
description: A three-week festival of the music and arts of South Africa, a series featuring the mezzo-soprano Joyce DiDonato and a monthlong Before Bach celebration of early music will be among the highlights of Carnegie Halls 2014-15 season, announced on Wednesday.

title: Life Story of Wendy Davis Swings From Strength to Flash Point in Texas Campaign
description: HOUSTON  Wendy Davis is learning the perils of campaigning on her personal biography.

title: Today in Small Business: 51 Start-Up Failures
description: Washington

title: At Restored Landmark in Times Square, Mixing Brash and Beautiful
description: Who are Americas four best-loved actresses?

title: House Approves Farm Bill, Ending a 2-Year Impasse
description: WASHINGTON  The House of Representatives on Wednesday passed a bill authorizing nearly $1 trillion in spending on farm subsidies and nutrition programs, setting the stage for final passage of a new five-year farm bill that has been stalled for more than two years.

title: Wall Street Is a Short-Attention-Span Theater for Obamas Speech
description: Investors had a theres-not-much-to-see-here reaction to the presidents State of the Union address and turned their focus quickly to something else on Wednesday morning

title: In Our Pages: January 30
description: 1939: William B. Yeats, Poet, Dies

title: On Losing It (or Not)
description: Im always on the alert for any proof I can muster that my missteps, mistakes, misunderstandings and failures of memory are just the stuff of normal human-being-ness  and not the signs of mental decline as I age.

title: Analyst Who Worked on Herbalife Leaves Pershing Square
description: An investment analyst who played a leading role in Pershing Square Capital Managements bet against Herbalife has decided to leave the hedge fund, according to a letter sent to its investors.

title: Atlantas Residents and Officials Turn to Social Media Amid Snowstorm Chaos
description: Updated, 5:08 p.m. A few inches of snow continued to paralyze Atlanta and other parts of the southeastern United States on Wednesday, as my colleagues Kim Severson and Alan Blinder reported. Thousands of motorists were stranded in their cars overnight, while others abandoned their vehicles and slept in shopping centers. Hundreds of accidents were reported. Some schools kept students through the night, scrambling to feed them.

title: New York Fashion Week: Rag & Bone Mens Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Kevin Tachman.

title: Times Minute | Secrets of Successful Aging
description: In the Video

title: Times Minute | Secrets of Aging
description: Also on the Minute, Wendy Davis fights back and Greece's no-middle-man movement.

title: Big Block of Cheese Day: The White House Offers a Chance to Ask Questions
description: After the State of the Union Address, the White House is embarking on a day of social media outreach: The First-Ever Virtual Big Block of Cheese Day.' First, a brief history lesson: according to the current administration, President Andrew Jackson in 1837 placed an ad announcing an open house at the White House  an opportunity for any and all to mingle with the president and his staff. The event featured a 1,400-pound block of cheese that sat in the main foyer of the White House.

title: Classical Playlist: Zuill Bailey, Natasha Paremski, Leon Kirchner and More
description: BRITTEN: Cello Symphony and Cello SonataZuill Bailey, cellist; North Carolina Symphony, Grant Llewellyn, conductor; Natasha Paremski, pianist(Telarc)Benjamin Britten composed several important works for his younger friend and colleague the cellist Mstislav Rostropovich. The longest, most substantial score was the Symphony for Cello and Orchestra (1963), a dark, wrenching and overpowering piece that Britten once called the finest thing Ive written. An exciting new recording  a live performance in vivid sound  couples the brilliant, searching American cellist Zuill Bailey with the fine conductor Grant Llewellyn and the North Carolina Symphony. The CD includes Mr. Baileys gripping account of Brittens 1961 Cello Sonata, with the pianist Natasha Paremski. (Anthony Tommasini)

title: Chinas Biggest Bank Gains Entree Into Trading in London
description: Updated, 8:19 p.m. | LONDON  The Industrial and Commercial Bank of China agreed on Wednesday to buy a controlling interest in Standard Banks global markets business in London for $765 million.

title: Making Consignment Stores Destination Shopping
