description: Perhaps fittingly for a onetime director of guest relations at an amusement park, Donna Speigel has turned the Snooty Fox chain of shops  consignment shops, no less  into Cincinnati destinations. Her customers come from as far away as Indianapolis and Louisville, even paying $25 to reserve a seat on Fox Hunt tour buses, where they are served boxed lunches and company lore. At the stores, they get wine and dessert and typically shop, if not until they drop, at least until they have taxed the buss overhead racks and lower storage compartments with their purchases.

title: Unpopularity of the House Could Turn Senate Races
description: WASHINGTON  To Representative Steve Daines, Republican of Montana, his vote this month against a 1,582-page, $1.1 trillion spending bill was at once a stand for fiscal sanity and a protest against spending cuts to rural communities, a constructive no, as he put it last week.

title: Investors Still Wary of Efforts to Shore Up Currencies
description: FRANKFURT  Emergency measures by Turkey and South Africa to stop a headlong flight of foreign investors had little effect on Wednesday. The financial markets all but ignored increases in official interest rates aimed at strengthening the countries currencies.

title: He Was Deadly in Cha-Cha, Too
description: It should surprise no one that the actor Cole Horibe, cast as Bruce Lee in David Henry Hwangs new play, Kung Fu, about Lees remarkable career, was a contestant on the reality show So You Think You Can Dance. Lees fighting in movies like Enter the Dragon that established him as a martial arts legend always mixed brutality with a balletic elegance. And Lee himself was a dancer, even, believe it or not, winning acha-cha competitionin 1958.

title: A Decision Deferred: Turning Off the Pacemaker
description: Nobody really knows exactly how many Americans are walking around with pacemakers and defibrillators. But with surgeons implanting at least 225,000 pacemakers and 133,000 defibrillators each year, there probably are a couple of million out there now, said Dr. Paul S. Mueller, a Mayo Clinic general internist and bioethicist.

title: A Conversation With: Times Now Editor in Chief Arnab Goswami
description: Arnab Goswami, editor in chief of the Times Now television news channel in Mumbai, landed one of the biggest interviews in Indian journalism in recent years when he spoke with Rahul Gandhi, the Congress Party vice president.

title: Below the Line: Shooting The Grandmaster
description: When the cinematographer Philippe Le Sourd teamed up with the director Wong Kar-wai to make The Grandmaster, he was expecting a six-month project. Those six months turned into three years, making the production felt as epic as the life story at the heart of the film: that of the kung fu master Ip Man. Mr. Le Sourd, nominated for his work on the film, shot in various locations and sometimes in extreme weather conditions.

title: Ice Strands Thousands in South
description: Thousands of commuters were trapped in cars overnight on highways in the greater Atlanta area and hundreds of students remained inside dozens of schools Wednesday morning.

title: Top Intelligence Official Assails Snowden and Seeks Return of N.S.A. Documents
description: WASHINGTON  The nations top intelligence officialon Wednesdaydelivered a scorching attack on Edward J. Snowden, the former National Security Agency contractor, and called on him and his accomplices to return the trove of classified documents he took from the N.S.A.

title: Enough With the Teaspoon Approach
description: David Brooks: Gail, back in the early 1980s, I bought my first computer, a Kaypro. It was big, clunky, slow and by todays standards, unbelievably primitive. Lets face it, the State of the Union address is the Kaypro of political events. We ought to totally re-engineer the whole enterprise.

title: Snowden Speaks to German Television
description: In an interview with German television, Edward J. Snowden said that despite feeling threatened, he does not lose sleep because he still believes that what he did was the right thing to do.

title: Study Says New Method Could Be a Quicker Source of Stem Cells
description: A surprising study has found that a simple acid bath might turn cells in the body into stem cells that could one day be used for tissue repair and other medical treatments.

title: Jessica Albas Edgy Elegance
description: The Girl: The actress paired her one-of-a-kind floral motif white-leather dress with layers of rock and roll  tousled tresses, a dark cranberry lip, black strappy sandals and edgy jewelry at last nights Hollywood Stands Up to Cancer event.

title: A Mafia Legacy Taints the Earth in Southern Italy
description: CASAL DI PRINCIPE, Italy  The Italian state arrived in the heartland of the Camorra mafia this month bearing a backhoe. Police officers in polished black boots posed for television cameras as the backhoe clawed into an overgrown field, searching for barrels of toxic waste or some other illegal industrial sarcophagi.

title: Not All Monuments Men Were Men
description: In February 1952, as Europe rebuilt after World War II, Ardelia Ripley Hall arrived in Bonn, Germany, to play her part in a bold American military mission that had begun about a decade earlier.

title: History, Yes, but Movie History
description: In a lighthearted scene in The Monuments Men, an Army officer played by Bill Murray gleans clues about stolen art from a German dentist while getting a tooth yanked.

title: A Culinary Trip to Cape Town
description: Red Savannah, an upscale travel company in Cheltenham, England, founded by the ex-Abercrombie & Kent chief executive George Morgan-Grenville, recently introduced a seven-night culinary trip to Cape Town and surrounding areas.

title: Image of the Day: January 29
More Vegetables, Please (But Hold the Red Peppers)
description: The picky eater ate broccoli pizza!

title: Why the Owner of a Growing Business Found Time to Start a School
description: We just published an interview with Donna Speigel, owner of the Snooty Fox chain of consignment shops. Last year, the 11 stores rang up more than $5 million in sales. As Ms. Speigel explains in the interview, she has turned her Cincinnati-area shops into destinations that routinely lure people on tour buses from as far away as Louisville and Indianapolis. But Ms. Speigel has also been creative on another front. In 2006, she opened a nonprofit school for people with special needs in Covington, Ky. called the Conductive Learning Center of Greater Cincinnati. Moreover, the school is largely funded through special Snooty Fox initiatives, notably a popular platinum credit card.

title: What You Get for ... $1,500,000
description: BIG SUR, CALIF.

title: Homes for $1,500,000
description: This weeks properties include a house with a Pacific view in California, a townhouse in Virginia and a Creole home in Louisiana.

title: Why Is Latin America So Progressive on Gay Rights?
Man Admits Killing 2 Women With Hammer, Officials Say
description: A woman and her daughter were bludgeoned to death in their Queens home by the womans live-in boyfriend, who called 911 and confessed that he had killed them because they are witches, law enforcement officials said on Wednesday.

title: Pete Seeger, Jamming at the Beacon Sloop Club
description: The folk musician and activist Pete Seeger played a lively role in the Beacon Sloop Club, which he helped start in 1969. It started as a campaign to clean up the Hudson River  the groups symbol is a sloop that Seeger built called the Clearwater  and has continued as a monthly part-advocacy, part-fellowship gathering to which people bring food, talk and make music. At the meetings, Seeger would call out, Now everyone get in a circle, make it big for everyone. Chairs would scoot around. No, its not big enough. It has to include everybody.

title: App Smart: Job Hunting
description: Today you only have to look as far as your pocket to find new work because there are many apps for mobile devices that can help.

title: Remember Want Ads for Jobs? Now You Find Them on a Phone
description: What do you do when you lose a job or need bigger challenges than your present one offers? Start that job hunt. You could earn more money or even prove the person who fired you wrong by landing a better job elsewhere.

title: A Dutch Jihadist in Syria Speaks, and Blogs
description: Last summer, a Dutch public television producer scanning the Internet for information on foreign fighters in Syria stumbled on something he had never seen before: Instagram photos of a man wearing the uniform of the Royal Netherlands Army who appeared to be fighting alongside Islamist rebels against government forces.

title: An Advanced Degree in Quiet
description: As she began her junior year at New York University, Vanessa Csordas-Jenkins planned to live with two friends. But the plan fell through, and she and her friends ended up in the Broome Street dorm along with four strangers.

title: Citing Growth, Fed Again Cuts Monthly Bond Purchases
description: WASHINGTON  In its final major decision under the leadership of Ben S. Bernanke, the Federal Reserve said on Wednesday that it would continue to slowly dismantle its stimulus campaign, citing growing underlying strength in the broader economy.

title: The Gun Report: January 29, 2014
description: Having a gun range on your property is legal in Florida, thanks to a 1987 law allowing anyone to fire anything they want on their own land. Doug Varrieur, who has turned the front yard of his home on Big Pine Key into a makeshift range, was looking for a way to teach his eyesight-impaired wife how to shoot her self-defense pistol without the inconvenience of going to a commercial gun range, which is 50 miles round trip, costs $45 an hour and is enclosed in a building with people shooting around you that you dont know, he told the Miami Herald. The only rules to discharging firearms on residential property are that you cant fire over a paved public road, highway or street, or occupied dwelling.

title: In Rare Public Forum, Architect Defends Decision to Take Down Former Folk Art Museum
description: An architect typically doesnt go before the public to defend a private project. But on Tuesday night Liz Diller of Diller Scofidio & Renfro stood before a crowd of 650 people, many of them her peers, to explain in detail the six-month process by which her firm tried to save the former home of the American Folk Art Museum before deciding it was impossible.

title: And the Grammy-Goers Go to ...
description: After Beyonc shook her booty, Lorde took selfies with Taylor Swift, and Madonna wobbled offstage, the real partying began Sunday night, as Grammy winners and losers decamped to various after-parties across Los Angeles.

title: Crime Writer Henning Mankell Says He Has Cancer
description: Henning Mankell, a master of Scandinavian crime literature, has been diagnosed with cancer, he said Wednesday in a Swedish newspaper.

title: Neanderthals Leave Their Mark on Us
description: Ever since the discovery in 2010 that Neanderthals interbred with the ancestors of living humans, scientists have been trying to determine how their DNA affects people today. Now two new studies have traced the history of Neanderthal DNA, and have pinpointed a number of genes that may have medical importance today.

title: 20 Al Jazeera Journalists Face Charges in Egypt
description: CAIRO  Egyptian prosecutors said on Wednesday that they were charging 20 journalists working for the Al Jazeera television network with conspiring with a terrorist group and broadcasting false images of a civil war that raises alarms about the states collapse.

title: All Right, There Are Two Republican Parties
description: Republican pundits have been arguing recently that immigration reform could splinter the party ahead of the 2014 elections. They shouldnt be worrying about immigration. The Republicans response to President Obamas State of the Union showed that the G.O.P. is actually two parties, or perhaps even more.

title: Grammys Spur Streaming; Katy Perry Single Hits No. 1
description: Lorde may have been the Grammy Awards most talked-about artist on Sunday night  more of the 15.2 million Grammy tweets were about her than any other act, Twitter reported  but when it came to streaming music, Daft Punk appears to have gotten the biggest early lift.

title: Applaud, Tweet and Repeat at the State of the Union
description: Immediately after a presidents State of the Union address is delivered, news organizations frequently seek to answer a question: How many times did members of Congress stand and applaud? In this era when social media has become an important arena for politics, and in some ways eclipses the statements and interviews representatives and senators issue after an address like the State of the Union, another question may be more important: How many tweets did members of Congress send during the speech?

title: Dow Chief Says Buffett Supports Him in Loeb Fight
description: Dow Chemical may have expanded its stock buyback program and dividend, but it showed little inclination to make further concessions to activist investors like Daniel S. Loeb.

title: Migration of Monarch Butterflies Shrinks Again Under Inhospitable Conditions
description: Faltering under extreme weather and vanishing habitats, the yearly winter migration of monarch butterflies to a handful of forested Mexican mountains dwindled precipitously in December, continuing what scientists said was an increasingly alarming decline.

title: The Sound of a Tree Falling
description: The title song from Terry Roches album.

title: State of the Union: Few Horatio Alger Stories
description: There were a lot of pedigree shout-outs Tuesday night in the State of the Union address and the responses, generally in reference to humble beginnings.

title: Francis
description: A song by Terre Roche.

title: New Owner of Patch Lays Off Hundreds
description: Just two weeks ago, AOL announced that it was handing over the majority stake in Patch, its troubled local news enterprise, to Hale Global, an investment company that specializes in turning around troubled companies through technological innovation. Hale said at the time that its intention was to keep operating all of Patchs 900 sites and that no staffing decision had been made.

title: Sothebys Sets Financial Path. Now, for the Art.
description: Sothebys is revamping its financial science  now, for the art. The auctioneers stock popped, at least initially, on the news on Wednesday of a $300 million special dividend and new criteria for investment. The plan addresses some aspects of the critique by the activist investor Daniel S. Loeb. But governance and broader strategy remain at issue.

title: Messages of Relentless, Spiraling Bloodshed from the Central African Republic
description: The emergency director for Human Rights Watch, Peter Bouckaert, has documented some of his most vivid warnings yet on the killing in the Central African Republic, describing a country in the relentless, spiraling bloodshed of sectarian retaliation on the civilians left behind as rebels withdraw.

title: Decoding the Feds Statement
description: The statement Wednesday from the Federal Open Market Committee, the policy-making group of the Federal Reserve, offers its assessment of current economic conditions.

title: Dining in Dublin, From Boxty to Blaa
description: Manor Street, the main street that runs through the neighborhood ofStoneybatter in north Dublin, is lined with traditional pubs. L. Mulligan Grocer, as its name suggests, is housed in a former pub and food shop. And it fits right in: A long bar, lined with taps, dominates the right side of the room.

title: Dublin, Beyond the Guinness Storehouse
description: For the alternative R & B artist James Vincent McMorrow, the worlds image of Dublin fails to capture what makes the city special for locals.

title: House Hunting in ... Austria
description: A RESTORED FARMHOUSE OUTSIDE SALZBURG

title: A Farmhouse Outside Salzburg
description: A four-bedroom home built in 1890 is on the market for $1 million.

title: Military Plans Reflect Afghanistan Uncertainty
description: WASHINGTON  American and NATO military planners, facing continued political uncertainty about whether foreign troops will remain in Afghanistan after December, have drawn up plans to deploy a force this summer that is tailored to assume a training mission in 2015 but is also small enough to withdraw if no deal for an enduring presence is reached, alliance officials said.

title: Wry Hybrid of Debonair and Tetchy
description: Debonair, an adjective that fits the actor and singer James Naughton to a T, isnt a word that describes the despairing, grandiose and perverse fantasists who inhabit the songs of Randy Newman. But Mr. Naughton, 68, whose anthology of Mr. Newmans work opened the 16th season of Lincoln Centers American Songbook series at the Allen Room on Tuesday evening, persuasively empathized with Mr. Newmans cranky, woebegone characters. Typical is the narrator of You Can Leave Your Hat On. Addressing a woman who may be a prostitute as she strips and shakes her breasts, he grunts, You give me reason to live.

title: Grammy Producer Responds to Trent Reznors Angry Critique
description: The executive producer of the Grammy Awards has responded to a public complaint by Trent Reznor that his performance at the show was disrespected.

title: Pet Owners Brace for Chinese New Year Fireworks
description: The explosions of Lunar New Year fireworks are considered a sound of celebration and a deterrent to evil spirits. But they also are responsible for injuries and fires and cause air quality, which is already poor in many parts of China, to worsen.

title: Palestinian Shot Dead by Israeli Forces in West Bank
description: JERUSALEM  A Palestinian man, Muhammad Mahmoud Mubarak, 21, was fatally shot on Wednesday by Israeli forces in the West Bank. The Israeli military said in a statement that Mr. Mubarak opened fire first at a military post north of Ramallah and that soldiers fired back to eliminate the imminent threat to their lives. There were no casualties among the soldiers.

title: Apps With No Rules? No Problem
description: Toca Boca, the Swedish app developer that makes digital products for children, is slowly building a formidable library of apps.

title: What Would You Do With Eight Tiny Subarus?
description: Look through the automotive listings on any citys Craigslist page, and youre bound to find a fairly predictable list of vehicles like pickups, S.U.V.'s and late-model sedans from Detroit and Japan. But once in awhile you come across something unique.

title: Video From Snowdens German TV Interview
description: Updated, 8:12 p.m. | In excerpts from an interview with German television made available to The Lede on Wednesday, the former National Security Agency contractor Edward J. Snowden said that he sleeps well in Russia, where he enjoys temporary asylum, despite reading recently on Buzzfeed that some of his former colleagues in United States intelligence would like to kill him. I dont lose sleep because Ive done what I feel I needed to do, Mr. Snowden said. It was the right thing to do and Im not going to be afraid.

title: Excerpt From 'Brokeback Mountain'
description: A scene from the opera.

title: Obama Kicks Off His Opportunity Agenda
description: A day after his State of the Union address, the president visited a Costco warehouse in Maryland to promote his economic plan and discuss raising the minimum wage.

title: On View | Frank Lloyd Wrights Love-Hate Relationship With the American City
description: Frank Lloyd Wright was generally not a fan of cities. He thought them dirty, congested and hollow. In his 1932 book, The Disappearing City, he wrote of the American metropolis: A parasite of the spirit is here, a whirling dervish in a whirling vortex. The exhibition Frank Lloyd Wright and the City: Density vs. Dispersal, which opens this Saturday at the Museum of Modern Art, examines the legendary architects feelings about urbanism through his plans for a horizontal anti-metropolis he called Broadacre City, a lifelong project that some consider to have been a blueprint for suburbia. Perhaps surprisingly, there are also schemes for several unrealized skyscrapers, the very icons of the cities he held in such noisy contempt.

title: Europes Banking Risk Plan Is a Long Shot
description: The European Union on Wednesday revealed a long-awaited proposal to reduce the systemic risk posed by big banks, a measure that would bring the blocs regulations more closely into line with those of the United States. But it is unlikely to become law anytime soon.

title: For a Wife, the Musing Never Stops
description: Two innovative books published in the 1970s used fragmentation and discontinuity to create kaleidoscopic portraits of their heroines lives. Renata Adlers Speedboat, narrated by a woman who worked at a tabloid newspaper, jump-cut among vignettes from her life to capture the incongruities of her experience and the larger incongruities of American life in the 60s and 70s. Elizabeth Hardwicks Sleepless Nights, whose narrator bore more than a passing resemblance to the author, mapped the contours of her life by putting memories, aphorisms and observations on shuffle.

title: Below the Bikini Line, a Growing Trend
description: For the last decade, the Brazilian bikini wax has seemed to dominate salons and popular culture alike, leaving its adherents completely bare (or with just a suggestion of hair) in their nether regions.

title: Daring to Be Free, in a Story Line and in the Marketplace
description: Perhaps the most impressive thing about Broken Age, an enchanting, imaginative fable from Double Fine Productions, is that its makers have created a video game that is at least as interesting as the story of how it was made.

title: Wendy Davis Responds to Criticism
description: In a speech Tuesday night, the Texas state senator and Democratic candidate for governor responded to accusations that she has misstated details of her experience as a single mother.

title: Singing of Toilets, Instead of for Tonys
description: In 1956, Hank Beebe was a young composer just getting started in the New York theater when he auditioned for something his agent had called the Chevy show. It sounded like a big break. I thought he meant the television show with Dinah Shore, Mr. Beebe said.

title: In TriBeCa, a Savile Row Fantasy
description: THERE ARE ONLY a few ways to utter the sentence Ive seen a lot of hand-rolled pocket square edges, and those are by far the best, and most of them are awful, pretentious, smug. Nick had it down, though.

title: Loving Ice Cream and an Older Woman
description: Wednesday was the day that the world had no idea it had been waiting for: the day that Louis C. K. made available online a movie that has gone virtually unseen since he filmed it a decade and a half ago. The movie, which he wrote and directed, is called Tomorrow Night, and he has described it as having been living in film cans since receiving a few festival screenings way back when.

title: Blending In With Her Environment
description: Chelsea Darlings look begins with her name. The 24-year-old New Orleans hairstylist was born Chelsea Martin, but then she read an article about how choosing a name was a way to shape an identity. So she adopted the moniker Chelsea Darling, inspired in part by the 60s and 70s style she favors, the era of Candy Darling and Sid Vicious.

title: Obama on Foreign Policy
description: In his State of the Union address, President Obama addressed crucial foreign policy issues.

title: From the Wetlands to Williamsburg, the Zen Tricksters Ride Again
description: It could have been the Wetlands circa 1994, except that it was Brooklyn Bowl in 2014. Which doesnt seem possible, since that would make me  hmm  carry the 1  and. Really? You know what they say: All the years combine.

title: Attorney General on Target Data Breach
description: Speaking before the Senate Judiciary Committee, Eric H. Holder Jr. confirmed that the Justice Department was investigating the credit card data theft that affected millions of Target customers.

title: After Big Bet, Google Is to Sell Motorola Unit
description: Larry Page, Googles co-founder and chief executive, likes to talk about big bets and moonshots. But the thing about moonshots is that they can crash into earth.

title: Law Enforcement Strikes Back in Bitcoin Hearing
description: Law enforcement officials testified on Wednesday that virtual currencies like Bitcoin had opened up new avenues for crime that government has not been able to keep up with.

title: Top Russian Biathlete Reportedly Fails Doping Test
description: A Russian biathlete who is the reigning womens European champion has been suspended for a doping violation just a week before the Olympic opening ceremony in Sochi, according to Russian reports. The suspension dealt a blow to the Olympics host country and cast a pall over one of Russias signature sports.

title: Leaping Uncontained by the Stage or the Screen
description: When the Russian ballerina Natalia Osipova announced last year that she would be joining the Royal Ballet, many New Yorkers were disappointed, fearing that a commitment to London would mean that we would see less of her here, where she has danced superlatively with American Ballet Theater. And indeed Ms. Osipova is not scheduled for Ballet Theaters 2014 Metropolitan Opera House season. Yet on Monday, New Yorkers could watch her with her new colleagues in Giselle, via one of the Royal Opera Houses cinema broadcasts.

title: For a New Jersey Mayor, a Surprise Invitation to the Super Bowl
description: The mayor of East Rutherford, N.J., the town in which Super Bowl XLVIII will be played on Sunday, finally has a ticket to the game.

title: Pictures of the Day: Central African Republic and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Central African Republic, Syria, Gaza City and Atlanta.

title: Check-In by Smartphone
description: Aiming for efficiency, two Aloft hotels will begin offering keyless check-ins, allowing smartphone-equipped guests to bypass the front desk and proceed directly to their rooms, where doors will open when activated via Bluetooth technology and the phone is held in front of the lock.

title: Be Careful at the Book Club, the Author Might Be There
description: The living room in the plush apartment on Central Park West was filled with all the trappings of a traditional book club.

title: Snowboarders Explore Their Backyard
description: Jeremy Jones, a professional snowboarder, built a career on exploring remote mountains by helicopter and snowboarding down them. Then he began to discover his backyard under the power of his own feet.

title: Obesity Is Found to Gain Its Hold in Earliest Years
description: For many obese adults, the die was cast by the time they were 5 years old. A major new study of more than 7,000 children has found that a third of children who were overweight in kindergarten were obese by eighth grade. And almost every child who was very obese remained that way.

title: Video: Snowboarder Explores His Own Backyard
description: In the past six years, Jeremy Jones has collaborated with Teton Gravity Research to create a trilogy of films: Deeper, Further and now Higher. These films document his efforts to explore and snowboard remote mountains under his own power.

title: Ita Unibanco Buys Controlling Stake in CorpBanca of Chile
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  The Brazilian bank Ita Unibanco has acquired a controlling stake in the Chilean bank CorpBanca, a move that follows its growing ambitions to expand in Latin America.

title: Big Profit at Facebook as It Tilts to Mobile
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Ten years after its founding as a simple website for a few thousand Harvard undergraduates to manage their social lives, Facebook is a far different company.

title: A Whirl of Memories and Ardent Invention, From Nureyev to Now
description: New Yorks Dance on Camera festival has now reached its 42nd edition. Started as a Dance Films Association initiative and itinerant for its first 25 years, it found a home at the Film Society of Lincoln Center in 1996. The schedule for the 2014 season, which runs from Friday through Tuesday, is crowded.

title: American Idol, at 13, Is Trying to Stay Relevant
description: Audiences, like French presidents, cant always be trusted.

title: District 3 Winter Regionals Friday Open Pairs
description: At the District 3 Winter Regional in Rye Brook, N.Y., two weeks ago, the winners of the Friday Open Pairs were Bjorn Fallenius and Andrew Rosenthal of New York City. They were originally announced as second, but a score correction moved them into first by 0.84 match points ahead of Gail Greenberg and Jeff Hand of New York City. Third were Ann Borgschulte of Lexington, Mass., and Stephen Gladyszak of Chelsea, Mass.

title: A Soviet Composers Circle of Friends
description: It takes a village to raise some composers to prominence. That was the lesson to be learned from an onstage discussion on Tuesday evening at the Juilliard School that preceded one of the six free concerts in the schools remarkable Focus! festival.

title: For Already Vulnerable Penguins, Study Finds Climate Change Is Another Danger
description: Life has never been easy for just-hatched Magellanic penguins, but climate change is making it worse, according to a decades-long study of the largest breeding colony of the birds.

title: Newly Released Books
description: This month, three novels and three collections of stories, each with a vivid sense of place, including an absurdist version of the Midwest, a gritty corner of British Columbia and a fictional Eastern European country in 1939.

title: Industry in North Dakota to Cut Flared Natural Gas
description: HOUSTON  Faced with growing criticism and lawsuits, an oil industry task force representing hundreds of companies in North Dakota pledged on Wednesday to make an all-out effort to capture almost all the natural gas that is being flared in the Bakken shale oil field by the end of the decade.

title: Obamas Call for a Year of Action
As Chinas Economy Slows, the Pain Hits Home
description: HONG KONG  Piles of unsold coal line rural roads in north-central China. Some iron ore mines near Beijing are operating at a fraction of capacity. Chinese farm products are even increasingly scorned by the Chinese consumer.

title: The Prognosis Is Grim, but Im Living My Life
He Had a Hammer, and His Hammer Was Song
description: To the Editor:

title: Citigroup Joins Rivals in Permitting Junior Bankers to Take Saturdays Off
description: Memo to junior bankers at Citigroup: You can soon join your friends at other Wall Street banks in taking Saturdays off.

title: Which Vision for Oscar?
description: LOS ANGELES  At some point, deep in the four and a half years it took to make Gravity, Alfonso Cuarn, the director and co-writer, screened his lost-in-space saga for a test audience. And? It was a disaster, he said.

title: Why Are We Talking About Wendy Daviss Choices?
description: Wendy Davis, a Texas state senator and Democratic candidate in the race to become governor of Texas in 2015, has been under attack for blurring and misstating details of her story as a single mother. If Wendy Davis were Henry Davis, would the national media  including The New York Times (Texas Democrat Defends Back Story Under Criticism)  be covering the attacks on her as she and her opponents battle to define her personal and family history?

title: C.I.A. Drone Bases
description: To the Editor:

title: Jobless in North Carolina
description: To the Editor:

title: Nederlander Organization Agrees to Improve Disability Access at Its Theaters
description: The Nederlander Organization has agreed to increase access for disabled people at the nine theaters it operates on Broadway, lawyers for the federal government said Wednesday.

title: Times Minute | Grimm's Blow-Up
description: Also on the Minute, when journalists migrate to online upstarts, and is climate change killing baby penguins?

title: Times Minute | Grimms Blow-Up
description: In the Video

title: Q. and A. | Playwright Thomas Bradshaw on Race, Porn and Suburbia
description: Thomas Bradshaws plays have elicited belly laughs from some viewers and disgust from others. Naysayers have called the 33-year-old playwrights shows, which include Purity, Burning and Job, ugly fantasies and horror shows. One Chicago theater critic went so far as to warn Bradshaw to get out of town. The reactions are due to the fact that Bradshaw, who is black, stages outrageous behavior  including child rape, racially charged sex and modern-day slavery  in casual, conversational ways.

title: Aiming for Recognition, Axa Trims Its Name
description: AXA EQUITABLE is taking an ax to its name, trimming it to Axa so it will conform in the United States with the French-based companys brand elsewhere.

title: On Any Given Night Out
description: Its just supper, baby, the celebrity chef Mario Batali said merrily on a frigid Friday evening, surveying a dinner-party scene of the sort some would give their eye teeth to join.

title: A Sporty Classic With Fresh Detailing
description: Flip through any of the latest fashion magazines and youll be struck by the ubiquity of the sports influences for spring: loads of mesh, track pants, crunchy Teva-style sandals  remember those sparkly numbers at Prada?  and athletic bomber jackets like the ones here, any of which will raise your outerwear game. No everyday bombers, these jackets are reimagined with luxe fabrics and cool embellishments. Another reason to like them: their versatility. Wear over sporty looks, like a mesh top and silk track pants; or as Elettra Wiedemann (shown here) did, wearing her Giambattista Valli as a statement piece over trousers and a print top.

title: In London, Fashion History Up Close
description: For those who were shut out of the blockbuster Savage Beauty show at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in 2011 or, because of the crowds, couldnt get close enough to the Alexander McQueen clothes to actually see them, a trip to London may be in order.

title: Standing Tall on Its Own
description: On the Grammys red carpet on Sunday, there were plenty of notable outfits, like Katy Perrys Valentino couture dress and Taylor Swifts all-grown-up Gucci gown, and some genuine moments of oddness. (Madonna. Enough said.) But perhaps no single sartorial touch drew as much attention as did the oversize hat Pharrell Williams wore as he jauntily walked past the paparazzi and chatted with Ryan Seacrest, who, strangely, never thought to ask, What are you wearing? (Mr. Williams later told another interviewer it was vintage Vivienne Westwood.) The hat invited comparisons to the Royal Canadian Mounties, Smokey Bear and even the Arbys logo. And, inevitably, within minutes of its appearance, the hat had its own Twitter account, @Pharrellhat, and, by the next morning, more than 16,000 followers.

title: Anything but Uniform
description: No matter what happens Sunday in the Super Bowl between the Seattle Seahawks and the Denver Broncos, there will be one West Coast team that comes out a winner: Nike.

title: Winter-White Makeup
description: Winter white is a fresh choice for clothing, but the dry-cleaning bills can be downright chilling. This season, the shade is also widely available in makeup, with somewhat less risk to your pocketbook.

title: Did Google Really Lose on Its Original Motorola Deal?
description: Updated, 8:57 p.m. |

title: Personal Trainer, Worn on a Wrist
description: My first experience with a fitness tracker was memorable. It fit snugly in my pocket and estimated the number of steps I took and the calories I burned each day. There was just one problem: It seemed to think I was getting roughly the same amount of exercise regardless of whether I was jogging around a track or eating French fries in a diner. After about two weeks, I stopped wearing it, most likely because I lost it.

title: Loud, Strong, Committed and Always in Search of America
description: Pete Seeger, who died at 94 on Monday, inspired generations of musicians to think about music in a particular way  or, it turns out, many particular ways, depending on the musician. Some were inspired to consider the nature of the instruments they played, and for banjo players in particular, Mr. Seeger was a role model and a master teacher. For most, though, he was the consummate political singer, a campaigner for free speech and the right to protest, whether the cause was personal rights or the state of the environment. Since Mr. Seegers death, several musicians and others who were inspired by him spoke about their experiences with Mr. Seeger.

title: A Super Bowl View in the Meatpacking District
description: With prices for a luxury box at the Super Bowl hovering at $500,000, some New Yorkers may be wondering where they can toss back a few glasses of Dom and enjoy this all-American pastime with other well moisturized types who aspire to be high rollers. Enter FC Gotham, a flashy sports lounge that opened recently in the meatpacking district.

title: Super Bowling Down Broadway
description: Super Bowl sideshows have taken over 13 blocks of Broadway, building up to Sunday's game. A toboggan run, goal-kicking nets and autograph hunters now jostle with New Yorkers along the fabled street.

title: Obamas Speech Raises Hopes of Advocates of Mortgage Finance Overhaul
description: The presidents State of the Union address on Tuesday provided a glimmer of hope for those looking for action to revamp Americas mortgage system.

title: New Concern About Testosterone and Heart Risks
description: A large new study found that prescription testosterone raised the risk of heart attacks in older men and in middle-aged men with a history of heart disease, prompting some experts on Wednesday to call for more extensive warning labels on the drugs.

title: Dynamic Duo: Alfonso and Jons Cuarn
description: The father-son filmmaking team Alfonso and Jons Cuarn talk about the draw of space, character and their Oscar-nominated film, Gravity.

title: A Barneys Campaign Embraces a Gender Identity Issue
description: Arin Andrews and Katie Hill do not look out of place in the new Barneys New York campaign. Both have nonexistent hips, are right in the ballpark of six feet tall and arent yet old enough for a legal drink. But theres one marked difference between them and the models you ordinarily see on runways and in the pages of Vogue and Elle: Mr. Andrews, 17, was born a girl, and Ms. Hill, 19, a boy.

title: Address by Obama Drew Fewest Viewers Since 2000
description: More networks than ever before covered the State of the Union address Tuesday night, but the total audience still came in lower than any year since 2000.

title: Sales at Metropolitan Window Fashions and Others
description: Sight Unseen is discounting everything on its site by 20 percent, through Saturday (the Pyramid lamp by Bzippy & Co., usually $275, is $220); 347-748-1231, shop.sightunseen.com.

title: A Hotel That Takes in the Neighborhood
description: When the Broome hotel opens on Feb. 14 in SoHo, it will have a European look, but the furnishings will be mostly homegrown. We wanted local artisans and vendors, said Vincent Boitier, one of the four French partners and a previous owner of LOrange Bleue, the SoHo restaurant that closed in 2012.

title: Marcel Wanderss Wonders
description: It took some time for the Dutch designer Marcel Wanders to get his professional bearings. He attended four art and design schools, ultimately graduating from one in Arnhem, in the Netherlands, in 1988 (with honors). Then his career took off. In the 1990s, he joined the influential collective Droog Design, and in 2001 he was a founder of the furniture company Moooi.

title: A Model Instrument
description: Peter Dilworth, a graduate of the Media Lab at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, and Maxwell Bogue, a toy inventor, have put the idea of 3-D printing into the hands of everyday users without the need for software or even a computer.

title: A Mystery at the Bend
description: LOS ANGELES  New arrivals to this city are often told by locals to hop in the car and take Sunset Boulevard to the Pacific Ocean. It is a beautiful drive, world famous. It is also an initiation into the California myth without the downsides: you glide past the traffic-clogged 405 freeway, wind through rustic canyons where movie stars live and breathe in the ocean breezes west of Brentwood, as if nature had provided Angelenos with free air-conditioning.

title: Sometimes Asparagus Is More Than Asparagus
description: Helen Yoest didnt set out, as she said recently, to write a horticultural Kama Sutra. It was sort of an accident. Ms. Yoest, a garden writer, was researching an article on avocados when she learned that the fruit was considered an aphrodisiac. What makes it so, she wondered: The nutrients? The shape? Bingo. Turns out their reputation dates to the Aztecs, who marveled at how avocados grew in pairs, and named the plant the testicle tree.

title: Blue Bottle Raises $25.75 Million, Including From High-Powered Friends
description: Few brands are as beloved in the tech community as the Blue Bottle Coffee Company, a nearly 12-year-old purveyor of gourmet brews made in painstakingly detailed fashion.

title: Major Expansion Ahead at The Washington Post
description: The Washington Post has significantly increased its budget and plans to make dozens of newsroom hires under its new owner, the Amazon founder Jeffrey P. Bezos, the papers executive editor, Marty Baron, said in an interview on Wednesday.

title: Planters: Best Supporting Actors
description: It may seem like an odd time to be thinking about planters, with signs of the polar vortex still in evidence. But as Jon Carloftis, a garden designer with clients like Google and Makers Mark, said, Now is the time everyone needs something green in their life.

title: Boeing Shares Fall as It Cautions on Its Profits in 2014
description: After doubling over the last year, Boeings stock dropped 5.3 percent on Wednesday when the plane maker projected flattening profits in 2014.

title: Music Data Firms to Collaborate on Internet Radio Platform
description: Gracenote, a digital music data service that the Tribune Company bought last month for $170 million, is quickly moving forward with its plans for a customizable Internet radio program that would let consumer brands, car companies and anyone else have their own music app.

title: Extra Arms (and Teeth) for Wrangling Firewood
description: In our family, it is my job to build and poke at fires in our wood-burning fireplace. I use wrought-iron tools I bought on eBay, and they have served me well. But this winter, I tested something new: Grill Daddy King Tong fire tongs (about $45), which promised to let me manipulate smoldering logs with less effort.

title: Should I Update the Flooring in My Entry Hall?
description: Q. The floors in our home are mostly hardwood except for the entry hall, which is dated tile. Is it worth replacing?

title: If You Can Make It Here...
description: Sure, a Super Bowl always produces a hero or two, but William C. Rhoden says a Super Bowl hero made in New York carries a little something special.

title: Video Sports of The Times: If You Can Make It Here
Get Game-Ready with Shopping Events Starting the Week of Jan. 30
description: Get Game-Ready

title: Despite Decades of Enmity, Israel Quietly Aids Syrian Civilians
description: NAHARIYA, Israel  Two brothers, ages 10 and 8, were playing marbles outside their home in a town in Syria when a rocket decapitated the older one and critically wounded his sibling. Having rushed the surviving child to a local hospital, the mother recalled, medics told her: If you want to save your son, you should take him to Israel.

title: Knicks Shumpert Is Day to Day After Shoulder Injury
description: Knicks Coach Mike Woodson said the sprained right shoulder Iman Shumpert sustained in Tuesdays victory over the Boston Celtics would be re-evaluated Thursday morning. Appearing Wednesday on ESPN Radio, Woodson said Shumpert was day to day but cast doubt over his availability for Thursdays game against the Cleveland Cavaliers.

title: Obamas Free-Trade Conundrum
description: WASHINGTON  IN his State of the Union address on Tuesday, President Obama focused on reversing the growth of economic inequality in the United States and restoring the American dream. At the same time, he also announced his support for fast track authority that would limit Congresss role in determining the content of trade agreements.

title: Syrian Oppositions Calm at Talks Surprises as Officials Falter
description: GENEVA  The Syrian government officials were expected to present themselves as the grown-ups at the peace conference here, representatives of a capable, sovereign government facing opponents they call political amateurs at best, and at worst, terrorist rabble.

title: New York Wants to Banish a Symbol of Love: Mute Swans
description: In the war against invasive species, the targets are typically unappealing. Think feral pigs, snakehead fish, Asian long-horned beetles and emerald ash borers. But now, the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation has declared war on mute swans  the jumbo, snow-white waterfowl with the long, graceful necks  which were introduced from Europe in the late 1800s for their aesthetic appeal.

title: John R. Huizenga, Physicist at Fore of Nuclear Era, Dies at 92
description: John R. Huizenga, a physicist who helped build the worlds first atom bomb, solve dozens of atomic riddles and debunk claims that scientists in Utah had achieved nuclear fusion in a jar of water, died on Saturday in San Diego. He was 92.

title: Obama Orders Creation of MyRA Savings Accounts
description: Making good on a State of the Union address promise, President Obama on Wednesday ordered the creation of new employer-sponsored savings accounts intended to help more people get started saving for retirement.

title: Detroit Art Museum Offers Plan to Avoid Sale of Art
description: The Detroit Institute of Arts, whose world-class collection has been targeted as a potential source of cash to help dig Detroit out of federal bankruptcy, announced Wednesday that it would raise $100 million to help save itself, joining a group of private foundations that have already pledged $370 million toward the effort.

title: A Checkered History
description: Americare Certified Special Services, the home health care agency seeking to expand its role, has faced lawsuits and federal and state inquiries.

title: Maryland Gunman Wrote in Diary About Killing People
description: For more than a year, the 19-year-old gunman who opened fire at a shopping mall in Columbia, Md., last Saturday, killing two skateboard store employees, made sporadic references in his journal about killing people and showed awareness that he struggled with mental illness, police officials said Wednesday.

title: New York State Recommends Expanding License of Health Agency With Checkered Past
description: It was a medical scheme that shocked the public conscience when it came to light in 2001: Two dozen mentally ill residents of a Queens adult home were forced to have unnecessary prostate surgery that generated tens of thousands of dollars in government fees.

title: A Pioneering Black Quarterbacks Lasting Legacy
description: LONG BEACH, Calif.  President Obama, hosting the undefeated 1972 Dolphins at the White House last summer, made his way around the green room before moving out for a public ceremony.

title: Plan on Repaying Debt Is Presented to Detroits Creditors
description: Drawing the bankrupt city of Detroit a step closer to remaking itself, the citys emergency manager on Wednesday provided creditors with a detailed proposal for how much of the citys $18 billion debt Detroit intended to pay back.

title: Threat by Staten Island Lawmaker Adds to a Reputation as Hot-Tempered
description: Representative Michael G. Grimm is a hothead.

title: How to Get More Early Bloomers
description: WHEN New York Citys mayor, Bill de Blasio, went to Albany earlier this week to talk about his program for universal preschool, the discussion reportedly focused on funding, not on whether or how preschool would actually help children. President Obama seemed equally confident when he introduced his plan for universal preschool last year, flatly stating, We know this works. But the state of research is actually much murkier. And unless policy makers begin to design preschool programs in ways that can be evaluated later, the situation wont get any clearer.

title: The Incredible Shrinking Presidency
description: It was hard to watch President Obama during Tuesdays State of the Union address and not see a man who has had his coat trimmed and his ambitions adjusted.

title: Wall Streets New Housing Bonanza
description: Wall Streets latest trillion-dollar idea involves slicing and dicing debt tied to single-family homes and selling the bonds to investors around the world.

title: How Preschool Got Hot
description: All of a sudden, early childhood education is really, really popular. Everybodys favorite. If early childhood education were an actor, it would be Tom Hanks or Meryl Streep. If it were a video game, it would be Candy Crush or Angry Birds, minus the spyware.

title: Tests Said to Find Formaldehyde in West Virginia Tap Water
description: Tests on the water supply in Charleston, W. Va., a week after a chemical spill tainted the citys water system turned up traces of formaldehyde, suggesting that theres a lot more we dont know about the consequences of the spill, an environmental expert told a state legislative committee on Wednesday.

title: How Pressure Mounted for Development in Hoboken
description: HOBOKEN, N.J.  Last May 8, a severe rainstorm left the streets of this city flooded once again, causing the mayor, Dawn Zimmer, to recall the inundation from Hurricane Sandy.

title: Pre-K, the Great Debate
description: Against all odds, prekindergarten is gaining ground.

title: U.S. Says Russia Tested Missile, Despite Treaty
description: WASHINGTON  The United States informed its NATO allies this month that Russia had tested a new ground-launched cruise missile, raising concerns about Moscows compliance with a landmark arms control accord.

title: Colleague of SAC Leader Was Not Alerted to Trades
description: The billionaire investor Steven A. Cohen kept one of his closest associates at SAC Capital Advisors in the dark about the hedge funds rapid selling of a substantial stock position in two drug companies, just days before the companies reported disappointing results of a clinical trial for an Alzheimers drug.

title: The Farm Bill Could Have Been Worse
description: Few bills of real substance emerge from todays polarized Congress, and those that do tend to be misshapen lumps. They have enough useful provisions to win approval from Democrats, but are weighed down by the dangerous and occasionally bizarre demands of the many branches of the Republican Party.

title: Uncertainty Over Whether N.F.L. Settlements Money Will Last
description: As intriguing football matchups go, Sundays Super Bowl has nothing on one looming down the turnpike in federal court in Philadelphia  with Judge Anita B. Brody the ultimate referee.

title: Secrecy Behind Executions
description: It is bad enough that the death penalty is barbaric, racist and arbitrary in its application, but it is also becoming less transparent as the dwindling number of death-penalty states work to hide the means by which they kill people.

title: New Government for Czech Republic
description: President Milos Zeman of the Czech Republic appointed a new center-left government on Wednesday, ending a protracted period of political paralysis that has destabilized the country. The freshly installed prime minister, Bohuslav Sobotka, 42, has pledged to shepherd the country toward stability following a corruption scandal last summer that forced Prime Minister Petr Necas to resign. A subsequent interim government failed to win parliaments confidence. Mr. Sobotka, a Social Democrat, has pledged to combat some austerity measures of previous conservative governments.

title: Academy Rescinds Song Nomination for Alone Yet Not Alone
description: LOS ANGELES The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences said its governors had voted to rescind an Oscar nomination for the song Alone Yet Not Alone, from the movie of the same title, because one of its creators, Bruce Broughton, had improperly advised fellow members of the Academys music branch that he was in the running for a nomination.

title: Presidential Power vs. Congressional Inertia
After Keeping Company With Mobsters, Politician Now Speaks Their Language
description: Years ago, a Newsday editor had a great idea for a young reporter. Go, he told me, to the Bergin Hunt and Fish Club and see what the boys are doing on the first day of deer-hunting season.

title: Iraq: More Violence in Baghdad
description: Car bombings and shootings in Baghdad on Wednesday killed at least 19 people, according to security and medical officials, adding to a death toll that has been rising quickly. The four car bombs targeted Shiite neighborhoods. Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki, meanwhile, called on Sunni tribes in Falluja to support the Shiite-led governments forces so they can storm it and clear out antigovernment Sunni militants.

title: The Siren Song of the Hebrides
description: Lured by the beaches and the otherworldly light on a Scottish island, a family builds an unconventional beach house there.

title: The Lure of the Hebrides
description: The Scottish Hebrides are known for an almost otherworldly allure that draws visitors back year after year.

title: Warrantless Surveillance Challenged by Defendant
description: WASHINGTON  A Colorado resident charged with terrorism-related offenses challenged the constitutionality on Wednesday of a 2008 law allowing the National Security Agency to conduct a sweeping program of surveillance without warrants on American soil. The challenge  the first of its kind  could lead to a Supreme Court test of the program.

title: Jump in Prostitution Arrests in Super Bowl Week
description: Four days before the Super Bowl, just a few blocks from the N.F.L. extravaganza known as Super Bowl Boulevard on Broadway in Midtown Manhattan, a different scene was playing out Wednesday at Midtown Community Court on West 54th Street.

title: Senator Asks Veterans Agency to Review How Financial Advisers Are Accredited
description: Senator Claire McCaskill of Missouri is asking the Department of Veteran Affairs to examine its process for accrediting thousands of financial advisers in the face of concerns over abuses of veterans benefits.

title: Winning Powerball and Lottery Numbers for Jan. 29, 2014
Remembering My Mothers Obsession
description: Of all the troubling events from my childhood, one of the most enduring remains the afternoon I visited a prisoner serving a life sentence for murder. It was 1978 and I was 9 years old, escorted to Western Penitentiary in Pittsburgh by my mother, who, compelled by a lifelong objective of raising her sons awareness of injustice in the world, no doubt considered this to be a well-suited occasion.

title: Russell Wilson, a Standout Whos Easy to Miss
description: It was no surprise that Super Bowl week launched with a frantic rush to surround Richard Sherman but with plenty of good space available in the presence of Russell Wilson. That injustice of unbalanced attention revealed far more about the malleability of the news media  especially during the long, news-starved run-up to the game  than it did about either player.

title: Obama to Meet Jordanian King
description: President Obama host King Abdullah II of Jordan next month at Sunnylands, a sprawling desert estate in Rancho Mirage, Calif. The White House said Mr. Obama and the king would discuss the Middle East peace process and the Syrian civil war, which has sent a wave of refugees into Jordan.

title: A Former Regulator Returns to Private Practice
description: Before David Meister was butting heads with Wall Streets top defense lawyers, he was one of them.

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, January 30, 2014
description: It was like something you would see if they told you the plague broke out and you had to run for your life.

title: Pakistani Premier Forms Group to Start Talks With Taliban
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif named a four-member commission on Wednesday to initiate peace talks with the Pakistani Taliban, saying he would pursue a dialogue with the militants despite recent terrorist attacks that have left the country reeling.

title: Maryland: Shooting Suspect Wrote of Death
description: The suspect in a deadly shooting at a mall wrote about killing people in his journal and said that he was ready to die, the police said Wednesday. The man, Darion Aguilar, 19, expressed a general hatred of others in entries over the past year, the Howard County police department said. Mr. Aguilar wrote that his plan was set, but did not say what that meant, and apologized to his family for what he was about to do, the police said. The police said Mr. Aguilar wrote that he might need help for a mental health problem, but never told his family. The police believe Mr. Aguilar killed two employees of the skate shop Zumiez on Saturday at the Mall in Columbia before killing himself.

title: Facing Complaints, Columbias President Calls for Transparency in Assault Inquiries
description: Columbia Universitys president, responding to complaints about how the institution investigates and punishes sexual assaults on campus, announced new policies on Wednesday intended to make its procedures more transparent.

title: Chancellor, a Lover of Collisions, Has the Seahawks Ready for a Final Clash
description: JERSEY CITY  Kam Chancellor, a safety for the Seattle Seahawks who is known as one of the N.F.L.s most punishing hitters, proclaims his bad intentions on his shoulders, both tattooed with the word Bam.

title: Stringer to Unveil Changes for New York Citys Pension System
description: Dozens of city pension managers would have to regularly report their personal investment transactions, and placement agents for investment managers would be banned from doing any business with New York Citys $150 billion retirement system, under a reform plan to be announced on Thursday.

title: Foundations Band Together to Get Rid of Fossil-Fuel Investments
description: Updated, 3:08 p.m. | Seventeen foundations controlling nearly $1.8 billion in investments have united to commit to pulling their money out of companies that do business in fossil fuels, the group announced on Thursday.

title: Global Design Du Jour
description: PARIS  On Sunday, the British designer Tom Dixon was a guest of honor at a cocktail party at Eclectic, a new restaurant in the 15th Arrondissement here. Mr. Dixon had designed the space, with his usual flair for muscular materials (in this case, concrete warmed by splashes of gleaming metal). He was being feted by Maison et Objet, a trade fair held every January and September, which had anointed him, along with Philippe Nigro of Paris and Dimore Studio of Milan, a designer of the year.

title: Corrections: January 30, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Sure, Son, Ill Be in Your Skin Flick
description: The land of id is flooded with sunshine in Thomas Bradshaws Intimacy, the sensationally square new play that is putting the X (make that triple X) back into sex on 42nd Street. Pornography is the subject of this sui generis comedy from the New Group, which opened on Wednesday night on Theater Row. You might even say that porn is its form.

title: Riddled With Spelling Problems
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  Before we discuss todays puzzle, Id like to take a moment to talk about the format changes in our commenting system, as well as the issues that have occurred as a result. The Times is well aware of the general reaction that readers across the website, not just on Wordplay, have had to the changes, as well as the specific bugs you have reported.

title: California: Charges Against Bus Company Dropped
description: State labor officials have dropped charges that a Chinese high-tech bus company was paying a handful of workers below minimum wage. Last fall, investigators said that the company, Build Your Dreams, was paying workers here temporarily from China in Chinese currency equivalent to less than $8 an hour, the states minimum wage. But the company, known as BYD, has provided bank documents that showed the workers were paid the equivalent of $12 to $17 an hour in California. On Tuesday, lawyers for the state labor agency removed citations that ordered nearly $12,000 in back wages. The company agreed to pay $1,900 in penalties for paying the workers in Chinese currency rather than dollars. The company has won several contracts to create electric buses across the country, including in Los Angeles. It operates its American headquarters in downtown Los Angeles and a manufacturing plant in northeast Los Angeles County.

title: Four Airlines Are Told to Raise Some Wages by $1 an Hour
description: After a lengthy campaign by airport contract workers to receive better wages, the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey sent a letter to several airlines late Tuesday ordering them to increase pay for some employees.

title: Jason Kidd Grows in Role, Along With Beard
description: While Nets players have made strides this month forming a team identity, they have seen Jason Kidd take steps to fine-tune his identity as their coach.

title: White-Glove Treatment for Super Bowl Trophy
description: Justin Tuck said the gloves were too small.

title: American Stocks Bounce Back
description: American markets bounced back on Thursday, buoyed by relatively strong economic growth in the United States.

title: A Huge N.B.A. Rivalry: Sneaker Collections
description: P. J. Tucker, a forward with the Phoenix Suns, really likes sneakers. He likes them so much, in fact, that he needs four locations to store his collection.

title: Judge Limits Expert Testimony on Terrorism in Manhattan Bomb Case
description: Saying he wanted to avoid turning the trial into a referendum on terrorism, a state judge handling the case of a Manhattan man accused of planning pipe bombings said on Wednesday he sees no need for an expert on Islamic terrorism to testify at the defendants coming trial.

title: Riz Ortolani, Film Composer Who Wrote a Love Anthem, Dies at 87
description: Riz Ortolani, an Italian composer of dozens of film scores, whose Grammy-winning instrumental melody featured in the 1962 film Mondo Cane evolved into More, the celebrated anthem of love covered by sensuous crooners around the globe, died on Jan. 23 at his villa outside Rome. He was 87.

title: Set to Play, Harvin Is Drawing Attention
description: For a player who tied for 392nd in the N.F.L. in receptions this season, Percy Harvin is getting an awful lot of attention in the lead-up to Super Bowl XLVIII.

title: Rangers Beat Another Rival, Completing a Double Play in the Bronx
description: An intense game at Yankee Stadium between two longtime rivals, the Rangers and the Islanders, ended on Wednesday night with the fans on their feet, gasping as the Islanders Kyle Okposo, bidding for the tying goal, shot the puck inches wide of the net.

title: For Organist, the Best of Both Worlds
description: For the Islanders organist, Paul Cartier, the surreal novelty of an outdoor hockey game at Yankee Stadium put him in a completely familiar place.

title: Before Big Game, Stepping Into Medias Big Top on Radio Row
description: Within minutes of one another, Dan Marino, Darryl Strawberry and Mark Messier walked through the crowd of tables in the Metropolitan Ballroom on the second floor of the Sheraton Times Square Hotel on Wednesday.

title: Failed EuroVegas Bid Was Still a Boon for Spanish Casinos
description: MADRID  Even though Sheldon G. Adelson, the American billionaire casino magnate, abandoned his plans for a $30 billion casino and leisure resort on the outskirts of Madrid last month, he has nevertheless helped get the roulette wheels spinning here for the first time in almost a century.

title: Suede Safari Style
description: In 1968, Yves Saint Laurent introduced its first belted safari jacket, which propelled the hunting-expedition look into mainstream fashion. This season, Saint Laurents designer Hedi Slimane updated the original, introducing a more polished, shorter version in solid suede. And the safari legacy lives on in other designers resort collections, where monochromatic, all-suede staples abound in shades ranging from light camel to dark mahogany. The thick buckle strap becomes a simple, yet sleek design element on an Alexander McQueen skirt, Calvin Klein halter and Gucci boot  a nod to the practical, waist-cinching detail of the trench. And the velvety skin adds sturdy softness to a pair of Jimmy Choo sandals and a Proenza Schouler cross-body bag.

title: U.S. Aid to Afghans Flows On Despite Warnings of Misuse
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  With billions of dollars in American aid increasingly flowing straight into Afghan government coffers, the United States hired two global auditing firms three years ago to determine whether Afghanistan could be trusted to safeguard the money.

title: Word of the Day | vivisection
description: vivisection \vi-v-sek-shn, vi-v-\ noun

title: Be-Bopera: Charlie Parkers Yardbird Coming From Opera Philadelphia
description: Opera Philadelphia has commissioned Daniel Schnyder, a composer and saxophonist who works in jazz and classical music, to compose a chamber opera about the jazz saxophonist Charlie Parker, the company is expected to announce Thursday. The work will have a libretto by Bridgette A. Wimberly, and is being produced in a partnership with Gotham Chamber Opera, in New York. It is expected to have its world premiere in Philadelphia in June 2015 in a production directed by Ron Daniels, with later performances by Gotham Chamber Opera.

title: The Disappointing Office of Financial Research
description: Simon Johnson, former chief economist of the International Monetary Fund, is the Ronald A. Kurtz professor of entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.

title: Wireless Mergers Will Draw Scrutiny, Antitrust Chief Says
description: WASHINGTON  The nations leading antitrust enforcer said this week that it would be difficult for the Justice Department to approve a merger among any of the top four wireless phone companies, casting doubt on recent speculation that T-Mobile and Sprint might consummate a deal in coming months.

title: New York City Council Gets a New Speaker
3 Injured in Staten Island Gas Explosion
description: A gas explosion and fire Wednesday night at a house on Staten Island injured three people  one critically  and forced the evacuation of more than a dozen homes, according to the Fire Department.

title: A Pioneer of Street Photography Leaves Behind Strong Images of Indian Women
description: AHMEDABAD, Gujarat  A little over five weeks before hisfirst exhibition in the United States,one of Indias first street photographers sat crossed-legged on a bed in his home in Ahmedabad, Gujarat, and pulled out one of his favorite photographs. It was an image taken in 1937 of women washing clothes on the banks of the Sabarmati river that cuts through Ahmedabad.

title: Whats on Thursday
description: 9 P.M. (CNN) THE SIXTIES: THE BRITISH INVASION Tom Hanks is among the executive producers for this special, which looks at the quest by British bands to conquer the American music scene, starting with the breakthrough performance of the Beatles, above, on The Ed Sullivan Show on Feb. 9, 1964. It also examines the revolution in fashion, advertising, politics and sexual mores, and looks at groups that followed, like the Animals, the Kinks, the Hollies, the Dave Clark Five, the Who and the Rolling Stones. Comments by Smokey Robinson; Graham Nash; Ahmir Thompson, a.k.a. Questlove; and Micky Dolenz make the case that the British invasion was actually a reciprocal flow of influences back and forth with American artists like Bob Dylan, the Beach Boys and Motown musicians.

title: Test Yourself | English, Jan. 30, 2014
description: Take the Quiz

title: After Weak Earnings, Shell Halts Plan to Drill in Alaska
description: LONDON  Royal Dutch Shell said on Thursday that it would not pursue its contentious and accident-plagued effort to drill in Alaska this year as it confirmed a steep fall in profit in the fourth quarter.

title: Santanders Profit Doubles but Misses Expectations
description: LONDON  The Spanish lender Banco Santander reported on Thursday that its profit more than doubled to 1.06 billion euros in the fourth quarter as it continued to benefit from declining charges for bad loans. But the earnings still came in below analysts expectations.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Ice Storm Strands Thousands in Ill-Equipped South
description: In Ice Storm Ambushes South, Stranding Thousands, Kim Severson and Alan Blinder report on the unusual weather event that paralyzed parts of the Deep South.

title: Toward Visual Paths of Dignity
description: We highly recommend viewing this slideshow in full-screen mode.

title: Do You Ever Feel Overlooked and Underappreciated?
description: New Jersey has long suffered from an inferiority complex and found itself the butt of one too many jokes. Even now, as the host to Super Bowl XLVIII this weekend, the state still worries it is playing second fiddle to New York City. Have you ever felt like New Jersey  that you didnt get the respect you deserved?

title: Continuing Unrest Could Undermine Thailands Economy
description: HONG KONG  Thailands economy tends to bounce back vigorously from the coups, street protests and natural disasters that trouble it every few years. This time, however, could be different: As the nations once buoyant growth is slowing, investors and businesses are growing increasingly frustrated with the current political gridlock.

title: Dassault Systmes to Buy San Diego Software Firm
description: LONDON  Dassault Systmes of France said on Thursday that it had agreed to acquire the San Diego-based scientific software company Accelrys in an all-cash deal for about $750 million.

description: In the Video

title: Times Minute | Obesity and Children
description: Also on the Minute, a verdict for Amanda Knox and Brokeback Mountain makes it to the opera house.

title: New York Today: For Non-Fans, an Open Field
description: Updated 10:45 a.m. Good Thursday morning. Its in the low 20s, and the temperature is struggling back up to normal.Meanwhile, Manhattan has been converted into a Super Bowl fan zone.

title: Talks Stall as President of Ukraine Calls in Sick
description: KIEV, Ukraine  Critical negotiations between the embattled Ukrainian government and opposition leaders were thrown into disarray on Thursday when President Viktor F. Yanukovych went on sick leave, complaining of a respiratory infection.

title: Notes on a Tour of the Indian Womens Movement
description: MS. GUPTA : Walking through the red-light areas of Sonagachi or lobbying in Albany for the New York State laws against human trafficking, Gloria and my life have interwoven into shared writing sessions, rallies, meetings, dinners, books, conversations, late night phone calls across continents, brainstorming and sometimes movies. With her, I have experienced how movements move and how immense the feminist movement is.

title: Super Bowl Prediction: Slight Edge to Seahawks
description: Football fans should be in for a treat Sunday, as Denver and Seattle ended the season ranked No. 1 and 2 in the Advanced NFL Stats efficiency model by virtue of each teams dominance on one side of the ball. For the Broncos, that side is obviously offense, led by quarterback Peyton Manning. And for the Seahawks, it is defense, led by their smothering secondary.

title: Suggesting an Alternative to Performance Reviews
description: My last post documented my frustration with the performance-review process. But I dont like to complain about something that doesnt work without thinking of a replacement, so over the last several years, Ive developed a new model I call performance coaching.

title: Facebook Unveils New Tool to Read Posts and News
description: Users of Apples iPhone are about to get a new way to browse their Facebook feeds and find other interesting articles that have been posted on the service: a visually focused application called Paper.

title: Daily Report: Cutting Losses, Google to Sell Motorola Unit
description: Google announced on Wednesday that it would sell Motorola Mobility to Lenovo for $2.91 billion, less than two years after paying $12.5 billion to acquire it, Claire Cain Miller and David Gelles report.
